dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_002: Dr. Kal'tsit told me you have to be 100% focused on your work to maximize efficiency. So... yes, that's what I'm gonna do!
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_003: Rhodes Island has achieved cruising speed, Doctor. Would you mind sorting out the navigation log for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_004: I still have a lot to learn as leader of Rhodes Island. I hope you'll be there to guide me on our path to the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_005: Maybe it's just wishful thinking, but I hope Rhodes Island can be like a second home to everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_006: Making it this far has cost us so much. Sometimes, I can't help but ask myself... is it really worth it?
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_007: Sometimes I remember where I came from... It was cold, and the air smelled of rusted copper. Rhodes Island is a cozy place in comparison. I'll do everything I can to protect our home.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_008: Hehe… Dr. {@nickname}, let me tell you something: I picked up the violin again.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_009: We've still got a long, long way to go, Doctor. This might be a journey without an end, but as long as you're with me, we'll be okay.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_010: There's still lots of work that needs to be done, Doctor. We can't afford to have you resting.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_011: I'm so glad you're back, Doctor. Now we can walk this path together, me with you, and you with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_012: I see... thank you, Doctor! I've learned so much from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_013: I'm so excited to fight by your side again, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_014: What I saw that day... the despair stuck in my throat, hopelessly trying to scream... I want to bury it all deep inside my mind and never let it out…
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_029: No matter how difficult the mission, we can handle it as long as you're here, Doctor. I've never doubted you.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_030: We may have achieved a perfect victory, but we still can't let our guard down.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_031: Well done, Doctor! You must be exhausted. Be sure to rest when you need it.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_032: I'm fine... Get it together, everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_033: You want something to drink, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! Please make sure you get lots of rest today... Y-You've already worked for the better part of the day? Did I get here too late? Sorry...Blaze just asked me to get my height measured... Oh, you're just joking? Thank goodness.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_043: Doctor, if you can remember even some of your past... That would make me really happy. Right, I'm still not very good at the violin, but... since you're the only one here to listen, there's a song I'd like to practice. A sort of nostalgic song.
dialogue_tracker.char_002_amiya_CN_044: I remember the names of those who've left us, and I can still feel the lingering fear, rage, and pain of battle. But if I'm to give a speech in front of everyone, I want to tell a story of hope instead. Doctor, I'm a little nervous... Could you hold my hand, please?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_001: Doctor, please sit. I'm just here to give you a physical examination, so relax. If there are any irregularities, please tell me in full. Meaning? We'll set aside what it means to Rhodes Island for now. To me, the meaning it holds is quite significant.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_002: I will conduct scientific examinations on you at regular intervals, recording your vital signs and state of consciousness. No other personnel have this authority. If anyone wishes to conduct an examination on you, you have the right to refuse. Do you understand?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_003: Medical is the core Department of Rhodes Island. Theoretical research and practical treatment both require medical talent, and the need for medical staff on field missions is always growing. Please remember that in the time to come, you will need to recruit ever more Medic Operators.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_004: I'm sure, on a daily basis, you interact with many Operators. When you converse with them, you must be alert for any speech that attempts to influence your will. Remember to preserve your ego; at necessary times, I suggest you seek my help. Of course, for you... I should be unnecessary, shouldn't I?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_005: Amiya has left to eat with the young Operators. She is a child too, and you should accompany her as well. These lands have no mercy on the basis of age, but children will always be our unvarying hope. I very much admire this notion of... a certain someone's.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_006: Doctor, do you ever doubt the meaning in your own existence? I do. Life upon these lands is tremendously tenacious. It evolves to suit a unique niche, often finding nurtured tameness and confrontation futile. What is our destination, Doctor? I believe you will find an answer. I can only persevere in that belief.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_007: Don't spare too much worry for me. Rhodes Island shouldn't be so fragile that one person's departure would leave it unable to proceed on. What is it? No, it's only a slightly hyperbolic supposition. No matter what, I thank you for your concern, Doctor. But more than myself, I am concerned for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_008: The path along which Amiya grew into Rhodes Island's leader was considerably troubled, and the sacrifices we've made bear testimony to that. From the faintest glimpse you caught in that stretch of the past, you may gradually come to understand the meaning of it all. You can make your own choices, Doctor... someone once told me that.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_009: My hope? It is to protect yours and Amiya's hopes, Doctor. Though our definitions of 'protect' have nothing in common, it's an oath I will never abandon. I will be standing here with you, until the very end. We are unable to forget the past, but a different future may await you.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_010: Are you awake, or still in a dream?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_011: Doctor, my appearance here indicates that the situation has turned for the worse. You must concentrate on continuing to accomplish your mission.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_013: With strength comes fragility. Such is the principle of all living things.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_014: Mon3tr and I will protect everyone. Especially you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_018: Now you need only devote yourself to operation planning.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_020: You know the plan. Move to intercept.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_029: Make sure a video record of this battle is properly cataloged.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_031: Assess the risk coefficient of those fleeing, as well as the possibility of a reprisal attack by enemy forces.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_032: Secure evac route. Prepare to operate!
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_033: How is the infrastructure project here developing?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_036: You seem to have grown used to your own work and responsibility. You've become much like a leader.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_038: It is once again the New Year. I only hope that you will find a suitable manner with which you can enjoy this brief holiday logically. Additionally, I wish that you will enjoy this upcoming year in good health, and won't spend too much time in the infirmary.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_043: So this is the day you've chosen, is it? I won't ask you about the significance of the date. You are free to keep the answer to yourself. I only hope that your choice will serve to give more meaning to Rhodes Island's existence. Of course, if you would like, I can offer you my well wishes, too. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_CN_044: It is not for anyone to tell you what the significance Rhodes Island carries is. Neither should you be bound by your unreachable memories. Instead, the current you must find that answer yourself. There will come a day when you'd decide Rhodes Island's course. I trust that your decision will bear responsibility to the ideals that we discussed.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_001: The Ark does not have the resources to maintain unnecessary, extended communications. But there will be no restrictions on transmissions between the two of us. Keep the channel open.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_002: With the Originium held back by the curtains Rhodes Island has drawn, mankind was able to build the Ark and drag out its feeble existence. Yet the pressures of survival cannot suppress greed and desire. Every faction's leader yearns to become the administrator who holds all the keys. I understand that you pity them for their predicament, but you must decide based on your own judgment.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_003: Inactive Originium solidified and accumulated, while redundant information piled atop itself in layers, giving us a new home. Only because you were there by our side could we delay the awakening of the arrogant master of all creation. All those who survived rely on your aid. They are all very appreciative, and so am I.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_004: The people of today may still remember what trees looked like. That is why they can point to Originium clusters and call them an Originium Forest. But when we can no longer conceive of trees and woods, the word 'forest' will forever disappear from our languages. If things continue that way, 'these lands' will cease to exist as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_005: Originium soared through the skies and seized the twin moons, its clusters dispersing into the universe like spores, contacting and assimilating both the living and the dead— This is what is currently happening outside of Terra. Originium is swallowing everything into its body and incubating an all-encompassing chaos. But Terra can still be saved, and only because you remain by our side.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_006: Under the curtain weaver, symptoms of Oripathy have faded into history, yet mankind continues to voice its dissatisfaction. The old order did collapse, but the minds of man remain narrow. Amiya must still go hither and thither to unite them. While she is now an excellent leader, you are still the only one she can rely on.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_007: We can no longer draw meaningful lessons from past experiences. The answers to our questions come not from our collective pool of knowledge, but from innovation and imagination. As you are more proficient than I in those aspects, there is no need to seek my advice on every single matter. Your insights are more important than my opinion here.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_008: You already know how 'death' functions for me. So there's no need to worry about the damage I take. Instead, you should pay more attention to your own condition. The sarcophagus cannot heal the trauma wrought by extreme stress and exhaustion. If there is anything you would like to say, I will listen.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_009: I can hear the crystal clusters surging. The Originium tides will soon dissolve me... Don't give me that look. Take care of Amiya and the city. We can continue to work on those problems the next time we speak. Well, then... see you again, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_010: Scanning... The atmospheric oxygen level is still decreasing... No, let the Doctor rest. I will check it out.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_011: The anti-Originium communication lines have been activated... Signal received. Come in, Babel. This is Kal'tsit, exploring the former Leithanien region as planned. No coagulation point found as of yet. What about you, Doctor? What's the situation there?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_012: Experiences from before the crystallization age are for reference only. Do not overly rely on them.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_013: Formalities are no longer necessary between you and I. You need only keep your promise to maintain the Ark's safe course.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_014: Mon3tr, these tattered lands will one day need you more than ever. Now, with your own voice, say hello to the Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_017: I will correct any flawed decisions that occur during exploration.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_018: Mark the area you need explored. I will arrange for the rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_019: All units, double check the status of your anti-Originium equipment.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_020: Stick to the plan. Do not throw your life away for nothing.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_022: I will synchronize the battlefield data.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_025: Never let your guard down before the enemy.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_028: On my mark, prepare to counterattack.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_029: How much time do we have left?  I see… I trust your judgment.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_030: All units, proceed according to plan. I will hand the report to the Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_031: You should be more careful. We can't afford even a single loss.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_032: All personnel, retreat to safe zone. Comm permits are transferred to you for now. I will sort out the situation before us.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_034: Seems you are still very fond of your little tricks.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_036: Have you ever imagined a future where only you remain?
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_038: Holidays may not provide much joy to anyone anymore, but there is not much left to commemorate. Do not let Originium take away these precious memories too. These are the best wishes I can offer you.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_042: There is still much we can do, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_043: I will return to the Ark tonight. I hope to see you through the anti-Originium curtain, just like in years past.
dialogue_tracker.char_003_kalts_boc#6_CN_044: The lights of Rhodes Island once illuminated the night sky, and everyone aboard celebrated throughout the night, both on the bridge and in their cabins. Those were the good old days, yet now our operators can only shut off their electricity and drift to sleep even a moment sooner. All the effort we put in today is to allow civilization to shed light upon the lands anew.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_001: Forgive me, Doctor... There are limits to what I can do, including in conversation... but I'm honored to be your assistant. I look forward to helping you with your work.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_002: Doctor, time heals all wounds. Please have more confidence in yourself. Your Operators have chosen to follow you because we believe that you will bring positive change.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_003: Many Infected have relocated to Rhodes Island... not because they have any particular goals to achieve, but simply because they want a place to call home. The world outside no longer accepts them, after all...
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_004: Owl may not seem very friendly, but she's got a good heart. Please excuse her and pay her no mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_007: 12F? That was the day I 'came to' this world. You could consider it my birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_008: I might not be able to spend my entire life serving one person... but at least I can start working on it now.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_009: She has finally found you, Doctor. What a perilous journey it's been. You're very important to her, as well as to everyone else.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_010: I'll be by your side watching over you, Doctor, even in your sleep. So rest easy, you have nothing to fear.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_011: You have my thanks for allowing me to join you. From now on, I will do my best to serve you, Doctor, with my alchemical skills. I have never had a name... but if you must call me something, you can refer to me as 12F.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_012: I see, I understand now. Thank you for your guidance.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_017: I may not possess outstanding skills, but I will do my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_018: Will it be alright for me to be the leader? Anyway, thank you for your trust, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_019: Relax, Doctor. We will complete this operation in no time.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_029: I'm used to failure... but a victory after countless defeats is always the most precious one. Don't you agree, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_030: This victory is all yours, Doctor. And I am honored to be a pawn in your game of chess.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_031: That was a hard-won victory, but we did it. Are you all right, Owl?
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_032: Failure is only normal. Don't be discouraged. I've been in many wars, and my experience tells me that your victory will come soon.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_033: If you'd like, I can help. No trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_036: I am so thankful for all that you have done for me. I feel ashamed I have so little with which to repay your kindness. Forgive me, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_038: 'I want to live through the coming year.' That's probably every mercenary's wish they only dare think deep down, and never risk saying out loud. Doctor, may all be peaceful in your New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. I'm very curious, actually. Is this your real birthday, or is it maybe a particularly significant day to you? Oh, perhaps I'm prying too much. Please, forgive me.
dialogue_tracker.char_009_12fce_CN_044: I was just a lucky survivor, and found a place to call home in Rhodes Island. I will devote all the power I have, and I look forward to the ending that you lead us towards, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_001: I will be your bodyguard, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_002: I've always had my suspicions about Rhodes Island. Still do.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_003: Why are you staring at me? Nothing better to do?
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_005: I know every nook and cranny in Lungmen. The docks, the neon signs, the winding paths, I can see them all in my mind, clear as day. I'll never forget them.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_006: Things around here have deteriorated lately. I'll be on guard, but I'll still need you to be careful.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_007: Maybe one day that man will take note of my efforts, but until then…
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_008: Amiya trusts you completely. When I see you two together, it makes me wonder... what if I had someone like that by my side?
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_009: I've... I've never been able to rely much on anyone, not even...
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_010: Doctor? You fell asleep? Hmph. No nerves to keep you awake, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_011: Ch'en. Leader of the L.G.D.'s Special Inspection Unit. For my own reasons,I'll be joining you for a while. Seeing as we're already well acquainted from our prior work together, I'll ask you to take me to my workplace now.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_012: It's all in the service of more efficient operations.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_013: A promotion? I've been through these things before.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_014: Roger. Just give me all the missions your usual Operators can't handle.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_018: Listen up! We'll be much more efficient if we work together.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_029: Your evil must be stopped. I will do so by any means necessary.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_030: Where did you find the courage to challenge me?
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_031: The wounded wait here for a medivac. The rest of you, stay on guard.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_033: So this is Rhodes Island's base? Bigger than I expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_036: Doctor, you're in a good mood. Is it because that operation went well? Same here.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_038: Doctor, about that last report—You're still working? That's unexpected. With all the commotion out there, I thought I'd open the door to find a room full of celebrating operators. Happy new year, and here's a printout of the report—
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_043: Here I am, what do you need…? Your birthday? You have time for stuff like this? What are you waiting for, am I supposed to sing for you? In your dreams… Happy birthday, I'm leaving.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_044: I left Lungmen in search of something. Something that I can only find on my own... But you Rhodes Islanders, you have the strength to win people over with your ideals, and I hope you won't let me down. Me? I'm not there yet, I need to be faster.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: I will be your bodyguard, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: I've always had my suspicions about Rhodes Island. Still do.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: Why are you staring at me? Nothing better to do?
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: I know every nook and cranny in Lungmen. The docks, the neon signs, the winding paths, I can see them all in my mind, clear as day. I'll never forget them.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: Things around here have deteriorated lately. I'll be on guard, but I'll still need you to be careful.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: Maybe one day that man will take note of my efforts, but until then…
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: Amiya trusts you completely. When I see you two together, it makes me wonder... what if I had someone like that by my side?
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: I've... I've never been able to rely much on anyone, not even...
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: Doctor? You fell asleep? Hmph. No nerves to keep you awake, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: Ch'en. Leader of the L.G.D.'s Special Inspection Unit. For my own reasons, I'll be joining you for a while. Seeing as we're already well acquainted from our prior work together, I'll ask you to take me to my workplace now.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: It's all in the service of more efficient operations.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: A promotion? I've been through these things before.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: Roger. Just give me all the missions your usual Operators can't handle.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: Listen up! We'll be much more efficient if we work together.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: Your evil must be stopped. I will do so by any means necessary.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: Where did you find the courage to challenge me?
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: The wounded wait here for a medivac. The rest of you, stay on guard.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: So this is Rhodes Island's base? Bigger than I expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Doctor, you're in a good mood. Is it because that operation went well? Same here.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Doctor, about that last report—You're still working? That's unexpected. With all the commotion out there, I thought I'd open the door to find a room full of celebrating operators. Happy new year, and here's a printout of the report—
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Here I am, what do you need…? Your birthday? You have time for stuff like this? What are you waiting for, am I supposed to sing for you? In your dreams… Happy birthday, I'm leaving.
dialogue_tracker.char_010_chen_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: I left Lungmen in search of something. Something that I can only find on my own... But you Rhodes Islanders, you have the strength to win people over with your ideals, and I hope you won't let me down. Me? I'm not there yet, I need to be faster.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_001: C'mon, I'm no good with paperwork. You sure you want me here in the office? I'd be better out in the field. Wouldn't you rather I brought home some wins?
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_002: I fight for the Infected. Life for our people is rough, anyone with eyes can see that. It's just that most people don't give a damn about our lives. But I do, I care a lot. We've got so many operators here counting on me, and I'm NOT about to let them down.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_003: The reason I work for Rhodes Island? Because I've got nowhere better to be, naturally. But I've gotta be honest, I can't think of any place better than here. The pay's good, the medical treatment is cutting edge, and we've even got a cute little rabbit. It's just brilliant. What could be better?
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_004: I'm one of Rhodes Island's frontline breachers, I don't have powerful Arts that wipe the field, and it's not like my combat techniques could down a whole army. But, if I combine the two things I'm good at, then BOOM! You get quick results. I think that's what they call a chemical reaction.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_005: Amiya is one of the most talented fighters I've ever met. She keeps a clear head in any situation, and her Arts are enough to scare even me. You know, Doctor, I can't help but wonder, how did she get so good at fighting, as young as she is? Honestly, I wish she was picking up joyful, happy experiences, not the combat kind.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_006: If you need my help, no need to be shy - just say the word! You put your trust in me, and I return the favor. You command, I fight. It's symbiotic. Aw, look at us! We're the best partners in all Rhodes Island! Oh, don't tell Amiya I said that.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_007: The crew's been buzzing about who you used to be, before your memory loss. They were talking back before I even met you. It looks to me like you aren't the same person anymore. Soooo, I guess I'm talking about two different Doctors? Past Doctor and Present Doctor, hah!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_008: Dr. Kal'tsit says you're going to really shoulder responsibility for Rhodes Island someday. She saved my life, and I trust her. She also asked me to decide what kind of person you are for myself. And I'm going to do that, at least until Oripathy takes my life.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_009: Hey, Doctor, pass me that towel, would you? Yeah, just finished training. I need at least six hours every day to stay combat-ready. Gotta roll out whenever the order comes in, you know. Alright, I've kept you waiting long enough. So where are we going this time? If that's the plan, I guess you're picking up the tab?
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_010: Would people get the wrong idea if I carried the Doctor to bed? Maybe I'm better off leaving well enough alone…
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_011: Rhodes Island Operator, Blaze, reporting in. Here, the authorization letter signed by Dr. Kal'tsit. Now I'm under your direct command. Alrighty, Doctor, let's show the other squads what we can do!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_012: I've seen a lot of battles like this. But tougher times might still be ahead of us.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_013: Hehe, can you feel the air getting hotter? No? Reeaaally? Then I'd better kick things up a notch. Aww, I was trying to get you fired up.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_014: Us Rhodes Island Operators put all our trust in Amiya, Dr. Kal'tsit, and you, Present Doctor. Because you've never given up on any of us. Fighting for the Infected is the right thing to do. It's worth it, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_017: Time for combat? Count me in!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_018: Alright, I'm the leader, huh? I got this, I know all about wiping out hostiles!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_019: Us frontline breachers have high standards. Try to keep up!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_020: It may be a little gruesome, but I love shredding steel and crushing bunkers!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_021: You know, it wasn't easy learning high-temperature vapor dynamics!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_022: Let me show you the chainsaw techniques the other elite operators taught me!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_023: This place could use some heat.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_024: Hear the roar of my chainsaw!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_025: Don't worry if you see fire, that's just a side effect!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_026: Surrender now if you don't want to get sawed in half!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_027: My blood's only gonna make this place hotter!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_028: Fresh blood coats my saw, and boils the whole battlefield!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_029: No sacrifice is meaningless, and no victory comes without a cost.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_030: The rights of the Infected will only be won by the actions of the Infected!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_031: Let's work harder next time. We can always do better, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_032: Let's just say luck wasn't on our side this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_033: Any new facilities at Rhodes Island this time?
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_036: Wait a second! I'm way too sweaty!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_038: 'Scuse me!—Oh, hey, Doctor, Happy New Year, one sec, I gotta get all three of these drink crates to the canteen, and then move the movie projector for 'em—ah—and a few offices need decorating... and then I'll come back for you! Hey, Amiya just passed by, I gotta drag her over to get her height measured!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_042: Doctor, when are we heading out on our next mission?
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Here's an extra-extra-large cake for you! Yeah, I can't hold birthday parties of my own, so you got the kind of cake I wanna eat. Any other presents you'd like? I don't mind if it's a tricky request. I could carry you twenty clicks to find the right shop!
dialogue_tracker.char_017_huang_CN_044: I don't have such crazy Arts, but reading this mission summary for the year, I've been in a bunch of tough battles, huh? Sure saved a ton of Infected too... You're worried for my health? Hey, what's to worry about? My stamina training figures are always on the rise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_001: Doctor, what's wrong? Oh, I'm fine, just a little tired. Please check these two files in a moment. A lot of new Operators have joined Rhodes Island, and we can't disappoint them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_002: Rhodes Island and this land at large have already lost so much. We will put a stop to it... Rage may destroy us, but when confronting malice, ever more people have no other choice. Until the land finds peace, no one will be able to extinguish this fury.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_003: My rings look different? I couldn't hide it from you, Doctor... You're right, one of them broke. But it's okay, Dr. Kal'tsit helped me switch it for a new one. Did... that have something to do with when I blacked out, you ask? Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_004: In this whole operation, we gained no commercial profit at all, and we gave so much... But there are many things you can't weigh in terms of business value. Rhodes Island was never a company born exclusively for profit, and this land needs more than just physical medications.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_005: Chernobog's Reunion... it's over, and is there any more point to denouncing what they've done? Think of the people who trampled them, abused them, massacred them... hatred breeds hatred. That was something that should've never happened in the first place.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_006: Once, there was a Sarkaz betrayed, who walked this land bent on vengeance, only to cast his own life into the cycle of revenge. What I can't understand is, he'd already settled on his own end before he drew his sword. In his rage… he settled on death, with a clear mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_007: Death should be carved into our memories, never to be forgotten, no matter who brought that death about, nor who was brought to. Our mistakes will never be right... those scars should always remind us, warn us how frail we are.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_008: Even now, they still sometimes come to mind. Misha's gaze, FrostNova's roars, Patriot's cries... Ace, Scout, and so many operators sacrificed their lives for a single belief. But the Infected all across Terra—what is it that they've died for?
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_009: Doctor... recently... have I been a little less like myself? The nameless anger that rises up, time and again... is that mine? If so... no, even if so, I won't give up. I will protect you, Doctor, by this sword.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_010: Doctor, are you okay? Do you need to rest a little? I'll help carry you. Don't worry, I'm doing fine. So long as you're rested.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_011: Doctor, it's so good to see you. My appearance? Um, please don't be afraid... I can explain this. But don't worry, Doctor. Whatever happens, I won't ever let you come to harm. I swear it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_012: 'If the fight is unavoidable...' This is what the person I most trusted once taught me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_018: I shoulder the wrath of so many others.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_022: This sword thirsts for revenge... I won't permit it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_023: My sword is cloaked in Chi Xiao's shadow.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_024: Madam Ch'en's swordsmanship... flows within this weapon.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_026: Your thought, your Arts, I can cut them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_027: 'With what do I answer your failure of justice?'
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_029: Doctor, thank you for always supporting me. Our battles will only get harder from here, but we can't give up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_030: How long do we fight? How long until the flames of anger on this land die down...
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_031: Doctor, good job. Let me handle the clean-up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_033: Phew... we can take a little breather now, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_036: Doctor, could you... hear me out for a bit? Is that okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_038: For a brief moment, I could hear a voice growling deep within my heart: The suffering on these lands is eternal, and nothing can be turned around in such a short span of time... No, I refuse to accept that, Doctor. I trust that our journey and our fight are meaningful.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_043: Does it feel strange at all to celebrate a birthday that you don't remember? Does it... feel like... that's not you? It doesn't? Thank goodness. Doctor, I'd like to take out my violin and give it another try. Perhaps this time I won't break any strings.
dialogue_tracker.char_1001_amiya2_CN_044: There is no avoiding pain if we are to end the vicious cycle that is hatred. Nevertheless, I believe there will come a day when I can set down this blade. Doctor, until that day comes, I'll protect you at all costs. I only hope that... it won't be you who gets hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_001: I have some free time, so I guess I could help you out... What's this? This has got nothing to do with disasters and Arts, just some normal paperwork? Hey!
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_002: You wanna try some fortune-telling? Well, that brings me back. I haven't done it for a while. I could take a look at your fortune to kill some time, I guess. Hmm, if your luck isn't beyond words as always... Well, you're gonna have to prove my results wrong.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_003: I do research on Arts because it's part of my responsibilities as a Caster. If I can't even do that, how am I supposed to protect those who... Huh? You got sweets? For me? Uh, thanks...
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_004: Hibiscus... My sister always helps people whenever they need, even if it's not part of her mission. It's like she's not a Sarkaz at all, what with how kind she is. She treats this world with kindness, but how many people know to repay it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_005: Why I'm not into fortune telling anymore? 'cause the fear and curiosity that people have about the future usually has to do with natural phenomena. That, and I've realized the results you get with fortune telling don't really mean much, having come face to face with so many cruelties.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_006: In terms of performance, books and staffs are just about the same as Arts conductors. If you ask me, I think knives are much more practical. When you run short of your Arts and have to throw yourself into a melee, or you're out in the wilderness, just trying to survive, all those words in the books aren't going to do you much good.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_007: It's a pain to fight as a team, but when I look back on those times I fought side by side with my Reserve Ops teammates now... It brings back memories, I guess. If I get the chance to fight alongside them again... No, never mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_008: I wasn't that grumpy and curt now, was I? How come Hibiscus still treats me like a kid who hasn't grown up yet? It's like she's doing it to pick on me! We finally managed to make up, but it just ticks me off when I see her act so calm about it!
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_009: The times we live in are so messed up, there's just way too much malevolence going around in this world. We have to change that. I can't stand all those rotten hypocrites acting all kindhearted treating my fellow Sarkaz like that... just because of who we are.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_010: Sheesh... You always look so peaceful in your sleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_011: Hey, what's the big idea? Who let you come in without knock—Oh, it's you, Doctor. Why am I wearing this? Well... I'm hitting the training grounds to test my limits once more. Wanna come watch, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_013: There are lots of talented Casters out there, but I'm not so lucky. That's why I have to get stronger if I want to be able to save the world. Thanks for helping me out, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_014: I've got the hang of fire Arts now. If I keep working on this, I might just make it to the boundaries of modern Arts theory... I might even be able to manipulate space and matter.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_017: I've got a good idea of the enemy's weaknesses. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_018: I'm not good at this kinda stuff... Just gotta get this over with quickly, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_019: I'm counting on you to have my back while I take care of the enemies.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_020: You've strayed from the path of righteousness. Your sinful souls deserve no mercy.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_027: Too weak. There's no point in hiding!
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_029: It's only by overcoming challenges that we manage to accomplish something.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_030: Hmph... Accept your defeat in pain and fear. Evil will always be defeated.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_031: This shows how powerful we are now. It's far from enough, though. I know I can do better than this. I have to do better.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_032: Gah... I gotta... eradicate all evil...
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_033: I still have lots to do. Let me stay here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_036: I'm reading. There's still a lot I need to learn... It's time for tea already? Let's get going, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_038: Helped yourself with the desserts there, Doctor? You can't run for the hills on an empty belly, and we need sugar to replenish ourselves. Why run for the hills, you ask? See that ominous red tint looking over here from the corridor? If you don't want to get caught and tortured with crap movies, you need to move your legs fast!
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_043: You've already been waiting here? Tch, you got me this time. Anyway, you can thank me for the present later, for I have something to show you, so quiet now. Just to let you know, we fortunetellers have found a way to boost one's luck. And look no further for its inventor because she's standing right before you. I see... I see... See that? My divination says you'll get even cooler in the future. Also, Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_1011_lava2_CN_044: Where are we making our next stop? Seems the truth of this world always extends far beyond the catastrophes we've learned from papers, just as this dagger in my hand turns out to be more helpful than those words in the books. One day, after I've turned the last page of them, I'll be out there, finding out the truth myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_001: As I am now, will my presence inconvenience you? Will I remind you of past miseries? I... long for being with you. When the time comes, we will leave this place together, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_002: You thought we could not survive if away from the sea? A myth, it is. My kin and I will soon be able to swim through the air. In the end, even those places devoid of anything will be our ocean. We simply need to evolve, and we only need to adapt.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_003: My former friends tried to grant me my eternal rest with their hands. They refused to confront their true selves, but I do not resent them, and I could not hurt them, even if they rejected and attacked me so vehemently... Perhaps everything I did was bringing them harm. My regrets died along with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_004: This box? My past lies within it...the fragments of my past. Fractured as they are, they still suffice to tell that I am not an empty puppet... that I am not a phantom. Gradually, I was reborn into what I am now, bit by bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_005: Dr. {@nickname}, was a future like this also in your past vision? You may have nothing but hatred for me now, but I do not fear it. Hate me as your heart desires... while you are still able to.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_006: Your companions, Kal'tsit and Amiya, said that you are worthy of my trust until the very end. But one can never save the others. I failed to save my friends, and you failed to save yours. We both have lost everything, but I was granted a rebirth, and following that, a new future. This... is just unfair to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_007: Long ago, my family was murdered when I was still in Ægir. I always assumed the sea monsters did it, but I never expected to learn that it was all the handiwork of the Ægir. My blood kin and my songs are scary, they all say, but they are wrong. It is the people who are scary.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_008: I did struggle, I did resist. But to what avail? When the tide rises, no traces of lesser lifeforms will remain undrowned. You are my very last friend. Will you also be like them, rejecting the ocean for a futile end, even if it costs you everything? Do you wish to be what I used to be?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_009: Am I sick? Or am I still dreaming? I dreamt that the black sky was our ocean. When the others and I swam up, we did not feel ourselves sinking at all. Strange, so strange. Is this our future? Their faces are so blurry, they... They... No, no.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_010: Dream... What kind of dream will you have? Where are you now? Will you find it there... just another dream?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_011: Dr. {@nickname}, I have been waiting for you. It's been so long, far too long that... I have forgotten why I am waiting for you here... But none of this is important anymore. It's not that important anymore.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_012: These things... I have seen them too many times. Nobody needs things like these anymore.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_013: Formalities of the past... what good are they now? Nothing has survived, except you and me. We will cast those aside, and all we need is to be a step closer... Join me, Dr. {@nickname}, and be my blood kin.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_014: Nevermore shall my eroded sword cleave, Nevermore shall my former friends breathe, and nevermore shall I feel the warm blood flow inside me. Still, I am satisfied. I have become one with the ocean. Doctor, come with me — your true form is still waiting for you beneath the waves.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_017: Fight alongside the others? Against whom?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_018: No more lives should be lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_019: What will it feel like... when their arms penetrate this body?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_020: Treat me not as a calamity, for death is not my wish.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_021: What do you wish to do? I shall obey.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_022: No longer do I walk alone. My blood kin are with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_023: Now, harken to the song of the distant sea...
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_024: Rest at ease. The tide also rises.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_025: The sky and the land... both a drought to relieve.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_026: May the song seep into your souls.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_027: With me, to our eternal home we will return.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_028: Fear not, my kin… The time is nigh.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_029: They will become our blood kin. They no longer need to feel the suffering of aridity. Their prior existence was already too painful.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_030: Will you treat me the same way? Is this also the ending you designed for me? If that is what you wished for, I will not deny it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_031: Why must you flee? This futile struggle will only bring about more senseless terror.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_032: Run, Doctor... Run away, from here, from me... Leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_033: Sooner or later, this place too will return to its primordial form.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_034: ...Why am I still wearing this hat?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_036: We failed to protect everything. The harmonious future is our only hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_038: I still remember this day... but time has no more significance at this point. The sea and sky, and all life, will never change anymore...
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_043: I can feel the joy of a life being born... but, how should I share this joy with you...? Dr.{@nickname}, don't stray too far from me. We can embrace this new life, together...
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_CN_044: Doctor, leave. There's nothing left in these ruins. Everything familiar has vanished. The memories still sting us... Doctor, do you hate what I say? But we've both lost our families, all of them... Would you become family with me, as I am now?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_001: I understand. Some thoughts lose meaning when expressed with words. It's fine. So long as those thoughts echo in your mind, so long as you still need me, I will be here by your side, and nowhere else.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_002: No more rolling around in the frosting. You're an example to the fairies, the guardian of the garden. I won't clean you scale by scale, or wrap you in silk and put you in the clouds anymore... Of course, you can do anything you like. This may be my own wishful thinking, but I imagine you'd be willing to hear out my suggestions.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_003: The soil on the plains contain all souls' desires. Those thoughts, regrettable yet magnificent, despicable yet delicious. They are your food to enjoy. Are they sweet? Are they Sour? You must've figured out how to share them with me, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_004: Singing's not so hard. You only need to let your voice out of your throat. Your desires will shape sound itself, and I will write it into a score. Come, have a try. Sing the way you want. It'll be fun.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_005: Once in the past, you loved to entwine yourself among my fingers. You breathed like a great dragon, but let out only faint squeaks. Just when did it all change...? Now you only hover above my head, looking at me from afar... I want to see you, without having to look up all the time. That's very tiring.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_006: Amidst the sea of impulses and desires, I opened my eyes. You did, too. That's why I'm bringing you with me: to unleash our desires and break these shackles. But it looks like you have other ideas... I'm scolding you? Not at all. This is what makes you different, and I like it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_007: The fairies swallowed dreams, and so were shaped like those dreams. Plates roll and tumble across the ground; puppets chase one another;  seaflowers raise their instruments... Dreams become reality itself. If I were to become a little fairy myself, do you think... the distance between us might lessen?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_008: I found a scale in the nest. Are you starting to shed again? I will sing to you lullabies, take off your gown, and rinse that filth with warm water. Will you... refuse me? I promise you everything... so please, just this once, listen to what I demand.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_009: The fairies are talking amongst themselves. They whisper: the guardian of the garden is lingering in the borderlands, trying to leave the plains. Then go. Go where you like and follow your nature. Bring your dream and my heart with you. Only then, will the you I well-acquainted return to my fingertips.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_010: Sleep soundly. I will be the residual melody in your sweet dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_011: Spread your wings and squall to your heart's content. Everything is permitted in these red plains. Spread your joy and excitement to the fairies. Let them sing and frolic with them. I'll be waiting for you here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_012: This screen is cold and dull. Why don't we instead relish some fresh, living memories?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_013: There are no tasks or duties here. Our own satisfaction is the greatest reward. Indeed, I'm very satisfied now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_014: Fighting is the most primal of instincts, and there's no point in resisting it. If you're frightened, I can guide you forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_017: I will follow your words, and drift along the currents…
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_018: You already have the answer in your mind. Why follow the commands of others?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_019: Watch your shadow. Don't let it be stolen.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_020: Listen. The sound of a banquet.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_021: Flowers wither, and petals dye the land red.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_023: Don't send a thread into a knife's edge.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_025: This song will never stop, not until the melody is written…
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_026: The red velvet of life props up this dead diamond.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_027: The moment you leave, I will take these lost dreams away.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_028: It was your determination that dyed my dress red.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_029: When you trust your instincts, victory is never far off. You use them well.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_030: Fighting isn't complicated. You did well. You may have whatever reward you desire.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_031: You missed them? They must not be important.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_032: Come with me. We will live on, together.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_033: Let the fairies redecorate. We'll come back later.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_036: Look into my eyes, and tell me the first word that comes to mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_038: This is a holiday where humans celebrate their calendar cycle starting anew. You should go enjoy yourself. It must be very fun to swim among fireworks. Oh, and remember to save me a spark. I'll plant it in the garden.
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_042: Where are you flying off to today?
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_043: Normal cakes and pastries can't satisfy your hunger, can they? Maybe we could go with some new ideas. Hmm... A frosted galaxy? A chocolate mountain? Maybe a candied fruit forest? You still want human pastries...? Alright...
dialogue_tracker.char_1012_skadi2_iteration#2_CN_044: Your wings have gotten stronger, and your scales are tougher now. I wonder how you'll look once you shed that robe. If only I could bend time to my will, the new, reborn you would be back at my side so much sooner.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_001: You're not the type to sit around the office. It's easier to guard you if I dress more casually.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_002: I won't doubt Rhodes Island anymore. Your cause, Amiya and Dr. Kal'tsit, and all the other operators here are worthy of my respect.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_003: The way operators are supposed to see things and deal with problems is nothing I've known before. It'll take some time to get used to this.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_004: I heard from Amiya what you went through in Siesta. Sounds like you had a tough holiday. What about me? It was terrible. Maybe not terrible. That's all I can say.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_005: My roots are in Lungmen. That will never change. The world I knew there will stay with me wheresoever I go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_006: When I left Lungmen, I thought there was an answer to find, but now I get it. There's no such thing as answers, only actions and results.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_007: Doctor, it's been a while since I left Lungmen and came on board as a Rhodes Island operator. It's about time you treat me as an operator too. It's hard for me to do anything if you are always on your toes around me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_008: I've got a lot of people relying on me, and I used to take that trust for granted. It may be harder than ten sets of advanced training every day, but I'll be worthy of their trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_009: The events in Chernobog and my experiences in Dossoles both proved one thing—Whether fighting or saving, I must first understand my target. I need to broaden my horizons and open my eyes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_010: Asleep again... You've done a lot of work already, so I'll let you have ten minutes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_011: Ch'en, reporting back in from my holiday in Dossoles. I have a lot of reports to write about my trip, so I'm just passing by to say hello, Doctor. Let me know if you've got something. Now that the holiday's over, everything's back to normal.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_012: There is always someone out there who's better than us.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_013: You're giving me a promotion as a Sniper operator? No problem. I'm sure I can set a fine example.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_014: To tell you the truth, I never thought my shooting would get to this level. I'm more used to fighting with a sword, but shooting is indeed more convenient in certain scenarios.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_018: No need to fret. I'll take care of it all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_019: Buck up and get ready for battle!
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_020: Are you all ready? Let's go, then!
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_022: Ch'en here. Ready at a moment's notice.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_023: I will take care of this place.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_029: Pure evil and a little torment is nothing to be afraid of. But there's never anything pure there, that's what's terrifying.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_030: That was some beautiful teamwork. Well done, everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_031: Help the wounded, and if you got any strength left, I need a few of you to stand guard with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_032: Stay calm and fall back! I'll bring up the rear!
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_033: Hm? Another new room? Engineering's doing a good job.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_034: You never learn, do you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_036: Doctor, do you have a field operation next? I'll come with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_038: A New Year's party? I'll be there. Hoshiguma and Swire are both here, and that's special. By the way, Swire told me she brought snacks from Lungmen, you and Amiya should try some.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_043: This party gets more and more impressive by the year. Last time I came, you didn't have a present pile like this. Maybe I should just keep your present for myself... Just kidding, here, take it, don't get it all mixed up with the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_044: I'm still learning to use my gun, so I'm not touching Chi Xiao for a while. The more refined my swordplay becomes, the more I think it's not the weapon itself that defines right or wrong, but the one who wields it. So, are the moves I've made right or wrong? Do they have any meaning?
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: You're not the type to sit around the office. It's easier to guard you if I dress more casually.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: I won't doubt Rhodes Island anymore. Your cause, Amiya and Dr. Kal'tsit, and all the other operators here are worthy of my respect.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: The way operators are supposed to see things and deal with problems is nothing I've known before. It'll take some time to get used to this.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: I heard from Amiya what you went through in Siesta. Sounds like you had a tough holiday. What about me? It was terrible. Maybe not terrible. That's all I can say.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: My roots are in Lungmen. That will never change. The world I knew there will stay with me wheresoever I go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: When I left Lungmen, I thought there was an answer to find, but now I get it. There's no such thing as answers, only actions and results.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: Doctor, it's been a while since I left Lungmen and came on board as a Rhodes Island operator. It's about time you treat me as an operator too. It's hard for me to do anything if you are always on your toes around me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: I've got a lot of people relying on me, and I used to take that trust for granted. It may be harder than ten sets of advanced training every day, but I'll be worthy of their trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: The events in Chernobog and my experiences in Dossoles both proved one thing—Whether fighting or saving, I must first understand my target. I need to broaden my horizons and open my eyes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: Asleep again... You've done a lot of work already, so I'll let you have ten minutes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: Ch'en, reporting back in from my holiday in Dossoles. I have a lot of reports to write about my trip, so I'm just passing by to say hello, Doctor. Let me know if you've got something. Now that the holiday's over, everything's back to normal.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: There is always someone out there who's better than us.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: You're giving me a promotion as a Sniper operator? No problem. I'm sure I can set a fine example.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: To tell you the truth, I never thought my shooting would get to this level. I'm more used to fighting with a sword, but shooting is indeed more convenient in certain scenarios.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: No need to fret. I'll take care of it all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: Buck up and get ready for battle!
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: Are you all ready? Let's go, then!
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_022: Ch'en here. Ready at a moment's notice.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_023: I will take care of this place.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: Pure evil and a little torment is nothing to be afraid of. But there's never anything pure there, that's what's terrifying.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: That was some beautiful teamwork. Great work, everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Help the wounded, and if you got any strength left, I need a few of you to stand guard with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: Stay calm and fall back! I'll bring up the rear!
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: Hm? Another new room? Engineering's at it for sure.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: You never learn, do you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Doctor, do you have a field operation next? I'll come with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: A New Year's party? I'll be there. Hoshiguma and Swire are both here, and that's special. By the way, Swire told me she brought snacks from Lungmen, you and Amiya should try some.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: This party gets more and more impressive by the year. Last time I came, you didn't have a present pile like this. Maybe I should just keep your present for myself... Just kidding, here, take it, don't get it all mixed up with the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_1013_chen2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: I'm still learning to use my gun, so I'm not touching Chi Xiao for a while. The more refined my swordplay becomes, the more I think it's not the weapon itself that defines right or wrong, but the one who wields it. So, are the moves I've made right or wrong? Do they have any meaning?
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_001: I'm gladdened to be by your side once again, Doctor... Yes, may the light be with you as always.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_002: Being in Kazimierz was no easy thing. The Adeptus Sprawiedliwi and the General Chamber of Commerce are still constantly at each other's throats, and the day when glory once again shines on Kazimierz seems very far away still. Only at Rhodes Island can I let my guard down, and regather myself with peace of mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_003: Are they still well? How is Liz's health? Has Shining been pushing herself too far in combat? In my time back home, my mind's eye often wandered to the scenery I saw by their sides. Once, they journeyed home with me, but next shall be the time when for the sake of their ideal, the Radiant Knight devotes her light.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_004: I was absent from Kazimierz for too long. It's as if I'm all too used to life at Rhodes Island now. Whenever a Knight of kindred spirit wished to travel with me, it cast my mind back to my days here. That said, processing multitudes of paperwork is more tiring than I remembered. I still have much to learn from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_005: A victory nodded in by capital bears no glory. Yet it was thus I first came to meet those souls who harbored faith, and was able to light that flame. I pray that this flame can show the way forward, that it may inspire those who crawl to stand back on thier feet and forge ahead, that it sheds the darkness, that it reveals the true light of hope. Doctor, I have always firmly believed so.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_006: This weapon? Heheh, there are only a few who know. My grandfather wielded in his youth a swordspear alike, which my father inherited, teaching me swordsmanship with it in turn... When I returned to my home, the scenes of my younger years came back to me. That's what led me to this weapon.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_007: Maria has realized her own truly beloved undertaking. She's gifted, highly assiduous, and with Zofia beside her, I couldn't be more reassured. It seems now that the forge's hammer suits her better than the longsword. I truly hope that this honest, sincere passion of hers may forever last.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_008: Kazimierz's struggles are unlike those of other lands. Without the constant conflict in light and shadow, we know only swollen greed and twisted regulations. That Maria and her cohort could stay aboard Rhodes Island is a good thing indeed. Though people of like minds aren't few in number, we still find ourselves barren, barren of virtue.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_009: In this age on the verge of collapse, I once... felt alone. But Shining and Liz shone upon my fate, and Rhodes Island became my home to return to. I once was shone upon by others, Doctor, so I know profoundly, a beautiful vision and a faith identified, are enough to change the world.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_010: Tiredness has not called on me yet. May you first rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_011: Oaths and trust both are unchanging in the passage of time. Isn't that so, Doctor? The Radiant Knight, Margaret Nearl, rejoins you here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_012: The particulars of tactics have seen some adjustment. Hm...
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_013: That I could once again experience this gladdens me greatly. 'Fear neither hardship nor darkness.' Doctor, I shall go together with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_014: So long as I hold radiance in my hands, so long as my heart beats with faith, the hardships of our world will not fetter my step.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_017: Upon changing armaments, my combat style will also be obliged to adapt. Take due note when deploying me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_018: I will keep in mind your instruction.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_027: This long night too shall now end.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_028: To grasp bright power is so as to sweep all wrongdoing from this world.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_029: I have never held the slightest hesitance to entrust my life to your hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_030: There will come a day when we clear the mist of hardship and darkness, awaiting first light's rays, awaiting... an even better tomorrow.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_031: I hope that they may seek a proper path anew.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_032: The time has not yet come to give up, Doctor. Please allow me to defend the rear alone. I leave the regrouping to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_033: Is my previous dormitory still left for me? Thank you, for going to the trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_034: Hahh... just a simple prank, then, Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_036: I am delighted to once again browse your library. May I borrow this book to lend to Maria?
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_038: Does it surprise you that I'm here? Yes, the deskwork piles up without end. But as the clock strikes the new year, I find myself yearning to be sat here on Rhodes Island's deck, gazing over the barren land that light has yet to reach. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_042: Have you been doing well lately, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_043: Today is your birthday—naturally I'd remember. Please, accept this handcrafted trinket. Kazimierz's products may aim to dazzle, but in all truth, it's never anything more than new packaging... You'd like a Radiant Knight souvenir figure? Please, spare me your jokes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1014_nearl2_CN_044: Since returning home, I've come across more and more knights who support me. While I was once steadfast in piercing through Kazimierz's long night alone, it's now my greatest honor to stand with kindred spirits. What about you, Doctor?  To what corner of the land has Rhodes Island delievered its brilliance this past year?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_001: Were you looking for these documents, Professor? Here you are. I personally believe that some of these theories aren't explained in enough detail. If you wanted a springboard for your ideas, I suggest referencing these two papers. I've added some of my own commentary, so feel free to look it over.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_002: The little lamb didn't go away even after the volcano erupted. It's actually been staying with me the whole time, and sometimes gets into trouble. H-Hey, you can't go standing on the Doctor's head! That's terribly rude! Sorry, Professor. Um, Can you see the little lamb? It's right here, hand to the right, and then down a little. Yeah, you're petting it right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_003: This coat was Mom's old protective gear. Professor Keller once told me, this mark came from a sudden burst of magma. It almost left a scar on her, but Mom just laughed, saying she had good luck. If I were to go on an expedition with her, I'd probably need to be the one to lead.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_004: Shh. Here, Professor, I snuck these over! I saw it all – you were muttering about how badly you wanted some snacks earlier, right? I've actually gotten pretty good at reading lips. Not to brag, but I might be better than Rhodes Island's intelligence agents by now. But, just maybe.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_005: I'm getting ready to head out, Professor. Another volcano is about to become active. While luck is still on my side, I need to go a bit farther, a bit deeper. I want to wear the brightly-colored ornaments, and get to the truth in the hot magma, just like Mom and Dad did.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_006: Professor, in a few days, I'll be going to Leithanien to attend a press conference and the premiere of my documentary. Our research is too obscure for the ordinary people who want to learn about volcanoes. But I still hope that one day, I can use this method to show everyone the beauty of volcanoes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_007: Frostleaf has been going to Mousse's book club a lot these days. Earthspirit and Provence have been trekking far and wide. I've been exploring more volcanoes... Professor, I still remember those early days, when Mousse was so nervous she couldn't even talk, and Frostleaf was always alone. But look at them now... they're getting better.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_008: Hehe, Mr. Kahn's letter just arrived. He says he's really mad that Professor Keller and I went rowing on a sulfuric acid lake without protective gear. Mom and Dad did crazy things just like that before they had me, and they didn't bring Professor Keller along. So this time, so I took her with me!
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_009: One moment, Professor, I'm changing out my hearing aid battery. Hmm? You're... Did you forget, Professor? I can read lips now. Besides, the sign you want should be like this, then this. What you just did was 'I have been suppressed by the volcano.'
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_010: Phew... Even without my hearing aid, I can still pick up the little sounds of Professor's breathing…
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_011: Professor, I'm back, and I brought some souvenirs for you. I'll send them over to Dr. Kal'tsit and Amiya in a bit. I also managed to get a good amount of new data and specimens from Siesta's volcanic eruption. Would you like to come and take a look with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_012: A volcano's every change and movement is fleeting. Only by capturing them on camera are we able to preserve every last detail.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_013: Our documentaries are being taken seriously? That's great! During my inspections in recent years, I've seen a lot of governments that don't trust our judgment and won't allocate resources to evacuate the residents. I hope I'll be able to make a difference.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_014: I know what you want to say, Professor, but I've never made my expeditions hard for myself. Starting from the smallest example, I bet you've never fried a fowlbeast egg over lava before, but I have!
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_017: How about a slice of lava cake before we head out? It was one of Mom's traditions.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_018: Volcano field investigations are extremely dangerous. Everyone, please follow my instructions.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_019: Please double check your protective gear. Also, remember to keep a safe distance from the lava, and give regular status reports.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_020: Relax, volcano. We're just here to collect a few precious samples. Please don't get mad.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_021: This time, we can make up for the missing data in the last report.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_022: Don't worry about me, Professor. I've scaled a lot more volcanoes than you can imagine.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_023: Volcanic soot contains lots of Originium particles. Let's not stay too long.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_024: Magma will dredge up Originium veins. Keep your distance.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_026: Ashes from volcanoes, they consume and erase, then nourish and propagate.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_027: Those particles have no place here. I'll send them away.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_028: Oh, flowing magma, please slow your steps.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_029: We are one step closer to the truth of this land, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_030: Perhaps there will still be people gazing across this volcano a century from now. Their footprints will cover ours, and the seeds buried beneath the ash will bloom into even more beautiful flowers...
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_031: Why…? I'm not seeing any errors in the formula or the data... Um? I think I see something surfing through the lava...?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_032: Phew... Thankfully, the volcano didn't want to keep me that badly.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_033: Professor, I brought the documents you asked me about.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_034: I heard you coming, Professor. I recognized your footsteps.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_036: Professor, I know how good you are at learning. I can tell you're doing the wrong sign on purpose just to make me laugh!
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_038: A pebble encounters countless other pebbles during its life. They will collide with each other, become magma, erupt when they reach critical temperature, and then finally turn into the ash that nourishes new life. We're just like these little pebbles, Professor– Huh? Why didn't you tell me the fireworks already started?!
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_042: Professor, the fault lines of mountain ranges and trenches are quietly moving beneath our feet. Little by little, they inch us closer to the volcanoes we hope to visit.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_043: The obsidian in this brooch comes from a volcano you haven't climbed yet. When you're not busy, we can go volcano-climbing, one by one. You'll know exactly which volcano I'm talking about once you get to the top. The scenery up there is magnificent, and the other half of your present is waiting up there.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_CN_044: Professor, I read in a book that after thousands of years, we will all re-enter this land's cycle. Maybe I'll become a little plume of magma, reshaping the land along its rock formations. When that time comes, I'll be able to forever look out across the land, with those I nourished nestled up against me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_001: Mmm~I smell whipped cream. Look, the lambs have started their picnic over there. Care to join them with me, Professor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_002: Professor, would you like to try this cupcake I made? It's got a small piece of berry, some cream I scooped from a bigger cake, and the plate is a vine leaf… Why is there a lamb hiding in your hood...? This must be one of Dolly's pranks.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_003: What do you think of my dress, Professor? Is the ribbon tied right? The lambs invited me to a party, but all they gave me to wear was a big ball of wool! Rather naughty of them, don't you think? It's been so long since I danced in a dress. I'm worried I might have some trouble. Would you mind practicing with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_004: Hm? What was that, Professor? Sorry, I didn't quite catch that, please wait a second... My, how did this wool get in my ear? It must have slipped when I was playing hide-and-seek with the lambs! Go ahead, Professor, I can hear you now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_005: We've come pretty far, haven't we, Professor? A little fowlbeast brought me a rock from an acid lake. A little musbeast led me across an ocean of pink. And I even went aboard a great ship made of love and warmth. With these treasures, I don't feel at all lonely.
