dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_006: Do you like this cake, Professor? It's not just a regular cake. The base is made of love and dedication. The cream is distilled from our adventures. Various emotions are sprinkled as a finishing touch. And I've placed it in a box made of memories. It took me a long time to learn to bake a cake like this, Professor. I hope you'll remember the taste forever.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_007: The little lambs can't wait to take us out to play again. What did you think of the chocolate lava in that volcano earlier? I much prefer the crystal candy from the thermal lake myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_008: Phew. Looks like the sun's about to set. If only we could catch up with it, then the picnic could go on a little longer. How nice it would be if we could dance in a circle and sing. Pretty sun, warm sun, why you set so soon? Please stay, please wait, for time is such a boon♪
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_009: Cotton drifting on♪ We fly like clouds and chase the sun♪ Over the lava spout♪ We can't stop while the sun is out♪ Slow down if you please♪ You need to grant our wishes three♪ North Wind, make us rain♪ Bloom hot flowers from pebble grains♪
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_010: Shh... Listen carefully, Professor. That's the sound of flowers blooming... So soft and gentle. I'm glad I can hear it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_011: Is this a dream? A cozy, cloud-white dream?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_012: I wonder if anyone recorded the picnics, too?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_013: The flowers will not wither, and the sunlight will be forever warm. If only we could stay in this moment…
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_014: Look, professor! The hills are covered with Volcano Watchers! It's beautiful! Ah, mom and dad are there, too! Hm? You don't see them?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_018: Yes? You're putting me in charge of the picnic?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_019: Come quick, Professor! There's still a ripe berry on that vine!
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_020: The little lambs say it's fun to roll around on the clouds. Do you think we can go for a picnic up there?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_021: I hear fowlbeasts flapping their wings.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_022: The rainbow bridge rises between the clouds.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_023: The lava surges on, never turning back.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_024: A pebble returns to her hometown.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_025: A cotton candy cloud, drizzled in azure sky syrup.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_026: A sweet-and-sour rainbow, dipped in golden sunshine.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_027: A refreshing breeze, mixed into bubbling soda.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_028: Sleep now, and fall into a sweet dream.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_029: Hand in hand we stride, singing atop the gentle clouds.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_030: Ring-a-ding-ding, when the flowers gently fall, the berries you can haul.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_031: Oops, be careful now. Sudden shrinking takes some getting used to. Try not to trip and fall, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_032: Oh my, who knocked over the cake stand? The lambs' faces are covered in cream!
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_033: Can I bring the cake in?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_034: Hey, quit it, little lamb. Oh, it's you, professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_036: The lambs and I have matching bow ties. Aren't they pretty?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_038: I think it's snowing on those hills in the distance… Are you cold, Professor? The fairy tales say you can spin snow into nice, soft robes. Those who wear them will sleep the gentlest of sleeps. I hope you too will have sweet dreams tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_042: Professor, since we've shrunk and the desserts haven't... Maybe we can keep eating as much as we want?
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_043: You've finally reached the top of the volcano, Professor. This is the view I've always wanted to show you... Why are you dreaming of me? Hehe, it's my way of telling you what I want to say. Happy birthday, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1016_agoat2_epoque#34_CN_044: Mhmm... It's so quiet here. The sun is as warm as ever, and the breeze is always gentle. Professor, we may go on separate journeys from here, but don't worry. Even if we part ways for now, there will come a day when we meet again.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_001: A Dublinn spy, one of Caster's lackeys, the leader of the workers, plus Wiš'adel... Fancy that, a full house? In any case, I take it I can rest while you handle my business? Since you did let me tuck myself back onto the ship.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_002: What's this? It's one of those healthy meals they hand out outside the training grounds. 'Help yourselves', they say. What's that look for? It tastes good enough, better than the emergency ration handouts in Londinium by a country mile... Tell you something I know better now, Doctor. It's bloody hard, as it were, to keep a city's worth of bellies full.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_003: My sword here has enough legends to fill a storybook. Even my teacher had his version to tell, flourishes and all. Yet, people only seem to remember those who wielded the sword, not the ones who forged it first... I won't stand for that, Doctor. I'll be there to tell the stories of the unsung heroes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_004: Sometimes, after a night of dotting Is and crossing Ts, I'll climb up onto the roof of Westhaleg and watch the sun come up. Down in the street, there'll be costermongers hollering, workers delivering goods. On occasion, you'll spot my boxing gym mates, all hungover. A few of them'll look up and see me, and we'll wave at each other. I love this city a lot, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_005: All this regalia's from an old friend. It's not the lightest thing ever... I'll tell you what she taught me: If you've got a noble 'calling' that pisses you off, then go on and get loud about it. Give it hell, and hold nothing back. I can't argue being Speaker now weighs on my shoulders, but my spirit will stand tall, and I'll have her as my witness.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_006: 'Victoria'... I know to a lot of people, it's not me that sticks out, it's my name. But so what? The things they're so desperate to scrounge from me are the things I'm off to smash to bits. It's in my power to force that through their heads, sooner or later. The fight's only just started.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_007: Alright, I've been coming back aboard a bit much recently, I admit. Mm-mm-mm, I'm not skiving. It's just hard to meet some of the people here otherwise. Delphine's dead set on calling it 'diplomacy'... And I don't just drag you along as a safeguard, Doctor. I have to be honest, I do want to learn a little more from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_008: My face? Just a blister, nothing big, helped Indra and the lot in a fight as I was passing through Norport. Heh, even the ones challenging our turf don't come half as strong as they used to. I've seen babies punch harder than... My clothes? Oh, flip, I forgot to change into my casuals!
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_009: Can you believe it? A simple trick like that and Dr. Kal'tsit's got the whole Glasgow Gangers on Rhodes Island. Wait, you knew all along? Haha! Come on, no need to dodge. There! A playful rap on the head, that's how we boxers respect our opponents after a match is done.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_010: Wake up, Doctor, you've got tons of business to sort out still— hah, finally I get to tell someone else that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_011: Doctor, to be clear, this is not official business. What it is is two old friends, reuniting now the war's over. And about my old files... I think I'll finally fill in my name. Vina Victoria. No more hiding from it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_012: Can't help feeling the itch... I might go and file for time off with Parliament.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_013: I lost a lot of mine, on the way back home. Parliament awarded them all these posthumous medals, and I still don't know who to even give them to... We weren't told how heavy glory weighs. I came out knowing.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_014: I know clear as day what's up ahead. If I'm the only one left at the end of this all, so be it, I won't hesitate. But in my heart, drinking with her best mates until we drop in the sunset, that's the happy end to the story of Vina, the story of the Siege.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_017: I fight alongside you once again, Doctor, with a sword that's not just for show.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_018: I'll adjust my combat style to fit you all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_019: Recon, strategize, deploy… then, the siege.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_022: It's the frontline for me after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_024: Get up! There'll be no bending of the knee!
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_026: Who says you can't hammer with a sword?
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_028: Violence too, is an effective means.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_029: My teacher was right. With each step forward, I still learn something new from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_030: Getting to lump you with the thinking work feels bloody refreshing. It's been forever since I had a stress-free scrap!
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_031: The most precious lesson war taught me was this—there's never an absolute best-case. Regret is its own kind of mercy, and that goes for us and them both.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_032: Not time to give up yet. Follow me, I'll bring you all home.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_033: ...Really calms you down here. Think I'll get my forty winks.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_034: Um. My cape... you're stepping on it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_036: Eh? Did you say something, Gawain?
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_038: Doctor, if you're wondering about the prezzie pile in the cafeteria, that's from Londiniers all over. They had their local branch send them in, as thanks to Rhodes Island. Not one person who's alive will forget what we paid... Happy New Year, and do have a butcher's around the city when you can.
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_042: I always feel a bit awkward gamboling about Rhodes in this outfit. Need me to change back?
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_043: Doctor, if you'd like to accept these! Here we've got a well-wishes card from Morgan, here's some handmade boxing gloves from Hannah, and here's a medal engraved by Dagda... Hold on, where's mine? Oh, flip, I left it at the gym! Wait, it's your birthday today and you forgot?
dialogue_tracker.char_1019_siege2_CN_044: Ever since that upheaval, Rhodes Island has been on every central nation's watchlist. Each future step you take might well cause new turmoil, but clearly you lot have set your hearts on something. Doctor, when Rhodes Island is in its most crucial moments, Londinium will be there to aid.
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_001: Yahoo, Doctor! Whacha doing? Looks like fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_002: Does Rhodes Island have a karaoke place? It'd be great if we had a place to sing the night away, especially when we don't have battles to fight!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_003: My job as an idol is to make the fans happy with my songs and performances. But what should I do as an operator of Rhodes Island... ?
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_004: Hi, hi, Doctor! Anything I can help with? Don't judge me by my look— I actually do some heavy lifting at Penguin Logistics.
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_005: Yup, my special skill is singing! I can do a cappella, lead vocals, choir singing, pop music, and I can even rap, yo yo! But, I guess that's not a very useful skill for an Operator. If only I had a more practical skill…
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_006: M-My ears...? Uh, I can't tell you! A-And even if you ask Texas, she's not going to tell you either! Ehhh—Sorry, I'll explain if I get the chance someday…
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_007: You know, Texas actually saved my life. She also taught me so much I never knew. Which is why I... want to be there with her whenever I can... I, uhh, I'm just trying to show my gratitude for her, that's all!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_008: You think I look upset? Um... it's because... Exusiai went on a mission with Texas again, right? If only I were as good as Exusiai…
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_009: Doctor! Could you teach me to use a weapon? My songs have no practical use except for support and encouragement. If I could fight with a weapon... What? You're not good at fighting either?!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_010: Texas... are you listening to my song?
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_011: (｡･∀･)ﾉﾞHiiii! I'm the loveable idol from Monster Siren Records: Sora! Oops, sorry, introducing myself like this at Rhodes Island must be kinda weird. Aww…
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_013: A promotion? Do we also have an idol ranking on Rhodes Island?
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_014: I can feel the surge in my heart. It's like back to my first concert. I'm just delighted that you trust me so much, Doctor! All my hard work has paid off! Hmm? My ears? Wh-What about them?
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_017: As a squad member, I'll try my best to learn from the basics!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_018: I'm the leader? Is that like standing at the center of the idol group?
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_019: Singing on the battlefield... Now that's a fresh experience!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_020: If only my music could put an end to all this fighting...
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_025: Come on, we can do it!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_028: Don't lose heart, we can win this one!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_029: I heard your cheering loud and clear, everyone! Thank you!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_030: Awesome! A smashing victory! Texas, did you see how I sparkled on the stage?
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_031: We did a good job, team. Thank you for your hard work!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_032: I'm sorry... I wasn't good enough to be your help...
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_033: This place is much bigger than the dorms at Penguin Logistics!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_038: It looks like I can't hold a solo live this year, but that doesn't change my desire to sing. Happy New Year! This year, I'm going to bring even more smiles to my fans—um, no, that's not the word... Oh, right! I'm going to bring even more music to everyone at Rhodes Island!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_042: I hope you have a fantastic day, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_043: A lot of fans say my singing can bring people true happiness, and I really hope they're right. Doctor, today I've got a song just for you. Happy birthday! This is for a beautiful life and a cheerful you, all year long!
dialogue_tracker.char_101_sora_CN_044: Idols and Messengers are both jobs about passing on love. Seeing fans and audiences smile is a source of happiness in my own life. I'm sure, together with everyone at Rhodes Island, we can spread this blessing even further. It's a tiny little dream, but I'll do my best to make it come true!
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_001: There's a lot more I can do for you now—more than secretarial work. I won't be opposed to fighting anymore. But still, to be here, writing for you, is... a great honor of mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_002: What would you like to ask? Maybe you want to know—how much power Dublinn has... no? Oh, just how I'm personally doing? I'm still no more than a shadow, but—not my sister's. Dublinn's flame is lit by so many people, so many ideals, and the shadow cast by that firelight—that is what I am now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_003: It's getting dark. Around this hour, there'd be people walking leisurely along the grey pavements, perhaps fowlbeasts gathering by the ponds—that is the Tara I remember. It's no special thing, but neither has it truly existed before. Doctor, I believe everyone should have a home to welcome them back.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_004: I can't make myself out to be a comrade of yours—there are some by your side that surely hate me. But—once Dublinn no longer needs these raging, burning flames, then I'll come back here... I want to come back here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_005: In my spare time? I still like prose, and poetry, both reading and writing... and I like to hear others sing. I know a few folk songs—very pretty ones, but no record has been made of them. Doctor, Have you ever heard, how the stems of reeds can be used as whistles? Yes, the reeds that would burn away at the brush of a flame.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_006: Once you've caught Oripathy, living can become very painful... Do I resent it? No, I just used to not understand... life is so fragile, so much is ready to steal it away, yet we were meant to withstand that—to resist each and every trouble? But now... I can see you fight not just to resist—you fight to give people back their lives.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_007: Do not fear, but do not disregard. Be light, be gentle... that is how you touch another. I remember learning this from you, Doctor, and it ensures my flames won't turn others to ash. Don't worry, I can bear the pain that accompanies. My fire won't die out.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_008: Many prophecies say similar things—'it is the Draco's nature to fight.' I won't stand for that. But—if my sister stays blind to what will become of the land, once blanketed by the fires of death... then I will stop her. I know what kind of Leader the people put their hopes in—and that's not what she is.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_009: My mind's not at peace, Doctor. Is my every choice truly right? Their lives stoke our flames in the night. Yet in the end, if they fail to burn through the darkness... No, why should their lives even be mine to dictate...? But still, I will walk on. Now I bear a duty, and I will walk on.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_010: Not a word needed... It's always so tranquil, by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_011: I know—you'll have many new questions for me, about my identity, about my goals... but—I am still the same Reed.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_012: No matter how many times, you'll still choose to fight like this...
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_013: What is it you seek, from those who earn this medal? Tell me more about your dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_014: Upon the damp soil, there struggles life after life. While my flame does not yet die, I will reach them—I will.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_017: I understand the objective you've set.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_018: You fight not by my will, but yours. You choose to be warriors. So I will stand with you, shoulder to shoulder.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_019: What blocks the way, I will burn through.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_020: It is your tyrannies that fuel this flame.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_021: Where do you wish to go?
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_024: Your lives are mine to protect.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_026: This endless burn, you needn't bear.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_029: In honesty, it's hard to even tell whether your battles are victories, given your dreams still lie so far, far away. But at times like these, it strikes me—perhaps we may all see the day, when peace comes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_030: To drive them away with fire is easily done. But—if we're to ensure they'll never come back to hurt us, then a fire is not enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_031: Did they flee? I have no hate for those who do—but here on the battlefield, I will pursue them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_032: The pain of burning, I can bear much more of. Just—don't let anyone else—disappear to the flames again...
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_033: I remember how I hid away in the ship's cabins. I miss those days.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_036: The poems I've transcribed? I can read them to you, if you're interested. It's okay if you don't understand Taran—perhaps you'll still feel the emotions' touch.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_038: Can I sit here, and watch the flames? Mm, I'm not here to celebrate this day, not at all... but—hearing the bells echo through the wilds, it makes me glad for the firelight, on this night.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_042: Ah, Doctor. Yes, some things never change.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_043: You read the poem I left in your gift...? To tell the truth, it wasn't written for this day. It's just—last night, while wrapping your present, the perfect rhyme suddenly came to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1020_reed2_CN_044: You and I are different. Dublinn is a dream that took shape long ago, long before it found itself in me. But Rhodes Island—you take something so hard to envision, and convince people to believe in it. You are what saved me, and I will always remember that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_001: We'll be alright without sorting these files, won't we? Then you can lie down and sleep for a bit longer. It's good for your health. At least you can get rid of those bags under your eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_002: Got a heap of useful info from our mission in Yan this time. It's all written up in a report, submitted and filed. Come on, Doctor, I'm not a reserve op anymore. I can pull up my socks and write a report start to finish, easy enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_003: At the end of the day, the best thing to do with apples is munch them outright, or bake them into pies so you can share with everyone—it's too wasteful using them as targets. And if you just want to split one in two, you're better off with a kitchen knife.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_004: I've got a bucketload of magic tricks to bring friends closer. The 'marathon alarms,' the 'invisible warning tape,' the 'hollow cake,' they're all brilliant. Which ones do you fancy learning, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_005: I'm awake, Doctor. I'm not like I was then—it's not that easy to sleep even if I want to. So where do you need me? Any field missions? Maybe instructing the reserve ops?
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_006: Accidents always happen too quickly. Quicker than a bolt flies, even. And I can never react in time. And then I just watch things happen one after another, and... Sigh, it'd be nice if I could see things coming a mile away like you, Doctor. At least, when it comes to preparing, I've got confidence I don't botch anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_007: Doctor, don't tiptoe behind me again! I know when you're close up most times, but on the off-chance you sneak a bit too well, I might just give you a bad scare out of reflex.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_008: We all came out of that fight in Rim Billiton a bit more grown up, but... *exhale*... It'd be nice if getting better didn't come with a cost, you know...
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_009: There's no place you can escape to, and no dreams you don't wake up from. When we face something terrible, we can only choose to give it our all, hard as we can. Might leave a sting or an ache, but at the very least, you won't carry that regret all your life.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_010: You know, it's a happy thing to fall asleep like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_011: Hi-hiii~! Doctor! I'm back! Haven't got caught up in hassle lately, have you? Haha, that's good. Right, I'm heading back to my room to rest up. If there's anything you want dealing with, remember to give me a shout.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_012: Some still fight the same as ever. It's nice to see.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_013: I've gotten these badges how many times now? But whenever hand me one, Doctor, I'm as happy as could be.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_014: Once you raise your crossbow, the only things left swimming in your eyes are your sight and your target. But before you pull the trigger, there's so much you've got to think about... I won't be careless or neglectful ever again.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_017: Hi, everyone! I'm here to slack off~
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_018: Alright, time to assign the tasks.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_019: We're heading out. Remember, mind your cover.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_020: Relax, the targets aren't that bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_021: Go ahead, I'm all ready and set.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_023: Shh, don't make any more noise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_029: That's spot-on work. Have a rest, Doctor, I'll keep a watch on the follow-up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_030: So long as it turns out well, a little pain's no big problem.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_031: They won't be much threat. Do you want me to catch up with them?
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_033: This place is nice! Maybe I can find some beauty sleep in here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_036: Not that way, Doctor. I've left an extra-special 'surprise' for my friends over there!
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_038: Happy New Year! Mmh, that's my greeting in. I'm going back to rest now. You too as soon as you can, Doctor. You have to unwind on your days off~
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I've left your prezzie in your bag. What, been forever since my last prank? I suppose it has been. We've known each other for so long, you've seen practically every trick I have in the book. Or perhaps you're saying you miss that sometimes? Well, I can indulge you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1021_kroos2_CN_044: I'd say the meat roll Lava brought out for this year's dinner party was extra tasty! But the caramel pudding wasn't sweet as last year's. Come to mention, still nothing's beating that light show Closure put on three years ago. You bet, Doctor, I remember them all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_001: Doctor, if you want me to talk to you, then at leaaast give me some topics I can show interest in.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_002: Doctor, don't blame me for having no interest in your grand endeavors. To be honest, the reason I became an Abyssal Hunter is hardly as lofty as you imagine. Abyssal Hunters bear a grave mission, but me? I just think the life suits me more, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_003: You want to know about my life in Ægir...? After so much time, my childhood memories are a bit of a blur. Maybe I'll remember a thing or two by telling you about it. Originally, I was meant to be a sculptor...
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_004: My combat style shows no restraint compared to the past? Doctor, I think you might be misunderstanding me. If you call me mad, I'll take it as an insult. But if you call my combat style mad... I'll take that as a commendation.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_005: Hark... to the boundless master of all creation, embraced by darkness, murmuring soliloquy... Let me take a stab, Doctor. Maybe you like the old me rather more than the present me? I'll be honest, I've got a soft spot for that me too. It's nice to be so pure, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_006: Doctor, you always worry so much. Do something for me, tear this sheet up, yes, just like that. Sometimes, things aren't so complicated. Survival is splitting everything in your way in two. It's just that simple.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_007: *Sigh* Doctor, I'm dying to get you visiting our city. That's the only way you can understand how tender my comment is on the life quality of Rhodes Island. It's a shame your body'd be too delicate for it. All the more shame I don't even know whether our city still exists.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_008: Even if I've got a list of gripes about Rhodes Island, you people haven't abandoned the collection and preservation of art. I can retract all my criticisms just for that. Doctor, forget your job for a moment. This, is a work you shouldn't miss, not in a lifetime.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_009: You want to hear me sing? Of course I can indulge you. But I'm so sorry, singing has a special significance to us that you just can't share, not being one of us. Doctor, Doctor, it vexes me that I have so many things I want to share with you. Just how could I convey them to you?
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_010: May you too stay lucid in your dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_011: I recognize you, and you recognize me. We don't need all those boring introductions. But you still don't know me, and I still don't know you. If I recall correctly, dry-landers use simple enough means to get to know each other, so let's get communicating.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_012: Are you trying to tell me… my combat style should be more 'fit-in?'
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_013: For politeness's sake, I accept your commendation. But, to us Abyssal Hunters, combat is the means we have to master to survive. We don't need applause or flowers for it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_014: You chose a dangerous way to learn of the Abyssal Hunters and our enemies, Doctor. With nothing but your delicate body, the tides will drown you. But at the same time, you can count your lucky stars, because I invite you to hide behind me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_018: Just let me think, whether you are here to help, or to trouble me like a whelp.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_020: The time for fun has now begun.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_022: Waiting is its own art, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_023: Every battle deserves to be enjoyed.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_024: I'm in a... gorgeous mood right now!
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_029: We might not define danger the same way, but I'm willing to respect the genuine joy of others.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_030: Do we have a ballad of victory? Yes, but not now. We're still a long way from true victory, aren't we?
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_031: Incompletion has its own beauty. That's how you're comforting yourself, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_032: I'm to blame too for placing my trust in you. But don't worry, I'll bear the responsibility together with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_033: You want to hear my opinion of this landship? You'll be disappointed.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_034: Oh? I knew it was you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_036: You've got a strong hunger for knowledge, but it lacks direction at times, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_038: A New Year's feast? Your desire for seeking joy in suffering is truly admirable... Of course I'll join. When on land, do as the landwalkers do, no? I'll see you then, Doctor. Happy New Year, and here's to death come closer to us still.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_042: I hope you have a meaningful day today, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_043: I heard today was your birthday. I support chasing all sense of ceremony, even if it's not going to mean anything. So, happy birthday, Doctor, and congratulations on notching up another year of suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_1023_ghost2_CN_044: I can sense that the madness which used to bind me is slightly different to the Oripathy you're attempting to overcome... and what's interesting is, even having the knowledge I do, I can't give a clear solution. On that exploratory note, at least, I'm prepared to work with you all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_001: Doctor—oh, no need to panic, I'm not dragging you into a checkup, I'd just like to sit down in here for a moment... Out of all of Rhodes Island, it feels like your office is the one place that hasn't changed.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_002: Doctor, we're about to partially renovate Rhodes Island's wards to better meet patient aftercare needs. I've written down all the supplies we need here. Would you like to check over it quickly? Yes, I am in charge of this work now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_003: Doctor, I've adjusted the flavor of my healthy meals based on everyone's input. I came to realize that blindly insisting on my own views might not actually be best—you can only resolve conflicts better once you listen to the other side, and stand in their shoes... It would've been nice if I'd realized that sooner.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_004: I've always been so hard on everyone, keeping them to healthy schedules, never letting them do anything bad for their illness. It turns out I was the one failing at all of that, heheh... But don't worry, there's still a lot I've got to do. I'm not giving in yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_005: Diseases don't just torment the body—they impact the mind too. 'How will others see me? Can I ever live how I used to?' Everyone has worries like that... If I can't help my patients put them to rest, then my treatment isn't done yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_006: I once saved a child in Leithanien. When she came to and saw me, she screamed for her life and ran away. Before that, I never thought there was much of a difference between Caprinae horns and Sarkaz horns. We can't change how everyone sees things, but at the very least, I don't want my patients to fear me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_007: I think Lava's really changed lately. She gets up and sleeps early without needing me to remind her, and she barely ever talks back when I nag her, but it's all the more worrying for some reason... Doctor, if you ever feel tired or depressed, you can come vent to me! I'd be perfectly happy!
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_008: This flute? It's actually an Arts staff. It's from when I went to Vyseheim. It was there I used Arts to harm someone for the first time, and it was the first I saw a friend leave us forever, just out of reach. Every time I hold this staff, all my feelings in that moment come back to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_009: We happily see off recovered patients, and say goodbye to former companions with a smile. People come and leave. Our varied dreams may lead us to different paths, but we'll always mean something to  each other... Doctor, would you be open for food with me today? I'll go and ask Lava along.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_010: Doctor, you might be reliable with work, but you act just like a child when you're off. Now you're sleeping on desk again. I've told you so many times, it's bad for your spine, and you might catch a cold just like that... *sigh* If I'm not there one day, could you really take care of yourself?
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_011: Doctor, I'm back—Umm, Doctor, I know my last field assignment took longer than usual, but don't look at me like you don't recognize me... Medic Operator Hibiscus, reporting in.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_012: Everyone's taking charge of themselves, now—that's nice to see.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_013: I'm suddenly reminded of my time in A1, training with everybody... Everyone's matured so much now. I'll keep up the effort, for all we've been through.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_014: Bodily trauma can be treated through medicine and surgery, but how do we cure the pain from hostility and prejudice? Healing people's hearts, Doctor, that's what I will devote myself to.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_017: I won't fail you—this time, I'll be sure to protect everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_018: I'm leading? I wasn't usually the one doing that before... No, I won't shirk responsibility.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_019: Don't be afraid. I've got your backs.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_020: I'm not going to let you harm my friends.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_023: First aid ready. Medical support standying by.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_024: I wish this to be the last time, if possible…
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_025: If we can prevent more harm this way, I'll stand my ground.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_026: Please tell me if this hurts.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_027: I can do more than just heal.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_028: Hold it. There's no sense in getting any more hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_029: It's always easier to harm than heal. But... is it really something to be proud of...?
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_030: I'm so glad everyone could come back safe...
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_031: Prioritize treating the wounded. I'll guard against counterattacks.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_036: Doctor, here's your healthy recipe for today. Make sure you eat on time.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Let's relax—we don't get holidays often. But still, you have to watch your junk food intake, and don't stay up until sunrise. I'll be keeping an eye on you. Mmhm, I'll watch out for my own health too, I promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_042: Staying healthy is just as important as working hard, Doctor. Don't let either slip.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_043: Doctor, I—made you a birthday cake, actually. I used low-fat butter and dark chocolate, and I cut back the sugar as much as possible, but still, the calories are flooring me. How should I even... okay, just for today, I'm making an exception! Thank you for the good work, Doctor. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_1024_hbisc2_CN_044: Rhodes Island didn't just grant me knowledge, but a dream worth fighting my whole life for. As a Sarkaz, as an Infected, as a doctor, and as a sister, I've found my home here. Honestly, I need to say just how fortunate I am. Right now, I want nothing more than to protect all this.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_001: Doctor, got any trouble for me to handle? What? Just haul these files for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_002: I gotta hand it to her, Doctor, this axe Zumama made for me turned out great, but I've already got this muscle memory from whacking enemies with my staff. See, still carrying it with me. I'm here to save people, after all, not beat 'em up. Gotta work that out.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_003: Doctor, check it out. Getting extra weapons' kind a juggling act, so I found a solution. Trained my tail a little, and now, I can use it to hold my staff. Only downside is—I think my tail got thicker after all that exercise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_004: How's that, Doctor? Shoulders feel much better, right? I told you, controlling my strength's a piece of cake, it's just none of you wanna believe me. I've been practicing medicine as a pro for years now. It's about time you recognized the fact, don’t you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_005: Oh, right, Doctor, it’s been a while since your last trip to Acahualla, right? Join me next time I visit my home, if you can spare the time. They told me it's a party there now. Even I'm wondering what my home's gonna be like when I visit again.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_006: Doctor, you know there's times you can trust your intuition. You've got all these Operators who trust you, see. Even with your eyes closed, your fists are still real strong—What? Compared to mine? Hey... I could K.O. you before you even made it out of this office, so I'm the stronger one there!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_007: Zumama can build machines, Tomimi can manage people, and Inam's a damn-good lord ameer... Man, my friends rule! But my medical skills aren't bad either! Huh? What do you mean that's the one thing they’d argue?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_008: Y'know, Doctor, I never understood why you made everything so complicated all the time. But now, I kinda get it, in a small sorta way. To put it in plaintalk, you're just finding ways to get bigger fists. So let me get real here, Doc. It's time you worked out with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_009: Zumama was right. All I gotta do is think about how to get stronger, and how to throw my fists. So I've got an extremely serious question to ask you, Doctor... If I get Zumama to build us a two-seater Raging Ironhide, do you wanna ride driver-side or passenger?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_010: Alright, how should I wake the Doc up...?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_011: Hold on, Doctor, I know what you wanna ask, and my files are still up in Medical. But, y'know, Dr. Kal'tsit's got a point. Doesn't reflect well on Medical to have a physician steamrolling around the front lines, so from now on, this is how I'm heading out.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_012: There... wouldn't a quick axe chop do the job?!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_013: *sigh* Just doesn't give me the same kick I get being endorsed for my medical skills...
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_014: Doctor, doesn't matter if I've got an axe or staff in hand, I'm just hoping to accomplish a little something, make everyone's lives a little bit happier. I've managed to do a bunch so far, and before my body gives out on me here, I'm gonna do more.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_017: Leave the front to me. The rear's all yours!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_018: You get to follow me under one condition—you all stay alive and well. Got it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_019: Let's go! Oh, speaking of which, what was our objective again?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_020: Alright, guys! Let's make some noise!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_021: Doctor, leave the big guys to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_024: I'll take the lead! The rest is up to you guys!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_025: Relax, it'll be over in an instant.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_029: Uh... might be kind of weird to say at this point, Doctor, but nailing down a tough mission on nothing but trust for others—that's pretty damn neat.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_030: Everybody good? We've got another battle waiting for us. Pump yourselves up! We're gonna crush this mission together!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_031: No rush. Doesn't matter if we're chasing 'em down or watching for a counterattack, just leave it to me. I want anyone who needs it to rest up!
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_032: Doctor, hold on tight to my shoulders! Don't go blaming me if you fall off.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_033: I guess I'll drop in at Medical before the mission.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_034: What's the rush, Doc? Not like I'm gonna run away.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_036: You look pretty free to me, Doctor. Just so happens I am too. Wanna take a walk?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_038: Happy New Year to you, Doctor. Oh yeah, you heard, right? Me and Zumama are gonna prep an Acahualla-style New Year's feast. We've done it your way, I think it's about time you saw how we Tiacauh do a festival. You're gonna come, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_042: Doctor! ...Oops, my bad. Didn't bruise you, did I?
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_043: So it's your birthday again, Doctor. Craziest day of the year aboard Rhodes Island, apart from New Year's. Seriously, Rhodes Islanders are taking some hell of a shine to you. Here, a present from me. Also, I'm watching you, same as always. You're not doing a second of work today.
dialogue_tracker.char_1026_gvial2_CN_044: We don't need to exchange any sappy words here, do we, Doctor? I'm Gavial, the medic-slash-warrior of Rhodes Island. Where there's people with Oripathy, I'm there. It's that simple, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_001: There's a limit to the types of documents I can help you with, Doctor. But I'll try to learn. I'm hoping to lead my own major engineering project someday, so I gotta accumulate knowledge from different domains.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_002: Just spending some time reading. No, I'm not pushing myself too hard. Oripathy doesn't leave me too much time, so I must... Oh, sorry, I didn't mean to make things awkward.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_003: I've gotten quite a bit taller in the last couple of years? Hehe, I'm still growing, after all. My ears have gotten perkier? Er, I guess it's also because I'm still growing...?
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_004: No, Doctor, I haven't gotten more talkative... but Engineering veterans say we have to sound certain of ourselves, in order for our skills and designs to feel certain... I'll keep working at it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_005: Looks like the upcoming courses are even more complicated, and Engineering's idea of an internship is a little… *sigh*… never mind, I can handle it. Yes, I'll be sure to get enough rest. Rest is important to studying efficiently.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_006: Mankind may have learned to overcome the darkness of night, but there are always shadows that even the brightest lights cannot breach. If I can continue to improve this technology, and bring warmth and light to those who shiver in the cold night...
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_007: Though I now fully leave the line patrol work to my drones, it doesn't mean my early intership years are worthless. Look at my physique now, even Medical doesn't have to worry about me anymore... um, Doctor? Why are you crying?
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_008: Volvort Kochinski... I've seen their mark on Mamá's equipment. Not even Rhodes Island intelligence has been able to track down Mamá since the incident. Is she covering her tracks, running from something?
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_009: Doctor, I'm going to visit a client to help with PLC testing. It won't take too long. You can use Rhodes Island Messengers to contact me if you need something... but I'm sure you can handle anything that comes up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_010: Doctor... Doctor? Asleep already?... I see... This next segment is prone to bugs. I should set alerts to silent...
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. This equipment was my graduation project. My initial plan was to... huh? Putting it into service? Dios mío(My goodness), so this is the 'Doctor's Thesis Defense' that Closure talked about?
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_012: No matter how much I watch, I just can't help but feel… everyone's style is so individualized, it's hard to summarize anything for general application…
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_013: It's an honor to earn your recognition, and that of Engineering. I know this is just the starting point, and I'll keep working to make sure that I don't let you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_014: Countless frontiers remain uncharted on this land named science, waiting to be mapped and discovered. Though our latest technologies help get their views from afar, we have yet to set our foot on them. My dream, Doctor, is to be the pioneer that explores these realms with engineering.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_017: A practical field study... in combat?  Sure, no problem.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_018: Understood. I'll compile a deployment report with suggestions for improvement.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_019: We're into an assault mission. Before we breakthrough the enemy defenses, I'm counting on you to hold the line.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_020: Battlefield is where soldiers and war machines witness their own prime… and their own end.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_029: Things were worse than expected, Doctor. Even our contingency plan was pushed to its limit... but we still did it!
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_030: Phew… Everything went according to plan. All equipment in good condition. We're ready for the next phase.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_031: Effect on target below expectations, risk of potential failure… The re-simulation of both Doctor and PRTS  are required for next steps.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_032: No obstacles on the evacuation path. It's time to retreat, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_033: These facilities could use an upgrade...
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_034: One moment, I'm almost done here... just a few lines more...
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_036: Here so early, Doctor? Give me a moment, I'm almost done...
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_038: Want to watch the light show together tonight? I designed this year's New Year show featuring my latest eco-lights, and they're sure to impress. After I'm done with their modification with Engineering, I'll donate them to offices in remote regions as disaster relief supplies.
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Here's a gift I designed for you. Why don't you take a look inside? See? There's a button on the side of the base. Just press it... and there we go! 'A town lit by home lights under a starry sky' in this little crystal ball, lovely isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1027_greyy2_CN_044: I never thought I would have the opportunity to learn so much and do so much... with determination and hard work, even one little spark can light up the night sky. This is the most important lesson that I learned from Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_001: I'm your bodyguard again, just like old times, Doctor. And it's not just a job, it's a reunion. That's something worth cherishing.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_002: How does it feel to be back in Siracusa? Not great. It's for wise guys and famiglie, not me. I'm only staying long enough to cut ties with the past. After I'm done washing my hands of the whole business, I'm heading back to Lungmen to pick up the girls, and then going out for a nice drive.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_003: I didn't want to get Penguin Logistics involved, but it was a relief to see them in Siracusa. My noisy friends, that life of freedom... Looking back now, staying with them in Lungmen was the best decision I ever made. Just, don't tell them I said that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_004: Sometimes I hear Siracusans talking about the downfall of Famiglia Texas. No two versions of the story are the same. Most are pretty dull, and some make for interesting fairytales, but in the end, they're all pretty embellished. The real story is... I just got exhausted, and decided to leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_005: Ever noticed how even the rain here stains the walls outside? Dirty rainwater can't wash anything clean. And that's Siracusa. Siracusans might be used to it, but I'm not.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_006: I've got no interest in joining Greyhall. The dons sit in their chairs, acting all high and mighty, hiding their plans. I decided to confront Signora Sicilia because she thinks she can tame everyone, and that's one thing I can't stand.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_007: I saw Lappland in Siracusa. Oh, you haven't seen her in a while? Not like she needs anyone worrying about her. If she's over me now, she'll find something else to cut. As for the score we haven't settled, I say it doesn't matter. We'll meet again soon enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_008: I was born in Columbia, but my grandfather wanted me to become a proper mafiosa and sent me to Siracusa to learn the trade. But to this day I don't understand why the people here like macaroni so much? I used to go to this little place for macaroni myself, but it closed down a long time ago. The owner died in a back alley.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_009: In Siracusa, there were a whole lot of people trying to guess what I'd do. It wasn't that complicated. I was there to do what I had to do, and help those who deserved help. Doctor, all I ask is that we continue to get along just like we used to. This relationship, built on real trust, is hard to find there.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_010: It's quiet here. No hitmen haunting the shadows, no wolves waiting in the alleys.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_011: We meet again, Doctor. The Siracusan rainy season always gets my tail wet, so I prefer the climate here. Don't worry, Exusiai and the girls will keep taking care of the deliveries, but I'll handle any jobs assigned to me personally.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_012: Thanks. Doesn't seem much different from your average delivery run in Lungmen.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_013: I'm not helping you for the money, Doctor. But still, go ahead and send my salary over to Penguin Logistics as usual. I'll pick it up from Emperor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_014: I still have a lot to take care of before I can enjoy a peaceful life, and if the only way to shake the past is to smash it to pieces, then that's exactly what I'll do. Simple as that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_018: Alright. Try to keep up. Let me know if you can't.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_019: No need to make a scene.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_020: Don't leave bloodstains. They're hard to clean.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_023: Got a problem that needs solving?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_024: I see them. I'll be right back.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_025: Bad luck, you ran into me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_027: Pass on your last words? No.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_029: The only way to solve a problem is to clear all the obstacles in the way, no matter what they might be and keep moving.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_030: A battle without an explosion or cheering makes me feel a little uneasy. Let's head back. A drink? Maybe next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_031: There's still more to clean. When's our next sweep?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_032: I can take out a few more. You go ahead and retreat.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_033: This place reminds me of Lungmen. It's quiet. Doesn't have the constant pitter patter of the rain.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_036: Doctor, where's the hair dryer? I'd like to dry my tail.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_038: It's a brand new year, so Happy New Year. Sora gave me a CD to listen to, and it's a totally different style. Very relaxing. Looks like her time in Siracusa expanded her horizons too. Want to give it a listen?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_042: Great, this place is the same as it ever was. Morning. Got any new plans?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. You're another year older, and you'll have another chance to grow. Since it's a special occasion, want me to call over the Penguin Logistics girls and throw a birthday party? Even I get in the mood for a little bit of fun and excitement with my friends. That's not the kind of 'excitement' you'll ever find in Siracusa.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_CN_044: Sometimes I think to myself, what Rhodes Island is trying to do is really hard, but you're actually doing it. Me? I don't think about anything so complicated, but I'm more than glad to help out. All we're looking for is peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_001: I'm your bodyguard again, just like old times, Doctor. And it's not just a job, it's a reunion. That's something worth cherishing.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_002: How does it feel to be back in Siracusa? Not great. It's for wise guys and famiglie, not me. I'm only staying long enough to cut ties with the past. After I'm done washing my hands of the whole business, I'm heading back to Lungmen to pick up the girls, and then going out for a nice drive.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_003: I didn't want to get Penguin Logistics involved, but it was a relief to see them in Siracusa. My noisy friends, that life of freedom... Looking back now, staying with them in Lungmen was the best decision I ever made. Just, don't tell them I said that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_004: Sometimes I hear Siracusans talking about the downfall of Famiglia Texas. No two versions of the story are the same. Most are pretty dull, and some make for interesting fairytales, but in the end, they're all pretty embellished. The real story is... I just got exhausted, and decided to leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_005: Ever noticed how even the rain here stains the walls outside? Dirty rainwater can't wash anything clean. And that's Siracusa. Siracusans might be used to it, but I'm not.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_006: I've got no interest in joining Greyhall. The dons sit in their chairs, acting all high and mighty, hiding their plans. I decided to confront Signora Sicilia because she thinks she can tame everyone, and that's one thing I can't stand.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_007: I saw Lappland in Siracusa. Oh, you haven't seen her in a while? Not like she needs anyone worrying about her. If she's over me now, she'll find something else to cut. As for the score we haven't settled, I say it doesn't matter. We'll meet again soon enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_008: I was born in Columbia, but my grandfather wanted me to become a proper mafiosa and sent me to Siracusa to learn the trade. But to this day I don't understand why the people here like macaroni so much? I used to go to this little place for macaroni myself, but it closed down a long time ago. The owner died in a back alley.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_009: In Siracusa, there were a whole lot of people trying to guess what I'd do. It wasn't that complicated. I was there to do what I had to do, and help those who deserved help. Doctor, all I ask is that we continue to get along just like we used to. This relationship, built on real trust, is hard to find there.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_010: It's quiet here. No hitmen haunting the shadows, no wolves waiting in the alleys.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_011: We meet again, Doctor. The Siracusan rainy season always gets my tail wet, so I prefer the climate here. Don't worry, Exusiai and the girls will keep taking care of the deliveries, but I'll handle any jobs assigned to me personally.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_012: Thanks. Doesn't seem much different from your average delivery run in Lungmen.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_013: I'm not helping you for the money, Doctor. But still, go ahead and send my salary over to Penguin Logistics as usual. I'll pick it up from Emperor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_014: I still have a lot to take care of before I can enjoy a peaceful life, and if the only way to shake the past is to smash it to pieces, then that's exactly what I'll do. Simple as that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_018: Alright. Try to keep up. Let me know if you can't.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_019: No need to make a scene.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_020: Don't leave bloodstains. They're hard to clean.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_023: Got a problem that needs solving?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_024: I see them. I'll be right back.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_025: Bad luck, you ran into me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_027: Pass on your last words? No.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_029: The only way to solve a problem is to clear all the obstacles in the way, no matter what they might be and keep moving.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_030: A battle without an explosion or cheering makes me feel a little uneasy. Let's head back. A drink? Maybe next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_031: There's still more to clean. When's our next sweep?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_032: I can take out a few more. You go ahead and retreat.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_033: This place reminds me of Lungmen. It's quiet. Doesn't have the constant pitter patter of the rain.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_036: Doctor, where's the hair dryer? I'd like to dry my tail.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_038: It's a brand new year, so Happy New Year. Sora gave me a CD to listen to, and it's a totally different style. Very relaxing. Looks like her time in Siracusa expanded her horizons too. Want to give it a listen?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_042: Great, this place is the same as it ever was. Morning. Got any new plans?
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. You're another year older, and you'll have another chance to grow. Since it's a special occasion, want me to call over the Penguin Logistics girls and throw a birthday party? Even I get in the mood for a little bit of fun and excitement with my friends. That's not the kind of 'excitement' you'll ever find in Siracusa.
dialogue_tracker.char_1028_texas2_ITA_CN_044: Sometimes I think to myself, what Rhodes Island is trying to do is really hard, but you're actually doing it. Me? I don't think about anything so complicated, but I'm more than glad to help out. All we're looking for is peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_001: I'm to assist you? One moment, then. I'll go and change into more appropriate uniform... What? No need?
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_002: I'll be honest, even now I'm not used to life with my mask off—it always feels like there's something missing from my face. Still, it seems I can operate freely in daylight now. Please, give me more daytime missions, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_003: The combat style the Felynes have taught me is like nothing I've known before. Unbroken strings of attacks as a defense, swift evasive maneuvers, different styles combining to achieve completely differing effects... Even though I've been training day and night, I still can't say I've mastered it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_004: These clothes have your attention, Doctor? They confused me just as much when I first put them on—they have a startling defensive capacity, despite their obvious design. How it's achieved is completely beyond me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_005: There's a strange force in these dual blades. They attack with thunder, but without the use of Arts... Is it the materials that cause it? I was definitely more proficient with my old katana... but when it comes to protecting us all, I'll shy away from no weapon.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_006: The Felynes never cease to mention monsters even more fearsome than Rathalos—the kind that could bring about Catastrophe-scale disasters with the flap of a wing. If Rhodes Island ever faced such a threat... no. After all we've been through, I wouldn't fear an enemy like that anymore.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_007: Though I've changed my loadout and gained new skills, I'm still the same Yato you know. Just give the order, and I'll take on whatever role Rhodes Island needs of me, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_008: Noir Corne's always been this way, fussing over minor details, dragging down the mission. Still, I admit he's occasionally helpful... okay, a little more than occasionally. The point is, I don't hate him.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_009: Operators are often worried about the way I do things, wondering if I'm putting myself in harm's way. Honestly, the concern's unnecessary. Thinking too much on my situation would only slow me down, but when it comes to what my friends are going through, trust me, I will care.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_010: It seems you need some rest, Doctor. You can try this, if you want. It's a Felyne blend of a remedial plant they call Sleep Herb and some kind of mushroom. I hear it works very well, sleep-wise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_011: Hey, Doctor. That's right, it's me. Op Team A4 Captain Yato, back and reporting in. As for where I got all this new equipment, you have the whole story from me in the mission debrief.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_012: Hold on, I had notes on the locale. Let me find them...
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_013: Whatever role I'm in, I'll bring everything I have.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_014: Another medal for me? I'd love to wear them, but I don't think this outfit has anywhere for them to go. Still, thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_018: Alright, it's in my hands now. The success of our mission is assured.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_019: Target confirmed. They won't know what hit them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_020: Op Team A4 Yato in position.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_028: Fight or flee, it's no use!
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_029: We owe this victory to your fine command. I still have a long way to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_030: Take victory as a whetstone to hone the cutting edge.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_032: This falls on me. You make a retreat, and grant me one more attempt.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_033: I'd like more dangerous or challenging work, but if these are your orders, I'll gladly accept, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_034: What is it, Doctor? Intrigued by the materials for this outfit?
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_036: Oh, hey, Doctor. I guess I'm not used to dropping the mask after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_042: Hey, Doctor. You're the same as ever. I wonder if I'm any better than I used to be?
dialogue_tracker.char_1029_yato2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Could you drop me from field missions for the day, if that's alright? Noir Corne says he's got plans, see...
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_001: My next mission is to protect you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_002: I don't say much? That's because I'd rather avoid thinking about most things.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_003: Our job is to deliver life and death.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_004: I usually listen to Sora's songs when I'm driving.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_005: Cigarette? Oh, no, this is chocolate. You've gotta replenish your energy regularly. Which reminds me... do you want some coffee?
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_006: How long have I worked for Penguin Logistics? When did I start...? I don't even know how long it's been.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_007: Watch out for the Red Wolf. She's not evil, but... she's not like us.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_008: No matter how hard I run, my past will catch up to me one day.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_009: My independent lifestyle and rowdy friends have brought me a lot of trouble... but I kind of like it this way.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_010: Is it time for a break?
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_011: Code name Texas. I'm responsible for driving, moving cargo, and keeping our people safe. Try to get the mission briefings as concise as possible, please.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_018: I'm not good at barking orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_031: A few of them got through.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_032: I may have underestimated this operation.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_033: Do you need any supplies? Just let me know.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_038: Happy New Year. I was just about to give these to Exusiai. She said she'd be hosting a big party tonight, to celebrate her results not being rock bottom. The other girls? Croissant was hauling a huge batch of goods she got in earlier, so I figure she's got a stall laid out now. As for Sora... have you heard her new single, Doctor? I'm pretty into it.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_043: Here's a box of vinyls from the boss's collection. I got it from Lungmen. Take it, Doctor. No need to worry about my boss. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_CN_044: I like how Rhodes Island does its anniversaries. Here's a couple wine truffles I just picked up, rum and bitter almond flavor. Tastes pretty good. Why don't you give them a try?
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_001: My next mission is to protect you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_002: I don't say much? That's because I'd rather avoid thinking about most things.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_003: Our job is to handle life and death.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_004: I usually listen to Sora's songs when I'm driving.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_005: Cigarette? Oh, no, this is chocolate. You've gotta replenish your energy regularly. Which reminds me... do you want some coffee?
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_006: How long have I worked for Penguin Logistics? When did I start...? I don't even know how long it's been.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_007: Watch out for the Red Wolf. She's not evil, but... she's not like us.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_008: No matter how hard I run, my past will catch up to me one day.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_009: My independent lifestyle and rowdy friends have brought me a lot of trouble... but I kind of like it this way.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_010: Is it time for a break?
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_011: Code name Texas. I'm responsible for driving, moving cargo, and keeping our people safe. Try to get the mission briefings as concise as possible, please.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_018: I'm not good at barking orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_031: A few of them passed through.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_032: I may have underestimated this operation.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_033: Do you need any supplies? Just let me know.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_038: Happy New Year. I was just about to give these to Exusiai. She said she'd be hosting a big party tonight, to celebrate her results not being rock bottom. The other girls? Croissant was hauling a huge batch of goods she got in earlier, so I figure she's got a stall laid out now. As for Sora... have you heard her new single, Doctor? I'm pretty into it.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_043: Here's a box of vinyls from the boss's collection. I got it from Lungmen. Take it, Doctor. No need to worry about my boss. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_102_texas_ITA_CN_044: I like how Rhodes Island does its anniversaries. Here's a couple wine truffles I just picked up, rum and bitter almond flavor. Tastes pretty good. Why don't you give them a try?
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_001: Alright, I'm here to help! Chill, I'm all good with this gear now. Bumping into everything? That's the old me!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_002: Out in the field, it's pretty important to watch what you and your teammates eat. Just a while ago, I learned how to use this simple BBQ spit to treat raw meat. Here, lemme demo for you right now!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_003: I've hauled butt all across Terra, and I've never seen gear both as sturdy and as comfortable as this. Feels like when I wear it, my attack power gets boosted, plus I can hit enemy weaknesses way better, and my fire attacks are stronger too! Yeah, uh, I figure that might just be me? Haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_004: The Felynes say the more experienced the hunter, the more thorough the pre-mission prep. Packing all your potions and tools is just as key to the hunt. Still, Yato loves to chew me out, saying I'm always bringing too much stuff on missions. Rock and a hard place, y'know?
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_005: Feels weird, honestly, not having my ol' reliable shield on hand. Still, the Felynes say if I get good enough with this long sword, I can basically fend off every attack under the sun. Guess my training's got a long way to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_006: You only really master combat technique after taking on enough enemies. I guess no shortcut to getting promoted after all, huh? Especially for dummies like me, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_007: I get that whetstones aren't thrilling, but they're a tool you can't go without. Even a blade with sharpness this fine is gonna need nonstop polishing its whole life.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_008: I just wanna do my job as a guy in the background, even now. Us nobodies, we've got our own duties, our own worries, and our own things we wanna protect.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_009: Ditching the shield, using a long sword like this, it keeps reminding me of the old days. Bad times I hate to remember. But without our past, I guess Yato and me wouldn't be who we are today.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_010: Get your rest on, Doctor. Leave the place to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_011: Operator Noir Corne, back under your command with all-new gear! Alright, Doctor, don't care if it's bandits or nightmare bizarro creatures, you leave it all to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_012: Lemme scrub back a sec, I want a closer look. Yeah, mm-hm...
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_013: I've gotta give thanks to my kickass gear for carrying me this far. But obviously, the biggest props go out to you and everyone around me for all your help!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_014: This is Operator Noir Corne, everyone's shield through hell and high water! And hey, I guess I can handle being everyone's sword too!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_017: No prob. I'm all readied up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_018: You want me to lead, without Yato? You sure? I think it'd be better if you got her on.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_019: Everybody done eating? Alright, go time!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_020: Mission start! Target position is a lock!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_021: Which area am I heading to?
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_029: Now THAT was a good battle. Take pride, everyone, and good work!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_030: Mission complete, perfect job! We gotta get back to Rhodes Island, because I'm looking forward to celebrating!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_031: Good work, Doctor. We'll do better next time, don't you worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_032: Doctor! Got your Farcaster from the Felynes? You need to ditch, fast. I'll come right after you, no worries!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_033: Whoa, whoa, steady. Lemme put my sword away first.
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_034: What's up, Doctor? Need me to head somewhere?
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_036: Haha, what do you say, Doctor? How about a round of drinks?
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_042: It's another fine day. Take care of yourself, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_1030_noirc2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I hauled everyone in to wrap up as much of your work for you as we could. No drinks on the agenda today, either, we want you to get some major rest. Call that my present to you, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_001: Let's commence work, Doctor. We have a mountain of issues to face.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_002: Doctor, can you pass a message onto Ifrit for me? I'm returning to Trimounts—there's some urgent business that requires me in person. So she'll have to eat dinner with Saria tonight. I... I'll make it up to her next time, I promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_003: Do you need coffee? This is a special bean Joyce prepared for me that keeps me up even in the daytime. After all, I can't coop up alone in the lab day and night like I once did. I have lots of meetings that I'd rather not take, and lots of reports to read that I'd also rather not.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_004: My thoughts on returning to Rhine Lab...? I'd rather not reflect on it like that, if I could. All I can say is, I used to perennially expect someone would come to my aid, but now I understand—I can only rely on myself if I am to achieve anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_005: Guess what this stack of papers is? They're whistleblower reports. Some labs think they can protect themselves by airing other labs' dirty laundry to me. The more they do this, the more anger I feel welling up inside.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_006: Return those gifts to senders, and have them convey to whoever's behind them, that I'll be making a personal visit, and they'd better be prepared... Sorry, Doctor, am I bothering you at work? I'll excuse myself for now. Yes, alright, I'll be back in Trimounts later today...
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_007: This contract pertains to the ensuing direction of our partnership with Rhodes Island, Doctor. You'd better take a look. I don't want us to blindly accept Rhodes Island's aid. Of course, I do hope that outside of work, we'll remain good friends.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_008: Yes, Doctor? No, I'm no longer restricting Ifrit from seeing Saria. Honestly, on the contrary, I hope they see more of each other now. Ifrit is grown up, after all. And more importantly, her presence will remind Saria that,  not all prices are numbers, and reports do not remove scars.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_009: To be honest, being domineering is an awful sensation. When people come to my desk, the way they look at me makes me uncomfortable. But that's something I'll gradually adapt to. I'm going to rest for a short while, Doctor. I'd like to hear your thoughts after I wake up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_010: I'll deal with some minor affairs for you, Doctor. Rest well.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_011: Doctor, my time aboard Rhodes Island will be inevitably diminished in the future. There is one thing, however, that I can guarantee: my relationship with Rhodes Island will only grow closer, because I trust Rhodes Island, and I trust you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_012: Some battles are unavoidable, I know.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_013: The pharmaceutical I took part in developing is highly effective? That's excellent. Though I have to devote more of my energy elsewhere, I would never want to give up my research.
