dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_014: I know what you want to ask. The path I'm about to walk is a thorny one. Am I really prepared for it…? I don't know whether future me will come to regret this, but at least right now, I will firmly walk on.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_017: Support role aside, you can delegate some tactical planning work to me too.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_018: I'll see to it our tactics are drawn up.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_019: We should probe into the significance of the fight, and not indulge its outbreak.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_020: I'm a physician, but also a member of the squad. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_029: Doctor, I always find a great deal to learn from you, though I hope I never have occasion to use these tactics.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_030: The samples in this area... We've taken these before. Let's move on.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_031: I'll organize aid for wounded personnel. Everyone else, please assist in maintaining the perimeter.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_032: Doctor... it looks like we should reformulate our tactics.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_033: This place still feels like home.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_036: Doctor, I happen to have some issues I'd like to discuss with you. Are you available right now?
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_038: Doctor, I imagine Ifrit sent you, didn't she? She tries everything she can to get me to put down my work—she's always making trouble for me—she even threatened to burn my lab reports. You're the third one she's sent... Alright, we'll break here for today. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Here's your cake, your card, a small gift, and... I seem very practiced, do I? Oh, I'm sure; I've definitely grown somewhat used to celebrating birthdays. Days like this lift your spirits, don't they?
dialogue_tracker.char_1031_slent2_CN_044: When I first joined Rhine, research was my everything. Following the Diαbolic Crisis, Ifrit and her Oripathy were my everything. But now, as I come to know more and more, the things I want to do grow in volume too. Still, Doctor, we'll reunite at the same destination, when all's said and done.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_001: Yes, I have received the notification that fragmentation mines are forbidden in the corridors. But rest assured, Doctor, the high voltage fencing installed on your door violates no ordinances.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_002: Indeed, I was the one who introduced recent Lateran Operators to Rhodes Island. If you have no objections, I will continue to introduce functionaries with special circumstances to you. I hope to study how Sankta live outside Lateran, and how it compares to their life within.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_003: This mission may call for a piano performance? Do not worry. I have memorized the complete scores of over a hundred classical pieces, and I can play every note in accurate order. Any properly trained executor should be capable of this. That does not count as playing the piano? I do not understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_004: The title 'Saint' can neither enhance my abilities nor reveal any precise mission to me. Though it has added difficulties to my work, I cannot fathom why I was chosen. Its objective and demands are something I must seek myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_005: Doctor, this is my medical examination report, please confirm. Currently, no horns have grown on my head, and my halo has seen no changes in shape or form. Indeed, my violation of the law has not had a physical effect on me, but it's nothing worthy of celebration. Abnormalities have been on the rise. This is an omen of disaster.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_006: Doctor, during my recent missions, my limbs have been acting before I complete my thought processes. This phenomenon can impede successful completion of my missions. I am troubled. Could you tell me whether it's a kind of disease? Will my condition worsen? Is there (a) medicine that can heal it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_007: Most confuse Arturia's Arts as tampering with cognition and mental faculty, but I know the fact is just the opposite. Arturia is interested only in the truest emotions, and cares not for where these emotions lead. The influence she can command is far worse than anyone can possibly imagine.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_008: What are you doing, Doctor? Bodily contact is no replacement for spoken language. I cannot decipher your thoughts through your limbs. You think that I need comfort? If that is your judgement, then I have no reason to refuse. Infact, I am merely thinking back to my recent mission. What leaves a man no other choice(,) but death?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_009: As you can see, this is a burnt flower. I have, to the best of my abilities, maintained its condition in order to bring it to you. It is not a gift, because it does not meet the criteria for one. It's a question in my mind. I am still pondering the things behind this flower.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_010: You lack sleep, Doctor. You need more rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_011: You seem surprised, Doctor. Please rest assured that the change in my equipment won't affect my ability to complete my missions. If you find yourself ill at ease because of my attire, I can change into my previous garments before I enter Rhodes Island. No need? Understood.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_012: I have attempted a few combat techniques, and they have yielded excellent results.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_013: You put together an all new profile. Is this a false identity for my next mission? If the need arises, I know where to prepare identification that can pass checks. No need? This, too, is a normal promotion?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_014: I am trying to understand the law. Is Laterano's foundation truly these words alone? Is that applicable to lands other than Laterano? I must admit I have indeed been affected by it, to a certain degree. I will attempt to find the answer posthaste.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_017: The law itself has no power. It calls for enforcers.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_018: I require those who can act on their own judgment.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_020: Commencing operation. Please confirm the mission objective.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_024: I shall ensure the integrity of the law.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_026: Destruction is the most naive behavior.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_027: Annihilation is the most common result.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_029: No casualties, no commotions. All good.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_032: We need to reformulate our battle plans.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_033: Maintaining a dedicated room is a show of respect? I see.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_034: I have heard there are certain hobbies that are not easily understood by others. Perhaps this is one such hobby?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_036: Speak the word if you need anything, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_038: Changes in numbers and symbolistic objects are how man reminds himself of the flow of time. Yes, I said I can understand, in spite of the fact that I need no such reminders. However, if this day brings you joy, then it is indeed very meaningful. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_043: Gifts need to be packaged in such a way that you cannot immediately see the contents on a single glance? Is this a compulsory requirement? My apologies, I am not well-versed in such matters. Well, then, Doctor. I will prepare an unscannable safe and a new gift. Please wait for just a moment.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_CN_044: I have been looking for you, Doctor. The cleaning agreement that I have entered into with your company is nearing its end. If you desire a new agreement, you may refer to these items I brought with me for reference. The Notarial Hall has never entered into a long term agreement with a foreign corporation. Our partnership with Rhodes Island will be a new challenge.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_001: 'Calamity'. Deploying simulation sequence. Activating emergency response protocols. Queueing worst-case scenario simulation.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_002: From the Tower of Revelations to the Notarial Hall in Pagus Michaelion, then on to the Sunset Chapel in Pagus Saint Marcel, then the chapel square—the city is alight. I sense the existence of each individual, and their disappearance as well. We are one—as 'Laterano'.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_003: The entity known as The Lord of Fiends is locked on, and I will help her shed the Black Crown. Civlight Eterna is too heavy a burden for a single fledgling. Laterano will share in this aura, and 'empathy' shall unite Sankta and Sarkaz as one.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_004: The Many share similarities with present-day Laterano, but extreme approach behavior does not conform to the laws of evolution. Does this mean, however, that they are no longer sentient? And can such a life form come to a natural end? The nomadic monastery has arrived on the coast; You Many, your answers shall be used as reference for the conclusion.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_005: Owing to 'empathy', Laterano remains pure and efficient, even in the face of 'calamity'. When night falls, this place is the first to illuminate. Laterano will reconvene the Summit of Nations, and rally all forces when necessary.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_006: It possesses no personality yet maintains the capability to modulate and influence human emotions. Why did it ultimately choose to develop a mechanism as complex as 'empathy' for the Sankta...? What brought about such a question? I am thinking—Error, exception detected.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_007: Emotional fluctuation detected; the six-year-old heir to the decedent does not possess the requisite psychological resilience. Processing; she demonstrates capacity to accept the decedent's status... 'Death'. Federico, you, too, stood in the rain at that cemetery. Did you come to understand it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_008: Yulia, Clément—error; above names should not appear in the list of victims... Do you still remember? Federico, when your mother taught you to read and write, to play music. She whispered to you as you slept—you would come understand that you were just as useful as any patron firearm.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_009: Arturia, cease your seduction of the Doctor. I am awake. I will share the possibilities I saw, as well as the limitations within. My head is still too foggy to begin the description, please allow me a look at the sky—it is a blue most familiar to me, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_011: Pathway locked. Framework stable. Connection established. This is Laterano.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_013: True. Our partnership agreement requires renewal—you represent Rhodes Island, and I, Laterano.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_014: I see a certain future. Of Laterano, and of myself. The events that transpire within are far from inscrutable, but the question I find myself pondering is: why do they come to pass?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_017: I am Laterano. I calculate every possibility, and remove every obstacle.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_019: In which zone did the crisis occur?
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_021: Laterano has reached a conclusive assessment of the situation.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_030: Operation complete. Laterano will now return to the landship.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_031: The Commandments contain deficiencies. I will implement corrections.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_034: I did not notice your presence, Doctor. I am still processing this information.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_036: Thank you, my condition is now stable.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_038: Even under such conditions, rituals of similar types persist. Wandering executors return to the nearest monastery to spend the day with their compatriots. I sense the existence and disappearance of each individual. I recollect that feeling, and know that it is not 'empathy'.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_042: Doctor, please hold here. These possibilities require immediate disclosure and discussion. With YOU.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_043: I am about to return to Laterano. The Notarial Hall's directives take precedence over your birthday celebration. I have, however, acquired this party hat for you... Is this inappropriate? If my understanding is correct, blue is a suitable color for such an occasion.
dialogue_tracker.char_1032_excu2_sale#12_CN_044: The possibilities that Arturia and I perceive are uniformly extreme; nevertheless, Rhodes Island, and you, as its commander, remain a constant variable. Therefore, Doctor, your assessment is required before 'calamity' arrives.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_001: Alright, chop chop. Finish your work during your coffee break so the rest of your day is all coffee break!
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_002: It's a holiday, so of course I gotta dress a little more casual. I may not have taken as many field missions these past few years, but I still passed the L.G.D.'s physical exams, in high heels.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_003: If Rhodes Island's looking for business partners, you can definitely trust these companies. Hey! Why are you looking at me like that? I'm just genuinely listing off my recommendations. You're making it look like I'm plotting a hostile takeover of Rhodes Island. If I'm actually planning an M&A... I just need to talk you round, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_004: Ahem... I've taken a glance at our recent mission records. Looks like Rhodes Island's tactics have got more professional over the past few years. Not bad, not bad... Excuse me?! What's wrong with your former training consultant checking your operators' records? I absolutely have not been looking at Ch'en's files!
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_005: It's not really a big deal, being L.G.D. chief. I've got a little more on my shoulders, a little more to worry about, and I can put myself in Ch'en's shoes a little more now... Oh, let me reiterate: I'm taking over the L.G.D., not taking over for Ch'en! If that stupid Lung came back right now, she'd have to call me 'Chief.'
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_006: I may have left my family's company, but I still deal in business every now and then. It's a way to build Lungmen, so there's no need to avoid the subject. And now that I've figured out what I need to do, I don't find my grandfather so scary anymore. Hmhm, Once you've made use of your fears, that's when you've truly conquered them, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_007: The new Siesta's an interesting place. Even without its beaches and volcano, it's still worth a visit for its sky pools and natural springs. My investment there has resulted in pretty decent returns too. Doctor, if you find the time, you should go and see for yourself. Heading back to a place you haven't been in a while... might be just like a reunion with an old friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_008: Things are looking up for the trading company I'm running with Bison. Transporting one country's goods to another, sharing the cultures of places afar, these are the charms of commerce. Many are afraid of breaking barriers, but, Doctor, I'm sure we can find common ground.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_009: Is this the last document you have? Alright! You really kept me waiting this time, but finally, time for supper! I know this new place that's not so bad. It's on me tonigh—Oh, You don't want me spending money?  Umm... alright, then it's on you. I know some other places.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_010: Rawr... Ahem... You finished your work?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_011: Long time no see, Doctor. Ahem, let me introduce myself again. Beatrix Schwire, soon-to-be Chief Commissioner of the Lungmen Guard Department—I really am the chief! Whoever said the L.G.D. chief can't take holidays?!
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_012: It's been a while, but that's quite the improvement—Excuse me!? Why must you emphasize that this happened when I wasn't working here as an instructor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_013: Exceptional talents earn exceptional rewards. That's how things should be.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_014: Alright, alright. I get that you can't do without me anymore. No sense beating around the bush like that. If you need my help, just say the word. I'll always be here for you, as your friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_018: Just follow my command and it'll all be fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_019: Let's try to take up as little of our holiday time as possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_020: I don't really want my holiday mood ruined, so hurry up and stop resisting arrest.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_021: I haven't taken orders in a long time… feels kinda weird.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_025: The moment you break the law, your back's against the wall.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_026: Where are you trying to run?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_027: Be good, be cuffed, I'll hear your motive after taking you in.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_029: That's all the men and wares accounted for. Let's call it a day here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_030: Don't get cocky. This is just barely a pass mark by L.G.D. standards, but if you manage to keep this up, I guess I could still commend you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_031: If you can take care of something in one go, it's best not to do it twice. Keep your costs under control.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_032: Let's wrap it up here. I'll take care of the mission report.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_033: This place hasn't been redecorated even once this whole time? You serious?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_034: Doctor, do you know the consequences for attacking a cop in Lungmen? Don't worry. I'm just teaching you about the laws there.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_036: Oh, you like this fashion brand? I can pick out an outfit for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_038: Happy New Year! Perfect timing. Come carry these things for me. I've got gifts for all my friends here in Rhodes Island—Oh! Be careful with that! Pure gold's very heavy!
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_042: Good morning... Hm? Just saying hello. What were you expecting? Rawr?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Over the last two years, I've come to realize more and more that only shallow friendships need all that shallow pretense to maintain, so I didn't get you anything this year. Doctor, take a day off. If there's anything you want to do or anywhere you want to go, I'll come with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_044: The relationships you build on the battlefield are not something you can fake. Hoshiguma is pretty worried about that stuff, though, always beating around the bush. Next time, I'll drag her to Rhodes Island to join the parties. Avoiding suspicion? I'm the chief of the L.G.D. Who am I supposed to avoid looking suspicious to?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Alright, chop chop. Finish your work during your coffee break so the rest of your day is all coffee break!
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: It's a holiday, so of course I gotta dress a little more casual. I may not have taken as many field missions these past few years, but I still passed the L.G.D.'s physical exams, in high heels.

I just need to talk you round, right?

dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: Put your hands up and don't move!
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: That's all the men and wares accounted for. Let's call it a day here~

dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Good morning... Hm? Just saying hello. What were you expecting? Rawr?
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Over the last two years, I've come to realize more and more that only shallow friendships need all that shallow pretense to maintain, so I didn't get you anything this year. Doctor, take a day off. If there's anything you want to do or anywhere you want to go, I'll come with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1033_swire2_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: The relationships you build on the battlefield are not something you can fake. Hoshiguma is pretty worried about that stuff, though, always beating around the bush. Next time, I'll drag her to Rhodes Island to join the parties. Avoiding suspicion? I'm the chief of the L.G.D. Who am I supposed to avoid looking suspicious to?
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_001: While you were out, I tried to sort the documents on your desk for you... It shames me to admit it, but... I haven't made much progress when it comes to desk work.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_002: I ran into Franka and Liskarm on my way to the dorms. Even though I hadn't seen them in so long, we talked like we were never apart... Um, Doctor, do you think, maybe, I c-could apply to serve on missions with them?
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_003: I don't have as much money on hand these days. I argued with my father a lot about pioneering in the barrenlands. And so... I stopped drawing from the family trust fund. But I can still earn some money out there pioneering, at least enough to maintain my equipment.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_004: When I was little, everyone always had so much on their plates. Only my retired grandfather could stay at home with me. He would tell me stories about his time in the army, so that he can cheer me up this way. Even though his past never stopped tormenting him, he was still willing to fluff it into tidy little stories, just to make me smile.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_005: There was a soirée a while ago where someone brought up the war in Victoria. I chimed in with my own experiences. Only a few words, but enough to ruin everyone's time. You know, Doctor, that was the moment I finally realized why Blacksteel mercenaries rarely talk about themselves.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_006: I'm nominally still employed by Blacksteel, but it's been a while since I've done any mercenary work. No, it's not that I regret the decision I made back then; I'm just tired of responding to disaster, always one step behind. This time, I want to be there to protect something from the beginning.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_007: Doctor... Would you mind coming to the training room with me? I don't need a spotter, it's just... new operators keep coming to me for advice, and facing them alone makes me feel a— a little nervous.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_008: Oh... You want to know about the flower on my chest? Actually... it wasn't an accessory to begin with. It was a shard of metal that got lodged in my leg. After it was surgically removed, I... decided to turn it into a buttonhole flower instead of throwing it away. Y-Yeah, I guess it is kinda weird. I'm not sure what I was thinking.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_009: I know now that there's no shame in crying... or having a soft heart. If you're sad about something you can't put into words, why not express your feelings with tears? It's part of being human, so there's nothing to be ashamed of.  Um... Am I right, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_010: You look a little worse for wear every time I see you... Are you doing alright these days, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_011: It's been a while since we last met, Doctor. I'm glad there's still something I can do for you. That's right, I have changed a lot. If you could find the time, I'd love to sit down with you and catch up...
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_012: I just dug up my old combat records, which proved to be pretty useful. Comparing my before-and-after, I at least know what mistakes I shouldn't be making again. Ugh, I really looked like a... bumbling idiot back then.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_013: I'm just glad to receive your acknowledgement, Doctor. The rewards are secondary.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_014: Doctor, are you giving me a promotion? Then, can I... make a teensy tiny extra request? It's nothing big, just... Can I... have a hug?
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_017: Come in, Commander, this is Jessica. On the line and ready to roll.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_023: I'm headed into the thick of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_024: With all of you behind me, I won't take a single step back.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_025: Drawing a bead on the target.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_029: No resting on your laurels now... We've got more fighting ahead of us.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_030: That was close, I almost... A-Anyway, good thing I managed to pull through in the end... Sorry, Doctor. Please, give me a minute. I need to get my emotions under control.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_031: I think... a minor setback is no big deal. It's already enough that none of our people got hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_032: Doctor, an apology doesn't even begin to cut it... I'll try to make up for this failure on subsequent operations.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_033: How I miss the time I spent on this landship... If only I could've stayed longer...
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_036: You looked a little surprised shaking my hand just now... D-Did my calluses scare you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_038: Doctor, getting to sit here with you exchanging New Year's wishes is already pretty nice. I remember that time in Bolívar, the only thing I had to share the New Year with was a gun thiiiiiiiis big. Yeah, bigger than me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_042: Glad to see you again, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I brought you a gift from the frontier... A jar of all-natural maple syrup. Though it's not as fancy as the stuff I used to get you, it's a rare treat where I live. It's can't even buy it with money; you have to head out to the forest to collect it yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_1034_jesca2_CN_044: I used to be so preoccupied with what goals and achievements I would score in the future. But my experiences in recent years have shattered those fantasies. Just getting to grant some happiness and dignity to the people in your life is already good enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_001: Huh? You sure? What did I ever do to make you think I'm some kind of loyal bodyguard, who wants to serve you all day and all heartily? Getting cold feet? Sorry, but I've accepted your request. Remember, it was you choice, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_002: You heard? Ines and Hoederer are actually gonna open a shop in Kazdel. I know the places they've been looking at, they're all shitheaps. But I guess my li'l revenant here could help mop the floors with his party tricks? His opinion? Lemme ask. Oh, he's fine with that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_003: Theresa and Amiya... Both of them love gazing off into the distance like that. I went and had a look myself, but there's nothing special out there. What are they always staring at? I'm gonna figure it out someday.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_004: I haven't had a day of peace ever since I picked up this grumpy hunk of scrap metal. Can you imagine what it feels like to have an old, undying geezer babbling on about the past, right into your ear, day in and day out? Oh, you do? Well, well, guess misery loves company, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_005: You wanna work with my team? Do I look like a girl who'd fall for the same trick twice? Yeah, yeah, save the explanations. You know what you did. But be warned, my mercs pick their own roads now. While I'm gonna take out the scumbags who dare treat us like pawns. Should I start with you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_006: How many Sarkaz mercs just like me has Her Highness seen? Does she really remember all their names...? Whatever. Mine is the only one she picked herself. Oi! Say my name, Doctor. Wiš'adel. Not some codename picked out of a pile of stiffs anymore. It's. My. Name.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_007: Tch, how dare that little bunny bossing me around. She thinks I'm gonna go along with it and be her errand girl, just 'cause she gives me that gentle look? Drop it. No one can be a second Theresa. Even that bunny does have some... some... Whatever. At least Rhodes Island's still moving, and all the naive dumbasses haven't died out yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_008: You seriously think we're getting along? Wanna guess what it is I'm holding right here? Hmph, relax, it's fear you're gonna bear for what you did. Wouldn't be much fun to cash this thing out that easy. So, when are you gonna let your guard down again, Doctor? I'm really looking forward. To. It.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_009: Evil spirit'… is the current you still qualified for that title? Doesn't matter how mysterious the soul boxed up in your little frame there is. You're a lot more... honest, than I thought. And I'd much rather put up with an idiot, than waste my time with scum.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_010: You can sleep when I'm around, huh? How about we make sure you don't ever wake up?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_011: Wiš'a... del. I sign my name here, right? Her Highness says this name means 'wishing for a home.' I don't make wishes, though. Huh? My handwriting sucks? Screw you, who are you to judge.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_012: You don't have to prove anything to me with your videos. We'll see how you take advantage of people's lives. We'll see closely.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_013: Can't you come up with something new, Doctor? Other than this useless little garbage? Why don't you, say— have Kal'tsit sing me a song? Or if that's not sincere enough, you could join in, gimme a duet?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_014: I don't have the energy to waste on saving this land. I just wanna kick in the Military Commission's front door and make Lateran Candles outta the guys inside, then blow 'em sky high, spreading out into the Babel logo with fifteen different colors. I'll send you an invite to the show. It's gonna be one for the ages, I gua-ran-tee.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_017: If I die here, use the pension to buy some roast potatoes for the gang! Hahaha.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_018: Somebody's not happy with me as captain? Sounds like a you problem.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_019: Aw. These wonderful days just never end.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_020: Whose turn is it to get blown to bits today?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_021: The revenant's babbling again. Son-of-a-gun's got a filthy mouth.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_022: So you racked your brain, then came up with a plan of plopping me here? Bravo.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_023: Wow, looks awfully dangerous. You call me out for this?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_024: Trash the mission briefing. I know what you want.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_025: Poor little guy. It's your unlucky day.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_026: Now now, wait in line. We got plenty for everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_027: Always so focused on the ground. But have you forgotten... to look ABOVE?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_028: Boom! Who says there's always a countdown?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_029: What a thrilling battle. Now what does this Doctor standing next to me think, looking out over the battlefield? Nah, save it. I'm not all that interested.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_030: Do you like my nails? Guess what I used to paint them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_031: You're not happy with the results, Doctor? How about we blow the whole place up, burn everything for a bonfire? Wouldn't that light you up? No? Shame.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_032: That was pathetic, Doctor. We might just die here today. It's what we deserved, right? Hahaha— You scared? Then follow me close. Step only where I step. Otherwise... Today might actually be the end.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_033: If no one's gonna do anything about this door, I'll just fix it myself. Hey, revenant, get the hell out here and start working.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_036: What's up? You bored? I got some fun things we could do. But don't blame me if you end up— dead.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_038: New Year's? You even celebrate the New Year? Hehehe. Oh yeah, you know I love to party. I even left gifts for everybody, all in your name, Doctor. And soon, things will be a blast... literally.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_042: Oh joy, there's your face again, Doctor. What a great start for the day.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_043: Oi! Why are you bumbling around me all this time? Were you…expecting something? Pfff, maybe take a look under your desk? Cut the blue wire. That hint is my birthday present to you. Real thoughtful of me, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_CN_044: No matter what, this place's never gonna be Babel again… You know, I hate morons who can't stop nagging about the good old days. So why don't we talk about what to blow up tomorrow?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_001: Oh, Doctor, your old flame really was no good at housekeeping. Look at all this 'trash' she left behind. I'm in a good mood today, so I'll clean up after her.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_002: Oh? From up here, you can see Terra really is round. Look, Originium's almost covered the whole thing. Wow, how lucky are we? We won't have to worry about running out of it. Not gonna marvel at your masterpiece, Doctor? C'mon, cheer up, at least we still have time to do something about it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_003: Steam Knights, Royal Guards, Spire Casters? Originium sure is something, able to copy all those losers. Hah, right on cue. Hey, you old fossils, weren't you screaming about vengeance all those years you were stuck in the Furnace? Well, here's your chance. Don't tell me you were all just talking shit.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_004: Are those... Feranmuts? Huh, never thought I'd see a live one. If Hoederer was here, he'd definitely take the chance to babble on and on and on about them, then Ines would tell him to stop giving useless lectures with that sharp tongue of hers... Hmph. Give me a sec, will you? I'm gonna kill one, give you the chance to duke it out down below.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_005: Hey, why're you easing up on the firepower over there? Elite operators? Ugh, she really knows how to twist the knife. What, want me to give you some time for a high-five sesh with your old pals? Hmph, not like you even have hands. If you lose your nerve, oh right, no nerves left, how about—You'll do it yourself? Y'know, once we're done here, it wouldn't be so bad to let you yap for a bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_006: You killed the most important person in my life, and now, it's my turn to go kill yours. That'll make us even. What, thought I was gonna say something nice? You'll have to forgive me, all the nice girls are dead. You mad? Good. That's the only thing keeping us alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_007: Stop grumbling, Doctor. It wasn't my idea to turn you into a soul and stuff you into a gun. By the time I got there, you were the only one left alive, and only barely. It's cramped in there? Well, be a good little cannon, and once we take back the ship, I'll move you into something a little roomier. How's that sound?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_008: That little bunny gave me this bottle of nail polish before it all went down, said the color really suited me... Never thought I'd be reduced to sharing a sob story like that with you. What a tragic life I lead. But, whichever way you look at it, you're still alive, and chatting with you's much better than chatting with a bunch of tombstones.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_009: Surface signals are gone, and our way out's cut off. In other words, whatever comes next, I'll be facing it down with you. Can't think of anything scarier than that. I'm gonna have to take a page out of Hoederer's book and write a memoir of my own. I'll call it: The Two Crises of Terra: Originium and the Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_010: This area all clear? Ahh... I think I'm gonna find someplace to take a nap.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_011: We're finally here, Doctor. Is this ship floating out in space supposed to be an old haunt of yours? What, feeling anxious? Well too bad, you don't have a choice. 'Wiš'adel', here to destroy your Originium project now that it's running wild.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_012: Doctor, if you keep mumbling battle plans in my ears, I'm gonna toss you out the airlock.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_013: Alright, as the Speaker of Kazdel, I hereby dub thee 'Destroyer of the World'! Don't like it? Then once you've fixed your mess, I'll give you a new title. How's 'Betrayer of the World' sound?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_014: Look at all the assholes we buried along the way. You won't find a more legendary Sarkaz mercenary than me in all of Terra. How are you gonna honor me? Oh, You'll remember me after I die? Hah, you better walk the walk, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_017: Now where should I clean today~
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_018: Who we're killing, that's up to me. How we're killing them, I'm open to suggestions.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_019: Hello, space~ Housekeeping here~ Ready to clean~
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_020: If they're making my life difficult, I'll make theirs twice as hard. It's always been that simple.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_021: The good news is, today, they're all gonna die here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_022: The bad news is, we both might just die here with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_023: I'll make you shriek so loud the stars'll hear you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_024: I'll carve my name onto every little bit of Originium out there.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_025: Get yelling, Doctor. Your friends are waiting~
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_026: Look at you all. Destroyed half the world, but you never figured out how to beat me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_027: C'mon, let's see what tricks you jackasses kept up your sleeves.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_028: Too bad, so sad. Not even ashes left.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_029: The further we go, the quieter you get. I know, I know, you've got other ideas about the out-of-control Originium she left behind. I'm just wondering... She hurt you so bad you ended up like this. Is she really worth it?
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_030: Hmph, that's how we do it, and that's how we're gonna keep doing it until this stupid never-ending Originium's all bombed to bits! Then, I'm gonna go home and get some sleep for once! Home... Hah, gonna have to rebuild Kazdel.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_031: Hmph, whenever I remember these monsters are just a bunch of shitty rocks, I can't find the energy.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_032: Congrats. You win, probably. But you're about to see me really go wild.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_033: Damn, how's this space station manage to be even bigger than stupid Rhodes Island? Ughhh.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_034: Still as curious as ever, I see, even out here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_036: Well, it's down to the two of us again. Am I still thinking about killing you? Hah! Good to know you haven't lost your sense of humor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_038: If you hadn't mentioned what day it was today, I'd've forgotten what it was like to celebrate a holiday. Take this, a shell-case flick, my treat. Get mad, then go give those rocks over there a treat of their own. Haha, it's settled then. Hey! A Happy New Year to you, my Originium friends! Bang!
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_042: We didn't die today. Makes it a pretty good day, I'd say.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_043: Once this is all over and we're back at Rhodes Island, you can make yourself a giant birthday cake, and everyone'll be there to cheer for you. I'll cheer too, and ease up on the sarcasm, just so you can enjoy a proper happy birthday. How's that, managed to claw back a bit of yourself? Huh? Sing you the birthday song? Drop dead.
dialogue_tracker.char_1035_wisdel_sale#14_CN_044: After everything we've been through, you're still thinking about that landship? If Her Highness and the little bunny were still around, what would they be thinking about? Hmph, of course I remember what day it is today. Today's a good day, whether you're keen to throw your life away or to put an end to everything. Get ready, Doctor, we're heading out.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_001: I've arranged today's paperwork by category, Doctor. Allow me to assist you with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_002: I ran into Hibiscus and Lava the last time I came aboard. They were bickering about something or other, as per usual. The two sisters might've grown a lot, but they still love their daily squabbles. Doctor, do you think everybody has one thing about them... that they can never change?
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_003: What do I do with my time off? Hmm... Well, last time, I went to see the Red Hand Gang and the survivors of that incident. Their perseverance helped me understand, on a deeper level, why Rhodes Island helps people.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_004: Please don't avoid necessary training, Doctor. You see, I never missed a single training session. I wouldn't say it makes you totally untouchable in battle, but it can keep you alive. My two scars are proof of that.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_005: I often think back to when Ace encouraged me to join Rhodes Island. He said I'd become a great operator. That's been my motivation to keep me going through my training. But... it was only when I officially became an operator, that I understood the weight of his expectations.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_006: What has war revealed to you, Doctor? When I finally stood on the battlefield myself, I came to understand that many commanders see their troops as sacrificial pawns for victory. Ever since, I've always been reviewing and reassessing how I lead my squad. I'm not going to let myself become that kind of commander.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_007: Once back in Londinium, some soldiers from the coalition of dukes laughed at us, calling us fools. But if Rhodes Island's operations really are foolish, then I doubt any action on this land could be called wise.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_008: I sometimes go to the training grounds to guide the recruits. Most times, I'm more worried than they are about any mistakes. I always feel like I should be doing something to help push them along faster. But as Instructor Dobermann always says, I need to relax and give them more time. It looks like I still have a lot to learn.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_009: Oripathy and the Infected are two very big and complex topics. The only thing I can worry about is protecting the people in front of me. But I'd like to believe that, someday, we'll find a solution to those problems. I'll be supporting you the whole way, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_010: Doctor...? Oh, you are asleep. I'll handle the rest of your work, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_011: Rhodes Island Operator Fang, reporting in. I look different from before? Yeah, that's right.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_012: Now I better understand what I've learned.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_013: Thank you for the promotion. I'll work even harder to improve myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_014: To support the weak and protect my friends. That is my creed. The firm hand guiding me forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_017: I've read the intelligence report for this operation. Awaiting orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_018: I'm leading the squad? No problem. I've got plenty of experience.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_019: Don't be nervous. Trust your training.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_029: As long as we stay united and keep pushing forward, we have nothing to fear, even from the strongest enemy!
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_030: Excellent command as always, Doctor. The team is pretty excited. Why not let them congratulate you?
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_031: We barely managed to accomplish our objective. I'll get the team together for a postmortem debriefing. We'll do better next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_032: We've been blindsided! All units, ensure your safety, retreat now!
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_036: Ah! It's you, Doctor. I thought Kroos was pulling another one of her pranks.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. This past year's been really busy, but I got to see many places and experience a lot with Rhodes Island. Alright. Let's push ourselves just as hard next year too!
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_042: I'm always here for you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Do you have a birthday wish? No no no, don't tell me now. But If there's anything you'd like my help with, you can tell me directly. I'm always at your service.
dialogue_tracker.char_1036_fang2_CN_044: Rhodes Island's another year older... Time sure flies, and all the former members of Reserve Op Team A1 have joined different departments... Ah, look at me. This is no time to get nostalgic. There's still plenty of new problems for us to tackle.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_001: Doctor, are you busy? Oh, it's fine if you don't have time to chat. I need to get some work done too, how about we eat together after we're done?
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_002: Doctor...? All is well. I'm just reading this book. I suddenly realized that Theresa once read it to me, though even now I don't know how it ends. Tears...? Maybe it's because... it's such a heartwarming story.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_003: Yes, another ring of mine broke. Dr. Kal'tsit says no material could stand against such intense emotion. But even though this ring is broken, I still want to keep wearing it. It's both a restraint and a blessing. I'll make good use of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_004: Doctor, Blaze invited me to an event she's organizing. It's to celebrate our return to the landship, and a lot of elite operators will be there. Will I be joining them for drinks? No, of course I... Doctor, you and Dr. Kal'tsit are always looking after me, so you should know I've grown up a bit, but not that much.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_005: I've come to understand more and more how difficult it was for Theresa. What should I do? I think... I'll go and see Kazdel, as it is today. W will stand with me. And... there'll be more, others, in the future… Yes, I'm feeling more confident now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_006: I touched and felt Theresa's every emotion. She was full of love and hope... for this great land, the Sarkaz, the people by her side, and herself. But all of it came to a sudden end, along with her life. She was holding onto so much sorrow... and so am I.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_007: Dr. Kal'tsit has seen so much death. She was forced to watch many of her loved ones go, one by one. It's just... too painful. I've grown up now, so I can shoulder more responsibility for her. She doesn't have to walk alone anymore. Doctor, I want her to know that we're here for her.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_008: I expected as much... Thank you. Oh, Doctor? Do you want to talk with 'Civilight Eterna' too? Alright, come over here, don't be nervous... Just like this, feel the flowing energy. Feels like she's holding your hands, right? You'll get along well, I'm certain of it, and I always have been.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_009: Doctor, I can feel your guilt, confusion... and sorrow. But you shouldn't be trapped by your past. This is what Theresa and I both wish for you. We still have lots of work to do. The one who ignited the flame of hope may no longer be with us, but the fire still burns. Babel never truly fell.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_010: Doctor, are you well-rested? If you're still feeling tired, you don't have to force yourself to work. I'm here, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_011: Don't worry, Doctor, this is another one of my powers. I still can't heal every injury I see.... but I'll keep you safe. I'll protect the ones I love.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_012: Could I use all my different powers in the same fight? Oh, Doctor. I was just talking to myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_018: I can feel so much sorrow… so much sadness…
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_020: Fighting... is the only option here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_023: This staff is bound to my thoughts.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_024: Mine and Theresa's emotions... I'll manifest them here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_028: 'Through the grim perils of the longest night, we shall breach into the promised dawn.'
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_029: I don't want to lose anyone else. I'll carry on this fight, for every sacrifice, and all those still alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_030: The flames of hatred still spread. I'll try to extinguish them, no matter... how many times it takes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_031: I've made a few slips... No, it's not your fault, Doctor. I could have done better here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_032: I won't let anyone hurt you, Doctor. Hold onto me, and don't let go, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_033: I'm so glad to be home.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_036: Doctor, do you have something to say?
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_038: Where's that form...? Hmm... I'm looking for a financial statement from Closure. Where did I put it...? Right here! Oh, it's a summary report from HR... Which reminds me, I haven't checked the new purchase order yet either... Doctor, I won't make it to the party. So I'll wish you a happy new year right here. Ahem-hem: happy new year! Oh? You want to stay with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Do you want me to... play the violin like before? I didn't get to sneak in much practice... Oh, the time we have to ourselves just gets shorter and shorter these days... But luckily, I know your favorite tune by heart, and I'll never forget it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1037_amiya3_CN_044: Another year has passed, and Rhodes Island is still sailing onwards. Doctor, tonight was just so wonderful I wish I could hide it away, deep in my mind. Thank you for staying by my side. We'll spend this very same day next year, together.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_001: Leaving all this work to me? Hahahaha, I appreciate your trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_002: It's Siracusan tradition to mask up and dress formally for a kill, but the people of Nuova Volsinii think such costuming means embracing a new life. But no matter the occasion, you must find the best tailor for the job, no? I certainly have.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_003: Ah, what nice weather today—Siracusa's rainy season is over, and the Grey Hall old guy can no longer stay in their seats as all the hungry opportunists rush in. Hahahaha, could the Carnival have been such a roaring success without my help?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_004: If the left sword drops first, we donate the wineries to the city. If the right sword falls first, then the wineries offer free admission to everyone at next year's Carnival. Hahahaha, even as that obsessive, controlling father of mine rots away in jail, the Siracusans will never forget him!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_005: The families, the government, Signora Sicilia... every party has proved their own theories for their own gain. But how is a new city enough? What they want is a brand new country! And me? I want to see all their wishes come true, all of them!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_006: Quiet. I won't have another 'wasteland', or 'civilization' enter my ears. Our new game is not so boring. You must learn quickly how the humans play… Oh. Hehehe, you overheard me, Doctor? Then how about you be my enemy? Come, stand against me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_007: Texas said I'd show up eventually? Aha! She knows me so well. Anyone would burn her prison to the ground, but how many dare to remain and see what's left in the ashes? Hehe, there is no shame in running away. But after that, you pray every day! Pray that the inferno won't haunt your nightmares!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_008: Whiskey, on the rocks, with a mint garnish. Don't mind me, just knocking a few back while you carry on with your grand ambitions. But if I were you, I'd ease up on the goodness. Or the suffering will double when it all comes crashing down.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_009: You care very much for Rhodes Island, much as Texas cares for her companions. Woo yeah... that serious look on your face! Very good! Why don't we make a wager, with this landship... You count me in as part of this place too? Hmmm... Very interesting, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_010: Oh, dear Doctor, what would you trade for the peaceful nights you once knew?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_011: Long time no see. Oh no, did my weapon take your seat on the sofa...? A pity I was here first. What happened on the Carnival stage, you ask? Why so curious?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_013: I refuse. I don't think Rhodes Island could throw a decent Carnival, even if we put a mask on each and every one of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_014: Are you trying to placate me? Or do you think the game isn't fun enough...? I just can't see through you. No wonder I find your trust so entertaining!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_017: Where stand the wilds? Where stand the cities?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_020: The mad lead the blind! Hahahaha! 'Tis no wonder they never tire!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_021: The show hasn't started, and this place is already such a riot!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_022: Look, Zaaro! See the game we humans are born playing—
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_023: Your weapons are right at your fingertips, why wait?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_024: No need to cover up! If secrets go public, then everybody is in the game!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_025: What should I do? I knew who you were right away.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_026: What are you waiting for? The curtains are about to fall!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_027: The spotlight shines on us. Hahahaha!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_028: Do not disappoint tonight, my friends.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_029: A grand spectacle, a perfect show, a dignified exit. Bravo, Bravo… But I won't applaud, not without an accident befalling the act, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_030: Work's over, time for a drink. Where is Texas?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_031: Come gawp at those whose masks have fallen. Some carefree, struck with panic. Some let loose, so free and manic! Oh, what fun to prowl this ball!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_032: Defeat? Hahahaha. That's just the end of Act One.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_033: It's quiet in here—not afraid to miss the excitement outside?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_034: Haha... is this how you greet Texas too?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_036: Come here! Dance with the wolves.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_038: Happy New Year! You're inviting me in? How will you introduce me? Texas's archenemy, the Saluzzo traitor, or the white wolf who would conquer all? Hahahaha... Enjoy the evening, Doctor. For tomorrow, the twin moons shall rise for the hunt... like always.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_042: Here's a Carnival costume. Put it on.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_043: One birthday, my father brought me to tour a vineyard in bloom. I wondered why there was no monstrous vehicle to run it down to ruin, along with the whole of Siracu— What? No, I bought this bottle of wine off some random shelf. That manor became a trash heap long ago.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_CN_044: Hah, the things you and the Rhodes Islanders do are quite interesting indeed. Siracusa, no, everywhere of this land is a filthy swamp, yet Rhodes Island manages to hold on still. Is it because you're so adaptable, or... did you have a hand in writing the rules of the game?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_001: Leaving all this work to me? Hahahaha, I appreciate your trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_002: It's Siracusan tradition to mask up and dress formally for a kill, but the people of Nuova Volsinii think such costuming means embracing a new life. You must find the best tailor for the job, regardless of the occasion, no? I certainly have.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_003: Ah, è una bellissima giornata—Siracusa's rainy season is over, and the Grey Hall vecchi can no longer stay in their seats as all the hungry opportunists rush in. Hahahaha, could the carnival have been such a roaring success without my help?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_004: The left sword drops, donating wineries to the city. The right blade falls, offering free admission to next year's carnival—Hahahaha, even as that obsessive, controlling father of mine rots away in jail, the Siracusans will never forget him!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_005: The famiglie, the government, Signora Sicilia... every party has proved their own theories for their own gain. But how is a new city enough? What they want is a brand new country! And me? I want to see all their wishes come true, of course!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_006: Zitti. I won't have another 'wasteland', or 'civilization' enter my ears—our new game is not so boring. You must learn quickly how the humans play... Hahahaha, you overheard me? Then, Doctor, let's have you stand against me.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_007: Texas said I'd show up eventually? She knows me so well. Anyone would burn their bindings to cinders, but how many dare to remain and sift through the ashes to find what's left? Hahahaha, there is no shame in running away. Just pray for an end to the daily dreams of returning to the flames!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_008: Whiskey, on the rocks, with a mint garnish. Don't mind me, taking a few shots here while you carry on with your grand ambitions. I'd ease up on the goodness, or the suffering will double when ruin comes for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_009: You care very much for Rhodes Island, much as Texas cares for her companions—that serious look on your face! Buonissimo! Why don't we make a wager, with this landship... you count me as a part of this place too? Molto interessante, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_010: Doctor, I do wonder... What would you trade for the peaceful nights you once knew?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_011: Quanto tempo. Oh no, did my weapon take your seat on the sofa...? A pity I was here first. What happened on the carnival stage, you ask? Why so curious?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_013: Not a chance. I don't think Rhodes Island could throw a decent carnival, even if we put a mask on each and every one of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_014: Are you trying to placate me? Or do you think the game isn't fun enough...? I can't figure it out. It's no wonder I find your trust so entertaining!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_017: Where be the barrens? Where be civilization?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_020: The mad lead the blind! Hahahaha! 'Tis no wonder they never tire!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_021: What a riotous revelry! Did the show start without me?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_022: Look, Zaaro! See the game we humans are born to play—
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_023: We've all drawn our weapons, why wait?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_024: No hiding, no holding back. A secret exposed means nothing to hide.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_025: Che fare? Saw you right away.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_026: What are you waiting for? The curtains are about to fall!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_027: The spotlight shines on us. Hahahaha!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_028: Do not disappoint tonight, my friends!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_029: A grand spectacle, a perfect show, a dignified exit... Bravo, but I won't applaud your efforts—unless an accident befalls this act, hahahaha.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_030: Work's over, time for a drink. Where is Texas?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_031: Every mask has fallen. Aloof faces, shameful grimaces, and some finally about to lose it all... what fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_032: Defeat? Hahahaha. That's just the end of Act One.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_033: It's quiet in here—not afraid to miss the excitement outside?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_034: Haha... is this how you greet Texas too?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_036: Vieni qui! Dance with the wolves.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_038: Happy New Year! You're inviting me in? How will you introduce me? Texas's archenemy, the Saluzzo traitor, or the white wolf who would conquer all? Enjoy the evening, Doctor. The twin moons shall rise only for the hunt as before.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_042: Here's a carnival costume. Put it on.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_043: One birthday, my father brought me to tour a vineyard in bloom. Back then, I wondered why there was no monstrous vehicle to run it down to ruin, along with the whole of Siracusa—What? No, I bought this bottle of vino off some random shelf. That manor became a trash heap long ago.
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_ITA_CN_044: Hah, the things you and the Rhodes Islanders do are quite interesting indeed. Siracusa, no, all of Terra is a filthy swamp, yet Rhodes Island manages to hold on still. Is it because you're so adaptable, or—did you have a hand in writing the rules of the game?
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_001: 喂，扎罗，杯子还没有洗完？恺撒，别捣冰块了......都戴好礼帽，竖起耳朵，让我们欢迎新Boss在营业前来一段震撼人心的演讲。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_002: 一家无证经营的酒吧，一位无所不能的调酒师，一个无比简单的规则：今天之内你是Boss，主宰眼前的一切。哈哈，把那些让你为难的愿望都加进酒单吧。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_003: 尝尝。这杯酒叫“邪魔日出”，是上一任Boss，那个逃难的雪祀从萨米带来的好东西。我知道你肯定不会让我们失望，就算最后被狼群撕碎，你的遗产也只会更多。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_004: 收工！店交给你了，现在你有足够的时间和空间鼓捣自己的秘密了，这是Boss的特权。扎罗，车子还没发动好？嘘——忠告：员工下班后去哪儿，别多问。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_005: 我当然喜欢这家店，没了它，设计新游戏的灵感从哪儿来？无法无天？啧，阿涅塞，告诉Boss，我们是不是每天都在等警察上门开罚单？真无奈啊，来的不是坏种就是你这样的可怜人。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_006: 我是说过要你做我的敌人，但这并不妨碍我实现你的愿望，德克萨斯应该不陌生。这家店会成为泥潭的阀门，而你可以决定我将它拧紧还是打开。这种关系难道不比敌人有趣？
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_007: 考虑好了吗，救世主？是安排深海教会和圣愚坐下来喝一杯，还是找死魂灵商量怎么让罗德岛飞出星荚？哈哈，尽管吩咐，给你自己，也给我们这些员工一些挑战！
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_008: 嗯，录像里的独眼巨人也当过Boss。他试图用预见的那些“悲惨未来”改写我的规则，可惜啊，在距离交班不到五分钟的时候，他吐血死了......欸，你也是这方面的行家吧？
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_009: 冰块？睁大眼睛，Boss，酒杯里是一块石头。你想见见它的主人，你的老朋友吗？在这家店里，你有机会彻底搞定这一切。我当然知道，我当然做得到。惨痛的代价？哈哈，我兴致盎然！
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_010: 还没想好？哈哈，我只是想提醒你，对调酒师来说，冰化了，酒没动，非常不礼貌。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_011: 哈哈，不必摘帽，您现在就是这家酒吧的Boss。拉普兰德与她的狼群，竭诚为您服务。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_013: 恭喜你，我和狼群暂时还没失去耐心。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_014: 发自肺腑地向你致谢，Boss，你让我们在工作时很有激情——起码现在还是。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_017: 喂，瓦古，倒杯威士忌给我和Boss漱漱口。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_018: 我还是更期待你来告诉我，何为“秩序”。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_020: 嚼冰块吗？止疼，还能保持清醒。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_023: 有趣~阿涅塞，瓦古，别挡着我。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_024: 无聊~扎罗，恺撒，赶紧清场。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_030: 干得不错，好久没见到这群狼这么有热情了。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_031: 这就是你想要的？你知道让我期待落空的代价吧，Boss？
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_032: 新Boss什么时候来呢......扎罗，这个人为什么还没消失？
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_033: 你打算用这样的装修招徕客人？
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_034: 吃橄榄吗？是的，我又换口味了。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_036: 扎罗，啃下Boss半个脑袋，我要看看里面装着什么。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_038: 给你，伏特加马提尼，加了五颗橄榄。别有心理负担，只是尝尝员工调的酒而已。追加一杯，再好好讲讲你拯救或者毁灭泰拉的大计划，这才是我为你准备的新年礼物。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_042: 友情提醒——留给我听你发号施令的时间不多了。
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_043: 理解理解，明明是平时琢磨了千百遍的事情，在生日这天一本正经地说出来，成真的概率会翻倍嘛——喂，我和狼群就在面前，你为什么要闭着眼睛许愿？
dialogue_tracker.char_1038_whitw2_sale#15_CN_044: 一艘船，亿万人的命运，哈哈，你还是那点出息。不过我确实猜不到，最终你会为此烧毁什么留下什么......那时候的惊喜，便是我向你讨要的报酬，Boss。
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_001: Doctor, since you've decided to join our voyage, you'll need to contribute. Think you can handle steering the ship? Here's the wheel: turn right to go right, turn left to go left. Clear? Very good. Let's set sail. Joking? No, I'm dead serious.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_002: Here's your hammock, Doctor. The seas have been gentle these past two days, rocking like a cradle. But when the wind rises and waves swell, sleep won't come so easily. So I've brought you this bucket, use it if seasickness strikes. Just be sure to aim well; our cleaning crew won't take kindly to a messy deck.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_003: Doctor, I'll be occupied with my alchemical research. Can you helm the ship in my absence? No, not a word to the crew. My last experiment, while successful in improving engine efficiency, left our hull compromised. The crew wasn't pleased. At the celebration banquet that followed... They voted to hang me from the mast the entire night.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_004: These silvery liquid orbs, 'Corazonix', now form my right arm. They convey to me the movement of all things: the wind, the waves, fin-schools... and even the subtle currents of blood within the human body. That sensation... is as if I am merging with the very pulse of all existence.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_005: People forge connections by accepting fragments of others into themselves. That's what my maestro once said. He came from the Church of the Deep, so I initially misinterpreted his words. But in truth, his meaning was profound: we enter life as hollow vessels; we are incomplete until shaped by communication and shared understanding.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_006: In the past, I could only answer your questions about Iberia through second-hand stories. The glory of its past and the desolation of its present have never stirred any sense of belonging in me—Rather, its future is what I yearn to shape. With this ship as my lodestar, I shall forge my own narrative for Iberia.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_007: We're about to run out of provisions, so I'm taking the dinghy out to go fincatching. Care to join me, Doctor? Use a fishing rod? No, too inefficient. It's better to dive straight into the ocean, and hurl fins aboard with Destreza. Not a swing wasted.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_008: The ship's now entering the eye of the storm! Hard to port! Steady, sailors! Don't panic, Doctor. I hold these raging tides in the palm of my hand. I promise you won't be swept overboard. Oh, sorry. Didn't expect you to get all soaked…
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_009: Oh, Doctor. How did you find this sanctuary? Me...? When the crew gets too rowdy, I retreat here for some peace and quiet. Isn't it strange? Out here, where the only sound is the wind and the waves, I somehow hear the echoes of voices from Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_010: Asleep already? I never expected you to adapt to the rocking waves so quickly... Though, I've heard that people find rest where they feel secure.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_011: Doctor, welcome to la Cuna de Nene. I... am her captain. Ahem... The name wasn't my idea. We let the First Mate's pet draw the name stripes.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_012: Is this footage from my previous missions? You actually brought it aboard... That move was full of openings. It clearly wasn't properly calculated.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_013: A gift to celebrate my promotion to captain? That happened a long time ago, though. Why bring it up now, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_014: Congratulations, Doctor. In recognition of your exceptional service aboard, and the profound bond you've forged with the First Mate's pet, the crew and I have voted unanimously to promote you to the distinguished rank of Senior Groomer.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_017: Doctor, take the helm for now. This will be a tough battle, and my crew needs me to fight shoulder-to-shoulder with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_018: Give me your orders like before, Doctor. I will follow them.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_019: Hoist the flag, sailors! Tell the enemies, we are here.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_020: Starboard stern, batteries ready! All hands, prepare to fire!
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_021: I can hold here myself. I know what to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_023: Once the wind fills our sails, it's time to act.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_024: I hear the waves drumming against the hull. They herald our victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_025: Probes, functional. Corazonix... Good to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_026: Clear images... Hmph, check the data.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_027: Not bad... Reasonable data. Try processing it.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_028: Is it correct? Or not quite... Whatever, let's have a go.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_029: A truly resounding victory. Let us bask in the cheers of this moment.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_030: What we just encountered is but a minor hiccup before lengthy voyage. Cheer up, Doctor. Far greater trials await us ahead.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_031: There's no need to pursue a spent force. Let's return to the ship.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_032: Turn downwind and set full sail! We must get clear of this region immediately!
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_033: Why the surprised look? Even a captain isn't exempt from cleaning duties. Could you pass me the mop? I need to finish before dark. Thanks, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_036: My braid's come undone, will you help me?
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_038: Seeing how ecstatic the crew is tonight, I doubt the rum in our hold will last through the night. Oh, I must remind you, Doctor. When the revelry begins, keep clear of the railings. We can't risk a tipsy Doctor going overboard. Ah, why am I even concerned...? Ahem, just, uh, trust me on this one.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. We are sailing towards the rising sun.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_043: Today's your birthday, Doctor? After drifting on the seas for so long, my chronometer might be a bit fuzzy, despite my best efforts to keep it calibrated. Ah, look, migrating fins swimming beneath our hull... Fascinating, isn't it? Individually distinct, yet moving in such sublime harmony.
dialogue_tracker.char_1039_thorn2_CN_044: Back then, Doctor, I was still aboard YOUR ship... I once considered dropping the anchor, ending my life of wandering, to settle on Rhodes Island. But no one can stay in one place forever, and every journey has its end. What truly matters is that we have each other in this moment.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_001: Hey, leader! Got some work for us?
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_002: Leader, how about we throw a party? We can play some hip-hop and eat apple pie. The best life is the party life! No party, no life!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_003: Locked and loaded, ready for action! What's the objective today, Leader?
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_004: Some people believe money can buy anything. But, uh-uh, that saying doesn't really apply to me. Wealth won't make a lick of difference to where my targets end up.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_005: My first wish: more guns! We angels all have a patron firearm, a special gun we grow up with, but owning just one gun is kinda lame. I want eight more!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_006: My second wish: get someone to turn off this light over my head!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_007: I've always got Texas covered, that's why she lives so carefree. So obvious it goes without saying, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_008: If you ever run into an angel with black horns oozing ominous vibes, please tell her for me: I've never forgotten her.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_009: Us Penguin Logistics girls ain't so bad, right? What do you say, leader? Wanna come be our boss? Hehe, just kidding.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_010: Oh Lord… is this another soul for us to save?
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_011: Password: 'Long live the Penguin Empire.' So you're the client? Call me Exusiai. I'm nothing like that Lupo ice queen. I'm always down for some fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_014: Leader... No, savior, I swear on this gun in my hand, I will protect you until the day of reckoning.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_017: Squad combat? I'm very familiar with that.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_018: You've got a good eye. No one makes a better leader than me.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_019: Let's go! Take them all by storm!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_020: Relax, I already called dibs on the most lucrative real estate in Hell, to share with all of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_029: Perfect! Let's keep up the momentum and charge on!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_030: May my hail of bullets bring you eternal peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_031: Victory is a heavenly melody. Alright, let's go home and grab some beers!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_032: Life is like a gun, sometimes it just jams. Don't get discouraged, leader, we'll get'em next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_036: Leader, wanna try out my weapon?
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_038: Happy New Year, Leader! The party's about to start, Employee Performance Competition Night's over, and I'm not dead last! Here's your booze and apple pie. Let's heat ourselves up to the hip-hop beat, and set this firework tower to the sky~ Here we go! Three, two—BANG!
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_043: Leader, c'mere, c'mon! Welcome to your birthday party! Turn out the lights and blow out your candles! Oh, but remember, even as the candles go out, my halo will shine on you in the dark. Never worry that you'll lose your way—the angel's Blessings will be forever at your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_103_angel_CN_044: We are led in differing directions. But by your power and wisdom, you may guide us on our journey together. Should the soul in you that protects us be a constant, we too will open a brand new path for you by our souls of honesty and ardor.
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_001: Here. I've sorted these files according to how important or urgent they are, and whatever's left, I'll—Why do you look like you don't recognize me? C'monnn... Get these done so you can send me back out there already!
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_002: Ahhh... why did the little bunny run off when she saw me? Not like I'm gonna give her an airlift hug during work hours! I've been acting weird? Hah. After everything I went through, I get so excited to see everybody, it makes me wanna—Uh? You're not going anywhere? Then... a-one-and-a-two, up you go too?
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_003: How did you know I was researching this in my dorm? I'm trying to see how big my Arts can make the flames in this furnace, but I just can't believe—You got a tip about a fire hazard? Ahem, here's a bag of Cystymilk toffees, so *ssh* keep this a secret from Amiya, alright—Y-YOU WANT FIVE PACKS?! That's brutal! DEAL!
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_004: Let me do it, you rinse the bowls like this. It's not about making them squeaky clean, Yanese dining culture's just funny like that. Oh, there's something I really love about it, though—doesn't matter if you know your dinner mates or not, everyone sitting at one table shares the same dishes. So yap away while enjoying the same stuff, and bam! We're all friends now.
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_005: I made a few new friends on my trip to Baizao, went to a bunch of feasts, and tied up some loose ends. There's so much on this land that's unfair or unavoidable, and my work as an Elite Operator remains the same. It's got my blood boiling a little too—Oh, did I burn you? My bad!
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_006: My life's been pretty fantastical, huh? All those twists and turns and yet I survived, even ended up here at Rhodes Island—Is this what they call fate? If those accidents hadn't happened, I wouldn't be here right now—Oh, no, no, no! I prefer my life as it is, with the little bunny and you, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_1040_blaze2_CN_007: Right, let's go back and visit your mom. Wait, I mean visit my mom? Agh, that's even worse! Uh, Doctor? You heard all that?
