dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_013: Promotion? Wow! Let's celebrate with some cake. Look, I grabbed these from Logistics. It's fine!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_014: Well, well, you really know what you're doing, Doctor! That's right, I'm really talented. You'd better use my power well!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_017: All right? I'm feeling motivated! Time to climb all the way to the top!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_018: Eh? You want me to lead? This is all so sudden...
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_019: Say goodbye to the reckless Cliffheart. I'm taking things seriously from here on out.
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_020: I'll show them what I can do!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_026: My hook never misses! I've got this!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_027: Amateurs are doomed to fall to their death!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_029: There ain't no mountain too high, no situation too bleak!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_030: Of course we won with me around!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_031: Wow, they sure are good at running away!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_033: It's so warm here... I'll hang out over here for a while!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_036: I'm gonna teach you all about Mountaineering next time, Doctor! You'll love it, I promise!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_038: Happy New Year! Look, Doctor, I've prepared all this Mountaineering gear for you. Let's go! Huh? It's still midnight, you say? It's fine! We need to set off earlier so that we can catch the sunrise at the peak.
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Speaking of which, lemme have a look at what my brother gave you! Aww... he's still into this pricey boring ornament stuff. Zero times as practical as my present. Anyway, check this out, Doctor! A choice set of climbing equipment, just for you. Once the weather's good, let's go scale some mountains!
dialogue_tracker.char_173_slchan_CN_044: My brother and sister are still butting heads, but their relationship's smoothed out a bunch, I can feel it. Gotta thank you for melting the ice between them, Doctor. But still, I really wish hanging around home was as chill as being at Rhodes Island…
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_001: Hm? You're here to pray? Sorry, I'm busy right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_002: Hm? Yes, I'm the current Karlan Saintess. But everyone swamped by work deserves a little break from time to time, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_003: Wasting time on trivial affairs is what I call slacking off. What I'm doing right now is… taking the opportunity to recharge.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_004: Work hard, play hard, right? Don't force all those rigid rules on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_005: The Karlan Goddess? We share a good relationship, thanks to my duty as the Saintess.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_006: I'd be happy to help you, but the life of a Karlan Saintess is a busy one. Well, I guess I'll make an exception for you this once, but please make it short.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_007: My sis... Ensia... you people at Rhodes Island are all pretty fond of her, right? So it's not like she received any special treatment from that guy. And now... well, I think I get it now. It's fine like this. I'll just keep watching over her. It's fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_008: I twisted my ankle once when I was a kid. My brother carried me on his back all night, going from house to house until someone agreed to take us in. I decided that very moment that I wanted to grow up to become someone like my brother! But now... heh, forget it.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_009: Huh? How did you find me? I'll freeze your toes—Um? Coffee? For me? Thanks. Oh, right, Doctor, wanna hang out here with me for a while? The view is pretty nice. But let's keep it a secret, okay? A secret between just the two of us—aw, this coffee is so bitter!
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_010: It's rare to get to rest like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_011: Shh, I sneaked out—oh, um, hi, HR Director! I... I'm here to lend my powers to Rhodes Island. Pramanix, Karlan Saintess, at your service. Bless you, my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_012: I hear a voice... repeating something in my head...
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_013: 'You shall emerge victorious one day.' This is the pledge of Karlan, and what I'm praying for as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_014: Since when did you need blessings too? Can you wait a bit? I'll get ready.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_017: May the Holy Mt. Karlan be with us.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_018: Follow the bells and you'll find the way.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_019: Let me pray towards the mountains for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_026: Here come the bells, cold winds binding my enemies.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_027: These powers are a gift from the Holy Mountain.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_028: As the bells ring, the impenetrable armor shall be no more.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_029: It was simple, thanks to the Spirits' power.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_030: The light of Karlan was shining on us.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_031: If only we could have won without bloodshed... just my wish...
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_032: It's not looking good... I suggest we retreat at once.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_036: Close your eyes and I'll bring you somewhere new... Do keep your eyes closed, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_038: What am I doing here? You see, Doctor, Ensia's aboard Rhodes Island, and as her big sister, it's only natural for me to pay her a visit on New Year's. You won't have the heart to let Ensia spend the holiday out there alone, would you? How very cruel that would be.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_043: So—how does it taste? Nice and cool, isn't it? It's my own handmade frosted chocolate. Do you like it? Good, that's a relief, I really spent a lot of time studying it.
dialogue_tracker.char_174_slbell_CN_044: My brother's here too? Oh, no need to worry, Doctor, we all know what our business is. On this day, we're no more than operators for Rhodes Island. This place is like a little pocket, and I'm here from time to time just to relax, not for anything else.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_001: I apologize... It's my job to attend to you, but my body simply won't move like I want it to...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_002: I once breathed in some kind of Originium toxin... it damaged my memory and the nervous system in my lower extremities... at least that is what Dr. Kal'tsit told me. So I often wonder... what was my life like before then?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_003: This little blue bird often comes over and chats with me. Sometimes, I dream about turning into a bird myself... flying free in the skies, without a care...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_004: Once upon a time, I was imprisoned in an empty room. I only saw another human being when they needed my healing...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_005: With this staff in my hand, I can heal as many as I will. Is this... really an ability I was born with?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_006: Shining told me that the sins we carry... the guilt of starting the war, as devils... will one day catch up to us and we will have to face judgment. Those people who imprisoned me said the same thing. But...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_007: Amiya... I feel a sense of deja vu whenever I see her. Perhaps we met sometime in the past?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_008: The memories I have are mere fragments. My people... Originium... my mission, the rebellion, the war... but tell me, why are you in one of my memories too?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_009: How did I end up like this? Why must I suffer all that I do? Doctor, do you have the answers?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_010: Do you too dream of flying freely through the skies like a bird?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_011: Liz... that's my real name. Everything else is just cloudy, indistinct memories...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_012: Why is there a need for me to grow stronger?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_013: A promotion? I see. It sounds like something to rejoice over. But... I apologize, I don't feel any joy within...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_014: Thank you for personally informing me of my promotion, Doctor. But... to me, it doesn't matter as much as the story of the world outside that this little bird is telling me right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_018: I shall do anything you command me to.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_019: I need only do as the manual said, yes?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_020: The battlefield... a place where lives are taken...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_024: It's not my wish to take lives.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_025: My power is all yours now.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_027: You will not come to harm.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_029: No matter how difficult the battle gets, I will always…
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_030: To fight to the very end... that's our destiny.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_031: Perhaps they've already escaped this cage called fate...
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_033: Rooms... They too are a type of cage.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_036: Doctor... is this... what is known as 'intimacy'?
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_038: Happy... New Year? I'm sorry, it seems I've forgotten what this holiday entails—just make a wish and that'll do, you say? Then I would wish, in this coming year, for Margaret and Shining to be safe and sound... as well as you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. You still remember your own birthday... how fortunate, truly. Alas, I can't procure any present for you... Would you tell me what your birthday wishes are, Doctor? Your wishes may bring hope to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_179_cgbird_CN_044: Shining notes that since we came aboard Rhodes Island, my health has taken a turn for the better. When by your side, I feel this warmth, too. But why can I not shake this harsh premonition... Doctor, after I recall everything, will Rhodes Island still welcome me with open arms?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_001: Professor, I've finished all my Catastrophe studies notes. Do you have any more I could read?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_002: Huh? What? Why do I call you 'Professor'? Well, you're an expert on Catastrophe studies, so you're like a professor, right? Aren't we all supposed to address our superiors with respect?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_003: Pardon me? Please say that again? Oh, you're wondering why I'm hard of hearing? Well, I got infected with Oripathy back when I was doing research near a volcano...
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_004: Besides completing the tasks you give me, I have to go to Dr. Kal'tsit regularly for checkups. The doctor said my symptoms are pretty serious...
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_005: I have to work hard to finish the research my parents began! I want to prove that their work was meaningful, and that it could maybe even change the world!
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_006: My parents... they've passed on. A pyroclastic flow hit them when they were conducting studies near a volcano... I have to pick up where they left off and finish their research, no matter what!
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_007: My playmates? I'm pretty friendly with Mousse and some others, so I don't feel lonely at all! If possible, I'd love to start a book club with them too. Could we hold our club meetings in your office, Professor?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_008: Dr. Kal'tsit told me... I'm losing not only my sense of hearing, but my sense of sight too. …Well, what else might this disease do to me?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_009: How could I tell you were behind me? Because I could feel your warmth! My eyesight and hearing aren't as sharp as they once were, but my other senses are still the same. Can't bring me down this easily, you know!
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_011: I'm Eyjafjalla. My career before joining Rhodes Island was in the field of volcanology. I'm a bit hard of hearing due to my Oripathy. I just hope I won't be a burden to you, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_012: Please teach me all you can, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_013: Promotion? Really? I'm so happy to have your approval, Professor!
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_014: My mother gave me these little lambs. They're cute, aren't they? Huh? They're scorching hot? Be careful! You have to put on oven mittens before touching them!
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_018: Don't forget to prepare emergency supplies as well as weapons!
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_019: We can take care of ourselves, Professor. You just focus on giving orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_026: This may be a little hot...
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_029: I'm so glad you're safe, Professor...
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_030: Why must our world be enveloped in strife?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_031: Is everyone okay? Anything I can do?
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_032: Ow... It's... It's okay... I'm fine...
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_033: This room makes me feel safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_036: Thank you, Professor, for helping me become a stronger person.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_038: Happy New Year, Professor! Everyone's happily prepping their presents and decorations, and so many operators have come to talk to me. I can't hear them clearly all the time, but when I see the looks on their faces, I'm sure they must all be very warm words. Professor, I wish you that warmth, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_043: Professor, do you know there's a cake that's both named after and inspired by volcanoes? It's called 'lava cake.' I asked Gummy and Mousse, and they taught me how to make it. When you cut it open, the chocolate inside comes spilling out. Here's your cake, Professor, Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_180_amgoat_CN_044: Thank you for everything you've done for me over the last year, Professor. I'm delighted to be here with you. There's still so much I don't know about volcanoes and Catastrophes. Before I get to the point where I can't continue my surveys and research, I'm devoting all my energy into this. That way, I can live with no regrets.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_001: Listen to me, Doctor, it's for your own good.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_002: How do you like this fragrance? You feel refreshed, right? It's all thanks to Melantha. Her samples inspired me.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_003: Thank you for building me that flower greenhouse. It'll be a good place for our people to rest and ease their minds.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_004: Oh, you're up? Try stretching, see if you got all the tiredness out. Nice. I put a lot into this new fragrance. Glad it works.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_005: Narcissus, rabbitear iris, kalanchoe, boronia... I always carry all sorts of flower seeds on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_006: Oh, you mean this little one? She's still young, but she's been a big help with my fragrances.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_007: I've heard that scents are the foundation of ant society. The relationship between perfumers and their clients is the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_008: You seem to visit the greenhouse a lot these days. Oh, there's some pollen on your sleeve. Let me wipe it for you… Alright, you're good.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_009: You were asleep for quite a while. What did you dream about, I wonder?
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_010: Doctor? Doctor...? Wow, the lavender was much more effective than I expected…
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_011: Nice to meet you, Doctor. I'm Lena, the perfumer. Interesting job, right? Have you heard the word before?
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_012: Please take a look and tell me how I did.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_013: A promotion...? You came to tell me in person? I'm flattered. Oh, just a moment, Doctor… There we go, your collar was wrinkled, so I smoothed it out for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_014: I don't appreciate violence as a tactic... But I'll do my best to get used to it for Rhodes Island, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_018: Whether you need me as a perfumer or a healer, I won't let you down, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_020: What kind of battle will it end up being, I wonder…?
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_027: How do you like this scent?
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_029: I always knew we'd win, Doctor, so long as you're the one in command.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_031: Good job, everyone. Go get some rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_032: It's too bad we didn't win, but I won't let it discourage me.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_033: I always feel best when I'm at your side, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_036: I sense… a pleasant smell from you, Doctor
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. I'll just put all the New Year's plants right here, if you're fine with that? They might only bloom for four days, but so long as I'm around, your office will be filled with color and fragrance no matter the season.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_043: Perfect timing, Doctor. I was just about to go look for you. Come take a seat, I have a special aromatherapy and dessert prepared. Go on, take a deep breath and relax. Just for today, this greenhouse's flowers bloom only for you. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_181_flower_CN_044: I admit I have had a lot of regrets about leaving home. But now I run this little garden on Rhodes Island. This job has its own blessings, filling everyone's lives with wonderful fragrance. You know, Doctor, there's a saying in Minos: 'When a flower leaves its branch, it is embracing the whole land.'
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_001: Doctor, I've finished sorting the Originium from the other ores, as you requested. Is there anything else?
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_002: Oripathy is indeed troublesome. I can't even go on operations without approval from Dr. Kal'tsit. Oripathy shortens one's lifespan, you say? Yes, that's true, but I don't really mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_003: This tuning fork? It's actually a staff — not only a weapon but also useful for geological surveys. I find it always comes in handy.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_004: Without Rhodes Island, I'd probably still be a full-time geological researcher. And without you people... I'd probably already be dead.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_005: What? I have dark circles under my eyes? Aw, I knew it…
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_006: What's that behind me, you ask? Well... ah, never mind, it's really hard to explain. I'll tell you when we have more time.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_007: Some rocks talk to me, you know. They chatter and even squabble away. Sometimes, I lose sleep because of it… You think I'm kidding? Do I look like I'm kidding?
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_008: Provence is as careless as always. She needs to be careful or she'll end up like me, seriously ill. You'd better give her a good talking-to.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_009: Astonishing...! Look at this, Doctor! This surface... it couldn't have been formed without high pressure in the crust three hundred and fifty thousand years ago. Isn't it incredible…? Guess what, Doctor? The theory is correct! Those who refuted it are the true fools!
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_010: Doctor—oh, you're sleeping? You must be tired from all your hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_011: I'm Earthspirit, a geology scholar and Caster, reporting in. I work eight hours each day. Make me work any more and you'll have to pay me extra.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_012: Hm, is this academic data, or something else?
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_013: We must continue to refine our scientific method.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_014: Forgive my bluntness, but do bear in mind you are paying me only a single salary. No matter how far you promote me, I won't do more than a single person's work.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_018: I hope this squad performs well in all types of extreme environment.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_019: Don't worry, we'll be right back.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_020: We can't let them misuse Originium like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_028: You shouldn't have set foot here.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_029: What the enemy was doing… would only bring disaster.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_030: All enemies have been dealt with.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_033: This environment is quite suitable for research.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_036: This piece of ore is… for me? Really? But… it must be very expensive, no?
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_038: Take a look at the vast strata under our feet. Do you think they pay attention to the new year? Mhm, so neither do I. It's nothing more than an ordinary day off to me, so any tasks assigned to me will be treated as overtime, including attending any parties.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_042: Doctor, time to get to work.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_043: Happy birthday. This gemstone is for you. Very pretty, isn't it? I found it in the wilds after a Catastrophe had passed through. Does it confer good luck, you ask? Stones like these have already gone through countless arduous years of settlement and compression to become what they are. Asking it to control fate on top of that seems a bit much.
dialogue_tracker.char_183_skgoat_CN_044: There are too many unsolved enigmas in my research, and I only have so much time. Thus, I have to maintain a clear boundary between work and life. So long as each finds its own separate meaning, my time on this land will be worthwhile. I count myself lucky to have found this balance at Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_002: Laterano cakes are so delicious! But we operators have to pay attention to our diet, right?... aww...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_003: Not my gloves... I'm sorry, I can't take my gloves off... I don't want you to see my hands. That's the one thing I ask... sorry…
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_004: A-Are we departing now? Al-Alright, let me just prepare one moment...!
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_005: Do you think it's odd that I have two tails? Do-do-do I look even stranger than I thought? Umm...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_006: When my symptoms aren't flaring up, my hand stays all normal... It feels so nice, just being able to hold the kitties like this...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_007: Doctor, what kind of cake do you prefer? Mango, or matcha? I tried making a few, and... you already ate? Oh, umm, Okay...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_008: D-Doctor! Sora... sh-she's the super idol, Sora, isn't she?! I'd recognize her anywhere! I'm her biggest fan! Why is she here at Rhodes Island? And... and... can I ask her for an autograph?
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_009: Doctor, have you heard of the Avenue des Champs-Élysées? Yes, I happened to be born there. I really wish I could go back and visit one day... what? Oh, no, I appreciate it, but I'm not lonely. I have you, after all! You're my family.
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_010: Aw... Doctor... why are you ignoring me...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_011: Good day... p-please call me Mousse. And... and please don't stare at my hand so much...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_012: This is a favor I'll never forget!
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_013: Huh? Pro...promotion?! I-I'm not prepared for this...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_014: Doctor, I know there's a limit to what I can accomplish, so I swear... I'll do all that I'm able, as well as I'm able! It's... It's the only way I could ever repay you, Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_018: This is in my hands! You can do this, Mousse!
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_019: I essentially blend into the walls, so I'm a good choice for scouting...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_020: Scouting complete. Sending you enemy coordinates.
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_024: From now on, this is my battle...!
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_029: It was a tough fight... but I stayed steady through it all...!
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_030: Yay... Oh, oh, sorry, it's not that I like battles that much, but...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_031: D-Did I drag us all down?
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_033: E-Excuse me... May I come in...?
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_036: D-Doctor... I really can't hold it in anymore... do we have a scratching post? Urghh...
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_038: Happy new year, Doctor… Help yourself with the pastries there! I personally made some of them, and they go well with the tea I prepared. With my gloves on me though... they may not look as great as what I used to make. B-But should still taste good, I think!
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_043: Doctor, could you accept this felt doll? I made it with the fur those kittens left behind. It was a lot of fur for a small doll, so I tried a few times to get it right. Do you recognize it, Doctor? It's you... N-No? Aw…
dialogue_tracker.char_185_frncat_CN_044: Sora just gave me more of her albums, and they also came with her signature on them! How nice of her! She also gave me this little heart-shaped doodle on my gloves, saying these are the coolest gloves she's ever seen, and that I looked really special with them. Doctor, I'm thinking, maybe... I'm not as weird as I thought?
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_001: Yeah, yeah, I get it, you deserve a nice rest in your off time. But you gotta get your treatment right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_002: Huh? You want me to be gentle and caring? That's nurse stuff, pal. I'm a doctor, from top to toe. That means healing. Treatment. Don't waste my time with the fluff.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_003: Strange, why does Dr. Kal'tsit keeps telling me to 'be nice to patients'? She's been doing it ever since I got here.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_004: Your average doctor's biggest concern is keeping herself safe. Mine, on the other hand... it's getting my patients to stop being scared of me.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_005: Treatment time, ears open! Eyes on me! Hands up! Don't move!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_006: Doctors and fighters... life-savers, life-takers. People think we're polar opposites, but I think we're one and the same—we both sacrifice.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_007: Huh? I didn't beat anyone up, I just wanted to say hi. Watch, lemme demo... I initiate physical contact, and that's how I get closer to people, see?
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_008: I'm kinda missing my homeland... I chose to be a medic myself, but it's crazy it all turned out the way it did. Life sure took me down some wild paths, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_009: Doctor... you and I are both travelers on a lonely road. I guess that's why we understand each other so well.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_010: What the... you're asleep, huh? Heheh.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_011: I'm Medic Operator Gavial. First things first... Don’t judge me by the way I look. Got it?
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_012: Tch, I thought we were gonna have combat class.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_013: Everyone's so scared of me treating them... You're the only one who accepts me for what I am. Thanks for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_014: All right, no more fooling around. I'll be serious from now on.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_017: Leave the rear to me. Go show what you're made of!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_018: All right, get in line, everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_019: All right, ladies. Let's keep it cool.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_025: If you want treatment, you gotta come closer!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_029: Meh, pushovers. I wasn't even breaking a sweat.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_030: Man those guys were weak. I regret not giving 'em a few whacks with the staff here.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_031: Have you guys never taken emergency response training courses?
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_032: Darn it... I'm not giving up yet!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_033: Let's see if there are any interesting people here!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_036: You want me to just nod and listen? No. Freaking. Way.
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_038: Finally, New Year's! The croc doc is in and she says today's a rest day! Speaking of, they really celebrate New Year's peacefully out here. I kinda miss the Acahualla-style ceremony. Kal'tsit probably wouldn't approve holding it here at Rhodes Island though...
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_043: Happy birthday to you, Doctor. Speaking of, I oughta give you a little present... Let's take this opportunity to give you a full, thorough physical exam!
dialogue_tracker.char_187_ccheal_CN_044: You want my thoughts on what being a Rhodes Island doctor's been like? Nothing too special. Whether punching enemies into submission or using my staff to make patients listen, there's always a sense of accomplishment. It was my choice and I made it, so there's nothing to waffle over.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_001: Queching the flames of war demands prolonged suffering. To ignite them, however, it takes naught but a lapse of thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_002: The fall of Chernobog dealt a devastating blow to Azazel, our clinic. I must rebuild it for the children. As long as they can have a shelter to call home, any place will do. You don't need a reason to try for your family.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_003: Rhodes Island is in a respectable position, but the Infected of Ursus face prospects far worse than anyone could imagine. They must be ready to resort to violence in order to survive. At the end of the day, virtue and dignity hold meaning only for those who live to see the next dawn.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_004: All Ursus should take pride in their nation and their Emperor.' I, too, fought for Ursus once, but I don't have the passion driving me anymore. Time has robbed me of too much.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_005: Life in the military has taught me two things: First, have faith in your fellow soldiers; second, have faith in them, but do not trust them. This dilemma has always plagued our lands, and none can escape it.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_006: Dr. {@nickname}, a limitless future awaits you, just as it does for those children. Though I can neither let go of yesterday nor look forward to tomorrow, I shall fight for you till my last drop of blood, so you may be part of that future.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_007: I am fine with Ursus as my enemy. Once I swore my utmost loyalty to it, but that was returned with endless disillusionment and shame. For the children's sake, I will never falter, much less surrender.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_008: Once there was a long battle. When I finally broke into the enemy headquarters, I was too late... All I could do for my dying friend was take his pocket watch and sword. The enemy lost their commander, whose death brought us a brief victory. That day, Ursus enjoyed her momentary triumph, but I knew my war was over. A war where I lost everything.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_009: The photograph inside my pocket watch? Hahahah, so you saw it... This is Neon from when she was little. Isn't she adorable? She's not so quiet anymore, but she loves herself now, and that's all that matters... Live free, Dr. {@nickname}, that's my wish, even if it is trite.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_010: Don't lose focus. You must be alert at all times on Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_011: Hellagur, an infected mercenary. I will work with Rhodes Island in order to rebuild my Azazel Clinic and protect my family. But be advised, I have no medical skills.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_012: Battlefields may change, but not the cruelty.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_013: I'm used to it as a soldier, but I find it fascinating as an infected. Thank you for the ribbon, Dr. {@nickname}.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_014: War will never truly be over, but I believe even this land will end eventually. Maybe you can end our suffering one day, Dr. {@nickname}. Now, give me your order!
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_017: Only butchers thirst for blood. We are merely paying the price of survival.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_018: I'll have them following orders to Ursus army standards!
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_019: I don't mind losing my life, if that is enough to end this all.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_020: You have never seen a real war, pathetic runts.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_022: A slip of the mind is the difference between life and death.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_023: Killing is but the last resort.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_024: I've never truly left the battlefield, I know.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_025: A lash of blade, the flesh to flay.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_026: A thrust of whip, the sword to rip.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_027: A cleave of spear, the armor to tear!
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_028: Decapitator'… Our sacrifices were not in vain.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_029: You leave the fight behind, and pay for it with yet more fighting.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_030: Avert your eyes, I'm about to end their misery.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_031: Keep your guard up. One flaw is all the enemy needs to turn the tables.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_032: There is no shame in failure. At least you had the chance to learn from it.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_033: If only I can find shelter for the children.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_036: Would you like a candy? I still have some. But watch out for cavities.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_038: It escapes me how many New Years I've spent in trenches, or under the blaze of artillery. War is no stickler for timekeeping, and the greater part of my life has been embroiled in it. This holiday won't turn new pages for me anymore. That being said, don't the children look happy? Hah.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_043: As every child has a birthday, it gives me hope that maturity will come to them. Age will overtake me, like it or not, and I can only hope they'll still live safely after I am gone. You're still growing too, Doctor. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_188_helage_CN_044: I must express my gratitude to Rhodes Island. The longer the war stretches on, the more I realize the importance of a place to rest. Has the technology Azazel brought to Rhodes Island been of help...? That is good. After all, I can do little else but wield my blade in your service.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_001: Did you call me here for a new hunt? No? Gah…
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_002: This claw pendant? It's a symbol of revenge. The Ursus mercenaries who hurt my people treat these things as dogtags, so there's no mistaking them.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_003: A beast took my left hand when I was hunting. Luckily, a mechanic gave me a prosthetic limb, so I can draw my bowstring again.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_004: There was a time when I would've turned anyone who mocked my scars into a pincushion! But if you ask me now... Well, people like that aren't even worth the trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_005: If you're ever facing a difficult decision, let your instincts decide for you. Your body won't lie—This is what I've learned after a lifetime of hunts.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_006: I've been living alone ever since my village was wiped out.  So, I… I'm still getting used to being around people... But since you trust me and give me important work, I swear I'll return the favor.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_007: Ehh, a pebble got stuck in my prosthetic finger...? Darn it, I'm going to need a mechanic to fix it... N-No, I don't need you, I can handle this myself!
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_008: You'll make sure I don't ever lose anyone else? Hmph. Big words. But I'll see for myself if you can back those up.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_009: The doctors here offered to get rid of my more recent scars, but I said no. I want to keep them. They're proof of my work here... You, you understand what I'm getting at?
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_010: You're sleeping? Looks like this one can fall asleep almost anywhere. Well, that's a trait we hunters share…
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_011: Vermeil, hunter. You won't regret giving me work.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_012: Can I take another look at that?
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_013: Thank you, but... are you sure it's okay to promote someone like me?
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_014: I don't really care about stuff like Oripathy or 'the rest of my life.' Right now, the happiest thing I can imagine is fighting by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_018: You want me to be the captain? Am I... really cut out for the job?
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_019: The big game hunt is about to start!
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_020: You don't seem to understand your situation here. You've fallen into my trap.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_023: I can smell the game on the wind.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_025: You'd better start running, or there's only one way this ends.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_026: Don't underestimate the people of the wilderness.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_028: This arrow will find your throat!
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_029: Strong game is still just game.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_030: Nice. If you were born in Siracusa, you would've been a great hunter.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_031: The target got away. I'm going after it.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_032: We can't let it end like this…
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_033: This place has walls and a roof… that's enough for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_036: ...My plans for the day? Help you with missions. Shoot at enemies. Use up all my arrows. Finish the mission. Eat dinner, go to sleep. Simple enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_038: Everyone's celebrating New Year's... It was never this easy in the wild. We got a little cured meat out, ate a few berries we had stored, and that's how we celebrated surviving another year. Maybe it wasn't worth celebrating...
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_043: This cloak's for you. I learned to make this back with the other hunters. If you get lost in the wild one day, that hood you've got isn't gonna save you from sandstorms. Obviously, I'd rather be there with you to protect you, if I could.
dialogue_tracker.char_190_clour_CN_044: I never forgave any of my old enemies, and I'll never forget those who showed me kindness. The old Lateran guy's dead, but there's still Rhodes Island. I have a clear reason to fight with the time I've got left.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_001: Don't worry, Doctor. No matter what happens, I'll protect you.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_002: Liberi have excellent eyesight. According to legend, some can even tell one droplet from another in a rainstorm. Sounds incredible, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_003: I take everyday life too seriously? My apologies. I think that comes from my time serving as a Laterano Guard. I'll work on that in the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_004: To most Lateranos, heavy armor doesn't serve much of a purpose. Of course, when we perform the large-scale rituals of our homeland, we do dress up in ceremonial garb.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_005: I appreciate your faith in my abilities, Doctor. I won't let you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_007: Right... I submitted a request to the HR office... to become your personal bodyguard. I guess maybe I miss my old job too much.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_008: I grew up in Laterano and didn't really have the chance to learn about other cultures. Here at Rhodes Island, I get to see such diversity, way beyond my imagination. Actually...it's not so bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_009: I have no regrets. Yes, true, they did drag me out of Laterano against my will... but this has been a great adventure. I've enjoyed it.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_010: It is my duty to protect you, Doctor. Rest assured.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_011: My name is Plume, formerly of the Pontifica Cohors Lateran. I will be your sword, and your wings, as I defend your very life.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_012: Ah, so tactics can help you overcome a more skilled opponent, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_013: Thank you, Doctor. As your bodyguard, your approval is the best reward I can ask for.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_018: As the leader, it's my responsibility to keep everyone safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_025: You think you're faster than me?
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_026: No move can escape my sight!
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_027: My resolve lies with my spear!
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_028: I fight for the glory of Laterano!
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_030: Like a wave crashing against an immovable stone, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_031: Regroup! I'll look out for the remaining enemies!
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_036: Doctor... it feels like I'm abusing my position...
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_038: Lift the corners of my mouth, don't knit my eyebrows...good, hold steady, then ease my mind, relax... Okay, now get in and greet everyone… Ah! Doctor, you scared me. Um, Happy New Year!
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_043: So today is your birthday, Doctor? Alright, happy birthday! I promise I'll see my guard duty through more vigilantly. Uh, I mean, if you're going to hold a birthday get-together like the Laterans do, then I'll ensure your safety, and take responsibility for the aftermath.
dialogue_tracker.char_192_falco_CN_044: Someone once told me that the honor of protecting Laterano was the sole reason I fought. But now, I have more things to protect. My beliefs, my companions, and you. It all weighs heavier on my spear, but I will never let it slow down.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_001: Want to listen to some music? I'll lend you my headphones.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_002: Sorry, please keep a little distance from me.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_003: I never imagined that I'd have the chance to become a rescue worker.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_004: I picked up this axe a long time ago, maybe even before I learned to read.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_005: The songs I like are probably not so popular. They're only good for humming to myself when I'm alone.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_006: Don't blink—you have but one moment to witness this epic move.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_007: Want something to drink? My treat. You should relax a bit after work, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_008: I only realized how precious life is after everyone around me died, one by one. Ironic, huh? I think so, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_009: I'm a mercenary. I just do my job. As for the purpose of my mission and its consequences, I don't have a say in any of that. So, from now on, all my responsibilities are your concern.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_011: Frostleaf, former mercenary. From now on, I'm your operator. Assign me any job you want, I can do pretty much anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_013: Things are on the right track now.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_014: Whew... not bad. Feeling fulfilled for the first time in a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_018: Go your own ways and do your own jobs.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_019: Great, I feel like some exercise.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_025: My bodily fluids aren't the only thing that's chilling.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_027: Life, brittle as frost, fragile like leaves.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_028: Let's chill down some hot heads.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_029: I've been through countless battles... seen the carnage, witnessed the silent nothingness at the end.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_030: I remember every enemy I fought. Not a single one escapes.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_031: We didn't lose anyone, did we?
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_033: I'd like... a more private space.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_038: I never celebrated any holiday like this before coming to Rhodes Island. Even on a peaceful New Year's, I wouldn't have a room as safe and warm as this... Sorry, Doctor, can I just—listen to some music on my own for a while? I'll come and catch you in a bit. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Here's a charm I made for you. Inside it are some lyrics I extracted from a song, the one I always listen to when I'm feeling down. I hope it'll protect you from any hurt enemies might deal you. Oh, it's coming on too heavy? Not at all. Life's the most important thing, trust me on that.
dialogue_tracker.char_193_frostl_CN_044: You don't need to be too worried. My past experiences weren't all bad. They taught me what living wrongly looked like. And my time at Rhodes Island has made me want to stick even harder with this all-new outlook, to explore even more unknown places across the lands. Maybe you'd wanna come with me, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_001: Make you a deal, Doctor. I'll help you with work, and you teach me whatever it is you're good at. What do you think? Shake on it?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_002: Doctor, you know this language, don't you? How do you pronounce this word…? Ooh, that's right! I remember now. I knew I could count on you, Doctor. Just wait till I get back from my trip, I'll have a souvenir for you!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_003: Heh! Hah—! Get up, all of you! Weren't you going to fight the USSG? Now look at you all, lying on the ground already! Bunch of babies. You don't see my girls much on the landship these days, but there was a time when we followed the Doctor around, conquering the world... Yow! Anna...? Why'd you hit me?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_004: Honey drunk? Who's honey drunk? Beehunter? I told her to slow down already, but she won't listen. And now she'sh all drunk and shays I'm the one getting... Wait... Doctor... Shtand shtill, shtop... shaking... yer making me dizzshy...
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_005: What are Sonya and the girls going to do? You're asking the wrong one, Doctor. We're friends, yeah. But aside from Lada, the rest of them don't really talk to me about that kinda stuff. Especially Sonya—she'll go to Anna when she needs something, maybe Natalya, but she'd never come to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_006: Lada had a secret talk with me recently. Said she wants to open a little shop in Ursus, and we could all chip in and get our share. As for the shop, it'll be our headquarter. All the girls can have regular meetups there. And I can go over to hang out whenever I miss her, too. It's gonna be great!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_007: Has you-know-who been to Rhodes Island? Oh, so he spent a whole day sitting in the reception before you shooed him out...? Thanks for that. It's fine, I've got nothing to say to him anyway. Hmph, he wasn't there when I needed him, and now he feels bad enough to try to make up for it? Keep Dreaming!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_008: What do I think? Ummm... first of all, you should stop treating us like kids. Come on, Doctor, you don't need to worry about us so much. If you have time, why don't you teach me a few more formulas for Anna's Math lessons? We've counted you as a friend all this time, so if there's really something bugging us, you'll definitely know.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_009: I know we'll have to go our separate ways someday. But so what? We trust each other with our lives. The USSG won't fall apart, and we'll never forget the days we spent together. The same goes for you, Doctor. Call me anytime you need my help, and I'll be there, no matter what.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_010: Doctor, let me play you a refreshing tune on my guitar!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_011: Hey, Doctor. You already know me, do we really still have to do this? Formalities matter, huh? Fine. Leto of the Ursus Student Self-government Group. Reporting in!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_013: Sooooo…. How long did it take for Sonya to get promoted?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_014: What's this? Promotion gift for 'General Leto'? Ah... That's a name I've not heard in a long time. Time really flies, it's like years have gone by and I've done nothing.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_018: For real? Are you trying to improve my teamwork again?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_025: You thought that would knock me out?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_027: Here's a few bolts to eat!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_028: I'll take on all of you!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_029: Phew—I always thought I was pretty adventurous myself, but now? I think you really enjoy living life on the edge, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_030: We have to toast to occasions like these. Who wants in?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_031: This isn't over! I can still fight!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_032: No way I'm gonna swallow this... Can we go one more round?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_033: I've been here a while, but I still gotta say... Rhodes Island is crazy big.
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_036: Doctor, are you heading to Medical too? Let's go together!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_038: Doctor, the USSG's having a feast tonight too, so of course you're coming? Oh, also. Mama's gotten much better lately, so she's been thinking of hosting one of our own in a couple of days. But it'll be too quiet with just the two of us, so she asked me if you might be interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_043: Happy birthday! Here's a honey cake for you, I even asked Lada to teach me how to make it. I snuck a piece for myself, and it's real tasty, so you should hurry and try some! Honey drunk? Oh, yeah, no wonder I've been filling a little dizzy for a while now... Ah, look out! The cake!
dialogue_tracker.char_194_leto_CN_044: Here, a souvenir from my last trip. It's pretty good, so you gotta try some. Is it me, or did Rhodes get a lot more crowded since I was away? I don't care if you keep onboarding more people, but you'd better make sure the USSG's clubhouse stays as-is, got it?
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_001: Greetings, I'm here for my shift… That's a peculiar look on your face. Do I seem so unreliable?
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_002: We don't throw ourselves into battle because we want to. We just have a stronger will to survive than most. If you understand, that alone would be enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_003: Zima, the girls, and I all came from different schools. But all the students in the city knew the legends of General Zima. Doesn't that sound cool? Literally. Zima is Ursine for 'winter', you see. Hm, yes.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_004: How did we escape from Chernobog? Hmm... you really don't want to know. Sometimes the truth is better left untold.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_005: Oh? I'm reading a mystery novel… As a matter of fact, it taught me some lessons that proved useful in getting me through that terrible time.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_006: My favorite books? Hmm, I enjoy topics like politics, economics, and dialectical materialism… Baking magazines and stuff like that are nice too.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_007: Home? My hometown? Obviously, we can't go back there. You know as well as I do that there's nothing left of it. Even if we rebuilt Chernobog, I still…
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_008: Rhodes Island is safe. And there are so many books here in your office... If I could, I'd really prefer to stay here…
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_009: What will I do in the future? Hmm… No idea. My books don't have an answer for that. I hope someone will give offer me one, someday…
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_010: Such a twist is beyond my imagination. 'Every last one of the passengers on this train, you're all murderers!'
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_011: I am Istina. I'm still a student, but I was recruited for my ability to use Arts… Yes, it is rather strange for a student to serve here, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_012: You want me to be stronger?
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_013: Do you feel like you understand me better now? Naive, you're far from really knowing me.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_014: Now that you've offered me such recognition, I will reveal my true power. Allow me to demonstrate by reducing this office to a fine powder… Just kidding. There are too many precious books here. I would never do something so awful.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_018: Hmm… The team is somewhat different from what I imagined.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_019: Let's show our determination, earnestness, and boundless passion.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_020: May the star of victory shine upon us.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_023: I have a distaste for war.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_028: Time to teach you a lesson.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_029: Why do they fight... even when it may cost them their lives? What do they gain from it?
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_030: Doctor, if you have to commend us, now is the time.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_031: Those enemies who fled... We probably won't see them again.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_032: Neither our numbers nor our efforts were sufficient…
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_033: A secret room, where, shall we say, interesting things happen.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_036: It's too noisy here, I'd rather read in the Doctor's office.
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_038: No, I, I'm not honey-drunk, Sonya just poured me a, a little, but I just felt I should convey to you, a, Happy New Year... Er, are these Sonya's flowers? For the New Year? Why is this flower, burning hot to the touch…
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. This hardcover is my gift to you—Ah, well done, you've discerned without so much as a flip that it contains not literature, but cake. No, I wasn't at all hoping to see you scoop up a handful of icing…
dialogue_tracker.char_195_glassb_CN_044: 'The Silver Branch', 'Mathematical Theory of Originium Arts', 'Superpropositional Logic'... Hm? I'm going through the books I've read this year. Suspense fiction has its merits, but dipping into all manner of knowledge is comforting, in a sense. It lets me believe, undeniably, that I am moving forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_001: Hello, Doctor! You hungry? Heehee, I heard your stomach growling from a mile away! It sounded like thunder!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_002: My shield? I can lift it easy! One, two, lift! Hehe, see? Oh, Relax, Doctor. I'm not gonna drop it or anything. You don't have to stand all the way over there.
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_003: The bad guys who destroyed my hometown are gonna pay! I'll smash them with my frying pan!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_004: Zima says she'll protect me, but I'm not a baby! Me and my shield kept everyone safe before we made it here! It's not a shield, it's a vault door? No it isnnnn't! I can't believe you're calling it that!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_005: Doctor, you wanna taste my cooking? Hehe, you can try it soon. I've already asked Closure if I can work the cafeteria! Just waiting to hear back.
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_006: Tadaaah! Here comes Gummy's specialty: bacon and eggs! So, do you like it? It's tough to get the heat right when I'm out in the field, but most days I can make it perfect!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_007: Me and the other four weren't always together, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_008: Why am I always so cheery? Umm, actually... After the things we've seen, it's hard to be cheery... But I really want my friends to forget about all that awful stuff. So I need to pull myself together and smile a whole bunch to make that happen!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_009: I... I miss my parents, and I do want to find them. I think about them all the time... but if I leave now, I don't think I could do anything by myself... So... Doctor, could you please teach me how to fight? I don't want everyone to think of me as some kind of kitchen girl!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_010: Are you sleeping, Doctor? Hmm, maybe a bit of reading here would be okay, I guess?
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_011: My name's Gummy! You must be the Doctor. Thank you and everyone from Rhodes Island for helping us! I don't have any special skills, but I'll do what I can as good as I can!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_012: I can feel my power surging! I might even be able to lift you up, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_013: I'll become a three-star Rhodes Island chef after the promotion, right? Just kidding! Hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_014: I want to do much, much more besides cooking! I don't know if I'm strong enough to do everything you want me to, but I'll give it my all!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_018: Что?! You're making me the leader?!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_019: Just wait for us to get back, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_029: The bad guys should just give up! With the Doctor on our side, they'll never beat us!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_030: I didn't want to have to do that… but if we don't fight, the bad guys will get us!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_031: We won, and that's what matters! It's a good thing!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_032: Ughh… did anybody get hurt…? Doctor? Is the Doctor okay?!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_033: Wow, what a big room! You could get so many people in here!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_036: Doctor, I know my food tastes great, but don't eat too much of it! You'll get fat!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_038: Doctor, I've been busy all day today in the kitchen. Zima went out to do something early this morning, and Rosa's still busy decorating the hall. Even though we all promised to make New Year's dinner together... Istinaaaa! You can't set off fireworks inside!
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_042: Doctor, you want something to eat?
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_043: Afternoon, Doctor... a big crowd kept me in the kitchen late last night, I had to make cakes in all different flavors... But I got the tastiest one I made right here. Happy birthday, Doctor! Say aahh—
dialogue_tracker.char_196_sunbr_CN_044: Doctor! Come try the piroshki I baked! They're even tastier than before, right? Heheh, I'm growing up too, you know. And then Mama and Papa, and Zima and all my friends won't have to worry about me. I'm going to get even stronger!
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_001: It is an honor to serve you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_002: I was once naive enough to think I could have anything I wanted. Now I know, while that may be true for most things, it is not for others. Those I can never get. Not on my own.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_003: Any work you might have, please feel free to let me try. Don't worry, after what I've have been through, the dignity of a noblewoman is the least of my concerns. Now I am just like Zima and the girls, an ordinary student under protection.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_004: Doctor, if you would like to know more about Chernobog, I may be able to provide a unique perspective. I was only a student, but you know, the Student Council President does interact with society at large, in some ways.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_005: People like Istina, who forgo the opiate that is entertainment in pursuit of greater knowledge, are quite rare. Even at a noble school like I attended. If she had been my classmate back then... No, it's no use thinking about that now.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_006: To hate the world on account of a tragedy is as shortsighted as loving the world over a comedy——Is it? Doctor, have you already decided how to handle all that you will soon face? And how should I? I'm still unsure.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_007: Doctor, I have a favor to ask of you. Would you please look after Zima and the girls... specifically their mental health? They look like they're adjusting well, but I know they're not. Even I, occasionally, think back to those times...
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_008: Doctor, I wonder if you could ever understand? I was a victim, at times, I know. But at some point, I found myself an unconscious victimizer. And I even… 'indulged' in it... I... I can never forgive myself for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_009: Doctor, is it easier to forget, when you're fully grown? When I come of age, will I be able to forgive myself? Will becoming as mature as you allow me to finally deal with the misery in my heart?
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_010: The Doctor is asleep...  Looks kind of cute.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_011: Greetings, Doctor. Allow me to once again express my gratitude to Rhodes Island for taking in me and my friends. I've had enough of a break working in Logistics, and I'd like to do as Zima and the girls do.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_012: I too must prepare for the battlefield…
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_013: It seems my experience in student government is paying dividends in my work life. How delightful.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_014: There is still much I don't understand about what I am doing, about my future, about myself, and about so much more. But I am young. I still have time to think. Don't I, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_017: Let us put my training to the test.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_018: I will do all I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_020: Comrades, let us keep to the plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_027: Rosa, believe in yourself. You can do it!
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_029: Doctor, we did it...! Oh, um, ahem, truly a delightful victory!
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_030: I hope I've met Doctor's expectations.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_031: My apologies, Doctor. If only I had tried harder...
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_032: We must review this carefully after we get back…
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_033: I wonder if there's anywhere quite like the salon?
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_038: Happy new year, Doctor. This is a busy day, but I'm glad that I can contribute towards the party. I hope everyone likes my floral arrangements and desserts. Oh, I just remembered something. The USSG and I will be hosting a small private gathering this evening. You're more than welcome to join us, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_042: Doctor, it's great to see you.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_043: We had to be extremely careful with our gifts at school. A slight mistake may just trigger a sizable scandal. But that's something I no longer need to worry about, and I can express myself however I wish. Happy birthday, Doctor. Gummy taught me how to bake these cookies. Thank you for taking care of us.
dialogue_tracker.char_197_poca_CN_044: I may never be able to free myself from the nightmare. But since my arrival at Rhodes Island, I gradually found the courage to face it. It's all thanks to you and my friends at the USSG. You always stand by my side and lead the way... I believe one day, I will finally be able to start my life anew.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_001: It's not the duty of a guard to stand here and do nothing. Why don't we chat a bit?
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_002: With perfect positioning and a suitable environment, my letters will arrive just fine. After all, it's my job, right? I need to do well to survive.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_003: Are you hungry? If you want something to eat, just say the word. I can't compete with Matterhorn in the kitchen, but I can at least cook a decent meal.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_004: The comms equipment here at Rhodes Island is way too good. At this rate, I'm going to lose my job...
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_005: Anything else you need? Just don't keep me on the line for too long.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_006: Huh? There's a faint smell on the letters? No, you must be imagining things.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_007: I owe my life to Master SilverAsh. If necessary, I would do anything for him.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_008: You want me to transport... all these? That's a lot, Doctor! Come on, I'm not a miracle worker!
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_009: Seems I'm no match for you. I suppose it's time to retire my business smile for now... *Ahem*... I'd like to show you my true face, from now on.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_010: Doctor, there's a new message for... Ah, never mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_011: Esteemed Leader of Rhodes Island, your ally—Courier of the Snow Realm—is here at your service. If you get into any sort of trouble during your contract with Master SilverAsh, just snap your fingers and I'll be there.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_012: Whoa, that's an incredible job well done.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_013: You'd save a lot of trouble if you sent me onto the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_014: As a Messenger of the Snow Realm, I'm sure to appear whenever you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_018: I won't blemish the name of the Snow Realm.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_019: Too bad some people just can't live and let live.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_020: They'll pay for what they've done.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_029: I'll bring news of our victory to Rhodes Island right away!
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_030: Let's grab a nice dinner after we clean up the battlefield. My treat!
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_031: Anyone injured? I've got medicine and bandages.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_032: Let's get out of here first. Here, this way! Hurry!
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_033: I'll greet my roommates and neighbors first.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_036: Alright, I'll whip up a meal for you later.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_038: Doctor, I've brought you some food from Kjerag to celebrate the New Year. They're still warm, so would you like to try...? Are they to your taste? D—Don't eat so many! The beastmeat isn't that easy to digest!
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_042: Call me whenever you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! I have a present for you. You'd like to open it now? How about guessing what's inside first? Mm-hm... Correct, it's a scent sachet! I hope when you're carrying it around, you can feel as though I'm by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_198_blackd_CN_044: It was Master SilverAsh's choice to partner with Rhodes Island, but I believed in his decision. And my days at Rhodes Island have proven not only how right he was, but also how trustworthy you are.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_001: I've moved your belongings where you wanted. No worries, it wasn't heavy.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_002: The shield is a symbol of a steadfast guardian.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_003: I've been responsible for protecting Young Master SilverAsh... I mean, Master SilverAsh... ever since he was young.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_004: It's not exactly polite to talk about Miss Enya behind her back, but... *sigh* I do pity Miss Enya for what she has suffered. She really deserves a better life.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_005: If my shield gets damaged, I should take it to the artisan called Vulcan for repairs. Is that correct?
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_006: This is far beyond my expectation. That artisan is truly skilled. I need to thank her properly.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_007: Life at Rhodes Island is fun. The Snow Realm is rather bland in comparison.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_008: Master did send me to protect Ensia. But I honestly don't think she's the type who would sit there and ask to be protected.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_009: I am slowly starting to understand why Master SilverAsh holds you in such high regard. Doctor, from this day, feel free to command me as your shield.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_010: Sometimes, I suddenly start missing my life in the Snow Realm.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_011: Ally, I salute you in true Snow Realm fashion. My codename is Matterhorn, and I am one of the guards dispatched here by Master SilverAsh.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_013: Thank you for the approval, Doctor. I am greatly flattered.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_014: I will not step back, not even if this shield shatters the very next second. Not because of my loyalty, but because of my conviction.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_026: I'm not here just for show!
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_027: With my conviction, I shall bring any monster to its knees!
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_028: You don't have what it takes!
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_029: I wasn't even giving my all!
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_030: Their strikes can barely tickle me.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_031: I'll pull off a perfect victory next time for you, I promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_032: I should not have taken the enemies lightly. Now I pay the price.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_033: Very nice room, this one. Furnished tastefully, with a peaceful atmosphere.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_036: This is my signature dish. How do you like it?
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_038: It's only natural for a guardian to keep his eyes peeled on New Year's day. Troubles do not shy away from celebration days. Rather, they are more likely to jump on people when they let their guard down. Rhodes Island is a comparatively safe place, but you must not lower your defense, Doctor. Happy new year.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_043: It's your birthday, Doctor, isn't it? No need to worry, for I dare not forget the date. It's just the gift I prepared... I'm really not sure if you are going to appreciate it... So please, Doctor, do me a favor and open it after I leave. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_199_yak_CN_044: I'm actually not familiar with what lies outside the Snow Realm, since most of my job was to simply perform the duties my master has entrusted to me. I need to broaden my horizon. Even though I'm no more than a guardian, I need to learn more and see more.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_001: Close your eyes, don't rush to open them. They may feel slightly hot, that's normal... Shh, stay calm, I crushed some herbs to help your eyes relax. You must have been staring at some dangerous thing. I do that a lot, trust me.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_002: A guide...? I guess Simone is a better fit for the job. She's also a veteran hunter like me, so I know you'll be in good hands, and won't get into... trouble. There have been some misunderstandings and a few tribes now turn me away. Just remember, if anyone tells you I'm a man eater, they're lying.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_003: Hands off. I've told you before, no one gets to touch my bow. Not you, not the smiths. You don't have the skills to hunt shadows in the depth of Sami, so you shouldn't draw their attention. I know your kind, I know you're curious. I'll just repeat myself over, over, and over again until I get through to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_004: Check the logs from the research teams. See? These little hornbeasts are friends, they're harmless. And this kind of snow needs Arts to control, so call me if you run into some. Good, go ahead and add some notes to these pictures, you're pretty clever. Why the look? Is it so strange that I know how to use electronics?
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_005: You all are strange, just like Magallan, insisting on comprehending the land on your own terms. I've seen your hard work, you'll come to know the whole of Sami as you see her in your dreams someday. But now? You aren't there yet. I'm worried about you, but since we're working together, just listen to me and you'll be fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_006: Put that navigation instrument down, you're no professional, it's wearing you out just carrying it around. Let me lead the way, just like Arges used to do for me. She always says pitfalls and pains guide you to destiny, but I find I can get where I want by just following the sound of the breeze and the twigs in the trees.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_007: You've never tried sleeping on a cave floor before? What about a bed made of vines? You should give it a try, I can't get a good night's sleep if I don't hear the heartbeat of Sami. How could I even close my eyes if I can't wake the moment I get a vision...? Yes, I have a lot of nightmares, what about it?
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_008: ...You called for me? Did you come across some trouble? If everything's fine, let me sit here alone for a while... I'm looking at the dead. The unsullied dead will walk among the beasts of the forest... I'm still looking for my parents.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_009: Have I ever gotten lost? Hmm... Maybe. I left my home at first to find revenge, but when I saw all that sullied snow, I could only think to draw my bow and aim, to show the shadows that I was the true hunter. Can you be a hunter, too? Or can you be a companion to carry me out of danger when I'm hurt?
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_010: Does the Doctor have the same kind of dreams that I do? Hm, probably not, we aren't in Sami, after all... Lucky enough for you, the shadows won't be chasing you through your dreams then.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_011: If you come across any abnormalities while we're working together, I'll take care of them for you... Codename? Typhon is my only name. I found it on the horn ornament my mother left behind. Some people say it sounds scary, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_012: Are you trying to show off your camera skills? No...? But how can you even call this combat experience, if you don't experience it yourself?
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_013: Um, what's this promotion badge for again? If it's useless in combat, then let's wait until we settle the danger right in front of us, then you tell me the story behind it.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_014: Many travelers to Sami find death in avalanches caused by loud boasting, or other arrogant behavior. They never even get a chance to see Sami's shadow. You won't make the same kind of mistake, not with me accompanying you.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_017: Take these weapons and tools. We need them more than extra hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_018: Got it, I'll take the lead. Don't be nervous, I can handle this.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_020: Don't let them out of sight, even if your eyes are hurting.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_021: Stay calm and make your move. No need to worry, I've got your back.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_022: What do you need of me?
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_025: I'll pin you to your shadow.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_029: Each of my arrows slows the black that taints the Sami snow.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_030: I see you managed to complete a mission without causing any unnecessary pain to the quarry. Um, not bad, not bad. Sip a hot drink and get some rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_031: If you've run out of arrows or let your target escape, then you should give up the chase. You've already lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_032: Grasp these seeds tightly in your hand, and run. Don't look back. I'll take care of things here.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_033: Can you explain how these machines work? I've got a good memory, Magallan explained the structure of the research station last time, and I still remember it all... Well, at least, I think I do.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_034: Nope, you'll have to be faster than that to even think about faking an attack.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_036: Do you have someone you trust standing guard? I want to rest for a bit, your camp is so warm…
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_038: Oh, there have been more and more people celebrating this festival. Will you have a feast too? What about fireworks? Always? Seems I've come to the right place. I'm going to look around for activities I've never tried before, so you don't have to entertain me.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_042: What's up, Doctor. Where have you been? You're not lost, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_043: I helped you find a safe spot. Trees, water from freshly melted snow, the rotting flesh of beasts buried in the soil—you have to thank them for joining your spirit and letting you walk on this land. Come, take my hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_2012_typhon_CN_044: It's good practice to always check up on your prey, because the hunt never truly ends. I've seen you defeat many opponents and save many lives. Good on you, but... you wish to fully wipe your enemy from the face of this land? No, a permanent extermination is just wrong.
dialogue_tracker.char_2013_cerber_CN_001: Hm...? What should I do? Just put these papers in this box?
dialogue_tracker.char_2013_cerber_CN_002: Doctor, are you working? Can I watch? Yay! Here I come, sofa.
dialogue_tracker.char_2013_cerber_CN_003: I'm super strong! Forget one bad guy, I can take on a hundre—Uhh, maybe a hundred is a bit much... But ninety-nine is no problem! Um-hum!
