dialogue_tracker.char_2026_yu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Are you hungry? Give me a moment.
dialogue_tracker.char_2026_yu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Nian, quit sneaking bites and go call Dusk out. Ling, could you lend a hand? Shu and I are swamped in kitchen. Where did Dage wander off to now...? Ah! Doctor! what took you so long? Come, have a seat and join us! Happy New Year!
dialogue_tracker.char_2026_yu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Come, have a seat. Make yourself at home. You can order anything on the menu.
dialogue_tracker.char_2026_yu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Doctor, happy Birthday! This is a present I've treasured for years...my private cookbook. If you follow the instructions step-by-step, you too can become a master chef. If Yu can cook, so can you. What? Still want me to cook for you? Hehe, OK, OK. I'll make an exception today.
dialogue_tracker.char_2026_yu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: I never knew Rhodes Island could be so bustling during festivals. I have literally been cooking on all burners today. But, well, it's all worth it. Just look at all these young sprouts, so full of promise... Ah! What are you doing? Open your ears, and don't measure me! I-I didn't grow any taller...
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_001: I've checked your schedule. Isn't it time you took a break? If you'll excuse me.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_002: Evolution is the law of nature. But Rhine Lab attempted to tamper with this law, even to take control of it. What a foolish endeavor…
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_003: As a researcher, have you ever participated in some experiments you probably shouldn't have? No? That's good.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_004: Don't you think it's too noisy at Rhodes Island? Everyone should be quiet and focused during work. You should enforce discipline on your subordinates.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_005: My true power has nothing to do with first aid. However, I have slightly adjusted the operation of this power to accommodate it to your command.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_006: You think Calcification Arts only makes organisms weaker? You're wrong. I can condense calcium into a tough enamel. The enemies can try as they want, but no one can break my shield.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_007: You've seen me arguing with Silence? Yes, we do that a lot... Sorry for causing trouble for you and Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_008: Please tell Ifrit on my behalf, 'No matter what happens, I will protect you'... Meet her? No, I'm not ready for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_009: Even in the most desperate of situations, one must stand fast to be a symbol of strength for the people they hold dear. That is where I draw my line and how I live my life. You'll do the same, won't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_010: I'll go back to my room if there's no further assignments.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_011: I am Saria, formerly of the Rhine Lab Medical Research Institute Experiment Team. As for now... I need Rhodes Island's help to bring the astray back to the orthodox.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_013: Good, you must continue motivating your subordinates with your ideas if you hope to maintain influence over them.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_014: Promotion? I don't want any special treatment. But for Ifrit's sake, I do need your help to correct all those twisted laws and rules.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_017: I am within my rights to oversee and bring up my own opinion on your command.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_018: Send me the operation briefing, I will review it.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_019: All operators must maintain strict discipline.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_020: Are they the ones who caused such destruction and started all this conflict?
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_025: Just who are you weaklings going to stop like that?
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_029: Your tactics appear modern, yet the ideas behind them are primitive at their roots. Just who are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_030: All must return to the existing order. None may disobey the rules.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_031: The routed enemies may be calling for reinforcements. We must not drop our guard before we find the last of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_033: This room has interesting decor. I'd be more fond of a futuristic style, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_036: Doctor, you might do a bit of research into the past in your free time. You will find many a thing of great interest.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_038: Life is the accumulation of maturity. Hone yourself well in the coming year, {@nickname}.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_043: According to the rota, you have a workday today. I'll tell any operators who come with gifts to wait to celebrate until you're done with work. The gifts, I'll accept on your behalf and place at the entrance. I'll be placing my present among them as well. Happy birthday, Doctor. Time to get to work.
dialogue_tracker.char_202_demkni_CN_044: The founding of regulations and traditions symbolizes that they might be broken, and it is not my job to judge nor to punish, but simply to see disorder rewound to order and chaos returned to organization. The road is a challenging one, but I won't be stopped.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_001: *Yaaawn*... Doctor, could I take a quick break?
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_002: Don't worry about my bow. I keep it well maintained. It's much tougher than you, so stop asking about it already.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_003: There are so many interesting people at Rhodes Island. Would be nice if I could make a friend or two to travel with.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_004: Nowadays, the Knights of Kazimierz are little more than a bunch of musclehead jocks, or clowns obsessed with billboards and firework shows. Man, it's so lame.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_005: I was planning to return home after finishing this job, but now I've changed my mind. Why, you ask? You should know better than to ask a girl a question like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_006: Want to know the origin of my codename? You see, there are different ranks for the Knight Assassins in Kazimierz. There's three Darksteel and two Lazurite assassins above me, but I and I alone bear the rank of Platinum, from now till the day I die. So I figured it'd make a good codename.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_007: Ah, it's Miss Nearl! No, no, I wasn't going to lay a hand on her. I'm just worried she's going to charge at me with her hammer.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_008: Kazimierz is... a boring place. *Sigh*, I'm almost mad at how much more amusing life here at Rhodes Island is.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_009: Have you thought about how you're going to maintain your relations with everyone here at Rhodes Island? You know, all suits of armor have small gaps which leave you vulnerable, and that's where the enemies always try to jam their blades. One hit to your weak point can bring down everything you've painstakingly built.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_010: I'm so bored. Hoping something amusing happens.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_011: Assassin of the Armorless Union of Kazimierz here as per our agreement. What am I called? Hmm... Call me Platinum, then. Nice to meet you.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_012: Good. My bow feels even lighter. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_013: Promotion? Isn't the rank of Platinum already intimidating enough? Oh, you are an interesting one.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_014: Hah. Do you have the guts to gaze upon the true face of the one called Platinum, my dear Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_018: Really? I'm commanding? It's not my strongest suit, but all right.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_019: Will this battle be an interesting one?
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_020: You may as well attack at the same time. You're all too weak anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_029: Nice. I had quite an enjoyable time.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_030: Checkmate. I'm sorry, but victory is mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_031: What a pity that we left some alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_032: Don't give up... He who laughs last laughs best.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_033: The atmosphere here is surprisingly good.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_036: Want to go on a walk? If you're busy, there's always next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_038: Huh? Wasn't expecting to run into you here. Me? I'm just feeling the breeze. It's too noisy down there, and too many people. I want to be alone. Hm. Still sticking yourself here like a little dope after you've learned my answer? Could it be... You want to stay with me a bit longer? Ugh—whatever, this place is boring. How about we just ditch in secret?
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_043: A kind little reminder from me. Those tickets I gave you WILL expire. Don't make me tie you up and drag you there, okay? ...Day after tomorrow? Alright, it's a deal then. No backsies. What, why am I smiling? Is this your first time going to an amusement park with someone? That's cute. Interpret it however you like, little dummy.
dialogue_tracker.char_204_platnm_CN_044: Missions: boring, enemies: boring, but it's still way better than Kazimierz no matter how you slice it. Just getting further and further away from there feels great. The wind from Kazimierz will never again blow my arrows off its mark, and I never want to breathe its air ever again.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_001: I can spend some time discussing matters with you before my next experiment.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_002: You are spending far too much time outside the laboratory, Doctor. As a researcher, you must know this only hinders you from making great strides.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_003: SilverAsh's sisters? Yes, I've met them several times... Hm...? What more do you want me to say? I know nothing about those frolicsome, ever-changing creatures, and I certainly am not interested in them.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_004: It is incredibly ignorant to simply write off the symptoms that arise upon Oripathy infection as a mere disease, and then to go on to think only about how to 'control' and 'heal' this disease. Don't tell me this is how you think as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_005: Shining. I knew I would find her here... Hm? No, she is an excellent scholar, and we collaborated for a period of time until she disappeared one day. That's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_006: I am not working for SilverAsh; our objectives merely overlap. Of course, I won't deny what he is trying to achieve holds great significance for the future of the Snow Realm.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_007: The best way you can earn my trust is by showing me your true academic strengths, and it seems you've already realized as much, Doctor. I am not like SilverAsh. I am not interested in deeper emotional exchanges.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_008: If you understand SilverAsh well enough, you know he is not a callous man. From my point of view, he might even be a little indecisive... That, is your weakness too, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_009: Much like SilverAsh's, your endeavors require the help of countless supporters. However, the more supporters you have, the more you have to worry about. Since you cannot disregard them, you should avoid getting entangled. That is my one and only piece of advice for you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_010: It seems you are rather lax in maintaining your own health, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_011: Pleasure to finally make your acquaintance, Doctor of Rhodes Island. I've been eager to meet you ever since Karlan began its relationship with your company. You may call me Gnosis.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_012: War is merely a means to an end. That said, if you claim there are more efficient ways, I'm happy to learn.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_013: I am far more interested in gaining access to Rhodes Island's databases than I am in a salary increase.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_014: If Rhodes Island is willing the cross the line, I am sure you will see results that far surpass what you are currently achieving... That said, with SilverAsh as an example, I do understand the reasons behind your convictions. Hmph, allow me to offer a helping hand, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_017: You're in luck. I just completed my experiment.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_018: Fulfill your roles, and leave the rest to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_019: I can only hope this mission won't prove to be a waste of time.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_022: You disrupted my train of thought, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_024: Let's put an end to this as soon as possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_028: Do not disrupt my thought process.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_029: I look forward to seeing such spectacular results from you in your research, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_030: Having prepared appropriately, these results are unsurprising.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_031: Sometimes, there is much to gain from the unexpected.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_032: Were there too many variables outside our control...?
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_033: Time to head to the lab.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_036: I have an idea. Care to hear it?
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_038: My experiences of Kjerag inform me that today will be a raucous day... Well, Doctor, I still have experiments to perform, so if you'll excuse me. As compensation, I will provide you some novel research results. Oh, one more thing: Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_042: You should spend your time more efficiently, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_043: I've gathered from the hollering and hooting of the operators out here that today is your birthday. This book will serve as your birthday present. Accept, and then I ask you to please pacify the people outside the laboratory... SilverAsh is here too? Hmm, it seems you do carry a beyond-average estimation in his eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_206_gnosis_CN_044: Celebrate, out there? I have no interest. I've made my way out of the laboratory and given you my greetings, so there is no further reason this occasion should keep me, unless you think I can produce novel research results for you in conditions this clamorous.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_001: H-Hello, Doctor... It's nice meeting you...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_002: Um... Sorry... I'm not a good talker...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_003: Yes... My parents are Victorian merchants. But I haven't been able to contact them for a long time... I picked this code name because it reminds me of home.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_004: Th-That masked Operator... makes me feel... nervous...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_005: It's not that... I'm trying to avoid people, it's just, I'm not sure... what I should do...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_007: Sorry to make you worry again, Ansel... But you don't have to give me special treatment. Many more people need your help.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_008: Oripathy granted me powerful senses, but they're slipping away, little by little... Even so, I will not crumble... There's so much more I want to talk about with everyone...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_009: Doctor, could you take this bottle of perfume, please? I brought it from home... This type of perfume lifts spirits. I often take a sniff when I feel down.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_010: Merry? Keep it down... The Doctor is very tired.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_011: I'm Melantha... From now on, my blade is yours.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_013: Thank you very much... Um, were the others promoted as well? I think they all deserve it just the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_018: The leader? But I'm not particularly good at giving orders...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_019: Let's work to make the world a more peaceful place.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_020: Ansel... I'm counting on you now.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_029: No matter what difficulties are in store for me, I will keep on advancing.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_030: We won? Thank goodness for that...
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_032: We failed... How did things end up this way?
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_036: Doctor, thank you for always taking care of me... Um, actually... I'd like to keep taking on the fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_038: Um… Happy New Year, Doctor. My parents sent me a letter and a present. I'm also doing a little better today, in terms of perceptiveness. It's a happy day for me. I hope… it puts you in a good mood too.
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_043: Doctor, thank you for all the care and encouragement you've given me. This is a present from me... some refreshing fragrances. I've already tried them, they don't clash when mixed together. So you can blend them however you like…
dialogue_tracker.char_208_melan_CN_044: Doctor… How have we been doing? Um… yes… Thank you. I hope I can do better, bit by bit! My squadmates have been supporting me all the way. I hope to repay them… with my strength.
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_001: Hello! It's my shift now, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_002: What does my 'Cardigan' codename mean? Ahh, It's actually the name of my clan. It's a family tradition to use it as a codename.
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_003: Wow, I found one of my people on another team! I've got to invite her to hang out with me sometime!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_004: I was born in the north of Leithanien, a place full of snowy forests. Oh, that reminds me, I can teach you to ski, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_005: A lot of people say stuff like 'it's a Defender's job to hold her ground,' but that's such an outdated concept. Speed is what you need! This is the age of maneuver warfare! Mobility is the key to victory!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_007: *Sniff sniff*... I recognize that perfume, it's gotta be Melantha! I hope we can become closer friends... 'Cause then we'll be able to work better as a team!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_008: Hehe, I really enjoy playing with kids. Back in my hometown, I took my brothers and sisters sledding every year. I really miss it! Oh, speaking of sleds... I wonder if Adnachiel can make one for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_009: I have plenty of things I don't like. Oripathy, for instance... But there's no point in worrying too much. I would rather live my days in happiness! Plus, I've got you with me, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_011: Heeellooo! I've never been in such a big mobile facility before! I'm so excited! Merry of the Cardigan here. Are you the Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_013: Yay! I will keep fighting hard for my next promotion! I'm sure it will come in time!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_017: Awesome! Finally, my time has come!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_018: Ansel! Come on! I promise I won't lead everyone on a wild-goose chase!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_019: Formation ready! Advance to the objective!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_020: Let's go! ...Steward, what was I supposed to do next?
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_029: I knew we could do it. Right, Adnachiel?
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_031: Thanks, Medics! You saved my life...
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_033: Steward, what should I do next?
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_036: Melantha? Huh? Why are you here, Doctor?!
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! I wonder why there's no snow outside. And after I spent all that time getting my sled ready… When will I ever get to rocket down the slopes straight into a snowdrift like I did when I was little?
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_043: Yay! Happy birthday, Doctor! Hm, something smells good. You got a gift from Melantha, didn't you? What a scent! Melantha taught me how to make perfume, actually, do you want to try with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_209_ardign_CN_044: I promise I'll be more careful, I won't break anything! Sorry… Honestly, my salary won't even be enough to cover the damages if I keep breaking things… heheh…
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_001: Welcome back, Doctor. Steward at your service.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_002: Steward is my surname, as well as my Operator codename. Doctor, I'm sure you can tell from it what my ancestors did for a living.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_003: I didn't expect to see another from my clan here. Is she looking for someone? I know how that feels... Oh, never mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_004: People often say our fur has the 'color of snow.' Doctor, have you ever seen snow?
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_005: Lava has a very distinct fighting style. I thought she was going to cast with her book, but her real Arts Unit is a dagger. Her style reminds me of the mystic who taught me Arts.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_007: It is my honor to work for you, Doctor. But if possible, I do hope you pay some extra care to Melantha. She's always alone…
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_008: Adnachiel is a mysterious one... No one can tell what he is thinking.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_009: Ansel... It's okay... I stopped caring about my identity as an Infected long ago. In fact, I received a lot of help because of it. Before the infection takes away what's dear to me, I will use it to create a place where everyone can live in peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_010: Are you tired? Do take a good rest, Doctor. Rhodes Island will need your skills tomorrow.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_011: Caster Steward reporting in. I'm glad to be working with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_012: I have learned a lot. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_013: I'm glad that you are satisfied with my work. Instructor Dobermann will be happy too.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_017: What can I do for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_018: Cardigan, always read the situation before you act.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_019: Well, I'll be sure to bring you some good news.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_020: They probably won't make it to tomorrow.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_029: With the right strategy, we'll make it through any tight spot.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_030: A perfect victory. Good work, everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_031: Ansel, please check the casualties for me. We must prepare for the next battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_032: Did we make a mistake somewhere...?
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_033: Is that you, Cardi— WAI-WAIT! WAIT! Don't touch the equipment!
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_036: Doctor, is there anything I can do for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_038: Heavy snow always dominates Kjerag at this time of the year, burying everything from the last year beneath. With that, our calendar turns a new page. If possible, Doctor, I really wish to give you a tour of my hometown. But, the wilds there are dangerous on snowy days, and you'll need me as your guide.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! And allow me to be your personal butler today! Steward, at your service.
dialogue_tracker.char_210_stward_CN_044: Had I not come to Rhodes Island, I would't have had the opportunity to continue my study on Originium Arts, let alone making friends with my teammates in Reserve Op Team A4. I will cherish all I have at present, for chances like these don't grow on trees. So, Doctor, let us keep up the hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_001: That device you're holding seems to be in poor shape. Would you mind if I take a look at it?
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_002: Hey, Ansel. Cardigan looks good today. Anything I can help you with?
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_003: We have a squad of very interesting people, especially Melantha. She always seems to be hiding from me, but I can sniff her out.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_004: Cardigan, what are you doing? You look so happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_005: Not every Laterano has the right to use guns, rare weapons that they are. In my hometown, we're pretty good at making knockoff gun parts. The crossbow crafting industry is also on the rise. The result is what I have here - a crossbow with a tactical rail attachment.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_007: Would you like to try some of my handmade sweets? I'm kind of ashamed that I can only make 25 types of desserts. It feels like I've disgraced the Laterano people.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_008: What's wrong with my halo? I don't know why, but it seems to have deviated slightly. According to Dr. Kal'tsit, it probably has something to do with my abnormal hippocampus.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_009: Instead of watching you from afar, I feel much better standing by your side, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_010: Doctor, you strike an impressive figure, even when you rest like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_011: My name is Adnachiel. I'm a Sniper from Laterano. Although I'm not yet certified to carry a gun, I can match the veterans with my crossbow!
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_012: Put me to good use and I'll be more than happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_013: Thank you very much for the promotion.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_018: If anything breaks, bring it to me. I may be able to fix it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_019: It's time to go. Are you ready?
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_029: Everything went just as you planned, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_030: We have the Doctor's orders to thank for this.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_031: Our operation was a success, but something feels a bit off...
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_033: This place has a great vibe.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_036: Doctor? I'm so happy to be with you!
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_038: Just like here, everyone would get together on this day to celebrate in Laterano. Some friends would even come visit just for the occasion, and see whether my halo was righted yet. Well, it's a shame I wasn't able to get my own gun before I left, but I guess I clicked with the crossbow anyhow. Slick of me, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_042: May the Lord bless you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_043: I've learned how to make fifteen more desserts this year, and though that's a long way off from how many desserts Laterano has, it should be enough for you to choose your birthday cake. I'd lean towards a fruitcake or a raspberry mochi—sweet and delicious in spades.
dialogue_tracker.char_211_adnach_CN_044: Doctor, nothing's made me happier than getting to work with you so long. I can't count how much you've cared for my squad members over the past year. Whichever way you guide me, Doctor, that's the future I'll sprint for.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_001: Doctor, it's time for your injection. Oh, um, are you alright?! Are you scared of needles?
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_002: Like Dr. Kal'tsit is always telling you, Doctor, you really need some exercise. I'm new here, but you still need to listen to my advice.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_003: Cardigan! We've told you, if you move like that when you strike, you'll wind up getting hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_004: Good grief... Doctor, you need to take care of yourself. You can't make us do it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_005: Are you worried about my health after so many night shifts? You shouldn't be. My race has a unique way of producing hormones, which allows us to handle night activities better. So I can hand my shift over to Hibiscus at just the right time.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_007: You must stop with the midnight snacks. Don't go bringing up my eating habits. I eat at night because of my race! Yes, it's a racial trait!
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_008: I'm Ansel. It's a little embarrassing to admit, but I chose to become a Medic because I've been sickly since I was young. But now that I'm an Operator, I'll make sure not to burden you. So please treat me just the same way you treat the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_009: I know everyone does what they can. But I heard from Dr. Kal'tsit that Steward and Melantha's conditions aren't looking too good... My job is to make their lives as easy as possible. Doctor, let's redouble our efforts, together.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_010: Adnachiel, could you ask Cardigan to settle down for a moment? The Doctor is resting.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_011: I am Ansel, a medical intern. I'll be assisting with surgery and internal medicine, among other things. I look forward to working with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_012: I hope I didn't cause you any trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_013: I'm glad that you care so much for the wellbeing of us Medics.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_018: Medical support should be the top priority for any tactical squad.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_019: Alright, all medicine has been prepared.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_026: Your medication is here. Take it!
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_029: Phew, thank goodness I brought enough medicine. Please don't worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_030: I was very impressed by everyone's performance. It was fantastic.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_031: Please hold on, I'll treat your injuries right away.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_032: We've sustained injuries! I need to get the wounded to the rear. Cover me!
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_033: I'm checking on the medical supplies here.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_034: Whoa, Doctor, please don't mess with me!
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_036: Doctor, I'm very glad that you like me.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_038: The Medical Department actually gets busier around New Year's. People hurt themselves setting off fireworks or gorging on food... I get wanting to indulge in the holiday spirit, but you need to keep yourselves safe too. You know how to take care of yourself, Doctor, don't you? Very well. With that, I wish you happy new year. May you spend the year without that kind of visit to Medical.
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_043: Doctor, good evening. It's just past midnight, so I think it counts as your birthday. Happy birthday to you! I got you a cake, but my advice is to wait till tomorrow to eat it. Oh, come to think of it, does this make me the first to wish you a happy birthday?
dialogue_tracker.char_212_ansel_CN_044: I only came to Rhodes Island at first because no other place would accept my resume. It seems more like a kind of destiny now. All of A4 are maturing, and I can't fall behind, Doctor. The good news is, test results show my health condition has gotten a lot better over the last year.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_001: Heheh, aren't you the lucky one, Doctor? I don't have any work for the day, so I wouldn't mind keeping you company for a bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_002: The marketplaces of Lungmen, the suburbs of Ursus, the ancient ruins of Victoria... Doctor, these lands hold countless beautiful sights, but very few people ever slow down and take them all in.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_003: Doctor, do you want to hear a story from my travels? In that case, I think we should get some fine tea cakes before we sit down. Otherwise, even the most captivating story will turn boring.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_004: I've watched plenty of organizations rise and fall, but so far, Rhodes Island is the most interesting one I've seen. Will the epochs bend to your will, or finally swallow you whole...? I'm dying to find out.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_005: Doctor, I have a few ideas where we can get some good food at our next destination. Interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_006: Doctor, you seem to already know a thing or two about fallen angels. Unfortunately, I can't give you any more details than what you've got. Even if I shared everything else with you someday, that would stay my one secret.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_007: Doctor, you don't need to worry about maintaining a good relationship with me. Friends, family, and love... I've got nothing against them, but I don't need them either. Heh, not like that's going to stop you from trying, right? Well, I don't really mind, so give it your best shot.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_008: Hey, Doctor, I'm back from... Whoa, were you waiting for me here? You even prepared a whole table of snacks... Hehe, all right. How could I turn you down after a gesture like that? In return, I'll tell you about the fun I had on this last delivery run.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_009: ...I see now. The spark of joy I felt when I thought of having a friend like you wasn't fake after all. Scrap what I said before, Doctor. Maybe I do need a bit of warmth in my life.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_011: Hey there, Doctor. I'm Mostima. You might've heard from Emperor that I'm not bound by the contract between Penguin Logistics and Rhodes Island, and can therefore act independently. Having that said, I'll probably be staying here anyway when I'm not busy. Sooo, I'll see you around.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_012: Well then, let's see how Rhodes Island fights.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_013: You know, Doctor, relying on me isn't a very wise decision.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_014: You really want to see me go all out, Doctor? Just for the record, I have to ask… Do I have to pay for the collateral damage I cause? No, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_018: Hmm... Sorry, but why don't we let everyone do their own thing?
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_019: Ah. I know this place. Let me lead the way.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_025: Seventy percent-ish should do the trick.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_026: It's about time to wrap things up.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_027: I have nothing against you guys. It's just the story of our lives.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_028: I wonder what we should eat after this?
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_029: Feels good. Guess I could use a thrill every now and then.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_030: Hm? I thought I missed a few, but I guess that's a job well done.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_031: The results of a battle don't really matter to a Messenger. Just surviving is enough of a victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_032: Gotta admit, this 'teamwork' isn't really my thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_033: Mind if I go wander around?
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_038: This day used to be like any other for me. Wouldn't stop long at any one place, wouldn't form any serious friendships, wouldn't have fun like everyone else. I never imagined I'd enjoy the holiday atmosphere here. I gotta admit, it isn't half bad. Happy New Year, Doctor, hope we all enjoy it.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_043: So today's your birthday, Doctor. Happy birthday. Would you take an incredible story from my travels as a present? I guess not... alright, how about we take a trip together? I'll pick the scenery, you choose the time.
dialogue_tracker.char_213_mostma_CN_044: The more dangerous the place, the more enchanting the views get. Once you make it through every layer of danger, to finally stand in the eye of a Catastrophe, you're a part of the scenery yourself. In the end, where will you lead Rhodes Island, Doctor? I'm still dying to see.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_001: You give Kafka the work that needs doing, Doctor, and then I pass it all on... okay! This's just like how underground gofering goes!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_002: Seeing as you're my friend now, Doctor, you can ask me for anything. Oh, but, apart from lending you my shears.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_003: Rhodes Island's fulla all sortsa people I never met before. Everywhere I go, I sees what I wants. Hm? You're wonderin' WHAT it is I want? That's a secret, y'know. Secret.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_004: Hmm... still can't read your eyes. They're calm as a lake... But there'll come a day when I get your number, Doctor, just you wait!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_005: Doctor, Silence kicked me out againnn! Hard times for a Kafka, sob, sob... huh? I started it by messing up her experiment? Aw, nerts, Silence got to you first... eh-hem, well, good talking, I'm just gonna mosey on out now!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_006: Well, until I can get what I want, I guess I'll lend you a hand. Just lending it, though, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_007: Story goes, I used to live in a real maaad kinda city, dealing with bad people alla the day. But then I came landship-side, and everyone's been some kinda nice with me, even givin' me snacks and all! Mm-hm, and that's why I like it here at Rhodes Island!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_008: ...Y'know the secrets everyone tries their best to hide? They're like monsters, hidden in the dead shadows, waitin' for their chance. Beautiful... and dangerous. That's exactly why I do my darndest to collect them! Doctor, don't you got anything for my hoard?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_009: Doctor, if you've ever got a problem, we can always call my 'friends' from Columbia in to help. Though you don't really gotta. One Kafka'll sort out all your troubles head to tail!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_010: Bet you think I'm goofing off right now, Doctor. But I ain't.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_011: Whatcha need me for...? Hey, hey, wait, no bean-spilling, not in front of everybody! Just treat me like a normal gardener, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_012: Just gotta figure what they're aiming for, and I can draw up some counterplans. C'mon, ain't I a wiz?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_013: Seeing as you really need my power, Doctor, just c'mon and say it. Be like Kafka here, all serious and open, yeah?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_014: Gardenin' or fightin', I didn't start doing either for compliments. But having my own efforts get noticed by you and the rest, well, that makes a Kafka real happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_017: Wonder what we can harvest this time?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_018: Just leave it to me. I guarantee you're all in for a fun time!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_019: Ah, thinkin' sucks... I guess I'll be listenin' to you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_020: Look at all these naughty li'l saplings. Ain'tcha cute... sit tight and Kafka'll trim ya up.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_025: Watch your eyes... I see all your weakpoints in 'em.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_026: You're all just hedges who know how to walk.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_028: Kafka knows you're scared. Tremblin' li'l bare branches.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_029: Smooth sailin' just like always, Doctor. Alright, makes a Kafka wanna go get 'em!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_030: Man, were those enemies pushovers. If I'd known sooner, I coulda saved a Kafka some effort.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_031: Hmm, guess I gotta be more careful with the pruning next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_032: Whaddaya doing, Kafka... you can read their plans, can't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_036: Doctor, Kafka here wants to deck out your office with some bonsai. Don'tcha worry, I'll make 'em look real good.
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_038: Doctor, let's build us a snowman! First we roll up two big snowballs. We make the hat kinda round, then we do the clothes reaaal long... Ta-dah, one 'Doctor,' made to order! Oh, I dunno though, feels kinda sad seeing a Doctor all alone on the deck!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_042: What work you got for me today, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_043: Doctor, birthday cake for you! See the flowers around the outside? Pure bespoke craft by Kafka hands. Careful you don't lose count counting 'em all, heheh! C'mon, yannow fine work like this ain't no sweat for me and my shears. Not that I got anything against working up a sweat for my best bud—hey, whoa, whoa, paws off! No eating yet! You admire the freakin' thing first!
dialogue_tracker.char_214_kafka_CN_044: Yannow, I've been here long enough to see all you Rhodes Islanders are real good people. And nothing gets me more heated than good people getting bullied. So if there's ever any bad guys you just can't handle, you drop me a line. A Kafka's always saving some secret sauce—what, no need? Fine. You're the boss, boss.
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_001: Umm, excuse me… I've been waiting here... for two hours…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_002: Sorry… I know people keep ignoring me... But... my Arts aren't to blame…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_003: My Arts... make me undetectable to people... in certain environments…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_004: I… I've never had any friends... S-surely no one wants a friend that…  they can't even notice… right?
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_005: My tail... It curls up when I'm not fighting... So please, don't be afraid…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_006: Doctor... you can leave the dangerous work to me... After all... my Arts were made for that…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_007: These ID tags around my neck… I collected them... I like holding onto evidence... that someone once existed...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_008: Don't let that 'Nightmare' girl near me!... She's dangerous... My Arts don't work on her... Why…?
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_009: I… I really want to cure my Oripathy. But if it's cured... what's going to happen to my Arts?... If they're gone, will I... still be of any use...?
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_010: Doctor's ignoring me… I don't like it, hmph...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_011: I'm Manticore... My Arts can take out lives silently... Please don't be scared, you're not my target…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_012: Thank you... I-I'm looking forward to you teaching me... more...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_013: Finally, I got a promotion... I always thought I wasn't good enough… so you didn't promote me…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_014: Did I... manage to help you? I don't have anywhere else to go... My home is here... at Rhodes Island... So please, let me protect it with you...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_018: Nobody will like me... as their captain...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_020: Please choose tactics that make use of my Arts... even if it's something crafty and underhanded... I won't mind...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_029: Even in such terrible battles… your judgement and decisions didn't seem to waver… You're incredible, Doctor…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_030: A victory by all means... Still...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_031: I can handle the runaways... if you wish...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_032: I'm sorry... It's all my fault...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_036: Thank you for paying attention to me... I know it's your job... but it still makes me happy…
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_038: Happy New Year... More people have  noticed me... in the last year... I'm a little scared, but... a lot of them are very warm, and kind... So, I'm going to try as hard as I can... to adapt...
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_043: I'll just put the present on the table and leave... Doctor, happy birthday... Eek! Did-did you notice me...? Um, Happy birthday to you... Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_215_mantic_CN_044: I don't want to go through the experience... of losing a friend again... I will defend everyone, with my own life. Even if it's somewhere none of them will see me...
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_001: I hope you're not a pain to deal with like Monica, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_002: Monica sure has a weird taste. Did you know she thought about using things like Seer or Baker as her code name? Incandescence sounds about normal now, yeah?
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_003: Skadi and Specter are Ægirs, like me. Whenever I see them, I feel like… You know, my heart starts racing. Geez… If this is what I think it is, maybe I should dress up…
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_004: To be honest, I wasn't really interested in coming to Rhodes Island at first. After all, Monica was the one you hired, and I'm just her bodyguard. But then she didn't need one anymore and finding a new job gets my tentacles all tied in a knot, so I decided to tag along and take my chances here.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_005: Monica and I lived together back in Iberia. Taking care of someone as unorganized and impulsive as her was a pesky chore… But she was the best option I had. I don't get along with my family and she was the one who took me in.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_006: The Inquisition used to give me loads of trouble for my crossbow. They'd disassemble it, inspect the structure, and then give me a tongue-lashing for modifying it to look like a rifle. Yep, I know my weapon gives people the wrong idea, but I don't care. The Inquisition eventually gave up and just asked that I don't go scaring people with it. Heheh.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_007: Doctor, Rhodes Island doesn't have any restrictions on their operators making friends, right? ...No, um, I just wanted to make friends with those Laterano folks. I've always loved Laterano's guns ever since I was little, so I tried to emulate one when I made this gun.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_008: You know, my Mom once told me that something happened to me when I was little, but I can't remember it for the life of me. Mom doesn't seem too eager to tell me, either. Meh. I'm doing fine now, so I guess it mustn't have been a big deal.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_009: I gotta hand it to you, Doctor. Taking care of Monica alone takes everything out of me, but you have to take care of so many operators… Anyway, let me know if you ever need help. You know, you're not the only caretaker around here.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_010: Your work-rest balance is all out of whack, just like Monica. Alright… where's the blanket…
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_011: I used to be Monica's... Err, I guess it's Incandescence now... Anyway, I used to be her bodyguard. She finally found herself a proper job now, so I'm free to do other stuff. That's all. Hope we get along well.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_012: So this is how the pros do things...
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_013: Before I came, I thought to myself, a security guard at a pharmaceutical company would be pretty chill. And if I didn't make the cut, janitorial work would also be fine. Not gonna lie, I'm starting to regret my decision a bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_014: Honestly, I never thought I'd achieve something like this... You know, getting stronger wasn't on my list before, but this feeling isn't half bad. Thanks, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_017: Time for the mission? Got it.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_018: I'm leading? Mm... I'll try my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_022: I'd like to listen to some music.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_029: Doctor, want some candy? You can relax now. I'm spent, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_030: I'll double-check to see if we missed anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_031: That's good enough, right? Saves us both the trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_032: Let's go, Doctor. I've secured the retreat route.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_033: Guess I'll take a look around first.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_036: Doctor, is there anything I can help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. This is my first time celebrating with so many people, and it's not bad at all. Oh, speaking of which, I was supposed to write a letter to Mom before I left, but I totally forgot. Gotta write one now.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_043: Happy birthday! Here's your present. I bought Monica one, and it worked really well, so I got you one, too. The bane of you people with messed-up work and rest schedules: an ultra-mega alarm clock. Fail to follow a schedule and you'll get an alarm loud enough to cause a tsunami.
dialogue_tracker.char_218_cuttle_CN_044: I never had many plans for the future to begin with, and I never thought I'd come this far. Looking back, I made the right decision to come here with Monica... How do I see the future now? Hm... Man, what a question. I got nothing.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_001: It's time for my shift. If I'm interrupting your work, I can wait outside.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_002: Have you gone through every new operator's personnel files and info?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_003: Nowhere in the world is completely safe with a war going on. Not even Rhodes Island. Please remember that.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_004: To be frank, you're surrounded by people from all walks of life. That can be quite dangerous, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_005: I'm surprised that so many other Sarkaz have come to Rhodes Island. What's more surprising is that they actually get along…
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_006: My bowgun may not be easy to operate, but it's just as powerful as the Laterano guns. I use it to defend the glory of my people.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_007: I see Firewatch is here. I can't believe she's using the name of our old guerrilla group as her codename. It's like time stopped for her the day her home was destroyed...
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_008: As for what happened between Firewatch and I... she'll tell you when she's ready. All I can say is that I was not the one who led the rebels to her village... but no one would believe the words of a Sarkaz, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_009: She wants her revenge, and I have my duty. Even though we've met again at Rhodes Island, it probably won't affect anything. Our paths aren't likely to cross.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_010: What's that sound? Is someone monitoring this room? Or am I just… imagining things?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_011: Codename Meteorite, a freelance mercenary. I'm Sarkaz, as you can see. Do you still want to hire me?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_012: My aim with my bowgun has improved.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_013: You want to promote me? I see that I made the right choice to work here.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_014: Thank you so much for this, really. I can't believe someone like me could work a stable job here at Rhodes Island. I'll do everything I can to repay your trust in me.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_018: Me, a leader? To be honest, I'm not that good at giving orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_019: I'll do my best to take care of everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_020: Enemy status confirmed. All units, prepare to engage.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_029: I don't want to see anything laid to waste in the fires of war ever again. Let us put an end to this, once and for all.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_030: Trying to escape after I laid you to siege? Don't be silly.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_031: Someone's escaped. Not the time to let our guard down.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_032: Retreat! Back to the stronghold and regroup.
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_038: That's another year, come and gone. Getting to live one more year is certainly worth celebrating as a merc, but more than that, I don't want anyone else living with this kind of uncertainty... Doctor, I got some presents for the kids of Rhodes Island. Could you hand them out for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I want to take this chance to express my gratitude, for you are always looking out for me. I wasn't sure what would be a suitable gift... but I will give you an oath, I'll give it all I've got to protect you. Um… is that okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_219_meteo_CN_044: Before this, I'd never stayed with an organization for such a long time, and I haven't figured out my plans for the future, but I really wavered when I heard Amiya say, 'I want to help the Sarkaz.' Maybe there are still lots of people out there, with hope for the future in their hearts.
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_001: Reporting in, Doctor! Patrol completed. Nothing out of the ordinary!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_002: I'm starving. That battle really took a lot out of me... You say you've got something to eat? Just for me? Whoa... It's… it's an apple pie! Thanks a lot! It looks great!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_003: Everybody here at Rhodes Island calls me 'Tiny,' but it really doesn't bother me. The boys back on the force always teased me the same way. Hey! Don't pat my head! Or rub my ears! Or squeeze my cheek for that matter!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_004: Doctor, I might not make it to training on Wednesdays or Fridays... Right, I need to be out there helping the civil corps to keep the peace and catch the bad guys! Wh-waht? I have an important mission on Friday?!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_005: Rhodes Island has lots of strong Operators, but there's no one who can match my speed!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_006: Time flies, Dcotor. We've been working together so long. I will never forget anything we've been through. But we can't stop now! We have to keep striving for that bright future, don't we?
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_007: I just bumped into Skadi in the hallway... Doctor, you think she's cold and distant, don't you? She's actually very kind. Really!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_008: Compared to everyone else, I'm pretty ordinary. I don't have any superpowers, or spectacular achievements to brag about... But I don't need magic or claws to make the world a better place. I can do that with my own two hands! But before that, we still have to eat well.
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_009: Doctor, you always worry so much about your people, but you never remember to take care of yourself. You can't do that! No matter what dangers you may face, I promise I'll be there to hold your hand! Definitely, you have my word!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_010: Hmm? Why do you smell so good, Doctor? You're definitely hiding something tasty, aren't you?!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_011: Mounted Police Officer Grani, here to answer your call for help! Fear not. From this point forward, I will protect you!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_012: I see. That's another thing I should watch out for. Got it!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_013: An elite promotion medal? For me? Thank you, Doctor! I'll hang it up with my police medal!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_014: Since the day of my first mission, I've been leaning on this lance to get back on my feet. As long as I grip it tight, my heart will brim with the courage it needs to protect the people and their dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_017: Shall I go scout the battlefield?
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_018: You're making me the captain? Okay. I'll protect the whole squad!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_019: All right, let's bring home a victory!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_025: My lance will clear a path!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_027: Only one comes out on top when the lances are crossed!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_028: My battlefield extends well above the ground!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_029: If you look to harm those under my protection, you'll have to go through me first!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_030: Nice! That was an excellent fight! You all did splendidly!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_031: Doctor, please stay close to me. There may still be some enemies around.
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_032: Damn it... I can't let myself fall here!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_036: If we get the chance, I hope we can see the world together, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! It's been another year, and the energy at Rhodes Island gives me the drive to do more things to benefit Terra. Can't do it on an empty stomach though. What are you guys having? Smells good.
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I've tried this a few times with the other operators, and it's super fun! Come, get on my back. Ready? 3, 2, 1... go!
dialogue_tracker.char_220_grani_CN_044: This lance has been with me for a long time. People say I don't use it to its full potential, but I only hope that justice is served wherever my lance can reach. I won't lose to anyone as long as I know I'm fighting for justice.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_001: Assistant? The one where ye just stand next tae folk, aye? Nae bother, saw that plenty in the army myself. Wait, I have tae do paperwork too? And assess combat data? And compile reports?! Th-that sounds mighty hectic.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_002: Back in school, Chenchen always had a pissed off look on her face, made no end of enemies at first, but tha's just the kind of girl she is. Nae time at all, she had people seein' her wi fresh eyes. But y'know, bandagin' up her wounds, cookin' for her, teamin' up wi her squad and all that... I had tae look after her a fair bit, and that was no easy thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_003: I'm great at drivin' machines! Harvesters, tractors, tillers, I'll be right at home wi anythin'. Hm? PDAs? Screens? Wireless systems? If yer meanin' little gadgety stuff, I'm nae so—ah crims, I just barely touched this—why's it smokin'?
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_004: Ye didnae get a proper supper in yesterday, did ye? No, I dinnae want tae hear aboot 'work, work, work'! If yer body gives out on ye, ye willnae be able tae get a thing done. Tell me what ye'd like, and I'll whip it right up for ye. Ah, na anything too fancy though, aye? I'd be lost tryin'.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_005: This Rhodes Island ship is... crivens, it's a million times more wonderful than Victoria's warships! We've got sunlight, wheat fields, herds of stockbeasts... Doctor, what if, we try growin' somethin' too? Like potatoes, say? I know all aboot growin' potatoes!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_006: Where d'ye think someone's hometown ends? The hoose furthest from the tractors? Or where the land meets the sky? Does it stop at the fronts we keep drawin' and redrawin' maps wi, all reds and blues and lines and arrows...? Y'know, after so many battles... sometimes I cannae recall what my hometown looks like.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_007: I'm sure that I ran across her once, that Reed lass. But she looks so lonely the noo, so pitiful... can she really be the same terrifyin' person I met before? It's right strange. I should go ask her...  What? I cannae talk tae her? Why no?!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_008: My mum's part of the reason I ended up runnin' off to military school at all. Always bangin' on like 'Vouivre women must keep gettin' stronger', she is. ...S'pose I wanted to be cheeky about it, aye? Though lookin' back on it, no need to be AS tough as my mum. Och, I'm still more soft and cute than hard and chiselled, wouldn't you say? Go on, say?
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_009: When I was still in the army, I came across this spectre-like force. Hauntin' the dark edges of Victoria, and most of the people who witnessed them went missin'. I've a duty to expose them, and that's why I've been scramblin' aboot. Oh, dinnae you step in for me. You've got yer own callin' to worry about, na?
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_010: Ah! Fancy that, skivin' off! Aww, got me jealous. Doesnae beat a nice hay pile for a few winks though, aye? I'm noddin' off just thinkin' aboot it... Wouldn't hurt tae take a wee kip myself...
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_011: Hello! You're the Doctor, aye? Officer Ch'en fae Lungmen said I'd be able tae find some helpers here! I need tae sign my name first? Aye, right enough. Baaag...pipe. There! Eh? 'Become an Operator?' 'Full-time bed and board'? Ach, what's goin' on here?!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_012: Whoa, you folks here at Rhodes Island sure can fight!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_013: A promotion? Hmm... cannae say if I like it or na. For soldiers, more responsibilities means more battles, and a greater risk of mistakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_014: Joinin' Rhodes Island has been a good thing for me. Oripathy and the Infected may seem a touch scary at first, but runnin' from it willnae solve a thing. That's what I've learned here, and I mean it when I say, thank you—I see my way now, right ahead of me.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_018: Assumin' leadership! Team will hereby carry out the operation!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_024: My spear and I hail from Victoria!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_029: Be it school or the military, I've still seen worse.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_030: Phew... I've managed tae live up t' the reputation of this uniform once more.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_031: Enemy routed! All units, pursue only wi caution!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_032: You get out of here! Go!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_033: How do I get tae the greenhoose?
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_036: Wanna go on a picnic? Just the two of us!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_038: The toon always used tae get together at New Year's back home. Roastin', drinkin', dancin' aboot bonfires, playin' bagpipes loud and proud, and then gettin' all kitted out in fancy dress and jumpin' straight intae the freezin' lake. Oh, it isnae anythin' too serious really, just a daft auld way of sobering up a wee bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_042: Doctor, how's about we go farmin'!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_043: I heard the news! Today's yer big day, Doctor, so that means a meal on you, aye? Me and Chenchen'd always treat each other to supper back on our birthdays at school, heheh. Oh, right, I've got a wee prezzie for ye, too. Here y' are! It's one of the potatoes I planted a wee while ago- just sprung up proper today!
dialogue_tracker.char_222_bpipe_CN_044: Thinkin' over it, I've been through a fair few battles wi all the folks at Rhodes Island by now. I really do miss the days of lyin' in the hay havin' a nap sometimes. But nobody'd have an idle life to live if I put this spear doon and left, ye ken? So you'll no catch me moanin' aboot it!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_001: Oh yeah, my dude, when you're callin' my name to get my attention, don't forget to stress the K at the end. Or else I might assume you're stammering or somethin'.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_002: Whoa, whoa, hold up! Is that vampire lady none other than 'Mr. Blood'?! Man, we've still not settled that medical score we had a while back, and this is the perfect opportunity! I'll have to set up my experiment equipment later... Heheheheh!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_003: Lemme guess, Hung's still tellin' you to watch out around me, ain't he? Oh, just to 'look after me'? Yeah, that sounds like him all right. But listen, Boss, I know your type. You're like me, and you just wanna do whatever you want, right? Then just ignore that guy. We can do whatever fun stuff we like.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_004: Yeah, I develop new drugs, do surgery, and nurture bacteria cultures, but those are all just fun hobbies to me. Doc. Aak? Nah, don't call me that. I don't save anyone, 'cuz I can't teach them the value of their lives. All I can do is just prevent 'em from dying.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_005: The medical department guys are askin' for me? Man, give me a break. I don't dig those professional physicians. They firmly believe that being a doctor's this noble job, and are content with saving more lives... before everything just comes crashing down when their faith got shattered. I've seen that happen time and time again. Honestly, it makes me sad.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_006: I don't dislike Rhodes Island. Instead, I think you guys are doing your job just fine. People are dyin' in the world right as we speak, and with all those doctors cooping up in labs, waiting for patients to knock on their clinics' doors, diseases ain't rid themselves of these lands. Hardly anyone gets it, but you people seem to have it in mind... Keep up the good stuff, will ya?
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_007: Me, a cynic? You got me wrong, my dude. I simply pity all the people on this land. Everyone's got their own hardships to deal with, and I know that. But what's the point of curing pains and sufferings when we can't cure their source? What medicine saves a man who's being murdered? Terra doesn't need more doctors in suits, my dude.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_008: My pops was an amazing doctor, and he was all about saving people's lives. But his colleagues slandered him, sidelined him, and framed him. That's how he ended up as a underground doctor, the nastiest among the wicked. Stuff like that ain't so unusual, but I'll admit, what happened to him really changed my own life.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_009: Have Waai Fu and Hung left? Really? Aight, I'm gonna hang out in your office for a while then. Y'know, if anyone can make this land a better place, it's gotta be people like them. You, meanwhile... Well, guess we are simply two peas in a pod, aren't we?
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_010: Aha! You Feelin' tired? Then come try this new compound I made! Free of charge, of course!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_011: So you're the Doctor, eh? Nice to meet'cha. My name's Aak. That's right, two A's with a K. Anyway, I'm here 'cause the agency got some business here at Rhodes Island. A quick question before we start: does the phrase 'medical mishap' put you off?
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_012: Huh... Does this mean I might get involved in combat scenarios like this? Surely not, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_013: A promotion? Almost too good to be true, man. I knew my agency has been exploiting me all along!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_014: Honestly, I dunno if I'm helpful or not. The way I see it, you've gotta be nice to be helpful, and I'm not blind to how people perceive me. But in any case, if you ever get sick, you know who to call.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_017: We goin' on a mission? Sure, let's do it.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_018: All right, team, gimme your thoughts on my new meds after this is done.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_019: Once I start an operation, there's no stoppin' it.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_020: Relax, guys. You just can't die with me by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_021: When prescribing, I always go double-down on the dosage.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_022: I ain't one for battle, but treating peole is so much fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_023: Time for a clinical test of my new meds.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_024: Learn to treat yourself with kindness, or regret when sickness treats you.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_025: All lives are equal... while yours is a deviation.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_026: Just take the shot. You will be amazed.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_027: My potion might give the bad guys a new leaf to turn over!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_028: Medicine, a box you wish you've never opened!
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_029: I doubt I can make the world a better place on my own, but at least I can stop it from gettin' any worse with your help.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_030: Could we capture some enemies for a little experimenting? It's not violating ethics as long as no one sees it. Not a chance? Aww.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_031: Letting 'em get away like that? You are a saint.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_032: Don't worry, my dude. I can fix any injury as long as the patient's still breathing.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_033: Now, now, let's see. Which of these rooms is my new lab?
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_036: Yo, my dude! Found any new experiment samples for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_038: Happy New Year, my dude. Hung just made a bunch of food, wanna try? I don't really do holidays myself—big rowdy pointless time, when you could be sittin' here takin' the breeze in. But hey, want some tong sui? I got it from the dining table, and man, it's not half bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_043: Heheheh, here's a cake, fruits of my research! I assure you, it's pure cake, nothin' but the same stuff you find in every cake! ...You heard weird laughing from the lab yesterday? My dude, there was no such thing, and I think your ears might be goin' funky. C'mon, a bite of cake'll fix you.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_044: Does it matter that much? I don't really super-mind the kind of man I turn out to be in the end, but it's like Waai Fu and Hung keep having these hopes of somethin'. And Rhodes Island's a little better than what I was thinkin' here. So no duh, I'm happy to keep goin' with you guys.

dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: Simmer down, guys. With me on your team, none of you's gonna die even if you want to.
dialogue_tracker.char_225_haak_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_021: When prescribing, I always go double-down on the dosage.

I don't really super-mind the kind of man I turn out to be in the end, but it's like Waai Fu and Hung keep having these hopes of somethin'. And Rhodes Island's a little better than I was thinkin' here. So no duh, I'm happy to keep goin' with you guys.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_001: Hi, Doc. Have you eaten yet? Here, I got some cookies if you're hungry.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_002: Doc, I know Aak's been a nuisance to you, but could you be lenient with him? He teases people a lot, but he's not a bad person. Also, let me know if he ever gets under your skin, I'll give him a lesson on that.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_003: Just call on me when you're hungry, Doc, and I'll make you a little something to eat. I may not look a like a chef, but I did learn a recipe or two from Mr. Lee.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_004: Say, Doc, do you give any lectures on machines here at Rhodes Island? I've got an interest in that stuff and was hoping I could learn something new.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_005: Hahah, just between you and me, Doc, for the longest time I thought all detectives do the same stuff as Mr. Lee. You know, taking sips of tea at the scene of gang fights, that sort of thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_006: I'm sure you already know, but with the intellect and talent that Aak's got, he's destined for great things one day. But personally, all that matters to me is that he doesn't ever go back to what he used to be.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_007: Me and Mr. Lee, well... How should I put it... I was a bit scared of him at first. He seemed like a clever guy who's got a lot going on, which had me on edge... But now after knowing him for so many years, I know I have nothing to worry about, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_008: Hey, Doc, If you need info on something or someone, just tell me and I'll ask Mr. Lee for you. Nothing in Lungmen happens without him knowing about it.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_009: To be honest with you, I actually don't like getting into fights. I'd much rather we could all get along with each other. But I won't back down from inevitable conflicts; there are things I'll fight to protect. Things like the agency, and now, Rhodes Island as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_010: Do– Phew, almost woke the Doc up... Guess I'll take this opportunity to rest too.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_011: You must be the doctor that Mr. Lee talked about. The name's Hung, it's a pleasure to meet you. My fields of expertise are security and repairing machinery. If you ever need a bodyguard for a public appearance, or if your TV or fridge break down, just give me a holler!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_012: Woah, your operators never cease to amaze me... I've got to work harder.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_013: Thanks, Doc! I'll be giving it 110% from here on out!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_014: Doc, don't hesitate to give me all the work you need done. I might not have the brain for many things, but I've got the brawn!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_019: Stay close behind so we don't get split up.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_024: I'm here to protect you all!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_027: You're not hurting anyone on my watch!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_028: A little scratch ain't gonna stop me!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_029: *pant*... *pant*... Sorry, Doc, but could you give me a minute? I'm totally burned out.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_030: You can stay here and rest, Doc. I'll clean up the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_031: Stay beside me, Doc. There are still enemies around.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_032: Hurry, Doc, climb onto my back! I'm getting you out of here!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_036: Sup, Doc? Anything I can help you with?
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doc! ...I'm in a good mood? Haha, of course, who wouldn't be in a good mood during a pleasant time like the New Year? Anyway, I'll be counting on you this year as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_043: Doc! Birthdays are big days that shouldn't be muddled through. You've got to celebrate right! If there's anything you want me to make, just name it! ...Sitting here with you? Is that it? Um, okay... guess I'll save those groceries I bought for another time...
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_044: Doc, congrats on making it through another year. Aak's a lot more steady than he was a year ago, and now he knows the right path to take. Waai Fu? She hasn't needed me to worry about her for a long time. By the way, Doc, it looks like Rhodes Island is holding a dinner party. Anywhere you might need me?
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Hey, Doc. Have you eaten yet? You could have one of my cookies if you're hungry.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: Doc, I know Aak's been a nuisance to you, but could you be lenient with him? He teases people a lot, but he's not a bad person. Also, let me know if he ever gets under your skin, I'll give him a lesson on that.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: Just call on me when you're hungry, Doc, and I'll make you a little something to eat. I may not be a chef, but Mr. Lee taught me how to cook a few recipes.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: Say, Doc, do you give any lectures on machines here at Rhodes Island? I've got an interest in that stuff and was hoping I could learn something new.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: Hahah, just between you and me, Doc, for the longest time I thought all detectives do the same stuff as Mr. Lee. You know, like investigating crime scenes, that sort of thing.
