dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: Me and Mr. Lee, well... How should I put it... I was a bit scared of him at first. He seemed like a clever guy who's got a lot going on, which had me on edge... But now after knowing him for so many years, I know I have nothing to worry about, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: Hey, Doc, If you need info on something or someone, just tell me and I'll ask Mr. Lee for you. Nothing in Lungmen happens without him knowing about it.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: To be honest with you, I actually don't like getting into fights. I'd much rather we could all get along with each other. But I won't back down from inevitable conflicts; there are things I'll fight to protect. Things like the agency, and now, Rhodes Island as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: Do– Phew, almost woke the Doc up... Guess I'll take this opportunity to rest too.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: You must be the doctor that Mr. Lee talked about. The name's Hung, it's a pleasure to meet you. My fields of expertise are security and repairing machinery. If you ever need a bodyguard for a public appearance, or if your TV or fridge break down, just give me a holler!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: Woah, your operators never cease to amaze me... I've got to work harder.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: Thanks, Doc! I'll be giving it 110% from here on out!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: Doc, don't hesitate to give me all the work you need done. I might not have the brain for many things, but I've got the brawn!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: Stay close behind me so we don't get split up.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: You can all rest easy, knowing I'm here!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_024: I'm here to protect you all!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: You're not hurting anyone on my watch!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: A little scratch ain't gonna stop me!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: *pant*... *pant*... Sorry, Doc, but could you give me a minute? I'm totally burned out.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: You just stay here and rest, Doc. I'll clean up the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Stay beside me, Doc. There are still enemies around.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: Hurry, Doc, climb onto my back! I'm getting you out of here!
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: Are there any broken machines in here?
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Sup, Doc? Anything I can help you with?
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doc! ...I'm in a good mood? Haha, of course, who wouldn't be in a good mood during a pleasant time like the New Year? Anyway, I'll be counting on you this year as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Doc! Birthdays are big days, you can't let them slip by. You've got to celebrate right! If there's anything you want me to make, I'll make it! ...Just sit and hang with you? I don't need to cook anything? Well, jeez, then I bought those groceries for nothing...
dialogue_tracker.char_226_hmau_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: Doc, congrats on making it through another year. Aak's a lot more steady than he was a year ago, and now he knows the right path to take. Waai Fu? She hasn't needed me to worry about her for a long time. By the way, it looks like Rhodes Island is holding a dinner party. Anywhere you might need me?
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_001: Heheh, Dr. {@nickname}, What can I do for you today?
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_002: Combat missions take up most of my job, where I just havoc around with my hammer... It feels nice to get to sort files like this every once in a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_003: When I worked for RIM Billiton, I was in charge of a lot of things: mining ores, doing geological surveys with electromagnets, all kinds of stuff. Hmm... sounds like a mouthful, right? To put it simply, I smashed what blocks the way and kept digging down!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_004: Amiya has a lot on her shoulders. If only I could help share her burden a little... And perhaps yours too, Doctor. Don't hesitate to let me know if there's anything you need help with!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_005: Providing cover, trailblazing, area denial... I might not be able to literally shield my teammates like the Defender Operators, but I can still protect everyone in my own way!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_006: Did... did I manage to keep everyone safe?... *Sign of Relief* I'm so rapt... Please, Doctor, from now on, let me stay with you and Amiya!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_007: Doctor, want a cabbage veggie salad with mushroom pies? Yep, I made three servings! Yours, mine, and another for Amiya. She loves the pies I make!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_008: The running backs on the football field are unstoppable. They just keep charging forward in spite of everything, all to clear a path for their teammates. And then they just fall down and leave it to everyone else to finish the job. Isn't that sort of like what I do? It's very cool! I hope I don't have to get tackled though.
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_009: Doctor, as long as I get to stay with you and Amiya, it's enough for me. Memories belong in the past, while the future is waiting for us to color it in. Amiya and I will continue to create more memories with you in the days to come!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_010: Doctor, seems you've got some time to spare... Then let's go get groceries for tea tonight!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_011: Savage, from RIM Billiton, reporting for duty! The moment I got the message from you and Amiya, I rushed right over to see what I could do. Huh? You don't remember anything? Strewth!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_012: Ooh, I see. Uh-huh… I totally understand it now!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_013: I feel a lot better taking orders from you, Doctor. I won't let you down!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_014: Don't worry, Doctor. No matter how many enemies there are, as long as you're with me, I'll smash 'em all!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_029: Hmm, guess no mission's too difficult for us!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_032: It's too dangerous here! We have to fall back!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_033: Huh? You're really trusting me with work this detail-oriented?
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_036: All done with work for the day!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! And also to you, Amiya, my little beaut~ Here's to the year you grow tall as a tree. And Doctor, here's to... augh, well, here's to a lighter workload! No more overtime!
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I remember you used to love—oh, I bet you don't remember yourself, do you? Oh well, I'm sure you'll still love this butter and pulled-meat pie! It's the taste of a happy life. Amiya's words.
dialogue_tracker.char_230_savage_CN_044: I'm a little dazed all of a sudden, seeing everyone at Rhodes Island so happy. After all we've been through, just having you and Amiya here, safe and sound, is already more than I could ask for. I'll be with you from here on out, fighting to preserve this happiness.
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_001: I-Is there anything I can help with? Just say the word and I can do it.
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_002: Franka and Liskarm are so incredible! I really admire them. I want to become as great as they are someday. I can... I can do it! Will you help me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_003: Um, I heard word that Vanilla's here too? She was in my squad when she first joined Blacksteel. We went on missions together! She's become such a reliable Operator now... but I'm still just me...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_004: Dr. {@nickname}, do I come off as... spineless? I know I shouldn't let people walk all over me... I'm trying to change...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_005: Sometimes I feel like I'm back in Blacksteel, even after going through so much with Rhodes Island. I'm not the old me anymore, either... it's weird. Is it because I miss how it was back then? No, no. I don't miss the person I used to be, I know that for sure...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_006: Hard work doesn't mean anything without results. That's what I think at least! That's why I don't want anyone to see me training alone. Having you, though... it's really comforting when you're with me, for some reason.
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_007: I pulled a muscle training a couple days ago... but don't worry, I-I'm okay! Urk...! I won't let this get in the way of you or anyone at Rhodes Island, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_008: Freeze, hands in the air! Oh, did I scare you? I'm sorry, it's just Franka told me to be bold and assertive, and I only wanted to try it out... I'm really sorry...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_009: Everyone at Blacksteel and Rhodes Island is so amazing and talented. I know I'm nothing compared to them... but, still, just every once in a while, I really like it when I get compliments...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_010: Doctor... Doctor? Are you sleeping? I'll clean your desk up for you, then...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_011: Um, are you Dr. {@nickname}? Nice to meet you. I'm Jessica from Blacksteel Worldwide. Sorry... I'm really bad at introducing myself...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_012: This seems a lot more effective than training by myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_013: Doctor... I'm... I'm so happy you're honoring me... Just... let me cry it out for a bit, I'll be fine...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_014: Ah, Doctor, does this mean you think I'm a great Operator? Thank you so much for all your help. You were by my side all the way...!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_017: Just give your orders and I'll carry them out!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_020: I'll definitely prove myself this time!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_028: I'll show them what I can do!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_029: I'm going to climb to the top of the mountain. I won't stop halfway!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_030: I... I really did it? I managed to protect everyone by myself?
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_031: I could do better. I can't get complacent just because we won!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_032: Requesting medevac! I dragged everyone down... it's all my fault! Sorry! I'm sorry!
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_033: I wonder if the people at Rhodes Island are nice...?
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_036: I can do a little cooking...
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_038: Uh... S-Sorry, Doctor. I think I pushed myself too hard. My hands won't stop shaking... But I can hang these balloons on my own, no problem! Alright... Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Sorry… I can't make anything myself, so I had to buy you a gift… It's too expensive? It could pay for a whole month of training? B-But isn't that pretty normal for a gift?
dialogue_tracker.char_235_jesica_CN_044: Back at those Blacksteel ceremonies, when we all got to meet the really highly-decorated mercs, I would find myself wondering if I could ever match them… But since coming to Rhodes Island, I'm always thinking about how much I'd like to go on the really tough missions with the senior operators.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_001: Doc~tor~, you didn't forget anything, did you?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_002: Picking pockets to feed myself? Yeah, that was how I grew up. I didn't exactly have a choice. I woulda starved to death otherwise.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_003: If you want sturdy grappling hooks, the key thing's a good rope. Hm? Why do I like my hook so much? Well, go scale a building with your bare hands and you'll see.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_004: Fine, fine, your word's the word, Doctor. Can I go back to my room now? I've got stuff coming up. What? Still no? C'mooon, cut me some slack! Pleasie please?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_005: If it wasn't you Rhodes Island, I'd probably still be rotting in jail. Say, how'd you find me anyway? Hmm… Maybe you heard about my skill through the grapevine?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_006: There's lots of ways if you wanna survive in the slums, though more people simply die without a way at all. Never had much of a choice myself. Hope you can understand, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_007: My parents kicked me out, and I had to fend for myself on the streets. Compared to my days in the gutter, life at Rhodes Island is a massive improvement.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_008: Saw a lot of people get same disease as mine who didn't end well. I kinda gave up on myself too, until I got lucky enough to be found by you guys… Tell me straight, Doctor. You can cure me, right? You...you can't? *Sigh*, I can live with that, I guess.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_009: Before, I was always looking for the next meal. Now I can really eat my fill. Gotta hand it to you, Rhodes Island's alright in my book. Huh? You wanna hear me say 'thank you'? Nah-ah, in, your, dreams. *Gasp*, I just said it...
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_010: Ugh, this chair... ahhh….dangit... so comfy...!
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_011: The name's Rope, nice to meet ya. Oh, here's your ID card, don't forget it. Huh? Why do I have it? That's a se-cret!
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_012: Does watching this stuff actually help?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_013: C'mon, lets talk about payment. Promotions are cool, but my salary is what really matters.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_014: Fine, fine. Now that I've got my due, I guess I should give my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_018: I'm doing captain biz? I would've asked for a bonus usually, but I can let this slide since it's you.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_019: Look at the map and figure out your route before we get in there. This is experience talking.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_020: So, what kind of good stuff will our enemies be carrying today?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_021: I don't really do straight-up fights.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_022: Put me to good use, ooo-kaaay?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_024: Hmm, is this a good spot?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_028: Once I hook you, you're not getting away.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_029: A lot more excitement on that one than usual! A lot more profit too... whoo-hoo~!
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_030: It'd be a waste to leave all that good stuff here. The enemies don't need them anyway, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_031: Some of 'em got away? Just leave them be. They might turn over a new leaf, who knows.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_032: Hey! Let's just bug out now, Doctor! We must save ourselves first!
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_033: Is there an air vent in this room? Nothing, just curious.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_036: I mean, I'd like to figure out how a normal girl lives sometime... but, you know... I mean, maybe that's not really me?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_038: Piping hot food, big wide smiles, piles and piles of presents... It's the kind of scene I would only be able to steal glances at through windows. Thank you, Doctor... Aw, c'mon, I was being serious there! Anyway... happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_043: Happy birthday. Got your present here. Go ahead. Yep, it was your wallet, until the moment I took it from your pocket. No harm in giving it to you here as my present, right? Okay, okay, jokes are over, now look inside. I spent forever hand-drawing the card, y'know?
dialogue_tracker.char_236_rope_CN_044: Yeah, yeah, I know. I've been at Rhodes Island so long, I oughta get used to my new life already. I'm gonna stop crawling through the vents, and I'm really gonna cut down on stealing stuff as a prank... Doctor, do you think, that after so many field missions—I've learned to use my skills for the better?
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_001: Aaaahhh! You want me to stay by your side? I can barely keep my heart in my chest!
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_003: Don't mind me, just continue with your work.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_004: Hmm? What am I looking at? Why, you, of course!
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_005: If that's what you ask, Doctor, I will do what it takes to become stronger.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_006: Heheh... You don't need to worry about any ambushes or assassination attempts. Because I'll aaalways be here with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_007: Are you finally... a little bit interested in me now? Well, I've always been a big bit interested in you.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_008: Thanks for taking such good care of me these days. By my knighthood of Kazimierz, I hereby pledge to repay your kindness with my life—huh? You're not used to me talking this way? But I'm an honest-to-goodness knight. Surely I can improvise a speech or two.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_009: Ever since I was taken away to Kazimierz, it's rare for someone to be so kind to me. So, if you don't mind, Doctor... I, Gravel—no, I Senomy, on my honor as a knight, shall serve you always at your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_010: When I'm here with you, don't you feel your heart racing?
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_011: Mmmwah. Hm? What's wrong? Your face is beet red. That's just how I say hello. Don't think too much about it. Anyway, I'm Gravel, a knight of Kazimierz. It's a pleasure. Heheh.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_012: Are you the one who comes up with all the Rhodes Island's battle tactics, Doctor? Oh~ that's even more intriguing.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_013: You think I'm doing well, Doctor? Yaay!
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_014: This means you need me, doesn't it? Heheh.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_017: You want to go together? Hehe...
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_027: You really think you'll get away?
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_029: Of course the Doctor's tactics are flawless~
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_030: My blade hasn't even been stained red yet... hehe...
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_031: Run all you like, Let's see how far you can get.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_032: Sorry... did I... mess up again...?
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_033: Hmm, looks like there's a lot of good hiding places here in this room~
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_036: Yes. I'm right here, always and forever.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Give me your hand—mmmwah—hm? What are you so surprised for? Kissing the hands of those we've sworn to protect is how us knights of Kazimierz celebrate the New Year, you know. You've never heard of it? Sounds like you need to pay a little more attention.
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_043: How daring of you to tear open a gift package with no sender, Doctor. With that little caution, trouble's bound to come knocking sooner or later~ Actually, rather than being on my toes all day as your bodyguard, how about I just open these up for you, hm?
dialogue_tracker.char_237_gravel_CN_044: Doctor, does it ever keep you up at night... that you might never find any trace of your past again? Whenever I step out onto Rhodes Island's deck, I wonder, would walking away from here bring me any closer to my forgotten memories?... Say, Doctor, don't you know you're supposed to console me, when I bring down the mood like this?
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_002: The two seniors from the BPRS squad are here too? In that case... Could you assign me to their squards in future missions, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_003: Huff... huff... three more sets of physical training and I'll be half-done for today. Doctor... please... fetch my water bottle for me...
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_004: You want to know about my hometown? My hometown… it's a cruel wilderness. Even survival itself is a difficult feat there. Compared to that, Rhodes Island is like heaven.
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_005: I've become stronger than when I was an intern for Blacksteel.
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_007: The 22nd rule of Blacksteel: 'Anyone who loses her weapon no longer belongs here.' That's why I always bring my hellebarde with me wherever I go. The rule doesn't apply to everyday situations, you say? But... if I remember correctly... wait, let me check. 'This rule only applies to contracted Operators and new recruits under training.' What?... Ms. Franka didn't tell me about this part...
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_008: Instructor Dobermann's really got a heart of stone! Why choose me other than anyone elase to deal with all those live Originium slugs? I... I just can't!
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_009: I think I know now why Franka and Liskarm decided to stay at Rhodes Island. Compared to Blacksteel, this is a place we can call home. There's lots of fun things to do here besides the missions...
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_010: Shh, the Doctor's having a rest now. Keep your volume down, would you?
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_011: I'm Vanilla, trainee Operator from Blacksteel. Looking forward to learning from you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_012: It's time to organize my notes. I need to digest what I've just learned.
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_013: A promotion medal? For me? My-my sincerest gratitude!
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_018: Me, the leader? Are you sure about that?
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_020: I will not bring shame to Blacksteel!
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_026: This hellebarde isn't just for show!
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_027: Battles aren't always won by the most experienced!
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_031: If we worked a bit harder, we could have done better.
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_032: I... I'm still not strong enough...
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_036: Doctor, would you like to dine with me tonight?
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_038: Happy New Year! There's so much good food, plus the party tonight; this is bliss... Back home, our evening supper depended on how much we could catch that day. So we'd be out hunting before sunrise, just to celebrate the New Year. It really wore you out...
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_043: Doctor, I heard it was your birthday. I have some beast jerky from home, please, help yourself to some if you don't mind. The people back home loved it, which is what made them all so strong! Happy birthday, and I wish you another year of good health!
dialogue_tracker.char_240_wyvern_CN_044: It's been a while since I came to Rhodes Island, and I'm so grateful to everyone for helping me get settled in with life here. I don't freak out whenever an automatic door opens anymo—ah! Doctor, I think a burdenbeast-looking robot just passed by...
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_001: So... I have to just stand here and not do anything? Laaaame.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_002: These gauntlets aren't that heavy. See? Even a dainty little girl like me can carry 'em around real easy.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_003: You remember fighting by my side before? Can't say I remember fighting by yours, sorry... I just fight for what's right, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_004: Hah. That boxer, Beehunter? She's really something! I enjoyed sparring with her so much, I had to throw out some serious moves. And she's got an amazing honey collection too. Wanna visit her with me next time? You gotta learn some kung fu first, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_005: Reading a movie magazine...? Well, guess what? The 'hot kung-fu actress' mentioned in this article is ME! What? You don't believe me? Come on, look! This is me, can't you tell? C'mon, that's definitely me!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_006: Do I regret forgoing my previous life? Well, sometimes, of course. But the world ain't kind to us Infected. Lots of places I'm not allowed to go. It blows.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_007: There's a street full of food stalls in the neighboring city. And... a candy shop over there? And a theme park? Aww, Doctor, can I get a day off? I wanna check out these places!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_008: Am I satisfied with life at Rhodes Island, you ask? Hm, to be honest... It's even sweeter than what they show in the movies! I got cool opponents to practice with, top-notch food, and by working here, I'm doing something good for the world! What could be better!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_009: Doctor, look! What do you think about this script? Oh, who's gonna act in it, you wonder? You and I are gonna be the main characters! There's this scene where we leap from the roof of a thirty-story building and slide all the way down. Isn't that cool? Hey! Come back! Wait!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_010: You're catching some z's, eh? Guess I'll slack off for a bit too. Man, this couch is so fluffy!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_011: You swear you've seen my face before? Probably saw it in a movie I was in! Call me FEater, and what I do from here is your call!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_012: It's over? Come on, let's watch just a while longer. We're almost at the fun part!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_013: Oooh! A promotion! Thanks so much, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_014: This here's the perfect opportunity to show you some REAL kung fu!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_018: Huh? I'm the leader? Not sure how it'll go, but...
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_020: I'm FEater. Pleased to beat you!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_026: This is straight out of one of my movies!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_028: Who says a movie star couldn't be a real kung-fu master!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_030: It's over already? I was just starting to get warmed up.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_031: Hey, it's no biggie. Just a few scratches and bruises.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_032: Aw... I just wanna go home and sleep...
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_036: Hey, Doctor, want my autograph? I'll take a pic with you if you want, too!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! Hehe, back in the old days, theaters would screen my movies this time every year, all playing to a full house!  Still, can't live in the past forever. I gotta punch ahead, and people gotta move on forward. Let's forget all our grievances for today!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_042: Did you have breakfast yet, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! There's this saying that 'life's a movie you can't reshoot,' so when it comes to a key scene, you've gotta live life like you're on fire! Any birthday wishes, Doctor? Gimme a wish as cool as the lead of an action movie, and I'll help you make it come true!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_044: After I became an Infected, I thought for a bit that my career and my life were both over. Rhodes didn't just rein in my illness, but also gave me a fresh start. Standing up again in dire straits is exactly what the hero does, right? Doctor, Let's climb back to the top, together!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: So... I have to just stand here and not do anything? Laaaame.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: These gauntlets aren't that heavy. See? Even a dainty little girl like me can carry 'em around real easy.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: You remember fighting by my side before? Can't say I remember fighting by yours, sorry... I just fight for what's right, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: Hah. That boxer, Beehunter? She's really something! I enjoyed sparring with her so much, I had to throw out some serious moves. And she's got an amazing honey collection too. Wanna visit her with me next time? You gotta learn some kung fu first, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: Reading a movie magazine...? Well, guess what? The 'hot kung-fu actress' mentioned in this article is ME! What? You don't believe me? Come on, look! This is me, can't you tell? C'mon, that's definitely me!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: Do I regret forgoing my previous life? Well, sometimes, of course. But the world ain't kind to us Infected. Lots of places I'm not allowed to go. It blows.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: There's a street full of food stalls in the neighboring city. And... a candy shop over there? And a theme park? Aww, Doctor, can I get a day off? I wanna check out these places!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: Am I satisfied with life at Rhodes Island, you ask? Hm, to be honest... It's even sweeter than what they show in the movies! I got cool opponents to practice with, top-notch food, and by working here, I'm doing something good for the world! What could be better!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: Doctor, look! What do you think about this script? Oh, who's gonna act in it, you wonder? You and I are gonna be the main characters! There's this scene where we leap from the roof of a thirty-story building and slide all the way down. Isn't that cool? Hey! Come back! Wait!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: You're catching some z's, eh? Guess I'll slack off for a bit too. Man, this couch is so fluffy!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: You swear you've seen my face before? Probably saw it in a movie I was in! Call me FEater, and what I do from here is your call!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: It's over? Come on, let's watch just a while longer. We're almost at the fun part!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: Oooh! A promotion! Thanks so much, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: This here's the perfect opportunity to show you some REAL kung fu!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: Huh? I'm the leader? Not sure how it'll go, but...
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: I'm FEater. Pleased to beat you!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: This is straight out of one of my movies!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: Who says a movie star couldn't be a real kung-fu master!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: It's over already? I was just starting to get warmed up.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Hey, it's no biggie. Just a few scratches and bruises.
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: Aw... I just wanna go home and sleep...
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Hey, Doctor, want my autograph? I'll take a pic with you if you want, too!
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Did you have breakfast yet, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_241_panda_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! There's this saying that 'life's a movie you can't reshoot,' so when it comes to a key scene, you've gotta live life like you're on fire! Any birthday wishes, Doctor? Gimme a wish as cool as the lead of an action movie, and I'll help you make it come true!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_001: Structural design, industrial R&D, scientific research. You name it, and I can do it, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_002: The Engineering Department never approve my proposals. Do they have any bias toward me? What should I do... Oh! Actually, Doctor, would you please submit this suggestion on improvement for me? It's a deal then!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_003: There are many workshops like mine in Rhine Lab, but what takes others six weeks to finish, I can have it done in one. I'm not boasting!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_004: DO NOT interrupt me when I'm doing my research, or I'll have my Meeboos bite you! And I will bite you too!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_005: At night I'm always full of inspiration... and the… urgency to sleep! No, I can't bear it... Where's the pillow... I need to rest...
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_006: Hm? Why are these cuties called Meeboos? That's because they go 'meeee-boooo' when they boot up. So I named them after that. Fitting, don't you think? Just listen and you'll get it. You press this switch to... NONONONO, That's the self-destruct button! Ahhhhhh run！
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_007: That girl who just passed by... that was Silence, right? If only back then... Oh, sorry, the non-disclosure agreement is still in effect. I should keep my mouth shut.
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_008: I feel kinda empty when I've got nothing to do... I guess that's just how engineers are. I bet even you have to idle your time away on occasion, Doctor. Huh? You don't?
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_009: Doctor, may I request... No! Not 10 square meters! I asked for too much last time, so this time... all I need is 3! W-Wait! Don't leave yet! 1 square meter, just 1 more for my research will do! Please, Doctor, I'm begging you...
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_010: Geez... where's the coffeemaker... Oh, there it is... You want some too, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_011: Lutra Workshop of Rhine Lab, at your service. Yup, I run the workshop on my own. No assistance needed. Amazing, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_012: This structure... Interesting. I'll look into it.
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_013: This raise came just in time! I can afford to upgrade my equipment now.
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_014: I promised that you'd not be disappointed. Now look what I have! Surely kept my end of the bargain, didn't I?
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_018: Commanding both Operators and my Meeboos at the same time is a bit much even for me...
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_019: Hopefully we can get some useful experiment data!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_020: Come on, Meeboo, show them what Rhine Lab's technology can do!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_027: If anything breaks, just make another one!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_028: My Meeboos are more than just machines!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_029: Come on, Meeboo! Show everyone your victory dance!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_030: Nice! We practically rolled over them!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_031: The device is slightly damaged. I'll fix it in no time.
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_032: Oh no! My Meeboo...! I'll need to make more...
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_033: Now I want a new workshop!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_036: Doctor, let me touch your head! Inspiration can strike, you know!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! I love New Year's, there's always so much to eat when you go out, even if you miss the canteen's dinner time! I wish every day could be like that... Ouch! Alright, fine Meeboo, I'll eat on time, you're hurting me!
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_043: Your birthday present? A literal piece of cake! Here's a cake sample, complete with blueprint, recipe, and a mass-production line ready for full rollout! How's that?
dialogue_tracker.char_242_otter_CN_044: What is research for, Doctor? My former coworkers say I can be surprisingly shallow, but if I were only in it for the money or fame, there are better ways. I just want to help advance technology, even by a little bit. And here, I can do that.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_001: Doctor, where are you going? Shouldn't you be working? Lunch? Well then, I'm coming along. There's a few things I want to buy, and I can also keep a lookout for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_002: Sorry, Doctor, Rhodes Island is just a part-time job for me. I have to study hard to make sure I have a nice, normal future ahead of me. If you plan to have me aboard and on 24-hour call… Well, I'll have to ask you reconsider that.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_003: I color coded all the documents to be sent out, the backups have already been delivered, your schedule is right here. I bought your late night snack and put it in the refrigerator. Don't forget to heat it up. And last, oh, do you need me to change the light bulb in your office for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_004: Did I ever tell you about my other job? No? Well, I won't. Don't look at me like that, Doctor. There's just not much to say. If my other office worked a tenth as hard as Rhodes Island does, they'd probably have become the only detective agency in Lungmen.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_005: You wonder where I learned martial arts? Well, I have my old codger and his weird education to thank for that. Not that I resent kung fu. Martial arts should always be a part of me if I hope to uphold justice.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_006: Just like how people value morality, martial arts have yin and yang, right and wrong. To right those wrongs, to defeat evil, to counter bad kung fu, these are all second nature to me. The world is dark, and someone must stand for justice.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_007: You think you just saw me? In downtown Lungmen? That may have been me. I just finished class. Hm? You saw me beat down some thugs who were harassing a passerby? And then slipped away before the police arrived? Must have been someone else. Heh heh. Definitely. You were just seeing things, that's it.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_008: My rotten dad said he had to go find the true meaning of kung fu before he went off, and I still don't know where he is. Please! What year does he think it is? Find some common sense and learn some responsibility before you get yourself killed. But at least I haven't forgotten what he taught me: 'Martial arts have martial virtue, humans have human kindness.'
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_009: Doctor, did any mail come for me? It did? Great. These are my grades... my very important grades! It's been straight A's for me, so far. If I don't work hard enough, I'll end up regretting all the things I wasn't strong enough to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_010: Falling asleep at a time like this... Oh well, I'll just finish your work for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_011: Is this Rhodes Island? Nice to meet you. I'm Waai Fu, your new part-timer. Please don't go easy on me. I can handle anything you ask of me. Yes, just give me the word.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_012: If I can fight like this here, I can definitely knock them out.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_013: Thank you very much, Doctor. You placed your trust in me, and I won't let you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_014: I often witness injustices in my life. If I ever find myself unable to stop them, I reflect on the moment, and force myself to get stronger. So, if ever you need me, don't hesitate to say so. I'll be there, with all my strength!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_018: I have much to learn, but I won't turn down the responsibility.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_019: Fight evil with the fist of justice!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_020: Like cutting weeds and pulling roots!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_025: You have crossed the line too far!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_026: Pick on someone your own size!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_027: Don't blink! Song Do Bart Cham style!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_028: The mind directs, the fist executes!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_029: Foul intentions lead a foul life. Repent now. There is still time.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_031: That was not enough. I need to train more.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_032: Father... I'm still... not strong enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_033: At least it's better than some old, messy detective agency.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_034: An ambush...?! ...Doctor, don't you ever sneak up on me like that again. Now let's get you to Medical first.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_036: You want to go for a walk? Sure, let's get going. It's safer to have me with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_038: Doctor, happy holidays. I—I was just taking a walk. I haven't had Hung's food in forever, so the moment I slip up... It really does take a strong will to resist temptation, I still need more training... Doctor, it's not too late yet. Let's go train together!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday to you! Please, take this present. It's a wooden dummy. 'When seeking the way, the greatest fear is to have no master nor opponent,' so to us who wish to be martial artists, it's both an opponent and a master. Alright, let me teach you how to train with it!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_044: Working for Rhodes Island has been valuable practical experience for me. I've learned a great deal. But I think I need more experience still, before I can decide whether or not I should stay. Whatever the future brings, I believe you and I are fighting for justice.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Doctor, where are you going? Shouldn't you be working? Lunch? Well then, I'm coming along. There's a few things I want to buy, and I can also keep a lookout for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: Sorry, Doctor, Rhodes Island is just a part-time job for me. I have to study hard to make sure I have a nice, normal future ahead of me. If you plan to have me aboard and on 24-hour call… Well, I'll have to ask you reconsider that.

I bought your late night snack and put it in the refrigerator. Don't forget to heat it up. And last, oh, do you need me to change the light bulb in your office for you?

If my other office worked a tenth as hard as Rhodes Island does, they'd probably have become the only detective agency in Lungmen.

dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: Just like how people value morality, martial arts have yin and yang, right and wrong. To right those wrongs, to defeat evil, to counter bad kung fu, these are all second nature to me. The world is dark, and someone must stand for justice.

You were just seeing things, that's it.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: My rotten dad said he had to go find the true meaning of kung fu before he went off, and I still don't know where he is. Please! What year does he think it is? Find some common sense and learn some responsibility before you get yourself killed. But at least I haven't forgotten what he taught me: 'Martial arts have martial virtue, humans have human kindness.'

It's been straight A's for me, so far. If I don't work hard enough, I'll end up regretting all the things I wasn't strong enough to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: Falling asleep at a time like this... Oh well, I'll just finish your work for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: Is this Rhodes Island? Nice to meet you. I'm Waai Fu, your new part-timer. Please don't go easy on me. I can handle anything you ask of me. Yes, just give me the word.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: If I can fight like this here, I can definitely knock them out.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: Thank you very much, Doctor. You placed your trust in me, and I won't let you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: I often witness injustices in my life. If I ever find myself unable to stop them, I reflect on the moment, and force myself to get stronger. So, if ever you need me, don't hesitate to say so. I'll be there, with all my strength!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: I have much to learn, but I won't turn down the responsibility.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: Fight evil with the fist of justice!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: Like cutting weeds and pulling roots!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_025: You have turned your backs on society!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: Pick on someone your own size!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: Behold, the power of the Song Do Bart Cham style!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: The mind directs, the fist executes!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: Foul intentions lead a foul life. Repent now. There is still time.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: That was not enough. I need to train more.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: Father... I'm still... not strong enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: At least it's better than some old, messy detective agency.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: An ambush...?! ...Doctor, don't you ever sneak up on me like that again. Now let's get you to Medical first.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: You want to go for a walk? Sure, let's get going. It's safer to have me with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Doctor, happy holidays. I—I was just taking a walk. I haven't had Hung's food in forever, so the moment I slip up... It really does take a strong will to resist temptation, I still need more training... Doctor, it's not too late yet. Let's go train together!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday to you! Please, take this present. It's a wooden dummy. 'When seeking the way, the greatest fear is to have no master nor opponent,' so to us who wish to be martial artists, it's both an opponent and a master. Alright, let me teach you how to train with it!
dialogue_tracker.char_243_waaifu_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: Working for Rhodes Island has been valuable practical experience for me. I've learned a great deal. But I think I need more experience still, before I can decide whether or not I should stay. Whatever the future brings, I believe you and I are fighting for justice.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_001: What kind of ambience do you prefer when you're working? Of course, my music can't directly alleviate the busy state you're in, but I'd feel terrible if it couldn't make you more comfortable…  or content.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_002: This next concert is for Amiya. I really am curious... what would she see in me if I were allowed to touch her emotions? Oh, that look on your face... are you worried? Then, why not come along... and confine me to your side?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_003: 'Music is the order you dig out of chaos.' That's what my Leithanian teachers taught me, but they've all since died in silence or lunacy. If it were me... I would tell my students, 'Music is a flowing will, a language of self-expression.'
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_004: I can tell your fingers are still stiff. It seems you're not yet used to learning this way. Don't be nervous, I'll guide you... Oh? What's the matter, Fede? Are you going to greet me with a mine or an electric fence this time? If you'd like a music lesson, the Doctor and I will oblige.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_005: I'll never stop performing, even if you, Doctor, are the one who asks me. Trauma is one thing, but freedom is another. My life is the same as the others, it will simply come to an end if I stop in my tracks.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_006: No matter how powerful one's spirit may be, there is no way to vanquish the inevitability of death. If there is meaning in life, if there is really something out there that can fight against chaos and nothingness... it has to be every emotion that I'm feeling right here and now, and the melodies they'll turn into.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_007: I'm watching... the clouds. Water accumulates above and in excess before turning to rain. Mother made just as natural a choice when she decided to leave. But father still refuses to accept it, even now. What about you, Doctor? Will you also refuse to listen to the truest self... that lies within you?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_008: Working with you is actually quite dull to me. Yes, because I don't want to, and can't play your music. So I've curbed my expectations of you, for I fear that when this emotion bursts in resonance along with my strings, you will turn to a grotesque collection of variegated fragments in my arms.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_009: Let me be your personal musician. Let me... feel my way around your mind. How elaborate are your ideas, and how terrifying is your rising willpower? I will of course be captivated by your music when it blooms into its ultimate form; and at that moment, what I will perform for you... shall be myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_010: Rest well… I don't need to mix any 'illusion' into this lullaby. Your dreams... are already colorful enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_011: I should have introduced myself by playing some music for you. Unfortunately, I've been forbidden from doing so for the moment. Let's start with a codename, then. You may call me... 'Virtuosa.'
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_012: I've no interest in these means of inflicting harm. Do you mind if I wander about for a bit?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_013: You've come to understand me more and more, even without the sound of an instrument to connect us. And yet... just how am I supposed to share this joy in my heart with you?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_014: Whenever I touch the strings, the surrounding emotions all flow into me, through my fingertips, surging up into the sky and down into the ground. Did you hear it too? The cry of life in its truest form... How astonishing, how beautiful.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_017: What audience have you picked for me today?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_018: I don't often play with accompaniment, but I can try to match the others' voices.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_019: Notes fall into memory, and a melody resonates in the mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_020: What tones are your souls in?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_021: The concert may begin at any time.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_022: What would you like to hear?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_027: Liberty and sunlight all around us.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_028: Feel your own self, to your heart's content.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_029: War itself is unworthy of a performance. But I will listen to every voice on the battlefield, from hero to refugee.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_030: Over already? Your victory doesn't need to be embellished by my music. I'd much rather... perform for you a piece inspired by that cloud passing overhead.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_031: Guilt, doubt, fear... this surge of emotion rising from the battlefield will follow them, accompanying them to their graves.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_032: The performance ends, and the audience scatters. After such a conclusion, how long can the strings continue to vibrate?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_033: What a beautiful sunset. It would be even more romantic if there were music swirling around the deck.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_034: These strings are vibrating... for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_036: Hmm? Have I been lurking in this corner for a long while? There's a tune lingering in my head, and I refuse to go to sleep before I can express it.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_038: The New Year's concert is about to begin. No, I'm not a part of the performance, this is a gift the children have prepared for you. I'd much rather be on the sidelines, recording the joy blooming across your face and the children's when the music begins.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_042: Sometimes, I too prefer to avoid the crowd, far away from all the sounds, just to feel my own self... and to feel you as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_043: Is it the pain or joy of the past that you think about this time of year? Tell me, and let me transform the blotches of your mind into reality through music... as long as you allow me, of course.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_CN_044: The end is approaching us. If you too believe that the emotional bonds between people help resist despair... the symphony I scored with Rhodes Island will certainly play.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_001: Do you hear the music? It is a concerto resonating with countless individuals' emotions—we play distinctly solo, yet as a harmonious whole. What a magnificent possibility.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_002: The Tower of Revelations, the Notarial Hall, the Sunset Chapel, and finally, the chapel square—the halos over our heads are extinguished, yet the city remains illuminated as always. Please hold here, Sankta. And tell me, is Laterano not more connected to the rest of this great land, and less dissimilar?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_003: The Sarkaz are singing, and the Sankta play the accompaniment—who is this funérailles for, you ask? The nomadic monastery guides everyone it receives back to their homes, irrespective of life or death, irrespective of race or identity. Join in the chorus, and speak no more of this meaningless question.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_004: What is that vast, deep-blue expanse? The ocean, or the distant cosmos? Is it your origin, or your destination? Is it 'evolution', or the sum of all perfection and imperfection that you've carved throughout this process? You Many, is this your true voice? Life deserves a voice.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_005: I am listening... Fear and trauma persist nevertheless, but the strong will overcome them, while the weak find their own ways to fight—with no need to follow a Pope or a Lord of Fiends. In the face of 'calamity', all will play their own songs.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_006: Are these possibilities inherent within 'empathy'? It has no personality, yet is able to suppress and manipulate human emotion—why did It ultimately choose to build a mechanism as singular as 'empathy' for the Sankta...? The music... why has it fallen silent?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_007: Yulia, the Witch King, Cora, Emmanuel... The audience will forever remember the sound of this cello. Do you still recall her words when your mother first taught you to play this instrument gifted by your father? 'Arturia, Mamma wishes you the most peaceful sleep, every single night.'
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_008: While 'Calamity' and the gathered crowds are both distant, a Sankta sounds lonely strings in this deserted monastery—is this to be my end...? Arturia, would you acknowledge life's meaning, even in its fleeting nature, if you were to return to that rain-soaked cemetery?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_009: Doctor, can you believe Fede is still asleep? Now, here I am with my cello, and here you are in front of me—it would be a shame for you to miss what I've just experienced. Give me your hand—Yes, right on this string. Let's create this harmony together.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_010: How beautiful... Humans are both the afterglow, and the sky that harbors it.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_011: I'm connected... This is the Movement that does not yet exist.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_012: Not a single note shall fade.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_013: The future I envisioned has been set in stone, Doctor. It simply has not been elucidated yet, which is why I shall move towards it.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_014: In that future, we are each other's audience.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_017: If the musical movement were not inherently prescribed, why do we adhere so rigidly to its interpretation?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_018: A single cloud among countless others, dances with the wind and descends with the rain.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_019: We advance to every last corner of Terra.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_020: Won't you open? 'Tis a visitor rapping at your heart chamber door—
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_023: Behold, the symphony of countless voices.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_024: Behold, the consonance of innumerable souls.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_027: Embrace the regrets, if you have any.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_028: Feel each other, to your hearts' content.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_030: We stand side by side. No calamity or unknown shall shake us.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_031: Joy, fluke, or mourning? We accept it all, so long as it is sincere.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_033: Listen to the breeze in the corridors. This vessel has its own true voice as well. What of yourself?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_034: Doctor? You have a pretty good sense of rhythm. 'Calamity' will not strike so soon, meaning you still have time to pick up a percussion instrument.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_036: What are you trying to do? Even if I am not allowed to play, I can still make music resound within your mindscape.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! We can create a moment of shared emotion simply by circling an ordinary date on the calendar—look, people have always possessed the potential for 'empathy'. Though it is a far cry from the grandeur of the Movement, I am now fully convinced of its existence.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_042: Since music cannot supersede language, Doctor, there's still a lot for the two of us to talk about.
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_043: Doctor... did you already listen to the entire piece behind my back? Though it was but an impromptu session, it contained all the thoughts I had while waiting for you, as well as the emotions that should be expressed no other day but today. Since you didn't miss it, tell me—what did you hear from it?
dialogue_tracker.char_245_cello_sale#12_CN_044: Doctor, the possibilities that Fede and I perceive differ entirely, but the constant is that you remain here at Rhodes Island. If you are the single leitmotif that remains unchanged across countless variations... how could I bear to stray too far from you?
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_001: I'll stay with you until my next expedition, Doctor. Don't be afraid to send me out anywhere you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_002: I actually heard about you a long time ago, Doctor! Yeah, Mayer and MuMu told me all about you. I just had to come to Rhodes Island to see what you're like in person. Oh, I also got a little present for you! Here!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_003: This one? It's an Emperor strap! Who...? The Emperor of Penguin Logistics! I visited that company a whole bunch, so I've met him lots of times. He's so cute! I give him plenty of pets every time I go! You ever pet him before, Doctor? You don't dare? Why?!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_004: Is Iffy doing better these days? Last time I left Rhine Lab, she was in pretty bad shape. I've been worried about her…
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_005: Has Mayer made anything new? I haven't worked on any new equipment for a long time, so I wanna do some research with her. Oh right, Doctor, I'll let you in on a little secret. If you bother Mayer while she's working... What? She already bit you?
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_006: Unlike Meeboo, Sisyphus or Kirkika, my drones are operated differently. There is a limit to how many I can run at once, and it's just the way it goes. But I have a new system in development. I think you'll be surprised before long.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_007: The Polar North? The dreams that are buried there are cold and cruel, but... in order to make my dreams a reality, I am willing to do anything it takes.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_008: 'The tiny gardner, and the tiny flower, growing under the tile with no one to care for it...' It was Iffy's favorite storybook, maybe because it resonated with her. But, well... It seems like she doesn't remember it. Hmm… that's odd.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_009: The North... it's both mysterious and beautiful. The towering cliffs, the lonely, snow-covered trees, the glowing, prismatic Originum crystals… And the vast snowland, stretching to the ends of the earth. Doctor, you should come see it with me. We'll go together, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_010: Doctor? Stay awake Doctor! If you fall asleep, you'll freeze to death!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_011: Rhine Lab Specialist Magallan just discovered a mysterous research vessel! And you are…? Oh my goodness, you're that doctor from Rhodes Island! Uh, W-Would you like to join my expedition!? Adventuring together would be really interesting!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_013: Update complete! Now my devices respond twice as fast.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_014: Doctor, if you're curious about the results of my research, then I'll have to show you my stuff! Hehe, just so you know, I'll be showing you true power, so brace youself!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_017: Leave the exploration and support to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_019: Hold on, calibrating my equipment… Done!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_020: Preflight testing complete. Drones standing by.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_022: I bet you need my skills.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_024: All my equipment's good to go!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_025: Is the target marked? Ok, launching drone!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_029: Watch out, there's a blind spot in my scan—What, it's already over? All thanks to you, Doctor, you're reliable as ever.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_031: There's still some enemies around. Are we going after them?
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_032: They're flanking us? My bad, sorry…
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_033: Hm...? You even have heated floors?! Ahh, this is bliss.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_036: Come on, Doctor. Ice skating isn't so scary. I'm here with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! My work's kept me too busy to take any time off to spend with my parents. But I sent them a letter, and a few samples I gathered in the North, heheh. Oh, Doctor, my parents know about you too. I told them about all the friends I made at work.
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_042: Um? Anything I can help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_043: Phew! It took me a bit, but I finally made it in time! Happy birthday, Doctor! Here's a snowflake sample, it's from the furthest north anyone's ever been! I messed up a bit, but this one's the best sample I could get. It's my gift to you!
dialogue_tracker.char_248_mgllan_CN_044: I lead an incredible life, Doctor. I've got the know-how to do my scientific research, I've got parents and friends who support me, and my dreams in the North to keep me going. But I still have one, tiny little wish. If somebody ever writes a history of the North, I want my name in it.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_001: So you're saying I have the right to decide your schedule and itinerary?  Which means, whatever I write in this memo book, Doctor, you've gotta do. Wowie! Too late for regrets now, heehee.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_002: Ecology's about filling some dirt, putting some plants and animals on it, then making a profound study about the cyclic relationships between individuals, species, and biocommunities. With the help of innovative research, we can improve the ecosphere or even forge a brand-new... Well, someone clearly knows it all, because that's an unadorable look you're giving me. Alrighty, let's change topics.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_003: I want you to come with me next time I go clothes shopping. The thing is, I don't really understand fashion stuff so much, and I wanna hear your ideas. What, you don't either? Sure! If you've got opinions, and I've got opinions, then we can do swapsies. Plus, I get to see you wearing something else for once.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_004: Are your lips kind of dry there...? Yeah, they look a little chapped. You need more water on the regular. Alright, you can have my chapstick, and then we're even again once you buy me a new stick. This is the only brand I use, and it's gotta be peppermint flavor. Don't get the wrong one. Okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_005: Looking back on it, it's like Rhine was just founded yesterday. The stuff we fought over at that time is a total one-eighty compared to now. Heheh, good memories… Doctor, Do you still remember when Rhodes Island was new on its feet? No? That's fine, you'll remember with enough time.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_006: Here I am, dewdrop landed on a leaf, but we'll be baked away in the sun soon enough. Oh, don't let it end here. We could melt together, dew filling leaf's veins, and make our grand return to the land... um, that's about dew, okay? Like, it's just dew that wants to—um... Mmm...
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_007: Has Magallan been good recently? Oh, still out exploring? Hasn't said when she gets back yet? Aw, okay... I've still got the crystals she sent me last time, out in cold storage. Any interest in this stuff? Well, well, I see you have a good hobby. Come on, let's crack open your horizons.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_008: If Kristen didn't have the talent and leadership, Rhine Lab would've never been founded. But maybe it was her power that got her to bare her true self to everyone in the end. People change. I wonder what I'll become?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_009: My people have no future. We've only been able to pray for answers from the past. You're from the past, Doctor. You're the hope of my people, and me. But even if that wasn't the case, you're still the one who pulled me from the bubbles, and you're still gripping my hand. How could I ever let go now, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_010: Getting distracted on the job? Terrible habit.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_011: Muelsyse, Director of the Ecological Section at Rhine Lab. Not that I think we need any formal how-do-you-dos, Doctor. After all, we've been friends forever now.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_012: There really isn't a single fresh thing anywhere across the lands.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_013: A present from you? I'll keep it nice and safe, that's a guarantee. How about in return, let's go to the movies?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_014: Dew gets turned to vapor, and everything in it vanishes without a trace. Will I ever see showers of blessing? Will I ever meet my people again and know them anew?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_017: Sunlight's a little spicy. Just let me take five.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_018: Okay, maybe I should assign roles first?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_019: The way seems kind of rough. Careful, you don't want to trip.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_020: Annoying people, annoying business. Let's deal with them ASAP.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_026: Now's not the time for hellos.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_027: Let animosity be gone with the flow.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_028: Oh wishes, I beg you coalesce.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_029: Good work. Need to get under this umbrella?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_030: Job's done, be sure to rest up now.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_031: I told you to be careful... any ouchies?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_032: I got my mirages to lead them off. We'll go this way.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_033: Let's really decorate this place. It'll be cozy in no time, promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_036: If anything's bothering you, put it to one side for now. Here, try this out, 'Orange Storm'.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_038: Office hours on a holiday, really? Even the most hardcore researchers at Rhine wouldn't be in the lab today. If you're so sure about going through that door, then I'm gonna... *sigh* I'll go get you some coffee...
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_042: Hiya! How about a little chat before you get to work?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_043: Hm? Mm... nothing, I'm just imagining what you might've been like when you were born. Speaking of which, you decided what you're eating tonight? It's not like the canteen instantly churns out your order, so can we hurry it up?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_CN_044: If Kristen was here, she'd be far away from the crowd, out on that balcony staring up at the starry sky... Nobody understood her, just like nobody fully understands my own sorrows. You, Doctor? What kind of person are you, and what unspeakable aches live in your heart?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_001: In a landward raindrop, in a humidifier's mist, whenever you need me, I'll hear your call.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_002: All trace of Her walking our land, all the names She was praised by… Everything is gone, evaporated like morning dew... Across our clan's recollections of Her, 'Muel' is the only thing that remains. A syllable now carried on in my name.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_003: She's gone. She dispersed all Her Elves... then time carried Her far away, to a place farther still. But you know, just a hunch, I think She simply got sick of being a Feranmut. And just like some special Rhodesies we've got, now She's probably living up the human life, maybe? You think that sounds right, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_004: To get the information in this crystal, you have to 'communicate' with it. Yep, that's right, just like the kind we make when I hold your hand. Oh, actually, lemme borrow your hand a sec! How's that, can you sense Her feelings? No? Not one teeny tiny bit? Oh... Okay...
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_005: Pfahhh! Water doesn't get cleaner than this! You can take a sip too, if you're thirsty. I know, you're probably scared it's Her blood or Her tears or whatever, but don't overthink it. If you drink from this spring, it'd make Her the happiest person of us all... well, not person, Feranmut.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_006: The ever-wakeful spring wells from Her back, that its currents caress Her like silk cloth. And in sweet rains it waters the parched land, that it nourishes all life as it grows...' Your kin left that passage to Her in your recollections. It makes me think, I should draw Her. That way, others'll be able to see Her.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_007: You're right, no place suits me better than this. Problem is, I've been spoiled by modern life. If I seriously live here all on my own, the boredom is gonna shrivel me right up. Maybe the other Elves could deal, but... I can't... At the end of it all, I'm just a plain and ordinary girl.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_008: The environment's changed so quickly here without Her, and it's not in my power to do what She did. It's like a lifelong dream suddenly landed in my lap, but the caveat was it could disappear at any time. So life will always be on edge, haunted by suspense and fear. I don't wanna live such a painful life, Doctor. I'd rather take the risk.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_009: Everything of Her, everything I could ever find, I've got it all by my side. Thank you, Doctor, for accompanying me so long. Whatever comes next, we can save thinking about it until we get back. Oh... it's raining. Maybe it's time for us to leave too.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_010: Time is still mourning Her, so it won't slip away that fast. If your legs need a break, we can sit and catch a breather.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_011: The birth, the existence, the dying, the everything of my blood's origin… They are all here, nothing left but pieces now... If you're interested, I'll tell you every story of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_012: This cramped cage we jail each other in.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_013: We've known each other for so long, but you just keep giving the same gifts... Of course I love it, c'mon.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_014: Look, the sun's coming up. How warm it is... Cozying up like this, hiding away from all that the years do to catch us... May be a good life too.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_017: All the pains caused by 'right and wrong'… How I wish the water could wash them away.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_018: How do you understand them? And how do you make them... understand you?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_019: Just look away one sec, okay? I want to let the waterflow relax for a bit... the way my people did so long ago.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_020: Lives head toward their demise. What can I do… before the end…
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_023: This... is how my ancestors welcomed the rainclouds.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_024: Miss Waterdrop… where will you land?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_028: But I can't go back. Back isn't the answer.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_029: Gimme your hand, Doctor! Uh, um... I just wanted to share my feelings with you. Don't worry, I'm not gonna get you wet.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_030: The leaf trembles. The stream murmurs. I understand how they feel now much better than I used to… Oh, no, they're happy. Simply all delighted, trust me.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_031: They're gone. Bet they know the way back home, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_032: Water will take us to safety. Hold my hand tight, and keep your eyes shut.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_033: Same as it ever was, and honestly that's not bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_034: At least I can still feel your touch.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_036: An exploration journey this endless isn't easy for me, no sirree. Did you really get used to it long ago? Don't work yourself too hard. C'mon, let's you and me take a little walk.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_038: There's no trace of time in our strata of crystals, just as our people in Sami don't leave calendars in their amber. That's that— we're a race who can't see what's ahead, embracing lives so long that we can't feel epochs flowing by. Give your terminal a break for now, Doc. Don't you want today to be a one-of-a-kind day?
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_042: Oh, you all rested up...? Look after yourself, okay? No vanishing into bubbles on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_043: You can stop guessing now. It's the real me standing before you, not a flowing shape. You know I make the trip here every year, so why would this year be an exception? Alrighty, I lugged half a ton of investigation files here for Rhodes Island. So c'mon now, let's just head to the restaurant first.
dialogue_tracker.char_249_mlyss_boc#8_CN_044: Beneath time's ashes, there lies the Elves' lost knowledge and forgotten tales... but even I can't really comprehend them. Digging through the past— it weighs down on you a lot more than healing a wound, or blessing a new life. Doctor, how do you manage to confront it all?
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_001: No need to look for me. I've always been here.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_002: Those in the dark cannot show you the way, nor can they see where you point. Don't tarry here, it's time for you to leave...
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_003: Under this mask, even I do not recognize myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_004: This is Miss.Christine. I don't know where she came from, nor do I know when she will leave. If she likes you, she will approach you on her own... Yes, just as she's doing right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_005: In the past, I was not lonely. I once had several friends, and we traveled all over as a theatre troupe. But when Oripathy broke out, everything drew to a close, and everything began...
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_006: This darkness is a refuge, a throne, and Paradise above all. The spirits of the dead have never left, and I've cursed the world from atop their bones... You see me as I am now. Do you still wish to hear my song? Do you still dare... to stand before me?
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_007: This device embedded above my throat presses against my neck, but it is exactly what I need. Like a mask does, it conceals my sins and my voice. You'd like to hear my real voice? No, you can't. It isn't something you ought to bear...
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_008: My song ended all of their lives. It came, that endless night, the song that would not stop, the quivering falsetto and organ fragments that expelled from a throat—it horrified them, suffocated them, but it was so... miraculous. Doctor, tell me. What in the world is it... that I do?
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_009: I can end many lives for you, but I first need you to confirm that I am awake. Something is trying to influence me. It doesn't want me to leave the stage. It wants my song to echo forever... and it wants me to kill you. Before I play the role of your assassin once more, I must discover the truth.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_010: The shadows have never left your side, even without the night. Do be careful of your untimely somnolence, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_011: Code name, Phantom. The Phantom Behind the Curtain, Treasurer of the Night. Tell me, who are your enemies, and where do they hide?
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_012: Killing is not an end, but a means.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_013: As you wish. You are the one who sets Rhodes Island's tune, and you require neither guide nor guardian... Yes, I know all too well, you are your own master.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_014: There is no looking back after this step, no turning back. What I am about to share with you is not as wonderful as you may believe... Come, come here, and allow me to show you what lies beneath the veil of night.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_017: Is it time for me to take the stage?
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_018: I am no stranger to giving guidance.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_020: Let us raise the curtains on this play.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_022: So, let us sink into the night.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_024: Hear my voice. Hear my song.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_025: Do you see your own face in the mirror?
