dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_026: The actors are all puppets of the script.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_028: Yes, lift your voices! Sing for me! Sing for me!
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_029: Is this the victory your leadership has brought about...?
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_030: It is over. Victory is not sweet, as conflict always leaves an aftertaste.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_031: They escaped. Fortunate for them... and perhaps for me as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_032: Fall back... You've already lost your way.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_033: Hm? Behind this mirror, there seems...
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_036: The sound of these footsteps... It's you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_038: Is time's passage so worthy of celebration? Is it truly within our power to bid adieu to the past? It may be all too ironic that one like I, draped in misfortune, should wish you well... but as the New Year beckons, the shadows shall continue to keep to your back.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_042: The shadow behind you looks heavier than it was yesterday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. If this desolate throat of mine could still sing, I would gladly devote a ballad to you for the occasion. It is my regret, then, that the opportunity is no more. Ah, Miss.Christine offers us a rose—it seems she, too, wishes you well on this special day.
dialogue_tracker.char_250_phatom_CN_044: A role who deviates from the script cannot exist, nor may a shadow hide forever in the night. Rhodes Island—are you to be the stage I next take...? I only hope that this time, it is by your hands the curtains are brought down.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_001: I don't need to go outside today? Th-thank goodness... Infected people like me have no right to wear these clothes. How strange it is that I cannot wear the clothes I make with my own hands... Eh? Rhodes Island doesn't care about stuff like that? Really?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_002: Um... my outfit? O-Oh, I designed this one myself. The skirt incorporates some traditional motifs, though it can't compare to my papa's work... Still, this is my attempt at a vintage style.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_003: Good afternoon, Doctor. I'm trying to clean up my room... Sorry, my room often ends up being a mess... I used to never have to organize my room, and now that I'm starting to learn, it's actually rather fun... although I often break things in the process...
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_004: I've always had trouble adjusting after being pulled away from my old life. In the very beginning, I felt like I couldn't continue living after becoming an Infected, and I was just so scared... But I'm not like that anymore. There's so much I want to learn, and I want to do more for those just like me here at Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_005: Since I was young, my father insisted I study swordsmanship. I didn't enjoy it at the time. But after the incident, I've found holding the sword more reassuring... than holding the spinning thread.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_006: I used to be afraid to go outside. As an Infected, I felt like everything scorned me... But now I understand that one's self-esteem has nothing to do with whether or not she is Infected. After all, that is the most beautiful adornment.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_007: Doctor, um... If, if it's possible, can I make some clothes for you...? I think you'd be just right for bringing out some of my ideas. Um, I sometimes ask the other Operators in the same way...
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_008: The people who stoned me with Originium... Of course I hated them, but now... If I continued to harbor that contempt and despair, it would have driven me to do terrible things. I have no regrets about running away from home, even if it holds many warm memories of my past.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_009: I want to incorporate the many things I've learned from everyone into something we can all wear...Hehe, even with that in mind, the elements are a bit complicated. But this reflects my emotions, whether I'm brandishing my sword or flourishing my needle.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_010: I'll use this time to craft something small.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_011: H-hello, Doctor... My codename is Bibeak... Excuse me, but is there a facility with a loom and a knitting machine here?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_012: The way they fight... I've never even considered it before…
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_013: A p-promotion? Are you sure? I'm actually not very good at fighting... Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_014: All the Operators of Rhodes Island, and you, Doctor… stand at my side. I know, even with my limited lifespan, I'm still able to live as a normal woman… Or even, a life most people would never dream possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_019: Just like a textile, there is only one way to weave.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_022: Our combat uniforms are all ready!
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_023: Is wielding the sword the same as wielding the needle?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_024: I can also fight! Believe in me!
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_026: Save the talk for after the battle! There are people I must protect!
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_028: Can the thread of life also be cut?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_029: Great work, Doctor! Um, what did you think about my performance?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_030: I-it's finally over! If your uniform is damaged, I can help repair it…
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_031: Oh, someone got away... But, that's a better outcome... than the cruelty of death.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_033: Hmm... Where is the textiles room?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_036: Oh, Doctor, could you grab those textiles for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_038: At New Year's, I used to make a new item of clothing for each member of the family. We would all sit around the fireplace, to greet the New Year together. It's the most blessed memory I have... But now, while clothes are renewed year after year, the people who've left us will never return.
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_043: D-Doctor, um, happy... happy… Happy birthday! I've never seen you wear any other clothes, so I made you an outfit exactly like your current one, but with lighter and suppler material used. It... it should be more comfortable... Would you like to try it on?
dialogue_tracker.char_252_bibeak_CN_044: Time is like the thread on a loom, forming into a person's life bit by bit… These moments I've experienced at Rhodes Island have surely made me stronger. With my sword in hand, and companions at my side, I'm given the courage to withstand the bitterness.
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_001: Hi, Doctor. If you need anything, please tell me...  Um, I assume you still remember my code name...?
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_002: Doc-Doctor, hi... Um, I just checked the Medical Department's power grid, and taking some files around while I'm at it... No, nobody's forcing me! I mean, they take such good care of me, it's the least I can do for them...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_003: I decided to learn electric Arts just so my friends back in the slums could have some light, just so the nights would be a little less miserable... That pitch black, it's really scary. And the kinds of people who live in the dark, they can be scary too...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_004: These Originium generators here at Rhodes Island are amazing... You know, if we had anything like them back home, we wouldn't need to live in the dark all the time, like life without light is normal.
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_005: My mother taught me the basics of Arts. She told me I use Arts just like she did when she was younger, but I'm also as sickly as she was... If she were still alive, I'd hope she could come with me to Rhodes Island...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_006: Doctor, before I got the training from you, all I could do with my Arts was light up one little room. But now that little spark has turned into something that can help lots of people...! Thank you so much!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_007: Huh? A current anomaly in Miss Mayer's storeroom? W-why is it her again... What? Dr. Kal'tsit wants more cables for her lab? And another outage in Ifrit's room? Waahhhh... Doctor, help meee...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_008: Zzz... Wha? Doctor...? Ah! Sorry! I wasn't napping! I, um, I was... Oh, is this Medical?
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_009: Doctor, are you going out again...? Okay, I know. I'll wait here for you... Um, Doctor, please hurry back...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_010: Whoa...! Aaaugh... Static electricity. Gave me a jolt...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_011: H-Hi. My name is Greyy. I'm kind of an electrician... Erm, th-thanks for taking me on...!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_012: C-could you pause it for a minute? I-I'm taking notes…
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_013: A promotion? Okay, I'll take it to... Huh? It's, it's for me...? Really?
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_014: Hehe. Doctor, I shall light the way for you!... Um, sorry, just got too full of myself...  But I actually mean it...!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_018: I'm the Captain...? O-Okay! If that's your wish, Doctor!...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_019: Let me handle the logistical support...!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_020: Doctor, I see the enemies rallying...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_022: I should be able to do it...!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_026: I won't let you hurt my friends...!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_028: An electric shock c-can really hurt...!
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_029: Doctor, we've done a wonderful job...! Cou-Could we go home now?...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_031: Doctor, the ones who ran off... We won't see them again, will we?
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_036: Doctor, you're really tall... I-I wonder when I'll get to be that tall...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Well, er... there's a fireworks show coming up, and I was wondering if we could watch it together. Yes, I like fireworks. They're so small, yet so bright and colorful, shining over the land...
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_043: Here's my birthday present for you, Doctor... Um, I didn't have the money to buy anything nice, so I made something myself... a candle that won't be blown out. May it light a corner of your room and never go out.
dialogue_tracker.char_253_greyy_CN_044: Doctor... I've been studying electrical engineering in depth lately. It's a little tough... but I'll work hard! I want to illuminate more places for Rhodes Island, and for everyone... I, I'm sorry, I'm getting ahead of myself, aren't I?
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_001: There are no evil spirits around you, so can I go now?
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_002: Memories carry fate, and your fate has come to an abrupt end. That's why the evil spirits no longer haunt you, but I can still clearly see their traces... Doctor, don't just blow off my words... It's for your own good.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_003: If you need someone to talk to, you can always talk to Morte here. Don't worry, Morte is here to help. When you fall asleep, all your problems will be resolved.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_004: Those emotions that make people want to cry are just food for Morte, so that's why I don't really cry. Is that bad?
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_005: The true face of the curse? Do you want to see what's inside Morte? Can't... at least not for now... That'll hurt Morte as well, and yes, those who hurt Morte will writhe in pain. I'm serious.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_006: The checklist is still missing a few items: balls of yarn, used buttons, fresh apples, soil from Laterano, crushed cathode-ray tubes... Doctor, help me.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_007: Here, this apple's for you. It's just a leftover from a ritual, and I don't like letting things go to waste... Why are you thanking me? I just said it wasn't specifically for you... Hey, what, stop patting my head... Ah, whatever.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_008: Because Morte is here, I have no need for emotions. But when everyone praises me, I feel a bit weird... And Morte doesn't want to take those feelings away, and it's scary... It's totally fine? Really? In that case... I guess it's fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_009: Doctor, here you go. It's a clone of Morte, so make sure to keep it on you at all times... A curse? N-no, Doctor... If you take it, it'll be as if I'm always with you... Is that okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_010: Swing low~♪ Sweet chariot~♪ Be devoured by your dreams~♪
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_011: My new name is Shamare... and this is Morte... As for the other things... it'd be best if you don't find out. Like Morte said, it's for everyone's sake...
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_012: These things won't help with the ritual...
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_013: Stuff it with cotton, sew shut the mouth. Plug up the ears, and cover the eyes... There, a new doll is done.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_014: Morte has no need for a ritual like this, but... I... I'm really happy. We'll both do our best.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_018: If only they could be as obedient as Morte, that'd be nice.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_020: Today's fortune is... Oh, that's really bad news for you guys.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_024: Your resentment, I'll take it all.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_026: Rest at ease, and allow the land to embrace all.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_029: The evil spirits, they're all gone now.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_030: A predestined victory, just as they whispered.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_031: Someone may have escaped, but it doesn't matter. Morte has already ensnared their fate.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_033: This place... reeks of evil spirits... Not bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_036: Do you want to sew something with me? Morte's also very happy...
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_038: Doctor, I saw you leave the office. There's many people outside today... New Year's? It's so noisy, what are they all doing? Morte doesn't like holidays like these. Can you make a talisman with me? If you put an apple stem inside, it can help you avoid curses.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_043: Give me your hand. Put your finger here, and make a sign like this... Got it, Doctor? This is a curse. From now on, if you ever get bullied by anyone, you can make them hurt a lot all over. Me? Mm, I'm not going to use it a lot, I'm just teaching it to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_254_vodfox_CN_044: Fur, shiny pebbles, sweeties, spice, and most importantly, draw on a smile... Doctor, I learned a new way to make dolls. It's really cute? Uhm...
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_001: Ehehe~ Oh, Doctor, is your day going well?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_002: This is a floral tea that I made myself! Doctor, come try a cup, I promise you'll feel cozy all day!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_003: The sunlight in the greenhouse is so comfortable. Even though I'm an operator, it sometimes makes me want to slack.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_004: Use the fruits of your labor to make everyone forget about their sorrows and worries. That's probably the tenet of all gardeners, don't you think~?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_005: I much rather prefer growing things to destroying them. But as long as I think about how I can help everyone, I can muster up my courage.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_006: These bottles? Inside are all the pollen and seeds that I've been collecting. I usually wear a gas mask and gloves before handling them, or I might get poisoned.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_007: Umm, everyone seems to be a bit weary these days. But, I'm sure they'll cheer right back up when they see the flowers I've planted!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_008: Doctor, Doctor! Are you coming to the greenhouse today? It seems like everyone's been really busy the last few days... If nobody comes by the greenhouse, the blooming season's going to pass right by. Wouldn't that be a darn shame?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_009: Tending to the greenhouse is really hard. But, as long as I can make others smile with the flowers I grow, all my hard work will be worth it!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_010: Doctor? Oh, you're asleep... I hope the fragrance of these petals can drift over to your dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_011: Doctor, this is Podenco, here to say hi! If you have time, I'd love if you could come by the greenhouse!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_012: Aw, I thought this was a video about gardening techniques.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_013: Artist? N-n-no, I'm just a normal gardener.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_014: Look, Doctor! The new varieties I've been tending to for so long have finally started to bloom! Aren't they so pretty?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_017: Hm? Am I coming along as well?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_018: Ah... I only have experience in tending a greenhouse. Is there anything I can do?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_019: I see the enemy! Everyone, let's go!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_020: Everyone, make sure to take care of yourselves!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_026: Ah, I'll take care of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_027: I've seen weeds like these before.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_029: Phew, is it safe already? Good job, everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_030: Achieving a flawless victory is like cultivating a beautiful flower. Both require a lot of hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_031: Doctor, everyone is awaiting your next orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_032: Ah... I never thought things could become like this...
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_033: Shall we plant some flowers over here?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_036: Doctor! Would you like to decorate your office with some flowers?
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_038: Back home, most flowers would already have withered by now. But just thinking about how spring will be here soon... fills my heart with hope. Doctor, let's find the first flower that blooms in the greenhouse together!
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Please, try this floral tea! I made it the way Miss Lena taught me, and if you really savor it, you can taste a hint of cake flavor! Eh? You can't? Let me try... Oh... Sorry, Doctor. I... I think I forgot the honey…
dialogue_tracker.char_258_podego_CN_044: I've been all over with Rhodes Island. Does that mean I've spread flowery fragrance to just as many places? Hehe... I may still have lots of room for improvement, compared to Miss Lena, but I'll do my best to make Rhodes Island an even warmer place!
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_001: Aw, c'mon, get someone more literate for this job. I'm a soldier, all I know is following orders. Paperwork's beyond me.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_002: Life is tough enough already. Let's relax with some butter, frosting and jam.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_003: If Frostleaf wasn't still lugging that big axe around, there's no way I would've recognized her. We fought together before, probably as enemies. Anyway, I'm relieved to see her living the good life at Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_004: Watch it, Doctor, you can't go touching my weapon. I just replaced the Originium on that thing. It's dangerous when you hold it wrong... Look out! I, I'll take you to Medical...
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_005: Defensive ability is what matters to a Defender. I don't care if it's organic fiber or ceramic padding, as long as it's the state-of-the-art, just buy it!
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_006: Stories from my past? Umm… Don't have much to say. I mean, what kind of story could a bad tempered soldier have? All those merits and medals... Hmph, they're nothing in the face of the lives lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_007: The greenies we got in the reserves are pretty good. But they suck at securing amenities. Back in my day, the rookies were way smarter about hiding cookies.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_008: I talked to Logistics. From now on, they're putting 'Industrial Material' on all our snack packaging. Then, all we need is you to sign off on them for us, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_009: Doctor? Oh, sorry. I was all caught up in reminiscing. I still can't get past certain things. If my old commander was anything like you, maybe... We wouldn't have had to go through that.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_010: Psst, Psst! Want some pop rocks? I got all kinds. I know I got one you'll love.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_011: Hard as rock and lethal as lightning! That's me, Dur-nar. Nice to meet you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_012: Ah, shoot, I'm out of popcorn.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_013: A promotion? Good, good, do I get paid more too? Awesome!
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_014: The old me only knew how to charge on ahead and fight without stopping. Now, I fight for everybody. Just give your orders, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_017: Ready to deploy. Where am I needed?
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_018: I only have one request: Safety first and don't ever forget it.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_019: We're off! Remember to stay frosty and keep an eye out.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_020: I never did get used to the stench of war.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_023: I'll leave the support to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_029: Ever heard of the Medal of Glory? I feel that's tailor-made for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_030: No need to clean up the battlefield? Okay, then we're done here.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_031: The enemy still hasn't gone far. Should we chase them down?
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_032: Take it easy, Doctor. It's not your fault...
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_033: Whoa, I bet a fancy interior like this cost a bundle!
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_036: You must be drunk to want to hear me sing war songs. Okay, don't you regret it.
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_038: Happy New Year! I can finally lay my snacks out for everyone to eat with pride! Medical won't be so cruel on today of all days, right? I've been looking forward to this cake forever, *homp*—oooh, it's amazing! Doctor, move that fork quick or all you get is crumbs~
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_043: As thanks for always getting us off the hook, here's a present I brought in for you. But first, sign here. I guarantee it's all above board—signed? Great! I'll take this down to Dobermann! A permit for building a snack cupboard, signed by the Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_260_durnar_CN_044: Huh? It's not often I see you at the bar, Doctor. What's wrong, trouble at work? You're a great commander, I don't want you taking any wrong turns any time soon. Come on, I'll order you an 'Iceflame,' and we'll talk over drinks?
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_001: Doctor, here is the paperwork. Is it strange to see me on clerical errands? The truth is, compared to battle, I much prefer... writing...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_002: Doctor, look outside the window. The night is quiet... and peaceful. Up until now, every night has been filled with the red light of fire, and the stench of burning. I only feel easier... on nights like tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_003: There's been a—red-haired Vouivre girl, who never stops staring at me... Does she suspect my identity? But... she wouldn't have any evidence... Hm. I'm not going to let her find me out.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_004: Is it time for my regular medical examination? Un... Understood. But... I don't trust those other doctors. If I have to be examined, I want... you to help me with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_005: You all have a lot of questions, but I can't answer any of them. This is for your own sakes, and I encourage you ... not to overestimate yourselves.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_006: ...I am strong. I know the terrifying power I hold, though I... have no love for it. But if you desire it—then yes, I will fight...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_007: This spear... I am not able to fully use its power. Despite that, I've had it take so many lives. Guilt? ...No, I have no guilt. After all, our lives are all equally worthless
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_008: I do not mind my Oripathy... Without it, I would never have spent my days here. It will take my life? I—still do not mind it... So many other things across this land could kill just the same, why then... would you fixated on this particular one?
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_009: I am a shadow, but I do not spurn that. I am only able to stay here, incognito, because I am a shadow... However... however... if someone with the same face as me ever finds you, do not fight her! You will die. I don't... I don't want you dead...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_010: I will stand vigil for you, so... please rest at ease. Good night.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_011: You were the ones... who saved me? You want my name? ...Just 'Reed' is fine... like the reeds by a pond. A nondescript existence...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_012: Your battles are—very bitter... but, this way, many more may continue to live.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_013: Forward, soldiers of Dublinn! ...I was constantly forced to give these words, but in reality—I hated them...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_014: You have a dream that calms my soul... and I want to help you accomplish it. So long as I rouse the fires of Dublinn, they may come to light your way in the dark of night.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_017: The fires of war will char the wilderness...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_018: Just as you have exhorted me, I will no longer neglect the lives of others...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_019: And so, we go to harvest...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_020: Why do you burn as easily as stalks of wheat...?
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_022: No one else will see I am here, will they...?
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_025: The living blaze will purify your tainted souls.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_029: Endless battles, flames that never cease to smolder... This isn't what you truly desire, is it?
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_030: Should this fight be for the sake of our shared future, I will bear anything...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_031: What else can we hope to gain from the battlefield? Let's go. Hurry, let's go home...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_032: No. I won't let anyone hurt you... I swear it.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_033: Can I have a separate room? I don't mind how small it may be...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_036: Doctor... won't my body temperature burn you?
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_038: Ah, you found me. Why am I not at the party? Well, if you could... sit by my side. Truthfully, watching the smiles on others' faces during the holidays still hurts my heart. It seems—this snow won't lift any time soon...
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday to you. Ah, please wait a moment. You can't blow this candle out. Just let it burn like this for a little while... I hope that this flame—can bring you some warmth.
dialogue_tracker.char_261_sddrag_CN_044: By now, I've said all my thanks. I just hope that, when danger ultimately approaches, Rhodes Island won't be drawn in, or at the very least, it'll be in my power to protect you...
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_001: I advise you to keep at least two meters away from me, for your own good. And of course you shouldn't speak to me either... I don't want you to be the next victim of what's after me.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_002: You've read my file? Terrible, isn't it? If I'm allowed to stay by your side, the same misfortune will befall you, and that's trouble for me too.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_003: My long hair looks good? Oh… Well, thank you. Would you like to feel it? It should have a soft touch. I'm confident of that.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_004: Could that be...? The one over there, you guys call her Specter now, right? Why is she dressed as a nun? Amnesia? That's a problem… Dr. {@nickname}, you have to help her. She can't be allowed to forget her true function.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_005: You just don't know when to give up, do you? I suppose I have no choice but to defend you with all my might.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_006: Down beneath the vast blue sea, below the white waves that lap endlessly at the earth, lies all that I once held dear. I fear that one day misfortune will once again take away someone important from me. That is why I fled. I don't want anyone I care about... to suffer on my account.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_007: Good, another easy day. No giant tentacles coiling up my teammates, no fanatics lurking in the shadows with their hands coated in blood... Yes, just some straight fights on the battlefield. An easy day for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_008: According to legend, my people have fought against those calamities for aeons. Perhaps we kept them from making landfall and terrorizing you city folk as well... So, how about buying me a drink, as a thank you?
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_009: When you've finally made the long journey through the dark up to the water's surface—your eyes dazzled by the sparkling stars all over the sky, your cheek soothed by the cradling waves, your tears seep into your mouth. They have the same salty taste of your home—compared to all that, the bathtub at Rhodes Island is so tiny and puny... I'll have to show you my home someday.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_010: Dr. {@nickname}, you fell asleep…? Rest well then, and may you never see your dream eroded by sea waves.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_011: I am Skadi, a bounty hunter. Are you really hiring me? I cannot say what calamities I may bring with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_012: So this is how you fight. Rush in with a 'woosh,' knock them down with a 'pow,' and finish them with a 'thud.' Very good. I'll keep it in mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_013: So this is the promotion you Rhodes Island folks are always going on about? Not bad. Feels like I've become stronger. Just by a bit, maybe.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_014: Your thirst for my power really troubles me... But if nothing can really stop you, then brace yourself, for the infinite darkness we will stand against together.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_017: I am quite skilled at teamwork, but...
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_018: You're placing everyone's life in my hands?
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_019: It's hardly a sport when all the enemies are human.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_020: Compared to the calamities I fought against, you are barely a threat.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_025: Who knows what lurks within the kelp forest?
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_026: This sword has a terrifying past. Care to find out?
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_027: Sing me a song, my torturous nightmare.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_028: Don't blink, for you may miss the misery of your death.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_030: The words and thoughts of our enemies mean nothing to me. All I care about is how to defeat them.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_031: Feeling a little rusty? Hope you won't mind having part of your share taken away.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_032: Such simple misfortunes are only the beginning.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_033: Put me in a room by myself please.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_036: Y-You should watch your distance... I really can't guarantee your safety this close…
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_038: New Year's is a day of relief and enjoyment, isn't it? I've seen how the bounty hunters celebrate. They drink, they sing, and they don't sleep until the first light of dawn shines on their faces... What are you all going to do here? Eat a great feast, and then ignite some blossoming explosives? I see...
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_042: Never let down your guard, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_043: Birthday...? I never considered giving you any gifts before. Are cakes and candles how you convey such sentiments on the land? You must want very much to receive a gift from me, correct? In that case, here is a song. Lie by my side, and I'll sing to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_263_skadi_CN_044: I am a lurking danger to Rhodes Island. If anyone more is hurt because of me, I-I... We will bear our trials together? That's how a family should be? ...What you've just said is something very opinionated. But I don't hate it. Thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_001: It's wise to care for your safety, Doctor. But you can work without worry now, I'll keep you protected.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_002: I've met plenty who claim to practice martial arts. Most are posers who lack substance, but not Waai Fu. She's an interesting one... although her training is not yet complete. I look forward to sparring with her, once she's ready.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_003: Rhodes Island doesn't have a cellar, you say? Hmm… Now that won't do. Alcohol is indispensable. It's meant to be savored, enjoyed, and sometimes used to numb the pain. Trust me, Doctor, build a cellar. I know exactly what you'll need to stock it.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_004: I built a library back in Mansfield. Most of the books I could get my hands on were Columbian, and thus, my extensive reading eventually brought a sense of monotony. It is most pleasing that Rhodes Island has such a diverse collection of books.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_005: Schemes and ploys meant nothing in the face of absolute power... Or so I thought, until I realized that no power is truly absolute, at least not mine. Now, I never underestimate anything or anyone, no matter how insignificant they seem.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_006: I used to think that Rhodes Island was just another Mansfield, a 'free' prison. And you, just another me—a convict unchained, a king behind bars. But now I see that I was mistaken. This is not a prison, and you, Doctor, are a friend to all.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_007: Are the ones over there from Rhine Lab? Don't worry. I bear no grudge against Rhine Lab itself, and I won't harm them in anyway. Farce like that will only complicate things for you, Doctor. However, one of these days, I might need to ask them about one thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_008: Doctor, are you free later? Let me take you out for a drink. Nothing important. I merely have a few secrets that I'd like to get off my chest. You are the first new friend I've made in a long time.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_009: You are a very good friend, Doctor. If I manage to survive after sorting everything out, do come visit me at Mansfield. That's my kingdom, and what is mine there is also yours.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_010: Falling asleep so trustingly in the company of others... Is that really trust, or have you slipped up?
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_011: I owe Rhodes Island my life, and so my candor must befit the weight of my debt, Doctor. I am going after a certain department within Rhine Lab. If you don't want your relationship with them ruined, now is the time to turn me away.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_012: Battlefield experience... Indeed, that's something that I lack. Much obliged, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_013: Doctor, do not be afraid. The fury of my fist will not fall upon the undeserving.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_014: Look well, Doctor. My composure, politeness, and grace are but a mask. Peel that off, and you'll find me at my truest, bloodthirsty, violent, and destructive. See me, know me... only then be my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_017: Perfect time to get a pump.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_023: I'll remember to dial it back.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_024: I won't let them go any further.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_026: Is that all? Strike me like your lives depend on it!
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_029: True grit must be tested in adversity, but we must be careful not to punch above our weight.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_030: Good boxers never show all their tricks unless needed. Operations are the same, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_031: Violence without just cause is but mindless abuse. I've learnt to rein in my urges long ago.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_032: As long as we're still alive, we're not defeated.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_033: Pardon me, but the ceiling in Rhodes Island is a little low…
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_036: Doctor, have you read any good books recently? I have a few to recommend.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_038: New Year's hasn't meant much to me for a long, long time. You see, prisoners don't usually hope much for tomorrow, or the future. But now that I'm a part of Rhodes Island, I suppose I should try to change that. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. It shames me to admit that if I were still in Mansfield, or earlier in Columbia, I would have arranged a far grander celebration for you. Now, the best I can offer is a well-prepared drink. Would you do me the honor?
dialogue_tracker.char_264_f12yin_CN_044: What a lively day. You could say that Oripathy is like a shackle on life itself, depriving people of their freedom and their futures. Yet even in the confined space of Rhodes Island, I still see hope in the eyes of many. This has given me no small revelation on my own future.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_001: Some burdenbeasts won't drag themselves to work until they're whipped. But you're different, Doctor, you're way smarter than a beast, isn't that true?
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_002: Doctor. Just to put any little misunderstandings to rest, let me say this now. Maria might call me her aunt, but that's only because I'm higher in the family. I'm still young. I'm not much older than her. And, I'm still not married. Clear?
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_003: A spat between me and Dobermann...? Oh, don't worry, she's a top-of-the-top instructor, I know that. We've just had a bit of a… bit of a difference on how we like to train our people, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_004: There's plenty at Rhodes Island who pack personality AND strength. You could pick anyone, turn them into competition knights, and have every eye in the room on them... Well, maybe let's not stir that pot.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_005: Doctor, can I borrow you? I just want you to help me carry some things. What things, you ask? Well... Hmm... all sorts of random things I buy when the mood strikes me.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_006: My injury...? Well, I'm not setting foot in that arena ever again, and I've long since learned to get along with my right hand. So let's not worry yourself, okay? Or maybe... you're just being polite, Doctor? Tiptoeing around saying I can't fight at operator standards, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_007: My little Maria, she just runs away to the Engineering Department any time she's free. Such a headstrong girl she is, I never know what to say. Where did I go wrong that she ended up like this...? Well, whatever. Compared to forcing herself to arm up and do what she doesn't want to, life is better this way.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_008: Hm…? Oh, Hello, Doctor. No, I've just been feeling a little empty. Margaret never needs my fussing, Maria's found what she wants to do here, but... what about me...? Oh, gosh, what am I saying? Don't you worry about me, Doctor. I'm fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_009: Doctor, we don't get along half bad, but you don't just lie there and leave it all up to me, not in your wildest dreams. I hate danger plenty, but layabouts leave a bad taste in my mouth. Though, when your back's against the wall... Well, we can talk about it then!
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_010: Someone's easygoing, eh? Alright then, I'll let you nap for ten minutes.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_011: Ahh, this is Rhodes Island, is it? I'm Whislash Zofia. As a former competition knight of Kazimierz, trust me when I say I'll whip your operators into shape.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_012: I've never even heard of fighting like this before!
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_013: So this is a Rhodes Island promotion, then...? Good. I don't pay much attention to my wages, but getting paid for my effort feels nice. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_014: Hmm, thinking about it carefully, the pay here is not bad, life is good enough, and I get to see Maria and Margaret all the time. Staying here as an instructor sounds like a great choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_017: Let's see who you've got on this one.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_019: Get ready, everyone! We're moving out!
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_020: You all know your job? Alright.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_027: You won't be able to withstand the whip!
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_029: Honestly, I was going to have a word with you about taking such a dangerous mission, but since you tied things up so beautifully, I'll just let it slide…
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_030: I can tell you're a perfectionist... Well, nothing wrong with that.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_031: We won, and that's enough, no? Let's not obsess over it.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_032: Doctor, don't just stand there! Follow me!
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_036: Doctor, you've got to focus on your work.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_038: Since Margaret left Kazimierz, we haven't had a chance to spend New Year's together. So, I'll have to go all-out for today's banquet… Oh, Doctor, would you like to join the Nearl family feast? You're cordially invited.
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I got you a little gift. Sign right here. It's not a big plot, but I picked the location with care. The scenery is gorgeous. You could build a villa, or garden or something… What? Why are you looking at me like that? Is land not an appropriate birthday present for a friend?
dialogue_tracker.char_265_sophia_CN_044: I've met all sorts of fascinating little guys at Rhodes Island. The light in their eyes when they train is the same as I see in Maria's. I'm eager to see them transform into capable fighters. And until that day, I'll keep whipping them into shape. Oh, make no mistake, this is my duty, not a hobby.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_001: The files are in order. Is that all we have to do today? Good, then why don't we talk about the operation the other day, Professor?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_002: Try not to come too close when I use Arts, okay? ... You won't? Whatever suits you then.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_003: Why am I calling you 'Professor'? Because I'm actually learning quite a lot from you: where to assign personnel on the battlefield, how to command, among many other things… What more reason do we need?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_004: Here, you can have this. Some sort of candy, I think. No need to thank me. I got it from someone else anyway. Couldn't care less.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_005: Sankta using staves is a rare sight to see, you say? Those fanatics on a non-stop shooting spree must have left you with a bad impression with their 'pews' and 'bangs.' Not all Sankta use guns as their weapons. At the very least, I don't like them.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_006: Rather than sharing a single secret, we should exchange our secrets with each other. That's how you build a strong, equal relationship. So if you want to learn any of my secrets, you better come up with something just as saucy for me, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_007: There are no Infected in Laterano. Once a Sankta contracts Oripathy, he is immediately exiled. But even if you become Infected, no matter where you are, you still enjoy all kinds of privilege as a Laterano... You just don't get to set foot in your homeland again, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_008: My parents' will left me with quite a bit of trouble, and it was really a hassle to get it taken care of. If it wasn't for that uptight executor making things difficult for me, it all could've been much easier... Oh, whatever, it still went according to my plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_009: I want to capture a few people to try out some new Arts in our next operation. I can't...? Alright, fine. It's a shame, but if that's what you say, Professor, maybe some other time, then. Eh? Not this time, and not ever? Geez, don't be so uptight.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_010: Are you asleep? People who fall asleep at work get their faces drawn on, you know...? Just kidding, I know you're awake.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_011: Codename Arene, officially joining today, it seems. So you are the Doctor... I hope we'll get along, Professor {@nickname}.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_013: This doesn't seem all that different than before. Or are you going to teach me some tricks of the trade, Professor?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_014: Doctor, you aren't testing me, are you? Alright then, I'm just getting in the mood. Okay, starting right now, whatever happens is going to be our own little secret.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_018: So actual combat for my next assignment? Okay, let me think about the deployment...
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_019: As long as we achieve our goals, it doesn't matter if the process is a little rough, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_024: I can do whatever I want, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_027: Tell me. How are you feeling right now?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_028: That's not a bad scream at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_029: That went far better than I expected. I shouldn't have thought so little of you, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_030: That was just as expected. No surprises, even a little boring.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_031: A few slipped past. Should I go after them? Strategically speaking, I don't recommend it.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_032: This is quite the bad situation... You know what the appropriate course of action is now, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_033: Isn't there a closer room to the Professor's?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_036: We have some time to spare. Why don't we review our last mission, Professor?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_038: Professor, I've learned a new trick. You can come closer this time. It's not dangerous. Put this piece of metal on your hand, then just very lightly... Look, it turned into a small firework. How about that? It's just as good as the noisy ones outside, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_042: You look tired. It's okay if you sleep a little longer, Professor.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_043: Happy birthday, Prof. {@nickname}. As you can see, I'm not too fond of overly complicated ceremonies. I hope you're not so into loud parties, either, since I'm planning to celebrate in more meaningful ways with you. Right, I mean just the two of us.
dialogue_tracker.char_271_spikes_CN_044: Professor, when you steer Rhodes Island, what do you weigh and consider? Enemies, friends, what we need to do, what we mustn't do... There has to be a line that we cannot cross so that we don't lose ourselves. Am I right? I see...
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_001: Need me to make you some midnight snacks, Boss?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_002: Here you go, Boss. And this. You mentioned it before... Everyone says I have a good memory, but I don't know.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_003: When I'm off… I practice cooking. Not just seafood. What do you like to eat, Boss?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_004: Errr… Boss, is it usually on me to find something to talk about?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_005: Boss, if you ever want to see a Lungmen night market, I can take you. It's fun... but not exactly safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_006: Boss Lady Kal'tsit gave me special permission to use Rhodes Island's supply channels. Now I can try some new stuff. Any requests, Boss?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_007: I had Officer Hoshiguma on me for a while, for a couple of reasons... But I know she was just looking out for me, same as the neighborhood aunties and uncles.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_008: I've been told that with my looks, my good memory and knife skills, I was born to be a villain. I don't like that, and I've struggled to find a proper way to change myself. But after coming to Rhodes Island, I realized I should just live my own life.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_009: Boss, do you think there's any way to put my memory to good use...? I never thought about it before, but it would be nice if I could help.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_010: Bo... Oh, you're asleep. I'll just keep reading then.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_011: Hey, Boss. I'm Jaye. Officer Hoshiguma said I'd be better off working here, so here I am. I know seafood, I can cook, and I'm pretty good with a knife. I think I can help.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_012: Oh... so cooking and warfare are pretty alike…
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_013: Boss, does this mean I can expand my stall a bit more?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_014: Boss, I figured it out. If you just treat the enemy like fish, then fighting is a lot easier.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_018: I know how to lead a fishing crew.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_029: Boss, did we just do something special?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_030: Boss, is it... is it over?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_031: Boss, should we go after them?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_032: Boss, I think we should probably run.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_033: I don't know if there's a suitable place to set up my stall…
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_036: Boss, I wonder if you have any food preferences...?
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_038: I used to always have to close up the stall late, but now all of a sudden it's a holiday. Can't say I'm used to it... Boss, you want some late-night chow? I'm a little hungry myself. I can cook something for us both.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_042: Hey Boss, you're looking good today.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_043: It's your birthday today, Boss. Big day. I always remember it, but I'm no good at presents... How about I make you something to eat? Whatever you want, I'll whip it up.
dialogue_tracker.char_272_strong_CN_044: When Officer Hoshiguma said I should come to Rhodes Island, I was ready to work my hands to the bone. Then I realized, I may not get paid as much as I thought I would, but the work's also easier than I thought, so I guess it balances out... I'll keep doing my best, Boss.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_001: I drew up the work schedule for you. Please kindly follow.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_002: How to make a celestial globe is a secret, but as we know, anything can be on the table for a fair price. I'd be happy to reveal my trick of the trade as long as your price is right.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_003: Observing the stars everyday makes my neck sore. Wonder if the medics would have any suggestions for that... What, Miss. Warfarin is the physician on duty today? Um... I'll check again another day.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_004: Astrology is learning about the present and the future from celestial alignments. It's not quite divination, but with the same result. So, would you like to give it a try, Doctor? It's free of charge!
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_005: 'Similar genes, among blood relatives, causes, uh, reverberations of Originium...' I can barely understand a word in this work of an occultist. Doctor, Can you interpret the medical report for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_006: Ever since my Oripathic infection, the stars have diminished their responses to me. I must find a way to reverse it before I lose all my power. Otherwise I'l… Could you help me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_007: You want to know more about the organization I'm with? Sorry, I took an oath not to divulge anything, and it's not for public knowledge, anyway. If you're curious, just think of it as a completely neutral community.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_008: Sometimes, I envy Astgenne...  Ah, guess I should call her Elena now. She has everything I'm missing... But like you said, Doctor, we relied on each other because we complement each other, that's why we're sisters.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_009: As the nights bid us farewell, so do the starlights fade and quell. If this is the end that awaits us ahead, I should be picking up something more meaningful to do. Such as? Umm... Doctor, do you mind me waking you up every morning?
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_010: The tea's ready, Doctor. Time for a little break.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_011: Astesia, astrologer, reporting for guard duty. I'm yours to command, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_013: A promotion medal? How exquisite. I'll treasure it well.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_014: Stars shine bright, bearing witness of our past nights.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_018: Let me be the guiding star for all.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_020: The stars will light our way.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_023: Don't panic, Astesia. Do it like you usually do.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_026: Lend me your wings, avians among the stars!
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_027: The serpent has brought about your end.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_028: The light of stars shall be my blade!
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_029: So this is 'our' power, a power even the stars failed to foresee...
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_030: Fantastic results, Doctor. But don't overwork yourself, be sure to rest up well.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_031: If I put in more effort, maybe the outcome could be better…
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_032: I'm dead on my feet... but it's not time to quit yet
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_033: Let me see... Yes, the layout's good. The furniture won't attract any unwanted spirits this way.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_036: W-What's that... something on my face?
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_038: A year's outset, and the start of another cycle. Before the stars fade in their response, would you like to try making a wish to them through me?  Today is the day wishes most easily come true, you know. Come, take a look at my celestial globe...
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. Your present is in the box before you. Whatever delights you will surely delight me too. Now, close your eyes, say the name of something you like, and then open it.
dialogue_tracker.char_274_astesi_CN_044: I appreciate Rhodes Island for being there for me and my sister. The pain Oripathy exacts on my body, is far from surpassing the doubt I have in my own life of study... but the Medical Department is still helping me to find out why I'm losing my power. So there's still hope for everything, isn't there?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_001: I'll gladly offer my help if you need it. Just remember to return the favor someday.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_002: Vina... Err, I mean, Miss Siege—always gives me this feeling I can't describe. I wonder why...?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_003: My dad? Oh my, you know I ran away from home and you're still going to ask me that? Doctor, are you perhaps not the best at conversation?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_004: Dr. {@nickname}! Do have a try of my cooking... You taste medicine? Oh, gosh... Well, I do have some knowledge in herbs, but you know I wouldn't be experimenting on you, would I? Eheheh...
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_005: I used to think my parents were so stuffy and numb to it all, so I ran away from home to find a new life. But after having traveled so far and been through so much, I've come to realize why my parents felt how they did now. Ahahah, c'est la vie, as the saying goes.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_006: Dr. {@nickname}, see that lone cloud over there, off from the rest? That's the way my hometown lies.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_007: Faith' is an interesting topic. I never had the chance to go to Laterano, but how funny I should hear all about its feats on Rhodes Island? Although I've mostly heard about, er... one very overly active girl. Has Laterano always been such a lively place?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_008: The boats of Toron need a lighthouse to make their way back to port, and Rhodes Island has served as the safe haven at the end of my trip. Dr. {@nickname}, your light might not illuminate the whole harbor, but go on... Do what I couldn't. It's my honest request.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_009: Right here, right now, is where I, Grace Arizona, place my faith. Dr. {@nickname}, you hold my hopes in your hands, forever more.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_010: ...That's the face of someone lost in their dreams. I wonder if you're feeling uneasy, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_011: Breeze, a traveling scholar from Toron County. It is a pleasure to meet you, Doctor. Phew, I've had enough of formal etiquette, so this will be the last of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_012: ...Stunning medical skills. There's Rhodes Island for you...
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_013: I bestow my heartfelt blessings on you for your gift, Doctor. Hmm? What a shoddy reaction—this is a hand-kiss, you know, we're being serious here. Hurry up, come on!
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_014: Well, this time won't be as mannerful as the last, not that I'd think you were hoping for that? So here goes. I will dedicate everything to Rhodes Island, a pledge that transcends my consciousness.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_017: Leave the medical work to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_018: Thank you for your trust. I will make sure to prioritize the safety of the Operators.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_020: Those who seek to inflict harm on others have no right to ask for forgiveness.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_024: Make sure to look after yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_030: Every victory creates a kindling that will flourish into an everlasting fire.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_031: Keep your senses alert. The wind is still restless.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_032: Why are they so fixated on hurting others...?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_033: What a... unique place this is.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_036: Doctor, would you like to hear the story of my hometown?
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Seems a whole year's flown by. How long does that make it since I left home, then... wait, don't give me that look, or the head-patting! I'm not homesick!
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Here's three slices of Victorian cake. One of—excuse me, what's the rush? I didn't even finish yet. Lucky you to pick the spicy one. Come on, wash that down with a spot of tea.
dialogue_tracker.char_275_breeze_CN_044: I wonder from time to time what my parents would think of me now, working at Rhodes Island. Would they be proud of me? Or maybe they still wouldn't forgive me... Either way, saving more lives is an ideal I'll never be swayed from.
dialogue_tracker.char_277_sqrrel_CN_006: Um, Chief, I'mverynervous… Actually, I'mnotgoodatexpressingmyself… Thankyou, foryourconcern.
dialogue_tracker.char_277_sqrrel_CN_008: Chief, canyoupleasehelpchangethislightbulb... I... can'treachit... Oh, it'sworkingnow. Thankyou.
dialogue_tracker.char_277_sqrrel_CN_009: Chief... Theythey'rebarbecuinginthedormagain. Canyoupleasestopthemforme! Aaaah! SomeoneswappedmyfireextinguisherwithIfrit'sflamethrower! Areyouokay, Chief?
dialogue_tracker.char_277_sqrrel_CN_038: Happy New Year Chief, I hope you'll continue to cooperate with my work over the following year! Hold on, I think I smell fireworks I don't know if I inspected that batch or noooooOoOoOo! No lighting fires, no setting off—
dialogue_tracker.char_277_sqrrel_CN_043: Chief, this is a... a Pinenut egg waffle that I made myself. I, I, I hope you have a happy birthday! Uwbwlhbh please stop pinching my cheeks!
dialogue_tracker.char_277_sqrrel_CN_044: Reporting in Chief, all meat roasting for tonight's dinner party that was to be done over a charcoal flame has now had induction stovetops substituted, celebrations can begin at any time! In future I'll be even surer to make every operator aware of how terrifying a fire can be!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_001: I'll make the arrangements. Just leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_002: Doctor, I certainly hope my teammates won't cause any trouble while I'm here working for you... Aagh, the more I think of it the worse this headache gets...
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_003: An ordinary job, a peaceful life. That's all I ever wanted.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_004: Yeah, it's not that I don't get along with the other A6 members... I just get a little headache whenever I see them...
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_005: My group members just bump into new troubles every day. There is the anti-social one, the never listening one, the awfully stubborn one… Just when will they ever settle down and work?...
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_007: I don't know how I ended up on this team either. All I wanted was an ordinary life. Why did I end up in charge of these... problem children?! Wait a minute, Midnight is a grown man!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_008: Popukar... gotta pat her on the head. Catapult... gotta tie her up. Spot... never make him mad. As for Midnight, just knock him out. There, Doctor, now you know the proper protocol for dealing with Team A6.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_009: I made a cake for my teammates. Wanna take a slice, Doctor? Everyone in A6 just love fruitcakes. They really are a bunch of kids, aren't they?
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_010: Not much time left. Done with your work for the day, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_011: Captain of Reserve Op Team A6, Orchid, reporting in. Are you the Dr. {@nickname}? I look forward to working with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_012: I learned a lot from this video. I'll keep it in mind for sure.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_013: Thank you so much. I'll work hard to improve my skills from now on and strive for better results for you!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_017: I'll complete my mission to the best of my ability.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_018: Please follow the tactical combat manual closely, everyone. Thank you for your cooperation.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_019: The battle has begun! Be careful, everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_020: Please make sure you follow every detail on the plan. Alright, everyone, now spread out!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_028: Oh come on, I already have enough work to deal with!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_029: Well done, Doctor! Impeccable leadership even against such a tough opponent.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_030: A perfect job! Looks like we can have a good rest today.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_031: We need to work harder next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_032: Is everyone okay? Let's get out of here!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_036: Huh?! Overtime again?! Ugh, I knew it...
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_038: Popukar, listen, I want you to sit still on the couch... Catapult, what are you doing—they just hung the streamers from that window! Midnight, for heaven's sakes, get down from the fireworks pile! Ugh, all of you! Stop messing around, NOW! Or nobody's getting a New Year's present! NOBODY!
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_042: Greetings, Doctor. Let's start today's work just as planned.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_043: Present time. I picked out a color-changing lipstick, one that goes from transparent to light pink. Even if you aren't in any makeup, it'll give you some complexion. I wasn't sure what kind you'd like, so I went the one I use, a fruit flavor. How about you give it a try...? No, no, Doctor, no licking once it's on.
dialogue_tracker.char_278_orchid_CN_044: I've been so busy with work, I wouldn't even have noticed another year vanish in a blink. Forget anything else, I have far more patience than I used to, honestly. Have they grown up? No, they're still the same loud brats as ever. But at least they're doing much better now. Look at this—they made me tea after hearing I had overtime.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_001: Fragmentation mines deployed. None may interfere with your work or rest, Doctor. You can focus on your duty.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_002: I am well aware that Rhodes Island has its own specialists in countering infiltration, sabotage and assassination. I know not who is behind these, but they are operating covertly in every corner of this landship. My mind is just playing tricks on me? Negative, Doctor. My mind does not play tricks.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_003: I serve the Laterano Notarial Hall, so I rarely live in Laterano. But even if a Laterano citizen lives in other city-states, most of their rights and privileges still depend on the support of the Hall. In my case, for example, my work has less to do with the living, but more with those at death's door.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_004: The control system is denying you access? Please allow me to check it. Mm, it appears to be a front-end crash caused by inputting an erroneous command. It has nothing to do with the framework and can be easily solved. Doctor, please feel free to ask me if you have any similar issues in the future. I understand machines better than I do people.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_005: There are many Sankta at Rhodes Island who also use a gun. They will not fire at one other in the face of the law, but I am different. If necessary, I will not hesitate to fire upon my fraters. Of course, there is hardly a need for that, because my fists are sufficient to deal with most of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_006: Do not worry about the Notarial Hall. They are all reasonable people, and the agreement I signed with Rhodes Island is also in line with their protocols, so they won't make things difficult for you. As a matter of fact, Doctor, I think you are well suited for notarial work yourself. They always welcome foreign employees.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_007: I have a distant relative who had great musical talent ever since she was a child. Contrary to what others expected, her gift led her onto a tumultuous path. Fortunately, she seems to hate me very much, because I cannot see the illusion she creates, nor understand what emotion means to people.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_008: Private disputes are more frequent than public conflicts, as chaos is the norm over order. I have seen much more people who fired upon me at first glance than those who opened their doors to welcome me. But it matters not, for I can complete any commission, whether it is to kill a living person on behalf of the dead, or to create a dead person on  behalf of the living.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_009: Being treated as an aberration is normal to me, because I cannot understand other people, nor do I have any desire to deal with them. On the contrary, talking to you is quite interesting to me, Doctor. Neither you nor the Notarial Hall has denied me because of the way I live. You make me feel at ease. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_010: Rest is necessary, Doctor. Take your time and rest well.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_011: Well met, Doctor of Rhodes Island. I am a Laterano citizen who signed a clean-up agreement with your company. Here is my certificate. You require to know my name? You may call me Executor, if you insist.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_012: There is value in referencing these battles.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_013: Thank you. I have already prepared all the ammunition I need for the next battle. If the situation worsens, please allow me to use heavier firepower. Promotion? I have already thanked you for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_014: Another promotion? I understand, there must be an infiltration operation that requires me at the heart of the enemy. If that's your wish, then I have no objections. You have no such a need? You are just promoting me? Why's that?
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_017: The law won't enforce itself. It needs executors.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_018: I am not good at working with others.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_024: Only the law is the truth.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_025: My bullets always find their targets.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_026: I carry out the wills of the dead and the living.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_028: All is permitted when called by necessity.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_029: Mission completed. All contracts successfully fulfilled.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_031: Mission completed. Defects in the result.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_033: Do not worry about me. I have no need for stable residence.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_036: How can I help you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_038: Doctor, a pile of fireworks is amassed on the deck. There would be severe consequences if someone decides to use them for vadalism. For your safety, I will return to inspect— No? Roger that, I respect your decision. Just for the record, such tactics as raised may be applicable in our next operation.
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Like others, I have prepared a gift for you. However, given I do not grasp the associated connotations, I am unsure whether my imitation of this formality may displease you. I may need to rephrase as follows. Would I be allowed to do something that makes you happy today?
dialogue_tracker.char_279_excu_CN_044: I execute every assignment from Rhodes Island stringently, as I do with instructions from the Notarial Hall. However, when contrasted, your assignments better reflect my efficiency. No, I have no intent of comparing partner organizations. I simply mean to say that you are a truly outstanding commander.
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_001: Ummm... Nice to see you again, Doctor. It makes me happy... hehe...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_002: Doctor, do you need a break? I made you some tea, and Miss Orchid made cookies. Here, hope you like them… And, umm... Cheer up!
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_003: Why is everyone in Team A6 always fighting with each other...? If things keep going like this, we can't be a team anymore... Fighting is bad. I must make them understand!
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_004: The gear on my chainsaw is kinda loose, the one that makes the 'vrrrr' sound ... But I don't remember using it lately. Weird...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_005: Doctor, is Team A6 getting along well...? That's really some good news. Peace is the best... As long as they don't fight, nothing will bother me while I stay with you…
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_007: I don't know why, but I sometimes get these gaps in my memory. Then when I ask my teammates in A6, they just smile and tell me nothing happened at all...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_008: Um, Doc-Doctor, did I just pass out...? Um, why is everyone lying on the floor? Miss Catapult? Mr. Midnight? Mr. Spot? Why do you all have bruises on your face? And Miss Orchid too...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_009: I'm actually super strong? You say I lost control over my power, when I wanted to stop my friends from fighting each other? That's why I don't remember anything...? Okay, I think I get it! Umm... right, I will put my power to good use!
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_010: Aaaah! The cup! I didn't control my grip... Errmm... I'm in trouble when the Doctor wakes up...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_011: Popukar from Operation Reserve Team A6, reporting in. Um, my teammates in A6 are always arguing. I'm sure you worry about them, Doctor... But I know what to do...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_012: Umm, Doctor, is the girl in the video... me?
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_013: I'm so happy I don't even know what to say...! Thank you, Doctor...! Thank you so much!
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_017: My name is Popukar... Nice to meet you...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_018: B-But... I really don't know anything about tactics or strategies or anything…
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_019: Miss Catapult, um, it's time to deploy!
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_020: Miss Orchid, don't worry... I'll be fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_023: I want to stop this fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_029: Mr. Midnight, come back here... Miss Orchid is staring at you…
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_030: Can everyone have a good peaceful talk, now...?
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_031: Doctor… Doctor…? Here, I made some tea. You must be tired.
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_032: **A painful groan** I'm… injured…? It hurts…
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_033: Please don't leave me here alone...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. I made some soft and chewy New Year's cakes at the cafeteria... They say my cakes are great. I'm strong, so I always pound the dough well! Hehe...
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_042: Doctor, are you getting along with everyone today...?
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I never really celebrated birthdays before, but now that I'm at Rhodes Island, Orchid always lets me have extra snacks on them... Do you want any? I'll sneak some out for you. Others won't notice!
dialogue_tracker.char_281_popka_CN_044: Will we all stay together if I'm a good kid, if I'm a little smarter? I want A6 to stay together like a family... Will you help me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_001: We got a lot to do today, Doctor. So how about we play some games first? Isn't getting nice and relaxed the best way to prepare for a hard day of work?
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_002: Aw, I feel so lazy today for some reason! Maybe because Midnight isn't around? I love watching him chat up girls with that flashy smile of his. It's especially fun when the girls turn him down! Totally makes my day.
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_003: Doctor, you know who's the most reliable in our group? Oh, you can't guess? It's Spot! He might be quiet, but he's very reliable. So why don't we get him here to offer a hand? After all there's so much work for only two of us, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_004: Aw... Ms. Orchid yelled at me again today. She's such a nag! Must be work getting into her head and stressing her out. She should learn from me—I have the perfect balance between working hard and playing hard!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_005: Hey, where's Dobermann? She's out on business today? Yay, finally! I can slack off all day now, wonderful! I'm gonna go get some snacks first. Doctor, you want some chips or popcorn? I'll grab a bag for you!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_007: Uh, Popukar, sweetie, please listen to me, I'll do anything you say, okay? J-just put down the chainsaw! Oh no, she's out of control! This is the worst! Doctor, run! Run! We gotta jump out the window! Yeah, the window! Follow me!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_008: The town I came from... the mayor was a tyrant, a fat cat with no heart, no sympathy. Drove the townspeople nuts. I hated him too, so I blasted open his vault and handed out all the money I found to the townies. Now that was a good time!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_009: I don't care what anybody thinks of me—it's more important that I just enjoy every day doing what I like. My life belongs to me, so I alone decide what I do. Isn't that right?
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_010: Doctor's asleep? Well, can't interrupt a beauty nap. Guess I'll go out and have some fun.
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_011: Reserve OP Team A6, Catapult, reporting in! Hey, I can tell you're hella different from that stuffy old bit—I mean, that esteemed, honorable instructor Ms. Dobermann. Right? Like it's obvious!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_013: Hehe, I finally finished basic training. Wait, what? Dobermann will keep overseeing the newbies, even AFTER their promotions? You gotta be kidding me! No—
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_017: It's not time to head out yet, right? Let me hang out for a bit longer...
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_018: I'm the captain? Haha~I've been waiting forever to hear those words!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_019: Aw man, where did I leave my ammunition belt?
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_020: Ugh, I hate fighting. But what else can I do?
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_025: Watch how I get them with one shot!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_029: What an awesome formation! You got some great tactics, Doctor. And it all went down perfect!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_030: I love commanders that lead us to victory! Just like you, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_031: Relax, I set a whole bunch of traps right where the enemy's gonna be running. What? They didn't step in any of them? No way!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_032: Oh shoot! Hurry up, Doctor. We gotta move!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_033: Psst, care to take a peek and tell me if Dobermann's in there?
