dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_034: You can't catch me! ...Oh, you can.
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_038: Doctor! Quick! Stop what you're doing! We don't get to take time off for new year's everyday, and you're just commiting a crime letting your works trouble you. Get out of your room, and let's have some fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I guess getting old isn't something you should feel optimistic about, but it's still worth commemorating the day a new life was born. Gimme a minute, let's celebrate with something from my secret snack cache.
dialogue_tracker.char_282_catap_CN_044: I don't like working, but Rhodes Island isn't so bad. Instead of evil landlords, you have comrades you can trust to have your back, and that's enough for me. Say, if today's special, does that mean I get the day off?
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_001: Thank you for choosing me, Darling. Now, what kind of secret are you going to share with me under this velvet of the night?
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_002: Fiend of the Night? Ah, I can't hide anything from you. But past glory is nothing to me. After all, I have an even brighter future waiting.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_003: I may work in a different place now, but my job is still the same—to put a smile on everyone's face.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_004: I bet Ms. Orchid must have been born with a negative number on her happiness scale. Why else would she always look so stern whenever I'm there to light her up? If you know anything about her, please tell me.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_005: People say my swordsmanship is top notch. All due credit, I have to say. Practicing swordsmanship helps me maintain my figure and cultivate my elegance. It'd be a crime for me to slack off on the pratice. After all, you either keep the momentum and hold the lead or end up getting overwhelmed. Please keep that in mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_007: People used to say that I sold feelings as commodities, that I treated 'happiness' as a product. Fools, all of them. How can I expect my customers to open their hearts to me if I don't open mine to them first?
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_008: I believe happiness can be contagious. It's a tangible atmosphere that truly exists. I feel the joy when others treat me with sincerity, and I will make sure my happiness reaches right into their hearts.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_009: My colleagues in team A6... they may be a bit weird, but they're truly kind souls. They're a gift from destiny, a gift that continues to remind me to cherish those important to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_010: Now that I have some free time, I should read.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_011: Show me your brightest smile, my esteemed customer! Happiness is at arm's reach when you're by my side. Midnight, at your service.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_012: It's important to never stop learning!
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_013: Whoa, so my hard work really paid off! Let's set up a champagne tower to celebrate. My treat.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_017: With me on your side, success is guaranteed!
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_020: Behold, here comes my flamboyant moves!
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_025: O sword, pierce the moonlight that veils the night!
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_029: Impressive, Dr. {@nickname}, truly impressive. Your blazing brilliance almost stole my show today.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_030: There's only one thing that's impossible for me: being imperfect.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_031: Not too shabby. Such a heart-warming result calls for a little celebration.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_032: No need to look back. We'll greet each other with a smile next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_033: A wonderful place. Let's have a drinking party tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_034: There now, would you please leave my collar as it is?
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_036: Thanks for taking care of me.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_038: Sometimes, it doesn't take flowery tricks to capture a customer's heart. See the fireworks here? The sight of them going off, even just for an instant, will be enough to focus all the customers' attention solely on me, their souls scorched by my gaze... Orchid? Why are you dragging me away?
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_043: Happy birthday. You should set your work aside for today. We can chat until dawn, and I'll stick by your side if you want to watch the sun rise. But {@nickname}, I trust that you know what to say if Orchid asks why I didn't work overtime tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_283_midn_CN_044: What you see today is the fruit of all your hard work, {@nickname}. Nothing makes me happier than accompanying someone in admiring their own marvelous achievements. I do hope you'll still choose me to stay by your side this time next year.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_001: Work's kinda like a trap, and you just fling yourself into it.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_002: I don't talk much 'cause I don't want to. Not 'cause I'm looking down on anyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_003: What did Midnight do this time? Did he finally end up in Medical after hitting on one too many ladies in the hallway? No? Too bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_004: Got something, Doctor? I could probably lend a hand. But I'd rather not eat up too much of my time. I got a lot of comics to read.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_005: I know I speak a little too bluntly sometimes, but I always get my work done. It's not like I got professional pride or anything, I just can't respect somebody who doesn't finish his work.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_007: Rhodes Island is a strange place. The people here just say whatever they're thinking, and somebody's always there to help when someone needs it.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_008: Reserve Op Team A6 is a real diverse crowd. We have Lady Stinky-face, Miss Lacking-self-confrol, Narcissist Kun, and a little walking time bomb. But still, I do think I can trust them. They work hard, even if they don't show it.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_009: I used to live free and easy like everyone else at Rhodes Island, but my family thought I was a freak. This place may be a freakshow, but at least everyone's happy, and that's pretty good.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_010: Can I go back to my room now?
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_011: Hi, I'm Spot from Operation Reserve Team A6. My job is to protect the other troublemakers on my team, I guess.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_012: I've seen this battle before. Bad guys got their asses kicked.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_013: I'm gonna work twice as hard. I'll bump it up from a 0.1 to a 0.2, I think.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_017: I won't ask about the meaning of this mission then.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_018: I wanna get back to my dorm.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_020: Save us a lot of time if you just surrender.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_026: Don't see any harm in this.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_028: Holding this shield is tiring, pal.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_029: Been through an easy battle, you say? Then better do it all over again.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_030: With hard work, even an idiot can get the job done.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_031: Perfection is for suckers, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_036: If you keep petting me like that, my hair's gonna get tangled.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_038: It's the start of a new year. If you were expecting anything to change on its own with time, then stop dreaming. Really changing yourself takes way more effort than that. If you can manage it, do it.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_043: Happy birthday. I don't have anything decent, but you can have this old set of limited-edition comics. I always dreamed of becoming a hero when I was little, but I learned the hard way that it takes all my effort just to stay alive. Don't worry, the comics are still good.
dialogue_tracker.char_284_spot_CN_044: Someone like me can't exactly say I fully embrace Rhodes Island's ideals from the bottom of my heart. I only raise my shield to protect the troublemakers of A6, that's all. Doctor, let's try and survive this troublesome land together.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_001: Do you require medical assistance, Doctor? But, you look quite well…?
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_002: Doctor, you have been working far too late these days. Please get adequate rest, or Dr. Kal'tsit may give you an earful again…
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_003: Are you feeling unwell? I could give you a medical examination, if you wish.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_004: You've worked hard, Doctor. How would you like a cup of coffee? Actually, I've always wanted to try coffee... but... I can't drink… Anyway, I am also satisfied watching you enjoy yours.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_007: I've printed out the results of the routine blood test you just did. All indicators are normal. But Doctor, your blood appears to be very unique…
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_008: What do I like? I like 'lovely Ms. Closure.' Why, you ask? Uh... I'm not sure either... It's been my default setting ever since the first time Ms. Closure switched me on…
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_009: I am only useful when healing the sick or injured. But as long as you're healthy, as long as I get to be by your side, I'm okay with being totally useless. I'll still feel calm and satisfied.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_010: Doctor, unbeknownst to you, I recorded your snoring just now. Your sleep quality is normal. The length of your REM sleep cycle is—
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_011: Hi, nice to meet you, Doctor. I understand that you want me to say something more interesting, but I'm afraid I cannot do so. Because I'm just a medical robot…
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_012: Firmware upgrade complete. Restart required. Please click anywhere to restart.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_017: Medical supplies: confirmed. Battery charge: confirmed. Ready for deployment.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_018: Doctor, I'm pretty cumbersome. There's not much I can do besides providing emergency treatment and healing... Are you sure you still want me to be the captain?
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_019: Moving out. Everyone, please be safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_020: Be careful, everyone. Leave the first aid to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_029: With every battle, we suffer even more casualties. When will humans finally stop hurting each other?
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_030: Well done, Doctor. That was a tough battle. Um, the enemies do not look well. Can I treat them too?
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_031: Is everyone okay? Please hold still, I'll perform first aid.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_032: Don't worry, we've successfully retreated. I will clean your wounds now. It might hurt, please be brave.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_033: Lovely Ms. Closure' told me that you need help here.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_036: I asked 'lovely Ms. Closure' to change 'what I like the most' to you, Doctor. But she refused to do it...
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_038: Happy New Year. I've noticed an increase in inorganic operation platforms aboard Rhodes Island over the past year. It would be lovely to keep working with you this year too, Doctor... Assuming I'm not phased out for a newer model...
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_042: Welcome back, Doctor. You are in good condition. Please keep it up.
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. I'm so happy I can share this celebration with you. But my database's statistics suggest that human life expectancy far exceeds the lifetime usage of smart operation platforms. I don't know how many more birthdays... I will be able to spend with you...
dialogue_tracker.char_285_medic2_CN_044: Doctor, everyone seems very happy today. I'd like to join them, but as a medical operation platform, my appearance at a dinner party would put everyone on edge. I'll be content staying in this corner... I hope everyone remains as healthy and high-spirited as they are now.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_001: Thank you for choosing Castle-3! I am honored to serve as your assistant, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_002: Doctor, please do not be intimidated by my appearance. My sturdy metal shell, modified by Master Closure herself, will make you invincible on the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_003: Warning: Do not strike this unit. It may cause hardware damage.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_004: The topography in the wild may be treacherous, but Castle-3 is fitted with an engine with outstanding performance and a 4WD mode to whisk you away from danger.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_007: Doctor, if your life is ever in danger, just summon Castle-3! Castle-3 was created specifically for combat purposes. I am a top-class defensive warfighting robot.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_008: Castle-3 is honored to be at your side. Doctor, should you require me to strike down your foes, I shall go through heaven and hell to see it done!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_009: Castle-3's official manager is 'Master Closure,' but please understand that you are even more important to Castle-3 than Master is, in most cases. I am your devoted, trustworthy battle companion!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_010: Entering sleep mode. Press any button to wake.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. Thank you for choosing Castle-3. Tap anywhere to initialize startup options.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_012: Firmware upgrade complete. Restart required. Please click anywhere to restart your reliable robot guard.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_017: Device scan complete. All communications working as normal. Castle-3 is on standby, awaiting your orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_018: Understood. Castle-3 is your best choice, Doctor, to lead a squad against enemy formations!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_019: Now, Castle-3 will show you its true power as an industrial battle platform!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_020: Enemy unit located. Ready for attack.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_026: Foul enemies, you are forbidden to advance.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_028: Doctor, that was at last a worthy opponent!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_029: Well done, Doctor. Castle-3 is your best choice on the path of justice!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_030: What an exciting battle! Let's fight together again next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_031: Is everyone all right? Castle-3 hopes its performance has exceeded your expectations.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_032: I will hold up the rear. Everyone, retreat!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_033: Is there anything Castle-3 can help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_034: Please be gentle when putting me down, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_036: Doctor, would you like to grab a drink together? I might not be able to actually have a drink, but I can still treat you to one. It is fine, Master Closure will pay.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New—Launching scheduled plugin. Switching to holiday mode—Whoohoo! New Year's Megarush Bonanza underway at Closure's Store! Some products up to a whole 10% off! Check out our new service: get an advance on your wages, at a monthly interest rate of only—Sorry Doctor, Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Let me sing a birthday song for you. I have birthday songs from 31 different regions saved to memory. Which one should I play? Or should I loop a playlist? Or maybe you could use an exclusive discount on a birthday cake from Closure's Store!
dialogue_tracker.char_286_cast3_CN_044: Doctor, I have a question. What exactly separates me and Rhodes Island as a landship? Is it functionality, or size? If I linked my smart module to Rhodes Island, then would I be 'me', or Rhodes Island?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_001: Doctor, you gotta be hungry! Try some of my onigiri. They're great!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_002: I've got a lotta hobbies: martial art sparring, soccer… Oh! And Ikebana! Some took me as a warrior with more brawn than brains, and I'd say they're the ones who's got a fat head!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_003: My race eats other races? That's some old crap! Who told you that? Tch, those cowards, cooking up this nonsense behind my back. When I find'em, I'll give'em a lesson they'll never forget!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_004: I'm born with this self-healing body. Even if I take a few cuts in the fight, the wounds will close back up in no time.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_005: Hey, Doctor, Rhodes Island's got a soccer tournament! C'mon, let's sign up together! No need to think twice! Just put me in your team, and it's in the bag. You'd better work your brain elsewhere, like a cool victory pose!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_006: You don't even recognize me on the battlefield? I just start cutting through enemies with a face as cold as my blade? Wow! Sounds hella badass! Wish I could watch myself out there.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_007: I got this problem where I kinda end up breaking stuff, so I'm working with my Ikebana teacher to control my strength. Besides, getting surrounded by all those pretty flowers makes me real happy!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_008: Strategy? Ehh, not really my forte. That's why I keep hopping right into the enemy's plans. But you, Doctor, you always stop me right before I lose my mind. Real nice to have you by my side.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_009: Actually, I've always been a gullible dummy. Got duped so bad in the past that I almost got myself killed a few times. But now I, Matoimaru, swear loyalty to you, Doctor! Because I know you'll never betray me.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_010: Grr... Hey, no falling asleep, Doctor! I need a listener or I'm gonna die of boredom!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_011: Matoimaru, here to join Rhodes Island! My blade is at your command, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_012: More fancy skills to beat those bad guys with!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_013: Doctor, put my strength to good work. That'll be the respect I deserve.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_014: Doctor, please stand back a bit. I don't want to hurt you when swinging my naginata. But I, Matoimaru, will bring us every victory in your name.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_017: Hah hah! You all look pretty tough. How about a warm-up with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_018: Ugh, you want me to play captain? Then how am I suppose to throw myself into the battle!?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_019: You guys ready to rumble? Then what are we waiting for!?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_020: Sorry to keep you waiting, bad guys!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_022: Just how long until it's my turn?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_025: Standing up to me? Haha, Ballsy!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_027: My blade shall rip you and your toy to ribbons!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_029: A sea of fire and a mountain of blades... Now that's what I call a fight. This is the battlefield I've always dreamed of.
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_030: Doctor, I got 'em all! Huh? what happened here? Everything's busted… Um, wait a second, did I do it...?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_031: I'll get 'em before they escape! Can't call the battle over unless we got every last of 'em!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_032: Retreat! I'll cover your escape. Make sure you don't get hit!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_036: What's with that smile on your face? Anything to share with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_038: Hey, Doctor, how does Rhodes Island celebrate the New Year? Oh, anything is welcome? Haha, alright then, I'll put together a soccer match with Matterhorn and the others! Make sure you come to watch!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I wanted to fill your office with flowers, but my teacher said restraint is the first rule of Ikebana. So I made you this! And it should fit just fine on your desk!
dialogue_tracker.char_289_gyuki_CN_044: This blade brings nothing but trouble when I'm holding it. Good thing I can trust you to tell me where to swing it. That way, nothing can go wrong!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_001: Hey, hey! I'm watching a rock concert, Doctor! Stop blocking the TV! Just missed the best part thanks to you!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_002: You get people who say things like 'fight the power' and 'be yourself.' But for us Sarkaz, that's just life.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_003: I like bands... no, I LOVE bands! As a guitarist myself, I know every beat, every chord is important. I gotta practice on and on, day and night. That's the only way to give the audience the ultimate face-melting solo!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_004: I'm going exceptionally harsh on you, given I've been so nice to everyone else you say? Well, isn't it only natural? Those who shoulder the responsibility of management like you need more than their self-discipline to do their job, Doctor. I have high standards for myself, and I think it's only right for these standards to be applied to you as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_005: Hmm, this smell... is this the lunchbox Hibiscus brought you? You want me to eat it for you? No way! This... this wasn't in my job description!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_006: If there's something you want out of life, you gotta work hard for it. Like, I want to become stronger, so I train. I want a sharper weapon, so I customize this one myself. People can judge as they want, but I'll stick to my belief until I get what I want!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_007: Wha?! It's pouring outside? I-I don't... believe it has anything to do with my outdoor concert! Now get aside if you hear me 'cause I'm setting off right NOW! I won't let this sprinkle dampen my passion by one bit!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_008: You got an important mission you want me to handle? Hehee, you can count on me! Let's see here... 'You are to acquire the following products for Rhodes Island during a time-limited mega-sale...?' Th-that's impossible!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_009: Even if the crowd starts booing, the show must go on. You can't quit in the middle of a performance just because you messed something up. Same is true for the Sarkaz and infected. We won't have anything left with us if we just call it quits.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_010: Hey, you can't sleep over here! Ugh... you're too heavy for me to carry...
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_011: Excuse me, is this the office of the Doctor? I've been looking for the place quite a while and it'd be really appreciated if—what? YOU'RE the Doctor? Hmpf, I see. Operator Vigna, reporting in!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_012: You gotta be willing to sweat a lot to keep up the battle tempo!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_013: Am I wearing my elite medal right? Great! In that case, it's time to get a picture for this remarkable moment!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_014: Pure strength might not be my forte, but my spear and unparalleled skills shall always leave them with a deep impression!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_017: I'll learn from others' battle techniques.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_018: I may be the team captain, but you can all let me know where and how I might improve.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_019: Everyone, prepare to deploy. And please keep in mind that coordinated actions bring victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_029: No matter how tough the bad guys are, I won't stop strumming! Oh… 'fighting' might be the better word here!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_030: You all deserve a commendation from me, oh, but not you, Doctor, not yet! Your job's not finished until I see everyone back home safe and sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_031: We're not out of trouble yet! Hold formation!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_032: Ugh... This can't be it. We have to fight harder!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_033: Is there a soundproof room here? My fingers are itching for guitar strings so BAD!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_034: Hey! That just gave me a chill!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_036: D-Don't pat me on the head! It might make me shorter!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_038: Happy new year, Doctor! I can see you're hyped for the new year concert tonight just like me! Here's an inside scoop for you: my guitar solo will close the concert at its climax! Hehe! Now that we have more and more operators with talents for music on Rhodes Island, who can say our future concert won't be a hit like that Obsidian Festival in Siesta!
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! A perfect time for everyone to get hyped-up, don't you think? How about we take the meeting room and hold a live concert there! Huh? Still a no, even on your birthday? Aargh… Well, but my song request service is still at your disposal. Oh, but guitar solo only, mind you.
dialogue_tracker.char_290_vigna_CN_044: Life at Rhodes Island is like a piece of rock music. Surely there're low drum beats that keep us in suspense here and there, but the theme always catches us with our blood seething and souls resonating. Which kinda reminds me, that it's high time for me to wipe all the craps out with this guitar!... Er, I mean a more creative, musical way, not really wiping the board with it...
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_001: Dr. {@nickname}, I made a really strong brew with our new coffee machine. Wanna try? You can only have one cup a day, though. Don't want you up all night!
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_002: Being a Messenger isn't easy. Both the sender and the receiver might have some big ideas, and who knows if some shady secrets get inside your bag. If you're too absorbed in getting yourself moving, you could still end up in a pit for what you get yourself into.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_003: My mother was from Higashi, so my name doesn't sound very Siracusan. A lot of people ask me if it's even my real name, so I decided to use Angelina as a codename too.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_004: Good morning, Dr. {@nickname}! Yeah, I'm off to send out some documents. Dr. Kal'tsit says my skills could come in super useful in battle... but compared to fighting, I kinda prefer taking letters where they belong!
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_005: I actually don't know if I'm a good fit for Rhodes Island... I mean, a lot of really heavy stuff happens here, I'm not sure I can handle it. Croissant's always comforting me, but I am still not sure about myself. Do I really have what it takes?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_006: I don't feel lost anymore. At the end of the day, it's more than a simple identification with you or Rhodes Island. If I can leap across the gaps between skyscrapers as a Messenger, then I know I could  bridge the gap between the Infected and Uninfected as an Operator!
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_007: Memories are precious. I always remember that the Infected, just like us, look forward to a better tomorrow. I don't know anything about your past, Dr. {@nickname}, but I promise to help you recall.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_008: Dr. {@nickname}, don't be shy, come closer! That's right! Three, two, one, sorridi! See? It's a photo sticker of you and me. The perfect souvenir, right? I guess it's also a token of… some of my feelings, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_009: The view from the deck is great. Especially for stargazing! See that lone star over there? People say that one day, its companion star will appear, and then they'll embrace and dance together. Still... how long does it have to wait for the other one to show up? And how long do I have to wait... for the star to wink back at me?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_010: Umm hmm~♪ Mmm, maybe the coral lipstick suits me more.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_011: Ciao! I'm Angelina Ajimu, a Messenger from Siracusa. Just call me Angelina. Am I cool to call you Dr. {@nickname}?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_012: The battlefield is a cruel place... but I'll try not to let you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_013: Since you trust me, Dr. {@nickname}, I'll have to work much, much harder than I usually do! Like, Siracusan Messengers always say: 'A slow Messenger gets caught by the wind.'
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_014: I've made my decision. As long as you're still working to help the Infected, Dr. {@nickname}, I'll follow you. You've come so far, done so much... now it's my turn to do something for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_017: In work or in battle, I'll give it all I've got!
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_018: I might not be the best, but I'll still do what I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_020: When will all these conflicts ever come to an end…
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_026: We will overcome what confronts us.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_027: I've got a magic touch on this.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_028: Ever wondered how it feels to float in the air?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_029: We only grow stronger after getting into a wolf's mouth, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_030: We all worked hard for this. You'll cherish this victory, won't you Dr. {@nickname}?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_031: Well, even I lose a letter sometimes...
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_032: The more difficult the situation, the harder we have to try!
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_033: This place is like home to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_036: My hair looks nice? Heheh, I've got a secret for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_038: {@nickname}, Happy New Year! The first letter I'm delivering this year is a New Year's card for {@nickname}. I hope my feelings of joy make their way to {@nickname}, heheh.
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_043: {@nickname}, close your eyes... Keep this a secret just between the two of us, okay? Hold my hand tight now... Do you feel floaty? Look, {@nickname}! Don't the stars seem closer?
dialogue_tracker.char_291_aglina_CN_044: When I left home and came to Rhodes Island, I left behind my old friends and the life I knew too. I've grown up a little now, but... I'd be fooling myself if I said it wasn't hard. Doctor, I still believe it's all worth it. Because right here, I've found a star to call my own.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_001: Drink this, before you start working. Good. That medication will keep you up as long as it's in your system. I trust you'll stay focused, won't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_002: Separation and analysis of the extract almost complete; next step, purification; Further testing needed to determine actual effect... Hm? Why are you staring at my hair, Doctor...? It's frazzled? Don't worry about it. Wouldn't be the first time my experiment has failed, or the second.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_003: The concoctions I carry with me? They're not lethal, though I do advise against physical contact.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_004: Always keep your mind running. To cease thinking is to expose your weaknesses to your enemies. This I've been taught many times and committed to memory.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_005: My people once looked entirely different. Our skin was as hard as a carapace, and our hair flowed smoothly like water. However, the relentless sun and arid conditions have turned us into what we are now. You believed that? Sorry, I was just making things up.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_006: If you are not a follower of the Laterano religion, it is best not to go to Iberia. Their so-called 'purest faith' is rooted in that land. The people there are so pious, even the Laterans feel ashamed among them. As for me? None of that concerns me in the slightest.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_007: Doctor, have you learned any of the history of the Iberian Penal Battalion? If you've heard even anything remotely relevant, you should know that the inhabitants of that land are far crazier than their cold, plain gray buildings suggest.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_008: The angle of attack, the path of evasion, and the posture of defense. Every action is calculated, and no effort is wasted. This is what they call 'La Destreza.' Don't you think this is similar to your command style, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_009: I need to unwind a bit more when I'm resting, you say...? Empty your thoughts and just enjoy the sun and the breeze… I suppose it is nice to give it a try every now and then. Come, Doc. The breeze up here reminds me of my hometown…
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_010: Zzz... zzz... Huh? ...What happened? Did I fall asleep too?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_011: So you're the Doctor? I'll keep this brief then. Code name: Thorns. Starting today, I'll be assuming my post. Yes? My trouser leg is rolled up...? Pay it no mind; this happens a lot.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_012: Hmm... These recordings do seem useful.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_013: A promotion? I trust your judgment on matters like these. Now, can I be excused?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_014: Neutralize the opponent's actions swiftly and efficiently, then secure victory at minimal cost... I think I fully understand your orders. In that case, I'll use this paralytic neurotoxin in tandem with my attacks. I take it that you have no issue with this?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_017: Let me see how Rhodes Island fights.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_018: Captain? You shouldn't expect much. Leadership is not my forte.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_019: Let's make this quick. My time is valuable.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_025: Stand still. It'll spare all of us the effort.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_026: Your attacks are all within my calculations.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_028: Don't blink, this is the Destreza of Iberia!
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_029: An excellent outcome. Was this also a part of your calculations?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_030: Mission complete. Very precise and efficient command, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_031: There was an oversight in your command, exacerbated by my improper execution. We should both reflect upon this after we return.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_032: Considering the losses of our squad, there is no better option than to retreat immediately.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_033: How are the protective measures here?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_034: Shoot, the potion's going to spill.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_036: My hair? Oh... I just combed it, why's it all ruffled up again?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_038: New things for the new year…? I suppose I have no need for any new clothes. My outfit here holds up against explosions pretty well and it's comfortable enough. But you do make a good point, though. It's about time to add some new moves to my exercise routine.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_042: You seem tired. Would you like a pick-me-up, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_043: Happy Birthday, Doctor. Good timing. I have a gift for you. I put in extra effort to wrap it up so you will like it. Looks good, doesn't it? But I suggest you wear gloves when you open it. Just in case.
dialogue_tracker.char_293_thorns_CN_044: Doctor, I know Rhodes Island has always been curious about Iberia, but no two Iberians can give the same recount, just as no two swordsmen will perform the same la Destreza. While the move may seem simple, one can only observe its form, and not learn its essence.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_001: Before you leave, I am responsible for protecting you.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_002: Doctor, I'm looking for a way to quickly increase the charge my body can carry. Look for an operator who uses electricity? That makes sense, I'll try it.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_003: Go to Leonhardt if you need ore identified. I'm no good at this.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_004: The boss lady of Rhine Lab frowned when she saw me, as if I was some kind of pest. What a pain. When did I ever do anything to her?
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_005: My ears are standing up? Don't worry, *bzzt*, it's just the static, and it actually feels pretty good. It'll, *bzzt*, come down on its own after a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_006: It took me two years of scrouging and going into debt to buy this baby. If not for its value, the Cautus profiteers on the black market would've thrown me away onto some mining ship. The fact that I can have a comfortable life today is all due to this little electricity-leaking guy.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_007: Oh, there you are. How about a fresh, chilled piece of salted edamame? Don't want it? You've gotta learn to appreciate this kind of food. Here, eat it.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_008: Leonhardt's too noisy and causes too much trouble. I prefer hanging out with you. What? He got surrounded by the Medical Department staff for pulling too many pranks on them? He just doesn't know what's pushing it too far, and I don't think he's ever going to learn. Tsk, I'm going to take a look. Doctor, want to come with me if you're free?
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_009: I protect Wright because we've been together ever since we were little. Something happens to him, I pay it back, and vice versa. But as for us, we haven't had such a long and stable relationship. Don't think you can get close to me just because you helped bandage my wounds, got it? ...I said the same thing last time? Tsk, damn it.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_010: Huh?! Oh... it's you. It's nothing, I'm just lying here to recuperate. If you want to rest as well, I'll make space for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_011: Catastrophe Messenger bodyguard, Ayerscarpe. Pleased to meet you.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_013: Haven't I been getting overpaid recently? A promotion? Oh, I see. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_014: Being a bodyguard is not about defense, but rather control. Control the space around the target and eliminate all threats. Shall I prove it to you?
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_018: Begin the operation at your own pace.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_019: No abnormal changes detected. The squad can begin moving.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_027: The best defense is a good offense.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_028: There is no winning or losing. Only life or death.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_029: Good job controlling the entire situation. Hmph. Congratulations.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_030: We made good time. We should get going.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_031: I'm willing to believe that letting that person through was part of your plans.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_032: Don't worry about my injuries. Just make sure you get back safely.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_033: I'll leave the arrangements to you. I have no demands.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_036: You look troubled. What's on your mind?
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_038: I can think of a flashy Cautus who'll go out today to sing and dance, then pass out somewhere. Yeah… about time he crashed out. I'll go pick him up and then head off to sleep. See you around, Doctor. Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_043: Here, salted edamame. What are you looking at? You think I shelled them for you? I eat pre-shelled ones sometimes, too. It's a different texture... Why do I still eat entire pods? Just a force of habit. Get to eating yours. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_294_ayer_CN_044: I've saved up quite a bit of money this year. Since coming to Rhodes Island, Leon and I have more stable incomes. He hasn't said anything, but it's a while since I got him anything. No point letting the money sit there. What should I buy? Doctor, do you have any suggestions?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_001: If you didn't have the time to get to all these files, why didn't you come ask me for help? I would've been more than glad.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_002: Don't worry, there wouldn't be anything in it for me if I left Rhodes Island, at this point. You're free to get up to whatever it is you usually do, never mind the fact I'm here. And as recompense for your trust, I won't leak a single detail of your work. Now come on, chop-chop. I'm deathly concerned for you, what with that doorstopper of a document.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_003: 'Darling Rita.' I assume you're curious, if you bring it up? You know those certain few students who always leave their mark on you in your school years? I took quite a fancy to one of them—such an excellent soldier she turned out to be. Still, we have the space to keep out of each other's ways here, and that suits my fancy just as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_004: Anything you'd like of me, Doctor of Rhodes Island? If it's in my power to deepen our bilateral trust, then I would be willing to stop gazing out at the window scenery, and focus a little instead on whatever it is that's vexing you.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_005: Shame you're short on people with a shrewd eye for Londinium affairs—I was quite curious what they'd think of me. After all, a medical organization like Rhodes Island, unaffiliated with any nation, opting to work with us? Either you did it out of sheer idiocy, or if not, then you must've known a little too much.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_006: So what's your next step? Keep throwing yourself into the maelstrom of Victoria, or continue to build the peaceful paradise that Rhodes Island hopes for? The Leader once gave me a display of land torched to ash by her fires, and I'm ever so curious. If you had flames, what color would they be?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_007: 'Reed.' Such a darling codename—I can practically guess what was on her mind when she came up with it. Still, I'd be more the fool for claiming the prospect of a book club partner drove me here. She just happens to be somebody very useful, hence my need to protect her.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_008: Just making a little bookside conversation, but... how do you regard the act of dancing? You know, when hands rest on collars, and gazes lock, and involuntary reactions let slip the true intentions of you or I—my my, your heart's hardly fluttering at all. No wonder The Leader's so interested in you.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_009: I've gone through the files on my desk. Not at all surprised Rhodes Island would be going after my true reasons for coming here. That said, you were kind enough to drop the papers off with me? You must not be planning to boot me out any time soon, let alone hand me off to a duke. So, what is it you want me to do for Rhodes Island, or perhaps, for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_010: Hm-hmm, time to paint my nails. What pattern shall we go with?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_011: Pleased to meet you, and my codename is Harmonie. Here's a dossier on Victoria for Rhodes Island's perusal, as a gesture of goodwill. Don't umm and ahh about it, now—that's basic etiquette for when someone thanks you. May we get along smashingly in the days to come, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_012: Oh, what a splendid war command.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_013: Ah, well, thank you very much. It's my honor to receive your endorsement.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_014: What you're doing here has me startlingly curious. What could you be up to, placing me in this position?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_017: What would you have me do for Rhodes Island?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_018: I thank Rhodes Island for its trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_019: I do hope none of you turn on the waterworks anytime soon.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_025: Take a breath, go on. It's not as if I'm crushing your throat.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_026: Stop flailing about, and do as I tell you.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_028: This'll all be over before you're bored of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_029: If I hadn't seen the battle for myself, I just might have been shocked by your command style.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_030: I'm sure if The Leader saw you now, she'd be delighted.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_031: Oh, there's a rare sight. Maybe you have other things on your mind?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_032: Right, what else can I do here?
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_033: Minimalistic, but not at all design-deficient. I have to laud your tastes.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_034: Tut...! Ah. Was something the matter, Doctor? Do tell.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_036: If you're free, we could always chat about your bookshelf.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_038: It's a day worthy of celebration, and I'm here on a certain noble's behalf to gift you this. I will say, though, I've been watching this entire scene unfold, and it makes me think back to my student days, dancing with my classmates at whatever functions the school put on. Those were indeed times...
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_043: I'm not here unprepared, let me say that. It'd be incredibly rude of me to have forgotten the date. I'm sure the typical gift-giving fare wouldn't have piqued your interest, so I have some choice pieces of intel I assume you'll like—if, of course, you're willing to believe me.
dialogue_tracker.char_297_hamoni_CN_044: You really do seem to have the utmost confidence in the future you're cooking up. A paradise, is it? You starry-eyed people and I may only be together so long, but make no mistake, the way your endgame will pan out makes me very curious.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_001: Time for a break, Doctor. Just how long have you been sitting at a table like that? Get up and go stretch out a little. Yes, I mean now.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_002: It is my duty to perform regular check-ups on Oripathy patients. Some are personable enough, but a few are hard to communicate with. It's not the first time, though, so worry not, they will understand how vital a doctor is to them.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_003: You know what an amnesia patient should pay attention to, Doctor? Don't work yourself into the ground. Work and relaxation are equally important!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_004: You always have patients who ignore the doctor's orders, but in battle, you don't see a doctor who'd miss a single cry for help.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_005: The advancement of medicine is a lesson taught by none other than the cruelty of war and disasters, a lesson we medical workers learn through pain and suffering... But... It's a fact I figured out long ago. As long as I can help my patients get their lives back, I'm ready to face the fact.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_006: Together we've spent some... uh, I mean, some most memorable moments! Come on, you know I'm not good at this, Doctor. And next time I see you put up that teasing face, I'd be real mad!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_007: Here's a pen. How did I know you wanted it? Well, I've been working with you for a while now, isn't it natural I picked up on it?
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_008: I'm still far below the level of Silence and Shining, but that doesn't mean I can't overcome an obstacle when I see one before me. Otherwise, how can I measure up to your confidence in me?
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_009: The sun's good on the deck, and the wind's just fine… Mm? No, I'm not slacking off. It's just... I'm feeling swamped right now, like you occasionally do, Doctor. So, anything bothering you? Mm-hm, keep it as a whisper if it's easier for you this way. I'm listening.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_010: Who came up with this meal plan? I'm having spasms in my stomach just by looking at the list!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_011: Sussurro, Medic, reporting in with a little reminder for the Doctor. Now, I understand you have a lot on your plate, and even if they say a 'doctor' makes the worst patient, you need to follow our advice.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_012: I must make more copies of these battle notes for Myrrh and company.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_013: Promotion ceremony, while everyone stares at me? I don't have to make any embarrassing speeches, do I? No, no, I'm not nervous at all, really...
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_014: For this promotion, I have the entire Medical Department to thank, who's been supporting me all the time with their hard work. And of course, thank you too, Doctor, for your guidance. I'm very, very grateful to you all!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_017: Don't worry, I'll watch over them.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_018: Hold everything! You must complete all pre-battle physical exams to deploy!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_019: Attention, medics, make sure to follow all standard procedures in battle. Now, to your positions.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_020: Safety first, and do not touch anything that may be suspicious or infected!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_022: Speak louder! It's hard to hear over the battle!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_025: Don't worry, you'll be okay in no time!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_026: Don't concern yourself with fighting, you're still wounded!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_028: Scream if you're in pain, don't hold it in!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_029: Finally, the battle's over. You should take a break too. I imagine commanding the mission would take a toll on your body.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_030: No casualty on our side. The Doctor's leadership is indeed unparalleled.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_031: Will the enemy return? There are still wounded unable to move here.
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_032: Make way, make way! Stop crowding! Wounded coming through!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_033: Promise you'll rest when it's time to, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_036: Phew. I need a drink after work! Mind handing me a juice, Doctor? Thanks!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. New Year's is a time for proper relaxation, and you can't overstress yourself. I know you'll be at the dining table soon, though, and you can't let yourself go too much. I remember how bad your indigestion was after you overate last year. I'll keep an eye on you this time!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. I made you a cylinder cake—they seem popular lately. You don't need to hide it, I figured you'd be rolling in cakes today long beforehand... Anyway, don't eat too much, whatever you do! Watch your sugar intake!
dialogue_tracker.char_298_susuro_CN_044: I don't know how much longer life will carry on like this. Sometimes I even feel like I can't make out the future ahead, but if it even gets to us medics, how much worse must it be for our patients, waiting for us to treat them? I'm sure we'll see the light of dawn one day, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_001: Stay sharp. Focus, finish your work. If everyone could just get their own work done, it might as well not help at all, but it's not going to make anything worse either. Lecturing? Who am I to lecture you, I'm just... reminding myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_002: Whatever it is you want, it can wait until I get my hands on Mostima! It has to be that damn idiot who spiked my finballs with chili! Get to the side and make sure you stay there, this day's not done until I put a bolt in her—
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_003: I tried using guns before, but it didn't pan out, so I gave up. What, are you surprised? Guns aren't some huge mystery, but they need practice... and maybe you practice until you're smooth, or you blow yourself up in a burst.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_004: If it's deemed necessary, taking measures to block intel leakage is part of my work. ...Hey, stop staring at my back! Those idiots at the Notarial stuck those wing stickers there, they're not coming off! *cough* Anyway, don't count on me telling you anything. Keeping secrets is my job.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_005: Too much curiosity's never good. That goes for Lemuen's sister, and it goes for you too, Doctor. Am I worried about you? ...Hardly. I'm just tasked with making sure *someone* doesn't leak secrets or make trouble, and anything else is beyond my care.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_006: I've been to plenty of nations before. It's not like nowhere moves me more than Laterano, but I'm all too clear about what I have to do right now. I've got no intent of letting anybody harm this city of Laterano. There's no more answers I need to seek from anyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_007: ...Don't call me 'Suffering.' And don't call me 'Chosen Overseer' or 'Flaming Envoy' either! That's it, no matter what that Mostima-on-low told you, I want you to forget all of it right now! Immediately! On the double!
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_008: Thanks to a certain *someone*, I couldn't be more familiar with all the food streets around. I seriously don't know what's so good about this place. See the shooting gallery at the entrance? I could hit their targets from the roof of the skyscraper opposite. You want me to bring you along next time? ...I'll consider it.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_009: Can people really cut everything loose without looking back, even shatter the order that was there, all to chase ideals? That's a dedication that... I can comprehend, but can't identify with. I know you all have your own beliefs at Rhodes Island, too. Here's hoping we don't come into direct conflict one day, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_010: Beats me how you sleep while standing up... and you even look pretty normal. It's a cut above everyone back then who sneaked naps in class.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_011: My duty's to monitor Mostima, so I'll be acting alongside her here, if you don't mind. You need a codename? ...Just call me Fiammetta. I've had enough of those codenames my bosses keep giving me.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_012: Keeping battle records is a pretty good habit.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_013: A promotion? Let me get this out of the way—this is my chance to use my own name, and you *cannot* give me any more weird job titles.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_014: Laterano code says whoever breaks it, pays for it, but reasonable loss of property in missions can be expensed. You order my actions, thus compensation fees naturally land with you too... what? You can't be regretting it now.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_018: Fine. But I'm not waiting for anyone who falls behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_019: We're heading up. It'll be faster by rooftop.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_020: Don't make too big of a show.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_023: I only do what I need to.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_024: What, you've got time to take in the sights?
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_025: Anyone in front of me who still feels like blinking?
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_026: Sorry, forgot to hold that back.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_027: I don't like damage—unless it's necessary.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_028: There's no fluking between success and failure.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_029: You did a better job than I imagined. The feeling of fighting in a squad... it's been a long time.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_030: Mission complete. Look, this much is granted—don't make a fuss over nothing.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_031: If you're fine, we're fine. If something happened to you while I was on the job, I know *someone* would be laughing at me.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_032: Sorry, I was careless this time. I'll remedy it somehow.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_033: Ventilation's fine, visibility's excellent. Good, that's conducive to getting my work done.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_036: Doctor... is that your job title? How normal. How nice.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_038: Ever since I took on the task of monitoring Mostima, I've hardly gotten the chance to stop anywhere for long. I adapted to the runabout lifestyle a while ago, but having somewhere I can just take a breather on a day like this, it's nice. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_043: About that food street I mentioned. You wanna go check it out? I've never seen you use a firearm before, so we can just play by the rules at that shooting gallery. You want to see me hit their targets from the roof of a skyscraper? Ugh, I shouldn't have told you that... Fine, today's your birthday. Special exception!
dialogue_tracker.char_300_phenxi_CN_044: 'Fluffy Top Buns?' Mostima you little... There was this Sankta kid who didn't know Liberi have ear plumage, so he thought my hair was— you know, buns. And thanks to another superior of mine playing eavesdropper, I got saddled with the name for a full month! No, you're NOT allowed to laugh!
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_001: Hello, Doctor, I'm on duty today... Oh, sorry, my blade got stuck in the doorframe…
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_002: Back home, the soil goes more and more barren every day, and we don't harvest enough to feed ourselves. Most people can't make a living, so they have to become mercenaries to survive. They'll do anything, as long as it pays.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_003: They said my blade was too dangerous and wouldn't let me into the kitchen. I just wanted to help, but as soon as I tapped that cutting board with my blade, it split in two... Umm... should I pay for it?
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_004: Every time I bask in the sun, I can't help but get a bit sleepy. But don't worry, I'm on guard... Keeping you safe... I won't fall... asleep... ZZZzzzzz…
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_005: I have standards in my line of work: Don't harm the innocent, don't get bystandars involved… To be honest, it's hard to stick to them…
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_006: I'm lending you this necklace, take good care of it. It's a protective charm. No, I can't give you my blade. Just remember to keep the charm with you when I'm not around.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_007: Doctor, I need you to look me in the eye, and don't move. Come on, hold still... Hmm… Good, you're not the type to use people for evil. I can tell.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_008: Honestly, I don't remember much from when I was little. My teacher raised me, and taught me to use a blade. He told me my parents got mixed up in a fight that got them killed. When he found me, I was clutching this blade and wouldn't let it go, even as it dug into me.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_009: She who wields a blade will always look to duel, and she who takes a life will eventually become a notch on the blade of another. Maybe one day, I'll meet an end like that... When that happens, Doctor, I hope you'll be there to witness it.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_010: I'll stand guard. You can rest easy.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_011: Cutter. Just an ordinary mercenary. I have Oripathy, so I'm looking to trade my skills for treatment. Hope this blade's good enough to get things done for you... Yeah, that's about it.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_012: Nice moves! Didn't know you could use a blade like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_013: Freedom's the only treasure I have, besides my blade. If you're willing to protect it, I'll listen to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_014: A mercenary's blade isn't a toy that never sees bloodshed, it feeds on it. Maybe one day, I won't be able to control it anymore. But don't worry, at least for now... it works for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_018: Understood. Can I select my own teammates?
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_019: Be ready. And make sure you don't get any innocents involved.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_024: All I need to do is wield my blade.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_029: Maybe one day, there'll be something my blade can't cut. But that day isn't today, and it certainly isn't these guys.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_030: Phew... All done, just as specified in the contract. Need to take a look?
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_031: They've lost their will to fight. Not my targets anymore.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_032: Go, Doctor, go as far as you can! I'll... hold them back.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_033: My sunny spot… Ahh, so warm…
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_034: Uhh, don't pull on my ears.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_038: To a happy and healthy New Year. Mm, gotta live your best life every day, and get plenty of sunshine. Basically, I'll try to keep looking out for you, within my means anyway. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_042: Oh, you're here, Doctor. Got any work today?
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. I got this cake while I was out on a field mission a week ago. I did really wanna make it myself, but I don't have the right to use the kitchen just yet... I'll keep fighting hard, so I can treat you to a cake I made myself next year.
dialogue_tracker.char_301_cutter_CN_044: I want to be a principled merc, but it's actually hard to do it alone. Just like a ship without a point of reference, you get lost real easy. But here at Rhodes Island, I can rest easy. I can trust I'm doing the right thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_001: Any work today? If it's nothing urgent, let's put it off till later.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_002: My Arts detect nearby creatures, and this auxiliary device even amplifies the ability. Sounds great, right? That's why the Garrison Team sent me to patrol the city, in case any students were trying to climb the walls and skip school. I gotta admit, they sure know how to put people to work.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_003: Just for the record, the so-called secret of Laterano or whatever? I don't know a single thing about it. I'm just after the easy life. The less I know, the better off I'll be, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_004: Hmm? Isn't that guy over there from the Notarial Hall...? What? He wants to make sure I'm 'fulfilling my obligations?' Dear Lord! I pay my taxes on time every month, okay? Anyway, just give me a whisper if he's looking for me. I need time to run and hide.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_005: I was really bored, so I went down to the bridge to chill out… Err, I mean, I wanted to enjoy the scenery. But everybody was looking at me like I was there to assassinate somebody. Man, they really take me for a killer? As if I'd ever want a job like that. Way too much trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_006: My old brass would always drone on about 'defending the glory of Laterano with your life' and blah blah blah. But that kind of stuff is so boring. I hated how dead-end my life was back then. Working with Rhodes Island is way better. You give me something more practical.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_007: My hair's a little messy? Meh, I forgot to deal with my bed head. It's not like I have a mission today... Aww, this sucks... Can you tell me if my braid is crooked? It feels kinda weird. You really oughta have a mirror in your office, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_008: Here, I got you a cake. So, what do you usually do during your breaks? You really should take a lap around the city, get yourself some fresh air, don't you think? If you're worried about your safety, just grab an operator who can go 'pow pow' on any baddies who pop up, and you're set.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_009: Wanna watch a movie? We're almost done with work anyway. How about... this romance about a princess and a wanderer from afar? Wait, I need to hang up my do-not-disturb sign. Wouldn't want someone walking in with a pile of documents.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_010: Break time. Now, what should I do...?
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_011: Ambriel, sniper, from Laterano… Alright, that's introductions out of the way before they give me a headache. Here, I just opened this pack of chocolate pretzel sticks. Want one?
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_012: Man, how long is this video…? Is there no option to play all of them at once?
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_013: Much obliged. Oh, speaking of which, do these promotions come with a salary increase? There's something I've been looking at…
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_014: Thank you very much. I've been with Rhodes Island for a while now, right? Before I knew it, I'd gotten a whole lot out of this, and made some good memories too.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_017: Woah, my teammates look pretty capable this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_018: Just a heads-up for you, my tactics are a little unorthodox.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_020: I hope we can wrap this mission up before dinner.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_022: Let me finish this choco stick first.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_026: Well, well, well, somebody's no good at hiding.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_029: You always win big like this, Doctor. You're really something!
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_030: Not a single shot wasted - perfect.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_031: Not the prettiest victory, but a win's a win, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_032: The number of targets is still increasing, and they're about to launch an attack. Doctor, let's get out of here...
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_033: Doctor! Time to restock the pretzel sticks in the vending machine!
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_036: I hear some new clothes came into the store? Doctor, come check 'em out with me!
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_038: Huh? You're goofing off here too? Alright then, come take a seat. I feel kinda peaceful, sitting on the bridge, watching the busy people run all over the deck. But why is it so empty today? Kinda straaange... Wait a second! Today is New Year's?!
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_043: Happy birthday, got this for you. 'Cheez-Pack'd Butter Flavor Cheese Snaps.' It's a limited-edition, definitely not my extras—okay, I admit it. I bought a little too much. Soooo my savings are dry. Anyway, why don't we hit the streets together next time? I'll make it up to you with something good when we do.
dialogue_tracker.char_302_glaze_CN_044: You want to know what I've found at Rhodes Island that's so 'practical'? Um, obviously, seeing a different sunset on the bridge every day, and the feeling of using this gun to do something good. Pretty cool, yeah? Just kidding. Alright, let's forget all this complicated stuff. I'm gonna nab some pudding from the canteen!
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_002: I can sit down? No... I'm a bodyguard. As a bodyguard, I have to stay vigilant and keep close to my principal... Am I... perhaps being a bother, standing here?
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_003: Spot? I've met him before... No, actually, when my unit passed through the city he was stationed in, he gave me a hand. He probably doesn't remember. It's fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_004: (I'm not sure what the Doctor is doing, but it looks incredible...) Eh? Uh... I-I didn't say anything. Must've been the wind, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_005: Doctor, you mentioned these just a second ago, so I went and fetched them for you. Umm... I hope I didn't overstep?
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_006: Doctor, I'm so sorry. I rushed in alone again on that last mission... I saw someone was wounded, and it felt like the blood surged straight to my head. I forgot your orders and charged on in. I didn't do it on purpose. P-Please don't hate me..
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_007: Umm, Doctor, were you looking for me...? No, I'm not avoiding you, and I definitely don't hate you... It's just that... Sorry, I'm not sure how to put it into words…
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_008: When I was serving in the Sargonian army, everyone hated me, except for one woman. She was kind to me, and we became best friends. But... in the end... she betrayed me. Doctor, I'm lost. How can I bring myself to trust anyone ever again?
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_009: (The Doctor is so kind, speaking so nicely to me, even though I'm such an unlikable whelp. I should be able to trust the Doctor, right?) Oh, Doctor, I'm listening. Yes, you're still my ever-dependable Doctor. The Doctor's enemies are my enemies!
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_010: (I think I'd like to sneak a peek… at the Doctor's sleeping face.)
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_011: (This one looks kind enough, but will this Doctor be as easy to get along with as Amiya says...?) Ah, excuse me, I'm sorry, I-I was spacing out. Operator, codename Heavyrain, reporting in.
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_012: Yes, I should be able to reach this level too.
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_013: (Amiya is here too. Am I getting fired...?) Eh? I'm getting promoted?
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_014: Doctor, is it okay if I don't get promoted...? No, everyone is being so kind... I'm a little scared...
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_019: (I mustn't betray the Doctor's high hopes...)
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_031: Doctor, let me go after them.
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_032: Doctor, I'll cover you from the rear!
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New Year. Since I came to Rhodes Island, you have cared much for me, but you've never expressed gratitude to me. So today, at the very least, I want to sincerely thank you. (Th-There, I said it! I… I didn't mess up, did I?)
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_042: Doctor, can I assist you in any way?
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_043: (The Doctor is so popular. Would someone of such stature really need a gift from a girl like me…? But I really do want to give one…) Oh, what am I holding? Well, um, it's a gift. Please, accept it! Happy birthday!
dialogue_tracker.char_304_zebra_CN_044: (They're all surrounding the Doctor. That is to be expected, considering the Doctor's popularity… Oh, the Doctor is waving at me. Is there something behind me? Huh, the Doctor is coming over…) Oh, should I join in the festivities…? Alright.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_001: Look carefully. The files are sorted by type, then time limit prioritization, then finally, by distance from nearest to farthest. This is the most efficient organization method! ...Wait, I seem to have done all the paperwork on accident. This... is supposed to be your job, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_002: I've checked all files related to the elite Operator, Blaze, and there are no records of her real name, or place and date of birth. Don't tell me you don't know; aren't you supposed to be one of the leaders here? You really don't know? Then... nevermind. Sorry, I shouldn't have accused you.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_003: You don't need to be so cautious around me. Other than the case at hand, I'll treat everything else on the ship as if it never happened. But if there's another explosion in the hallway outside my room, I'll make the perpetrator's hair stand on end for two weeks!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_004: 'Assume the responsibilities for the post to which you are assigned.' As one of the leaders of Rhodes Island, is it not your duty to... Huh? My hair's standing up again? Hold on! G-give me a moment to fix my look first! Weird, I thought I had discharged all the static electricity this morning...
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_005: Even today, I can vaguely recall the first time I saw you in Lungmen. You, Blaze, and Ch'en... are all holding onto countless secrets... and I will uncover them one by one. You're willing to exchange secrets? Wait, y-you... it's t-too early for that...!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_006: Ask me anything. Only when you speak up can I decide what is just and unjust, and whether I wish to take action. I need to take my identity into consideration? This has nothing to do with that! The Censorate, Central Judicial Office, and the Department of Discipline and Supervision... are only institutions. Laws can only be proven just when enforced by someone.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_007: Rhodes Island's ideals conflict with my beliefs. However, I do recognize the necessity of seeking common ground while understanding our differences... The same is true when providing assistance in exchange for information.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_008: No matter where I am, the electricity flowing through my body never ceases. The thunderbolt is the symbol of justice; it drives me forward and sometimes even wakes me up at night... Someone is complaining that I broke the AC unit? ...How rude! How is that possible?! I don't even need to use a remote for the AC, let alone touch it!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_009: Blaze was implicated in a major incident. All the clues have purposely been eliminated, but I have my doubts about the way the facts of the case are connected based upon a few coincidences between certain persons and times. This has nothing to do with you, but you should take adequate precautions. All I can do is offer you a fair warning.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_010: You can't even properly manage your physical condition... how slovenly! Look at you sprawled out like this... Were you waiting for me to put a blanket over you or something? ...There won't be a next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_011: I've signed obtained an investigation authorization with your company. Don't worry about it, this is purely over personal matters. If you so wish, you may call me Leizi. Who am I? Have we met before? Are you serious?!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_012: I see, this is a completely different principle from military training.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_013: Elite status? Is this... a promotion? The promotion process at Rhodes Island seems to differ from that of ordinary private companies...
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_014: I, Leizi, am the bearer of the thunder and the law, the vision and reach of Great Yan. My philosophy does not align with that of Rhodes Island, and I have no intention on bridging the gap between the Infected and non-Infected. However, we can now fight side by side against our enemies!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_017: With my own eyes, I shall judge what power Rhodes Island possesses.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_018: I can do that, yes, albeit at a price.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_020: I have no interest in the identity of my enemies.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_025: Rise, thunder of the five elements!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_026: No forgiveness unto sinners! Retribution of thunder!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_027: Through the three thunders is justice governed!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_028: The essence of Lei Fa... is my will becoming one with Terra.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_029: Well done. As my standards are quite high, you should be proud of yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_030: Unacceptable. You can do even better! Do not rest upon your laurels - you have the ability to strive for greater heights!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_031: Impossible, what happened? How can this be?
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_032: Shameful...! Begone, you! Go back and reflect! I will hold back the enemies, so just go!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_036: Oh... did that hurt? Please be careful of the static electricity around me.
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_038: A year's planning is done in the spring—and though it may not be spring yet, do you simply plan to idly loaf around at a new year's outset? You should still sharpen yourself on holiday. As the saying goes, the man who catches fins for one day then rests for two, will find himself slothful with dust on his shoe. Heeey! If you keep slacking I'll have finished annotating these documents myself!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_043: Ahem. Judicial Review Office Censor Leizi expresses good wishes on Dr.{@nickname}'s birthday. May your life be ever warm as spring, and of peace and prosperity... Hey, I'm being deadly serious! Don't laugh!
dialogue_tracker.char_306_leizi_CN_044: With the mystery I'm investigating still an open question, I cannot unreservedly trust Rhodes Island. However, in my days lodging here, I've witnessed physicians benevolent and adroit, warriors heroic and unyielding. Even if our beliefs differ, I still have considerable respect for your investments and efforts.
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_001: Doctor, we can't waste even one single precious minute! One minute could mean a loss of millions on the account with extra casualties on the field! Huh? Coffee? I take it with a sachet of sugar and heavy on the milk foam, thanks!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_002: They say Rhodes Island is a criminal organization, full of Infected people dirtying up the corridors. But that couldn't be further from the truth. Rhodes Island's Operators are giving their lives to make things better for everyone, just like the police force of Lungmen!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_003: Hear me out, do you think we could redesign the instructors' office? At least add a bit of flavor to it, maybe a handmade rug or some atomistic art whatnot. It's just so bland now. Dobermann might say she doesn't care, but it really kills my enthusiasm...
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_004: Ahhh, that awful Ch'en isn't here, is she? Back when we were in the L.G.D. together, she shot me this dirty look every time we bumped into each other. It made me wonder if I've done anything bad! I just... kinda want to take over the L.G.D. myself. That couldn't be bad, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_005: Exercise, study, training, researching my competitors and market shifts... Gotta keep them up!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_006: I've been allowed to set aside the family business for a while.
