But it's clear to me that the future of Lungmen needs both a stable public sector and security apparatus, as well as a healthy business and financial system. In both respects, I'm ready to be of service to Lungmen!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_007: Lungmen bureaucracy is complicated, even for us. Keeping the peace, protecting the people, directing traffic, negotiating trade... Agh, it's absolutely backbreaking. But as long as what we do is good for Lungmen, I'll be—hehe—very pleased.
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_008: Doctor, why is Rhodes Island's training course so short...? Insufficient capital? Unacceptable, I'm requesting an immediate transfer to the business division! It's-it's not as if I like business, but if you need me to do it, I'm... more than capable!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_009: You know, Doctor, Lungmen could use someone as talented as you. So, well... If you're not enjoying this line of work, there's plenty of opportunities in the banking and management sectors! I-I can get you a job! Oh? You'd rather we work with Rhodes Island? ...Fine!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_010: Uughh... I'm exhausted... Two shifts in a row really does... zzz... zzz...
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_011: Swire, Senior Superintendent of the L.G.D.. I'll be joining Rhodes Island as a training consultant. Dr. {@nickname}, I'm looking forward to working together with you for the future of Lungmen!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_012: Hmm, as far as tactical theory goes, this is a decent application!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_013: A promotion? Hmm? But it doesn't do anything for me back in Lungmen, does it? Well, if you insist, I suppose I will accept it!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_014: Maybe it's that you want me to improve your relationship with Lungmen. Or, possibly, you truly need my talents. I suppose it could be something else you want, too... I'm not sure exactly what, and I can't promise it'll be on offer. But I'll be a stalwart with you to the end.
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_017: Aha~! You finally need my wisdom!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_018: Everyone, follow my orders to the letter!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_019: Wipe them out in one fell swoop! It's cheaper that way!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_020: Let's finish this quickly. My time is far too precious!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_022: I've seen through the enemy's strategies!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_023: This is far from my only battlefield!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_024: Business competitor or not, you will get a lesson from me!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_029: Fantastic! In battle as in business: high risk, high return!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_030: Capital is all mergers and acquisitions! Victory is like investigation and arrest!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_031: ...Bad... just bad... You can do better, can't you? We'll work it out together. Don't give up!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_032: How could this have happened? How could I... How could I have blundered so badly?!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_033: Not bad... No, I think this room could use some more renovation!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_036: How... How about we go for dinner together? M-my treat!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_038: Happy New Year! Look at this crowd! So many people here! I brought some Lungmen street food with me... I-I didn't bring it for you guys! I wanted to have some myself! Right, if Ch'en has any, make sure she pays for her share. Call it a handling fee.
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_043: Look at you always wearing that outfit. You gotta at least change your shoes sometimes. Here, look what I've brought for you. Dark, flat, no design sensibility whatsoever. The brand I usually wear just got a bunch of new styles, and I picked out a few pairs for you based on your tastes. But looking like that, nobody will be able to tell they're luxury branded! What a waste!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_044: I went against my grandfather's wishes by becoming a cop, but I believe it was the right choice for me, not that it's easy. This isn't just to take control of my own life. More than that, it's for Lungmen's future. Hey, don't think Ch'en's the only one who thinks about this stuff. Just like her, I have much to do in the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Doctor, we can't waste even one single precious minute! One minute could mean a loss of millions on the account with extra casualties on the field! Huh? Coffee? I take it with a sachet of sugar and heavy on the milk foam, thanks!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: They say Rhodes Island is a criminal organization, full of Infected people dirtying up the corridors. But that couldn't be further from the truth. Rhodes Island's Operators are giving their lives to make things better for everyone, just like the police force of Lungmen!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: Hear me out, do you think we could redesign the instructors' office? At least add a bit of flavor to it, maybe a handmade rug or some atomistic art whatnot. It's just so bland now. Dobermann might say she doesn't care, but it really kills my enthusiasm...

Back when we were in the L.G.D. together, she shot me this dirty look every time we bumped into each other. It made me wonder if I've done anything bad! I just... kinda want to take over the L.G.D. myself. That couldn't be bad, right?

dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: Not bad... No, I think this room could use some more renovation!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: How... How about we go for dinner together? M-my treat!

I wanted to have some myself! Right, if Ch'en has any, make sure she pays for her share. Call it a handling fee.

But looking like that, nobody will be able to tell they're luxury branded! What a waste!
dialogue_tracker.char_308_swire_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: I went against my grandfather's wishes by becoming a cop, but I believe it was the right choice for me, not that it's easy. This isn't just to take control of my own life. More than that, it's for Lungmen's future. Hey, don't think Ch'en's the only one who thinks about this stuff. Just like her, I have much to do in the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_001: Hm? Ah, this soil... it can murmur. It can dance. It is my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_002: Miss Closure told me I shouldn't walk about Rhodes Island 'fully equipped'... but I'm not used to... revealing... myself. Sorry...
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_003: Thank-you letters? Ah, from the Sarkaz workers yesterday? My equipment and type of Arts are a good match for physical work. Besides, their materials and fuel weren't featherweight. And they relied on the power of flesh and blood to ensure Rhodes Island sails smooth... it's incredible.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_004: That elite operator... I thought I'd seen enough bizarre Originium Arts in Leithanien to write any wild fantasy. But the moment he pushed apart the fog with a wave of his hand, I understood, as a Sarkaz, he was young yet incredibly ancient.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_005: I often think of the soldiers and companions that have left us. Sometimes, I have a sort of delusion that even now, I'm still fleeing... Doctor, have you been to Kazdel before? That was where my journey started, and once, where I'd thought it would end.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_006: Dr. Kal'tsit, huh... She startled me, but she's reassuring in spades... One thing, though. Rhodes Island seems to get along well with another mercenary group, too. Could you tell me about them, Doctor? It's best I don't know? I see... then I think I can more or less guess who.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_007: I became a Rhodes Island Operator so they could be treated properly, live on properly, and only then would those warriors... have died with meaning. But... since coming to Rhodes Island, I've seen clearly what I, myself, am truly fighting for. That was a first for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_008: Me, alone, talking to a clay doll...? You're... you're telling you saw me? That was just a kind of ceremony... huh? So everyone already knew? Really? Then I'll be more careful next time, do it late when nobody's up... um, I shouldn't?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_009: From Kazdel to Leithanien, so many marks have been carved onto the suffering. The moment they had no choice but to fight, I realized I had nothing at all. How do you see me, Doctor? You trust me? Will that trust... allow me to live on?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_010: ...The person napping there is the Doctor. Remember that well. Our road together is sure to be long and far.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_011: Sarkaz mercenary, Mudrock... You're the Doctor, then. Rhodes Island has saved me many times, and now, I'd like you to let me return the favor.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_012: I've had a taste of how Rhodes Island fights before, but, well, this still makes a great reference...
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_013: I used to be known as Reunion, and then under the Mudrock Squad, and now... I've been promoted by my former enemy. Is this what they meant by 'life is a rollercoaster?'
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_014: Hm? This seems fresh? I never take my helmet off in battle, after all... There's a lot of reasons why, but things have changed now. S... staying like this? If I have to...
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_017: I'm simply a Rhodes Island Operator, now. I'll obey your command.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_018: The captain... I don't like leading, but... I'm used to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_025: The land is as my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_029: Running is useless... resist it, even if you are not willing to resist. This is the only way I've come to know to face suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_030: My friends are whispering their celebration. They cheer our victory, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_031: Chase them... I'll watch over the battlefield with my friends' eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_032: It's not the first I've fled with my back to the enemy. If even more can live on this way... I'll cover your backs.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_033: The ceiling's... a little lower than I imagined.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_034: ...Mm? Did you touch me just now?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_036: Doctor? Could you stay with me for a bit? I'd like... to ask you a little about Kazdel. Ah, and my friends have missed you, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_038: The New Year? I see. Another year has passed. I... never liked days like this before, the whole idea of 'out with the old, in with the new.' What we lost has always left a much deeper impression on me than what we gained, but maybe things are slightly different now. Mm—may I join in for the dinner party? Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. This is for you. Ah, it's a stone sculpture of my making, not a 'friend.' 'Friends' aren't to be treated as presents. Do you like it? I could teach you, sometime, to converse with my friends. Would you be interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok#1_CN_044: In the beginning, all I wanted was to survive. But before I knew it, the responsibility of leading my companions fell on my shoulders too. I want to find myself, and my companions, a home. Doctor, should I keep walking with Rhodes Island, will I be able to?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_001: Hm? Ah, this soil... it can murmur. It can dance. It is my friend.
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_002: Miss Closure told me I shouldn't walk about Rhodes Island 'fully equipped'... but I'm not used to... revealing... myself. Sorry...

dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_038: The New Year? I see. Another year has passed. I... never liked days like this before, the whole idea of 'out with the old, in with the new.' What we lost has always left a much deeper impression on me than what we gained, but maybe things are slightly different now. Mm—may I join in for the dinner party? Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. This is for you. Ah, it's a stone sculpture of my making, not a 'friend.' 'Friends' aren't to be treated as presents. Do you like it? I could teach you, sometime, to converse with my friends. Would you be interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_311_mudrok_CN_044: In the beginning, all I wanted was to survive. But before I knew it, the responsibility of leading my companions fell on my shoulders too. I want to find myself, and my companions, a home. Doctor, should I keep walking with Rhodes Island, will I be able to?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_001: Sorting files? Whoa, I've suddenly gotten this headache. I can't take it, I need a break. Well, keep at it, Doctor. Such little paperwork should be a walk in the park for you, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_002: A job? Of course, I'm all ears. Or maybe you'd like something a little spicier than detective work? Some wet work? Haha, just pulling your leg. We don't do that sort of thing. We're fine, upstanding citizens running a legitimate business.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_003: Having Waai Fu and Hung around to keep an eye on that Aak boy really saves me a broken back. I'll admit, it's shameful, but I started out babysitting these kids, and now they're all taking care of me. Kids these days do more than we did when I was young, and that's great.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_004: It's thanks to your patronage that the agency is still running smoothly, give or take. Lungmen's a place with the human touch—live there long enough, and sooner or later you'll know a crowd, find the right connections. We don't like spilling blood in our line of work—always best to solve things friendly.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_005: How do you like it, Dr. {@nickname}? Jaye makes mean finballs, doesn't he? Old Tung taught that boy his trade and his way of treating people. It all combines for a flavor unique to Lungmen. Come on, have a try. It'll warm you up.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_006: Under this heading, you had the third row on the left here wrong, so I patched that up, no need for thanks. Oh, do I come off very fluent? Not at all, this is still my first time accounting on a scale so small outside of the agency. Things used to be very—ah, I'm getting distracted, don't you mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_007: Why are the lights all on at this hour... oh? Ah, Dr. {@nickname}. Are you still processing battle records? Well, I never thought you were such a workaholic. I'm impressed. But! You'd better turn in sooner. It's not worth it to break your body doing it.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_008: Everyone's chasing fame and profit. But after so many winning and losing, how many people get to end up as what they like? Living a decent little life of your own is sometimes a lot to ask for. Ah, what are we all doom and gloom for? I'll go stir-fry something up, so you wait for me, Dr. {@nickname}. A drink together would be even better, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_009: My hexagram says to avoid going out, so I'll pass on this mission today... what, I can't? I have to go, no two ways about it? Hah, I see. Then this is a special exception, once only! I'm lending you a hand, so dinner's on you tonight! Look, I'm all decided! This is the joint!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_010: Why a busy life when you can have a leisurely cup of tea. *gulp* Dr. {@nickname}, you do keep some good tea leaves here.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_011: Hello, hello there, you must be the Dr. {@nickname}? You've been looking after my employees for me. They haven't made trouble for you, have they? Oh, that reminds me, here's a card for my agency. Take it, go ahead.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_012: How about a quick scrap? No, no, I'm just joking. I'm no good in a fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_013: A promotion...? There's a first for me. Feels quite fresh, too. I think times like these call for some magic words—thank you very much, boss?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_014: Life goes by in a flash. If you're always jostling for the lead, when do you stop to smell the roses? Don't think too hard about things. Enjoy the moment. No matter how paranoid you are, it'll happen if it's going to happen. And you've dealt with it, all's right with the world.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_017: Do I have to come along too? *Sigh*... fine, fine. Let's get going.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_018: Good. Follow my instructions closely, then. Alright, everyone, dismissed—wait, hold it, don't head off for real! I was joking! Joking!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_019: It's like we're on a school trip here, eh?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_020: Fortune favors the bold, but you still need a few tricks up your sleeves to win the battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_021: I'm sure you can sort them... wait, hold it. Am I up now?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_022: There, there. Put your worries to rest. I'm right here.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_023: Hello, friends, what are we talking about?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_024: Time for a little telling off. But not too harshly.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_025: Come on, man. Friendliness is good for business.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_026: Hey, buddy! Calm it down! You nearly spilled my tea!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_027: My friends, I implore you to reconsider-- Is there REALLY no room for negotiation here?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_028: *Grumble* I told you. Don't get so worked up.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_029: My thanks. It couldn't have happened without you, Dr. {@nickname}... I owe you for this one. I won't forget.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_030: Well done, Dr. {@nickname}. What, where was I just now? Well, given your capability, it was better for me to be your moral support. Cheered the whole time, you see.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_031: Now, now, hold it! Do not press an enemy at bay. Let them run free.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_032: Risky, risky. There's a terrifying fortune to get. Thank goodness we run fast.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_033: Dr. {@nickname}? Here, take this. Decorate your room with it. Ah, but not at the head of your bed. What does it do? Haha, now that would be telling.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_034: I'm sure we can talk this out, nice and easy. No need for physical contact, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_036: No smoking here? But this isn't a cigarette, it's white stick candy. You don't believe me? Go on, try some.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_038: I'm getting old here—I nearly forgot it was a holiday today. So, how about an auspicious word or two from your partner? Here's to Rhodes Island business thriving and—erm, no, that's not right for the occasion. One more try. Ahem, 'May our health be rude, and our pillboxes grow dusty,' there we go, stay safe and all's well, Doctor. Hope your New Year is hale and hearty.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_042: Welcome to Lee's Detective Agency, do you have any work... Well if it isn't Dr. {@nickname}!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Eh? How did I know it was today? Haha, how could I forget? You're one of my biggest clients, a little human touch is the least I could... Okay, okay, no more jokes, Dr.{@nickname}. Go ahead, please, accept this meager token. Friendship is friendship, and we're past all that other stuff.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_044: 'Boiled cactus', 'Over the Lung Gate', and 'Boat of a Reed'. It's hard to make these dishes any other time of year, but I present them to you today. You know, Doctor, people can't strain their minds all the time, and it's necessary to let go every now and then. You've been working for all of us, and for that, you deserve some real praise, Doctor. Thank you for what you have done.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Sorting files? Whoa, I've suddenly gotten this headache. I can't take it, I need a break. Well, keep at it, Doctor. Such little paperwork should be a walk in the park for you, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: A job? Of course, I'm all ears. Or maybe you'd like something a little spicier than detective work? Some wet work? Haha, just pulling your leg. We don't do that sort of thing. We're fine, upstanding citizens running a legitimate business.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: Having Waai Fu and Hung around to keep an eye on that Aak boy really saves me a broken back. I'll admit, it's shameful, but I started out babysitting these kids, and now they're all taking care of me. Kids these days do more than we did when I was young, and that's great.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: It's thanks to your patronage that the agency is still running smoothly, give or take. Lungmen's a place with the human touch—live there long enough, and sooner or later you'll know a crowd, find the right connections. We don't like spilling blood in our line of work—always best to solve things friendly.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: How do you like it, Doctor? Jaye makes mean finballs, doesn't he? Old Tung taught that boy his trade and his way of treating people. It all combines for a flavor unique to Lungmen. Come on, have a try. It'll warm you up.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: Under this heading, you had the third row on the left here wrong, so I patched that up, no need for thanks. Oh, do I come off very fluent? Not at all, this is still my first time accounting on a scale so small outside of the agency. Things used to be very—ah, I'm getting distracted, don't you mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: Why are the lights all on at this hour... oh? Ah, Doctor. Are you still processing battle records? Well, I never thought you were such a workaholic. I'm impressed. But! You'd better turn in sooner. It's not worth it to break your body doing it.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: Everyone's chasing fame and profit. But after so many winning and losing, how many people get to end up as what they like? Living a decent little life of your own is sometimes a lot to ask for. Ah, what are we all doom and gloom for? I'll go stir-fry something up, so you wait for me, Doctor. A drink together would be even better, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: My hexagram says to avoid going out, so I'll pass on this mission today... what, I can't? I have to go, no two ways about it? Hah, I see. Then this is a special exception, once only! I'm lending you a hand, so dinner's on you tonight! Look, I'm all decided! This is the joint!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: Why a busy life when you can have a leisurely cup of tea. *gulp* Doctor, you do keep some good tea leaves here.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: Hello, hello there, you must be the Doctor? You've been looking after my employees for me. They haven't made trouble for you, have they? Oh, that reminds me, here's a card for my agency. Take it, go ahead.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: How about a quick scrap? No, no, I'm just joking. I'm no good in a fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: A promotion...? There's a first for me. Feels quite fresh, too. I think times like these call for some magic words—thank you very much, boss?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: Life goes by in a flash. If you're always jostling for the lead, when do you stop to smell the roses? Don't think too hard about things. Enjoy the moment. No matter how paranoid you are, it'll happen if it's going to happen. And you've dealt with it, all's right with the world.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_017: Do I have to come along too? *Sigh*... fine, fine. Let's get going.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: Good. Follow my instructions closely, then. Alright, everyone, dismissed—wait, hold it, don't head off for real! I was joking! Joking!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: It's like we're on a school trip here, eh?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: Fortune favors the bold, but you still need a few tricks up your sleeves to win the battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_021: I'm sure you can sort them... wait, hold it. Am I up now?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_022: There, there. Put your worries to rest. I'm right here.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_023: Hello, friends, what are we talking about?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_024: Time for a little telling off. But not too harshly.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_025: Come on, man. Friendliness is good for business.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: Hey, buddy! Calm it down! You nearly spilled my tea!
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: My friends, I implore you to reconsider-- Is there REALLY no room for negotiation here?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: *Grumble* I told you. Don't get so worked up.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: My thanks. It couldn't have happened without you, Doctor... I owe you for this one. I won't forget.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: Well done, Doctor. What, where was I just now? Well, given your capability, it was better for me to be your moral support. Cheered the whole time, you see.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Now, now, hold it! Do not press an enemy at bay. Let them run free.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: Risky, risky. There's a terrifying fortune to get. Thank goodness we run fast.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: Doctor? Here, take this. Decorate your room with it. Ah, but not at the head of your bed. What does it do? Haha, now that would be telling.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: I'm sure we can talk this out, nice and easy. No need for physical contact, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: No smoking here? But this isn't a cigarette, it's white stick candy. You don't believe me? Go on, try some.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: I'm getting old here—I nearly forgot it was a holiday today. So, an auspicious word or two from me, for good fortune? Here's to Rhodes Island business thriving and—erm, no, that's not right. 'May our health be rude, and our pillboxes grow dusty,' there we go, best we wish everyone well. You want your New Year to be hale and hearty, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Welcome to Lee's Detective Agency, do you have any work... oh, er? So it was you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Eh? How did I know it was today? Haha, how could I forget? You're one of my biggest clients, a little human touch is the least I could...  Okay, okay, no more jokes, Dr.{@nickname}. Go ahead, please, accept this meager token. Friendship is friendship, and we're past all that other stuff.
dialogue_tracker.char_322_lmlee_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: 'Boiled cactus,' 'leaping Lungmen gate,' or 'river on a reed?' What should we try? It's hard to get a hold of these dishes at any other time. I'm treating you all today, you hear. It won't do to strain your mind all the time, you need to let go now and then. Thanks for your hard work, Doctor. The things you do deserve some real praise.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_001: Doctor, do you need my help transporting anything?
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_002: This noisy metal music... sounds like Exusiai is throwing another one of her parties again. Doctor, should I go reprimand her?
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_003: I'm quite good with manual labor. I also know a bit about company management as well. So, Doctor, is there anywhere I can be of use?
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_004: My parents were the first generation to settle in Lungmen, so I'm actually a Lungmen native... Doctor, if there's anything you'd like to learn about it, I wouldn't mind helping you out.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_005: Doctor, if you want to know how a real logistics company operates, it'd be best to just ask me directly. Penguin Logistics is more of an exception than the rule, and though I don't mean this in a bad way, they don't have any reference value whatsoever.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_006: What do I like to do outside of work? Other than just resting, I'll sometimes accompany Croissant on her shopping trips and make sure she doesn't waste too much money... Doctor, do you also want to come along?
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_007: I used to believe that for any company to survive in the long run, standardization and efficiency were of critical importance. That's why at first, I couldn't fathom how a company like Penguin Logistics could stay afloat.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_008: After getting to know more about the people at Penguin Logistics and talking to them, I began to understand that the world is much broader than I had thought. There's nothing wrong with structure and rules, but they don't necessarily apply to everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_009: Doctor, perhaps you haven't realized this yourself, but the fact that you can unite so many people with very different personalities under one banner is no simple feat... It'd be great if I could become more like you one day.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_010: Doctor... You're taking a nap? I guess it can wait. Guess I'll start tidying up the place first.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_011: Pleased to meet you, Doctor. My name is Bison. According to the terms of our contract, I will now also be a member of Rhodes Island. I look forward to working with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_012: Thank you very much. I will make sure to learn from this.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_013: Thank you very much, Doctor. As long as I put my best foot forward, my hard work will be rewarded. This is what I believe.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_014: At Penguin Logistics and Rhodes Island, I saw a more expansive world than before... Doctor, one day, I will also find my place in this world.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_018: On-site command? I have some experience with that.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_019: Yes, I've noted the mission location and objectives.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_020: Hah... I won't be a burden on the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_021: What would you like me to do?
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_026: Hang in there a bit longer? Understood.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_027: Don't worry, my shield still holds firm.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_029: Way to go, Doctor! You must be the kind of leader that every company wants to have if you wanted to change jobs.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_030: Wow, Doctor... You really are amazing!
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_031: The basic objectives of the mission have been accomplished. This should be good enough, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_032: Don't feel down, Doctor. We'll have another chance.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_033: So this is the inside of Rhodes Island... It sure is big.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_036: Sora's new album is really good.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_038: It's New Year's, so on behalf of MountainDash Logistics, I'm sending formal greetings to Rhodes Island. May everything go well for Rhodes Island's employees, and may you be safe and sound in the coming year. Also, here's a personal card from me to you, Doctor, to wish you a Happy New Year. To another great year working together.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. Please try this bowl of long life noodles. All ingredients have been chosen with care. It has wheat from Yan, fin from Higashi, and the broth is Iberian ham. It took me months to put together, and it was still a rush to get everything in on time. I hope you like it.
dialogue_tracker.char_325_bison_CN_044: My father says the most precious thing to a business is pulling everyone together under the same ideal. At Penguin Logistics and Rhodes Island, I've seen that cohesion for myself. I have to learn from yours and Emperor's examples, in that regard.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_001: I'll be quietly modifying the Raythean Franker over here. You can focus on your work. I won't disturb you.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_002: Why does everyone always keep their distance from Blue Poison? I don't get it... She and I are both special? Umm, alright.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_003: Anything you want to say, Doctor? No? Okay. I'll be here. You can chat with me anytime.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_004: I always lose my appetite when the dorm is too hot... Oh, don't worry about it. It's a family thing, I'm not actually complaining.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_005: Why did I come to Rhodes Island? If I could run as I pleased on these legs, I wouldn't have left my homeland.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_006: Vulcan and I have a similar distaste for 'old things,' but I still think we have fundamentally different philosophies.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_007: So, Doctor, Blue Poison says I always seem to be hiding something. Do I really give people that impression? Sometimes? How…?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_008: It's not that I don't want to talk, it's just that I never got my way much before. So I'm not used to speaking up. Hope you won't take it the wrong way, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_009: Two memories stand out to me. One is the first time I ran with this exoskeleton. My eyes went wide and all was right with the world. As for the other... That would have to be right here, right now at Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_010: Umm? When did the Doctor fall asleep...?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_011: Operator Glaucus reporting for onboarding. So… may I go back to my room now?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_012: Hmm… Okay, I see. I got it now.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_013: I named the weapon, actually. Maybe it represents what I really want in life... Huh? Did they just announce my name for promotion?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_014: Trust in others… Well, I don't know what to do to make them feel trusted, but I'll keep trying.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_018: What? I'm the captain? Did I sign up without realizing it?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_019: I wonder what interesting things we'll find this time…
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_022: Fully charged and ready to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_023: The feeling of standing on dry land…
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_029: No hostile movement detected. Please check your status, team.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_030: No active enemy signals. EMP disabled. Nice work, team.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_031: Some enemies have escaped. Should we give chase?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_032: EMP disabled. We'd better call for backup quick.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_033: No problem, just need to find that screw first…
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_034: Oh… sorry, my mind was wandering.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_036: Mind taking a walk with me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New Year. Present? I haven't thought about it... Oh, actually, I've been hoping to get a fair allowance for battle damage... but I've never had the guts to raise it with Dr. Kal'tsit.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. I have a compass here from my collection. It's for you. Technology keeps marching on, but some stuff still keeps a classic form factor. Isn't that wonderful...? Oh, sorry, I got a little off-track. Anyway, may you never lose your way, on your forward course.
dialogue_tracker.char_326_glacus_CN_044: Being able to run again is such a blessing—I'll never forget what Rhodes Island has done for me. Now I want to help everyone by my own power too, but it still seems like I get in the way more than anything... I'll keep on trying, though. So that someday, I really can be of help to you all.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_001: Don't you just need me to push some papers around? I do this stuff all the time, piece o' cake.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_002: Doctor, hurry up and check out my new video. You're gonna love it.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_003: Yeah, that's the icon. Mind clicking on it for me? And if possible, can you click that icon next to it? Hehe, thanks a bunch.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_004: Raw footage! Ideas! Plotlines! I can't think up any content! I'm gonna lose subs......
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_005: I'm just an amateur explorer. I only plan to take a few shots and then come right back, so I won't be gone for long. Besides, how could being outdoors be as cozy as chilling in my room?
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_006: The folks in the Medical Department must've put some weird ideas in your head again. Look, I admit, I get weird impulses every now and then, but I promise, I'll never cause you any trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_007: My unique skill is video editing. Did you wanna do a Rhodes Island promo, Doctor? Got a plan for me? All righty, let's take a look. Hmm... Rhodes Island precautions, balanced diet videos, fire safety videos... What the hell are these?!
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_008: My instincts are telling me, there's a terrible Feline approaching, Doctor. Don't let your guard down. The moment you're distracted, they'll jump out of a dark corner and smack you to the ground in a single swipe of the paw. Eh? They won't?
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_009: The joy of living together with everyone, and the thrill of finding new things to film go hand in hand! It is for that reason I decided to become an operator, so I can share my happiness with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_010: Time to quietly sneak in a photo op. Mm, just one.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_011: 'Sup everyone, this is the Click Channel! Eh? I'm not allowed to take footage of the Doctor's office? Fine...
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_012: Let me do the filming next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_013: Promotion? Sweet! Let's take a group photo to celebrate the occasion, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_014: Relax, Doctor. This happens every time I get excited, but there's nothing to be afraid of.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_019: Doctor, you'd better not forget anything~
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_020: Let's see what interesting things can be filmed this time~
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_029: That was a sweet clip I just got! Make sure to come by and watch it after you return to the ship.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_030: Wonderful! We can just use this as a real-time battle record!
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_031: I was too caught up with filming that someone slipped through.
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_033: My video studio's about to open!
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_036: Hey Doctor, lemme show you something good!
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_038: Oh! I just got a new idea. Hold on, where's my camera? Anywhere I can set up a tripod? Doctor, help me test this out! When the fireworks go off, you look out the window. I'll take a picture of your eyes—
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_043: Doctor, have you heard of montages? It's when you mix a bunch of different shots from different scenes together. I sometimes catch you commanding when I film my battle records. Ta-dah! Doctor's Commanding Highlights in Ultra HD! It's your birthday present!
dialogue_tracker.char_328_cammou_CN_044: Doctor! It's true that at first, I joined Rhodes Island just to make some money for the road. But now, I'm never gonna leave a company that doesn't charge me for drone repairs! Even if there are a lot of big Felines here! I'm—Ahhhhh! Is that Blaze?!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_001: Doctor, have you ever considered some more... practical ornamentation for Rhodes Island? Such as monastery brewing casks, perhaps…?
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_002: Landen Monastery's clerics form no normal clergy, you know? Rather than prayer, we're much more about taking up arms to defend Laterano... That's how it goes, but our finances have been in a sorry state these past few years. The justice of guarding others with the faith we harbor—surely the Lord permits us that.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_003: Doctor, do you have any interest in beer or bread? Landen Monastery Fermented Goods Contest CCCLXXVII first-place winner, at your service! No need? Ah, alright... Truly, I want our soft, springy bread and fragrant beer to be known across all of Terra. That would do wonders for our revenues!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_004: E—Exusiai? The legend who blew up her alma mater seventeen times in three years? I never thought she'd be here at Rhodes Island... She does seem to have some learned business experts at her side, but the risk of an explosion while rebuilding the Monastery... best not for now.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_005: Different kinds of arrows entail different uses. There may be plenty of capable archers amongst my sisters, but I don't boast when I proclaim that I'm the only one able to adapt multiple combat modes at once! Heheh! At least, out of my year I am!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_006: It was only once I left the Monastery that I realized my arrows may do more than defend the Curia. They can aid so many Infected, beset by injustice... I'm very proud, but occasionally I'll remember the days gone past, where I simply drew my bow, and loosed. Now, every arrow has become so much more weighty.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_007: So as to rebuild the Monastery, my sisters have left to seek cooperation across all of Terra. Landen Monastery, age-old guardian of Laterano, is now a dispatch agency... If only those old men would grant a little more funding. What kind of an excuse is 'better to have a nun trained than a fund gained!?'
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_008: Rhodes Island is a far cry from Laterano, mingling the breadth of diversity in vision and ambition together. It's truly remarkable. Doctor, you must consider coming to the Monastery to teach after you retire. Issues of faith? That'll be no problem! None of us will mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_009: At the start of spring, we'll prune the overgrown vines, and then open up the cellar come evening and retrieve the wine. The moment the setting sun catches through our glasses, we'll down them in one gulp. Ceremony? No, it's just a custom of ours. Life and faith became one long ago, and we don't want to lose it, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_010: I feel like I heard bells... mm, just my imagination.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_011: Cleric of Landen Monastery, Operator Archetto. Today on, I'll be in formal cooperation with you, for the rebuilding of the Landen Monastery famed far and wide! Doctor, if you would, please look over these contract terms!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_012: I see, so this is how Rhodes Island's operators fight! Truly, they're exemplary!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_013: A promotion? My greatest thanks. Hm? I seem at peace? Of course. When you spend five years partaking in commendation ceremonies for outstanding clerics where all peers are absent due to hangovers, these things don't get to you much.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_014: Another promotion? Hmm... all the companies outside seem to strongly emphasize a hierarchical structure. Well, seeing as my excellence has been commended, might Rhodes Island be interested in establishing a long-term cooperation agreement with our Monastery?
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_017: Rhodes Island may see for itself the distinguished tactical prowess of Landen Monastery.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_018: Cooperating with my Sisters, everyone always drowned each other out... but under my command, things may be a little terser. I'll do my utmost.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_028: My bow has three choices, and the enemy three hardships.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_029: 'Long may the Monastery's bells sound.' This is a prayer for victory. Though we've already won!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_030: Now that I joined in this battle, nobody will think Landen Monastery's just an ornament of Laterano, will they?
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_031: Errrr… Please allow me the chance to remedy this! This is my mistake, and in no way represents the Monastery!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_032: Were battles beyond the walls... always so cruel?
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_033: It's too stifling in here. There's near to none of the Monastery's sunshine!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_036: Ah, Doctor, I've been thinking whether I should invite you with me to come see Laterano. Perhaps you'd have more interest in the Monastery then…
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_038: Hm, there may be plenty of Lateran citizens here, but everyone's natures and backgrounds are so at odds with each other. I just want to find a fellow countryman I can calmly pray and toast to the New Year with, but... they're all so…
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_042: May the Lord bless you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. This is a special day of great importance, and I offer you my most heartfelt prayers. May the bell sound to hold sickness and misfortune at bay, and may faith light your way. Also, I'd like you to accept this gift from me—an exquisite copy of a business contract, with all to gain and naught to lose!
dialogue_tracker.char_332_archet_CN_044: A good business partner is one thing, but a companion with whom you can uphold your faith is far more valuable. The weight of drawing one's bow for justice... I am sure all people of Rhodes Island can understand it. Long may the bells sound, that we continue to fight side by side, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_001: There are no security risks in your room, and you can work with peace of mind. I'll stand guard at the door to help you turn down any unnecessary busywork.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_002: The automatic door here is broken? Let me have a look. Hm… Haaaaah! Alright, Doctor, you're clear to go ahead and carry on with your work. I'll contact the maintenance staff.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_003: You want to learn more about Minoan culture? I see, I'll put together a report for you. No, that's not information I can cover in just a few words. I must report it to you in detail.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_004: Mercenaries must always update their pool of knowledge. If you can't keep up with the newest information, you could end up falling into the hands of enemies using the new methods, so there's absolutely no room to slack. I hope you understand this, Doctor. Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_005: What did that Minoan girl in the garden do...? My head feels strangely empty, it's like I'm completely relaxed… This doesn't... seem normal to me. Doctor, I need to rest. I'm sorry, I'm out of service as your bodyguard for the time being…
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_006: Hoooooo, HAH! Looks like I'm in pretty good shape today, maybe it'll feel even better to exercise a bit with the reserve operators. Oh, it's Hell Week? Alright then, I'll have to bug Dobermann again and get her to find a place for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_007: Corinia was built on the scales of merchants. Everyone there wants to squeeze as much as they can out of everyone else. But, people in the other city-states are a lot more interesting. I had all kinds of fun back when I was guarding them. The feeling was a lot like what I get with you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_008: You need to train properly, Doctor. Not exactly, stretching and walks are light exercise. What I'm talking about is real training. It requires a full range of intense exercises, as well as a healthy diet to burn fat and build muscle. Oh, you're fine with that? Good, let me see your results then. Don't be like last time—Hey! I'm not done talking yet, get back here!
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_009: Finished that one too? Want one more bowl? No problem. This is the first time I've made a complete meal. Usually I just fill my belly with some rations and don't cook much. Here's the last portion. When you're done, you'll exercise just like we agreed. That's the whole reason I learned to do this.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_010: Relaxing with a nap? Hehehe, this is a real luxury.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_011: Hello, my new employer. I am Sideroca, a Corinian mercenary. My paperwork is all done. You can count on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_012: These clips are only good for reference. Keep your eyes open in a real battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_013: Each badge is a symbol of trust. I'll accept this.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_014: I'll use my sword to cut down all threats to you. You have my word.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_019: Don't worry, I'll keep an eye on the team.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_023: Let's see what you all can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_028: I'll show you how a Minoan fights!
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_029: Seeing how you command, I feel like my protection might be a little redundant.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_030: What matters is you're alright. Let's get ready to head back.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_031: You had to suffer through that because I was careless. I'm so, so sorry.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_032: No matter what happens... I have to get the Doctor safely back to base…
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_033: It's too messy here. I'm going to have to give it a good cleaning.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_036: Doctor! This training was your idea! Why are you running off? Get back here!
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_038: Doctor, Happy the New Year. We can put your workout regimen on hold for today, but you still have to do some basic exercise. Also, I may have prepared a meal for you, but that's not an excuse to sit here eating the whole time—are you listening to me, Doctor? Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_043: I had this sapling brought all the way from Minos to celebrate your birthday. Find somewhere to plant it. I hope the joy of growth and new life will reach you in your thoughts.
dialogue_tracker.char_333_sidero_CN_044: The more I see of you, the more you unsettle me. Instructors Dur-nar and Dobermann are sharp, no doubt. They're no mercenaries, but still show such attentiveness to their employer. Doctor, I have a few questions I'd like to ask you, in order to better complete the missions you assign me...
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_001: 'Please give any tasks that require doing directly to Lens.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_002: 'Miss Scene is the simultaneous champion of the Nature and Still-Life categories in major photography competitions. If anyone is willing to wait, the probability of winning the Portrait category will also increase significantly. Doctor, do you want to be a model for Miss Scene?'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_003: 'Detecting that the Doctor's patience is fading. Commencing conciliation sequence — there is only less than half an hour left before Miss Scene completes the shooting. Please hold on a bit longer.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_004: 'The Zalak next door is looking for Miss Scene again. Though she hasn't laughed yet, I can tell she's very happy.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_005: 'Truthfully, Miss Scene originally wanted to work as a full-time photographer for a giant photographic equipment company in Columbia, but she ended up as an operator here anyway. According to Lens, it may be because the other party asked her to take pictures that she didn't want to. Indeed, Miss Scene is very picky.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_006: W h e n   y o u   s e e   s o m e t h i n g   y o u   l i k e ,     y o u   h a v e   t o   t a k e   a   p h o t o .
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_007: 'Doctor, are you trying to get Miss Scene to laugh again? In actuality, she is already laughing, but if you want to see it, you'll have to wait, and wait, and wait... and continue waiting until the curvature of her mouth becomes perfect. This process will take time — I can't tell you in exactly how many minutes, but it all depends on how the lass is feeling today.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_008: 'Lens has long been waiting for someone who can understand Miss Scene, but now there are many people in Rhodes Island who are willing to interact with her. This makes Lens very happy, and I wish that one day Miss Scene can find someone who can replace me.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_009: T h i s   c a m e r a.   F o r   y o u .  T h a n k  y o u .   D o c t o r  .
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_011: 'Photographer, Scene, and Robotic Photography Assistant, Lens. We are pleased to make your acquaintance.'  H e l l o .
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_012: 'Please repeat it again. Repeat. Please repeat it again.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_013: 'Accessory upgrade complete. Miss Scene thanks you.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_014: I s   t h e r e   s c e n e r y    y o u   w a n t   t o   s e e ?
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_021: 'Lens is here to work for you.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_029: C o n g r a t s .
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_030: 'Mission complete! Miss Scene is currently being transported back to base.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_031: 'The way back to the base won't be smooth.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_032: 'Please evacuate from the area! Please evacuate from the area!'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_033: 'Please order a hammock for Miss Scene. Thank you for your cooperation.'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_036: W a n t   a   p h o t o ?
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_038: I  n e e d  t o  w i s h  y o u  a  h a p p y  n e w  y e a r  m y s e l f .  H a p p y  n e w  y e a r .  'Me too! Doctor, Happy New Year! Happy New Year!'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_042: H  e  l  l  o  . 'Hello! Hello!'
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_043: H a p p y  b i r t h d a y , T h a n k  y o u  f o r  a l w a y s  l i s t e n i n g  s o  p a t i e n t l y  w h e n  I  t a l k . T h i s  i s  m y  f a v o r i t e  p i c t u r e  t h i s  y e a r . Y o u  c a n  h a v e  i t .
dialogue_tracker.char_336_folivo_CN_044: 'Miss Scene is not well-suited for a lively party like this. She would be at a complete loss. Therefore, Lens will have a drink with her here. Would you like me to help you with anything? Lens's music database has been updated with three new songs. Please press the button here to select one!'
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_001: Doctor, are you ready to work? I won't take no for an answer. C'mon. 3, 2, 1, start.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_002: Nails are part of a girl's appeal. Gotta take good care of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_003: Why do I call myself Utage? Well, it's not that complicated. It means 'Party' in Higashinese, and I just wanna live my life like it's a party every night. If I'm in a good mood, everything else is gonna be okay.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_004: You already saw it, Doctor? Well, that's too bad. Now the only way out is for you… is to come with me and use this two-for-one coupon.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_005: When I got Oripathy and started talking about coming here, my mom was worried about bullying. So she gave me the family heirloom, Shishiou, to defend myself. Didn't find any bullies, but I did manage to cut up some pretty bad guys. Doctor, you really know how to treat a girl.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_006: The people here turn all scary when they get serious. I'm as scary as six of them put together? Really…? Am I that terrifying?
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_007: Doc. Help me pick up ten boxes of limited-edition cookie sticks tomorrow? Just give me an advance on my pay. What? I've advanced the whole thing already? Aww c'mon, there's gotta be something you can do. Please, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_008: Doctor, you're razor-sharp some of the time and dull as a block at others. I don't get why. Oh, I see, right out of that 'How to Talk to Girls' book, huh? I'd expect nothing less from you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_009: It's not good to rely too much on any one person, but maybe the Doctor is an... Eek, Doctor! Oh it's nothing, I was just rambling to myself! D-D-Did you need something from me?
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_010: If you're tired, just go to bed. Not that complicated.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_011: Hey, Doctor. I'm your new operator, Utage. My hobbies are... Oh, I don't need to go into the details? Alright then, I look forward to working with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_013: Do I get work less after I get promoted? No dice? Oh well…
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_014: I guess it's time for me to get serious. Alright, let's crush the bad guys!
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_017: Alright, everyone, I'll be counting on your orders!
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_018: Hmm, team captain… Eh? Me? Captain?
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_020: C'mon, c'mon! I can't wait any longer.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_026: It won't hurt if I don't miss.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_027: I'll take what you don't need.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_028: You look kinda cute when you cry.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_029: Ahh, it felt good to blow off all that steam. Exciting stuff. Let's go for crepes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_030: That was so much fun. Thanks for all the enemies!
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_031: You're saving the stragglers for me? Well, I'll dig right in.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_032: C'mon, Doctor, stop spacing out and start running.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_033: As long as I can get my magazines, it doesn't really matter where I stay.
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_038: Oh, hey, Doctor. Happy New Year! As you can see, I'm trapped under this kotatsu... Hang with me for a bit maybe? It's waaarm. C'mon, just try it, you won't regret it!
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. Did you know? There's a real trick to birthday parties. I could share some hacks with you, like, on the down-low, to really up your popularity at dinnertime. Number one—wait, are these all your presents?! This whole room?!
dialogue_tracker.char_337_utage_CN_044: The dinner party today was, like, killer. That's the kind of thing you should really do every day. Otherwise, you start overthinking things and get all hung up on it. Then stuff gets worse and lose all your optimism for life, which is tough to hold onto. Meh, that's just me babbling to myself, don't worry about it. Anyway, enjoy the happiness you've got in the moment, that's what matters most!
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_001: What? You think this work is going to do itself? Hmph! There's no such fairy who'd finish somebody's work off while they go dozing off. Forget your wild ideas and get your nose to the grindstone, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_002: I and my companions will often receive children who come to the castle. Of course, on occasion we'll have a good and honest adult come lodging, but that sort of person is few and far between.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_003: I came to find a girl named Mabel. Ah, twenty years ago she was a girl. She's a woman by now. ...Codename? How would I know what her codename is? But I know for certain she's here, without a doubt!
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_004: If there's nothing to keep us, then let me take my leave. I'm still quite busy. I have an appointment with the children being treated here, and I'll be telling them stories today.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_005: Children are much better off compared to adults. Children are much more innocent. They have fine qualities. They are the most valuable, cherished thing upon this world.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_006: A beloved rag doll, a pretty flower, a storybook turned until its pages are worn... Children who've come to Wonderland have left much to the castle. Things they believe are precious, that they haven't much way of keeping safe themselves, all can be put into our care.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_007: Now come wisplight and lamplight, come light up the way~ Come to our little tea party to stay~♪ Here come the guards, and they dance and sing for us, carrying scissors to chop-chop away♪ I sang this song about my friends to entertain the children with me. Learned the words? I shan't sing them to you again.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_008: I know. Mabel's no longer with us. You called her Bluishsilver, didn't you? I've seen records... asked after her with her teammates—her tale is so sad. How strange. Though this is the time we'd set, I can't help but feel I was too late...
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_009: 'Wonderland,' 'Slumberland,' 'the Cradle'... have you never heard these names before? Oh, you poor soul. Had no-one ever told you any bedtime stories? ...Sigh. Oh, I suppose. Close your eyes, now. I'd rather not, but let's have you see for yourself, just once.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_010: Oh, really! How do you fall asleep somewhere like this? And the files are all still at sixes and sevens! ...Fine. Seeing that you work so hard normally, I'll help you just this once...
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_011: I am Iris, Master of the Castle of Dreams, Keeper of the Cradle. As per our agreement, I've come to return something a guest once left to the castle... How strange. Why can I not find her?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_012: How barbarous, though it does have its merits.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_013: I'm the master of a castle. If we're to talk promotions, I ought to be giving one to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_014: Right, then! You'll see first-hand the full power of the Master of the Castle! Fairytales uphold such purity, such beauty, and they owe it only to their protectors' sufficient strength. Is Rhodes Island not like this, too?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_018: Listen to my orders, now. Agreements made are not to be violated.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_019: I will lead you all to the proper place.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_020: And those are the people we're driving off, then?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_023: The air is quite thick here.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_024: Hmph! I'll help you just this once.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_025: Would you all like a bedtime story too?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_029: How's that? I've driven them all off, now!
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_030: So this is the taste of victory. Yet... I wonder why I can't feel happy about it...
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_031: Hmph. They've run off by themselves. Doesn't that sort things?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_032: What's going on? Did you fall asleep?! Quick, with me, out of here!
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_033: What a strange place. Is there no larger bed anywhere?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_036: Careful, there, don't ruffle the headdress... yes, quite, comb just like that...
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_038: Another year has gone by. As time passes like this, I always feel a little frightened. The children will grow up gradually, year by year, but I have to wonder, is that a good thing? Doctor, is growing up... something good?
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_043: Are you awake? Do you remember what you dreamt of? An unending sea of iris flowers, a dance at the castle, fireworks under a starry sky. Didn't you feel as though you'd rather not wake up? Those scenes are meant to be reserved for the children, but I can make an exception for you, just this once. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_338_iris_CN_044: By all rights, children are meant to be the hope of our land, yet Oripathy spells such early ends to their lives. Lives I can never even save... I can only hope to protect their fledgling dreams as best I can. That is my ideal, and why I must walk with Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_001: I've noted down your schedule. You can confirm with me anytime.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_002: If it's about making someone bleed, do not send Lady Ceylon to the task. Let those who live amongst the shadow take it over, like me.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_003: I won't tell you anything more about Lady Ceylon. And of course, others won't learn anything more about you from me.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_004: I'm your bodyguard, Doctor. My duty is to protect you, not chat with you. If you want to talk, please stop turning to me like Lady Ceylon does and find someone else.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_005: My expertise? Killing targets, guarding people, and... making tea. Don't be so shocked. After all, the tea Lady Ceylon makes is… Anyway, I'm good at that.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_006: Doctor, based on the danger involved in the missions to date, I believe you need to learn self-defense in addition to my protection. Otherwise, even I can't guarantee your safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_007: Once you've got blood on your hands, there's no turning back… Doctor, I do not wish you to go down the same road as mine. So leave the dirty works to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_008: You want to hear my revenge story? You won't be able to sleep at night, Doctor. But… somehow I do have this strange urge to tell you. Well then, let's hit the bar. This story will take a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_009: Sinners always get what they deserve, I know that. But I do wonder sometimes that... if I could have met Lady Ceylon and you sooner, maybe I'd be more than just a killer. It's still not too late for me? Do you really mean that, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_010: Falls asleep just like that? Can't keep a guard up at all, just like her.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_011: I'm Schwarz, Lady Ceylon's personal bodyguard, here to join Rhodes Island with her. If at all possible, please assign me to accompany her.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_012: I see that Rhodes Island is teeming with war monsters. I can only try to learn their way of battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_013: Now I understand why Rhodes Island wanted me. Your vision is a hundred times crazier than anything I ever did.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_014: Reawaken my memories? I'm fine with it. Maybe you can tame the evil inside us when on battlefields. Please, tame it for us.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_025: I've got you in my sight.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_028: Lady Ceylon may have mercy. I do not.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_029: Doctor, in a dangerous mission like this,  you'd better give you command from as far as possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_030: We got everyone, per your order.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_031: The perimeter is secured. What's next?
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_032: Come, Doctor, I'll ensure your safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_034: ...?! Please, Doctor, I don't want you to hurt yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_038: New Year's? I only looked forward to New Year's when I was very young, then I lost interest, but... Lady Ceylon enjoys it. I used to escort her home from Victoria at the tail end of the year, and she'd tell me what she'd been up to while away at university. Right, Doctor, you can come have a cup of tea with us later if you are interested.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_042: Don't let your guard down even on base, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_043: Here, it's a birthday present. I was there while Lady Ceylon picked out her present, so I chose some fine dishes for afternoon tea to go with the tea set. When you brew your relaxing tea, you can enjoy some snacks along with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_340_shwaz_CN_044: Master Doykos helped me to get my revenge, and gave me a new life, while Lady Ceylon taught me to see a warmer, gentler world. I'm also greatly thankful to you all. Rhodes Island lets Lady Ceylon be firm in her goal, and I can be more confidently clear in knowing where my fight is headed.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_001: I... can take care of some basic tasks, but your assistant should be able to take on a large share of your work. That may be… beyond my abilities.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_002: Prejudice is common between peoples. Before I came to Rhodes Island, I actually thought people outside of Sami left the womb with weapons in their hands... That's not a joke, Doctor. I really did.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_003: You're still bothered by the cold? Hmm... Sometimes, I feel like you're needier than a newborn. Hold your hands out then... Haah... Feel better? You're welcome. Give me a moment, I'll fetch you another blanket.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_004: Yes, I know this is a general education course meant for children. But a shaman's calling is to master all forms of knowledge, whether metal or wood. And my knowledge of the South probably isn't much greater than a local child. So a course like this suits me just fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_005: Fighting is not in Sami nature. But, if you do not become the hunter, then you can only be the hunted. This is true whether facing the elements, the demons... or the people of Ursus. It's the law of nature.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_006: I respect you, and so I give you my word. As long as I am aboard this iron ship, I will not trouble the people of Ursus. But when in Sami, I hope you'll turn a blind eye to... some of my actions. There is always a price to be paid, even if it falls to Ursus rather than a particular individual.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_007: My friends here at Rhodes Island made this outfit not long after I arrived. I was still a stubborn rockhorn back then, unwilling to accept even the slightest bit of kindness. Now... I'm probably not so inflexible. Even the coldest ice melts in the spring sun.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_008: Tribe cannot go on without a shaman. It was painful to part with the branches of my family tree, and let go of the responsibility of protecting my tribesmen. It used to be my only wish to remain in my ancestral home, accompanying the long-withered tree. But now, that is not possible anymore...
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_009: One crystallized eye is enough to turn a woman into a monster. The Southerners use Originium to command metal to move, yet fear that it will grow upon their bodies. Alas, what deadly weapons indifference and fear have become. Though they leave no wounds on the body, they instead bleed the spirit dry.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_010: I wave a twig… for a fresh and healthy year...
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_011: She was born under the tribe's santalla tree, so it became her identity, her codename, and a part of her life. Now the outcast returns to the tribe, regaining the right to use her name. She will commit herself to her new leader.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_012: They do not yet comprehend the enemy's cruelty…
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_013: May the generosity you've afforded me plant the seedlings of joy within your heart.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_014: The curse cannot extinguish the pain in my heart. Since it is conquest that Ursus craves, then let them be conquered by nature.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_017: What do you wish for the battlefield to become?
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_018: Protect our teammates, and victory will be ours.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_019: Look into the distance, and be mindful of your feet. Nature has already warned you of the changes.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_021: Did you have need of me?
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_026: The wild wind plunders your warmth.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_027: The deadly cold sends its regards.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_028: The eyes of Sami witness your end.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_029: Perhaps in your eyes, nature is just another tool.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_031: War is like nature, full of variables.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_032: The blizzard approaches. We should go.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_034: Is there anything I can do for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_036: In Sami, there is no food sweeter than honey. Is this... candy? Hmm... Oh, so sweet!
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_038: Flames represent destruction, but also contain vitality and warmth. The wither and decay has been burned away, and a red light spreads across this land. Regardless of what difficulties you may face in the future, please do not forget today's vision of passion.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_042: I am here, by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_043: Congratulations on completing another annual cycle of your life, Doctor. This should be the day when your strength is most abundant, so if there's anything you'd like to achieve, now is the time to start.
dialogue_tracker.char_341_sntlla_CN_044: Many tribes prepare to leave their homeland behind and go south, whereas many warriors bade farewell to their loved ones and are making their way north. The Sami people seem to be splitting in two, never to see each other again. I cannot change this, but all I hope... is for everyone to be safe and sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_001: You should take a little break. It's good for you. Of course that is true, aren't you glad to hear that?
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_002: Those who chase Catastrophes are called 'Yakumeguri', or as they say here, 'Catastrophe Messengers.' The job is bitter and tiring, and we are often ridiculed by ordinary civilians and bureaucrats alike. Will my lot improve as an operator? No? Hehe, such is life.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_003: Tomorrow's weather... hmm, I see... My dear boss, remember to bring an umbrella with you when you leave tomorrow.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_004: If I could have stayed in Higashi, I would not have come all the way here. But with these stones on my flesh… there's simply nowhere to call home.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_005: I would rather offer my salary to those in need than stash it away in my lodgings. Considering how little there is, it serves a better purpose in the hands of the needy. Besides, their smiles and words of thanks really warm my heart.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_006: I often wonder if the strange words that occasionally spill from my mouth are born of my own consciousness, or if they are bestowed upon me by the Kami-sama I have never met. The ritual verses of my relatives are all drawn from age-old scriptures, but I've always blurted mine out. It is quite confusing, to be honest.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_007: Again and again we prance, posture, sing, and pray, with no tolerance for the slightest discrepancies. Some people find joy in filling their lives with these things, and tell others that it will bring joy to the high heavens. How truly sinful.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_008: My clan and I lived in the mountains, not far from a Shinto shrine. At the foot of the mountain was a Buddhist temple, where the monks would return at night. Now for the question, Doctor. What do you think would happen? Hehe, I shall leave the answer on your table, feel free to take a look when you have time.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_009: Up so late, Doctor? Do you still have something on your mind? Thoughtful eloquence is your strong suit, but don't let it get in the way of your sleep. Here, I have some incense from Higashi for you. Just one sniff, and you'll... Oh my, I didn't expect it to be this effective. Well, I suppose I shall stand guard for you tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_010: Close your eyes, and calm your mind. Good~
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_011: Pleased to meet you. It simply would not do if I was to forget my introduction, yes? I am Tsukinogi, formerly part of a small Yakumeguri group in Higashi. It is an honor to work under you.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_013: Oh, a reward? Now, now, how should I use this?
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_014: The white night is a raging fire, through which a dark haze lingers. I asketh thee, where dost thy steps cease? Take things one step at a time, and do not stray off the path.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_017: I will not fall short of your expectations.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_018: Great is the responsibility of leading others.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_019: The time has come. Let us go.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_020: There are more important things to do than pray.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_026: Drown in the gloaming, lost in silence.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_027: Land unending, we walk in ignorance.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_028: Back down, before this exalted brilliance!
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_029: I was not able to help at all, but that is a cause for celebration.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_030: Congratulations! A perfect conclusion to this mission.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_031: The small issues that besmirch our results can be left to me. You may take your leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_032: Reckless moves often bring bad results. Let us reflect upon our plan once more.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_033: I have no demands of my accommodations, so please assign me as you will.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_036: If there is anything displeasing to you, please let me know. Yes, anything at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_038: What was the first word you said this year? Hmm... I do believe that is a fortuitous omen. Rhodes Island will be blessed by good fortune this year. Congratulations.
