dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_043: Here, give me your hand. Don't be nervous. Just follow my steps... Look, our hair flutters in the breeze risen by the movement of my arms, and our clothes sway in an elegant arc. Sharing a dance together is a beautiful thing, wouldn't you agree?
dialogue_tracker.char_343_tknogi_CN_044: Oh my... It has been quite some time since we were able to have fun like this. Sure enough, many things become enjoyable once you discard the formalities. {@nickname}, sit here. You are not allowed to go anywhere until this bottle of wine is empty.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_001: Doctor, you'll be working hard today? Then, I'll stay with you. If you slack off, then I'll use this staff... Like this... and give you a smack on the head. Bonk, bonk.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_002: Beeswax, Beeswax, Beeswax... Mm, okay. I should get used to it after reading it a few more times. Oh, Doctor, do you need something? I'm just trying to get used to hearing my code name... so I don't fail to react and get made fun of when others call me.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_003: This bug... Midnight seemed very scared of it and jumped up into the air as soon as he saw it, so I helped him catch it. But, where should we put it now... Um, Doctor, why are you backing away?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_004: My clothes are a bit big, so I feel at ease when they drape over my body. I like that sensation. But, sometimes, I'll accidentally step on them—Uu, uwah, ahh...! ...Fweh, I tripped again... Ow…
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_005: The new piece the Folk Song Association put out this month is my new favorite song. Oh, you've never heard of them before, Doctor? The full name is the Folk Song and Originium Arts Research Association... Still haven't heard about it? What about the Electro-music Arts Alliance? How about the Rap and Folk Joint Vantage? Haven't heard of any of them?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_006: The mark on my head? Ah... this is a ceremonial emblem passed down from generation to generation in my tribe, and it is a symbol of our Golden Gods' blessings on our tribe and our people. The faceless gods will protect us, no matter where we go, whether or not we remember them...
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_007: Leaving the tribe and traveling to other cities and countries is a rite of passage for all our tribespeople. Only by completing it can one become a fully-fledged adult like my sister. Um, Doctor, you believe I can handle it, don't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_008: Hehe, my horns are big and pretty, right? There aren't many people in the tribe who can boast horns like mine! The secret to maintaining them is to apply essential oils once a day, gently massage them with a soft brush—W-Wait, Doctor, I haven't finished today's routine yet, even you can't just touch them like that!
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_009: Doctor, please come here. Mm, okay, close your eyes, and let me touch your forehead. The scorching sun, the raging storm, and waves of golden sand washing across the desert. The gods set foot upon the land where we were nurtured, and bestowed our tribe with their blessings. Now, I will share this blessing with you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_010: Zz... zzz... Sister... you dummy... zzz... mm... H-Huh, Doctor? I fell asleep...? Sleeptalking? Did I say something?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_011: Hmm... Wah, excuse me, I let my mind wander. Hello, Doctor, I am, my code name is... Umm... Ah, I remember! It's Beeswax. Do you like it? My tribe helped pick it for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_012: Hm...? I have to watch all of this?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_013: Promotion? Mm... I don't quite understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_014: Doctor, perhaps the path that lies ahead for Rhodes Island is destined to be long and treacherous, but please remember, the gods' decrees and my blessings... will always be with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_017: Umm... where are we going this time?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_018: I'm the leader...? Even though I'm not sure how you select your team leaders, I'll try my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_020: Someone's over there. Everyone, please be careful.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_023: Over here? Leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_024: The land beneath my feet is the domain of the gods.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_028: This is the blessing of the gods.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_029: May they also receive the blessing of the gods…
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_030: Phew... It's over. Doctor, was I able to be of use?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_031: Ooh, they got away! Mm... but I guess that's fine?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_032: We can't do this anymore, Doctor. I'll hold the enemies back, so please escape!
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_033: What a spotless room... It'd be troublesome if I accidentally spilled sand over it, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_034: W-Woah... I stepped on my clothes again…
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_036: Ah, Doctor, please look at this! I caught another bug!
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_038: Wepet renpet neferet, Doctor. It's an important day, so the first thing I did was a little horn care. Now my friends can come touch them... Oh, touching my horns, you can't feel how well I've kept them? Hm, that's okay. You don't have horns. I don't blame you.
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_043: It's your birthday today, Doctor? Okay. Let me give you my blessing. Please close your eyes and imagine an endless desert. In the desert, a priest knocks the staff on the ground. The sound signifies the gods' blessings are drawing near, and each step kicks up a sandstorm... Huh? Why did you start coughing?
dialogue_tracker.char_344_beewax_CN_044: Even now, I still haven't figured out what my sister is up to. But having traveled with Rhodes Island for so long, I've seen lots of sights like the ones in the magazines, but with my own eyes. When I go back to my people, I'll probably see more clearly the blessings of the gods.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_001: Tabletop, 60 points. Floor, 63 points. Air quality...... 56 points. There's room for improvement, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_002: Have you experienced any bodily discomfort recently? Umm, dry skin, stiff shoulders... dry eyeballs, hair loss, fatigue? ...Very good, just old problems then, nothing serious. As long as you start exercising, these problems should go away in no time.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_003: Life in the Medical Department is just daily meetings, visits around the Island, learning the operators' physical conditions, and developing new drugs. Nothing really fresh or exciting.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_004: Mother, no matter where you are, please watch over me.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_005: Thanks for always taking care of us medics. I feel so much less anxiety while working, and I'm very happy. Of course, there are troublesome things to deal with as well, for example, when Blaze comes back, her body is always covered in blood, each and every time! Does she know how hard it is to clean up those bodily fluids?
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_006: How many times have I told you, don't stay up late, and don't overeat! You just won't listen, right? How are you going to take care of your health then? You might as well spend the rest of your life in that chair!! ...... I'm sorry, I need to go calm down first.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_007: I never quite know what Dr. Kal'tsit is thinking. Has she always been that... unique? I hope I can catch up to her one day, even if it's in just one area.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_008: As long as the wicked can be punished, what's a little bit of criticism? I don't mind spilling these poisons on my enemies. They deserve it.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_009: The word 'Ursus' only gives me pain. I don't want to hear it, not again for the rest of my life. But it's giant, its voice deafening, and I'm the only one it's going to drive mad.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_010: You also know that your previous environmental cleanliness evaluation scores weren't very high, right? If you don't turn things around, Doctor, you'll be on the business end of the Rhodes Island sanitation crane. ... I'll help you take care of these for now, so make sure you clean up the rest in your free time.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_011: I am Folinic from the Medical Department, and I am now participating in field medic missions. Meanwhile, per Dr. Kal'tsit's request, I will also help you manage your health. I look forward to working with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_012: It seems that the volume of drug input was insufficient last time, and it should be able to achieve its intended effect next time at triple the dosage.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_013: Thank you for your acknowledgment. I am simply doing what I should.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_014: One day, I will become as capable a physician as Dr. Kal'tsit. Just you wait and see.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_017: Medical support ready. I'll protect everyone's life.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_018: Medical support has covered the whole squad. The rest is up to you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_019: No problem, I can handle some psychological burden.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_020: Enemy engaged. Prepare for counterattack and treatment.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_024: Permission to attack has been granted.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_026: Don't worry, the effects will kick in soon.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_029: I was able to be of some help, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_030: Saving medical supplies is a good thing, but there's no need for that on the battlefield, is there?
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_031: Luckily, it's just a scratch. Just apply a bandage after cleansing the wound.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_032: Transfer the wounded! Get ready for emergency operation! Prepare for intraosseous infusion!
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_033: Inspection complete. This area is habitable.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_036: Sometimes the things I say to you can be a bit... excessive, but you should also recognize that you have your shortcomings, all right?
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Why don't we take this chance to look back on your health over the last year? Let's see... Forget it. I have to admit my management of your health still has room for improvement. I will work extra hard on that this year.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I prepared a gift for you. This is a neck massager developed by the Medical Department. Why don't you give it a try now? It might hurt a little, but it's good for your health. Hey, don't try to escape. I will manage your health one way or another.
dialogue_tracker.char_345_folnic_CN_044: Ever since my mother went missing, I haven't had a place to call home. Rhodes Island is the closest I have. Dr. Kal'tsit invested her ideals in this company, and so have I. Doctor, bear witness to my determination.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_001: I can be your assistant, but is it okay if I do some craft work here?
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_002: Doctor, if you like excitement, you should probably stay in Siracusa for a while. You won't enjoy it so much after that.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_003: Considering his personality, sometimes even I wonder why no one's beaten Chiave to death yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_004: Doctor, are you interested in DIY? See, the three of us actually design and make our own weapons and outfits. You could join us sometime, if you want.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_005: After cleaning up Chiave’s messes so many times, I’ve realized something: If you want real power, you’ll need to rely on more than just violence.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_006: In Siracusa, most people my age just want to join a famiglia, but there are plenty more who would rather live an honest life instead. Sometimes, I think those are the strongest of us all.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_007: (Yawn) …Oh, sorry, Doctor, I didn't get much sleep last night. Rhodes Island is way too safe. It's taking some time to get used to.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_008: Chiave, Broca, and me. The three of us are like brothers, and we've done all kinds of things together. But, sometimes, I really wonder if this really is the life for us.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_009: To tell you the truth, I wanted to be a public servant when I was a kid. Up until my dad made me pick up a weapon for the first time, that is. I don't mind drifting around with the other two, but I always felt like I was missing something, and I know what it is now. I wanted to become as strong-willed as you are, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_010: Doctor... you're asleep? You sure live a comfy life, heh? I'm pretty jealous.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I'm Aosta. It's thanks to you that the three of us are still alive. If you don't mind, please let us work here for the time being.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_012: Maybe we're still alive only because of a stroke of luck…
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_013: Doctor, is Rhodes Island really a pharmaceutical company? I've got the feeling that we might just be able to take over a Siracusan city if everyone here put themselves to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_014: I think I might just be able to live the life I've always wanted at Rhodes Island... Doctor, could I apply to open a DIY shop here?
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_017: I hope this isn't going to be too much trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_018: I'll give it my best shot.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_020: Guess we don't have a choice. Let's get this taken care of.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_024: Let me give it a shot.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_027: Time to put an end to this.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_029: Doctor, do you enjoy challenging yourself so much?
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_030: I got all of them. I just hope they're worth it.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_031: A few of them got through, but I think we'll be fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_032: Doctor, you go on ahead. I'll clean up the mess here. It's my speciality, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_038: New Year's used to be the three of us hiding in a small room, scraping together a table of assorted dishes to, at the very least, eat something together. And that's all. I never imagined having such a lavish New Year's celebration as this… Don't worry, Doctor, I'll keep an eye on Chiave and make sure he stays out of trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I've never given a gift before, so I'm not sure what you might like… Is there anything in particular you want? Just give me an hour, I may DIY it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_346_aosta_CN_044: Oh, Doctor, I got a lot of orders for props tonight. Did you notice? A whole lot of the decorations hanging around are my creations… Ah, don't worry, I enjoy this festive atmosphere well enough. Would you like me to make you some too? Free of charge, and I'm sure you'll be pleased with the results.
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_002: Doctor, you've been sitting there for a while, that's really unhealthy. Come do some stretches with me! Exercise and recover your energy. That way, you'll be able to work better.
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_003: Doctor, Doctor! She's here at Rhodes Island! Ah, her codename should be Dur-nar now. Anyway, she's really amazing! I've only ever seen her in recruitment ads before! She's also a really good person! She gave me so many snacks, ehehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_004: Doctor, I'm actually pretty lithe for my age, you know. Let me show you a standing backflip! Watch!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_005: This gun? Oh, it's a gun-type Arts... Arts something. Ah, right, Arts Unit! I applied for one out of habit when I came here, but I still prefer my fists over Arts.
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_006: Even though I know I'm very lucky, I only realized how badly other Infected are doing after coming to Rhodes Island... Doctor, what can I do to help? I really want to help them!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_007: ...Hm? Ah, Doctor! I'm writing a letter to my dad. Eh, I haven't introduced my dad to you yet? He's a really amazing policeman, you know! Let me tell you how great he is!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_008: Actually, it was my dad who suggested Rhodes Island. After he found out you could treat Oripathy, he pushed really hard for me to be able to come here. I don't really want to be away from him, but I know that he'll be happiest if I live a healthy life.
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_009: You're really reliable, although dad is still better. Yup, you're now the second most reliable person in my heart! Hehe. Ah, Doctor, I talked a lot about you in my letters to dad. He said he really wants to meet you!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_010: Doc——! Ah, Doctor's asleep. I'll have to be quieter...
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_011: Nice to meet you, Doctor! I'm the new operator, codename Jackie! I used to be an auxiliary police officer in Columbia. Let's get along!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_012: Amazing... It feels even more amazing than dad...
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_013: Eh, am I being promoted? Wow, that's great!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_014: I've learnt a lot living at Rhodes Island... Maybe I can even catch up to dad one day! Doctor, I'll continue to work hard. Please guide me well~
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_024: Time for me to show my power!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_028: I'll do it in one go!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_029: I thought we were gonna lose a few time, but we actually won in the end. Doctor, you're amazing!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_031: Doctor, want me to chase after them?
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_032: Sorry, Doctor. If only I'd put in more effort...
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New Year! This New Year, I'll be celebrating right here at Rhodes Island. Hehe, I've already written to dad, explaining how I'm learning to stand on my own, and how Rhodes Island is a place he can trust. Um, I do feel a bit lonely sometimes. But celebrating with my fellow operators makes up for it!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_043: Doctor! Happy birthday! My dad always taught me birthdays are best spent doing something kind for others. So I'm thinking, how about we head to the kitchen? We can help the logistics operators with today's grocery delivery. Hehehe, who knows? We might just stumble upon some exciting surprises!
dialogue_tracker.char_347_jaksel_CN_044: 'Walk a mile in someone else's shoes before extending a helping hand.' Now I get why the Infected I met before didn't want to accept help or even talk much. I've learned a lot at Rhodes Island. When I return to Columbia, all this will help me become a better police officer.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_001: Doctor, I'll be writing reports or reading nearby, just call when you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_002: I believe you reap what you sow, and have always followed that principle.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_003: Wow, I never imagined Oripathy would have such a trait! This requires immediate testing… Um, Doctor, I'm sorry, but I need to leave now. Hmm, I wonder if there's a suitable subject on base…
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_004: The day is not complete without tea. Would you like a cup too, Doctor? I have the finest Victorian leaves here.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_005: I've been with Schwarz since childhood. I know everything about her, including her past from before we met. Oh, but I won't give that up so easily, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_006: If I could find a cure for Schwarz, wouldn't that mean I could cure other Infected too...? Relax, Doctor, I'm not that selfish. But please also know that Schwarz is dearest to my heart.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_007: Originium research is still a vastly unexplored territory, Doctor. But I just want to find a cure for Schwarz, which is why I longed to join Rhodes Island since I first heard of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_008: Do you know, Doctor, that I despise those who discriminate against Schwarz on account of her infection alone? But here, she is accepted, and I can learn more about medicine. Coming to Rhodes Island was truly the right decision.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_009: No matter how good a leader is, there's still a chance to be blinded by selfish interest, so you must watch out for that, Doctor. Hehe, but still, you don't need to worry that much. As long as I'm around, I'll put you back on the right path anytime you stray.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_010: Falling asleep in a sitting position is a nasty habit, Doctor. Let me get you a blanket, at least.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_011: Hello, I'm Ceylon, graduate of Victoria National University, with a major in Originium research. I start my internship at Rhodes Island today, with Dr. Kal'tsit's approval. Nice to meet you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_012: An excellent application of Originium. Rhodes Island sure lives up to its reputation.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_013: So I'm officially recognized by Rhodes Island? Thank you, Doctor, I'll work even harder.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_014: Rhodes Island does boast terrific Originium research. If I keep working here, I'm sure I will cure Schwarz one day. Doctor, please help me on this path.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_017: A mission? A perfect opportunity to test my Originium Arts.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_019: I wonder if we'll find rare materials along the way?
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_020: Don't panic, handle it with composure.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_023: Leave the support work to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_025: You're all free to focus on the mission.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_027: This one should be better for the present situation.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_029: Phew... I feel like I just wrapped up a difficult experiment. It's tiring, but very fulfilling too.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_030: The enemy should be gone now...  Alright then, I'm going to look around the perimeter.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_031: If I were as good as Schwarz, they wouldn't have gotten away…
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_032: Don't just stand there, Doctor, give me a hand with the wounded!
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_033: Hm, maybe I could talk to the other doctors on base.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_034: Wait, my hair is getting messed up!
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_036: Did the Doctor fall asleep in that chair again?
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Yes, I'll go and chat with my Medical Department colleagues for a while, and then meet up with Schwarz later on. New Year's could never be more interesting at home than at Rhodes Island, and I've sent my father a card in any case.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_042: How are you, Doctor? Care for some tea with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_043: Here's your birthday present, Doctor. I know what it's like. You bury yourself in books or research, and you just can't help forgetting to take breaks. But with a tea set this beautiful by your side, I'm sure you'll be more minded to pause and brew a cup... hm? Oh, don't worry, it wasn't... terribly expensive.
dialogue_tracker.char_348_ceylon_CN_044: I might have gained new knowledge from my predecessors' writings at university. However, only after sailing such a long course with Rhodes Island, have I truly touched on the breadth of this land, and gained all kinds of experience the books never held. Ah, and on top of that, Schwarz is doing wonderfully here. Thank you all for looking after her.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_001: Ehi, Doctor, got anything fun to do?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_002: Tsk, goddamn peppers... I gotta find a way to make them disappear from the canteen forever.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_003: I heard Yanese got some old sayings similar to 'Catch the moment'. Heh, the line I like. Don't you think it suits me very well? The future? Meh, I'll let Aosta chew on those sorts of things.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_004: Oi, Doctor, don't just sit there all day. Why don't we have some fun, like… remodeling your whole office?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_005: Aosta once said I wouldn't live long like this. At the time, I told him, what's the point of long life if I can't do what I want?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_006: Fight for what you want, snatch what you like. I don't know the meaning of the word 'Surrender'!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_007: I think up what to do, Aosta thinks up how to do it, and Broca makes sure we get it done together. That's how we've always gotten by, and it's how we ended up here.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_008: Doctor, what are you doing all frowny-faced over there? If there's anything weighing on you, just lay it on me. I'm good at that sort of stuff.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_009: Say, Doctor, if someday you decide to quit running Rhodes Island, why not come along with us? Chiave doesn't take orders from anyone, but in your case, I'll make an exception.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_010: Ehi, Doctor... You fell asleep? Whatever, I'll be back later.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_011: Yo, are you the Doctor? Hello, and well met. The name's Chiave. Starting today, I'm your goon!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_012: Whoa-ho-ho... Hey Aosta, check this out! Give me a moment and I'll be even stronger than these guys!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_013: Huh? Promotion? What do you mean?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_014: Incredible. There are just too many interesting people here at Rhodes Island. How am I supposed to just stay in my seat? I've gotta get stronger and stronger!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_018: Listen up, everyone, I have a plan!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_019: Haha, let's go make some noise!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_020: Just gotta knock 'em all down, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_024: Haha, I'm gonna end you all!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_027: Yeah, yeah, you've all done a great JOB!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_029: Hah, now this is the fun stuff!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_030: Ah. Where's the challenge in that, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_031: Huh? I left a few? Never even saw 'em.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_036: Yo, Doctor, you're in a pretty good mood.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_038: Doctor! Aosta, Broca, and I have a new New Year's plan. Heh heh, once I tell you, you're in on the game. We're going to swap out all the chocolate sauce in the canteen for Siracusan meat sauce, then— Huh? Doctor, where are you going?! Don't you tell Dr. Kal'tsit!
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_042: Ehi Doc, did you have a good meal?
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_043: Ehi, Doctor, Happy birthday! Ta-dah— Check out this model car. I made it myself. It's yours now. Truth be told, if the conditions were right, I would've built you an actual car. Well, I guess that's a promise. Doctor, come visit me in Siracusa sometime and I'll trade this for a real car.
dialogue_tracker.char_349_chiave_CN_044: Rhodes Island's got all these heavies, plus smart people like you. One day, someday, I'm gonna do something big that'll rock the whole world! At the very least, I'll do it before I die! Uh, I should try to stay alive...? I guess you're right, haha…
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_001: You couldn't even finish the work you're supposed to do, so you're asking me for help?
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_002: Stop sending me to teach people Originium Arts. I have no interest in wasting time with common people.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_003: I'm not here because I have to be. Just because I want to be.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_004: The people I hate most are the ones who ask too many questions. I hope you are not one of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_005: Looks like you understand my Arts now, to some degree. I hope you're aware of the danger as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_006: Before I realized it, these Arts and this staff became my most loyal friends. I don't remember when I gained this power. And of course, I don't actually care.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_007: I have all kinds of memories. I don't know where they came from, and I don't know which ones are really mine. I've been traveling back and forth, from country to country trying to find the source. And now, here I am at Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_008: When I'm all caught up in chaotic memories, there's nothing better than an ice cream to calm me down. I relied a lot on ice cream, when I was alone.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_009: The memories from after I came to Rhodes Island are completely different from the ones before. There's a sense of realism to them. For the first time, I feel like I'm really myself. That's all thanks to you, and the rest of Rhodes Island… What? I am capable of giving thanks where it's deserved, alright?
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_010: Hmph… what a waste of time.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_011: I am Surtr. Are you the Doctor they mentioned? I'll be working at Rhodes Island, starting today. I hope you won't bore me too much.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_013: What? You're starting to value me now that you know my power?
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_014: So it's not my power, but me myself? Hmph, you leave me no choice but to pay it back with hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_020: Are they the ones I'm eliminating?
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_026: You can run but you can't hide!
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_031: Can you not even do such a simple thing?
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_032: If you can't help, just run! I'll handle this.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_033: This room is clean enough, I guess.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_034: I can find my own way.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_038: This day has always irritated me a little. Time goes by one year after another, and my memories also drift further and further away... Hmph, forget it. Hey you, come take a stroll with me on the deck. Maybe some cold wind will help calm me down.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_043: Happy birthday. You remember your birthday, even though you're amnesiac. That has to mean that something really important must've happened on this day… Um, I have your birthday memorized now, and I won't forget it this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_350_surtr_CN_044: For now, I still don't have a way to find my past self, but the process has also shaped who I am today. My days here at Rhodes Island are an important part of that. Doctor, we still have a lot of time together ahead of us. Keep your faith in my sword.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_001: Yo, Doctor! Is it time for my shift? Hmm? I suddenly popped up out of nowhere? Nope, just got here.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_002: C'mon, man, I worked with you on my background check. And I told you a million times: My last job was with Reunion, sure. But I wasn't mixed up in any of the criminal stuff. No guilt here!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_003: If there's one thing I really hated about Reunion, it was the food! If you can even call it food… My team mostly got by on rock-hard black bread. I had to throw it in a pot and simmer it into stew every time. Those people were just brutal on their stomachs.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_004: You must've run into Reunion's 'Wraith' guys a whole bunch of times, right? I was one of those. They sent me to scout stuff, never did any fighting. I used to place bets on who would or wouldn't get seen as a way to deal with the boredom. Thinking back, I guess that was kind of rough on the other guys.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_005: What did I do before I joined Reunion? I was playing hide n' seek with the Infected hunters, duh. With my sneaky little power here, they went home empty-handed every time, haha… But all I could do was hide. And that wasn't gonna help change things for the Infected.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_006: I joined up with the underground because I wanted to help other Infected. But over time, I got jaded, then I stopped being a good guy... Well, at least my hands are 'clean' again. What do I mean by that? Hehe, that's enough questions, friend. Never you mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_007: Look, camouflage Arts are really complicated! First, you gotta actually know the compisition and texture of your surroundings. Then, you memorize the shape of every crack in the wall, and all the colors of all the soil and every tree. If you don't have those down, even your nerves will get you popping out, and then it's only a matter of time until you're made.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_008: You were the only one in the office, and your snacks disappeared as soon as you turned your head? Wow, that's weird. Why don't you leave it to me? I'll solve this mystery and bring the thief right to you. Yep.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_009: So this is a map of the operating area? Let's see… Wow, you're really something. Your strategies are so clever, no wonder Reunion always got their asses handed to them. Okay, I'm moving out!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_011: Where am I? Right in front of you! You can call me Ethan. How did I get in here? Haha! Can't answer that one yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_012: Where was I? C'mon! Right over there! Look at the top left of screen. Top left corner!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_013: Haha, I told you before right? You won't regret putting work into my hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_014: Yo, Doctor. Make sure you remember the little guys like me. I could die in some battle somewhere and nobody would even know I was gone. So please, remember where I am!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_017: The wall moved, right before your eyes? Naw, you're exaggerating, definitely.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_018: Eyyy! I'm the captain now, so you'd all better listen up!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_019: Don't panic if you suddenly notice a missing squadmate.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_020: Time to fight? I gotta hide first!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_026: Violence can't solve all your problems, but it can solve you!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_029: Are we done fighting? Ahh, I'm beat!
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_030: I worked pretty hard. You saw me, right? Right?
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_031: So what if they got away. Just let 'em go.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_032: You should go first, at least I can grab their legs.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_033: Nice room you got here. Let's see what sticks out the most.
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_036: Hey, wanna go for a stroll?
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_038: Bluh, this weather's so nasty my blood's freezing up! That's what gets Savra like us the worst, the cold! Yo, Doctor, turn up the heat a little. C'mon, I'm here to say Happy New Year, don't get mad! Ooh-hoo-hoo, lemme get a nice, hot bowl of soup ready. Gotta fill it with mushrooms and meat...
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_042: Hey, Doctor, somebody looks happy. Did something good happen?
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_043: You're saying you got a present but never saw from who? Huh, that's crazy, must be some paranormal stuff going on here. Why don't we go check the monitors... Hey, wait a sec, you know I'm not for real, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_355_ethan_CN_044: Ahh. You know, being an Infected, it's cool to get stable work here. I can even get some little hobbies too. I must've been pretty great in my past life to deserve all this—nah, wouldn't be Infected now, if I was. Man! Forget it, I'm gonna help out with the decorations!
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_002: That Amiya girl is one of this place's leaders? What a black-hearted company Rhodes Island is.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_003: I'm not about to freeload here. Just let me know if you need some elbow grease.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_004: I have nothing against taking orders, but I don't like fighting without knowing why I'm doing it.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_005: My hobbies? Why should I tell you? Ugh... Alright, alright, I'll tell you. Just stop making that face... I like tinkering.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_006: Without Chiave and Aosta, I'd be a corpse in an alley. I owe them my life. So no matter what they want, I'll help them without a second thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_007: I don't hate you, but... I find it difficult to fully trust you.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_008: Do what you're told, keep the wolf from the door, live life. They all seemed like simple ideas once to me... But Aosta was right. In a country like Siracusa, things like those aren't ideas, they're dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_009: I gotta say, your leadership skills are decent... But Aosta once said that an organization turns rotten when people let their guard down. So, I'll be keeping a close eye on you.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_010: Asleep? What a carefree Doctor... Gah, where'd the blanket go…?
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_011: Since Chiave decided I'm joining you, I don't have much else to say. You can call me Broca. I'll follow your orders, but don't count on me doing anything extra. I have no love for big organizations like yours.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_013: A raise...? Don't particularly need one.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_014: Maybe Aosta was right, maybe Rhodes Island is actually trustworthy. And if so…
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_029: Alright… You've got a few tricks.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_030: They've all been taken care of.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_031: Need me to go after them?
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_032: Relax. You did what you could. Even Aosta makes mistakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor... What? I have to pay for my freeloading. Besides, occasions like these are incredible to me. Comparing to my time in Siracusa, Rhodes Island is decent.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_043: I've never given anyone a present before, so I'm not too good at picking. Aosta said I should make one myself. Here, it's a block of carving wood, anti-mold treated by me. Tung oil, stops it rotting. When I'm not around, you can move it in front of your desk, and treat it like I'm supervising you.
dialogue_tracker.char_356_broca_CN_044: I didn't think I'd run into you here. I just finished cleaning up my workbench— there's been a lot of orders in for weapons lately. Why haven't I been supervising you lately? Because you don't seem like you're about to turn rotten these days. And I approve of your goals. Let's work hard together, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_001: Do you need any help, Doctor? OK, I'll do my homework later then.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_002: Are you curious about my tails? Actually... after I came to Rhodes Island, I realized that I have more tails than the other Vulpo senpais. I don't really know who to talk to about this... But, my dad's colleagues all had a lot of tails... How strange.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_003: Upset? No, no, Doctor. Thank you for asking, but everyone treats me well. I musn't be too needy... Um... Doctor, actually... I feel the bed here is a bit small. It can't hold all my tails. Also, someone's been watering my bonsai. I really want to thank that person, and tell them it doesn't need that much watering...
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_004: Amiya Onēsan is really amazing. She always has so many ideas that I never thought of, and she's a great role model. But... She's not an adult yet. She's like me, she'll sometimes feel lost and upset. Doctor, please spend more time with her, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_005: That first time I took a really long ride from Higashi to Siracusa, I was so surprised! I never knew that other places could look so different. Right now, I mostly stay behind my senpais, and not everything that happens is good... But I really cherish my life here. Mhm!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_006: The flame that my dad creates is so pretty, shining like a crystal even though it is fire. After I came to Rhodes Island, I realized that it is the power dad uses to protect others. That means… I can use what he taught me to help my senpais here! Yoshi! I'll continue to do my best!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_007: Since my arm was hurt, my mom almost never lets me go out. I don't blame her. In fact, I'm worried about her. She's always fighting bad people... I mustn't cause her more trouble and let her worry. If I behave myself on Rhodes Island, she won't worry, right? Mom is super strong when she's focused!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_008: Doctor, what we're doing is very hard, right? I haven't been an operator for very long, and even though my senpais are always chatting and laughing, I can feel they are hiding their worries and feelings... If I can become a bit stronger, do you think I can help them share their troubles?
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_009: Doctor, you... you lost your memories? Is that true? Dr. Kal'tsit just told me about this today... Um, Doctor, please rest for the day! Even the Doctor needs time to think about life and not work, yes? Just leave the rest to me and, um, Amiya Onēsan! Hehe!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_010: The Doctor will catch a cold like this. I'll need to find a blanket…
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_011: Rhodes Island Operator, Lisa... Ah, I mean, Suzuran! Operator Suzuran! It's the codename I chose for myself. Starting today, I'm officially an operator, I will do my best!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_012: So this is how my senpais fight... Sugoi...
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_013: Doctor, earlier today, Dr. Kal'tsit praised me... Eh? A promotion? Not just praise? Ehh…
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_014: Look, Doctor! This is my Originium Arts! I've been working hard on this! Now, will I be able to go to more places with my senpais, see more things, and help more people?
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_017: Field missions are rare for me. I will do my very best!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_018: Eh? I'll be leading my senpais? Okay, leave it to me! As the captain, I mustn't show weakness!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_020: Visual on hostile! Uhh… can't we persuade them to give up?
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_026: Is everybody okay? Anyone need help?
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_029: So this is the actual battlefield that my senpais faced... Doctor, I think we can do even better. I can do even better.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_030: Doctor, did I do a good job? I didn't hold the others back, right? Really? That's great…
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_031: Doctor, are you okay? There are friendlies injured? I, I'm on it!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_032: Sorry, if only I were stronger…
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_033: I've lived here for a long time, so I won't get lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_036: Doctor! Oh, would you like some cupcakes? I was planning to take these to everyone in the Medical Department, but you also work very hard. So please, help yourself!
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_038: Ah, Happy New Year, Doctor. Here, have some snacks I just baked. I'll be helping the kitchen make lots of tasty treats today. Please remember to take a good rest today, Doctor! It's not often we have a day off, so let's enjoy it with our friends.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_042: Ah, Doctor. Remember to take enough rest, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_043: Doctor, could you bend down a bit for me? Yep, thanks. Now open your hands. Oh, and keep your fingers together... Now then... Hmm... Yoshi! Here, Doctor. Dad taught me how to draw a blessing talisman. I have written it on your palm. It'll give you good luck for the next year. Hehe, Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_358_lisa_CN_044: ...Hm? Oh, hi, Doctor. Everyone's busy today, and I'm going to help Amiya Onēsan— Mm? What was I thinking about? I... I was wondering how mom and dad are doing. Do you think I'll have a chance to visit them, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_001: I shall come! Doctor, so long as I am here, thou mayst be at ease in thy work!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_002: I grew from childhood in the monastery. Though I could recite the texts from heart, I never fully understood their inner meanings, and my old head priest and the other great masters gave explanations from which I could comprehend even less. Doctor, thou art of learned stature. Mayst thou be able to teach me?
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_003: Rhodes Island truly lacks none for novel machinery... hm? Doctor, underestimate me not. I may begin clueless, but I am no contrarian to the times. If I do not know how, then I need only learn. My personal music player even holds some songs of the good Miss Sora within it.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_004: So as to evade Catastrophe, I once accompanied my old head priest and fellow monastery apprentices over mountain and valley. My head priest spoke that Catastrophes were the wrath of the gods. Yet, I have never witnessed one by my own eyes. I am somewhat curious.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_005: I am not a true monk, merely raised by the monastery. At my departure, Saga was the name my old head priest gave to me. Its meaning is of high mountains and rugged roads. And only when I left the monastery, did I come to know how the world was no straightforward thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_006: I swallow hardship, and fear not fatigue, yet there is still one thing I cannot assent to. My master spoke that all living beings are equal. The Infected are people all the same, people only fallen ill. Why can they not be permitted to live?
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_007: Ho-ho. I may have only erred upon a Rhodes Island recruitment spot at first, but whether the food or the beds, it is all of great quality, and the pay pales not. I truly have stumbled upon a wonderful place.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_008: When I left the monastery, I had thought that entering society would involve no more than dealing with pests, ridding some despots. I had never dreamt it would be so treacherous as this. There are times I do not even know what I draw my blade for. Doctor... I do not understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_009: I still puzzle over much in my heart, but I have understood at least that some answers I must seek myself, and some thoughts I must think through myself. Doctor, until I have sorted it all out, I wish to continue my training by thine side. Pray, allow me this!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_010: Doctor... ho, thou art quite skillful to fall asleep sitting. In that case, I shall meditate for a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_011: Thou art the Doctor? Hail and well... ah, ought not I be more serious at times like these? Ahem—my name is Saga. I am a wandering monk. Should there be any place thou mayst need me, refrain not in sending me!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_012: Ho-ho. To think such strategy does exist in the world. My horizons have broadened.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_013: A raise? Splendid! I have been watering at the mouth to try the deluxe set at the cafeteria for quite some time, yet have been embarrassingly out of pocket... today, I am finally able to feast!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_014: Dear head priest. In my heart yet is wild disarray. The ways of this world I still cannot see through, nor cut down. Though I am fortunate to have met with great people, and with their guidance, there will come a day in our turbulent mortal world where I cut through to the heavens!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_018: Am I the captain? Not a problem!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_021: Takuan-zuke... hah! I am right here!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_029: 'Twas truly an arduous trial. I have gained greatly for it.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_030: As expected of the Doctor! Alone, I would surely have let quite a few through.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_031: My head priest spoke that one must have a merciful heart, and I believe that this suffices, more or less.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_032: Doctor, go quickly! Leave the rear to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_036: Call, and I shall surely come running.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_038: Ah, Doctor. Happy New Year. I am writing a letter. My travels have kept me away from the monastery for some years, and I have grown used to my current life. Yet at days like this, I can't help but miss head priest and the other disciples. Perhaps it is time for a visit.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_042: Doctor, hast thou eaten? An unfilled stomach will surely leave thee powerless at work.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_043: Today is the day thou camest into this realm. It is of two meanings—to be delivered into it is to be born, and to transcend likewise is to be born. Once my head priest told me that should one be capable of understanding the realm to be of void nature, in doing so they come of it. However, I believe it is not a realm bare and empty, but a self at ease and free in being that is truest to the message.
dialogue_tracker.char_362_saga_CN_044: Head priest once said, 'for that which must be done, act despite the impossibility.' I used to think it was a simple statement. After all, there were no tasks that could not be done, only those that should and should not be done. But as my travels continued, I realized it was a profound truth, worthy of acting upon for my entire life.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_001: Let's just burn 'em. You weren't gonna give those papers a second look anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_002: If you wanted me to lay defenses in here, I'd break up the floor for starters. Not that I mind, it's for you to think about.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_003: Got twps from Royal Guard knocking about, have you? Heh, ain't that interesting.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_004: Calibrate the sight? Nah, materials I ordered last should be here almost, I'll make the arrows first... Oh, push off, out my way.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_005: Most who leave Vouivre don't agree with the mercenary life in Sargon. Move to Victoria, end up doing something else instead, they do. Like... factory-working, farming, you know. Having their own little touch of land.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_006: You could probably tell, but I didn't use to be artillery. Mainly studied recon, infiltration, CQC, all that. Did not bloody take to it, and the instructors wouldn't let me switch courses, so I dropped out, simple as. What's the point in learning things you hate?
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_007: Oh, you're helpless! How am I going to the workshop wearing this?!
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_008: It's meant for attacking nomadic cities, this weapon. Using it to help you lot cope with skirmishers? It's like a hatchet to a cupcake. Let me try hitting a city or two sometime for practice, won't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_009: Don't you think these crystals on my shoulder here match well with my hair color? I like my off-the-shoulder clothes too, so it's perfect. Shame, though, it would've been nice if they covered the whole way like that Siracusan Messenger girl.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_010: I'll be heading back to sort stuff out, then. No point wasting time on this rotter.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_011: Arianrot, codename Toddifons. I don't like working for ordinary people, so I've got my fingers crossed you show me something unusual.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_013: What goes on in those Logistics' minds? Oh, look what Arianrot made, let's just grab it and... For me? Tch, fine. I accept. Your feelings are loud and clear. Thanks, see you.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_014: You've seen a Draco's flames before, I bet you anything. You ever imagined, the sight of them raining down on your enemy? I can make that your reality!
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_019: You lot go ahead. I've got things to prepare.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_025: I don't need visuals. Give me the map.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_027: Nothing remains once the arrows rain!
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_028: Ha! Fire wouldn't go out while there's something left to burn!
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_029: There's only so many who can make this thing shine—guess you're one of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_030: Out without too much ash on me. Gwych.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_031: Ammo's more precious than that little lot. Deal with 'em yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_032: Still good to move? We're heading home. Grab on.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_033: Like this titchy bit of space is enough? Let's break this wall down and I'll have the whole area behind, Diolch.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_034: Think it through before you put your hand out.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_036: Go on if you need something. Don't wait for me to change my contacts, I can hear you whatever color they are.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_038: Yeah, New Year's, there's a party, the whole song and dance, I get it. And that's why I'm sitting right here, having a drink with my magazines, while you carry on moaning and whinging. Trust me, that's my happy times.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_042: So it's you. If you need something, out with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_043: Oh? Birthday, then, today. How about we head deckside to celebrate? I'll give you my little siege ballista, can set off some massive fireworks? Oh, too dangerous? Tch, you sopping wet blanket. Whatever, off to the shops then, pick you out a proper present. Well? Get changed already, we're off.
dialogue_tracker.char_363_toddi_CN_044: Oripathy comes second, I've said that. If I'm not able to do what I like, that's not life no matter how long it drags out. And you know, being here, Rhodes Island, I always get a crack at something interesting. I half like it working with you lot. So don't you ever go letting me down.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_001: Doctor, anything I can help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_002: Ahhh... A hot shower every day is a blessing... After I got infected and had to move all over the place, it was hard for me to take a hot shower. Besides, the food here is decent. Oh, I just love Rhodes Island!
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_003: 'April'? 'April' is a song about spring. The lyrics describe the feeling of lying on the grass on a warm spring day, looking up at the sky and letting your mind wander. Wanna hear it, Doctor? I'm sure you'll love it.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_004: Strange, where's my lip gloss...? Oh, right. I lent it to Rope. Nah yeah, I was gonna teach her to do makeup. She's a fine looking girl. I bet she'll be even cuter after a little sprucing up.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_005: Back in Rim Billiton, the companies promise a pension for the Infected, but you only get scraps in the end. And it's hard to find a job... Good thing I decided to try Rhodes Island as soon as I saw the ad. I feel appreciated around here.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_006: After I got infected, people started asking me things like 'what's an Infected wearing such bright colors for' and 'what's an Infected listening to music for'... And my answer's always the same: 'It's what I like.'
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_007: Back in Rim Billiton, I was a professional hunter. I had to keep the beasts away from the city and sometimes escort company people. But… after I got Oripathy, I lost my job and had to hunt on my own for a living. It was real rough…
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_008: My parents died in a mining accident when I was little, and I grew up on a company pension, so I was always real grateful to the company. I figured getting Oripathy was my own dumb fault... But there's more to it than that, isn't there, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_009: Doing something for the Infected... I never thought about it before. I mean, it's hard enough to keep yourself alive. But after coming to Rhodes Island, I decided I wanted to try to do something not just for myself, but for everyone who suffers like me.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_010: Doctor, if you wanna nap, I can lend you my earplugs.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_011: Gosh, Rhodes Island has great pay and benefits… Oh, sorry, Doctor, I'm just a little shocked. My codename is April. Nah yeah, it's the name of my favorite song.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_012: Wow, the professionals here are really something.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_013: Wha? A raise...? Oh, it's not that I'm disappointed, I'm stoked! It's just been a long, long time since anyone told me I was doing a good job.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_014: Back in Rim Billiton, I liked to sit on the roof and listen to my music while I watched the whole city go by. Now, I can see even more from the bridge of Rhodes Island. I'd call that a silver lining after getting infected, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_025: Let's put on some Billy Bounce.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_026: Now this is a good rhythm!
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_027: I've got a lock on you.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_029: Such a tough battle! Doctor, need some slow music to calm your nerves?
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_031: Doctor, a few got away, should we chase them?
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_033: No matter how much I wander around Rhodes Island, it still feels so big.
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_036: Hmm, the Doctor should be in the office right now...
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_038: Around this time of the year, I was usually in the wilderness all by myself, trying to get warm by the campfire, watching the fireworks in the cities far away. That's usually how I found out it was New Year's. Exciting enough, but I'd rather be counting down with everyone else. Happy New Year, Doctor. Keep looking after me this year, yeah?
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I'm here to hang out! What do you want to do today? Karaoke? Shopping? Oh, I know a place where you can try archery. They even give out prizes for their contests. I'll shoot a few arrows, and whatever I win with my pro skills, it's going to be your birthday present!
dialogue_tracker.char_365_aprl_CN_044: Getting infected didn't make my hunting any worse. But the company still fired me for catching Oripathy. I'd say it's their loss, but to be honest, joining Rhodes Island was a stroke of luck for me. I only hope other Infected out there can be just as happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_001: No problem, Doctor. I've got your back.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_002: How do I aim while I'm skating? It's real simple, want me to show you? Here, put your hand on mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_003: Way back when, I, like a lot of my friends, took pride in being different. But after I became infected, I realized that alone wasn't cool. Life isn't something that you should let a little bit of Originium dust control, you gotta take charge yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_004: An old cop taught me how to shoot with a crossbow, and his daughter taught me how to skate. As for how to put the two together... that's called being self-taught.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_005: Don't get me wrong, skateboarding is just one of my hobbies... and the first way I had to really find myself. The real exciting part comes after that though, wanna hear?
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_006: Why'd I want to become a combat operator...? Doctor, what do you think is most important for us giggling and laughing 'street gangsters?' Of course it's freedom. I'm willing to fight for freedom, so that's why I'm fighting for Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_007: I have a lot of regrets about becoming Infected, such as the graffiti mural at the park that I left half-finished. Also, I can't eat any more of that old cop's secret-formula onion rings, huh? That's about it.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_008: I came to Rhodes Island with the mindset of getting my illness treated. Thought it'd be some stuffy place that reeked of disinfectant where everyone would be confined to their rooms... But man, I was surprised to find out, even though tagging isn't allowed inside the ship and all, that Ethan guy... Actually, nevermind.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_009: I found a way to express myself through donut hamburger combo meals, skateboarding, and hip-hop competitions. How 'bout you, Doctor? If you get burnt out, you should come kick it with me and Vigna. We'll just... hang out. Hanging out is in our DNA. Gotta respect it.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_010: If you're tired, just go rest. I'll be here.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_011: Aciddrop, Operator. This skateboard here is a piece of registered equipment, yeah. If you have any problems, just give me a holler.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_013: A promotion, huh? Thanks. The last time this happened was when I just won the Crab Cup, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_014: That old geezer originally taught me to use a crossbow so I could protect myself from the chaos on the streets. Who would've thought that one day, I'd be using it to protect the freedom of the Infected?
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_018: Teamwork's an important part of scoring as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_022: C'mon, how do I deal with these guys?
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_023: Now this is some exciting stuff.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_026: Time to show off a bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_029: Good work out there, Doctor... Oh, can you come with me to get a couple screws switched out after we get back?
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_030: The moment when you overcome a challenge is always the best feeling, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_031: Should we chase after 'em? If you ask me, I can still catch up.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_032: Ugh... Can't believe I messed up such an amateur move...
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_033: This bit of wall here looks pretty suitable... Uh, I didn't say anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_036: Wanna head down to the canteen together? If I don't make any mistakes on this trip, promise to treat me to some juice.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_038: Oh, Doctor, Happy New Year! We've got a block party in a bit. Why don't you come show off your moves? You could give breakdancin' a shot? It ain't that hard, I'll teach ya!
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_043: You're still working? Let's go get some exercise outside. Wait, you volunteered for overtime? Doctor, ain't no point in workin' this much. Life only begins once you clock out! C'mon, what do you wanna eat? It's on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_366_acdrop_CN_044: I used to skate to ditch class n' get away from the adults. Then, it was to lose the cops when I was out tagging. I said I did it in the name of freedom, but thinkin' back, I guess that was kinda selfish. We fight harder for other people's freedom than our own, don'tcha think? Like what we're doin' here.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_001: Fine. At least I can get a break from the dusty air outside, if I stay here with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_002: I don't shy away from sensitive discussions about the Infected? That's true. They're obviously different from us. But they also have the right to seize hope, just like us. So they don't need me to do anything special for them. That's equality, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_003: Blaze is too reckless sometimes. I know she's strong, but… What? You know how to handle her?  Forget it, I'll ask Amiya what I should do to get along with her after we get back.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_004: I was just speaking objectively. If you don't want to be discriminated against, then you shouldn't expect special treatment... What, she went back to her room crying? Look, I feel a little bad about it, but is someone that fragile really operator material?
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_005: Rhodes Island is changing, Doctor. Maybe you don't feel it, since you're the reason it's changing, and not everyone is so annoyingly outspoken as I am. Anyway, I do appreciate the direction Rhodes Island is moving.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_006: I used to prefer long-distance missions, like I was running away from Rhodes Island. I'll admit that was a little ungrateful, considering Rhodes Island adopted me. But now? Hehe, if you still have operators who like splattering blood all over the place, maybe I'll apply to serve in some faraway place again.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_007: Doctor, would you sometimes feel afraid? Catastrophes, Originium, Oripathy, and the Infected? Hm, I'm still plagued by nightmares even now. But these days, I have Amiya, and idiots like that Blaze. I guess I'm not as afraid as I used to be.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_008: Why are you called 'Doctor?' No, I'm not trying to get you to remember anything, it's just that title makes me very... wistful. Looking at all the Infected around you... Brings to mind a little bit of the past.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_009: I've known the whole time. When my mother brought me to Rhodes Island, she'd already lost her mind. I didn't feel the pain her inner conflicts caused her, but I can relate to it, because I relied on that obsession to get me to where I am today. Only now, I've found a new direction... I want to find her, and I want to save her.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_010: You shoulder the future of Rhodes Island. And with the burden of that responsibility, you can't be so lackadaisical.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_011: So you're the Doctor? Amiya told me about you. I'm GreyThroat. Please don't disappoint me.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_012: For efficiency's sake, speed up the playback. I'll still be able to see it all clearly.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_013: Even now, I'm still on bad terms with a handful of operators. My promotion might spark controversy, just a reminder.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_014: Whether Infected or not, we all choose to walk upon this land of our own free will. And so we must all work hard to survive, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_018: Whether or not they'll listen to my orders is another matter.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_019: A panoramic view of the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_020: I just have to rout them, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_026: I see them. Too bad they don't see me.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_027: I'm skilled enough to resolve this.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_028: Don't worry, their sights are totally empty.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_029: We won't see many victories like this, since our power is limited.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_030: I have no talent to speak of. So as a crossbowman, I can't let an enemy within three meters. Not even a corpse.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_031: The medics should stay behind to tend the wounded. I will chase after them, considering I'm used to working alone anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_032: Watch your flanks. I'll cover our retreat.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_033: I've been here for years, but I rarely wander around inside…
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_036: Aren't you afraid of upsetting the Infected operators if they see you with me all the time?
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_038: Happy New Year, Dr.{@nickname}. Where's Amiya? She's setting up the party tonight with the others? Then I'll just wait here. Blaze is looking for me? Did she already see the gift I left on her desk? I—I'm worried she's going to say something cheesy again. I'm leaving.
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_043: Dr.{@nickname}, this is my birthday present for you. Unfortunately, it's a little rough, since I used a little gap in time when the kitchen was free to make it. Though, a few operators did help me, and I think I rescued one of them before...
dialogue_tracker.char_367_swllow_CN_044: You still have a lot to do, don't you? Blaze understands me because we fight together, but it's not as if any two people, or groups, who disagree will have a similar chance. I'm very lucky... which is why I need to be more responsible—until the day when we can all sleep soundly.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_001: Do you think me Lady of the Office? This is work for grown-ups.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_002: Don't take Iris's songs so literally. They're meant for the young ones, you know. What? Yes, I'm the guard with the scissors—what about it? Chop-chop? That's the sound of me making clothes—what did YOU think it was? Huh... adults, honestly. So eager to assume the worst.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_003: Preservation techniques? Huh, fat chance. Even Iris hasn't the faintest clue about how I safekeep things. Why should I let YOU know?
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_004: Let me introduce Annie to you. She's my very best friend, and another 'me.'
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_005: Don't ask me. I don't know why the Castle takes deposits from everywhere, just to send them back out. Granny wants me doing it, so I do. Don't you know? I hear adults call that work. It's when someone has to do it.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_006: Annie's just the quiet sort, nothing at all like me. C-Controlling her? What are you talking about? She's a whole person, she goes where she wants to! She's only by my side because she likes being with me. That's what best friends do. Isn't it, Annie? 'Mm.'
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_007: With all the children here, it's no wonder Iris doesn't want to leave. Hrmm... if this carries on, we'd be better off plonking the whole Castle of Dreams here onto Rhodes Island. That'd save so much time and effort.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_008: Good girl this and good girl that, are you saying that I'm not good?—Well, I suppose sometimes you can't just do as you please. You have to 'act' a little, Granny says. Act how? Well... 'My greetings to you. I come from the County of Linton. Bena is my name.' Something like that, you know!
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_009: Granny brought me into the Castle when I was young, and I grew up there, and once she retired, I took over her whole job. What could I have in common with Iris, Little Miss Heir-to-the-Castle? What, you think I'm jealous? Dream on! Iris has to watch her figure, but me? I can eat all I want without putting on a pound!
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_010: 'Rest soundly. Doctor.' Who cares about that Doctor? Come on, let's go out and play! 'Alright.'
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_011: I'm Bena, and I was here to fetch an idiot who went out and forgot to come home. But I hear she still has things to do, so I'll just stay a while and keep her company.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_012: Oh, you can't show something this violent to Annie and me.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_013: Ah-hah! See, you do know how to play by children's rules!
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_014: Annie, are you ready? We're going to show this hooded hoodlum what our Arts are made of! 'Alright, Bena.'
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_017: Two people for a single job. This won't be tricky.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_018: Attention, please! Annie's told me of some brilliant ideas.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_019: Let's just take it like a walk in the forest.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_020: So you want to pull these toys apart too?
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_028: If there's no fixing it, smash it to pieces.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_029: What did you expect? I'm a dab hand at doing bad things to bad people!
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_030: No one else in need of a trim?
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_031: Leave the rest to the adults, then. We're going home.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_033: Hang on, this room's a little small. We're two people here.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_036: Annie's off on an adventure. Want to come along?
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_038: Well, happy New Year to you. Annie and I are taking our crack at the Yanese lantern tradition. This one's for Granny, may she live a long and healthy life. And this one's for you, may you... err... you know what, make your own wish...
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_042: Hey, no hiding things! What's that you're playing with?
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_043: It just baffles me! How can you all be so happy to have your birthdays? One year older is one year further from your childhood innocence. Honestly... here, a new pillow for you. Take it and dream sweet dreams. I wish that you keep that child at heart of yours alive... forever and ever.
dialogue_tracker.char_369_bena_CN_044: It's all over the shop today, isn't it! Let me take some photos for you. One, two... Good, these merry moments are safe and sound now. If you ever want to relive the memories of today, just come see me at the Castle.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_001: Hey Doctor, what can I help you with today? Have a chat to stave off the boredom? Or, did you have something interesting to tell me?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_002: Was that Savage who just passed by in the hallway? Back when the autonomous county was established, and later when it reached a cooperation agreement with Rim Billiton, her exploits were no less impressive than mine, you know?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_003: You know, some places have really problematic stereotypes about us Cautus. Why do they call me timid when I'm just good at avoiding danger? As a matter of fact, isn't it more accurate to say that only those who've delved deep into danger can become masters of avoiding it?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_004: C'mon, I've been a good boy. I'm getting all my regular checkups, taking my medicine, doing everything I'm supposed to. It's just the Medical lass is so uptight when she's recording my details. I can't help but play a prank or two, just so she'll loosen up a bit. Hehe. Oh, but don't tell that to the other medics.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_005: Doctor, my buddy, Rhodes Island doesn't have a mandatory dress code, so there's no need for you to wear the same old rags all the time. Look at what I'm wearing - this store's got some pretty tasteful stuff, so how about I help you pick out a new look?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_006: I'm actually pretty fond of Rhodes Island. Unlike those bigwigs who can't stop preaching about their greatness, everyone here's just trying to achieve their goals and working together to keep this ship sailing. Just like the folks in Rim Billiton.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_007: The one in my hand? It's a standard-issue Billy blaster that I modified. Before I got my hands on it, it also used to be an Originium-powered focus for Casters. Hmm... Doctor, you're not thinking that smashing rocks with brute force would be efficient, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_008: Ah, so you're also interested in the Eureka Incident, Doctor? It's not like there's any secrets left untold, since any of the books or documentaries worth their salt tell pretty much the whole story. But... I wish they had some more details on how I rescued those hostages. Nah yeah, I dismantled a lot of those cages after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_009: It's common for mining teams to hire Catastrophe Messengers. Since I was born on a mining ship and was always interested in technical books, being a Catastrophe Messenger means basically applying what I already knew. But Doctor, where'd you get your knowledge from? I don't see any relevant literature here...
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_010: Wanted to take a little nap? No worries, I'll wake you up unceremoniously in the event of emergency!
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_011: Leonhardt, Catastrophe Messenger. Doctor, you may have heard of me... No? Ah well~ it's better that way. Seems I won't have to tell the whole story again, like I did when that HR lady cornered me.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_012: Looks like my skills are better suited for positional warfare.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_013: Promotion? Haha, great! Wait a second. It doesn't come with some sort of exclusive, blinged-out elite uniform? C'mon, even a small ornament would be nice. No? Aww…
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_014: The road that Rhodes Island's chosen is much bumpier than that of us Catastrophe Messengers, but you don't seem to have any intent on stopping. Well, I suppose I'll have to sacrifice some of my leisure time to help you clear the road then?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_017: Mission time~! Let's see… Oh, it's a fight today!
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_018: You want me to lead the team? Mmmm… Alright. Leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_019: So this is the route to the objective... Can I take a shortcut?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_020: Let's see if our enemies have anything to offer besides numbers.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_022: Doctor, you'll save a nice spot for me right?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_024: Lure some more enemies into the ring, then leave the rest to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_025: Who says a spear is only good for stabbing people?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_026: Relying on your armor will only leave you vulnerable.
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_027: Strength in numbers, huh? Is that what you were banking on?
dialogue_tracker.char_373_lionhd_CN_028: Let's see whether you're gold or manure!
