dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_029: Everything's a piece of cake, as long as we employ the proper tactics.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_030: Don't underestimate the importance of engineering!
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_031: ...After I head back and adjust the parameters of this device, this won't happen again.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_033: Has this place been cleaned before?
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_036: Doctor, is there anything I can help you with?
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_038: Doctor, stand still and don't move a muscle, let me inspect you. Hmm... no dust on the bottom of your clothes, and your shoes are clean. That's good. Oh, wait! Your shirt collar is so wrinkled. You are not going to attend the party like that, right? Go back and sort that out, I'll wait here for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_043: Doctor, have you seen Leaf? Her signal suddenly dropped, and my terminal indicates she's somewhere around your office—You thought she was a present and put her away? The present wasn't her, it was the box on her back! Also! How were you so sure I'd give you a present?
dialogue_tracker.char_400_weedy_CN_044: I work as an undurable scientist yet want to step onto the battlefield, but Rhodes Island has actually satisfied my headstrong requests. Whether in the lab or the field, I'm always asking myself: Isn't there more I can do? I'm very greedy after all, when it comes to the pursuit of scientific value.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_001: Wasting me on tidying up papers? Hardly the most brilliant of plans. Why squander a pair of capable hands? Pass those charts and tables over, I'll reorganize them for you... And, as I'm already in your seat handling this headache, let's have you rest for a bit, alright?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_002: Little Garnet here is just an elaborate Arts creation. Whether taking lives or saving them, it allows me to shed less blood and do the job with a little less mess. But in the end, it's nothing more than a crystal of blood. Well, aren't you fascinated? Here, you can play with it for a while... Oh dear, why are you pulling away your hand?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_003: I've taken care of those tasks—effortlessly, I might add. No need to thank me. That would give the impression I've exerted myself over such trivial matters. Incidentally, when will that bunny start asking me for help directly, instead of using you as her messenger? Rest assured, I won't scare her like I did before.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_004: The sisters refused my visit again. They still find me... disagreeable. I've never claimed Rose Riverside's Canoes to be a harmonious family. As we can perceive the rhythmic pulse of each other's hearts pumping blood, the trust between us needn't rely on sentiment.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_005: No, no one else is here. I was just chatting with Laqeramaline—or rather, with the incantations woven by the Banshees, reminiscing about the riverside landscapes I've traversed. Who doesn't like to take something precious as a keepsake, to hold in place for a loved one?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_006: Some sisters have never seen this landship with their own eyes. Some imagine it to be an egg woven of countless blood vessels; others see it as a ghost formed from communication data and electrical cables. How do I know their imaginings with such clarity? Good question. How indeed?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_007: I won't tell a soul, so tell me: the one who just entered the office and the one who came in earlier, they have a rather... sensitive connection, don't they? Look at your furrowed brow... I'm not angling for intelligence, I'm genuinely concerned about you. Do be careful not to get caught up in emotional entanglements.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_008: Rejecting the kindness of others is terribly rude, wouldn't you agree? Some people, when they notice changes within themselves, want to break away from the past. But me? I will always remember the most intimate moments I've shared with each of my friends. These memories aren't fabricated, so why would one arbitrarily deny our friendship?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_009: Indeed, my interrogations are truly gentle. As long as enough blood flows, I can thoroughly sift through a heart and excavate all the secrets I wish to know. A pity, though, that you and your blood are simply too precious. Do strive to live on. The day you lie mortally wounded on death's door, I'll be there to see you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_010: Hmm... Pulse is steady. Not dead, just asleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_011: Codename, Entelechia. It's been quite a while, battlefield commander of Rhodes Island—Don't feel bad that you've forgotten me. No one can know every single one of our Canoes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_012: Can a recording on a machine be more truthful than a memory bubbling from one's heart?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_013: I should 'promote' you too, shouldn't I, as a token of appreciation? Why don't I purify the blood in your body, see if you can become a pure Vampire… Relax, you're not a mixed-blood Sarkaz, and unworthy of a torture you could not endure.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_014: Ah, a medal... Have you thought it through? I'm rather fussy when it comes to gifts and the ones handing them over. The vows between Canoes come first, so I can't do much for Rhodes Island... But if a friend has a personal favor to ask, I don't mind lending a hand at times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_017: I don't mind escorting this many people at once.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_018: Take care not to let your blood run dry.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_020: I prefer a clean floor, so I'll grant you a death without shedding blood.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_021: Oh, you have an indecisive side too?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_022: If you need to calm down, I can slow your heartbeat for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_023: At moments like these, Little Garnet shines most brilliantly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_024: Don't get me wrong. I don't like the smell of the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_028: Oh dear. Don't choke on your own blood, now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_029: Fine work. I will preserve this moment within my memories.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_030: Can you feel your blood racing? Do you find this scene beautiful? If you're satisfied with the battle's outcome, then I haven't come here for naught.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_031: So long as they bleed, they cannot flee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_032: Go already. Do not dwell on this mess, nor let it scar you. The aftermath is mine alone to handle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_033: A familiar sight. As I suspected back then, no one can alter this landship's mechanical design.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_034: Does it feel nice, having your blood run backwards?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_036: I would like to bestow upon you a little gift. Say, an Arts enchantment on your pen nib, the same I use on Little Garnet. How does that sound?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_038: How rare to see everyone in the mood to celebrate a holiday, rather than to mourn someone. It's also rare to see a banquet hall prepare a seat for a Vampire. The sisters of Rose Riverside have spoiled many a banquet before. Whoever said a dinner party isn't the perfect hunting ground for intelligence?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_042: If I were a commander whose life is either the target or concern of many and more, I would learn to tread a little lighter, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_043: A new birth is always a bloody affair. Some sisters choose to commemorate the day they killed an archenemy as their birthday; others pick the day their blood was purified and they became pure Vampires. How about you? Since coming to this great land, the blood you've shed and the pain you've endured… how much do you remember?
dialogue_tracker.char_4010_etlchi_CN_044: Farewells are difficult, so we must strive to minimize our partings. This isn't my personal conviction, but it was the reason Rose Riverside rallied behind Theresa, and why I support you now. Very well, present your year-end retrospective. I find solace in hearing memories unfold.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_001: Certainly. I'll stay by your side... At the very least, you don't curse loudly while kicking books all around the room.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_002: We Leithanians do fuss over our horns a lot. Some visit specialized salons to trim any excess cutin, and to keep their horns in shape... Me? I just use this sword. What's that look on your face...? It's up to you to believe me, but there's no way I could demonstrate it for you right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_003: I'm just an auditing student at Ludwigs-Universität. The old man needs my help for a lot of things, and I'm the only one who can stand his temperament. It's no matter, he's like a mobile library, so I've learned a lot from him.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_004: The bindings on this sword? There are some on my body as well. They tighten my joints and keep my muscles taut, preventing my mind from slacking off. They are not just for show.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_005: It doesn't matter if a weapon is easy to wield or not, I'd find a way to wield this sword even if it were twice as big. A Leithanian noble can have multiple violin bows made to order, but commoners might only have sticks to use... and we can't depend on others to protect us.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_006: Looks, background, titles, Arts aptitude... everything that we passively inherit is specific only to ourselves. What use they have is for us to determine on our own, not up to abstract concepts like 'fate'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_007: You don't have to switch it off. Everyone has their own peculiar habits after all. You can work only when there's music in the room, I get it... Don't worry about it, I'll listen to whatever you pick. I don't know much about music, but your taste... shouldn't be that bad, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_008: The more engrossed you get reading up on things, the stranger your mood becomes... If you're feeling moody, a little throwing or smashing might help you vent it out. I'll take care of the clean up afterward... You're saying that, you were restless because I was staring at you as your mind wandered...? I'll go check if dinner's ready.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_009: Doctor, if you're truly altruistically advocating for the masses—then please believe me, that even if you take away my sword, cover my eyes, and bind my hands, I, Lessing Maeyer, am still willing to fight for you to the very end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_010: Get some sleep. I'll keep watch from a spot where I won't disturb you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_011: Franz... oh, Ebenholz, as you might know him, he told me about this place. I come from Leithanien, I have a sword, I know some Arts... I can help you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_012: If you say this is useful, then it will be. I'll make sure to watch it... eleven times a day.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_013: Doctor, there's no need to make such a big fuss, and don't you give me a reward either. I already made it clear then, that I agree with your ideals and am willing to work for your sake.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_014: There are many spires in Leithanien, but there are even more people below them. It's natural for one of my background to make such a choice, but what's difficult is to actually shake up the ways of things. We still have a long way to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_017: You're responsible for the plan, and I'll be responsible for you. Give me the order.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_018: I accept this job as a valuable training opportunity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_019: Stay close to me, and don't fall behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_022: You can call me earlier next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_023: I've experienced more chaotic scenes than this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_024: I'll go someplace else that needs more help.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_025: You shall not pass, while I'm here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_026: You can run, but I'll keep chasing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_027: The only thing to hold a sword back is the cowardice of its wielder.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_029: You've made me believe in something: no opponent is undefeatable, and no goal unachievable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_030: Sometimes I put you and the old man together to compare... and the difference is obvious. He would be excitedly hurling curses everywhere if he were in your shoes now. Yes, that's how he acts when he's happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_032: Every time I fail, I tighten my bindings so that the pain leaves them to weigh on my mind. No, you don't have to, I'll bear yours along with mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_033: It's nice and neat here. I'm going to change my bindings... I was referring to my sword, you don't have to look away.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_034: Is this how you supervise others? That's not good.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_036: And what will you do if I overreact?
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_038: The days go by fast. You should come back with me to Leithanien if you get the chance. We'll go to the countryside, where patches of wild spruce trees grow straight and tall... When I was young, I thought they could grow even taller than the spires.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_042: Hello. I'm not nervous, I've always been like this... what else can I even say instead....? Heya?
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_043: You can't leave yet. Other things will have to wait till later, no matter how urgent they might be. Anyway, just stay here for a bit longer... Seems like you've guessed it. Yes, we're preparing a birthday celebration for you, and I've been tasked to make sure you stay here... It's an arduous mission, but I must complete it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4011_lessng_CN_044: Dr. {@nickname}, there is no one who can guarantee they're always headed in the right direction. You need only make a choice, and I'll follow you to verify. I'll correct your path if its askew, and we'll simply continue further on if it holds true .
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_001: Doctor! Was it me you wanted? Or did you want me to find Enya for something?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_002: I can't just pop up anywhere I want like I can back in Kjerag, Doctor. So if you want something delivered for you, you'll want someone else.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_003: Doctor! Is your belly empty? I've learned how to use Rhodes Island's kitchen, so I can put something together for you.... ah, but I can only do Kjerag food for the time being. Hmm... how about some cheese fondue?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_004: Enya... Enya? Doctor, have you seen Enya? It's about time we return to Kjerag, and with all the things that need her attention, she has to come with us. Just where has that girl scurried off to now...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_005: 'Prayer that will be found, devotion that will be rewarded...' If anything that convenient truly existed, I'd like to see it myself. Me? I'm hardly even perfect knitting sweaters—how could I grant anyone's wishes? Oh, but if you'd like a blizzard, that's something I can do for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_006: In a certain way, Enya and Enciodes are the same to me. Both siblings want to change Kjerag, after all. But if I had to say why I'm so much closer to Enya... it's because she became my Saintess. Not Enciodes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_007: Doctor, next time you visit Kjerag, would you like to see the view from the peak of Karlan? Standing at the summit above the clouds amidst the mountains, seeing the sun once again is a heavenly feeling. You'll love it—ah, but there is the chance you'll freeze to death before then. Tricky, that...
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_008: Enya's attitude towards her brother, well... I'm sure you understand—the opposite of intimacy isn't hatred, but indifference. And she likes to say as much, though it's not actually quite that bad between them. That said, in time... I have no clue at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_009: The world outside sprawls vast and far, Doctor. But I've come to realize something. It's like people are the same no matter where you go. The palette of emotions outside does not differ from what I have seen in Kjerag. It truly is a fascinating thing, though just as dull too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_010: Oh, my, your sleeping posture is terrible... I'll run you a bowl of water. You can wash your face as soon as you come round.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_011: Doctor... shh. I came out in secret with Enya. Make sure Ensia and the Karlan Trade people don't find out, or things will get messy for her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_012: *Sigh*. No matter how advanced our weapons get, combat is still so barbarous...
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_013: Oh! A promotion...Well, I've come here with Enya quite a few times now...
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_014: The Rhodes Islanders by and large seem to know who I am now. Which means I can get a little closer to them, right...? Oh, can't I?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_017: Oh, won't you want me leading, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_018: I'll see you all safely through.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_021: Dear me, I’m not done readying yet!
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_023: Don't you fret. No matter the environment, I can 'see' them just fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_024: No need for mercy on the enemy, correct?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_025: You thought I couldn't see you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_026: I'm aimed at you, you know?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_027: You didn't think it'd come from this angle, did you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_028: You're not getting close to me that easily, you know?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_029: Doctor, you can't be overzealous in challenging your limits, or you might hurt yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_030: What a splendid job, Doctor! You make me want to pat you on the head~
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_031: Now, now, it's alright. These are fine enough results, aren't they?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_033: Let's see, here's... whereabout is this?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_036: Doctor, would you like to go on a walk together?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_038: Oh, so this holiday's far more widespread than just a Kjerag celebration. No, I don't think it's too strange. I just feel like once one holiday's over, you blink and the next one's already here. How curious. Still, any reason to be happy's a good reason. Doctor, would you like some cheese fondue?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_042: Doctor! Did you sleep well last night?
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Come have a taste of this cake I made, or maybe blow out the candles and make a wish first? Oh, and put on this medicinal garland, it'll bless any children to live a hundred years free of ailments! You're not little anymore, you say? Heheh, Doctor, what are you telling me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4013_kjera_CN_044: Without even noticing it, I've racked up an awful lot of visits here with Enya. I must say, Doctor, I'm gradually starting to understand why Enya loves to scurry over here when she's free. You see, this is a place full of interesting, adorable people. To where will you lead this sailing ship? I'd love to see for myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_001: Assistant? File Work? Not sure I followed. Anyway, I found a nice-looking mountain with a great view the other day. Want to see it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_002: This makes no sense. Why did you build so many walls and corridors? They block your vision. A mad burdenbeast could crash into this little room without any warning, and you don't seem to be a bit conerned. Danger can be prowling at any corner and you must stay on your guard. That's what Agnese taught me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_003: You call the outside 'the wilds', but you can find everything out there. Put in a little effort and you'll find food and water just fine. But in the city, there are no places to hunt. How do you even survive?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_004: Um, Doctor, have you ever been to one of those 'parties' Exusiai talks about? They're scary! Those little balls of exploded plant seeds, those sweet, smooth milk puffs! Listen, this is not how you should live... What? They're having another party today? I wanna go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_005: Agnese told about a dangerous scent on Rhodes Island, but she and the pack would stay with me. Hmm? You can't see her? But she was just here a moment ago... Maybe she went to go get food?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_006: The man named Bernardo died, and Zaaro ran back to his territory with his tail between his legs... Seems like the hunt Agnese told us about is in the bag. But still she doesn't look happy. Why? The pack has more than enough food.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_007: Can I get a couple extra sets of Rhodes Island clothes? They're well-made, very warm, make good tents, and you can tear them up for bandages. No? Awww… Then how about the storage depot? I'd like to go and... uhh, take a look around.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_008: Doctor, Agnese spoke highly of you, and told me to learn from your 'cunning.' What does cunning mean? Oh! Is it cunning when you hide here by yourself, eating in secret, not sharing with anyone else? I don't think that's hard to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_009: Recently, I've started thinking that maybe life under a roof isn't so bad. Here, you are not a pack, you don't group up and subject yourself to one another. You're, well, something strange... Ugh! It doesn't make any sense! Anyways, I'll stay here a few more days! So get me something good to eat!
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_010: Asleep? That means nothing for me to do? Agnese, let's go play outside.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_011: Agnese called me Lunacub, so you can call me that too. I heard there's a 'canteen' place here, where you can eat whatever you want. Is that true? Where is it? Can I go there right now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_012: Too much trouble! Hunting really isn't that complicated.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_013: A promotion? Does that mean you'll listen to me? How many of these shiny... 'medals' does it take for you to obey me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_014: Agnese always tells me that humans are dangerous and cunning, their bellies full and hearts wicked, but you've proved you are different. You are allowed to join my pack.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_017: I still prefer hunting with my pack. They are much more open than humans.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_018: Since I'm the luna wolf, you all must listen to me. I'll make it clear first: if I don't see your fangs bared in the hunt, you won't get a share of the kill.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_019: How much will we bring back today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_022: Where are the idiots who came to die?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_023: Hurry, the pack and I are waiting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_025: Pipe down already! I'm not going to miss!
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_028: Stupid burdenbeast, you're not getting away!
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_029: Good hunt. If you lived in the wild, I'm sure you would survive for long.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_030: Tired. Already did what you asked me. Can I go eat now? What's on the menu today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_031: Hey! Some of them just got away! Do you even know how to keep the prey surrounded? I'm gonna teach you next time!
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_032: Grr... Agnese, the hunt failed. Come help us! Don't let this idiot die here!
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_034: Don't scare me like that! You wanna die?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_036: Hey, Doctor, don't you get tired of staying in these little cubes every day?
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_038: Hmm? Is today special? A new year? Don't get it. I think every day is brand new. Any day's worth celebrating as long as you get to fill your stomach. Anyway... Do you want to try the meat I roasted? It's very yummy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_042: What took you so long? Next time you make me wait for you in a stuffy little box, don't blame me if I get a little rude.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_043: A birthday is the day you were born onto this land, right? That much I know. I found a meadow full of flowers yesterday. It smells very nice. I haven't told anyone else, so let's go. I've already planned out the route.
dialogue_tracker.char_4014_lunacu_CN_044: To be honest, I still don't get what you people are trying to do. But I can see you're working to keep that rock-disease away from everyone, so that they can eat and drink all they want. I suppose it's probably a good thing. Another good thing, is I don't having to sleep with one eye open like I do outside. Here, I can sleep soundly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_001: No problem. Just leave the documents here, and I'll filter out anything that isn't worth you reading... Can't do it that way? We have to take each one seriously? Fine, fine, whatever you say.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_002: I guarantee that field op will be cleared without a hitch, so— I can't dump it on another operator? Come on, It was a long trip for me to come here, and I'm better off spending my time in the workshop while I'm on the ship. Work with me here, will you？
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_003: How's my stay? So far so good. Here I can focus on reviewing my designs without headphones on my head. No need to block everything out with music. Feels kinda refreshing. Still, I haven't modded any of the equipment in the dorm myself, so it does feel kinda like we're missing some features here. For example, something that automatically orders cactus tarts takeout at preset times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_004: Do me a favor and tell me when Lemuen shows up, Doctor. I help maintain her sister's gun every now and then, so my guess is she wants to have a few words with me. Why don't I just go see her? Uhmm... The way I put it, one can't be so proactive with everybody. Sometimes, you need to keep a certain distance. You know what I mean?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_005: Laterano has tons of magazines covering the combat attire of other countries. Their designs seem to have drawn inspiration from a variety of sources, all of which I'd like to try out. Oh, just so you know, I'm more of an order-by-phone kind of girl. I don't go shopping unless I'm invited by some very specific people. So, you gonna ask me out?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_006: I'm more willing to go on field ops than before? That's because I'm after inspiration for firearms upgrades. When I stand in war-torn ruins, where there's none of the ear-rending ruckus of Laterano, I get this weird sense of fear. I have to find a way to use my technology to combat that somehow.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_007: If the Lateran Curia ever asks for me, make an excuse and turn them down, will you? I don't wanna go back to listen to my boss nag about faith and standing. She thinks she can talk me into recognizing my mistakes, but I don't ever think that much when I do stuff.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_008: I study firearm assistive technologies, but I don't fundamentally understand what a gun means to a Sankta... Hm? Oh, nothing. Just a friend of mine who told me she's starting to use a gun again. Anyway, I'll be going on a trip soon. Be sure to approve my disembarkation when the time comes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_009: You look like you're in a bad mood, so I grabbed you a snack from— Hey, what's that surprised look for? Yes, you're no Sankta and I can't feel your emotion, but that doesn't mean I can't care about you. Alright, eat up now. I wanna see if this is from the tainted batch.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_010: You asleep...? Hehe... Well, well, seems like a good chance to release a drone in the hallway and stream someone's sleep-talking... No response? Looks like you're actually asleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_011: Spuria, liaison from the Sixth Tribunal of the Lateran Curia, here for cultural exchange. Oh, right. To prevent any safety inspections, my luggage has a self-destruct mechanism. Yep, the stuff inside isn't necessarily all safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_012: You want to watch combat records together? You aren't gonna complain that I'm not serious enough when I watch the videos, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_013: If you're giving me more permissions, I won't have to check with you the next time I want to do something, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_014: We Sankta know how to shoot just by the instincts we were born with. Then, after seven years of schooling, we've mastered advanced shooting techniques and learned the basics of maintenance and retrofitting. After that, we may spend our entire lifetimes without ever realizing... guns hurt people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_017: Yep, no problem. I've got the objectives all memorized.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_018: Relax, just leave it to me. What kind of havoc can I wreak?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_019: Aww, I prefer combat strategies without so many twists and turns.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_020: Perfect opportunity to observe the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_022: Go ahead. Tell me your plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_024: It's about time we switched to a frontal assault, no?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_025: Come on, don't be such a drag.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_027: Take a guess. Am I holding my gun to pray?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_029: What a surprise. It's been a while since I had so many casings at my feet. You really know how to put on a show.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_030: Just as promised, the mission's a success. What was I doing? Whoa, whoa, whoa, that's hurting. Nobody likes a Doctor who pries too much, yes?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_031: No worries, it's not a big deal. Just act like you're all remorseful, and nobody will press it too hard. But I still saw every mistake you made with my own eyes, better keep that in mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_032: Uh, you're not gonna fix the part of the perimeter that got blown up? That wouldn't fly in Laterano.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_033: Woo, I love this icy, modern feel.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_034: Careful. My gun might go off.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_036: How much do you know about Sankta guns? There's no way you'd ever be able to fire one, but I don't mind explaining things to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_038: If this was Laterano, I would probably be helping maintain order right about now. The communications center gets affected by explosions pretty easily, and they need my tech repair to mend things... Was it tough? Come on, when everyone else's partying hard, would you really be such a killjoy?
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_042: Hey, Doctor, you're finally here. While you were gone, absolutely nothing happened.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_043: Your birthday? Uh, you never told me. How'd I know? You didn't bring this up because you want a present, right? Haha... I really like that look on your face right now. Here, this instant photo's your gift. The first one I just took is mine, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_4015_spuria_CN_044: At first, I came to Rhodes Island just to check the place out and learn some new skills. I never expected to stay here and run so many field operations for you. You really know how to order people around, Doctor. That said, I've seen lots of sights I would never have seen in Laterano, so I guess it was all worth it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_001: Please don't take all that artistic license for reality. Putting a doppelganger to use takes a lot of energy, and it won't happen for odd jobs like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_002: I imagine the few Higashi professionals here at Rhodes Island hid their backgrounds from you. If needs be, I can investigate for you—I guarantee any information you get will be the absolute truth.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_003: I've worked for Rhodes Island for ages now; I know the ins and outs of everything. If you have any questions, I can always help—hm? What is today's special at the cafeteria? I... have no idea... I'll go investigate.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_004: When you're out gathering info, the right clothes can avoid you a lot of hassle. For example, these—once they're all coordinated, you can seem just like a Victorian student taking their first steps into society. In another outfit... I'll demonstrate sometime else if we get the chance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_005: Zzz... zzz... what a peaceful day... no bothersome cases, no quarrels in the street, and nobody to disturb you even if you sleep in... it's a shame moments of rest are always so short. Come on, Doctor, what do you need me to do?
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_006: Since birth, I was meant as a hidden blade in the hands of others. Infiltration, tracking, luring, they became as natural as breathing to me. Being able to use these abilities on the way of right... ha, I never did imagine that. Thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_007: After the lord passed away, the young master set up a company with the family property. He tore up his oath too, signing contracts with us instead, and just like that, the famed ninjas were completely made over as white-collar workers. As for why I quit... I think I didn't take to sitting in an office, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_008: Dietary habits in Victoria are surprisingly close to those at home. I realized, ever since then, that maybe one day the people of Terra could lay down their prejudices and work hand in hand. But considering the... emm, unique ways they have of cooking locally, I still have some reservations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_009: When I was young, my father drilled 'that which you should, you must' into me, and I always thought he meant I should do everything for myself. But after going from Higashi to Rhodes Island to Victoria, I came to see it anew. Distinguishing what I should and what I must, what to give and what to take—that's the true meaning of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_010: You're thinking about something, aren't you... carry on, I won't disturb you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_011: Nice to meet you, Doctor. Rhodes Island Branch Operator, Kazemaru, aboard from today on.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_012: I see... There's still more progress I can make on myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_013: Watch, just take the corner of this origami and ever so lightly—pull! And now it's just like a real beast cub. I just wanted to show off a little something to you, and I hope it turned out nice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_014: Ever was my family's forte to be protean, and by this piece of paper, all that lives is imitable. Watch now, Doctor—Mimesis!
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_017: I'll see to the role I should.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_018: Am I going to be leading? Oh, wow... I'll value this chance, you can be sure!
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_022: Danger? As if I should fear it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_024: Success is inevitable. No need to leave it to chance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_029: Under your command, I've been far too spoiled.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_030: Mission complete. Good, no tracks left behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_031: You've noticed how serious I was during the fight? Well—they weren't very friendly, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_036: Ah, Doctor, this is for you! I just finished folding it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_038: In the New Year's passage, may I offer my sincere blessings to you, Doctor. Um, no, I was just pondering a little. My time's finally become my own. The old me wouldn't have had the faintest idea how to allocate it. Now, though, I know just what I'm putting my efforts towards.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_043: Happy birthday. For you, Doctor. Put this paper flower under your pillow, and it'll turn into a real flower the next morning. Just like our first meeting, it's both real and fake, it all lies in your hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4016_kazema_CN_044: First shinobi, then salarywoman, and now an intelligence reconnaissance officer in disguise, I wonder what my next job will turn out to be. Ah, Doctor, I don't mean I'm leaving Rhodes Island! I'm just thinking, with all the curveballs life will throw at us, we should all tackle the now as best as we can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_001: Sorting files, serving tea, and transcribing meetings? Of course, I'm at your disposal... Come to think of it, in my first mission, I also approached the target under the guise of a secretary. One week later, I'd hollowed them of all valuable intel, and torn their influence down to rubble.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_002: If you don't trust me, you have permission to search my briefcase, and ascertain whether any data inside is critical to Rhodes Island. The Curio Collector's Guide to Antique Appraisal? Learning material for skills required under certain guises—nothing more, certainly not a personal interest. Pardon me if you wanted specifics, but no comment.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_003: The Dublinn Feline, name of Harmonie. Her plan had a lot of moving parts, and almost went off without a hitch—shame she still left an opening. Even your smallest mistake can have irredeemable consequences, such is the cutthroat nature of intelligence work. Yes? Do I consider her an enemy? Hardly; there is no value in a spy whose identity is exposed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_004: I'm working on a puzzle... Sorry, please be quiet for a while; your voice is disturbing the pieces. A puzzle's answer is unique; do you solve it through incessant trial-and-error, or through calm analysis and a hold of every detail? Only morons would elect for the former... Well then, did you need me for something?
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_005: Inside the aristocrat's ballroom, you need to mind every gaze, to pry into or guard against one another. That is the battlefield the spy roams. It demands of us the proficiency to cruise through it, but I highly doubt anyone truly enjoys it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_006: I rarely make decisions based on emotion, but my saving a completely unrelated civilian was out of fear, it's true. It didn't amount to a mistake, Doctor, and it won't impact anything... War only showed me some of its spiny thorns, but I know It will crush every emotion we feel and every concept we hold
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_007: Rhodes Island's doctors constantly limit my usage of Originium Arts. Aside from ensuring my condition doesn't worsen, they must be concerned that I'll cause some sort of uncontrollable accident... You can put your worries to rest, I know my limits. But nevertheless, thank you for caring.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_008: It was on a mission that an unanticipated explosion infected me with Oripathy. Of course, that mission was still a success... Why didn't I take cover? Doctor, a variable like that could impact the entire operation. But we could also accept it, and implement it as part of the plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_009: Thanks to work reasons, I've met quite a few people as unique and interesting as you. And for those same work reasons, the 'me' they got to know has vanished. Is it a shame? No, it's just the piecing of a new puzzle. All that said, I don't plan to ditch my current codename, for the time being.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_010: No pending intelligence work for the moment... What a rare break.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_011: You'll have received personal correspondence from the Duke. I'll be stationed and active aboard under the codename Puzzle. No need to bother investigating me; I've handed you all personal information that's been made public.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_012: This deployment is somewhat sloppy... or does it speak to your confidence in their individual abilities?
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_013: Doctor, you need caution when promoting intelligence workers. It may well add danger to your situation... But I'll let this one pass, seeing as you're affirming my work ability with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_014: The last promotion wasn't that long ago... I appreciate your trust. Of course, if Rhodes Island is wishing to work on closer terms with any nobility I serve, I'd be willing to pass on the message.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_017: Doctor, my public activity with Rhodes Island is better kept on the minimal end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_018: An intelligence worker in this position is barely a good fit... I have no reason to decline, naturally, if you have your own considerations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_019: Do you need me to tell you all, you seem like a pack of children at a holiday camp?
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_022: The intel work began long beforehand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_023: Probing the enemy's weak points, posthaste.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_024: Be ready at a moment's notice for the info I send back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_025: Don't leave it written across your face.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_026: Every look you take has value.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_027: Every expression you make is an opening.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_028: I can read you like an open book.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_029: Such adaptability and command proficiency... I'm all too glad you're not my target.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_030: Intelligence is the invisible scaffold, each battle merely following whatever course it lays out. With the boon of our preceding work, this victory should come as little surprise, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_031: Check for lost weaponry, cover all tracks, don't let anyone in the future discover what happened here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_032: A comprehensive plan must include a contingency for failure at every step. We're prepared, so evacuate ASAP... wait, destroy this intel before we leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_033: If certain Victorian nobles decorated their residences the way you do, my work would be more than twice as difficult.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_036: I was out of practice with a few skills—it seems I can revise here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. I've never joined in with noisy parties like this before. Everyone's completely open about prying into each other's freshly sworn resolutions, writing what info they're sending to their recipients on postcards. To a degree, it's stupid... Are these every year? These kinds of parties, I mean.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_042: Oh, I see it's you again, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_043: If the intel I've collected isn't mistaken, then nobody has ascertained your true preferences as of yet. So provisionally, I'm choosing to give you a puzzle as a gift. You want a race? No, it wouldn't be much contest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4017_puzzle_CN_044: Puzzle.' It's the identity I've both kept the longest, and had the least motive to work under. Rhodes Island really is a strange place. What is it that makes you all gather here...? Doctor, I've already handed in my on-board continuance application to our superiors.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_001: The files that needed sorting have all been put away. I hope it'll help reduce some of your pressure, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_002: The atmosphere in here is duly soothing, much like my mountain forest. Doctor, you're free to come play when you're not busy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_003: I've talked a lot with the Medical Department's operators, and now I can understand what everyone's goal is. Doctor, allow me to rescue this land together with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_004: This herbal pill... it's fine work. Myrrh's combined the properties of the medicinals and processed them in a special way. Hmm... I've never attempted such a manner of processing myself. In a little while, I'll see about learning from Myrrh.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_005: Aid and sanctuary are unalike. The former cures the body, the latter saves the soul.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_006: To live is an endless cycle, reaping what one sows, all beings beholden to this. I imagine you can understand, having been through so much. Leaving your own memories behind in a different incarnation, constructing your own view of the outside world; that is the purpose of this life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_007: These pills have not just the aroma of tea, but all sorts of flowers too. Many patients consider herbal pills bitter, so I've put my mind to diminishing that bitterness. I hope... the people of Rhodes Island won't dislike this flavor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_008: I very much agree with the tea here, its aroma calm, its true flavor apparent. As with tea, so with man. In this dwelling, those irrelevant rumors can be kept away; it's a rare place of respite.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_009: Doctor, the operators can have the dishes labelled with my name to eat, as well as some bottles of drinks I made myself. Everyone's been to truly tiresome lengths as of recent, and I wanted to do a thing or two to help alleviate their fatigue...
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_010: Are you tired? Rest well for a while. Don't worry; I'll protect you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_011: It's nice to meet you; I'm Nine-Colored Deer. Hm? Are these motifs so beautiful? Th-Thank you... please, observe them as you like.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_012: May I go with you next time? I want to ensure everyone's safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_013: You've endorsed me? So I have been of help to you, then. Wonderful...
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_014: The things I've learned may save many, but there remain yet more in need of aid. Doctor, can I still be more powerful than I am now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_017: Worry not, I won't betray your trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_018: Am I taking command? No problem.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_019: Don't worry, I'll bring everyone home safely.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_020: Don't separate. We meet the battlefield now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_021: I see them... an unknown enemy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_022: Are these new orders? Mm, acknowledged.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_023: This... is the chill of the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_025: The mind is as truth, a mirror reflecting all ways.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_026: A thought leaving reality, delusion in all cases.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_027: Heaven and earth come alike, all beings come together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_028: Everything has its way, per flame and per current.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_029: Mm... this battle was very smooth.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_030: Life is sincerely precious, but base and wicked life is punished in the end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_031: You needn't be sad. Though there were slight faults, with a little more of a try, you will always succeed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_032: If it has no power, no one should be shown that mercy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_033: What a strange place. So much I've never seen before.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_034: 'Kindness' is something not to be exploited, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_036: Doctor, here's a scented tea for you. It'll perk you up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_038: All in the past is like dream, like fire, like moons, like smoke. Like the reflection in a mirror, like the abyss of the void. But all things bloom and blossom in the wonderful years of life. Good work in the past year, Doctor, and may all things in the next one be auspicious and prosperous.
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_043: See the way of all beings, and all takes on the true aspect. The aspect without self, the aspect without all life, and so all life's aspect is found in one, and one becomes with heaven and earth from the day they are born. What does your birthday symbolize, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4019_ncdeer_CN_044: Blessed are those who give to the world. The blessings you give to the world will come back to you. May you continue to lead Rhodes Island forward, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_001: Feel free to assign any work to me. I have a lot of experience as a second-in-command.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_002: This communicator transmits signals over long distances, it's a powerful tool for keeping teams in touch. My Arts even amplify the signal, ensuring that communication between teams goes unimpeded. Honestly, battlefield communication is a job that was practically made for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_003: Lost? No worries, tell me where you wanna go. Um, to get there, first go up the stairs on the left until you reach the fourth floor. Then turn right, and after passing the third fork, make a left. Go down a floor, then proceed to your left. It's directly across from Closure's #3 Engineering Room. How's that? Aren't my instructions clear and concise?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_004: Thorns and I have reached an agreement: Next time, neither of us will hold back, and a victor will be crowned. I'll be sure to defeat him by a landside... What? Rhodes Island has an explicit ban on personal fights? You misunderstand, I'm only talking about chess. Loser has to shave his head, what say you to this bet?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_005: To be honest, I'm not used to being someone else's assistant. But since my captain relies solely on me to deliver her orders, I have to stay on the squad to support her. Oh, that's just between you and me, by the way. For both our sakes, don't ever tell her what I just told you, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_006: There's no overstating the importance of communication on the battlefield. And of course, the one facilitating it is the first to get targeted. But don't worry, as long as I'm here, I'll make sure your orders are smoothly transmitted to all combat personnel.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_007: Doctor, you came right on time. Actually, there's something bothering me. Why does everyone prefer looking at a map over asking me for directions? The captain says my glib tone gets on people's nerves. But that can't be, I always treat everyone with perfect kindness, wouldn't you agree?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_008: On the battlefield, few things are more important than morale. Do you see this banner? As a vanguard, just lifting it is enough to fill everyone with courage. Wait, Doctor, you didn't seriously believe that, did you? I was just joking, this thing's actually a communication device.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_009: Doctor, you've earned my trust. There's no need to be so humble. I know I'm a good judge of character. How about I call you my comrade-in-arms from now on? My captain and I used to be like oil and water, but look at us now. I believe that, much like her, you will eventually be moved by my sincerity. No? The captain sent you a letter complaining about me? What?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_010: Doctor, the files over here are... Hm? Already asleep? Well, even if it's just me, you really shouldn't let your guard down like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_011: 3rd Combat Squad, vanguard and communications specialist, Elysium, reporting in. We've always communicated through electronic means, I do believe this is our first time speaking face-to-face, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_012: I'm seeing myself in a lot of these battle records. Talk about weird.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_013: Thank you very much. I won't end up ranked higher than my captain if I get promoted again, will I?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_014: I've always trusted my own judgment, Doctor. But if you're the one giving me orders, I won't question them for a second. After all, isn't that what it means to be a comrade-in-arms?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_018: Don't worry, I'm just a stand-in. The captain's not here right now, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_019: Let's go then. Everyone, follow the route I drafted.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_023: I wonder who their target will be.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_024: Gather under this banner in the name of the Lord— Heh, I've always wanted to try saying that.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_025: Sorry, but I'm really not religious.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_026: Who would! Use a flag! As a weapon on the battlefield!
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_029: This just confirms it. We really do make the best partners.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_031: If they've lost their fighting spirit, they're not our enemies anymore. Let's stop here.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_032: It's too dangerous! I'll be the last line of defense! Doctor, please give the order to retreat!
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_033: Hm... Has this room been renovated?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_036: I've heard that if this tuft of red hair on my head falls out, it won't ever grow back. This is a very serious problem, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_038: Hello, hello? Can you hear me...? Signal's fine, connection to the landship's all clear. Doctor, try to guess which comms station I'm calling from...? Doc's distracted! Now! Set off the fireworks! Heh-heh, what do you think, Doctor? Now that's a passionate New Year's celebration, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_042: Hey, Doctor! Got any missions for me today?
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I've meticulously prepared this year's gift, taking into consideration everything I've learned. This time, you'll be blown away by... W-Wait, hold on, Doctor, don't leave! I swear, it's not a prank this time!
dialogue_tracker.char_401_elysm_CN_044: Rhodes Island's a lot busier now than when I first arrived. We keep finding more and more trustworthy companions, and I think I'm not the only one drawing complaints anymore. I'm deeply moved, so I painstakingly edited up an audio reel of everyone being drunk at last year's party! I hope it gets some enthusiastic reactions!
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_001: Here are the documents. If that's all, I'll be going... The stain on that sheet? Oh, that's, uh... I guess I did spill something when I was having a couple of drinks last night. Haha... Damn, I put it in the middle of the stack, how'd you catch it...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_002: Do cultured folks like you even drink? Come, come, let's take a swig together, okay? Climb the hills in the dark, cross the desert in a storm. Now we gather in the oasis, drinking all the finest booze… Hehehe, oh, my friend, let's return to our homeland…
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_003: Why are you all wrapped up like that on such a warm day? You'll be drenched in sweat. Hey you! Yes, you! Why don't you take off that jacket? A true warrior isn't afraid to show the results of hard training!
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_004: 'Operator'? No, I'm a warrior of Rhodes Island. Don't worry, it's not because I can't let go of the past, but because I want to defend the present. I'll train new warriors for you... same as I was taken in and raised back on the sands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_005: I once took in some war orphans. They begged me to teach them how to use a sword to get revenge. I agreed, and they succeeded, but at the cost of their lives… Many years ago, the chief taught me that the sword is only for protection.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_006: The war took the lives of everyone in my tribe. My friends blocked blows with their bodies, and the chief's blood dripped onto my head... Me and the other children set out on a path of revenge. I'm the only one left. No one and nothing else. Only me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_007: The mark I'm drawing on your forearm? It's a 'bite mark'. Look, I have one too. The chief carved it into my skin herself. She said that those who have undergone the trial of blood and pain become the bravest warriors. The mark brings us strength.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_008: I've taken plenty of hits both in battle and in the mines, but not many left marks. I used to think I was lucky, but now I wish I wasn't. I want the scars to help me remember certain people and things. Death brings back nothing, you know. I have to stay alive, and carry them myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_009: Is it snowing on that peak...? Ohh... Guess what, Doctor? I had a dream last night about sleeping in the chief's arms when I was first taken in. She stroked my forehead gently, and her palm was like the sun-scorched sand, warm and rough. They've never seen the snow. Now I see it for them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_010: It's a beautiful day out there. I had a good nap, and a good dream, for once.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_011: I choose to stand here, and so the land beneath my feet is my home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_012: No need, I'll grab my weapon and shield and head to the training grounds.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_013: It's a warrior's duty, no need to thank me... Wha? Blushing? Of course I'm not blushing. How could you even tell I'm blushing through my tan?
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_014: Thanks, Doctor... I'll take this medal back to my homeland. The spring there has dried up, but it will continue to bless me, and they will know that I'm still fighting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_017: Love, friends, hearth. That's what a warrior lives for.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_018: Warriors! Your courage will bring glory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_019: Don't eat too much before a battle, unless you want to throw it all up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_027: The enemy will never see our backs!
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_028: Raise your weapons and shields! Not one step back!
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_029: This is the home that we defend. This is where they die.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_030: The invaders' swords cut their own throats. An end they deserve.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_031: Haha, it is an honor to die defending my home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_032: My homeland, my friends, my love... they're all waiting for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_033: The heck? No alcohol here...? Huh? What's that in my mug? It's just some b… umm... bubbly barley juice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_036: Hahaha! Oh, I hate being tickled…
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_038: The strongest liquor for the bravest warrior. This one is mine, Doctor. If you really want it... devour this whole roasted game, and you'll be our hero for the day!
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_042: Yo, Doctor, you sure you don't need to sun a bit?
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_043: I made this drinking horn out of the sands of my tribal homeland. A new warrior blows her victory horn after her first battle, celebrating her arrival into the world.
dialogue_tracker.char_4023_rfalcn_CN_044: It's hard to describe what I felt when I first saw Rhodes Island sail by in the distance, the rumbling of the ship and the tremor of the sands... it's like my chief was whispering in my ear: You've found another place worth fighting for.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_001: Doctor, might these be the books and documents you were looking for? No, no need to thank me, I'm simply glad to be of help. How would I have known what you needed? Heheh. That would be... secret.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_002: Phantom and I certainly have... our similarities, in what we've been through. Though now he pursues the truth, I only wish to be far removed from it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_003: Doctor. About that lady who came to borrow your books... was her name Mint? She seems to be curious about a great many things. Curiosity in excess usually invites disaster, you see, and I have my reservations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_004: It is quite the relief you were with us last mission, Doctor. I find myself dazed by the sight of you when you command. As if something crosses past the curtain of night and the stirring stars, leading your way...
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_005: Dance, music. Both soothe the soul, twin arts calling on us to focus and follow. But at times, too great a fixation can be our undoing. Such stories were already far too plenty where I formerly lived. Even I... am no exception to the rule.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_006: Doctor? What are you standing there for...? I see... you overheard me talking with someone...? Cease with the jests, please. There is no one here... but me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_007: You wish to learn of the Crimson Troupe's affairs? Of course, I know of them all. But take caution, Doctor, for should you stray like they from the proper path... or come near to too many of them, you may be taken hold of. And that is not, whatsoever, desirable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_008: Here you are once more. Please, sit. Be reassured that I will not drive you out. So, what's the matter this time? Could Hibiscus have made another healthy meal? Or is Sideroca bound to whisk you away for training again?
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_009: My stories are hackneyed, bereft of novelty. Likely, not as engaging as you imagine. You would like to hear them nonetheless? Very well. Then I will tell you tales... but in exchange, Doctor, would you grant me a request?
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_010: Doctor. Doctor? Beg pardon, I know I should not disturb your rest... but it is far too still here for me to fully be at ease.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_011: I envisaged the scene in which we would formally meet, Doctor, and this very moment brings it to life. Operator Shalem, pleased to make your acquaintance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_012: At times, I do feel the battlefield and the stage resemble one another, in ways.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_013: Promotion, did you say...? Ah, I'm sorry, it just startled me. Thank you for your acknowledgement, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_014: Unlike him, still wreathed in his struggle, I had long since fled the past, never to concern me again... yes, Doctor, so I once hoped.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_017: Worry not, coordinating with others is a strength of mine. So long as nothing untoward happens...
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_018: I may lack for power, but I will do all that I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_020: See those on the stage... knowing nothing of their fates.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_022: Their future is clear to see.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_023: I hope we may resolve this peacefully.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_024: To kill and to be killed, to do battle. Far too many plays are penned on these themes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_025: And may this end as swiftly as can be.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_026: The path you all now walk bears not one hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_027: Surely, your skulls... would be mesmerizing to see, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_029: This is far beyond my wildest dreams. The best outcome, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_030: It is done. Be at ease, for no danger remains. Well done, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_031: Our mission is complete, Doctor. As for those who escaped... they have their own fates to meet.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_032: Haste not; ponder leisurely. We still have opportunities.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_033: Shall we rest here a while? How about some music?
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_034: Ah... I'm sorry, I was lost in thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_036: Doctor, could you hold my coat for me briefly? I'll be done in a moment. My thanks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_038: Some dance and song is all it takes—days like these never fail to tempt art into showing a hint of its beauty, such that more would bow to it. A grand performance is about to begin, Doctor, and when the time has come, will you be able to recognize the true me beneath the limelight?
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_042: Welcome, Doctor. Indeed, I knew you would surely come.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_043: Excellent, you are here just as I expected. Though some young operators express their affection in far too ardent ways, you'll nevertheless break their hearts should you hide away like this. And one more hint before you open the door, try to place your feet back, and find something to brace against. Yes. This way, you won't be thrown to the floor when they joyfully tackle you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4025_aprot2_CN_044: I have to wear this...? Are you sure, Doctor? I don't recall this sort of adornment being called for on the stage... Very well... And dance with you? That would be a little... Oh my. Excuse me, Doctor. The steps here should go like this... Here, let me show you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_001: Have someone else handle the paperwork and filing. But if you need anyone dealt with, or protected, just give me the list of names. I'll take care of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_002: These are clothes and snacks for Lisa, along with gifts for her friends. As for this box of old books her papa insisted I bring, I'm not sure what they're for. I'll just let Lisa decide what to do with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_003: Uniform? No, thanks. I don't know why you people need so many pockets. Just as I can't grasp why the Higashinese stuff planks and pillows in their waistbands, making it so terribly hard to move around… Anyway, I'm fine with this outfit, and it has nothing to do with me being Siracusan.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_004: Some of the operators here have unsteady breathing. Perhaps they could try reciting a tanka or two to adjust their breaths as they strike, like: 'Solitude seeps not from autumn shade, but from the mountain pines in red sun's fall.' Or 'I bear no off'ring branch unto the hills, for rich brocades of maple sate the gods.' You think these lines evoke a particular image? Hm. Probably.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_005: No need to hide the Wolumonde story from me. Hm, you look nervous, but I'm not here to cast blame, my daughter knows the meaning of her work. Suzuran is no fragile flower, and I am no hidebound gardener.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_006: My return trip to Siracusa? The perpetrator is dead, so there is little else to say. The man who, in his lust for power, deprived so many of a decent life, did not deserve a decent death.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_007: Lost in thought? Is something wrong? Hm, some business less suited to a so-called pharmaceutical company, is it? If you need my help, do speak clearly now. You see, Doctor, I have only the patience to manage this single braid.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_008: The wine tasting is already finished? I went to freshen up and hurried back as quickly as I could... Ah, sorry, but my work demands it. You see, precision is everything. I must be meticulous about which bastard die at which moment, not a second sooner. Hehe, but we don't need to pick a time for whiskey. Care to stay a while longer?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_009: So much snow on the deck, and yet the corridors are not cold. I detest inconsistent weather, so the landship has been a blessing. I only just realized how long I've been here. You're right, an assassin's vacation is a good thing, for herself, and others.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_010: I'll stay here, just call me if you need something. Hard to believe? Sometimes, I can be very patient, Doctor. Have you ever tried combing nineteen tails in one go?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_011: Hello. You must be 'the incredible Doctor' Lisa always mentions in her letters. Hmm, I've been curious to know what you looked like, and here you are. Which reminds me, could you update me on Lisa's studies, if you have the time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_012: It's not often I see recordings of myself. I fought my battles in quiet alleyways, with no witnesses.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_013: I appreciate the recognition. But this means those after the bounty on my head will come looking for Rhodes Island. You are not worried?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_014: I accept your medal, Doctor. You needn't say more. I do know the difference between this medal, and the emblems of the Siracusan family.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_017: Leave the toughest one for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_018: Just keep yourselves safe, ladies and gentlemen.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_019: My ears are sharp, so when I stop, you stop.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_020: Need to parley with them? But I rarely do such things, whether I'm in Siracusa or Higashi.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_022: So much negotiation and we end up talking with our blades.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_025: Hate and resentment have no place, but in a burst of autumn red.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_026: Flowers imbibed, the lady in suit and tie dance with her blade.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_027: At least make me lose the coat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_028: Why the rush? The road to the afterlife is crowded enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_029: Higashinese shoji screens often run a common theme. The kami created life and land to propagate themselves… A pity they didn't care for what came after. Sorting out this mess is hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_030: There's nothing to clean up. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_031: Crawling out of the swamp is hard enough, never mind doing it gracefully.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_032: Leave the rest to me... it's clear why we failed, and I know how to make it even.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_033: The soundproofing of this place is excellent. Was it done for professional reasons?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_034: Hehe, even Lisa has grown out of this by now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_036: The scar on my face? I wasn't born with it... Let's just leave it at that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_038: Happy New Year. What a wonderful gathering. Dancing, chatting, making noise just for fun, instead of drowning out a struggle. Hmm… Lisa's making her way here, Doctor. That was sake in my cup and not a double whiskey shot, understand?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_042: Hello, Doctor... Hehe, I can hear your footsteps even with my ears folded.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_043: Happy Birthday, Doctor. Lisa's papa asked me to give you this omamori. He hopes to visit you in person, if given the chance. As for me, I offer a promise: my blade is yours whenever you need it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_CN_044: I first contacted Rhodes Island because it was the best place to treat Lisa. But now, I would send her here to learn, even if she were perfectly healthy. Do not let this landship ever stop, Doctor, not after it has been sailing for so long.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_001: Have someone else handle the paperwork and filing. But if you need anyone dealt with, or protected, just give me the list of names and I will go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_002: These are clothes and snacks for Lisa, and these are some gifts I prepared for her friends. As for this box of old books her papa insisted I bring, I'm not sure what they're for. I'll just let my daughter handle it herself, once she's here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_003: Uniform? No, grazie. I don't understand why you people need so many pockets, just as I can't grasp why the Higashinese love stuffing planks and pillows into their waists, making it so terribly hard to move around... I'm comfortable in this outfit, and it has nothing to do with me being Siracusan.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_004: You have some nervous Operators here. Perhaps they could try reciting a haiku or two to pace their breaths. Like 'Solitude seeps not from autumn's shade, but from the mountain pines in red sun's fall.' Or 'I bear no off'ring branch unto the hills, for rich brocades of maple sate the gods.'—these poems evoke a particular image? Hm. I suppose.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_005: No need to hide the Wolumonde story from me... You look nervous, but I'm not here to cast blame, my daughter knows her work is meaningful. The Suzuran is no fragile flower, and I am no old-fashioned gardener.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_006: How was my return trip to Siracusa, you ask? The guilty party is dead, so there is little else to say. How could one who made so many suffer on a quest for power die with honor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_007: Why are you staring so emptily? Is something bothering you? Perhaps some work less suited to a so-called pharmaceutical company? If I can be of help, then speak, Doctor... My patience will last only until I finish this braid.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_008: The wine tasting is already finished? I went to fix my suit and hurried back as quick as I could... Ah, scusa. I forgot to look at my watch. My work requires careful timekeeping—there is a method behind the timing at which the bastardi die. But why not stay a while? Whiskey is a fine drink, special occasion or no.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_009: So much snow on the deck, and yet the corridors are not cold. I detest inconsistent weather, so the landship has been a blessing—I only just realized how long I've been here. You're right: An assassin's vacation is a good thing, for herself, and others.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_010: I'm over here, just call me if you need something... I am a very patient woman, Doctor. Did you ever try combing nineteen tails in one go?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_011: Ciao. I've always been curious what 'the incredible Doctor' Lisa always mentioned in her letters looked like... heh. And here you are. Could you update me on her schooling? If you have the time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_012: It's not often I see recordings of myself. I fought my battles in quiet alleyways, with no witnesses.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_013: I appreciate the recognition. But this means those after the bounty on my head will come looking for Rhodes Island. You are not worried?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_014: I accept your medal, Doctor. But enough talk, I do know the difference between this decoration and the emblems of the Siracusan famiglie.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_017: Leave the toughest one for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_019: My ears are sharp, so when I stop, you stop.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_020: You want to parley? A rare business for me, whether in Siracusa or Higashi.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_022: So much negotiation and we end up talking with our blades.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_025: Hate and resentment have no place, but in a burst of autumn red.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_026: Flowers imbibed, the woman in suit and tie—a dance with her blade.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_027: Try getting my coat off first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_028: Why the rush? The road to hell is crowded enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_029: Higashinese shoji screens often run a common theme. The kami created life and land to propagate themselves... a pity they didn't care for what came next. Sorting out this mess is hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_030: There's nothing to clean up. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_031: It's not easy to pull yourself out of the mud, but there is no need to stay serious all the time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_032: Leave the rest to me... it's clear why we failed, and I know how to make it even.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_033: The soundproofing is excellent. Was it done for professional reasons?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_034: Huh? Even Lisa has grown out of this by now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_036: The scar on my face? I wasn't born with it... no, never mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_038: Happy New Year. What a wonderful gathering. Dancing, chatting, making noise for a reason other than muffling troublesome movements —Lisa's making her way here, Doctor. That was sake in my cup and not a double whiskey shot, correct?
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_042: Ciao, Doctor... I can hear your footsteps even with folded ears, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_043: Buon compleanno, Doctor. Lisa's papa asked me to give you this omamori. He hopes to visit you in person, if given the chance. As for me, I offer a promise: call my name anytime you need my blade.
