dialogue_tracker.char_4026_vulpis_ITA_CN_044: I contacted Rhodes Island in the first place because it was the most suitable place to treat Lisa. But now, I would send her here to learn, even if she was cured. Do not let this landship ever stop, Doctor, not after it has been sailing for so long.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_001: Here, two Minoan Mists, freshly brewed... I'll have to behave myself, Doctor, since I'm your assistant now. The next time you choke on my strangling tail after getting me mad, I'll make sure you can at least find some solace in my feathers.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_002: Immoral scientist, disloyal mercenary, double-crossing spy... Yes, that's all me. Rules are what bar you from working to your full efficiency, darling, and you must learn to break them. That being said, I'm sure you have more to share with me for what little time we have alone together, other than the rules of Rhodes Island, I suppose?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_003: As senior consultant to Rhodes Island, I'd love to have more time to study the archives and collections of this ship. Meet my coworkers? You see the flow of history and soundless order in those objects. Tell me, what's worth seeing in people?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_004: 'Reflect the truth and glimpse the future'? Most astrologers got started just to steal a peek at their own doom. But when Kristen tore open the skies over Trimounts, she debunked astrology as the silly fabrication it is. And that's more interesting than the practice itself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_005: The foolish build walls, the wise topple them... or vice versa. History is a database that holds more than it seems, full of hints about the future. After all, history itself was the future for countless generations... that's what really grips me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_006: Our story? Feathers wet by dew from the trees, tails sweeping past decrepit pillars. Thus, knowledge was passed on through generations. We embrace the ever-expanding unknown, and walk toward madness... I don't want to lose my mind, of course. But if that's what it takes to change this ridiculous fate, then I'll do it gladly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_007: Doctor, were you… avoiding me? I just wanted to show you a newly-excavated ruin I found. What's that? Why do I keep bothering you? Oh my, shouldn't you do some soul-searching and ask why you are the only one I'm bothering?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_008: I saw you with Muelsyse at the mall in Trimounts. That elf surely knows how to work her charm, doesn't she? I could use some assistance from you as well, but my 'approaches' are different. Look down now, my tail will gladly learn the way through your heart, unless you accept my offer.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_009: Tell me, Doctor, how does it feel to lose your memory? I couldn't bear to see a great library reduced to ashes in a fire. But a librarian fool enough to only brush the dust off the shelves pains me even more. Who's sadder, you or me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_010: Your ears are red. Sensitive, aren't they? Puff... oh, they're getting redder! Now don't you move. You're still at work, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_011: I'm not here representing Maylander or Rhine Lab. I'm here because I, Ho'olheyak, want some further contact with Rhodes Island... Now, now, why are you trying to shake off my hand? I haven't finished introducing myself yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_013: Congratulations. You've earned yourself a promotion from me too. This time, I brewed four Minoan Mists... do they really punch you that hard? Stay sober now, if you know what's good for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_014: Another promotion? Does that mean more permissions at Rhodes Island? There are secrets in this ship that even you don't know about, I can sense that. Just what fun we'll have!
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_017: My job is to innovate on these missions. Your job is to be impressed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_018: There's no plan. Plans change anyway. As long as it helps the mission, you can break the rules at any time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_021: I thought I was just here as a consultant.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_022: My, my... Are you sure you want to treat me as a mercenary?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_023: Such ruthlessness! I said I don't like getting my feathers wet.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_024: How rude~ Didn't I tell you not to get dust on my tail?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_027: Oh, your Arts aren't working. How can that be?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_028: Did I say I was going to have mercy? I lied.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_029: Doctor, your performance reminds me of a bunch of unfounded legends. But now, I believe in them. Legends no more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_030: Are you… waiting for a compliment?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_031: Nothing is 100% true. Similarly, nothing is 100% false. Doctor, what we've done is already enough to bring all kinds of change.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_032: Leave the rest to me. I'm used to picking up other people's messes. Use the time to think about how you'll thank me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_033: Excuse me, are we accommodating a mercenary here, or is this how Rhodes Island welcomes their senior consultant...? Heh, Just kidding.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_034: What, here to challenge Siestan Iced Tea? Or, Minoan Mist?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_036: Careful! These are rare documents. How did I get them? Relax, not by following procedure, I assure you. What, you wanna interrogate me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_038: A historical society awards ceremony? Annual divination association convention? Not interested. Don't you dare think about all that crap when you're with me. It's New Year's Day. Aren't you going to ask me to dance? Don't worry, I won't touch you with my tail this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_042: Well, if it isn't the Doctor… What a coincidence, us bumping into each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Me? My people don't get many chances to celebrate birthdays, our lifespan being short as it is. I just didn't want to pass on this cursed knowledge. Do I still have time to change things? Ha, look at me, getting drunk on your birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4027_heyak_CN_044: The skies of Trimounts have been restored, Dr. {@nickname}, but no one will forget what they saw when they were torn open. What do you see in the future of this land? What can Rhodes Island do? What can I do for you, and for myself? That's what I want to ask you.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_001: You want me to do something so boring...? Fine, fine. I'll tag along, just because you're somewhat amusing.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_002: Don't count on me to move stuff. I'm not that brand of Forte.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_003: This is some insanely precise instrumentation... Wait, haven't I seen these before? Oh, right. If that Mayer girl shows up, don't tell her where I am.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_004: Never seen the equipment on my back before? Right, come over, put your hand here... keh-ka-hahahahahah! Look at your pathetic face! Guess what just sprayed out? It's water!—With a few... extras. Don't bother asking what!
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_005: My interest in helping others is zip. But boosting efficiency benefits everybody.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_006: Battles finish up faster now. Good to know, I guess.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_007: Cake? Soft and squishy—not my speed. But. Mmp, mmnm... the umeboshi on top's not bad, sure.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_008: No rain inside the landship? Duh, obviously I know that. But you never know how it might go outside. Hmph, next time there's a storm, stick close to me. You'll be glad I'm holding this.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_009: Hey. Fancy a desert day trip? I can guide you around there. Or anywhere else you like, as long as I have my multi-function jetpack, following the scent of the wind... heh, you're incredibly lucky to have a guide like me.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_010: You out cold? Hehe, then I've got a trick to try. Higher pressure, wider spray... And you're past the statute of limitations for a complaint.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_011: You the Doctor? They all say you're the one here who knows more than the rest. You're gonna let me figure that out.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_012: Combat's just like crossing the desert, where experience means nothing. Your only need is survival instincts.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_013: Doesn't this elite medal do anything at all? No fun to be had here.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_014: Medical professional? Funny thing to call me that. Anyway, it's all about getting my job done, either way, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_017: Out for field work again? Fine. You're helping me test new equipment when we get back.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_018: Leading a team in combat is close enough to being a guide.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_019: Route, okay. Equipment, check. Let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_020: Boring... Worse than running into a sandstorm.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_026: Time to test my upgraded equipment.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_027: How's the new nutritional paste taste?
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_029: Ugh. The sandstorms I've seen beat this any day.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_030: Scraped by, huh. Wasn't a waste of time after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_031: Efficiency lacking. Gotta head back and adjust my equipment, or switch reagents, maybe.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_032: At least you figured a good retreat route…
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_033: You have a lot of rooms, huh…
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_034: You gotta stop with the boring crap already.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_036: Wanna try touching my bag again? Won't hit you in the face this time. Promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_038: Wishing you a Happy New Year! I look forward to your kind guidance in the coming year. Okay, done. Without a hitch, right? Happy now?—a bonus? For me? Really? Hmm... thank you. Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_042: Rain again. Nice weather, huh, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_043: Happy birthday. Here's this umbrella's for you. I bought it from a trustworthy merchant in Sargon—It's top-notch. You'll be traveling all over the place, so it'll come in handy. Oh, and if you feel like jumping off the ship's bridge with it, I won't stop you.
dialogue_tracker.char_402_tuye_CN_044: I've checked Rhodes Island's navigation log. You've been down some awfully treacherous routes. But why don't I see even a hint of fear in anybody? What talent do you have, as the one who guides the ship, to bring out such deep, unshakable trust? I'm... curious.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_001: These documents won't take me long to take care of. Why don't you show me Rhodes Island's old business contracts? You never know what kind of restitutions there might be hidden in a contract's terms.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_002: Doctor, when you work out your business plans, feel free to put off the legal ramifications till the very end. I've never lost a case as a defense attorney.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_003: Huh? Even that ice-cold Młynar is here? And here I thought he'd want a breather after leaving his job behind in the Grand Knight Territory. Well, Rhodes Island isn't a bad place. At least they don't expect you to wine-and-dine clients here. Otherwise, considering his alcohol tolerance...
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_004: Is that a Kazimierzian newspaper you're reading, Doctor? 'Despite Conclusive Evidence, Knight Sports Match Fixers Found Innocent'—Oh, I was in charge of that case. What does that mean? Hehe, if they walked away scot-free, then obviously the evidence wasn't conclusive enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_005: I've never actually worked for a multinational corporation before, so I've been reading up on other countries' laws, too. But no matter where you are, the lawbooks make it clear as day who benefits under their rules.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_006: The courtroom is a place of victory and defeat. Both sides submit their evidence, and their disputes are arbitrated within the confines of the law. I never expected to find any justice in that process, but when the law can be freely trampled on by capitalism, being a lawyer gets real boring, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_007: Ugh, my back hurts. I kind of want a massage chair, but money's tight with my current salary. But considering Rhodes Island's revenue, I suppose the pay isn't completely unreasonable—Speaking of which, what do you think of my plan to demand compensation from companies we've worked with? What? How can it be extortion when we're asking for pocket change?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_008: Doctor, I think there are a lot of problems with the medical malpractice liability clauses in Rhodes Island's contracts. In most countries, we as a medical company wouldn't be liable for a lot of the scenarios listed in there—You don't want to fix it? Alright, I'll give it some more thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_009: I'm slowly starting to understand that expecting the law be able to judge all disputes fairly isn't just naive, it's intellectually lazy. The law is not perfect, and it will always be riddled with holes that we need to fill with humanity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_010: So even the Doctor likes to sleep at the desk, just like me. I'll be worried about your spine if this keeps up, though…
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_011: Hello, my name is Deszcz. I'm your new legal consultant. If you need to call me by a codename, then use Proviso. Let me get this out of the way first, though. The general practice of obfuscating all your employees' identities isn't going to fly with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_012: If you're putting me in charge, I can make sure the enemies will be liable for all damages.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_013: A promotion? Let me take a look at the new contract... Alright, everything checks out. My salary did go up. Thanks!
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_014: If you're letting me read these high clearance level materials, this is going way beyond a normal partnership, isn't it...? Thanks for your trust, Doctor. I hope I'll be able to accomplish with law what I never could before I came here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_017: I'm glad to help, but before we get started, can we be more explicit with regards to the terms of compensation?
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_018: Everyone, please be sure to handle the work you're assigned. Do not give our opponents any loopholes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_019: The court is now in session!
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_020: I've gathered enough materials on our opponents. They will lose this case.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_022: Ahem. Allow me to present my argument.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_023: If you are not party to this suit, please leave at once.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_024: Order! The court will soon reach a verdict.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_025: Hold it! The evidence submitted by the opposing party is suspect.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_026: Objection! The witness's testimony is self-contradictory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_027: Anything you say can and will be used against you. I suggest you exercise your right to remain silent.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_028: Based on the above, you are found guilty.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_029: No surprise there. As long as you understand how to use the system, the results follow naturally.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_030: I take it I met your expectations, Doctor? Now, per our contract, let's discuss legal fees.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_031: Don't worry, we'll get this case thrown out and win the retrial.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_032: Something must've gone wrong somewhere... I won't let this kind of failure happen again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_033: Can I apply for a more comfortable chair?
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_036: Doctor, I took a photo of what you just did as evidence.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_038: I wanted to treat myself to a gift at the end of the year, only to find myself completely broke. This would've been unthinkable at my old job... Oh, whatever. It's a new year. Better not dwell on the past. Happy New Year, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. I'm happy to report that Rhodes Island is not currently involved in any legal disputes, for now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. These scales of justice are a graduation gift I got from my law school. Take them. Not that I don't want them anymore, but I just thought it would be more meaningful for you to keep them in your room.
dialogue_tracker.char_4032_provs_CN_044: Taking in patients with a incurable disease feels just like taking on an unwinnable case... That said, I also believe that the value of doing something isn't determined entirely by the results. Keep it up, Doctor, and let me deal with all those pesky corporate rivals.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_001: Doctor, do all these files need to be filled out by today? It's just, with this much left... so be it, I'll help you out. If we sort this out together, it shouldn't eat into our break hours.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_002: When I decided to violate orders and act independently, I was expecting a severe reprimand. What I never predicted was that Mr. Executor would recommend me here…
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_003: Doctor, do you know if there's anywhere to borrow storybooks here? Operators at the Medical Department have asked me to care for the children under treatment, and I'd like to read them a tale or two.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_004: The Notarial Hall employs more than just field executors; there's plenty of civil service posts. I actually aspired for one in the first place, but when it came to the evaluation, I accidentally... um, collapsed a few rooms in the examination venue, which got me put in my current position.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_005: I don't rue leaving Laterano; it was my own choice. There's so many places I'm still not familiar with, but I feel that being able to see the breadth of Terra like I am now is more than worth it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_006: The Sankta ability to perceive each other's states of mind is common sense to us, not something that needs real elaboration. But I'm sad to say, at some point, I suddenly realized I lost that reciprocation with my own people. It wasn't any physical disease, I just... began to think.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_007: Stop, Doctor! Phew. You took the wrong cup—that's the espresso I brewed for myself, with no sugar. Yours was the one next to it. Sorry, I assume it was too bitter? ...It's fine, it tastes great? A—Alright, I'm glad you like it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_008: Doctor, could you lend me your comms device for a moment? I usually turn my comms off after work, and don't get any messages. ...There we go, I've granted you emergency contact privileges. You can get in touch with me whenever for whatever, this way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_009: You seem to be having plenty of fun. Yes, I can tell. Joy, sorrow, anger... emotions can propagate between all of us, regardless of what city or race we come from. When you're happy, it's no wonder I can sense it too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_010: Doctor, are you still awake? It's just a little longer now. We can be on break once this work's done. Here, I have your coffee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_011: Hello, I'm a dispatch at Rhodes Island via a transfer agreement with the Notarial Hall. A codename? Let's think... You can call me Enforcer. Here's the files pertaining to the agreement. I'll be counting on you to show me the ropes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_012: Brilliant. It'll be quick for me to adapt to this combat style.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_013: A promotion... Is this going to impact my specific working hours?
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_014: Maybe it's immature of me to approach things this way, but every step I've taken up to today is of my own choosing, and I'm satisfied with that. Doctor, thank you so much for watching over me all this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_018: If we run into any contingency situations, I will independently judge how to proceed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_019: The sooner we're out, the sooner we're on break.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_020: Do we have to compensate for damages incurred in combat?
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_023: This battle is by no means out of animosity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_024: We all simply have differing viewpoints, no more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_025: This is as far as you go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_026: A struggle with an ideal to support it is far from meaningless.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_027: I will hear you all out afterwards.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_028: Be careful not to fall from here, everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_029: They have what they uphold, and we have ours. Thank you for the willingness to realize, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_030: Mission complete. Good work, Doctor. Let's take a good break once we're back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_031: The ones who ran—did they give up? Or, maybe...
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_032: No need to be so dejected. We can still try again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_033: So these are the renowned Rhodes Island dormitories? Very... well, frugal.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_034: Careful! You could've spilled the coffee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_036: I wear eyemasks while I'm on break, so I can only tell you all apart by your footsteps. Was that just now... the Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_038: This is my first time welcoming in the New Year somewhere beyond Laterano. There's still plenty of places I'm not used to, but I've tried so many things I never tried before, and that... feels pretty good. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. It seems you've already gotten plenty of cakes today. So, here's my present—a mug of premium coffee. It is totally devoid of sugar, but if you taste carefully, you can pick out a fruity, caramel sweetness... Doctor, is something wrong? Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4036_forcer_CN_044: There are so many fellow Sankta aboard Rhodes Island. The sympathy might be missing, but I can see the joy and blessing on their faces as plain as day. Is it because they've all found a goal worth devoting themselves to here? If so, Doctor, I'll appreciate any future guidance you have for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_001: I'll sort out your battlefield reports for you. My officialese isn't too shabby. I'll stand guard during your rest hours. Anything else required...? I'd prefer you don't keep me idle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_002: Has Bagpipe kept up her habit of humming around you? Me? I'm more the type to appreciate music in peace. The only thing a horn can play is the order to charge—I'm joking of course, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_003: The name 'White Wolf' goes as far back in history as the Aslan monarchy. Why are you interested, though? ...Ah. You saw... my fangs? I'm sorry, I lost control of myself then. I won't let it happen again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_004: I have beautiful handwriting? Thank you. It just comes with the facade when you're raised noble, which I've never been keen on. But sometime these days, I'm grateful for it—whenever I pick up a pen, everything else leaves my mind, and my focus is only on how I write every letter in the proper way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_005: As that city spat great black crystals from its gaping wounds, I thought there could be no hope left for it... Is this place familiar with those made Infected not by Catastrophe, but by human hands, Doctor of Rhodes Island?
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_006: Rhodes Island Operator Misery managed to rescue me twice, and I'm sincerely grateful for it. I won't ask why I was the one he rescued. Those who live on are to carry forth the wishes of those who didn't make it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_007: I always feel stifled by gloomy indoor atmospheres. Do you want to go out and take a walk, Doctor? It might be overcast, but at least there'll be a breeze. There are times you can hear singing on the wind too, not just the echo of your own words.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_008: I can vaguely remember the portraits of my ancestors decorated with medals in the hall. I also recall the épée carved with the Lion King's orders, and the maples my father planted in the front courtyard... but that's all that comes to me. I haven't returned home in a long, long while. In Her chaotic theater, Victoria's soldiers have no time to file for leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_009: Doctor, does a commander as outstanding as you ever feel sorrow? Or anger? Or... hate? I try as hard as I can not to let personal emotions sway me, but I can't forget. I promised them I would never forget.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_010: How do you sleep, after having witnessed so much cruelty...? If I could do the same as you, with a simple shut of my eyes, would I feel any better?
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_011: Tempest Platoon Leader Horn reporting in, Doctor of Rhodes Island. I've already borne witness to your own tactics, and the fighting spirit of Rhodes Island's operators. Under our ensuing cooperation, I and my troops will heed your orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_012: No amount of training can ever suffice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_013: Thank you. I'll regard this as a commendation of my performance, and not a reflection of my status.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_014: Confer your emblems of rank on me. I'm willing... No. I must bear the hopes of more. Of those past, now, and to come.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_017: Victoria's servicemen should take pride in their own discipline.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_018: I trust in my platoonmates at any and all times. I'd like you to put that same trust in me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_019: We have no time to hesitate. There are souls waiting for us, behind the firing line.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_020: I'll put up my shield. Don't stand in front of me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_021: Allow me to study your command style in this battle, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_022: At attention. Ready to fall in.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_025: The Tempest must wipe out all that blocks the way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_026: Come! Best me if you can!
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_027: I'll impart on you all the cries I've heard.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_028: You want to topple me? By what?
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_029: One victory may not be enough to impact a whole war, but it can at least give more people a chance to see the open sky.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_031: Any mercy on the enemy is a potential disaster. Let me lead my troops to settle this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_032: Not a worry, Doctor. Until you've gotten everyone away, I will not fall.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_033: It doesn't resemble Victoria here, but... it reminds me of when I studied at the Royal Guard Academy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_034: Sorry, I'm not used to setting down my weapons. Did I bruise you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_036: Hm...? I'm just reading an ordinary novel. I've gone an awfully long time without reading something new. All the written word went up in the fires of war.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_038: When Misery rescued me, he told me the New Year had already come and gone. That was the first one I ever missed. Ever since, I've begun to pay less attention to these holidays at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. Have you rested well?
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_043: What rite should I be celebrating your birthday by? I don't believe you to be fond of drinking parties, so I'll sing for you, then. This is a small little ceremonial from back in the Tempest Platoon.
dialogue_tracker.char_4039_horn_CN_044: Periodic summations and celebrations both can't be dispensed with. When Amiya's speech wound up, the instant the people around me started laughing and bellowing, I relaxed. That surprised me. I see what's past is past now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_001: You want me to be your assistant? I can't, I barely know how to read. It'll just be a waste of your time. But if you need something fixed, then I can help.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_002: I'm too frugal? I don't think so, I just live the way I want. Machinery is good, but I don't need it to do anything fancy. Same goes for my clothes, only the stuff I make myself suits me best. If you have fewer needs, then of course you spend less money.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_003: When my dad was killed, I honestly thought there wasn't a single good man among the Sarkaz. But now that I think about it, I was too naive at the time. How can stuff like race or appearance decide if someone's good or bad? No matter what your race is, as long as you look out for one another, you're family.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_004: This outfit? Made it myself—it's gotta be as cool as possible since it gets really hot in the boiler room. It... doesn't look like work attire? What d'ya mean? There's all sorts of different workers, and each has her own needs.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_005: Neighbors who take care of each other, simple but comfortable furniture, an ever-growin' pile of spare parts, and machinery that clanks together like the growl of thunder. Now, that's the good life. I thought my dad'd grow old with his factory, and I'd grow old with the next-generation factory, but...
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_006: Doesn't matter what it is - as long as you make it yourself, it feels like home. Same goes for Londinium. Every brick and tile was laid down by Londiniers. We know what Londinium is thinkin', and we're gonna take it back with our own hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_007: Sometimes the commander reads books that are really hard to understand... I remember a line went somethin' like this, 'People built cities, but refused to adapt to them.' Not sure I agree with that though. As long as you find your own way to live, it doesn't make a difference whether you're in the city or in the middle o' nowhere.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_008: My dad and my old friends always used to say I was stubborn, stroppy, and foul-tempered. Don't think there's anything wrong with being stubborn, you need a bit of that to protect people around you. But, I failed... Cause... Where are they now...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_009: Here, Dr. {@nickname}. Why am I givin' money to you? 'Cause I can't spend it all, there's no point keepin' it around, and you happened to pass by. No need to be polite, I always used to give money to my friends, so they all got used to it. Huh, you don't need it? Damn it, gotta find someone else then...
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_010: Dr. {@nickname}, Dr. {@nickname}... Oh, havin' a sleep? Let me find a blanket for ya... Hmm, if I made a new blanket, the Doctor would probably find that helpful…
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_011: Londinium Citizens' Self-Salvation Corps Caster, Rockrock, reporting in. Dr. {@nickname}, we've had a few misunderstandings in the past, but I'm not blinded by those old prejudices anymore. I hope we can have a good working relationship.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_012: That's crazy... I gotta ask again, are you sure you're a drug company?
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_013: I don't care about my rank. As long as I'm with friends... I'm always ready for the next battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_014: I fight to reclaim my home, and to put an end to the war. I hope that one day, we'll be able to put down our weapons and pick up the tools to rebuild Londinium. Just like... in the past.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_017: Of course, it's my job to protect my family.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_018: Be careful. Your safety is more important than victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_019: My drones are ready, Doctor. Should I scout ahead?
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_021: I'm here, Doctor. I can see the enemy's tracks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_022: Standing by. Doctor, where do you need me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_026: It's up to us to protect our homes!
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_027: I'm not watching my friends die again!
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_029: I know my drone better than anyone else. It can't do that on its own. The fact that you've used it so effectively just shows how great a commander you are, Dr. {@nickname}.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_030: A total victory with no casualties. Dr. {@nickname}, if you were around back then, would things have... turned out differently?
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_031: The enemies are gettin' away, after them... Wait, no, scrap that. They might be leadin' us into a trap... Safety's gotta come first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_032: Run, Doctor, I'll hold them off! ...It's alright, there's no need to worry... When I joined the Self-Salvation Corps, I was prepared for this moment.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_033: This place... isn't the same as my home, but it's just as warm. I really like it here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_034: Aw!... Is something wrong? I'm just lookin' at this exhaust fan. Closure said this model's five years old, but it's the first time I've seen it... So ingenious.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_036: Oh, Dr. {@nickname}? I'm makin' a wooden carving for you. The things I make are usually only good for me, but it should be fine givin' away simple stuff like decorations, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_038: Happy New Year, Dr. {@nickname}. Do you have any wishes? Mine? Umm... I wish that we'll be able to spend every New Year in peace, up until the day we die.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_042: Good mornin', Dr. {@nickname}. Time for another day of hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_043: Dr. {@nickname}, I heard it's your birthday today, so happy birthday! Here's a present from me to you. Um, that's you and Amiya carved on there. It's my first go with this sort of ornamental thing, so it didn't turn out too well... You like it? Oh, that's brilliant, then!
dialogue_tracker.char_4040_rockr_CN_044: Dr. {@nickname}, enjoying yourself? Me? Mm-hm, of course I'm happy. Everyone's having a proper lively get-together, there's nothing better than that. Oh, that reminds me, I just drew this prize and I'm not really in need of it. You want it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_001: Ummm... Doctor, the documents on the shelves are a bit messy. Back home, I had a tabletop assistant device that automatically organized our files. All you had to do was stick the files in, then it would package and seal them. I think you should get something like that too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_002: Wanting to see new places is a pretty common reason for leaving home, isn't it? To be honest, every time I climb a tall mountain or dive into a deep lake, I feel like I've made the right choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_003: Doctor, are you a fan of wide-open landscapes? For example, imagine yourself next to a lake, watching the surface of the water rise and fall, the clouds gathering and dispersing, the sun slowly drooping behind the horizon, painting the lake a dazzling gold... That's the kind of scenery I love.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_004: A Catastrophe? Are we really going to cruise past a Catastrophe?! I didn't get to see the last one up close, so I can't let this opportunity slip by! I'm going out right–– What? The door to the bridge is locked?
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_005: My staff turns minerals into healing agents, sometimes with other special effects depending on the type of material used. You don't believe me...? I'm being serious here, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_006: I've helped more and more people, which gives me a sense of accomplishment. But as a physician, I still wish there were fewer and fewer casualties from people fighting each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_007: Doctor, have you seen fluorescent mushrooms before? There used to be a bunch of them growing by the rocks near the waterfall I played at as a kid. Some of them grew taller than the tallest person in the clan, serving as lamps to bring light to places where the city could not reach.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_008: My original reason for coming above ground was simple: I wanted to survey the geography around my homeland, and soak up the sights and sounds along the way. Now I travel further and further not only for the sights I haven't seen, but also for the people who need my help.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_009: Doctor, why do people bloody themselves fighting each other? I can treat a wound or two, maybe even a lot more than that, but what can I do as a physician if the people don't change their minds?
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_010: Your desk is still a bit messy. Let me clean things up for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_011: Pleased to meet you, Dr.{@nickname}. This is for you. It's a specimen box made from gemstones I collected – lapis lazuli, turquoise, plum tourmaline, chalcedony…
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_012: The lens doesn't move, Doctor. Do you think if we gave this to a Durin operator, they'd be able to upgrade it to automatically follow the subject? If it's my idea, it's my responsibility? Ughh…
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_013: I... never expected to be promoted so soon! I'll carry on my research into the curative properties of gemstones!
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_014: I left home so I could realize my dreams, I gained recognition here, and found a place where I could learn even more from my peers in the Medical Department. I've truly found a good job.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_017: Whenever I think of my squadmates getting hurt in battle, I start to feel uneasy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_018: I don't like war, but that's my personal feelings. As a squad leader, I vow to uphold my responsibility.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_019: Be careful, everyone! Nothing's more important than your own safety!
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_020: Is this really the only way to settle our problems?
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_022: I trust the Doctor will lead us to victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_023: I'll heal your wounds and dull your pain.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_024: Don't worry, I've got your back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_025: If you feel unwell, report it right away!
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_026: Don't push yourself too hard in battle!
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_028: Relax, tense muscles will only make your treatment more difficult.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_029: The more prep work we do, the better the outcome we'll see. This is all thanks to everyone's hard work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_030: Now's a great time to watch the sunset. Let's head over there and sit down for a spell.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_031: We fight now for a peaceful future…? If only our enemies wanted the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_033: The decor here is really different from back home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_034: Hm? Who is it? Oh, it's you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_036: I'm putting together a new specimen box, Doctor. Want to see it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_038: Woah, it's nice to see everyone coming together to celebrate! But, I suddenly realized, it's a darned shame this occasion only comes once a year!
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_042: Doctor, wanna head up to the deck for some fresh air?
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_043: This crystal here can soothe your mind. Try putting it on when you're feeling bad. Oh, and when you're feeling good too, sure! I took it when I left home, and it's yours now. Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4041_chnut_CN_044: I've been here at Rhodes Island a while now, done a lotta work with you and the folks in Medical, helped a bunch of people. Sitting here mulling it over now, I've gained a ton of precious experience I never picked up on before. I'll remember this, keep it all with me, right in here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_001: Hm? Am I able to be of help to you? I can't contribute anything towards your meticulous plans or lofty ideals, but if you wish me to attend you... that happens to be my specialty.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_002: Sitting for extended periods of time will cause muscular atrophy, and that's not going to help, Doctor. Come, I'll walk with you around the deck. I've also been wanting to hear about some of Rhodes Island's legends. No, sifting through the archives isn't as interesting as hearing it from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_003: My grandfather was involved in the construction of that great lighthouse. But now, haha, all I do is stay behind in the church, tending to the sick and elderly... No, I'm not complaining about my job as a caregiver; seeing their smiles brings me great joy! It's just that...
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_004: Skadi, Gladiia, and Specter... I never thought a day would come when I would stand on the same side as those Ægir greats; I mean, I barely know anything about the Ægir... Huh? You're putting me on the same team as them? Please, have mercy on me...
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_005: That Inquisitor fought to the last breath for our sake. When I saw the light of his lantern pierce the darkness, I suddenly realized: they are all fighting for our future. And though I might not be as strong as them, I don't wish to remain a bystander. I want to stand with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_006: Achieving great things is not easy for me, but even facing life itself is not a trivial task. Doctor, don't worry, I won't give up. I will try my best to catch up with everybody on Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_007: For us Iberians, our relationship with the 'sea' is a complicated one. The sea symbolizes terror and danger, while also holding nostalgia for a bygone era. But even as the great vessels of Iberia sink before our eyes, we... we require a bit of change.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_008: Caregivers have to respond to all sorts of different situations. Some people are difficult to deal with, but the gratitude we receive makes it worth it. Doctor, all that you do, day in and day out, must be for a very similar pursuit, right? You know the joy of being able to make a difference.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_009: Working in the Inquisition is difficult, and not everyone is as fair as Lady Irene... But, had I not experienced it, I never would've gotten to work with amazing people like you, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_010: Doctor, Doctor? You're going to catch a cold if you fall asleep like this... Let me fetch you a blanket. Is it alright if I dim the lights for you a bit?
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_011: So you're... the Doctor? Pleased to meet you. My codename is 'Lumen,' and I will now be serving as a Rhodes Island Operator. Even if I can only bring you a thin filament of light, I will give all my strength.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_012: Do we... really have to face such terrifying things?
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_013: No, I can't accept this. I've just been doing my job, nothing worthy of a promotion. Please, you don't need to look so dejected. Fine, I'll take it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_014: I'm just an ordinary person, and it takes a huge amount of effort to even keep up with the others. However, if you really need what little I can offer... then I will be there for you at any time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_017: Don't worry, Doctor. I'll catch up to the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_018: Me, squad leader? Umm... Can you give me a few minutes to sort things out in my head?
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_019: Looks like it's too late for second thoughts. Time to move out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_020: I'll do my best to keep everyone safe!
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_022: As long as I can help.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_024: It's fine, as long as I can muster up the courage!
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_025: Don't worry, I'm here with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_026: You can do this. Here, the first step is a deep breath.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_027: Hang in there, the treatment will be done in no time!
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_028: Please stay calm. It's a bit tricky, but as long as you give me some time...
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_029: Dr. {@nickname}, that you've shown me such a great project, let me become a part of it, and even had me stand by your side, means the world to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_030: We did it, Doctor! Even though this was a small victory, the day will come when these small rays of light will grow numerous enough to dispel the darkness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_031: Enough frowning, Doctor, it's bad for your health. If everything always went according to plan, what would motivate us to work harder and better ourselves?
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_032: Doctor, please evacuate! If I can hold the line and buy you a future, then I...
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_033: Rhodes Island is a beautiful ship, but sadly... I cannot feel the breath of the sea breeze.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_036: The thing I enjoy most is looking out the window at the surrounding scenery, relaxing away my afternoon. Want to join me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_038: Back when I was a caregiver, at the turn of every year, everyone would exchange presents and offer New Year's blessings. Even though I'm working in a different environment now, I hope to keep this little custom alive. Doctor, I wish you... a peaceful and prosperous new year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_042: Doctor, need me to give you a shoulder massage? I'm pretty well-known for my PT skills.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_043: Kal'tsit mentioned that today is your birthday, Doctor. I don't have the means to gift you anything precious... but please take this. It's an audio recording of the waves in my hometown. If you ever find yourself in a bad spot, please give it a listen. Of course, you're more than welcome to come to me directly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4042_lumen_CN_044: Now that I'm saying it out loud, it's a bit embarrassing... Doctor, if I could become like you one day... Err, never mind. Just being allowed to join Rhodes Island, and stand by your side, is already like a dream come true.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_001: You want me to be your accompanist? Sure thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_002: Whether in harpistry or archery, my skill is second to none in all of Minos. Look, this is the medal I won in Hymnic archery. Beautiful, isn't it? Proof of my skills as a harpist? Several troupes have asked me to accompany them, and that tells a story, don't you agree?... What!? You! You... Ahem... You may as well be seated, then. I will have my harp do the talking.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_003: Minos is a land of Romance. Day in and day out, you can see philosophers debating, warriors competing, and actors rehearsing grand epics. I will say though, our food and drinks are exquisite. They're enough to elicit an abundance of joy and make one act unreasonably if indulged too liberally... How do I know? As if I'd tell you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_004: Tragedies are the most dazzling gems among our grand epics... or so I'd like to say, but Pallas's story deserves the most compassion. There is no greater humiliation than for a hero to remain unsung. 'There must be no flaws in a hero's mythos?' She said that? I simply cannot agree.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_005: From Minos to Bolívar, from Columbia to Leithanien, each place has its own scenery and its own romance. The same uniqueness, however, cultivated endless enmity and conflict across the world. But just as roses do not lose their beauty simply because they have thorns, this great land is equally worthy of love.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_006: Even the mightiest hero cannot win a war alone. Just as an epic must be passed down to be meaningful, a hero must stand with others to even become a hero. In the past, I always felt as if something was missing from my journey. That 'something' has been found since I came here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_007: The Supreme One spread an incurable disease across the land, and the Healer was banished for opposing Him. The Healer, stripped of the power of divinity, descended to alleviate humankind's suffering through knowledge... Oh, this isn't Minos mythology or anything, it's just a story I made up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_008: Is this instrument a bow or a harp? Both. The techniques behind the two are similar, both requiring discipline and elegance. Like this, gently place your fingertips on the strings, and thoughtfully acquaint yourself with the vibration from your fingertips. Want to give it a try? No, no, not like that. Give me your hand, I'll teach you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_009: What am I reading? A volume of Victorian love poems. Shall I read some aloud for you? Come on, there's no need to be bashful. Love and courage are one and the same. They're the blazing flames that burn through our souls, a light true that one should not shy from. Come on, Doctor, let's read some poetry together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_010: Doctor, Doctor? Oh... A pity that I came with a little song for you, aww…
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_011: So this is Rhodes Island? At last, at the very end of this trudge... No, All of this was ordained by fate, so I should be saying, it's about time! You can call me Erato. Is Pallas here, may I ask?
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_012: A shock that I still have so much more to learn about team combat...
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_013: Rankings? Promotions? No, no, these trivial things have no place in the full picture when heroes cast their eyes over the rising horizon. But, I will accept this accolade as proof of our mutual trust.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_014: Should I celebrate this occasion by playing a song, or no? In fact, let me take a moment to think about what to say... Ahem... In the name of the Twelve Heroes of Minos, I, Erato, dedicate my bowstring to thee, and my harp shall accompany thee into the ages.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_017: Witness the crown jewel of Minoan archery.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_023: What wonderful scenery. A fine place for a battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_026: By harp mine put to peace thy weary mind, for death and slumber both are of one kind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_027: Listen well to the requiem I play for thee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_029: Life must eventually end, but legends live on forever. We've done it, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_030: A victory worth celebrating. Let us sing! Doctor, did you witness my performance?
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_031: Chasing stragglers is scarcely fit for heroes of legend. Let them be.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_032: Hurry, run! Our story mustn't end here!
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_033: Can I play some music here?
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_036: You seem to be in a good mood today, Doctor. How about a dance with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_038: Another year, huh...? Though I am still unfamiliar with Rhodes Island's customs, the importance of ceremony cannot be understated. If there is no ceremoniousness to counterbalance the atmosphere of levity, the occasion is forgotten easily. Anyway, Happy New Year, Doctor. As a present, I'll play a song for you. What would you like to hear?
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_043: In mythology, every hero's birth is accompanied by a strange phenomenon. For example, the once-in-a-century blooming of a flower, or a falling star... Just what happened on this day, years ago? It must've been a spectacular sight. Happy birthday, Doctor. Go ahead and make a wish.
dialogue_tracker.char_4043_erato_CN_044: Rhodes Island is a place right out of mythology, a hall of champions where people from all over the world come together to fight for a common cause. I wish to continue to witness the story of Rhodes Island as it unfolds. Surely, we shall compose the most grand of epics together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_001: You need an assistant too...? Ah, I just heard a little about you from Kal'tsit. Don't mind that. Is there any work I can help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_002: What a surprise, Doctor. Where did you pick up my novel? It only got praise from a few fellow writers thanks to some friendly connections; it's not worth spending your time with.  Unfortunately, it's the only sort of thing I can write, given the state of Victoria. I'm sorry about that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_003: I have a fair insight into coordinating formalwear and jewelry, you know. Right now, though? Treat this sort of dress-up as an actor's costume. The gentry and aristocracy are all at their drinking parties trembling for dear life, putting on a play of peace, watching for an explosion without knowing when it'll come.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_004: It's a pity you chose a bad place and time to arrive, or else I would've invited all you Rhodes Islanders to visit the theater as the Victorians do. The epic of the Aslan King owes its celebration to bards, after all, not letters on paper. Besides, my theater friends always leave me a seat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_005: Kal'tsit's always called herself a doctor, but before I actually came to Rhodes Island, I couldn't understand why she'd fixated on Oripathy treatment. After all, there were so many tricky issues she could solve.I mean... Really... She could have solved anything. Anything except Oripathy... But I see now. You're bringing hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_006: Teaching a group of barehanded commoners to stand off against Sarkaz warriors—hard to believe, even for them. Some advised me not to even waste time trying... But when I met Kal'tsit, I was still very tender myself. The small and weak have their own strength, by all rights.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_007: Without even looking, I know how Golding would evaluate that book. After all, we once wrote for the same newspaper and inked practically the same sentences between two articles—no, it wasn't a rapport, just that there's few words Victoria will allow you to pronounce loudly these days.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_008: Has Amiya been sleeping well...? She really is just like Clovisia. Though their hearts have grown to the point they can bear everyone's hopes, their bodies are still so easily overwhelmed. I'll be off in a while, to see how I can help them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_009: Ever since I was very young, I sat by my father's desk, watching him read and write. Even when writing letters to Kal'tsit, he never pushed me away. Just like he said, sooner or later I'd understand this all, and I'd have to at that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_010: Oh, you fell asleep... I wonder what you dream of, Doctor? The past, perhaps?
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_011: I've been wanting to meet all you Rhodes Islanders since a good long time ago. Very glad to make your acquaintance again, Doctor. Just call me Heidi.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_012: Oh my... This is all a lot harder to learn than what Kal'tsit taught me...
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_013: Do you need me taking on greater responsibilities? Of course I'd be glad to; I appreciate your faith in me. But as her Messenger, it's crucial I don't draw too much attention.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_014: What sort of clothes should I wear to match with this 'jewelry' Rhodes Island confers on me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_017: And by this, I will protect my home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_018: I'll see your orders relayed to every last one.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_019: I have the intel for what lies ahead all sorted. Go forth with aplomb.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_021: Let me witness this with my own eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_022: Is there anything you need me delivering?
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_023: Dust, and the scent of rust...
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_025: 'The young prince saw the other reach for the crown, and he raised his sword.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_026: 'We sing our elegy at full strain, in rivers of blood formed by fear.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_027: 'The girl, expelled from the city, still returns to rescue it.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_028: 'He lifted his slaughterer's blade, not believing that he could earn the love of a different line.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_029: I venture no one could have envisaged a victory so marvelous. Doctor, it seems the intel on you needs another update.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_030: There will surely be an end to suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_031: There's nowhere nearby for them to hide. I know where they're likely headed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_032: This is the risk we must face for the sake of ultimate victory. There are times we must bear the cost of defeat too, am I wrong?
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_033: I really wish Londinium's workers could have an environment as fine as this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_034: Oh? I'm here if you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_036: That's odd, I wonder where my bookmark fell.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_038: I've brought you my father's well-wishes too. Don't open those now. Leave the stuffy letters until the fireworks are over, hm?
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_043: Do you look forward to birthdays? Even with how long ago I crossed into adulthood, birthdays for me still are a commemoration of growth and progress.
dialogue_tracker.char_4045_heidi_CN_044: *cough*... I'm only dropping back in here to find Kal'tsit, I certainly wasn't ready to perform in any sort of program. Poetry recitals wouldn't be too in the spirit of this party now, would they? How about I go and help fix up the cake? ...Take care not to let other operators steal a bite? Jolly good.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_001: I'll be your assistant today, Doctor... I will disclaim. I have absolutely no secretarial experience. Thus, so I'm not hindering you, I will be doing nothing at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_002: You'd like to see Leithanien, you say? Heh, it's a fine place. The Empresses regard their subjects like their own children, the healthy regard the Infected as brethren, the faces of the people brim with blessing—lies? That's true, they are lies. Contemplate visiting Leithanien again once you can sit through the whole game with a straight face.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_003: Routine health inspections? Allow me a moment to ready my—hold on, isn't Hibiscus the one on duty today? I'd rather avoid her if I can. I'm sure I needn't explain why... I'm not frightened of her! I'm just not quite prepared for—could you amend my timeslot? Thank you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_004: Please relay to the Medical Department that my headaches and physical condition are no matter, and no cause for such alarm. There's nothing to examine—what? They're already expecting me? They've even made the consultation room available? I... You tell them that my headache has flared up and I'm not going anywhere—ugh.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_005: Social etiquette of Leithanian nobles? Hah, it's an endless subject. Shaking off commoners, spreading rumors of other nobles behind their backs—not to go on, but it all demands a cheek I find slightly hard to conjure myself. You'd best consult an expert, not me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_006: There'll always be a cohort eager to associate me with the previous Graf Urtica. I can't blame them though, I simply wish to live as a regular Infected. Abhorring inequality ... You say I'm faking to be common? Whatever you say. Even if I am faking, I prefer to keep it that way till the very end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_007: You noticed as much, Doctor? Indeed, I like to repeat what others have said in times of stress... it's the safest method I—no—Graf Urtica has of buying time to think. So long as he doesn't speak his own mind, he won't bear blame for what he says.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_008: It's Hibiscus on duty again—should I reschedule my examination? Nein, never mind. I'm deeply grateful for your help in avoiding her days, but I can't hide forever. Even after so long, I still close my eyes and see the wretched misery of that concert... perhaps it's time I face it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_009: Evening on the deck reminds me of the spiretop in Urtica—it had just as fine a breeze. I used to fantasize there how happy life must be, down on the ground. I only understood later that up there, freedom was the one thing stripped from me, while so many in the land had, save for freedom, nothing at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_010: No issue dozing off in this sort of place? Hmph, I suppose it's times like these when the assistant does the work. Pain in the neck—agh, I'm misspelling. Never mind, never mind. Let's find out what music's on the Doctor's headphones...
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_011: I extend my sincere gratitude to you, Doctor of Rhodes Island. Thank you for sheltering an insignificant down-and-outer. If such mediocrity as even mine can benefit Rhodes Island's cause, then I couldn't be more relieved.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_012: A very fascinating recording. Hm? I don't say that with irony. Nobody ever thought to buy video tapes for Graf Urtica save for himself, and he couldn't leave the spire.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_013: Promotion? Allow me to decline. No, not for lack of necessity, but of knowledge of who is being recognized. Is it myself... or the Witch King's remnants lodging within me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_014: Graf Urtica fears his ego's engulfment by the Witch King, yet has to employ powers inherited from the tyrant. But now, he is dead. Now, I am first and foremost an operator of Rhodes Island, and only after that am I the Witch King's botched replica. That suffices for me—that suffices.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_017: This power is not mine. However, Rhodes Island has need of it, so I will employ it to its fullest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_018: I hate it when I'm ordered around without rhyme or reason, but ordering others sits just as badly with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_019: Prolonged casting makes my headaches flare up, and I even hallucinate if I'm unlucky. Let's make it a Blitzkrieg, shall we?
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_023: Careful of music on the battlefield, especially when you face a Leithanian.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_024: The performance will begin soon, but it seems our audience can't contain themselves?
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_028: Gah! Get out of my head!
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_029: If you're lacking an appreciator to applaud and call for encore, then allow me to fill the role. Congratulations, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_030: Is it over? Very well, I need somewhere to rest for a moment before my headache gets any worse.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_031: An unsatisfactory performance'... No, it's fine, it's just something I often heard not so long ago. You can ignore it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_032: We can hardly call this ending good. Are you the one who just got a headache, not me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_033: This place might be far from a Leithanian spire, but I still prefer the feeling of standing on solid ground.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_034: Agh, here it is aga—huh? It's you, Doctor? That wasn't the headache?
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_036: Doctor, if you want to learn an instrument, I'd say ask someone else. A lot of my understanding has little to do with myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_038: I'm not omitting myself from the New Year celebrations for any special reason. I'm just not accustomed to that sort of harmonious atmosphere... You'd like to invite me to perform a song? Forget it, my music would be a horrible match for this mood.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_042: How did you rest, Doctor? I used to love staying up myself, until one time I went a full night without closing my eyes, and had splitting headaches for a week after... It was a horrifying experience.
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_043: Would you like to listen to a dark, terrifying, head-splitting Birthday Variation?—I'm joking. Happy birthday, Doctor. Sheesh, there's no need to be *that* surprised. Can't I joke every once in a while?
dialogue_tracker.char_4046_ebnhlz_CN_044: Every day passed at a crawl in Urtica, but now a year's silently flown by since coming to Rhodes Island... It feels like time's sped up. I imagine that's just proof life is more blessed now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_001: I've never been an assistant before. It's a novel experience, but rest assured that I will not be remiss, even if this work is not my forte.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_002: If any children aboard Rhodes Island wish to learn piano, you may send them to me, but I am a strict teacher. I am not one to release a student partway once he begins his studies.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_003: I hear a musical school known as 'jazz' is currently popular in Columbia. I've had the fortune to hear a few records. The free, unweighted playing style greatly amuses me, but sadly, I seem to lack the temperament for performing in such a swing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_004: Are you curious about my hands? Indeed, they're broader than others' at a glance. Please, they're no freakish things. I have them to thank that I can rain every melodie that swims in my head down onto the keys.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_005: The Infected are only comparatively freer in Leithanien, and not that free. Outside of the Afterglow, there was hardly anywhere I could live, or eat... there was almost nowhere to turn.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_006: My near-death experience unleashed a sudden, completely new melodie upon my mind. Compared to it, the musical forms I'd once learnt seemed like shackles. Just what tremendous feeling brought about its birth? Perhaps in the face of Death, I was nowhere near as fearless as I imagined.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_007: Thank you for your concern. I'm not feeling ill—my writing is merely bottlenecked, and I haven't slept in several days. My hair, well... I often unconsciously grab at it while composing, if that explains its current unruliness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_008: Doctor, would you like to exercise with me? You seem surprised. Fräulein Hibiscus requested it. Most artists are the frail sort, but my recitals often exceed two hours in length. How could I handle it without a sturdy physique to support me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_009: You flatter me. So many voices have been snuffed out in the rapids of history. Their owners were hardly without talent; they simply left too soon, before anyone could stop and listen to their masterpieces fine as nature's song. And I was but slightly luckier, enough so to escape with my life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_010: Asleep? I hardly expected the lullabies I wrote to have an actual effect on you...
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_011: Greetings, Doctor, my name is Czerny. Any charm or taste I may have had has been poured entirely into my compositions. And as for myself, I am no more than a run-of-the-mill performer. That's all the introduction you need.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_012: I will commit to watching these as you require, but this is hardly how I prefer to study. I have always approached others' second-hand experiences with skepticism.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_013: I'm extremely grateful for your sponsorship, Doctor; I am currently struggling financially. The annals of Leithanian art will commemorate your giving.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_014: I thank you for your approval. I had never seriously pursued Originium Arts before, and I hope henceforth that my Arts may be cast as freely as my melodien.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_017: Through my creations, both pain and joy become immortal.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_018: Compared to my piano, my ability with a baton actually fares quite well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_019: I've finished tuning. I may perform now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_023: To tremble in my music is your honor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_024: Extraordinary melodies can only be played by the soul that quakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_029: Huff... I may be—exceptionally tired in both body and mind, but I do not want the music to end here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_030: Drawing the final barline here is perfect. I hardly want any movement of mine to approach tedium.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_031: There are times when stubborn pursuit of a technique hinders more than helps. Allowing your emotion to follow the music's natural flow can take you further.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_032: Please, don't be disheartened. Not every composition is smooth from start to finish. There'll always be a few rounds of polish before you land where you want to.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_033: The deck of this ship is very spacious. Have you ever considered holding a concert there?
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_034: Watch that the noten in my pocket don't spill out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_036: Perhaps you like to try learning an instrument? I could teach you; I'm qualified to tutor for the majority of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_038: Forgive me for turning down your invitation to perform. Even the most assiduous musician wouldn't want to work on this day, and besides, the fineness of it needs no musical dressing. The laughs of passersby and the clinking of table glasses have answered well enough, no?
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_042: I've written a new song. Would you like to hear?
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_043: I've reserved some tickets to a performance of a symphony, all fine VIP seats. If you're free on the day, you must attend. Ah, yes, I wish you a happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4047_pianst_CN_044: To dance to music is a rare moment of liberty for the Infected. Doctor, would there be more dancing, more free souls, if I were to write more myself?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_001: I was an assistant for other researchers before I got my own lab... That being said, shall I begin your day with a cup of coffee?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_002: Doctor... Doctor who? Oh, it's your codename? Sorry. At Rhine Lab, calling for a 'Doctor' usually gets a response from everyone in earshot. You must be very special to Rhodes Island, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_003: The rumbling grapevine says Saria is at odds with Control. But I get the feeling they're both idealists, and those with a strong will tend to have an edge to them. I... am I any different? I hope you'll never see my edge.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_004: You think scientists are weird? Yes, obsession may drive us to ignore certain other things, including social and ethical norms. Our jobs aside, though, we're all normal people at heart.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_005: Research is like exploration; the further you go, the more dangerous it gets. But every step we take has a chance to change lives, which is why we keep going, even if death or public scorn await. We're kindred spirits, Doctor… And that is a fact.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_006: I made lots of friends in the world of science. They often discuss their dreams with me; some are not so good at expressing themselves, but I can guess. You say I've guessed wrong sometimes? Hm... perhaps. Maybe I should reflect...
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_007: It's getting cool outside. Remember to dress warm when you go into the field... *sneeze* I, er, forgot to do so myself. I often forget these things if Elena isn't there to remind me. *Sneeze* Oh, thanks for the coat. That's so kind of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_008: I never thought of myself as a genius. I'm just fortunate. My father and other people in the Pioneer team saved the money to send me to school, while the government sponsorship also allowed me to pursue scientific research. I'm here today thanks to the help of many people. That's why I want to do my best to help others too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_009: Sometimes, I wake up in the middle of the night in the labs and feel... scared. Scared that people will end up abandoning me, even after all I've done, and even... with hatred in their hearts. What should I do? All I want is to bring them happiness. Can you help me, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_010: All work and no play makes it a sleepy day... We have so much in common, don't we... Let me turn up the temperature. Noise-canceling mode... Oh, seems your cabin isn't equipped with that…?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_011: Hello, I'm Dorothy, head of the Originium Art Section at Rhine Lab. Dr. Silence already introduced me? Then it saves both of us the formalities. Please, just call me Dorothy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_012: Are these simulations or... hm, Rhodes Island feels different from how I imagined, but I understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_013: As a matter of fact, I was worried about not spending enough time on the Rhodes Island Landship... maybe I should apply to Kristen for another long-term cooperation project.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_014: Doctor, how do you like my lab? I'm thinking about what equipment I should bring over. Mechanist says my command of resonance might come in handy in obstacle removal and weapon development.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_017: What sights will the Doctor show us this time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_018: Don't worry, I'll take care of the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_019: The battlefield is an extension of the laboratory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_023: Do you need the traps activated?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_025: The sand will reshape the land.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_026: The slightest vibration can change the result.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_027: Stay down, and you won't get hurt any worse.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_028: No, I won't let you take another step… I promised them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_029: Whether it's by your calculation or instinct… All I could say is, marvelous.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_030: Your decisions were on the mark. Were you kissed by the goddess of truth? Can I touch your forehead? For good luck, you know, while I tackle my next experiment.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_031: 70% of my experiments don't turn out the way I want them to. The answer lies in the next attempt, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_032: I won't let anyone hurt you! I'll take care of things here. Go, and never turn back...
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_033: Rhodes Island is always so lively.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_034: Oh, it was you tugging at me? Thank goodness, I thought I skipped too many meals and was hallucinating...
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_036: What is it that keeps you staring at me, Doctor? Did you find an interesting problem to tackle?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. I just sent some gifts to my Pioneer friends. I wonder when they'll get them... Thinking of their hardships makes me worry and glad at the same time. Oh, I have a gift for you too. You're always moving forward, just like them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_042: Doctor, I was thinking about going out for a walk. Would you like to join me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_043: Humm, did those young operators just give you something? Wait... what day is it? Oh dear, I lost track of the days again! Dr. {@nickname}, could you make a stop by my lab? Thankfully I've got the entire year's presents all lined up!
dialogue_tracker.char_4048_doroth_CN_044: I hope everyone will have the chance to find themselves, regardless of whether they're Infected or not, regardless of their talent for Arts. Many think this is just a pipe dream, but Doctor, I know... you and Rhodes Island will understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_001: 交给我吧，观察别人工作中留下的痕迹，体会其中蕴藏的坚持、愉悦和亢奋，是我熟悉的交流方式呢。博士，在这份待办清单中，我也看得到你的付出。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_002: 在找旋律声从哪来？是这小杯子上的音乐术式。莱塔尼亚城市里的音乐大多由术式奏响。雕像、喷泉、壁画，各种想象不到的东西都可能是演奏音乐的装置。用它喝点什么吧，酒的话，就挑这首。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_003: 不好意思，评论音乐本身的好坏是听众和创作者的事情，我只是个拥有绝对音感的调谐师，很清楚自己擅长什么。都说努力过才知道天赋的意义，我早知道自己没天赋，也没必要努力，哈。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_004: 我的家乡是个旅游小镇，街市角落所有音乐我都精心规划过，每走一步都有旋律伴随同行。那里还有著名的“蒙眼识曲寻路”挑战赛，要是博士拔得头筹，可有不少奖金呢。我吗？不，我是裁判。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_005: 博士，帮我看看这份区域音乐设计提案吧。各个区域的背景音乐由术式相连，合适的乐曲能让大家不管工作还是娱乐都能更快进入状态。不过我没设计这里，你的失眠歌单总该由你自己来决定，对吧？
