dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_006: “让街市璀璨动人”？这些刊文总是添油加醋，调谐师才没那么高尚。不过说起来，总有非凡的创作被丢进没人在意的角落，把它们收集起来，播放给懂得欣赏的孩子们听，算是我小小的事业。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_007: 这张合照啊......那时我对没天赋感到很苦恼，日子过得难熬又难忘，所以把它挂在房间里提醒自己不能后悔。噢，我没回答为什么上面没有我？好吧，是因为......我根本没毕业。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_008: 嘘！你有听出来我的花在哪吗？最近送去医疗部的花加上了音乐术式，组曲还差这一首。我不想让病人留下遗憾，毕竟在他们眼中，我也是医者。让病人满足的不一定都是康复，是这个道理吧？
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_009: 医疗部说要帮我找找五音不全的成因，但我一直都知道，那不是病，而是高塔之上那些人眼中的嘲讽和厌弃所致。我不喜欢被寄予厚望的感觉。好在调谐总会把噪音排除，调谐师们总是不留遗憾。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_010: 啊，我不是故意的，是这首二重奏太催眠了吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_011: 不用担心，我在莱塔尼亚的工作暂时都交给同事们了。你猜错了哦，他们和我一样，不会有怨言，也不喜欢下班。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_012: 好复杂，像一首激昂的赋格曲。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_013: 我是受到赏识了吗？奇怪，只是做好分内的事就可以被嘉奖的话，博士，我还有一些莱塔尼亚的工友对罗德岛很感兴趣，考虑一下吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_014: 那次旅行让我看清了很多事，伟大的城市乐章并非来自天降的才华，而是任劳任怨的调谐师们的通力合作。我憧憬那样的生活——平凡地做着不可或缺的事情。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_019: 号角响了，接下来是擂鼓。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_029: 还没来得及听到休止符，敌人就放弃了，看来没必要准备很多曲子。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_030: 在哀乐里他们应该怜惜自己。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_031: 对于不那么动听的段落，草草收场也不是坏事。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_033: 安静得就像没有乐谱的白纸，我会好好布置这里的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_034: 我听到你在，你可吓不到我。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_036: 博士，我的角可不是什么打击乐器。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_038: 庆祝的事情等会吧，我在维持节日的音乐秩序，毕竟幕后人员总是散场后才会独自享受节庆。别误会，我并不排斥热闹的场面，我的祝福藏在旋律中一直陪着大家，音乐没有结束，调谐师便不会离开。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_042: 博士你好，请留意为你特别调配的甲板组曲，来点掌声会更悦耳。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_043: 生日快乐，博士。我在礼物上留了音乐术式，用了我自己精心翻唱的歌曲。虽然原版比我的版本好听得多，至少都在调上，但我敢肯定，博士再也听不到比这更难忘的歌声了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4051_akkord_CN_044: 曾经，忽视遗憾对我来说很难，我也努力过，可是后来发现没什么必要。激昂充沛的旋律能够待在高潮之中，被安放的音符也不会再被当作噪音，就像罗德岛的大家都能有所归依一样。
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_001: No problem. Leave it to me. While most of my work may be outdoors, I still need to handle thick stacks of paperwork. Once it's done, I'm hoping for a little reward... perhaaaaps, a short vacation?
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_002: Doctor, did you receive the report I submitted? Oh, this hair is a strand from the tip of my ear. I deliberately slipped it into the report to test whether you'd read it thoroughly. I'm glad you noticed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_003: Watch out! You didn't cut your hand, did you? I forgot to warn you that the wire is extremely sharp. You must be very careful when touching it. Though dangerous, it's incredibly versatile in the wild—perfect for climbing, tying things down, towing, and... dealing with some uninvited guests... oh... never mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_004: I brought back a bag of nuts I collected on my recon mission, all pre-shelled. Don't worry, I've sampled every variety, and they're guaranteed to be crisp and delicious. Oh, except for one particular nut, which might leave your mouth temporarily numb. How might you pick out that one? Pure chance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_005: I was once a Youth Scout, with a camp nestled in a beautiful park. I believed that was the essence of camping, until... I ventured into the real wilderness. I learned a harsh lesson: when every choice is life or death, you don't get the luxury of maintaining appearances. Life might afford poetry, but survival demands ruthless pragmatism.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_006: The records are wrong.I was born in the wilderness, and my adoptive parents brought me to a nomadic city to raise me there. As for my biological parents, their faces have long faded from memory. Still, occasionally... two indistinct faces appear in my dreams. Do they belong to them? I can't tell.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_007: I just saw Jessica in the hallway. She looks much more confident now. No, she didn't recognize me. My work doesn't involve direct interaction with coworkers, which means few at Blacksteel are even aware of my existence. That's why I was surprised when you took the initiative to talk to me, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_008: Doctor, I received the ID badge you sent me... but, I apologize, I can't keep it on me. My work demands absolute secrecy, and any form of identification is out of the question. Speaking of which, you'd be shocked at the secrets I've managed to uncover just by blending in as an unremarkable traveler!
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_009: Doctor, would you sit with me for a moment? I've always understood that my duty is to scout ahead and blaze a trail. Still, despite my meticulous planning, there are times when most of my people don't come back. It seems, no matter how hard I try, it's never quite enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_010: Don't you feel cooped up staying indoors, Doctor, especially when you finally got some free time? How 'bout we go for a walk…? The sunlight out there is just perfect.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I'm Surfer from Blacksteel Worldwide's advance recon team. My primary duties involve intelligence gathering and pre-mission reconnaissance. If you possess any pertinent information, please, don't keep it to yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_012: Mind if I take some of these with me? They'd make an excellent remedy for cabin fever on those rainy days when I'm confined to my tent.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_013: Twice the vacation days, double the salary... Achoo—oh, hi there, Doctor! No, no, I wasn't saying anything just now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_014: Guess what, Doctor? Yesterday, on my way back here, I saw a brilliant red sunset. A good omen that today would be a lucky day. Sooo, have you come bearing good news?
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_017: Adding me to this wilderness mission was a wise choice. Trust me, Doctor, I'll ensure your safe return to the landship.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_018: The wilderness is far more complex than most imagine. If you want to accompany me, you'll have to abandon those romantic notions about camping first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_019: Alright. We pitched the tent. Now we have a base camp from which to go anywhere we please.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_020: I'll go solo. A large group might provoke hostility from the locals.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_021: I'll go gather some dry branches. We must have a campfire lit before nightfall.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_022: Water's not far. Stay put, and I'll fill the canteens.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_023: *Sigh* I never expected to encounter so many people on this trip.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_024: Hello, I'm here for a brief survey. Don't worry, I won't overstay my welcome.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_025: They came just in time; our provisions are running low.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_026: *Sigh* They ruined the night. What a waste of this gorgeous scenery.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_027: Forgive me, I woke up on the wrong side of the sleeping bag.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_028: Excuse me, can we hurry this up? I really don't want my meal getting cold.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_029: Have you burnt this scenery into your mind, Doctor? We'll head out like a shooting star, but this memory, right here, right now, will endure for you to reflect upon over and over again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_030: Everyone gained from this trip. And my gain is everyone's satisfaction.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_031: The terrain ahead is not in our favor. Continuing this advance is not advisable, Doctor. We should stand down.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_032: Doctor, though the journey may not have been entirely satisfying, we must ensure no trash is left behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_033: Really? Are you going to confine me to this windowless room for so long? I must have done something to upset you, then?
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_034: Hmm...? Oh. Want some canned soup?
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_036: Go get some rest. I'll take the night watch.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_038: Looks like this year will be no different from last year. I'll visit some old places and some new, meet some old friends and make some new, and handle some old tasks while taking on new ones. The good news is, at least this time, I won't be alone on the journey.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_042: When was the last time we saw each other... a month ago? It's a joy to see you in good health, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_043: No, no, no, Doctor, this map isn't THE birthday gift. What you need to do is mark a location on the map, any one will do, and I'll take you camping there. I'm sure the breathtaking canyon views will help you relax.
dialogue_tracker.char_4052_surfer_CN_044: Sometimes, the farther the destination, the fewer provisions I load. In the wilderness, packing too much means a heavy burden; a light pack is the key to success. I've carried a lot for a long time: as the weight on your shoulders grows heavier, and the road ahead remains infinitely long, how will you ultimately reach the end, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_001: You want me to do file collation work...? These documents of yours all look dusty. I don't want to touch them. And how was your office even planned in the first place? Did you genuinely not feel personally, utterly disgusted leaving this cabinet here?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_002: I propose swapping for more corrosion-proof materials next time you do maintenance on the ship's core structure. Why? Because when all's said and done, it's not you or me that'll be left behind. It's this landship's skeleton. That's what's going to endure. That's what will stand for us.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_003: You've got some planning work for me? I'll ask to review my partners' design styles first. As long as they aren't too complex about it, I might be able to accept—okay, okay, fine, I'll do it, I'll take it, it's not as if collaborations are some big deal. Besides, it's not that you have disastrous taste.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_004: What is it... Ah, darn it, the pencil smudged my belt again. I just got it replaced... Last time it was Gavial, saying she'd get me a new one of the same look. As if! The emblem on the clasp was straight from my designs, and obviously she didn't even give those an honest look!
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_005: I know, I'll go to the infirmary in a bit. I don't want to interrupt my thought process at the moment. And you know, Doctor, the moment is the exact thing I most value—you called Gavial in? Was she on duty at the Medical Department today? You can't fool—hello, Gavial, no no, I wasn't just working on any designs.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_006: I used to appreicate a fan base of one, one who can truly see to the core of my designs, rather than having a crowd of followers with their superfacial admiration. For me, the latter holds absolutely no significance. But now… I suppose it's not all bad to let the masses see them. Discussion swirling around my work means I'm still alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_007: Why do I tend not to greet anyone? Because once I do, I have to make small talk, and that forces me to crane my head up to speak with them, which makes me seem insignificant. We should be seeing eye-to-eye, on EQUAL footing... Are you asking if it weighs on me? As if! It just makes my neck ache.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_008: I was genuinely full of anxiety back then. I always felt I didn't have enough time, though I'd never even accomplished a thing. But nowadays, I've gotten to the point where I can appreciate my own designs. The only thing is, it's been years since I last saw my teacher. I wonder if he'd be proud of me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_009: A close look is all it takes to unearth the core sense of a man from his work. Just like how I used to disdain anything superfluous. I treated my own life in the same way. Doctor, an artwork is a microcosm of its creator's life. Yours, I can understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_010: Hmm. Such a counter-conventional sleeping posture, such a complex yet stable load-bearing structure... miraculous. Is this not going to give you neck arthritis?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_011: I'm Operator Minimalist, freshly dragged here by Gavial. So this is what a nomadic landship's like? You must have a much easier time avoiding Catastrophes than we do underground. Hmph, the only thing in those fools' heads is merrily drinking their lives away—ow, Gavial, what did you hit me for?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_012: ...If it's not architecture-related, I don't want to see it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_013: A medal? Decently tasteful. You just give this to me, and that's it, right? I've absolutely no need for any sort of commendation ceremonies, and I imagine you don't like to waste time anyway. But I will—ahem—thank you for acknowledging me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_014: Everyone's experiences are different, and the significance lying behind my works will be out of sight to most... but there are some, like you, like my mentor, that I hope can understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_018: You want me for captain? What are you even... You're joking, aren't you? Hey!
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_019: Hm... alright, let me be clear, I don't have any prior combat experience. However, I am going to take this mission seriously.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_020: Instrument debugging complete. I can begin any time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_021: I am aware. Don't push me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_022: If you break anything, you're paying!
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_023: Instrument is operating fine. Now scanning terrain.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_026: We're not here to be courteous.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_027: I just don't get you people...
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_029: Huh. You're mightier than you let on, aren't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_030: *cough* *cough* *cough*... There's so much dust—it's filthy. Gah.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_031: What are you looking at me for? You want me to chase them?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_032: Snap out of it! Get running!
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_033: I don't want to open my eyes . I'm worried the interior design is going to scare the life out of me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_036: Phew... what time is it? No, what day of the week? Er... did I eat anything yet? I don't think I did...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_038: Ah, this is the calendar you keep on the surface. I've heard of it. The significance in a holiday like this to commemorate a year's end—it's such an improvement over those days of pure idle indulgence... So another year's already passed. Be sure to cherish your time well, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_042: Doctor, sitting for too long can leave you prone to neck arthritis. I suggest you watch out for yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_043: I've been straining my wrist muscles over the past few days. The Medic Operators told me it'd improve a little using these wrist braces, so I bought a few spares. I was at a loss for what to give you today, so take these two as a present. Just fix them to the table and they'll work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4054_malist_CN_044: My life is doomed to be as short as it is. How could I ever reconcile with that? I find it genuinely difficult to keep calm... not that you—need to console me. If I was truly that weak, then I wouldn't be standing here right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_001: Hello, Doctor. I'll be acting as your assistant from here on. Please keep an appropriate distance from me; I'll be more at ease that way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_002: I recall my first time ordering a fountain pen from Zeruertza's artisans, where I didn't make my requirements clear. Then I ended up with this crossbow. It plagues me to have had the peace-loving Durin forges a weapon… Operator Myrtle? Calling herself Generalissimo? That's just a childish fan—Ahem, it's her own self-styling.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_003: If you'll permit my frankness, it's my belief Rhodes Island should build work and living environments more suited to the Durin operators. At least the cafeteria menu should be decided by vote—they're all satisfied? They can't be! I'll go and ask them, lest you—lest someone be tricking them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_004: You require me to draft some slogans? I'd be happy to. It was routine work of mine in Zeruertza. You only need to provide me a typewriter, and that's all... Why do I not use a pen? My fountain pen is typically for more private things, more... not-so-Durin things.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_005: I was a steadfast teetotaler back in Ursus, but to my surprise, I could keep more drink down than most in Zeruertza. Truth be told, I didn't immediately understand why they loved their drink so, but I did eventually come to realize. We only drink in excess when hope is lost, and a forever stagnant, easy life can lose us hope as well as anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_006: I still hold that life in the Durin cities far surpasses that of the surface, but I have to admit, the flowerets that vie to bloom in the ruins have more of a power than all the blossoms of Durin greenhouses... Hah. All these years, and yet I'm a surface-dweller through and through.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_007: Ursus desserts and wine? Let someone else have the pastries, please. 'Ursus-style' is an exceptional stranger to me by now. That said, do leave the liquor here. Zeruertzans love their drink, and I'm no exception—wait, this isn't mead. Is this pure spirits? Oh, my head...
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_008: Noble? Correct, I was once a noble. Until a conspiracy wrested my family away, and left me with the sole luck of escaping underground to Zeruertza. There was no avaricious nobility in the city, nor any commoners who'd take advantage for their own gain. Only kindhearted Durins... What more could I ask for?
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_009: Doctor, I'd like to talk with you of beauty and virtue, of those things I consider vanished from the surface. I've witnessed their existence aboard Rhodes Island, and you've told me that more of their sparks are alight upon this land still... I don't dare trust. I have to go and see it for myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_010: Doctor, are you asleep? No? Well, no matter. If you're planning to hold the same posture for a while, perhaps I might draw a fountain pen sketch of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_011: I believe you're the Doctor? It's nice to meet you. Please accept my gratitude; thank you for allowing me to lodge here, a refuge on the unseemly surface.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_012: I could never imagine. Do you show these violent, bloody tapes to the Durins as well?
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_013: Thank you for the gesture of confidence. I'll endure the urge to flee the award ceremony as best I can, so please, if you could wrap it up soon... There's no ceremony, it's just a normal presentation? Oh, that's a relief.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_014: Another promotion, is it? Thank you. I'll accept this honor with my chest out in pride... And of course, we don't need to end this presentation as quickly as last time. Do not be afraid of those I should not fear—this is what life aboard Rhodes Island has taught me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_017: The day shall come for every land dweller, the day they find a cold weapon in their arms. And I learned it the hard way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_018: For those of you who've spent not a second out of the fight, decades-old tactical thinking from Ursus must be far past its prime.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_020: Enemy... A noun I hardly want to reunite with outside of writing. It's been so long.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_023: Good visibility. I'm ready to fire.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_025: Bolt pierces deeper than nib on the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_027: Abandon resistance now, or I pull the trigger!
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_029: Surface civilization is no different to the ferocious vile beasts, but perhaps you can become one who loops its reins.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_030: The battle is over. It's time to return and write, and do something more meaningful than this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_031: Apologies, Doctor. I'm still unaccustomed to the sensation of combat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_032: Doctor, evacuate everyone as fast as you can, I—I'll bring up the rear! Don't mind me, go!
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_033: Zeruertza has molded me. I'm still a little unused to moving about these narrow spaces.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_036: Doctor, if you insist on chatting with me, what say we talk about your favorite books?
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Please, enjoy this little play written by me and jointly presented by the Durin operators of Rhodes Island—er, where's Durin? She's asleep? Oh... well, don't wake her up. I'll take up her role.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_042: *yawn*... Good morning, Doctor. The book you recommended was very interesting. I finished reading it overnight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_043: This is for you, Doctor. I asked a Logistics Operator to formulate a special shade of ink—apparently, this one gradually changes hue once it's on paper. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4055_bgsnow_CN_044: Recently, I've begun to feel that if you had me recommend a lodgings for any surfacing Durin, I would suggest Rhodes Island without a doubt. It may not compare to the underground cities, but at least it's a place one can live with peace of mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_001: Your desk needs tidying up? It doesn't look messy at all. Much better than my study, hehe. Don't worry, no mess is too much for me. Truth is, I can't think straight in a tidy room.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_002: Come on! It's just midnight, too early for bedtime. In Sargon, the days are super hot, so our 'day' only really starts when the sun goes down. Staying up messes with your circadian rhythm? Pfft, big deal. It's worth it when you see the lotuses blooming at sunrise.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_003: My younger brother and I were born into a family of court historians, the Guardian of the King’s Secret. We grew up surrounded by stacks of scrolls handed down from our ancestors. As kids, we didn't get how valuable they were and just fought over the ones with more pictures. Thinking back, the pictures weren't half as fun as our fights.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_004: That's a figurine of the Shah on my desk. He's basically treated like a god in Sargon. I remember trawling across the entire desert just to dig up the relics he left behind... I came back empty-handed though... But, it's okay. I still felt good about getting to bring his figurine to visit the places he'd been.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_005: The pattern on my hood? It's my family's emblem. As the Shahanshah's personally appointed historians, our duty is to see and faithfully record everything that happens. Although... there are times when they prefer us to be silent witnesses.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_006: Doctor, there's a Juncus pen that has been passed down for generations in my family. It has documented many extraordinary lives and left its mark on treasured scrolls and manuscripts. I'm thinking, Doctor, if I were to be handed down that pen... How about I start with the stories of all its previous owners?
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_007: Hey, Doctor! I brought back a whole bunch of souvenirs for you. A few amulets, several volumes of supernatural tales, and a golden— Hey, don't swat it! The locals consider this bug a divine emissary that keeps travelers safe on their journeys, so promise you'll take good care of it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_008: Doctor, excavation work isn't as exciting as everyone thinks it is. It's mostly tedious and repetitive labor. If you really want to build a career on it, the best way is to either have a kindred spirit by your side, or a good rival to push you. That’s how you achieve more, and go further.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_009: Hey, Doctor. Wanna look around the bottom of this pit? Give me your hand. Careful! Now, this dirt might seem unimpressive, only going up to your knees, but buried under it are traces of the people who lived here centuries ago. It's difficult to explain, but the land remembers all that humanity does, and all the choices we make.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_010: Too relaxed to say anything? Hehe, of course you are! This is the soothing incense I brought from home. One whiff is enough to… Asleep already? Did I use too much? Oops... I did... now the Doctor's gonna be out for a whole day.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_011: Greetings, Doctor. On behalf of my exalted Padishah, I am here to negotiate with you on a collaboration project within his dominion. My name is Djerwnapekhaper Saciut Hatshepsut, but... my friends all call me Pepe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_012: Um, could we just hire the warrior in the recording to teach me in person? I'm not used to learning like this…
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_013: Now this is new, I was always the one giving out rewards.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_014: A promotion? Alright, then I'll bestow an honorary title in return. Don't underestimate its power! From now on, no one will be able to hinder you in my father's domain.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_017: With lightning and habūb, my hammer will rebuke the intruders and their greed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_018: Are you ready to join me on this journey to uncover history long-buried?
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_019: I have prayed to the gods, and They have revealed to me an auspicious omen! We'll find something good this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_020: Whoa, you robbers actually dare show yourselves before me?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_021: Take note: you can never be too gentle when cleaning relics!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_022: If we run into tomb robbers, hehe... Hammer time!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_023: Woah, woah! Let me down more slowly. There are fragile artifacts down there!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_024: Don't rush me! Lemme get a nice, big stretch before I squeeze down this hole.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_025: Too late to run now, nasty little thief!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_026: Put that down. Your filthy hands desecrate it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_027: You've got guts, trying to steal this!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_028: Rawr! I'm gonna stamp a lotus on your head!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_029: Doctor, once these results are published, your name will sit alongside mine for all eternity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_030: Now this is a shocking discovery! Any ideas how we might celebrate this, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_031: It's not much, but at least those thieves won't profane this sacred site so easily again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_032: How should we piece together these fragments…? Ow, my head hurts...
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_033: You better not leave me here on my own. I might get curious and go tapping around with my hammer, which could lead to me seeing stuff I shouldn't, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_034: Hey! Do NOT undo the bow on my back!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_036: I smell nice? But I don't usually wear perfume… Oh, it's probably just this lotus.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_038: Ssh, no talking. Let the new year's first ray of sunlight bathe your face and body, feel its cozy warmth and gentle touch… Hmm... Doctor, the previous year is now history, all that suffering and joy—The sun just carried it away.
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Careful what you wish for, though, Sargonian legends tell of crafty gods who will grant any wish, but at an unreasonable price! Better yet, just tell me your wish and I'll try to grant it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4058_pepe_CN_044: Doctor, if the conditions are right, some traces of us will survive long into the future. When those who come after us find the vestiges we left behind, it'll be like we're smiling at them across time! So, Doctor, let's put on our best smiles! For now, and for our friends waiting in the eons to come.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_001: Why do I keep my weapon right here? I said it before, you need a stable working environment. Anyone who wants to bother you will have to ask my little friend first.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_002: Rhodes Island is a nice place. Everyone follows the rules and goes about their business, like an idyllic island paradise isolated from reality.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_003: Doctor, those students over there, are they all from Chernobog? Middle schoolers from that city...? I see, I need to observe them a bit more.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_004: Were you the one commanding at Chernobog, Doctor? Then you also must have seen the state of things there. How are you able to sleep at night, after all that? I can't get it out of my mind… I just can't…
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_005: I've done well...? No, I haven't! I've achieved nothing, I even fled my homeland. A girl like me never does good… Uh, stop that. Why are you patting my head...?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_006: Who needs my protection? Who can I protect? I've been asking myself, since that nightmare... Back then, I saw the malice in people's hearts, it was... it was pouring out all over the place. It drowned the whole city... Under those circumstances, maybe justice no longer means anything, it no longer exists.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_007: Something wrong with my hair? It's... a little messy? Well, it is what it is. I had to cut it myself when I fled the city... Don't give me that look. It's just hair, it'll grow back eventually. Relax, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_008: This device belonged to my father, a police officer who dedicated himself to protecting the public each and every day. I can understand, same as my mother. We've never blamed him. It's just that... Doctor, all that my father did, was it really worth it?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_009: Those people, the civilians, their faces were so twisted. They looked just like the murderers who destroyed our city. But they were the people my father and I were supposed to protect. Doctor, what is actually just in this world? What should I do...? I just don't know...
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_010: So sleepy... But I can't afford to... fall asleep…
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_011: Thank you for rescuing me, I pledge my life to you. There's not a lot I can do, but if you find some way for me to be useful, please let me know. Codename...? Ummm, just call me Absinthe.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_012: What's the point of watching this stuff?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_013: There's no need for a promotion. Rhodes Island does enough for me… I-I have to take it? But, well… Okay... Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_014: I still haven't figured out what justice really is. But you told me before that my beliefs mean something... You might be right. I-I want to believe.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_018: Whoever the squad leader is, what's the status on the... Huh, it's me?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_020: Halt! Suspicious individuals thirty meters ahead… It's those guys again.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_023: Raid drill! Hands on your head! Don't move!
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_027: This is your last warning! Surrender or get shot!
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_028: Why does it always end up like this…?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_029: If only you were there back then, maybe things would've turned out different…
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_030: Mission complete. Doctor, you're not injured, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_031: Do you think any of them were from Chernobog?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_032: It's a panic, we've lost control! We have to retreat now, go!
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_033: This terrace... if enough snow built up on it, you could jump off like this and have a great time. Hup!
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_036: Oh, Doctor. Are you thirsty? Come, let's find something to drink.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_038: Papa always used to work this holiday. He wouldn't come home until very late, so my mother and I would wait for him. If I got too tired, I would sit by the window and watch the snow. By the time the sign on the other side of the street was buried, Papa would be home... Doctor, thank you. I'll be fine by myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_042: Are you alright? Need something to perk you up?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_043: I don't know how you spend your birthdays, but my mother always baked this cake for me. It's my favorite, and she taught me how to make it... Back home, I never thought a day like this would come... Do you like it, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_405_absin_CN_044: People say that what's past is past, but is that really true? I feel like some things, you'll always carry with you, but even so, you have to keep moving forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_001: You keep the place so messy but find what you need anyway? *sigh* Well, that's also a talent, I guess.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_002: Doctor, am I able to file for exemption from paperwork? I have a bad case of farsightedness. It's a lot of strain to read, and fatigue strikes easily.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_003: I'm a repressed sort, not talkative. If you're not entertained, you can head out for now. No, I don't mean to drive you off, I just...
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_004: I don't need to be issued a scope. In my crossbow's killing range, my naked eye sees clearly enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_005: My bolt points are a custom make. They pierce armor and cause massive blood loss in a short time. They're based on what Sargon hunters specially use to hunt big beasts, then I made modifications after coming to Victoria. Now they fly lighter, and kill harder.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_006: The merc business is tough, absolutely. Sometimes I'd be in the snow and an entire day would pass on my watch, and my feet would be frostbitten by the end. I appreciate your look of concern, but it was fine. Even lucky. My left foot hurt less when it was frozen.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_007: Why I like snow, you wonder? Let me think... Does never seeing it in Sargon count? Heh, it's not really that deep. People always have their inexplicable fancies.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_008: ...If it's alright for me to ask, could you read the poem in this book to me, Doctor? I borrowed it from Istina. She says it's a fine poem, about winter in Deity Grypherburg.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_009: Do you know what's most precious? Someone to peacefully watch the snow with. Maybe I've met one at some point before, but who knows? Once the snow descends, it covers all traces of anything, including the fading footprints.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_010: How about a mug of hot water? You seem a little pale.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_011: Hello, Doctor, I'm Totter. Long-range sniping's my specialty. You can leave any task to me as long as it's a workday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_012: Hold on, Doctor, it's too close. Let me put on my glasses and try again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_013: If you're pleased with my work, then I couldn't ask for more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_014: Thank you, Doctor, but your appreciation actually leaves me at a loss. Err. If I'm being honest, I don't have big dreams for my work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_018: Everyone, please coordinate. Thanks in advance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_019: Let's move. Time waits for nobody.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_020: They're fast on the move, but I can still read their tracks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_022: Great luck. Got a tail wind today.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_023: I see clouds rising. Probable hostiles in the snow.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_024: I see fowl taking off. Probable ambush in the grass.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_029: The best kills are one-shot. Less pain for them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_030: Target down. Mission clear, no setbacks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_032: Sorry, Doctor, target's out of range. I can't hit them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_033: Nice. Luxurious compared to my safehouse.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_036: Doctor, is that you? You're blurry, but you've got distinct footsteps. I can tell them apart.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_038: I saw all the snow outside when I came today. One vast blanket over the deck, it's beautiful. You should go take a look. Oh, right, Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I picked this out for you from my own collection. I hope you like it... Okay, stop giving me that look. Is it so strange for someone who likes snow to collect snow globes as a hobby?
dialogue_tracker.char_4062_totter_CN_044: Nothing complicated went into me leaving home. I just wanted to live somewhere it snows in winter. How about you, Doctor? Have you gotten what you want, on the move all these years?
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_001: I'm not so good at desk work, but if all you need is someone to stay by your side and help you arrange your tasks and schedule... I can give it a shot, perhaps.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_002: This pocket watch? My father gave it to me before he left home. It's nothing fancy, but it keeps time if you keep the movement and dial maintained… Uh, Doctor, is there anyone at Rhodes Island who can fix watches?
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_003: Out in the field, you can leave the cooking to me. That's what they had me doing back in the Columbian barrenlands. I can't promise, you know that, it's gonna taste very good… But at least it won't give you a stomachache.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_004: Back when I was with the Pioneer Team, the company left us undersupplied, and we did not take that sitting down. We ended up escaping into the barrelands. That's when I got this scar on my eye. It's not a disgrace, but it's not a badge of honor either. It's just the kind of bad luck that us regular Columbians deal with all the time. Mine's just a little more obvious than others.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_005: Planning your time and planning your life couldn't be more different. When you're eking out a living, you've got no choice but to use every last second. Even when you space out, you have to keep an eye on the clock. On the other hand, to plan out your life, you need enough time to think and feel. Those aren't contradictory. It's just the second one's more of a luxury to most people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_006: Is my sword heavy? You bet it is. But I need a heavy one to protect my friends and defend our overdue freedom. The truer the weight I carry is, the mightier I can wield it... And when I'm hurt, it also comes in handy as a walking stick.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_007: When my mother died, I didn't even get to mourn her. I had a huge pile of medical debt waiting for me to pay off. Why did I join the Pioneer Team, and why did I become a merc? It's not like I had other options. But I came to Rhodes Island after giving it serious thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_008: A free mercenary only takes a mission she thinks is worth the time. There was this one night when I was sitting by the fire, affixing some beast teeth to my sword. My friends were sleeping, and the only sound in the air was my watch ticking away. Time is always on my mind, but that was the first time I really felt its passing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_009: The mercenary crew I joined was doomed to disband, sooner or later. Without a clear goal and strict discipline, you can't survive in the wilderness… Maybe only an organization like Rhodes Island can really protect what's beautiful out there. I'm thankful that I could come here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_010: Doctor, if you don't need anything from me, I'll just zone out here for a bit... Feel free to talk to me anytime you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I'm Quartz... I think I'm on time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_012: I wish our squad could've fought like this back there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_013: Thanks for your recognition, but remember to tell me if there's anything I can improve on.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_014: Rhodes Island's promotion process and standards are pretty transparent. That's not easy to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_018: Don't worry. I think my decisions through.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_019: I propose we begin our operation at the top of the hour. It'll be easier to keep track of time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_020: Hide, and make sure to put out the cooking fire.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_022: Sheathe my weapon for the time being? Then my sword…
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_024: A bit late, not a big problem.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_025: Time your strike. It's more important than brute strength.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_026: Keep your distance. I only want to strike the enemy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_027: You're staring at my eyepatch, it reveals a lot.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_029: When every phase of the mission proceeds with watchlike precision, victory is assured.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_030: This is worth celebrating... When we get back to Rhodes Island, we won't have to eat my cooking anymore.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_031: Even the most accurate of watches isn't always accurate. Don't be so fixated on perfection
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_032: Sorry, Doctor, we had a few problems with the plan because my watch is broken. Go, and leave the rest to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_033: This is much more comfortable than a tent in the wilderness... Will someone stand watch at night?
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_036: Let's space out together, Doctor. We can chill for as long as we need... No need to watch the clock like we used to.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New Year. Hey, do me a favor and watch the length of your New Year's speech. Everyone is waiting to cut the cake.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. Careful. You almost bumped into my sword.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Here's a pocket watch... Of course, it's not my own. And it's not one of those collectibles the Columbian businessmen like. You may not need something like this to show off, but you can use it to check the time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4063_quartz_CN_044: If I hadn't come across Rhodes Island, would I still be wandering the wilderness by myself, or would I have returned to the city to face the music...? I don't know, but I don't need the answer, either. I stand with you and Rhodes Island now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_001: If you've thought it through, I have no qualms with it. Please let me know when the documents are due.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_002: ...Please, go ahead. It's okay. Reading the paper is just an unhelpful habit I picked up in the Grand Knight Territory, but one can learn much more from a day's trip outside the city than a hundred papers can teach... It's true that the Nearl name often shows up in the headlines, but there's no need to pay that any mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_003: I'm afraid I can't advise Rhodes Island on its affairs in Kazimierz. I may have spent a decade in that tower, but only as an unambitious nobody. I'm in no position to express my views on the General Chamber of Commerce. The sword...? Yes, I know how to use one, and I've always used the same one.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_004: No need to have Maria come see me. She's not a child anymore, and ought to make her own decisions, lest she embarrass her parents. A knight should temper themselves through travel, and no matter what she does under Rhodes Island's wing, she must always be responsible for her own actions.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_005: Leithanien's conspiracies... Nothing more than trifles that happened years ago. It doesn't change the fact that I'm an ordinary citizen, nor does it change anything else. To Kazimierzians, stars and heroes come and go. The success they enjoy is only that which they are permitted.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_006: Seems Margaret kept the title she earned from that charade. Hmph, so she still sees her actions as a victory, after squandering the Nearls' glory in those cheap commercial performances... My Originium Arts? Alas, I can nary illuminate a thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_007: No need to teach me how to get along with the Infected...You should be aware of my time spent living among the refugees…? The Infected, the disabled, the bankrupt, the famished and poor... they're all the same in the ways that matter. The most honorable thing they can hope to achieve is climbing out of their tent in the settlement before their final moments arrive.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_008: You, too, encourage the others to throw themselves at a cause that will yield no results. Those who attempt to walk through fire in the dark night will only find themselves immolated. That said, you don't need my advice, given the path you so obstinately walk alone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_009: In the first two years after they left the Grand Knight Territory, the campaign knights would often bring me their letters. By the time the last one arrived, Maria was already old enough to understand its gist... Whether the letters were written beforehand makes no difference to me, but given the weight of their lives and deaths, they wouldn't have disappeared without so much as a peep.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_011: Młynar Nearl. Per our contract's provisions, I shall assist Rhodes Island with its operations in Kazimierz. ...You already knew my name. I'm neither a knight, nor do I have a title.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_012: A Kazimierzian is smart after the damage is done…
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_013: I appreciate your appraisal, if you consider such ordinary performance worthy of promotion.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_014: Titles and positions are both meaningless. The knights of the Nearl family do not require recognition to walk their paths. Even in modern Kazimierz, where every path leads to darkness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_017: Man has forgotten true struggle… as well as those who require it to survive.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_019: Sand, dust, and blood. Most fail to imagine the sight of their admixture.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_020: To think they are unaware of their own shame...
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_023: These so-called foes… not even worth drawing my sword.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_024: Just like the old days?… No.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_028: That sigh... still haunts my mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_029: You still have full confidence in everything... With these people's fate in your hand, you still believe there will be a happy ending.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_030: If you have no other work for me, I shall take my leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_031: Deserters… they always have somewhere to hide, among their like-minded brethren.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_032: Mark my words, there will be battles you cannot win. Have you considered the consequences of those inevitable failures?
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_033: You... accommodate quite a few people here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_034: ...I believe I've made a suggestion regarding this matter?
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_036: Kazimierz's knight novels... Hmph... The Grand Knight Territory no longer has room for such fantasies.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_038: Margaret and Maria should be on board... No, no need to tell them. I find the commotions that come with the New Year unbearable. I'm just going to read the paper here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_043: If you have no time to deal with work today, then I'll take my leave. A present? I used to give Maria gifts when she was little. I even once chased after bandits who had ransacked a village, for the sake of a small child's birthday wish. That said, you are not a small child.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_CN_044: The future that Rhodes Island paints is impossible, but still, you attract supporters to chase it with no regard for their own safety. Your tottering ideals would never have come this far without the support of your followers. So spare me the civilities. I'm only walking this path alongside you for the time being.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_002: I've never guaranteed your survival for following me, Toland. If it was their lives that your hunters valued, they shouldn't have stepped onto the battlefield or had their recklessness take over them in the first place... Their deaths are not what you need to downplay for your mockery. You will always remember. As will I.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_003: The rivalries in the halls of power never ceased, they've merely become a part of the opportunistic pursuit of profit. The only constant is the innocent being dragged into the cesspool. As vassals of a treasonous knight, your parents were forced to take you into their involuntary flight ere the fabricated incrimination could arrive... Czcibor, why? Why didn't you... flee even further?
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_004: Why are you still here? Our ideals have come to an end, and I witnessed their final moments... No, never mind. You wish to spar? Then pick up your spear. Entrust your future not to a failure, but to sacrifice, and the pain in your flesh. Come.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_005: Father, you once told me that longswords are suitable only for valorous young knights. But the National Council's miscarriage of justice, the General Chamber of Commerce's rise to prominence—everything I've wanted to stop, my blade was useless to prevent. I couldn't remove your lesions, and with it by my side I watched as Schnitz left... I merely became accustomed to its prescence.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_006: Golden plains, a field of wheat, the path of a nomadic city, and the wake of a Catastrophe. The manor's garden, the arena, and those who hand over their last coin along with their last harvest... Father, I've always tried to walk a righteous path.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_007: Forget it, Schnitz. How am I to tutor Maria in your stead? I am no knight, and certainly no father. No one would call me 'gentle.' Besides... I never once imagined I would actually return to this place... Why, Schnitz? Why am I the one to remain?
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_008: Margaret doesn't speak to me, but considering how she was back then... we had no need to. She is just like you were at that age, Yolanta, too much so. She will experience the same things you did, and she will never regret them. That I should tarry at her side more? Hmph, there's no point.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_009: The Grand Knight Territory's appearance is ever-fluid. Today, the city exhibits no trace of what it was twenty years ago, its sunset-lit silhouette sunken and gone... Yet its nightscapes still spring up to my mind at times wanted and at times not. Often, I find myself thinking that I should at least... try to seek out and reclaim that past.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_010: The sound of a rainstorm in the wilderness...
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_011: 'Fear neither hardship nor darkness...' Hmph. A bygone time unworthy of remembering. A dream, far too lucid.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_012: Nearly the same struggles and sacrifices...
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_013: Blank paperwork for promotion within the order, excerpts from the recon knights' reports on our movements... Schnitz often sent these things, as his way of saying hello.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_014: How should I present myself...? As the one slandered by the papers and the groundless gossip in town? Or as the wanderer who once treated that vilification as a badge of honor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_017: To think they all still believe that blood is not spilled in vain…
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_019: The sound of the wind in the barrens... Far too familiar.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_020: It would seem they have yet to remember what to fear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_022: Blade whetted again… for but another battle…
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_023: Do I need to repeat myself on the battle plan?
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_024: All those... I have yet to abandon.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_025: It will be over before you feel the pain.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_027: The sunlight will have to wait.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_028: Even if there is but a sigh at the very end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_029: There is no one man who loftily sneers at the pointlessness of it all... Time speeds past us equally.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_031: From the windows of Kawalerielki's towers, my eyes have grown tired of those men and their unpunished misdeeds.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_032: 'Failure can be endured.' ... But the price is always dear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_033: I have no promises to make.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_034: I can tell who you are. Speak freely.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_036: Do not add any frivolous decorations to my sword, Toland... In the Grand Knight Territory, there are merchants eying the Nearl name. They will do as you do, and ridicule me in your place.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_038: Let us pretend that today was the New Year. Who could remember dates, after having trudged the wilderness for so long? ...But I am not wrong about the dates, I know. Everything that happens in Kawalerielki is measured by how many days it remains in the paper, no more and no less. No matter the story.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_042: Do I long for the old days? No. I simply cannot forget. That which I saw in the places untouched by light... and could do nothing about.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_043: Once you stop making wishes, you naturally no longer look forward to birthdays. Whether that's because you can already fulfill them on your own, or out of crippling despair... I'm afraid it's been far too long since the last time I said 'Happy birthday' to anyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4064_mlynar_epoque#28_CN_044: No matter when or where, there are always those shouting out their naive ideals. However, the idealists are not the only ones who can move forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_001: It's been a long time since I've felt like there was any conviction or meaning in my work. Rather than sit through show trial after show trial, I prefer to wade through these thorny, complicated files.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_002: You don't have to tiptoe around me. I don't judge good or evil on any ironclad law. And with all the crimes staged in the name of order… Ah, pay no mind to this judge's grumble, a powerless judge waiting to be indicted for misconduct in office.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_003: The thorns on this codex? Yes, of course the spikes hurt, but I wish for the pain to remind me: No matter how weak the statutes in Siracusa, no matter how highly I think of my calling, perversion of justice and blasphemy against the law are crimes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_004: They say 'the law is the basis of morality,' but that's not a natural truth. It emerges from a consensus of the people. When the people come to see violence as order, the law is nothing but a fantasy to dream of. And I, as the keeper of that fantasy, am the most ridiculous of all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_005: In Siracusa, being a city court judge is a dangerous job. Either you join 'them,' or... you disappear. I thought I could strike a balance between the two, but there's no way to stay clean when you're surrounded by mud. In the end, I was just another accomplice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_006: Maybe Siracusa really is that hard to change. The gangs, the famiglie... They shared a womb with Siracusa and shaped it into the country it is today. But we can't take them for granted. We must believe that a different path exists.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_007: Oh, mi dispiace, I didn't see you there. If you're all done with work, how about joining me for a drink?… Why that look in your eyes? I'm not an alcoholic. But everyone needs some liquid assistance every now and then, whether for fatigue or for suffering. Ecco. It's on the strong side, so sip slowly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_008: If you ever get a chance to visit Siracusa, please avoid the rainy season. However, if you really are that unfortunate... best thing you can do is find a little shop on the street and sit for a while. Maybe only after the rain can one enjoy the momentary illusion that the city is clean.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_009: In my many years as a judge, I've only handed down a few verdicts I could feel good about. I still remember the look on those two kids' faces when I broke up their little scuffle and told the aggressor to apologize. What, why are you laughing? Even the greatest justice must start from somewhere small.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_010: You're sleeping? There's nothing more valuable than these rare moments of peace. Conserviamo questi momenti.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_011: I am Lavinia Falcone, formerly a judge of Siracusa. Today, I report to you as Operator Penance. I hope that in working for Rhodes Island, I can absolve myself of my past mistakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_012: So much violence in the name of order... Doctor, I can only pray that your efforts are more than futile.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_013: I am honored to earn your support. We can certainly work together and offer mutual assistance, but let me be frank – that doesn't mean you can influence my decisions. Sorry, no offense intended, but that's a lesson I learned the hard way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_014: Be it a famiglia, a society, or a country, people are often bound by mutual interest... I used to assume this was the way of the world, but Doctor, you showed me a different path. I hope we can share this mutual trust long into the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_017: Sitting around in an office won't bring about justice. That's one thing I know for a fact.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_018: Whether or not you are burdened by a criminal record is unimportant to me. All I ask is that in this coming battle, our goals might be aligned.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_019: Contempt for the law is a crime. The words of my codex will prove their own worth.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_020: This time, I will hand down a fair verdict.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_021: No matter what I might encounter, I will not back down.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_022: What the law does not specify, I will reveal through practice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_023: This gavel of justice is weighty. Spero che siate pronti.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_024: I am fighting for more than just the law. Also the justice and virtue that extend beyond it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_025: The law is a means, not an end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_026: There is no such thing as absolute justice, but I still invoke it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_027: Can crimes be punished through methods outside of the law?
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_029: Even a crime-ridden swamp is not beyond salvation. Doctor, thank you for once again reminding me of this fact.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_030: A trial in all its vaunted glory will not bring about any substantive change. It matters more what we do after the trial. Doctor, I've seen what you've done, and find it praiseworthy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_031: Doctor, prepare a team to arrest the fugitives. There is no difference between a moment of mercy and a miscarriage of justice. They have not yet been read their verdict.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_032: Naturally, they and the darkness behind them will occasionally prevail... But mark my words, even the most frustrating rainy season will pass in time. Until then, all we can do is persevere, and keep trying.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_033: This place is nothing like stagnant, old Siracusa. The breath of hope flows here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_036: Are you here to discuss criminal procedure with me? No? Eccellente. I hope you never need my knowledge in that regard.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_038: Back in my homeland, even New Year's Day comes with no guarantee of peace. The conflicts of interest do not stop for a holiday. That's why I cherish my time here at Rhodes Island, spending it with all of you. Buon Anno, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_042: Doctor, I've categorized these documents according to their importance. Let me remind you that some of your operations land in a legal gray zone. I'm not opposed to them, but you need to think things through. I'll offer my advice as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_043: Doctor, is today your birthday? I'll skip the serious business for now, so just enjoy this day to yourself. If you have nothing to do, I could tell you about some of Siracusa's osterie?
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_CN_044: Doctor, Rhodes Island has a grand vision, but we have to think carefully. After all the slogans, ideals, and aspirations have been stripped away, whether we still have pure hearts, that is far more important than any false order.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_001: It's been a long time since I've felt like there was any conviction or meaning in my work. Rather than sit through show trial after show trial, I prefer to wade through these thorny, complicated files.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_002: You don't have to tiptoe around me. I don't judge good or evil on any ironclad law. And with all the crimes staged in the name of order… Ah, pay no mind to this judge's grumble, a powerless judge waiting to be indicted for misconduct in office.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_003: The thorns on this codex? Yes, of course the spikes hurt, but I wish for the pain to remind me: No matter how weak the statutes in Siracusa, no matter how highly I think of my calling, perversion of justice and blasphemy against the law are crimes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_004: They say 'the law is the basis of morality,' but that's not a natural truth. It emerges from a consensus of the people. When the people come to see violence as order, the law is nothing but a fantasy to dream of. And I, as the keeper of that fantasy, am the most ridiculous of all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_005: In Siracusa, being a city court judge is a dangerous job. Either you join 'them,' or... you disappear. I thought I could strike a balance between the two, but there's no way to stay clean when you're surrounded by mud. In the end, I was just another accomplice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_006: Maybe Siracusa really is that hard to change. The gangs, the famiglie... They shared a womb with Siracusa and shaped it into the country it is today. But we can't take them for granted. We must believe that a different path exists.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_007: Oh, mi dispiace, I didn't see you there. If you're all done with work, how about joining me for a drink?… Why that look in your eyes? I'm not an alcoholic. But everyone needs some liquid assistance every now and then, whether for fatigue or for suffering. Ecco. It's on the strong side, so sip slowly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_008: If you ever get a chance to visit Siracusa, please avoid the rainy season. However, if you really are that unfortunate... best thing you can do is find a little shop on the street and sit for a while. Maybe only after the rain can one enjoy the momentary illusion that the city is clean.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_009: In my many years as a judge, I've only handed down a few verdicts I could feel good about. I still remember the look on those two kids' faces when I broke up their little scuffle and told the aggressor to apologize. What, why are you laughing? Even the greatest justice must start from somewhere small.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_010: You're sleeping? There's nothing more valuable than these rare moments of peace. Conserviamo questi momenti.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_011: I am Lavinia Falcone, formerly a judge of Siracusa. Today, I report to you as Operator Penance. I hope that in working for Rhodes Island, I can absolve myself of my past mistakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_012: So much violence in the name of order... Doctor, I can only pray that your efforts are more than futile.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_013: I am honored to earn your support. We can certainly work together and offer mutual assistance, but let me be frank – that doesn't mean you can influence my decisions. Sorry, no offense intended, but that's a lesson I learned the hard way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_014: Be it a famiglia, a society, or a country, people are often bound by mutual interest... I used to assume this was the way of the world, but Doctor, you showed me a different path. I hope we can share this mutual trust long into the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_017: Sitting around in an office won't bring about justice. That's one thing I know for a fact.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_018: Whether or not you are burdened by a criminal record is unimportant to me. All I ask is that in this coming battle, our goals might be aligned.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_019: Contempt for the law is a crime. The words of my codex will prove their own worth.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_020: This time, I will hand down a fair verdict.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_021: No matter what I might encounter, I will not back down.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_022: What the law does not specify, I will reveal through practice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_023: This gavel of justice is weighty. Spero che siate pronti.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_024: I am fighting for more than just the law. Also the justice and virtue that extend beyond it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_025: The law is a means, not an end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_026: There is no such thing as absolute justice, but I still invoke it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_027: Can crimes be punished through methods outside of the law?
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_029: Even a crime-ridden swamp is not beyond salvation. Doctor, thank you for once again reminding me of this fact.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_030: A trial in all its vaunted glory will not bring about any substantive change. It matters more what we do after the trial. Doctor, I've seen what you've done, and find it praiseworthy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_031: Doctor, prepare a team to arrest the fugitives. There is no difference between a moment of mercy and a miscarriage of justice. They have not yet been read their verdict.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_032: Naturally, they and the darkness behind them will occasionally prevail... But mark my words, even the most frustrating rainy season will pass in time. Until then, all we can do is persevere, and keep trying.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_033: This place is nothing like stagnant, old Siracusa. The breath of hope flows here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_036: Are you here to discuss criminal procedure with me? No? Eccellente. I hope you never need my knowledge in that regard.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_038: Back in my homeland, even New Year's Day comes with no guarantee of peace. The conflicts of interest do not stop for a holiday. That's why I cherish my time here at Rhodes Island, spending it with all of you. Buon Anno, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_042: Doctor, I've categorized these documents according to their importance. Let me remind you that some of your operations land in a legal gray zone. I'm not opposed to them, but you need to think things through. I'll offer my advice as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_043: Doctor, is today your birthday? I'll skip the serious business for now, so just enjoy this day to yourself. If you have nothing to do, I could tell you about some of Siracusa's osterie?
dialogue_tracker.char_4065_judge_ITA_CN_044: Doctor, Rhodes Island has a grand vision, but we have to think carefully. After all the slogans, ideals, and aspirations have been stripped away, whether we still have pure hearts, that is far more important than any false order.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_001: If some work is beyond even your power, then how can I possibly take on a share?
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_002: That nightmare still comes to mind, even now. My life denied by some grand ecology... no, not denied. It would admit everything, it was more sublime than life itself... it made me feel shame at the selfishness of life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_003: I don't want to belittle the Medical Department's effort, but I don't believe life can be 'cured' like a disease. Human or Sea Terror, I'm doomed to live on as half-baked, and that's the price I pay for my own foolishness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_004: That special 'collaborator' of yours is just something other right now, using biological function to imitate his old form, and you should know that better than him. You're still seeking possibilities in him? I hope you aren't repeating my mistakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_005: I've felt at ease in my time residing aboard the landship, even come to recognize it as a feeling similar to my long-lost home... You don't need to be concerned. Even if Iberia will never be a home to the Ægir, I'd never refuse to execute my responsibilities there, such as we've agreed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_006: Anything that seems to be given for free will eventually demand some price of you. That's the lesson I learned. And some of what you do appears to practically overturn that... I'll have to wait and see.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_007: You're wondering what this song is? It's just something my mother taught me when I was young. I didn't take much interest back then, only humming perfunctory notes to follow along. It was only after losing her, I realized... these melodies form one of the few things I still have to my name.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_008: An ignorant girl gives up her song, and gains naught but a dream snuffed as quickly as the foam in return. It sounds just like a fairytale, doesn't it? And the fact that such a stupid girl could be saved at the story's end... seems like a fairytale, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_009: You've helped me recover the courage to trust in other beings, so I hope you see this responsibility through. Lead those willing to follow you, and put an end to those disasters that should never have befallen the innocent. Please, don't disappoint me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_010: You see them in your dreams too, don't you? All those faces who've quietly left your life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_011: So, you'd be the 'Doctor'. I don't have much to introduce about myself. If I'm standing here, you must have read and approved all the files about me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_012: Maybe I shouldn't doubt the value of these records, like I did before.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_013: The more you seek from a power you should reject, the deeper you fall into it. Eventually, it will engulf your entire being. You understand this, don't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_014: You wish to forge a space that can admit me, and hope for me to admit everything surrounding me...? An arrogant notion, truly. But maybe I could bear witness with you, until the day you give up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_017: Looks like we've gotten our approvals. It's time to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_018: I might bring their ruin, but only you can bring our victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_019: Let us reap those naive delusions and immature obsessions.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_020: I hear the sound of the flooding tide.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_021: Do you have instructions for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_022: Do I still have to wait?
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_025: They have no position to evade.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_026: They have no power to withstand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_027: They have no way to advance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_028: They have no path to escape.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_029: Sometimes, your grasp of the surrounding situation makes me instinctually fearful. Yes, I believe you could make even Sea Terrors comprehend fear. So, do you intend to feel happy about this?
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_030: The waves have subsided. If you have no other tasks, I should leave immediately to undergo a 'routine' inspection.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_031: Were you showing mercy? Are enemies of this level worth your indulgence?
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_032: We should go. Before the next wave has us drowned.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_033: So this, too, is the place you promise I can belong.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_036: This place might be more... calming than expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_038: I don't expect much for the new year, nor do I want to. I just want to take a walk around and see whether anything's changed, compared to my memories of the last year. If it won't bore you, I don't mind you accompanying me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_042: We still have some time, before the tide floods the soil beneath us.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_043: Look at this mountain of gift boxes. They symbolize everyone around you who treasures you. And I add: this, my present to you. I'm so glad these petals and pearls my mother gave me didn't fade with time, just like how she taught me to string flower garlands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4066_highmo_CN_044: Does Rhodes Island's intent to cure Oripathy stem from its mission as a healer, or its core members' self-interest as Infected? Now, under this starry sky, another threat has appeared to endanger us all. What will Rhodes Island do? You already have an answer, don't you, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_001: This table's really high! I guess it's easier if I just use my old form to jump up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_002: What are you doing here? There's these Medic Operators who keep chasing my tail all the time saying they wanna study me! I need to lay low! Still, why are you hiding here too? You're not slacking off, right, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_003: My power is controlling metal, stuff like the thing on your table. I can make it turn pointy, round, or flat, and even more complicated shapes too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_004: The people here look a lot like the spirits in our world. So maybe, the spirits in this world look like you do, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_005: This place is a lot like the Hall for Spirits to me, with all the Infected staying here because they have nowhere to go. But... the Infected have it really different from spirits. They can't even escape just by staying far away from everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_006: There's so many Catastrophes here... Is this why your cities have to keep wandering everywhere all the time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_007: I get it! Operators are Executors, aren't they? Executors do errands for the Hall for Spirits, and Operators do errands for Rhodes Island! Huh? No?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_008: I'll be an Executor someday, just like my master. My master's really mighty! Um... you too. Everyone on this battleship listens to you, so you've got to be somebody incredible.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_009: Doctor, are we friends now? Then if you can, you should visit our side to play sometime!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_010: Doctor, are you eating something secret there?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_011: Hello, Doctor, my name's Xiaohei, and I'm a spirit.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_012: Doctor... if I don't understand these tapes, can I ask you about them?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_014: I still don't really get it, but thanks, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_017: Doctor, I'm here! Huh? Is there something on my face? Ah, I just finished eating, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_018: I'm gonna be the captain? Can I handle that...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_019: Doctor, grab onto me, I'll use my power to send us there. It's quicker that way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_029: Is everyone okay? I'm so, so glad!
