dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_032: It's all my fault for being so weak, Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_033: I can't forget about the mission the Doctor gave me. But this mat's so comfortable, and the sun's so warm. I think I'm getting kinda sleepy...
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh#1_CN_043: So it's your birthday, Doctor! No wonder there's so many people aboard. Sorry, I didn't get a present ready in time for this, um... you can have this scroll from the Hall for Spirits, and if you're ever in danger, it'll save your life!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_001: This table's really high! I guess it's easier if I just use my old form to jump up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_002: What are you doing here? There's these Medic Operators who keep chasing my tail all the time saying they wanna study me! I need to lay low! Still, why are you hiding here too? You're not slacking off, right, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_003: My power is controlling metal, stuff like the thing on your table. I can make it turn pointy, round, or flat, and even more complicated shapes too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_004: The people here look a lot like the spirits in our world. So maybe, the spirits in this world look like you do, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_005: This place is a lot like the Hall for Spirits to me, with all the Infected staying here because they have nowhere to go. But... the Infected have it really different from spirits. They can't even escape just by staying far away from everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_006: There's so many Catastrophes here... Is this why your cities have to keep wandering everywhere all the time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_007: I get it! Operators are Executors, aren't they? Executors do errands for the Hall for Spirits, and Operators do errands for Rhodes Island! Huh? No?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_008: I'll be an Executor someday, just like my master. My master's really mighty! Um... you too. Everyone on this battleship listens to you, so you've got to be somebody incredible.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_009: Doctor, are we friends now? Then if you can, you should visit our side to play sometime!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_010: Doctor, are you eating something secret there?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_011: Hello, Doctor, my name's Xiaohei, and I'm a spirit.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_012: Doctor... if I don't understand these tapes, can I ask you about them?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_014: I still don't really get it, but thanks, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_017: Doctor, I'm here! Huh? Is there something on my face? Ah, I just finished eating, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_018: I'm gonna be the captain? Can I handle that...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_019: Doctor, grab onto me, I'll use my power to send us there. It's quicker that way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_020: Are... all of them bad guys?
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_021: Heixiu, we have to help the Doctor out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_022: Uh-huh, Doctor, I'm here, don't worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_023: I'm actually pretty good at assassinating.
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_024: I won't let you hurt them!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_026: If you get any closer, I'll get mean!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_027: I'm super strong! I'll show you how mighty I am!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_029: Is everyone okay? I'm so, so glad!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_032: It's all my fault for being so weak, Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_033: I can't forget about the mission the Doctor gave me. But this mat's so comfortable, and the sun's so warm. I think I'm getting kinda sleepy...
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_034: Doctor, don't mess with my ears!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_036: What are you still working for, Doctor? It's almost food time!
dialogue_tracker.char_4067_lolxh_CN_043: So it's your birthday, Doctor! No wonder there's so many people aboard. Sorry, I didn't get a present ready in time for this, um... you can have this scroll from the Hall for Spirits, and if you're ever in danger, it'll save your life!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_001: I'm not good at this stuff either. Huh? They need it done today? Eh... Fine, I told you I'd help. I keep my word. Give it here. I'll take half, but you gotta finish the rest on your own!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_002: Got any salt on you, Doc? Here, gimme some. I made potatoes. They taste so good when you sprinkle salt on them! We eat them like this a lot when we're out on a job! I roasted some fruit, too. Take it to W and Ines... Don't tell them it's from me! Got it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_003: I heard I might run into W here? Seriously? She and Ines saved me a while back, and I'm thankful for it, but she can be real annoying sometimes... Doc, I'm surprised you had the guts to hire her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_004: Manfred, that jackass! He actually did it! And he was serious about it, too! I totally thought I was going to die... Ugh, I know he's got his reasons... but I still can't let it slide! I've got a grudge!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_005: You were leading the squad then, right? Hmph, how could I forget? You gave me a real bad time! But if I had to do it again, I'd still choose to take everybody and bug out... I don't want to have to watch somebody sacrifice themselves ever again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_006: Is rebuilding Kazdel really a good idea? I don't know. All I know is I care more about the people around me—my squadmates, everyone from Rhodes Island... of course, that includes you, Doctor! We're buddies now, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_007: If Kazdel really gets rebuilt, does that really mean us Sarkaz all get to come back and reunite together? What will the Victorian rebels think of us? I can't see how this all ends... I don't know...
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_008: Doc! Is the mail in? Anything for me? Thing is, I was raised by my nana in a small town in Columbia, and we still write to each other! I'm always telling everyone here to write home more often, but for some reason they get pretty upset about it. I wonder why.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_009: C'mere, Doc. Try this on! Hm... Looks great on you. My nana knitted it for you! It matches mine, too! How's it feel? Comfy and warm, right? I told Nana all about you, and she called you a good egg!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_010: So bored... Maybe I should knit something. What do you think of this little pouch? It's very practical!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_011: Hey there! Starting today, my squad and I are at your beck and call, Doctor. Call me Paprika. You seem like a solid employer, but you're still on probation! I've got my eye on you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_012: Are these the ancient Sarkaz tricks the old folks talk about?
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_013: Awesome, I finally got promoted! Hehe, you said you'd let me lead my own squad after my promotion. You're a doctor of your word, aren't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_014: Doctor! You're a mighty fine employer! Amiya looks real dependable, too. There's no going wrong, hitching my wagon to you. If you've got any more high-paying gigs, be sure to give me a holler!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_017: Hehe, you picked the right girl for the job!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_018: Just leave it to me! I've got some experience leading a squad.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_019: Stay safe and keep in contact. Remember, the mission comes second. Your lives come first!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_020: Let's clear the place in one fell swoop!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_021: Don't worry. I've been standing by here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_022: I don't pick fights I can't win.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_023: Not one of you is getting away!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_024: Don't get careless just because I'm here!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_026: Get behind me, if you feel yourself slipping!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_027: We can't have any more casualties...
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_028: You bastards... Scram! I'm busy here!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_029: You're pretty amazing, coming up with a strategy like that... I gotta say, you're a lot better than W just lobbing bombs at everything.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_030: Awesome, smooth like butter! Hehe, I didn't need any backup that time. Let's see what W and Ines have to say!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_031: A few footmen slipped past us, but that's no big deal, right? Yep, everyone made it out of the fight alive. I call that a big win!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_032: N-No way... Doctor, you aren't trying to hold the line here, are you? C'mon, quit spacing out. Hurry up and run!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_033: Rhodes Island really treats us well... Oh, don't be so humble. This is much better than the dump we used to live in!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_036: This poncho feels great, right? Nana knitted it for me. It's so warm.
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_038: Happy New Year! I didn't expect such a crowd celebrating the new year together. It's so much fun hearing all the New Year's wishes! Doc, what's your wish this year? Me, I'm wishing for Nana to stay safe... Oh no, if I tell someone, the wish won't come true, right? Forget what I just said, instantly!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_042: Hey, Doc. What kind of missions do we have today? Oh, right. Let me get this out of the way. I'm not taking anything too crazy!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_043: Hey Doctor, guess what day it is? …You don't remember? It's your birthday! How could you forget your own birthday! Huh? You were pulling my leg? And you know I've prepared a present...? What?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4071_peper_CN_044: A great employer like Rhodes Island is hard to find. Our partnership has been wonderful! I never thought I'd see a day like this when you guys first beat us back in Londinium... We're gonna keep this up for a very, very long time. Right, Doc?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_001: Doctor, do you mind me tinkering with a few things here, or would that be too much noise? Just give me a tap on the back when you want to chat, of course.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_002: Doctor, I hear you've got a lot of books here. Could you lend me a few to read? They don't have to be on mechanical engineering, I'm plenty curious about stuff I don't know. Like this one, for instance, it's a beauty of a doorstopper... what was that? Don't touch? I-It's got a curse? Hold on, who put that on it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_003: The Sarkaz deserve sympathy for what they've been through, but one man can't steal another's home for the sake of his own. Peace will come to Londinium, and I hope, one day, every wanderer gets to build a homeland. It's what Rhodes Island wants too, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_004: A lot of people'll say the lord nobles do nothing but cling onto the privilege and wealth they inherit, and never think to build on this land with their own hands. Me? I don't mind fighting side-by-side with nobles, just don't make me call them 'lord.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_005: I didn't used to believe things could ever really be dire. Not until an almighty enemy showed up to me, and stole my pals from me, one after the other. They all trusted me, and I failed them. Granny was right. 'Being smart isn't enough to fool death.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_006: I'm a big fan of red. It makes me think of fireplaces on freezing nights. And all the friends who've left us along the way... I'm telling you, their sacrifices meant something. Londinium will come back to us, back to our hands, and it'll be better than before.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_007: Doctor, I find it easy to trust people, but don't take me for stupid. If you were just another lot of plotting schemers, I would've taken up arms with no hesitation. But you see, if I offer a shake when I meet someone, that's all the more likely I've got a new friend. Haha, I'm glad my bet paid off here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_008: When we were on break, me and my work pals liked climbing up to the workshop ceiling. Thirty, forty-odd meters. We'd step out of the window and go jumping between buildings. Wind'd blow by with the smell of the factory heat and rust, stars'd squeeze down past the buildings and smile on me. I could feel my city in its warm embrace.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_009: *sigh* It's a beauty of a place at Rhodes. I almost want to apply to stay aboard. Shame I've still got all those people and all that work waiting for me in Londinium... Doctor, when it's clear skies once more at home, how about you let me be your guide again? What do you say?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_010: Doctor, you must be bored out of your mind sitting at work all day. Want me to take you out for some exercise? Don't worry, no ziplines this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_011: Doctor, we've faced so much danger together. Do we still need this paperwork to stand for us being friends? Wait, you mean once I sign, I get to take any of Engineering's beauties apart? That's a promise, you hear? 'Stainless'—done.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_012: Cor, I suppose you really do make your logistics people fight too. Not that that's much of a problem... How about a little pay bump, eh?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_013: 'Top Engineering Operator?' If I want to be Chief Engineer, I'm still a few steps away, aren't I? Haha, I'm just pulling your leg. I've got no plan to jockey for Closure's living.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_014: It's a luxury now, just having free time like this to work with my drill and spanner. Doctor, thank you. I'm all willing to take to the field for my homeland and freedom. But it's you and Rhodes Island that won back this moment of refuge for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_017: Squad 11 of Self-Salvation Corp, joining up with Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_018: I'm a little nervous. Still, pressure's a good motivator, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_019: Remember, everyone! Not one fewer when we come back!
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_020: Hello, everyone over there, you can breathe easy. What's the line? 'I'm just your average mechanic.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_021: About time for us to shine?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_023: Picked a good place for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_028: Fight for Londinium! Victory to Londiniers!
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_029: We'll come together, we'll fight all the way, for this city we stand on, until we fall.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_030: Doctor, with you for company all the time, I start imagining I fight even better than the mercs. Don't you let me get too cocky. If Granny and Rockrock saw, they'd be knocking on my head with spanners.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_031: Hah... haha, made it through another battle. Hard as nails, though. Don't look so glum, Doctor. I know it's back to the Commander for a tactical meeting, but how about a bite to eat before then?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_032: Time to scram, Doctor. The zipline's ready. Give me your hand! It's only a win once you survive.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_033: So it wasn't Victoria with the best construction technology.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_034: Watch it! Drill didn't hurt you, did it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_036: Doctor, you always show up where I wasn't looking. I bet Rhodes Island has secret passages too, doesn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_038: Want a drink, Doctor? How about some ginger ale... what, a dance? Haha, my hands might be skilled at work, but my legs are naff dancers—it all cancels out. Still, if you're okay with me, I can try. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_042: Doctor, I'm just back from patrol. Safe as houses all around! You can break for a bit longer. The tenser the state of things, the more you need a proper stretch now and then.
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_043: Doctor, help me figure out why this panel's on fire... You can't figure it out either? I'd hope not, I broke it on purpose... um, flip, I shouldn't have said that. Would've ruined the surprise they had for you if I just let you walk on past. Closure's not gonna kill me, is she?
dialogue_tracker.char_4072_ironmn_CN_044: Dr. {@nickname}, thank you. Being with my Rhodes Island companions makes me see more clearly what it is I'm resisting. Everyone should have the freedom to run about their own city, and we fight for that right. That's a future that belongs to us all, including the Infected.
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_001: Remember, you two, this purr-ticular assistant role calls for maximum vigilance. If any meownsters come knocking, we throw the Doctor on the cart and go!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_002: Curious about our latest research? We're gnawing on 'An Investigation into Biological Discrepancies Between Us Felynes with a Y and Terran Felines with an I.' We were halfway done, but then we found out you have Aslans too, so it's back to the scratching post for us... You Terrans are meowder with your subspecies!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_003: Your Meowjesty, never forget to eat your fill before you go on a hunt. Dive into a fight with full stamina, and you might end up doing things you didn't even think you could... mrrreow!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_004: *dink* *dink* No Machalite Ore left...  Could substitute with Rock Spider stones and gloompincer shells... Don't know without trying. In you go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_007: The mountains never fail to remind me of an old bud, built just as tall and strong. He broke his weapon once and quit the Palico life after, but if memory serves, he then went with the Research Commission to take up cheffing in the New World... You never know what turn your next life'll take.
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_008: Say, Doctor, I'll let you in on a secret trick, friend to... maybe furless friend. If you ever get hurt in battle and you need to chug a Potion, set off a Barrel Bomb behind you while you do. Why? It'll stop any baddies getting the pounce on you, that's why!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_009: Terra has new materials. Lots of ores. Very lovely... Maybe I can make a weapon just like that Great Sword in the ice cave back home! For mew, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_010: Meow, meow, lots of... fascinating things in Doctor's room. Want to move them elsewhere, while Doctor's asleep... Smithy! Stay your paw!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_011: On Your Meowjesty's summons, we the Felyne Special Corps... cream of the crop of the Terra Research Commission's Furst Fleet, have arrived! Meowch! Get your hind paws off my head!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_012: What are you doing inside this box, Smithy? Im... Impawssible! It's all moving! How is it done?
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_018: A simple task! I'm a purr-ime leader, after all!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_019: Let's go, 'Hunters!' Put some pep in your step!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_020: Purr-ey spotted. Watch out, Your Meowjesty.
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_027: Taste the flaming soul of a hunter!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_029: Are... Are we out of danger meow? Can I open my eyes yet?
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_030: Absolutely stellar command, Your Meowjesty. That's what I call great gains... mrreow.
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_031: Equipment everywhere... grabbing, all of it. Grabbing and going.
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_032: Good gravy, they're catching up! Run, run like your tail's on fire!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_033: Hauling, hauling... Smithy, why do you drag that meowntain of materials with you everywhere you go?
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_036: What are you doing? Mrrow... right there, please... Hey, save a pet or two for me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4077_palico_CN_042: Ah, Doctor! Fine day to mew!
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_001: I'll protect you, as I've promised. But...it'll take some time before I can read all the words on these documents... Don't worry, I'll get there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_002: You have to be prepared, out in the wastelands. Always carry flint for starting fires, a weapon for self-defense, and fabric to use as a water filter... no flammable items in the office? But, what if there's a power outage?
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_003: Shifu taught us how to fight, how to avoid Catastrophes, how to farm and store food. Now we don't have to drift around in search of water and pasture anymore... Just like you, Doctor, Shifu seemed to know everything. I can't be like you and my Shifu, but I can protect you, so you can help people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_004: Whenever the tribe is on the move, everyone worries whether we'll find a good place to settle down. But people in nomadic cities don't seem concerned at all... Maybe for them, they're not moving in search of a new home, but drifting with the home they have?
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_005: Oripathy is not a rare sight in my tribe. We only think the stones that grow from the skin, they look like the stones we dig out of the earth… There are already so many things that can kill you; why persecute someone for a disease?
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_006: The name 'Anasa' means 'one without roots.' My people say that if you have no attachments, there's nothing that can trouble you. But everyone I've met since I left has something that they are attached to. Me? You mean I'm the same, in how I want to repay my debt? Hmm...
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_007: My name comes from the first Yanese poem my Shifu taught me. It tells of a cloud, 'Yun' in Yanese, that has been drifting for a thousand li, raining across the land, until it finally finds a mountain to rest upon. 'Jie' is the end of that long journey. After all, 'everyone should have a place to call home.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_008: That martial arts master is here too... I thought he was cold and heartless, but now I kind of understand him... a man who has lived for so long and traveled so far can only carry so much. That must be what Shifu thought as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_009: Sometimes you see the clear night sky after a Catastrophe has passed in the distance. Wind blows toward the horizon, and the stars seem so close you could touch them. A bonfire keeps the beasts away, while singing keeps you warm. The wastes are dangerous, but they are not terrible.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_010: Are you retiring for the night? I'll stand watch.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_011: My birth name? Doctor, you understand the Anasa language...? But I would rather continue to use the name 'Jieyun.' Shifu gave me this name, and I like it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_012: The reasons to fight never change much.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_013: I still have a lot to learn after leaving the wastes. I'm willing to do more, if you trust me to. As the Yanese expression goes: a promise is worth a thousand taels of gold.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_014: I haven't thought much about what I will become, but Rhodes Island could become home to many. Thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_017: Yes, I will complete the task you gave me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_018: Stay close. The wastelands are a dangerous place to get lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_019: We're bringing everyone home, safe and sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_020: The wind and sand don't cover all tracks. Something's not right here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_023: Remember those poplars, and you'll always find your way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_024: I'll pile some stones here to mark the trail.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_025: Would you give up after a loss?
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_026: You have invaded someone else's home...
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_027: Your families will be sad if they never see you again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_028: A few more cairns on the barrens.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_029: Will anyone remember them when all this is buried beneath the sand?
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_030: If I could learn from you, Doctor, I could protect my people's lands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_031: Shifu says it isn't important whether or not you achieved what you set out to do, but whether you gave your best without running away. We've done well, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_032: Don't worry, I remember the way that we came. There's time to retreat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_033: I'm used to the darkness... oh, there's the light.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_034: Be careful, Doctor. You don't want to be mistaken for an attacking beast.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_038: For us, the new year isn't a fixed date. It starts when we see the first sprout of spring. Then we drink, sing and celebrate.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_042: Would you like to go out for some fresh air, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_043: This is the seed of the 'Tree of Life and Death.' Flowers appear on its branches in every state of its life cycle, from bud to bloom to decay. None of us can escape the cycle of life and death. Every day is precious. Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4078_bdhkgt_CN_044: The Anasa are used to the cycle of life and death, but here at Rhodes Island, I see many struggle to say farewell to those they love. Home is where you find someone or something you can't let go of... I think I'm beginning to understand...
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_001: Filing documents? I thought that was a job for Little Handy... Well, I can do it myself. I could do a lot worse than chatting with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_002: Ten minutes until ocean current data inflow. I will take four minutes to prepare ink, five minutes to setup the equipment, forty-five seconds to doodle. The last fifteen seconds? Let you remove your hood, of course. Or, what's the difference between a faceless model and a lifeless rock?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_003: The Ægir sleep cycle is not affected by time of day. When inspiration strikes, an artist usually stays up for 50 plus hours without a wink of sleep. As for me, I'm more like you people, except I go to bed when the sun rises. It's eight o'clock already? I'm getting sleepy... Hm, why are you yawning too?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_004: Why do I enjoy chatting with the robot operators, when the Ægir frown upon emulating humanity with machinery? Hehe, because it's fascinating. Besides, my chats actually prompted Closure to upgrade their cognitive modules, ensuring they won't overload. I may take credit for any breakthroughs in that area.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_005: Ever since the Waterway opened, swarms of unsightly seaborns have appeared outside the dome. Truly annoying, to say the least. In all seriousness, though, it's my job to observe, record, and accumulate the data needed to eliminate seaborns once and for all. The more brazen they are, the closer an eye I must keep on them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_006: When the city was evacuated and the darkness crept in, my fear gripped me so tightly that I scribbled something on the dome without even realizing it. Recently, I went back and found that it was a smiling face. It suddenly dawned on me that I should have faced the darkness with a smile way earlier.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_007: There used to be a bunch of seaweed outside the dome, swaying leisurely to its own pace, no matter how fierce the currents. I've long wanted to grow some myself, stirring the water and watching it linger like nothing happened... kind of like you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_008: I modified this communal umbrella using dome technology. Now it can adjust its shape and opacity, and also detect temperature and humidity. But the Engineering Department didn't feel there was any need for it, and wanted me to change it back, because the tentacle-shaped monitoring unit was too scary... Hmm. Say, do you have an umbrella? Do you want to trade?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_009: 'Eventide of the Depths', a volcanic power station that once lit the deep in a red glow... Once the war is over, how about we go see it together? Even if it has been overgrown by Seaborn creep, I'm sure you'd come with me to reawaken it without batting an eyelid, wouldn't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_010: Friendly reminder! Your face will become my canvas if you doze off at work... Wait, you're really asleep? Turn the temperature up two degrees, Little Handy. It wouldn't be any fun if the Doctor caught a cold.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_011: Nice to meet you. I'm from Ægir and my name is... Hmm... Why are you staring at the bottle on my belt? Did you want a sip? Certainly, but I take no responsibility for what happens after you drink this ink.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_012: Pause, please, Doctor. Turn the image so I can see this one's back... What? This 'video' of yours only allows watching from a fixed angle?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_013: Promotion? Have I really done so well? Or do you just really enjoy working with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_014: Another promotion? What's the reason this time...? Extremely precise recommendations based on current movement... Uh-huh. What else? Leveraged her skills in maintenance and repair. Yeah yeah, I agree. C'mon, don't stop the praise, I'm all ears.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_017: Need me for data collection, or dome repair? Neither? You're always so full of surprises.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_018: You want me to be the captain? You'd better give me some interesting teammates.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_019: Come with me, everyone. You'll always know me by the ink bottle I carry.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_021: Take it easy. Haste makes waste.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_023: I'm on the scene. The flow of the currents... Ah… it's a mess.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_024: It's time to teach these rascals a lesson.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_026: Close your eyes, feel the undulating waves... Too bad, you've fallen into my trap.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_027: Aww, look at you, you've got ink all over you again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_028: Say something. It would be sad if you sank into the depths without a sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_029: Defeating a strong foe is satisfying, but don't forget to look up once in a while. See, the sights above… aren't they beautiful?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_030: You carried out the plan without the slightest fumble. Not bad. The Institute of Facility Management would appreciate people like you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_031: A little deviation won't cause any serious issues. I'll stay behind to check for problems.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_032: I know trial-and-error is a painful process. But if you keep knocking yourself like this, I may have to deal with the next job alone, imagine how dull it would be.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_033: Turn on the lights, Little Handy. Hey Little Handy? Hello? Alright, where's the switch...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_034: Well, well, are you asking for a poke in the head?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_036: You can use the ink as you wish, but the mapper? Nah-uh.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_038: My schedule today? Let me check... Huh? You don't work on the first day of the year? Hm, landlubbers do have some strange customs. Alright, let me plan out the day... first, help the Doctor pick a New Year's present.
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_042: You look cheerful. Up to no good?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I've recently come to appreciate the unique beauty of the patterns found on paper currency, and I've drawn a copy of this bill for you. Is it a good imitation? Don't let people see it? Counterfeit money? What does that mean?
dialogue_tracker.char_4079_haini_CN_044: Look who I found. While there's a vibrant party going on, we've got a lonely soul here reading... Oh, foreign languge, I can't understand it. Hmm.. how about this, Doctor? You tell me what the book is about. I'll tell you the patterns and meanings I've garnered. They're hidden in these lines and spaces between those words. Interested?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_001: I can offer you protection, and even handle a little business for you. But you'd better prove it's worth my time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_002: Rhodes Island's work in Lungmen will remain confidential, but I know that your actions saved lives. I've spent a long time trying to gauge just how trustworthy Rhodes Island really is. As for my conclusion, I trust you had no trouble setting up your office in Lungmen?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_003: I'm sure you've been working with Mr. Lee. You can trust the information you get from him, but there are limits to what a private investigator can do. If you need something outside his purview, you come to me. Don't worry, my methods won't send any trouble Rhodes Island's way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_004: I just saw Swire here. It surprised me how she was working so hands-on. If we'd followed the dreams we had as kids, she would've become the head of Lungmen's Chamber of Commerce, and I might be a university lecturer right now. You never know... Hm? No, I don't need to say hello. Given her status, it would be inappropriate for us to be seen in public.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_005: The coat my father always wears is a birthday present I gave him. I'm so used to the dignified airs he puts on, sometimes I even forget that... underneath the coat is an old man growing frailer by the day. Sooner or later, someone will have to stand up and take the weight off his shoulders.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_006: To certain people, the slums are a problem that needs to be solved. To others, this is their home. The shift from 'Slums' to 'Downtown' could take generations to settle. I don't know how far I can carry it myself, but I'll do what I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_007: I've never seen Ch'en onboard Rhodes Island. She has things to do, doesn't she? Hmph, hardly see any merit in recruiting operators like her. It's true that we don't get along very well. But I must admit, she is the one who showed me a different path.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_008: I had nothing to do, so I trimmed the potted plant on your desk a little. No matter how busy life is, we can't forget our aesthetics. Why are you so surprised? The four arts, flower arrangement, tea ceremony... They were all part of my education. You would never have guessed? Whatever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_009: The nightscape here is very different from my childhood memories. Lungmen may be advancing by the day, but it still has its unlit corners... How about we go for a drink together? You can't truly know a city until you've visited its streets during the wee hours.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_010: You can't let them see you exhausted, can you…?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_011: You and I have probably crossed paths before, Doctor, but we finally found time for a formal introduction. There'll be much more done on the problems the Infected face in the Lungmen slums, now that we're working in direct communication.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_012: There are many ways to deal with trouble, and direct confrontation is usually my last choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_013: I sometimes attend ceremonies like these just to make things go smoother. I don't remember how many titles I have. But in the end, I always have to return to the shadows.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_014: I know what I'm doing, and that's all that matters. At the end of the day, not all honors need to be made public, and not all roads need to be trod together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_017: You tell me your ends, just don't ask me my means.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_018: If any of you have any doubts about the target, this is your last chance to pull out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_019: I hope I won't have to explain to you what we mean by 'necessary methods.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_020: It's time to make an example. They'll see what happens when they break the rules.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_024: Let's put them six feet under.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_025: You didn't think. So this is what happens when you cross the line.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_026: You want to talk? Too late for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_027: Give me a reason to let you go. Don't have one? What a pity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_029: It better remain a secret forever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_030: Clean, decent. No one will ever find their remains.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_031: The situation is still salvageable. Leave the rest to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_032: There is always a way to correct a mistake. Don't let anger get the best of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_033: I don't need too much room here, but this place could use some decoration.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_034: You'll need an explanation for what you just did.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_036: Boh loh yau, fresh out of the oven, want one?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. My dad sends out greeting cards to his foreigner friends this time of year. I'm usually the one who writes them. Here, this is for you. You've been pretty busy this year. Good work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_042: I hope you didn't run into any trouble, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_043: You think this glass ornament is pretty...? As long as you like it. It's not that hard to make, actually... Anyway, Happy birthday. If you have time tonight, how about I take you out somewhere for dinner? I'll take you to get real Lungmen food, somewhere Swire's ilk would never know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_044: It's been some time since Rhodes Island and Lungmen first made contact. It took a lot of effort for us to assuage the suspicion we had and build the trust we now share. Fortunately, time has proven that the effort was worth it. Right, I don't like talking about 'trust' per se, but Rhodes Island is an exception.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: I can offer you protection, and even handle a little business for you. But you'd better prove it's worth my time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: Rhodes Island's work in Lungmen will remain confidential, but I know that your actions saved lives. I've spent a long time trying to gauge just how trustworthy Rhodes Island really is. As for my conclusion, I trust you had no trouble setting up your office in Lungmen?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: I'm sure you've been working with Mr. Lee. You can trust the information you get from him, but there are limits to what a private investigator can do. If you need something outside his purview, you come to me. Don't worry, my methods won't send any trouble Rhodes Island's way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: I just saw Swire here. It surprised me how she was working so hands-on. If we'd followed the dreams we had as kids, she would've become the head of Lungmen's Chamber of Commerce, and I might be a university lecturer right now. You never know... Hm? No, I don't need to say hello. Given her status, it would be inappropriate for us to be seen in public.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: The coat my father always wears is a birthday present I gave him. I'm so used to the dignified airs he puts on, sometimes I even forget that... underneath the coat is an old man growing frailer by the day. Sooner or later, someone will have to stand up and take the weight off his shoulders.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: To certain people, the slums are a problem that needs to be solved. To others, this is their home. The shift from 'Slums' to 'Downtown' could take generations to settle. I don't know how far I can carry it myself, but I'll do what I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: I've never seen Ch'en onboard Rhodes Island. She has things to do, doesn't she? Hmph, hardly see any merit in recruiting operators like her. It's true that we don't get along very well. But I must admit, she is the one who showed me a different path.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: I had nothing to do, so I trimmed the potted plant on your desk a little. No matter how busy life is, we can't forget our aesthetics. Why are you so surprised? The four arts, flower arrangement, tea ceremony... They were all part of my education. You would never have guessed? Whatever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: The nightscape here is very different from my childhood memories. Lungmen may be advancing by the day, but it still has its unlit corners... How about we go for a drink together? You can't truly know a city until you've visited its streets during the wee hours.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: You can't let them see you exhausted, can you…?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: You and I have probably crossed paths before, Doctor, but we finally found time for a formal introduction. There'll be much more done on the problems the Infected face in the Lungmen slums, now that we're working in direct communication.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: There are many ways to deal with trouble, and direct confrontation is usually my last choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: I sometimes attend ceremonies like these just to make things go smoother. I don't remember how many titles I have. But in the end, I always have to return to the shadows.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: I know what I'm doing, and that's all that matters. At the end of the day, not all honors need to be made public, and not all roads need to be trod together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_017: You tell me your ends, just don't ask me my means.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: If any of you have any doubts about the target, this is your last chance to pull out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: I hope I won't have to explain to you what we mean by 'necessary methods.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: It's time to make an example. They'll see what happens when they break the rules.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_024: Let's put them six feet under.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_025: You didn't think. So this is what happens when you cross the line.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: You want to talk? Too late for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: Give me a reason to let you go. Don't have one? What a pity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: It better remain a secret forever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: Clean, decent. No one will ever find their remains.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: The situation is still salvageable. Leave the rest to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: There is always a way to correct a mistake. Don't let anger get the best of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: I don't need too much room here, but this place could use some decoration.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: You'll need an explanation for what you just did.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Boh loh yau, fresh out of the oven, want one?
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. My dad sends out greeting cards to his foreigner friends this time of year. I'm usually the one who writes them. Here, this is for you. You've been pretty busy this year. Good work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: I hope you didn't run into any trouble, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: You think this glass ornament is pretty...? As long as you like it. It's not that hard to make, actually... Anyway, Happy birthday. If you have time tonight, how about I take you out somewhere for dinner? I'll take you to get real Lungmen food, somewhere Swire's ilk would never know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4080_lin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: It's been some time since Rhodes Island and Lungmen first made contact. It took a lot of effort for us to assuage the suspicion we had and build the trust we now share. Fortunately, time has proven that the effort was worth it. Right, I don't like talking about 'trust' per se, but Rhodes Island is an exception.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_001: Coming, coming! Warmy coming in with warmth! Huh...? Sheesh, Doctor! No calling me a little potlid like Lanns!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_002: Doctor, do you smell that? Hehe, it's the smell of my sweet pear and vegetables soup, slow cooked to perfection! I said it before, I'm gonna cook the best meals to cure everyone's Oripathy! Huff, huff—It's not so hot anymore. Give it a try, won'tcha? If you don't, everyone else will eat it right up!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_003: Rhodes Island is such a big, biiiig transport, and it has a kinda different furnace than the one at the factory... Oh, I just went to the engine level. The boiler man there thought I was lost and took me back up. I was fine down there, though. I'm used to the heat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_004: Come, Doctor. Hurry up and eat. No need to worry about me. It cheers me right up to see people enjoying their food. Aw, you still want to share with me? Okay, I'll clean this plate! Om nom nom... Wha? You were just picking out things you don't want to eat? Well alright then.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_005: I made this bracelet from bottle tree leaves. I can keep them fresh for a short while. Hehe, didn't think my Arts could be used like this, did you? Oh, Don't worry, it'll only be for a short while. I won't keep it going for too long, or they'll get tired, too. We should let them be. The withering will come slowly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_006: Dad liked to collect the carrots we had left to carve into small animals. Doctor, do you think Ray will like this carrot sandbeast? Ah! I think I carved a little too deep. I'm still not very good at this, not like Dad. If only he'd taught me a bit longer...
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_007: Doctor, look! The lady at Medical gave me a plaster with pears on it! Rhodes Island has so many Infected. It's the same back home, but we didn't live so well. And I had nowhere to go... Doctor, Is it a bad thing to be an Infected?
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_008: Deep in the pitch darkness, those warm breaths slowly got colder...' That's how Ray told her sandbeast stories. I've heard the workers saying stuff like that ever since the accident. They were kind of hard to understand at first, but I know what they mean now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_009: Yeah, it hurts a lot when my Oripathy flares up. And I'm worried I could go out of control, too. Huff... Hufffff... Doctor, want to try a bite of stewed pear? It doesn't cure Oripathy, but it's sweet. When life's all hard and bitter, we need something sweet! Hehe, does it taste good? Alright, I'll take this to Lanns now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_010: Doctor? Are you feeling warmer? Have a good sleep now. I'm right here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_011: Nice to see you again, Doctor. Do you miss Billy stew? I was just heading to the aft kitchen with Lanns— Hey! I'm not a little potlid. Don't call me Potlid!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_012: Whoa... Did you command all these battles, Doctor? You're amazing…
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_013: I-I got promoted? Does that mean I can ask Closure to buy some more authentic ingredients?
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_014: Thanks for your recognition, Doctor! I'll do what I can to bring even more warmth to the people! Um... Actually, what I mean is... I'm glad I can help out!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_018: Huh? I'm the head chef today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_020: They're not part of a good breakfast!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_024: This place feels a little too cool…
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_029: Everyone did such a great job... I'll make a big stew to reward them!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_030: Hm—Smells so good. Today was another huge success!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_031: We spilled a lot out of the pot. What a shame...
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_032: I wasn't paying attention, it's all burnt...
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_033: This room's so warm… Hm? You can adjust the temperature with this panel?
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_036: I'm not— Okay, if it's what you want to call me, Doctor, then no worries. I am a little potlid.
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! Do you want to go up to the deck to watch the fireworks together? Uh... It's not Arts. It's real fireworks. Everybody at Rhodes Island pitched in to make it happen! Shh—Do you hear that?
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_042: Doctor, are you eating good today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Lanns and I made you a carrot cake...! You've already got lots of cake from the others? Then... Huh? You could eat a few slices and share the rest with Amiya and Savage? That's great! I'll light some candles!
dialogue_tracker.char_4081_warmy_CN_044: When I was still small, I had so, so many wishes, but Dad only ever wished for me to grow up happily... Now I understand. I need to be happy first, then I'll wait for my other wishes to slowly come true. Doctor, you need to make sure you'll be happy during this new year onboard Rhodes Island, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_001: I may not be at your side all the time. But don't worry, when you need me, I will be there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_002: Logistics permits, equipment approvals, mission evaluations... Rhodes Island has too much red tape. While recklessness does tend to get you in trouble, being overcautious also gets on people's nerves. Let's keep it simple. If anything comes up, you tell me directly. I'll decide what to do from there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_003: I heard the Grandmaster also came to Rhodes Island? Don't worry, I won't pick a fight; but he must be curious if my skills have improved since I left Yumen... Come to think of it, after walking such a long road, he really should be taking it easy. And yet, he still pushes himself into a life of conflict. The same goes for you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_004: My dad hated the snow. Snow keeps the doors shut, ruining 'business' for his river fort. That's why he gave me this name. 'Qiu' for hatred, 'Bai' for the white of snow. People always find something to blame for their misfortunes: snow, storms, calamities natural or manmade. As for me, I happened to be born on a snowy day, that's all there is to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_005: I've seen some die in vain, some turn to crime, and others drive their friends and loved ones to despair… Justice is rare upon this cruel land, and eking out a living is always difficult. But there is no excuse for evil. Never has been, never will be.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_006: The conflicts I can resolve with my sword are actually the simple ones. Unfortunately, most are as a great river surging forth, sweeping up all the sand and silt in its path until it turns into an unstoppable murky mess. I may encounter more places like that small mountain village. And I can't say for certain that I will do better next time. But good is good, and evil is evil. One may not confuse them, and I will find my own way to distinguish the two.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_007: You'd like me to demonstrate my swordsmanship to the operators? Doctor, it's not something you can learn by watching. I know a scribe who served as the Grandmaster's record keeper. He followed the Grandmaster for over a decade. After years of observation, he could nitpick nearly any kung fu style under Heaven. And yet, he is weak to this day. A stiff breeze could blow him over... Anyway, I do happen to have some spare time. So I'll show you all a few moves.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_008: The sharper the blade, the easier it is to break. The same goes for hatred in one's heart... It's easy to understand. But the hard part is, you must first face that which lies in your heart before you can really let it go. I have both hatred and gratitude toward the Grandmaster. The hatred, I paid back how I saw fit; the gratitude, I will hold as close. That is all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_009: The tumult in Yumen is done, and there's no more reason for me to be there. And the home that I came from is nothing but a river now. In short, I've become the 'one without roots.' But, being rootless is not all bad, as it's led me here to you and Rhodes Island. There will always be a place where my sword comes in handy.  The land under Heaven is vast, and my fate will mark the grave for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_010: A rare bit of fine weather, a rare bit of leisure.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_011: Dr. {@nickname}, I am Qiubai. I can't say for certain how long I will stay at Rhodes Island, but every meeting is a stroke of fortune. I trust we'll get along just fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_012: When I was in Yumen, the Grandmaster would also review recordings of my every battle. For us practitioners of kung fu, having someone to provide feedback is always a good thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_013: Why wield a sword? To combat injustice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_014: I've seen a certain type of fowlbeast in the Gobi to the north of Yan. Their habitat is on the verge of disappearing. So they fly in groups, wet their bodies with water from afar, then bring it back home... If even beasts can go to such an extent, there must be more we can do as people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_018: Very well. Let's walk this path together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_019: Don't waste too much energy on the road.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_020: Don't bother telling me your names.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_023: A true battlefield. This is the right place to settle things.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_024: Dew falls heavy, grass bends low. Something's not right.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_025: Your hostile intent is all too clear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_026: No blade has mercy. Brace yourself!
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_027: And this is your excuse for evil?
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_029: Let's go, Doctor. Time to head back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_030: Even to the very end, I do not know why those people drew their blades... Perhaps, even they did not know themselves.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_031: Let it be. No sword technique is perfect, just as no outcome is flawless. We shouldn't get too fixated on fighting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_032: Even a technique you have executed a thousand times can fail. Don't focus too much on winning and losing, Doctor, you did what you could.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_033: Were you the one who decorated this room? No, nothing. I am a jianghu wanderer, and we are not picky.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_034: I'll write this off as a little joke. But, next time...
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_036: Doctor, why don't you come practice the blade with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_038: In Yan, even those who struggle the most will find ways to gift clothes to their children on this day, praying for a bountiful harvest in the coming year. No matter where you are, parting with the old and welcoming the new is a good notion. Only by letting go of bygones can we move forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_042: Doctor, remember to practice your kung fu.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_043: Doctor, I recently made a trip back to Yan, and brought this for you... It's just rice wine from the common folk of Jiangnan. It's not meant to be a keepsake. Pop open the seal, and let's share a drink or two.
dialogue_tracker.char_4082_qiubai_CN_044: Doctor, I plan to stay here a while longer. The path before Rhodes Island seems long indeed, and I'm curious as to where it will lead. But we all know this land is unpredictable, so just give it our all, and live freely as we can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_001: Are these the documents you need to mail? Alright, let me check them off.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_002: There's a letter for you from the Lungmen slums, Doctor. A former patient? Your expression tells me pretty much exactly what's in this letter.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_003: I use this sword to fight beasts that slip into the village, as well as bandits and thieves. For beasts, it's just a matter of driving them away. But people,  it's hard to keep them from going astray.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_004: There are villages that don't even appear on maps, relying on Messengers to communicate. I used to follow the ones who came to my village around, and even learned my first words from the stuff written on envelopes. But I had to grow up before I learned how much those few words meant.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_005: I once went back to the village where I grew up. All I found was a few abandoned huts and fields. The people who lived there probably found new lives in the cities. But sometimes I wonder, if I had worked harder, would they have stayed?
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_006: You know, I haven't been to that many places. I've wandered between the mountains and cities, and seen people suffering from hardship, helplessness, and stress... This is a vast land, but how many people live in its nameless corners from birth to death, with no one ever to know they existed?
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_007: The villagers didn't kick me out when they learned I had Oripathy, but still I couldn't go back to my old life. No, getting infected was my own responsibility. It'd be too full of myself to say I got Infected to help people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_008: I'm still looking for the young man's family. My words were too harsh... I didn't know his name, even at the very end of it. Superficial as it might have been, he came down for a taste of our harsh lives and recorded it. There's meaning in that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_009: I've seen many people wait at the village entrance, hoping for a letter from their families. I've seen all sorts of emotions on their faces when they opened the letters. Messengers carry little slivers of people's lives. That's got nothing to do with me, and everything too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_010: What a beautiful sunset. The weather tomorrow should be fine and clear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_011: Hi there, Are you the Doctor that's in charge here? I heard I could get treatment for Oripathy in exchange for work here... Oh, right, just call me Wind Chimes. It's a name that represents hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_012: I'd rather not get into fights while making deliveries...
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_013: All I did was carry out my duties as a Messenger... Anyway, leave it to me if you have a job like that again. I won't let you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_014: Many more people are waiting for hopeful news. Doctor, let's walk this path together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_017: As long as there's a destination, there's a way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_018: I'll make sure everyone arrives safely.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_019: The road is long. Walk slowly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_023: Bare mountains, dirt n' dust... all familiar sights.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_024: A long path through tall mountains… Stay alert.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_025: Leave now and I'll act like I never saw you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_026: I never wanted to point this blade at anyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_027: There are people waiting for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_028: Don't keep pushing down the wrong path…
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_029: No matter how far the destination, you will get there one day, as long as you keep moving forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_030: I'm happy to bring news of victory, but I would rather avoid conflict like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_031: The goods are still here. Let's hope those who ran away will learn and repent.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_032: Let's rest and regroup. We can take back what we lost later.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_033: It's good to have a place to rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_036: Careful, I just got back and I'm covered in dust…
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_038: Happy holidays, Doctor. I would love to invite you to villages of my homeland, if there's a chance... We open up the granaries at the end of the year, and celebrate it with spirits that we brewed in the autumn... Scenes like that are rare these days.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. This bowl of chang shou mian is a recipe from my hometown, just drizzle them with some scallion oil, and add some stir-fry... simple to make, but lingers on the tongue. Did you like it? I'm glad. Here's to your good health for another year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4083_chimes_CN_044: People who live in the distant corners of the land are often forgotten, but what Rhodes Island is doing has helped many of them. I want to thank you for that, Dr. {@nickname}.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_001: You can keep me in the shadows. My KIA status comes in handy, so no running your mouth about me being here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_002: ...I'd put down that tray, if I were you. It's one of W's 'wake-up calls' she makes for all of us. The woman's brain's like those wilds around Kazdel, taken by her overgrown madness by the year. And anyone who trusts a lunatic like her... Heh, is probably just as insane.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_003: There was one who hoped to flee the war, but only ended up sinking deeper and deeper into its quagmire. Heh, Pathetic, isn't it? But that's exactly how we live. We either give up and resign ourselves to death, or... we kill this very way of life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_004: Your eyes aren't deceiving you. Yes, it's a sewing kit. A needle drinks as much blood as a sword, in the hands of a merc. Besides… it's a tall order to look decent on battlefield, and a smart cookie like you should know that well, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_005: On the northern side of Kazdel... is a birch forest. Those gray and white trees wither in the frigid wind, then struggle to regain their vitality the following year. But when the last trees died, they had no idea that spring would never come back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_006: 'For all the people to fall into peaceful slumber?' Not half bad for a fancy dream of yours. I only hope people could have a chance to struggle on in the face of war and death, and perhaps after that, some energy leftover to hold a grudge. That is why I'm signing this agreement with Babel… with you, Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_007: Those faint lights out the window... They're campfires in the wilderness. W says I like campfires? Hehe, that's because the shadows under the fire don't lie. I see myself in them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_008: A merc who lived her life staring death in the face, but chose to die for a pipe dream in the end… Sounds like a bad joke, doesn't it? But if you had to make sense of it, the merc probably hopes her death could be more than a sneaky battlefield tactic. That's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_009: My eyes tell me that this ship, that doctor, Her Majesty, and you... have all changed. W thinks you're too good of an actor. She doesn't want to admit it, but she's changed a lot too. It's not like there's anything we could do about it anyway. The shadows beneath our feet keep getting longer and longer.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_010: ...Your dreams are a lot more peaceful than I expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_011: Ascalon showed you my files. Messenger or mercenary, you ask? Doesn't matter. I'm not after your life for now , 'Doctor.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_012: Are you sure I need to watch these? Back in Kazdel, you used to lead my people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_013: Hmph, great. Even in the middle of a war, you people still insist on these goddamned ceremonies.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_014: For us mercs, life is war, and war is life. The only escape is death. Our struggle will never end, as long as we live.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_017: Getting this crew together wasn't easy. You better make them count.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_018: W, on my team? Whatever, I'm just wondering what crap she's up to this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_019: Let's see... Which insect is falling into my trap?
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_021: I know what to do. Don't order me around.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_026: Nothing can mask the scent of despair.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_028: I will sink your corpse into shadow. No one will find it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_029: You always win, just like the old days. But this time, your joy is real.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_030: Take a breather and tally up your losses. Nothing worth celebrating here, we might be dead in a second or two.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_031: Wow, you kept everyone alive. Congrats.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_032: ...An arm, an eye, or maybe something else. More than enough to trade for a few enemy heads. Or, would you rather bear the price of failure? Tch, suit yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_033: 'Rhodes Island'... This landship sure has gotten a lot brighter.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_034: Not the safest way to say hello.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_036: If you want to make small talk, Hoederer's your guy. Or... I guess you'd rather stand here in silence with me for a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_038: ...A New Year's gathering? Choosing a specific day to get together is basically begging the enemy to ambush you. I... Well, whatever. Tell Hoederer I'm going. I have to keep an eye on W, in case she decides to do something stupid again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_042: Ascalon forced me to take this 'bodyguard' gig. Pick your jaw up off the ground, Doctor. You'll be seeing a lot more of me for a while.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_043: For us mercs, getting older isn't a thing to celebrate. You pick up more scars, and your value goes down. If there's anything worth celebrating, it's the fact that our victories were able to buy us another year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4087_ines_CN_044: You've tied so many different kinds of landmines together, and you can barely keep them from exploding. Now that's something I have to hand to you. Rhodes Island is a whole lot crazier than any band of mercs I've ever known.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_001: Why is this history book only half-written? Because it is waiting to be filled with the wars yet to come. Those Sarkaz who march off to their deaths will be nothing but footnotes. Speak your mind, Doctor. You might just as well leave behind some unique commentary on this segment of history.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_002: I was the one who killed Scout. We made a 'transaction,' then I jammed my sword through through his heart. Mercenaries like us could put a price on anything. Hmph, the most unfair part of the deal was that I had to keep on living.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_003: A pathetic soul looking to crawl up out of the quagmire? Ines is right. Still, when the mire wanted to drag me under, I realized there was no escape. For most Sarkaz, they'd find only hatred-borne victories to swallow when they're hungry for revenge. But I refuse to believe it's the way it should be, and I won't stop finding for us a true path to freedom.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_004: When I was young, my mother taught me to read and write Sarkaz. I still remember that volume of 'Qui'lon's Expedition' she kept on her, its ink smudged with some guy's blood... She died of Oripathy. As for the book, it's gonna carry our hopes and tears, until time wears it out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_005: While I was in prison, I liked to kill time by debating a scholar, an old Feline in the next cell over. Our conversations usually ended with him trying to prove that Victoria was more civilized than Kazdel. Eventually, he failed to prove it before the Sarkaz guards executed him. I should say it's not something I feel happy about.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_006: Most of the Sarkaz history books I collected have been lost. Whether burned to ash or cast aside in action like worthless scraps, their whereabouts hardly piqued anyone else's curiosity. But... for better or for worse, we have other ways to remember history.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_007: No, it's nothing... Fine, 'Introduction to Accounting Practice,' borrowed it from the library. Ines says that all you need to know to open a shop is how to collect money and give change, and now I'm a little surprised to find out she's right. Well, I won't call this a waste of effort. At the very least...there's no harm in having some idle thoughts.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_008: Can you guess who made these salted potatoes? W, Yeah. Hard to believe, huh? She actually cooks a lot more than Ines does. Try one, they're not bad. Mercenaries are good at taking lives, but there's a limit to one's energy. To hone our craft, we have to set aside everything else.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_009: What were you like back then? My lips are sealed, Doctor. Oftentimes, getting to forget is a gift. Make no mistake, I'm not suggesting you were a good person or some kind of bastard. People always expect things to 'return to the way they were,' whether it's about circumstances or people. However, amnesia won't give anyone a clean restart of life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_010: Seems like a lifetime ago...  Only that room with the swaying white curtains is long gone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_011: A nostalgic place, Doctor. As for this commission of yours, I trust we can both set aside its details for the moment. I do have some other ideas on the rewards, though, beyond the bounty itself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_012: Is this your upgraded training regimen? Hmm, it's definitely safer for the masses, but I'd do better with something more direct.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_013: I don't need these, Doctor. But if you insist on some sort of reward... you think I could teach a class to the children here in my free time? No, not to teach military history. I just want to share with them... some Sarkaz folk songs.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_014: Medals and titles give people an illusion of some kind of irreplaceable responsibility. Most times, though, it begets nothing but ruination. That's true for 'elite,' 'leader,' 'king'... and even 'the Lord of Fiends.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_017: If conflict is unavoidable, a swift end is a form of mercy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_018: I only hope this is temporary. It's not really my thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_027: The battlefield's all around you. Where do you think you're running?
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_029: One great victory isn't enough to tip the balance, but it can buy you a moment of respite. You may catch a breath now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_030: A single military victory means nothing in the face of what we're putting a stop to.  This is just a nuisance we've cleared aside.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_031: Why the long face, Doctor? Our heads are still sitting on our shoulders. As for them, don't worry, I'll take care of that for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_032: Less guys on your case isn't such a bad thing, is it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_033: Ines and W? They're here too?
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_034: You… Anything else you want to know?
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_036: I don't have time for small talk. If you want fun and games, go look for W. Huh, so I'm not the only one who just got kicked out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_038: Fireworks at the New Year's party? Looks like you folks are giving W a perfect opportunity to indulge herself. Oh, I'll take care of that... Call Ines over too. Can't let her stay hidden during times like these, she'll force me to clean up the mess myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_042: Didn't see you there. I was just... thinking about the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_043: Most Sarkaz... don't put a whole lot of stock in the process of getting older. They may forget a lot across the span of their long lives, but if you carefully listen to the way they describe the many oddities of life, you'll quickly find that the one thing never missing is the chapter in commemoration of suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_4088_hodrer_CN_044: Babel was once the ideal home of the Sarkaz sailing the ruins. Her Highness thought she failed, but you're proof that the road hasn't reached its end. It continues to stretch on... I really hope to see what you'll show us, when all is said and done, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_001: Can I go live in here? I'm not really comfortable having a whole crowd standing around watching me stream, so I'd feel way more at ease in your office... Besides, I'm your assistant now anyway, heehee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_002: Doctor, I got to thinking that the stream incident might not have been a totally bad thing. After all, I got to know so many nice people ready to lend a helping hand, and you too... Shoot! I forgot to turn off my mic–– Yes, and all of you as well! With your support, I'll break out of this funk!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_003: I need to decompress after that stream... Games? Doctor, were you even watching my stream? Chat wouldn't stop making fun of how much I suck. I don't wanna play another game this whole week... And that's why I need to practice every day? Uhh... I guess you have a point there?
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_004: Awwgh, it's so frustrating! How come a clip of me tripping over my words gets so many more views than all my VODs combined? I really don't understand viewers these days... Look, Doctor, what's so funny about this compilation of my brain-far—you just laughed, right? You totally laughed just now!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_007: I won an award the first time I did a solo show. Pretty lucky, huh? What, don't believe me? Look right here, 'Awarded to the employee who stayed put until the end of the show during an earthquake'! Getting hit by an earthquake hit during your debut sounds unlucky? Ah-Ahaha...
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_008: I used to work my butt off every day so I could make more money, then shop more and shop better. But you know, when I use fancy concealer to hide my eye bags, I sometimes wanna cry... Oh, uh, s-speaking of crying, getting fired from the TV station made me want to cry a lot more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_009: When I get up there to face my audience, the only advantage I have is the angle of my camera. But you, Doctor... You're the only one who watches my stream in person. You're my most special, and most unique audience. Ahem, it would be even nicer if you tossed a little dono my way~
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_010: Hello. You looking for the Doctor? What? No, no bother at all. The Doctor's fast asleep, and I'm just eating some dry instant noodles. Want a chunk?
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_011: Hello everyone, this is your omnipotent streamer, Eure—Errrr, sorry, scratch that. Rhodes Island operator, U-official! Reporting in, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_012: Doctor, I'm not gonna sugarcoat it. No matter how many vids like this I watch, I won't learn how to fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_017: Go to war? Me?! This has to be a dream…
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_018: And you're giving me command of the squad to boot? This dream sure is funny, haha...
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_019: Well, since this is a dream anyway, I will mop up all the enemies for you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_020: Bow down before the true master! Wooooo-wata! Scared now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_021: Heehee, mind sending me the instructions... in a superchat?
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_022: Your streamer is in perfect condition and ready to go live!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_024: Just treat it like a regular stream? I'll try!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_025: Ah, ah, mic check! Can everyone hear me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_026: Let me know what you think in chat!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_027: Next up, time to read the comments!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_028: Dear viewer, for your aggressive behavior, you've been permabaned from the channel! Oh no!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_029: The battle's over, so why haven't I woken up from my dream yet... What? This isn't a dream? Then, how come I'm not hurt at all?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_030: Phew, it's finally over... Time to get a good night's sleep. I hope I don't have any more weird dreams about war.
