dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_031: Hey you guys running off there, don't forget to tell your friends and family about me. Thank you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_032: Waahhh… this is the worst ending to a stream I could've imagined…
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_033: Can I use this place as the backdrop for my next stream? No? Fine, I'll try someplace else then.
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_034: Don't jumpscare me like that! A monster just pushed me into the pit, now I have to do a 'no death run'…
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_036: I'm done streaming, Doctor. Wanna take a walk around the deck?
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_038: New Year's Special: Exploring flavor across the lands! Instant noodles inspired by the delicacies of each country! First up is this pack of Kjerag red-braised–– Hey, why's my viewer count dropping?! Don't leave, guys! I was just kidding!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_042: Thanks for letting me stream from your office, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_043: Happy birthday to you~ Happy birthday to you~! I hope all of our friends out there celebrating birthdays today will enjoy eternal happiness! I'm gonna end stream slightly earlier this time, so see you guys tomorrow!
dialogue_tracker.char_4091_ulika_CN_044: Back in Dossoles, the TV station would throw a year end party, but I never knew these could be so chill until I came to Rhodes Island... Huh? Are you talking to me? You want me to sing? Sure, but let me get this out of the way first– my musical tastes are pretty old-fashioned.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_001: If I become your assistant, Closure won't be able to touch me anymore, yes? I'm aware of her extreme interest in me, but her planned modifications on my body are both ridiculous and unacceptable. They're an insult to a scientist, and I won't allow it even in my current form.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_002: Why would humanity grow horns and tails? This stage of biological evolution is past my parameters of understanding... I know tens of thousands of years have passed— Kal'tsit has mentioned this countless times. Hmm, I will need a bit more time to formulate my deduction.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_003: Closure wanted me to sound like a 'thirty-year-old rock band vocalist with a raspy voice,' but my original body was already twice that age... at least, that's what my final memories tell me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_004: Let's stop here for today, Doctor. I have to go over to Kal'tsit's office. She must be needlessly burning the midnight oil again. A soul, driven by her sheer sense of mission to trudge on for tens of thousands of years, just to stop what exactly? It would be better for her to get more sleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_007: Doctor, don't look at me the same way you do Castle-3 and the others. They are very... cute. But my robot body is just like your hood, merely a sort of costume... a style. I know who I am, and thus you and I are more alike.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_008: I'm not arrogant, but I am angry at your ignorance and lack of self-awareness, angry at your self-righteousness, all of you. Yes, I've lost all my knowledge, so you can take this anger as merely a 'result' of my 'calculations,' and a very clear result at that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_009: My wife, daughter, and the rest of my people are eternally resting in those sarcophagi, and will never wake up again. I've made many decisions, I'm well aware. But all I remember is that final dinner, where everyone bid me farewell, and prayed that the subsequent odyssey would go smoothly...
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_010: Doctor, are you free? I hope you might take me out for a walk.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_011: Hello there, I am Friston. That's right, just 'Friston,' not 'Friston-3' or whatever. I am not a replica, and very much less a reproduction of a replica. I hope you understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_012: This is valuable research material. I shall require a copy for myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_017: Doctor, which sector do you need me to take charge of?
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_018: Am I to lead everyone and find a new direction...? Very well, I won't let them down this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_019: Let's go. This is also a new journey.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_021: I will relay our combat strategies to THRM-EX and Lancet-2.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_022: I am naturally capable of more than THRM-EX and the others. I will shield them on the front line.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_023: As long as I'm still standing, no one will come to harm.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_025: Are you all staring at my expression doodle?
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_026: Your behaviors have been recorded and archived.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_027: Where's your leader? I need to talk!
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_028: What a disgrace... these ugly creatures.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_029: Doctor, your thinking routines and command style are very much distinct and different from the others... I guess some things never change.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_030: I still remember the duty I bear, but I must admit, I am no longer able to fulfill it, let alone execute it as well as you do. You have my respect, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_031: An odyssey will always have nigh-avoidable accidents, and a plan might always go wrong. They may be painful to accept... but what else can I do except accept them?
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_032: If the worst possible outcome is turning into something like me, then there is nothing to be afraid of. Doctor, you should evacuate first, and leave the rest to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_033: I would like to stack all of my borrowed ecological research materials over here. I trust there will be no issues with that?
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_034: You should have observed my expression doodle. Currently, it's 'anger'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_036: I've taken a photo of you, Doctor. You want to see it? Sorry, I've already saved it to my archives.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_038: The point of festivals is to wallow in nostalgia and longing. I wish you happiness, Doctor. It's a pity that I no longer have a past to miss, and no future worth anticipating... Oh? 'Justice Knight,' THRM-EX, what you doing? Doctor, did you call them over?
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Now, I would like to use this chance to once again declare the following: Do not celebrate my birthday on the 13th of November, that is the production date of 'Friston-3,' not the birthday of Friston.
dialogue_tracker.char_4093_frston_CN_044: I know that Kal'tsit keeps bringing up these 'incidents' I have no recollection of, hoping that I will gradually come to accept them. I understand my current situation, and I will stay with Rhodes Island. But for the future, I hope that I can find the answer myself... and not just through a 'calculation.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_001: Hm, by the way, may I ask who was your previous assistant? No, I'm not snooping or anything. It's just... There's not much I can do for you here, besides offer my quiet thoughts on the occasional poem.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_002: I see what you're hiding behind your back. Be at ease, I know very well that Leithanien needs a citizen to heighten her glory in foreign lands. Kazimierz, on the other hand, needs a scandal-plagued knight of self-professed purity. Both are as plain as day. Besides, that issue of The Red Wine is outdated. Their kinds never run short of personalities to gossip over.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_003: The wind can get very strong up on the decks. Perhaps you should change into something warmer. Me? I'm just dressing this place up as a certain city of greenery and shade in my imagination. The one where the gentle breeze blew from lands unknown, and the blacksmith's rhythmic hammering sounded the passage of time... Those days were brief. So brief, they are worth remembering.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_004: 'Droste' is my mother's maiden name. It is a common name with no place in the spires. How long would you stay in an alley full of marigolds, Doktor? Very few would grace their proses and stanzas with these forbidden blossoms, but they're really beautiful... To be honest, I'm surprised you actually remembered my full name, Doktor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_005: Poetry is charming as a respite from grammatical convention. It is a search for the most fitting of expressions in the most irrational.  The Candle Knight, who upholds virtue, and Viviana, who loves poetry... I have been a contradiction since the very beginning.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_006: Tales about foreign lands usually end with the traveler returning home. I was always preparing to return to Leithanien, but even after having experienced so much, my truest imp ression of the place remains in the candlelit books on those dark nights. I've seen the people I wanted to see, and I've made my choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_007: Look. What is it the candle lights here? Our faces? Lines of poetry that no one reads? Or the dark and mired path ahead of us? I guess you've always been able to see them, even without my candlelight. Right then, rest your eyes upon me. Don't let the light distract your gaze.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_008: I returned to that small, dark chamber in the spire and spoke to the little girl within. I told her that she will endure a lifetime of slander, suffer regrets that cannot be undone, and be trapped in a cycle of endless pursuit and loss… Yes, farewells feel the same as a dream. Do you find me, as I am in this moment, real enough?
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_009: 'If you and I were notes from one stanza, on which instrument are we strung? And what player has us in his hand?' Oh, I knew you would come. Have you finished reading the poems I gave you? Let me guess. I couldn't possibly share the image of your beloved, and it must lie within the most uplifting cantata.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_010: Mein Tag war heiter, glücklich meine Nacht.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_011: Greetings. Margaret told me about you.  It's a shame we didn't have a chance to meet in the Grand Knight Territory… They called me 'The Candle Knight' at the time. You can call me Viviana, Doktor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_012: Watching my own fights through a screen... For a moment, I thought I was still in Kazimierz.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_013: Are you going to grant me a title as well? There's no need for that, but it probably won't matter anyway. This place is no arena.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_014: Can I interpret this as... your hope that I will stay?
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_017: I, Viviana Droste, shall wield candle and blade to win victories in your name.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_018: Um, truth be told, the General Chamber of Commerce's spokesmen kept complaining that I didn't care much about my own matches.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_019: Let us move. A timely departure paves the way for an early return.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_020: Moonlight barely laid upon the breezy parterre, yet you've witnessed the entirety of autumn?
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_021: I listen, to this passing silence.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_022: I wait, for that belated serenity.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_023: This is no arena. No scars will be remembered or awarded.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_024: Leave. This is my last suggestion.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_025: Why obsess over rhymes? Poetry is woven with the thread of ideas.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_027: Alas, but tying your legs together won't make you fly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_028: Let time rest upon this unlit night.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_029: Tired already, Doktor? Me too. The last time I had such an unforgettable bout was that match I fought in Kawalerielki.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_030: Doktor, you're right. Words that shake one's soul always come from within the storm.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_031: Even the most uninspiring poetry may contain a few lines that tug at our hearts. Despite the regrettable techniques employed, I can't help but approve of the writer's expression.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_032: Doktor, accept this temporary lapse in creativity and remember how this moment feels. I'm still looking forward to the completion of this sonnet.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_033: No bathtub...? Never mind. Just a little joke.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_034: Hmm, who is there? Whatever. I already knew it was you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_036: Doktor, if the candle goes out, I can't say for sure what might happen next.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_038: Every year, my father spent the New Year with the nobles of the territory, and everyone who lived nearby were given their rewards. That was when I could finally speak loudly in my room. No one was ever there to notice me, and I paid no mind to the boisterousness outside, either... I was still young, but I still remember.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_042: Hmm, Doktor, what are you muttering there? I won't force you to recite any poems. But you have read them, have you not?
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_043: Come read with me, Doctor. Ever since I came here, I've rarely found myself so agitated that I couldn't read. Oh, right. If you find any books that interest you, please feel free to take them when you leave, even though you gave me plenty of them... Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4098_vvana_CN_044: People often say that the era we live in has no need for poetry. They claim it cannot provide leisure, and it is loathed for certain men's pretentious elegance. But there is someone who once proved to me the value of 'reminders.' In that case, I wish to walk with you to remind this era, with a candle, and a poem.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_001: Oh, thank you so much, Doc! Why am I thanking you? Heehee, because you just signed… MY PAID LEAVE APPLICATION!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_002: I used to be a troublemaker for hire. People PAY for my epic pranks. The coalition government, the Singas, True Bolívar. I don't care who I work for. Sometimes, I even work both sides. I take care of one job on my way to one place, and the other on the way back. Jajaja! All that ruckus, it was glorious!!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_003: Here, some corn bugles. Want some? No, no! You can't just throw them in your mouth. Where are your manners? Give me your hand, let me show you. First, you put them on each of your fingertips like that, then—Om! Hehe! Thanks for the food!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_004: You call this a weapon? Hahaha, that's so funny. I call it 'Twirly-twirl.' It's a toy my mama made for me. You can throw it out like this, and then it comes back. What? It's too destructive? That's the fun part.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_005: I've been pretty playful ever since I was a kid. I had enough tricks up my sleeve to turn the tables on the bullies, even pulled a few dukats out of them sometimes. I mean, come on, you need a thrill like that to really feel alive. But here you are, working your butt off all day long. Aren't you bored?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_006: Can't hear the rain in here at all.... You know, Doctor, back when I was a kid, rainy days meant I couldn't go out to play. All I could do was stay in mama's workshop, helping her count screws, and listening to the pitter-patter of rain on the sheetmetal roof... But I don't mind days like that. You surprised?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_007: A Liberi dude who calls himself a hottie, a Vulpo car mechanic who does things his way, and my fellow Bolívarian with the huge appetite. Just where did you find all these fun people? I knew I made the right choice joining you guys.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_008: Before I left home, I had a huge fight with mama, all because I caught Oripathy. I have my ways to keep from being a burden to my family, but mama… she hugged me so tight, she said she'd sell everything in the house to get me treated. I've never wanted to admit it, but I guess my life really is miserable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_009: You know what 'can soccer' is? It's my favorite game! Just take a can out of the ditch or whatever scrap heap, then play ball. Oye wey! What's that look on your face? We may have been poor, but there was plenty of fun to be had. Don't believe me? Come try for yourself!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_010: If you're that tired, how about you hand me all your top-secret documents and get some rest?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_011: Caper, or whatever you wanna call me. Just standing here already proves I'm tough enough, right? You're my boss now, so make sure I don't get bored. And be ready for my surprises.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_012: You saw that move of mine? Hahaha! Their reaction was so funny.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_013: All the officers I know are so desperate for promotion, they do all kinds of dirty infighting. So I assumed getting promoted had to be super fun. Hmph, turns out it's no big deal.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_014: I guess only my mama would be happy to hear I got promoted... It's all the same to me. But If I get promoted high enough to order you around… Heehee, then my head is full of ideas.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_017: Finally giving me a real fun job?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_018: Alright, everyone, don't overdo it! Of course, that doesn't apply to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_019: Come on, come on! Let's go!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_022: What you waiting for? It's gotta be me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_023: Think you can catch me? That's hilarious!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_024: What should I play with you guys?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_027: Watch me cut your pants to scraps!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_028: Watch me cut all that hair on your head!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_029: That was such a thrill! Can we do it again?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_030: The No.1 rule of playing a master prank—is to be a prank master first, haha!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_031: That's it? I haven't had enough fun.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_032: Doctor, you go on ahead! I'm gonna play with them some more!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_033: Doctor? Where did my luggage go? You didn't hide it, did you? Pff... Hahaha, just messing with you. I ain't got no luggage.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_034: Whoa~ Need me to keep what you just did a secret?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_036: Try touching my ear. I promise, no surprises... Sike!
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_038: Before, I always had dinner with my mamá on this day. She always got off work earlier than usual to make me these big fat tacos filled with meat. It's only on this day of the year that I get to eat so much meat... Hey, don't just listen. Eat up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_043: Look at you. Is today some kinda special occasion? Hehe, you look so funny when you're disappointed. Alright, here's my gift for you. You can probably figure out what it is, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4100_caper_CN_044: Doctor, I'm outta here tomorrow. I really didn't expect to be here for so long, and that I wouldn't ever get tired hanging around you. Rhodes Island's such a fun place. Don't you ever let it get boring. Where am I going next? Haha... A field mission! See ya!
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_001: Pages of truth torn and lost, blood of friends spilt and chilled... Will you stop that ever-writing hand, if such scene is in you eyes...? I see. I shall assist you in your undertaking.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_002: Oh... It's dark outside. My apologies, I must have misled you. Rather than having fallen into slumber, I was merely too immersed in reading. You need not wait by my side in such silence. Could you find your own  light? Allow me to illuminate it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_003: We and the Sami are alike? No, we merely hide among them. Our foresight and the Sami's divination are two pathways to the future, and neither side has fully accepted the other... Worry not, Doctor. The reproach I have suffered is not important. I humbly urge you to facilitate the cooperation between us all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_004: You seem worried that I'll have a difficult time adapting here. But in my eyes, this metal cave is not at all dissimilar to our dwelling. You perceive the flow of fate via the shadows projected on the cave wall, while we have gazed into labyrinthine darkness since our birth. That is the only difference.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_005: Yes, I am gazing at the Sarkaz tracks beneath your feet, but please do not let this bother you. I shall not be prying into your affairs, for the Cyclopes have long turned their attention away from Kazdel. My cooperation with Rhodes Island looks to the threat from the north, and this is my position within your fate.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_006: Is your interest really piqued by this note? You may read it, by all means. But it cannot foretell one's fate. The shapes that prophecies take are not set in stone, therefore keeping records is forbidden to us. In spite of this, I have written these words and fragments. Please view these as... lies that I must make, no matter the means.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_007: No, no... Please, do not say that... Typhon's life is unrelated to any prophecies. I saved her in the heat of the moment. She is unaware of the cause, nor is she curious about her fate. And it is my wish to never lay eyes on her future.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_008: The wind pays no heed to where each snowflake falls, as it is plenty accustomed to the sight of melting snow. On the icefileds, it sees the ravines sculped by fate... I ask you to understand us in that way. However... As I gaze at you here, I cannot help but feel a hint of sadness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_009: This is all my own choices. I would do whatever it takes to fulfill the prophecy that must be fulfilled, no matter the cost. When the day comes, you may loathe me. And so, allow me to offer you my apologies in advance. Would you perhaps think that... Sorry, please, pay me no heed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_011: You look the same as I saw you before... Sorry, please pay me no mind. I am a Cyclops from the caverns of the Sami mountains. With the impending darkness in my sight, I seek your cooperation. Please, call me Valarqvin.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_012: No matter how much you gaze into the past, there are no more possibilities to be seen there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_013: My mission will never change, no matter the time. Even so, you would go through the effort to prepare a promotion ceremony for me? You have my thanks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_014: A dark fate looms over the lands in silence, only for the occasional flash of lightning to tear it briefly asunder. It is in those moments when the foresighted see. Likewise, it is in those moments that warriors seek to wager their lives.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_018: This ray of light may be dim, but I ask all of you to follow it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_019: Avoid becoming engulfed in snow, as were the fates of many.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_020: I have no intention of setting my eyes on you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_023: Please deliver my visions to the masses.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_025: May the lightning tear chaos apart.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_026: May the blizzard cleanse life and death.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_027: May the mountains prolong our fates.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_028: 'We gaze, from the beginning to the end.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_030: With your axe and wit, you have left your mark on the icefield. Now, we can continue our journey forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_031: Are you still concerned? Fate will bring back to you the enemies who escaped.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_032: Please... do not stand before me... No, just allow me to take a moment of rest by myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_033: I thank you for arranging for me a place of respite. Alas, I am afraid I cannot make use of it often.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_034: Oh... That's awfully childish of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_038: The passage of time is vague in our eyes. To us, the most distinct thing might perhaps be the length of time between each droplet of water dripping in the caves. You think I am not one to celebrate holidays? You are mistaken. Like ice-cold frost water, these moments keep me clear-headed and rouse me from our dream.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_042: May you advance without hesitation, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_043: I cannot offer you my best wishes against my will. On a day like this, we would best take our own paths. May you follow your will and live on. I shall wait for you in the future I see.
dialogue_tracker.char_4102_threye_CN_044: A prophecy about Rhodes Island? My cooperation with you has lasted for some time now, and my answer to your question remains the same as the reason I sought your cooperation in the first place: We see doom often, but we also see what follows in the wake of such doom.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_001: You have to clear all these documents on your desk? Gosh, that's a lot. How about a short break, honey? Tired as you are, a refreshing drink ought to help.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_002: What would you like to order tonight? Some ribs, maybe fried fowlbeast? I recommend the ribs with red wine, or the fowl with a glass of sparkling water Hm? You want both? Only if you can finish it all, darlin'. I wouldn't want any to go to waste.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_003: I met an interesting guy in Tkaronto who claimed to be the president of the Columbian Chiromancy Association. He was all about palm reading, and insisted on teaching me a thing or two. Unfortunately, I'm not a believer —Why not? Heh. Because for all the nonsense that came out of his mouth, his furry paws didn't have a single crease on them!
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_004: Davistown is a mining platform. It gets really cold in winter, but the warmth of its residents kept my diner open for more than a decade. Unfortunately, social ties alone couldn't save the iron mine, and it eventually became a Blacksteel training platform. Well, nothing I can do but wish them well. Hope they don't tip the whole thing into a ditch.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_005: It's in great condition, but I haven't actually used this weapon much in the past few years. A steak knife is enough to settle a dispute. How? Simple, if it's sharp enough to cut a steak, it's sharp enough to cut other things... Wanna see it in action?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_006: I've seen automated mining platforms. I know it's just a matter of time until those industrial monsters phase out Davistown. But I still can't forgive the profiteers. They never give it a second thought how they're selling more than just the platform, it comes with the lives of everyone on it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_007: Something bothering you? Need a drink? I learned what I know out in the Columbian wilds, so my drinks aren't exactly stylish, but they pack a punch... Don't look at me like that, hon. We can just chat if you don't want to drink.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_008: Jessica was so gloomy out on the frontier, but she still worked her hardest, day and night. Poor girl wouldn't even admit she was tired when anybody asked... I'm glad to see she looks so much better now that she's here at Rhodes Island with you by her side—Oh, hold still, hon! Your neck and shoulders are stiff as a board. Of course it's gonna hurt when I press down on them like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_009: I made a bet that I could drive us from the frontier to Tkaronto in one night. Wanna come along? You ride shotgun, I'll drive. Either I win, or we'll just park the car somewhere and watch the sunrise, play it like we spent the night chasing the dawn.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_010: Doctor, wake up. You'll get a stiff neck if you sleep at your desk. Lay down on the sofa, I already put out a blanket.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. Jessica and I are here to get medical help for our infected Pioneers. She talks about you all the time, so I think we'll be good working together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_012: Hmm… This looks like more trouble than breaking up a fight in the diner...
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_013: A company promotion is a wholly new experience for me... thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_014: I'm not trying to protect anything, I just want to experience as much goodness as I can, leaving no regrets behind. But, if someone were here to do badness, I wouldn't hesitate to empty my magazine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_017: I still prefer the conflicts you can settle with a steak knife.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_018: I'll assign jobs like I would in the kitchen. Everybody okay with that?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_019: If you feel nervous, think about what song you want to sing at the party afterwards.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_021: What kind of 'drink' can I fix you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_022: Who do you want me to target?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_023: Got a clear view here. Hope they don't got the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_025: Want a drink? It's on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_026: Too bad, I've got you now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_027: Ready to surrender? No? Sorry about this, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_028: Ever stick a hot knife in butter?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_029: Well done, Doctor. This drink is to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_031: They're no threat anymore. Just let them wander off into the wilderness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_032: Don't worry about me, I'm just covering your retreat. I've seen worse.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_033: Sometimes I miss the days I spent riding a burdenbeast out into the wilds.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_034: Careful, you almost spilled the drink.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_036: Want a slice of this freshly baked meat pie?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_038: I hung up a dartboard in my diner one New Year's Eve. Anybody who beat me could get something on the house, or if they lost they'd to order an extra drink for every extra dart... Wanna guess how quick I sold out of booze that day?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. What can I get you today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_043: Remember the bet I told you about? That's your birthday present, if you're down for it. But in the meantime... enjoy this glass of 'Wild Sunrise'. Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4104_coldst_CN_044: I've been looking around, seeking out all kinds of scenery since I left the city I was born in. There are only two places that have made me consider stopping, Davistown and Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_001: Eh, how come work at the Engineering Department here is even more exhausting than Blacksteel? Good thing I've got some easy paperwork for a change of pace. Lemme start with this one. Umm... Hehe, sorry I bothered you, Doctor. I've got work to do, so I'm heading back to Engineering.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_002: Doctor, you should've told me you dropped something behind this shelf. Look at you, wriggling around on the floor all day. Alright, get up. I've got specialized tools I use to carry bulky, heavy engineering equipment. We'll move it aside and grab your stuff. Do you have earplugs, though? It's probably gonna hurt your ears when I tow around this heavy-ass metal shelf...
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_003: Be brave, Laura. If you want your work to go smoothly and advance your career, you gotta take the plunge. Think about your future... Think about your dreams... Ah! What are you doing behind me?! I, I'm fine, it's just... I gotta get an injection tomorrow. I'm... I'm trying to get myself ready.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_004: If you ask me, the most annoying part of engineering projects and experiments is the funding! Even when you get your hands on it, you still have lots to worry about. Everything I do costs money, and every monthly account statement is red as hell, and my budget's always like toilet paper! Speaking of, how much funding can you give me next month? I gotta start planning early.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_005: My whole family lived in a single basement room when we first moved from Bolívar to Columbia. The space under my mother's bed was my first 'engineering lab.' I made lots of weird trinkets there. But I also got smacked just as much, heheh.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_006: The power plant is like the heart of a nomadic plate. During my years in the field with my team, I've basically been its primary physician. Either I'm giving it all I got to recover its pulse, or... I'm pronouncing it dead when there's nothing more I can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_007: Hey, hey, Doctor! Down here! Look at me! I've got good news. Our engineering project just had a major breakthrough. Don't stand there like a bump on a log. Come, let's sit down, I'll show you... Oh my gosh, I'm sorry, I forgot to wash my hands. I got a handprint on your coat....
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_008: Nah, don't worry. My kneecap's not hurt. I just have a small crystal there, so I hide it with a band-aid. I know there's no need to hide it here, but I'm used to it. You know, Doctor, sometimes I wonder, If I'd met you guys before Blacksteel... Never mind. We don't have time for what-ifs.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_009: Doctor, you give everything you've got, even when there's nothing in it for you, just like Jessica. I'm not nearly as selfless as you guys, but I know when to be grateful. I won't let you down or squander the money and trust you two invested in me. I promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_010: Falling asleep right on your desk... and your hair blocking your eyes like that. Hmm, guess I'll leave you this bone-shaped hairpin.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_011: Pleasure to meet ya! I'm the engineer Blacksteel sent here on exchange. Just call me Almond. Are you the Doctor Jessica's always talking about? Let me get a good look at you. Hmm... You seem fine and... Normal, I guess?
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_012: Now this is interesting. I never thought you could use engineering machinery like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_013: Oh, you shouldn't have. It's all a part of our contract. I'm just doing my job so… Hold on! What did you just say...? Invest · ment?
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_014: Aw, come on. you can drop the act. I've worked on so many projects with Rhodes Island's Engineering Department. You're not here just to nitpick, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_017: You need my tech on the battlefield too? No problem!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_018: I used to lead an engineering team, but now a combat team…? Alright, let's do this. Everyone, listen for the whistle!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_019: Woo! I just got a new idea. Better write it down as soon as the fight's over.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_020: Careful now, 'cause you won't escape once my little friends catch you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_022: You need anything, I'm your girl!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_023: It's all just like the blueprints. Peerrfect!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_024: Even without a blueprint, I'm adaptable enough to work it out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_026: Sheesh, why are you so heavy?
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_028: Oh shoot, my grappling hook's stuck! Sorry for tripping you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_029: Doctor! Once we're back, be sure to check my blueprints! I can't just let you go when you've got such a great mind!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_030: Good work, Doctor! Want a cookie? Too tough to chew...? Hmm… I think it's fine…
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_031: I would've liked a more perfect finish, but these results aren't so bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_032: Laying down smoke! Doctor, we'd better fall back while the enemy can't see us!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_033: The wiring in this room's terrible. Who did this? I'm gonna sort everything out here line by line.
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_034: Wai-wai-wait! Don't push! You'll mess up all the cables in my backpack!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_038: Doctor, why you suddenly have three heads...? Now I gotta make four more sets of... uh... ear plugs, for the player that's gonna be your birthday gift...Wha? I had too much to drink? Don't be silly! Franka tried to get me to drink a whole big-ass mug, but I only had a-a teeny tiny little bit!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_042: I'm all set, Doctor. Ready to start working whenever!
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! I got you a set of puzzles for your birthday. You'll find out what my present is if you manage to solve it. Sounds like fun, right? Hmm... How come you look like you've figured it out already?
dialogue_tracker.char_4105_almond_CN_044: Every day I've spent on Rhodes Island has been very fun, but since I started having fun, it's been hard to get absobed in my work like I did at Blacksteel. Er, how should I put it? Blacksteel feels more like a place for work, while Rhodes Island is more like... hehe, you know, home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_001: Doctor, if you need me for anything, just say the word! You want me to file the documents? Oof, I'm no good with paperwork... How about this, we set work aside and I take you for a spin?  Wink.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_002: Doctor, I got the ceiling light fixed. Is it bright enough for you? If you don't need me for anything else, I'll go take care of other stuff. You think all this work is hard on me? I get to make some money, meet new friends, and seize the life I want to live with my own two hands. There's nothing better than this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_003: Ugh, I hit the wrong note again. Come on, don't laugh at me. Not all Siestans are natural-born musicians. Besides, the kalimba is harder than it looks! You wanna try? Here you go. Alright, Hold it a little further down, and gently pluck it with your thumb... You want me to teach you more later? Oh no, I'm no good at teaching either.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_004: Doctor, I found the perfect spot for sunbathing on the deck. It's got a great view. We can set up a parasol there, grab some ice-cold sodas, lounge on some beach chairs, and watch the clouds. When I was a kid, I used to take naps after I was done helping out at the store. Fell asleep listening to the waves like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_005: A police officer taught me these combat techniques. She said that when you run a business, you gotta have a few tricks up your sleeve. Most important is self-defense. Oh, right, she also gave me a membership card. She said it lets me sightsee all around Lungmen. What, You have one, too? What?! And there's no expiration date?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_006: Doctor, look! I marked all the sightseeing destinations on the map. There's the volcano Miss Naumann talked about, and the underground forest on Chuck's postcard. When Rhodes Island passes by these places, I'll be sure to apply for... Aw, darn it, my nose is bleeding again...
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_007: Oh, I'm writing Harley back, telling her all about the places I've visited. Can't let'em think I traveled less than Chuck, you know. I used to think about the future very little, and I never thought I'd one day leave the 'White Volcano.' That said, when I made up my mind and said goodbye to the past, the future was already there before my eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_008: This round little thing isn't a fowlbeast egg. It's a cobble found on the old Siestan beaches. My sister really treasured it, but she gave it to me right before I left. You know, Doctor, ties between people are like the beach. After the tides recede, you find only treasure. My life here at Rhodes Island has made me believe that even more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_009: I promised Lut and Liv that I'd keep track of all my 'journey experiences' with Rhodes Island. Our adventure team may have disbanded for now, but when I become more mature and when they grow up, I'll definitely take them on this journey of mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_010: One yawn, two yawns... Doctor, why don't I make you a glass of 'Cotton Sunset?' Trust me. You'll find yourself drifting in a fluffy, pillowy dream.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I'm Enis, and I'm formally joining Rhodes Island today. What, a codename? Umm, let me think... How about 'Bryophyta?' I hope I'll get to leave my mark on the mountain rocks and reefs, just like the moss.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_012: I didn't know you could work together in battle like that! Uh, I'm getting a little hungry. I'll go make some popcorn. You want some?
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_013: This counts as a promotion, right?  Nice~ I'll write a postcard back to 'White Volcano', and brag all about this to my siblings, heheh. Yeah, I'll have to use a postcard with a picture of Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_014: Elite instructor? You aren't trying to get me to become a kindergarten teacher or a boy scout leader, right? Haha, just kidding. But I've gotten pretty used to life here at Rhodes Island now. Let me keep following you guys to even more distant lands, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_017: Huh? I-I'm heading to the battlefield, too?
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_018: My gosh, you want me to lead the team? It's not the pay I'm worried about. I'm worried I could mess it up!
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_020: Gotta give it 200%, better take a coffee mint…
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_022: Alright! I'll guard this place well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_023: Fasten your seatbelts, everyone. I'm starting the meter now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_024: You want me out of the way? Don't be silly. You can't get inside without tickets.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_025: Fierce winds won't push me back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_026: Rough seas won't pull me under.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_028: Who says a logistics operator... can't fight?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_029: I really thought I wouldn't make it... But looks like we can overcome even the biggest waves when we're working together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_030: Doctor, I did well, right? I'm gonna get some ice cream. You want some, too? Alright, I can give you an extra scoop. Okay, okay, I'll give you two extra scoops.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_031: Uh, I got careless... Hm? I did well enough already...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_032: Go. Don't worry about me... I've got a lifesaver license, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_033: If only we had a surfboard here, oof…
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_034: Watch out! Phew, that was close... I almost spilled it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_036: H-Hold on! Don't look! I'm not done with the lyrics yet! You... want to hear it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New Year. I'm here to change the water cooler's jug. Why am I still working today? This job's special, you see. I get to run into a lot of people on the first day of the year, and I can wish each of them a happy new year. It's meaningful work, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_042: Doctor, want to try some Siestan coffee? You can add some tonic water, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Be sure to make a wish out loud on such an important day. Huh? It won't come true if others hear it? But back when I was still at the 'White Volcano,' it really seemed like our wishes would come true more easily when we yelled.
dialogue_tracker.char_4106_bryota_CN_044: Just like Siesta, I said goodbye to that beach, and just like Rhodes Island, I am searching out sights I had never seen before. Doctor, the destination of my journey may be a bit far away for me still, but the journey itself has already become a stack of postcards thick enough for me to look back on and treasure forever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_001: Doctor, I'm putting the flowerpots here. The scent from these clears the mind. It'll help you sift through those documents, guaranteed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_002: I used to have to collect plant samples for my employer whenever he barked the order. Give me a scarcely-traveled rainforest and I'll head in happy. Thing is, once our specimens started growing in people's hydroponic pots, and then protected areas, and then test farms... Well, that's where the trouble began.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_003: I was in the Convalescent Garden, and I saw the plant almanac Perfumer's compiling. Lots of gaps, no way to fill them in as of yet. See, a good plant hunter fills the blanks with their 'prey.' A great plant hunter not only does that, they also get the author to leave them plenty more new blanks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_004: I've been to Acahualla plenty. The residents there, Tiacauhs, I believe the name is. They're good people. They'll be frank with you, straight with you. It's just, two things I can't stand: one, they force me to go wrestling when they get drunk, and two, they keep judging my tail... is it really that thin, Doctor? My tail?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_005: This handsaw was custom-made for me by my mother while I was still in school. Never thought I'd be using it again after I got infected. Thanks to that employer of mine, hiring plant hunters. He let me continue doing what I loved... even if he's the same bloke who fired me out of paranoia in the end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_006: Doctor, this is the plant that got me fired. No monetary value, so you can imagine... I told my boss I forsook my assigned target for this bit of shrubbery, and he thinks I'm having him on somehow... But listen. I discovered this 'un. I gave it its name. And nothing could matter more than that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_007: To make a 'scarecrow,' you need a whole lot more than just straw. You also need a variety of tough, poisonous, and insect-eating plants, Originium Arts, as well as my dad's techniques to sew everything together... Tch, leaked my trade secrets again. Doctor, remember not to tell anyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_008: You're right, I am in fact used to keeping a cold, stoic persona in front of strangers. After all, your average plant hunter doesn't usually get into interpersonal conflict with a standing army. It's more often absent-minded guards with fixed salaries. Overpowering your opposition by putting on airs can actually ensure your safety, funny enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_009: Doctor, this is my very first time making a 'Scarecrow' for someone else. What d'you think? Uncanny resemblance, right? If danger's ever afoot, this can help—oi, slow down, don't touch those vines, else they'll—Hrm. It'll let go of your arm naturally after a short while. Trust me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_010: You were just trying to chat with me and I wasn't responding? Ooh, um, see, I was DEFINITELY, NOT using a 'Scarecrow', tooooo skive off work. Honest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_011: I need a job, and being a pharmaceutical company, surely Rhodes Island won't turn down an experienced plant hunter. And the plant hunter in question is none other than... Y'what? I just need to sign here, that's it? No fibs?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_012: Hang on! I think I saw a very rare shrub. Might even be a new species! Where was this video taken?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_013: There's a beautiful medal... but the design's a bit dull. You considered adding some plant motifs to it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_014: Never mind contending with people. I prefer exploring the wilderness, delving into the rainforest, living among the plants... Want to come along with me next time, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_017: Can we settle disputes some other way that's not direct conflict?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_018: All I can assure you is everyone returns safe. I cannot guarantee victory like the others can. Are you SURE you want me as squad leader?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_019: If this conflict truly is necessary, I suppose there's no way around it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_020: Good bit of bravery in you to stand as my enemy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_021: Chop-chop with the orders. I'll make 'em regret showing their faces.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_022: Chop-chop with the orders? I can see them coming...
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_023: Dead branches and rotten leaves! I'll sweep up in no time, just you watch.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_024: Bunch of ten-a-penny weeds. Nothing I'm interested in.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_025: The harder on the outside, the softer on the inside.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_026: Plant looks risky, who can tell. Plant looks safe, you're in for hell.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_027: Never assume the simple days will last.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_029: I never thought I'd be getting the best of that vicious an enemy... At this rate, you think we could be off somewhere more dangerous for sample-collecting?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_030: There we go, enemies dealt with, now we can show ourselves the door and leave.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_031: A few of 'em got away... They're not coming back, are they?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_032: Stay alive, Doctor. You won't have a future to count on otherwise.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_033: If I want to help improve Rhodes Island's plant diversity, where do I apply?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_034: If you can't tell the difference between me and a 'Scarecrow,' I think the vines might've poisoned you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_036: Hmm... Where should I go to collect samples next time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_038: As you can see, I'm giving a Scarecrow a new change of clothes. Back in my quiet little hometown, families would all give their scarecrows a fresh bit of kit at the start of each year... Not sure what the cultural significance of that was, but the most important thing is, don't let the fowlbeasts get too used to seeing the same getup. Fowls, they're smart little buggers.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_042: Good morning, Doctor. I watered the flowers in your office for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I've been thinking for a long time about what to give you, and finally decided I'd let you choose yourself. Here, take a seed from my palm, any seed. Plant it, and see what kind of flowers you get blooming eventually.
dialogue_tracker.char_4107_vrdant_CN_044: When I observe plants in the wild, sometimes I'll think, what if the ones that live for hundreds or thousands of years sense the passage of time too? How long would their experience of one year be...? Whatever it is, I'm sure it's not like mine. It always feels like each year passes by in a flash.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_001: That's a huge stack of documents... I can lend you a hand if you're struggling to clear them, Doctor… Oh, sorry. I should be on standby waiting for your request.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_002: Hildegard doesn't care how Leithanians think of her, and I'm not some civil servant mincing words for her. It's just that we've been together for a long time now, so I'm able to stand in for her on unofficial occasions, to speak words she's not at liberty to speak, or meet people unsuitable for her to see.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_003: That must have been Federico earlier... He's also the type to think of normal conversation as stepping on glass. But once you know them long enough, you'll be able to understand what they're perplexed with, or what they're chasing after. My advice? Get used to awkward silence.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_004: I just heard some people discussing my age, but I don't see the issue, really. I met a sickly fellow in Zwillingstürme. He was younger than me by a few months, but he's skating on thin ice every day due to his status as Graf... Well, at least I don't have to worry about my own safety like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_005: 'Wolfgang, everything you say and do will affect Wulfsburg's future.' That's what I told myself back then. My life is my answer sheet, which I keep neat. But the problem is... maybe not everything has to be treated as an exam... Um, I still seem tense, even now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_006: Thank you for your concern, but I don't mind Hildegard's disappearance at all. She told me the enclosure of war was built so that it could be torn down in the future without any worries. She must have been somewhat aware of it that day, but she still... Anyway, my mission isn't over yet, and I remain her envoy still.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_007: Doctor, why are fowlbeasts unable to touch the stars no matter how far they fly? Uh, no, I'm just used to breaking the silence when it gets too quiet. Please pay me no heed. I don't think the answer's that important...? It's because they can't even fly right when they're... Ahem, seeing stars.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_008: Didn't I soundproof the room with Arts...? This castanet? It's a gift from Lieselotte, given during my first audience with her. When I was living in the Spire, I would kick it at the books in my room. Knocking them down one by one, then put them back before the sun came up. It's normal for me to be childish at my age, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_009: You two are so similar... Sorry for disturbing you with my sudden words, Doctor... I was just thinking about how you and Hildegard are so alike. Both of you shoulder so many responsibilities in silence, and I can't tell when to step in. Can I help you? Or... can you help me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_010: My tuba? Of course I can play it... Speaking of which, can you play the piano? Can you practice with me when you're free?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_011: Doctor, I am here at the behest of Empress Hildegard of Leithanien, and I hope to maintain friendly relations with you. I can act as a your Messenger, and perform music for you as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_012: I've already seen this... Hold on, I have some old recordings of the annual Kaiserinnensfest. Would you like to watch them together with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_013: Phew... Seems like I haven't disappointed you. Uh, Doctor. Should I be acting more nonchalant about this?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_014: Mm... I'm glad to have met your expectations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_017: I'll follow your baton for the time being.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_018: I knew you were too lazy to show up, so I went to run some errands... I'm very much used to this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_019: A music score or a battle plan—you have to give me one of those at least.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_021: Opening with a tuba? A rare arrangement.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_022: Am I the only tuba in your band?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_023: I'll warm up my fingers first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_024: I'll join in the performance at the right section.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_025: Can you hear it, the restorative vigor of that fortissimo?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_026: Can you feel it, the melodious emotions of that pianissimo?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_027: A shrill howl? That's what happens when you mess up while performing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_028: Out of my way, or I'll shove your head up this tuba.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_029: While the tuba is one of the most difficult instruments to play, I'm sure I'll get somewhat proficient at it in time. But you, you seem like a musician who was born proficient with all kinds of instruments... Life is so unfair.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_030: Your ingenuity put to shame any conductor I've seen.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_031: How does one keep their musicality in tip-top shape? Practice. A flawed performance simply means you haven't practiced enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_032: Did we fail? I don't think so. People like you usually factor failure into your plans, yes?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_033: The soundproofing here should be decent...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_034: Ahh... you gave me a fright.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_036: Doctor, I'm just about to replace the bell on my tuba. Can you lend me a hand?
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_038: The new year was just a month away when I left Wulfsburg. They said we had to hurry to meet Their Majesties so we could make it to the annual celebration in Zwillingstürme. I was practicing the whole way, but... I really liked that piece though.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_043: Your seat is here. Yes, right here, in the center of the front row. Miss Orchid had me arrange an ensemble with the children on Rhodes Island, and, um, I'm one of the performers too... This is not a birthday gift, but I'd like your opinions on the performance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4109_baslin_CN_044: The annual Kaiserinnensfest is always a stunning event. The Royal Orchestra performs to the people, and it closes with a grand ensemble on the covered bridge for Their Majesties. The main reason we hold it every year is to make everyone believe in the path under their feet. Rhodes Island doesn't have celebrations as grand as that, but your footsteps are still full of conviction.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_001: Be at ease. I won't let another assassin do his work right in front of me, ever again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_002: There's nothing that can derail the historical trajectory of Victoria, not even Theresis, or even the dukes. It's nothing but different people taking turns to wallow in the same puddle of mud. You want my honest opinion? Heh. Stay back, lest you get mud splashed on you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_003: I lived with Mum for a long time when she was stationed on the border all year round, and the towers of Londinium were never in sight... I never so much as asked her. Just what it was that made her so willing to toil away all those years, out on the border?
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_004: Say. I hear Her Royal Highness Alexandrina is continuing to gather more supporters? Very well... Sooner or later, Vina will have to face the same choice as I did. Though all told, taking off a crown invites far more obstacles than giving up a dukedom. If you get the chance, do tell her I wish her all the best.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_005: The sword brandished and never sheathed is the sword of the weak. Even though my mum taught me swordplay from a young age, more than anything, she made me practice the art of stowing my blade. If I'm to inherit her position, then I can't be daggers drawn for most issues that greet me... And just knowing that chafes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_006: 'Self-evident?' 'Just?' Great nobles in their ivory towers, engaging in nefarious deeds so that their country endures and prospers, is that self-evident? The starving Infected robbing the innocent in a desperate attempt to live another day, is that just? These are questions I won't give up on finding the answers to.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_007: Rhodes Island has shown its sincerity to me, so even though she's... no longer with us, our deal still stands true. Of course, this is as long as you don't mind my currently utterly powerless status, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_008: Did you find these... at the video shop? I actually picked these out just for Baird, but she never gave them the time of day, saying they were just so noisy... They're useless now, so you can have them. These are some of Wrankwood's must-watch comedy classics.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_009: There's countless scenarios I've thought of to prevent my mum from being assassinated, and always, always, the result is the same... She was so strong, she never had a need to question her own decisions. Tears? Hah, you must be mistaken, Doctor. I learned long ago to never cry.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_010: You can rest easy, I'll be here. There aren't many chances to take a nap on the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_011: We can save each other the trouble of introducing ourselves, and I'll treat this contract as a token of you approving how we cooperate. Can I get back to work now, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_012: This battle record is a five out of five. It's as good as the Wrankwood action blockbusters I used to watch at the video shop.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_013: Interesting. A 'medical organization,' employing a standard military promotion system...? Hmm. I can already see certain people getting their just desserts for underestimating you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_014: A higher position often means taking more responsibilities, but I'm sick of people in those positions using responsibility as a shield for their own selfishness, so I hope things will be different here. In any case, our partnership has at least for now, taken another step forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_018: Don't worry. I'll make sure everyone on the squad is safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_019: Bury the habit of fighting each to your own!
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_020: Survey the terrain, and clear out those despicables in hiding.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_021: Hesitancy is forbidden on the battlefield!
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_022: May I draw my sword now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_023: A radical strategy, but I can work with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_024: Judge by appearance, and suffer the consequences.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_029: That was some clean commanding. We have a bit of time before our mission is estimated to end, so you should grab the chance to think about how to reward yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_030: A reasonable result. I'd doubt your ability to achieve your ambitions, if coping with this was beyond you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_031: It's not for us to leave without regrets, Doctor... Let's accept reality.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_032: Am I... still not good enough?
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_033: This style... it fits my impression of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_036: Want some canned food? The sugar will get you fat though.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor... Um, everyone's asking me to attend the party? I used to spend the day with just Mum, so I don't know... Never mind, I have nothing else to do today anyway, so let's go, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_042: It's been a while, Doctor. Ready to move out?
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_043: I took this photo from someplace high up while on a certain trip. Can you tell who these people are fighting for, when they've been reduced to dots? Perhaps you've never seen the land of Victoria from such a perspective, so who knows just what ideas you might have. No need to tell me though. Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4110_delphn_CN_044: We were all there when that happened out of the blue... Even now I still can't forget just how powerless I felt then. Such occasions will only happen even more often, as you get more and more factions watching you. Can you still persevere on, even when facing an unstoppable disaster?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_001: Induct yourself an adjutant, one you can trust, and secretarial busywork will never hound you again. Between ourselves, that's an industry secret. Steady, Doctor, I would be loath to suggest you induct me...!
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_002: Hip-hip to Rhodes Island's young generation. They can fight and they can imbibe, my goodness. But youth's folly is ignorance, you see: they don't know all's fair in love and war, they never caught me diluting my drink! Bah-hah-hah-hah-, my head... Doctor, if you'd hurry. Fetch me a sobering physic.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_003: Hah, what talent General Hellagur's girl possesses! I'd gladly have the youths here make a friend of her sometime. All the while my daughter plays the contrarian, but she at least heeds her father's wise words. Hm? To speak of which, Doctor, that letter you're holding... Excuse me? Incorrect address? Returned to sender?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_004: Good girl, no fear, just a little more... Doctor! Yes, like that, stroke the girl on the neck there, softly, gently, let her know you're there for her, you love her... well done, girl, now push! I see the child coming! It's a stupendous little burdenbeast lad!
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_005: Will! Charles! Funny business, they've vanished. What? They're off playing drinking games again? They had the nerve not to invite me...?! So be it, let them drink. All the years they've been company to me, the old fellows, and what have they gained? A riddling of scars and chronic pains, too pernicious for me to cure. How can I blame them, now they've so little but tipple for pastime.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_006: War stories? No, no, no, a richness of topics I could be your partner in. Why one of such sensitive dearth? I've said my piece on it—the battlefield lingers in your Sunday lapel like a bad odor, and never comes clean even should you change your suit. No, what say we talk of something else, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_007: I've partaken of fine foods across the land, but in my lowly opinion, only in the bosom of hometown, amidst the throng of locals, can you taste the most essential delicacy. This fondue tells such a tale. You'd like a travel guide from me? Hah-hah, very well, as you wish. To be asked for a work so dear to my passions is my honor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_008: You have a most vorpal gaze to recognize this pipe's Gaulish make. It was seized by my father's commander in the Battle of the Four Emperors, a spoil accorded to my father, then—bless his resting soul—it was handed down to me. Some decades it's spent crossing the fields of war. You'll even note the lost segment along the shank, much as I've lost a leg.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_009: Hush, Doctor. We shouldn't forget that I'm an officer to Victoria when all is said and done. Befriend me you may, and depend on me, but never should you drop your guard, nor tell me too much. Should the worst come to pass, it would spell the end of our continued association... and with my age, I'd fold under the regret.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_010: Don't watch your health now, and you'll certainly curse yourself when you're old.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_011: Here I thought they'd finally given me hard labor on the borders, and yet... I wonder if the Empire's deigning to smile on me? Oh, where are my manners? You, then, should be my commanding officer from hereon? I render you my services as a plain medical officer.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_012: Combat that would emphasize the individual's strengths... What revelation.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_013: Could it be? Is this in recognition of my surgeon's abilities? This means far more to me than a higher title ever could.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_014: I feel I could return home and open a practice right this instant. In fact, I plan to be off on the morrow. Hoh-hoh, yes, I'm pulling your leg. I tell you, I could have found no greater place than here to retire.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_017: Me? Surely I'm not about to be an accomplice in your sunbathing schemes?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_018: Attention, good fellows. Your only obliged consideration is how you survive. Agreed?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_019: Good fellows, let us think of happier things. If I may: how about something nice to eat after this operation?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_020: Be a little courteous to our guests, boys and girls.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_022: I trust your plans are drawn.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_024: What fine scenery. A shame about the fighting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_026: No soldier may cower in the field!
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_027: All casualties, retreat! All others, cover!
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_028: I say this once, protect your own lives first! I'll bear the onus!
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_029: Outstanding peace talks! As I always say—bloodshed can spoil anything. Best we remain amicable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_030: I see I'm deprived of a chance to practice my surgery! A marvelous regret to have.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_031: You say I've 'held back', do you? Hah-hah-hah, piffle! Don't you worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_032: To admit our own defeat is a form of virtue.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_033: Mm-hrmm. Doctor, your tastes are... comparatively maverick.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_034: Oh? Are you angling to swipe my cane?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_036: Oh, Doctor! Would you care to take a stroll with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_038: Goodness, how saintly is our Doctor that you would worry I be devoid of companionship, let alone ask after me? Hah-hah-hah, but a Happy New Year. Yes, lest I forget, my family chances to trip to Rhodes Island in a couple of days, and I'd be remiss to not personally invite you to our household dinner.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_042: Tally-ho, Doctor. Your presence suggests today will be a fine day indeed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_043: *sigh* Every soul that celebrates a birthday reminds me that while my girl was young, war had me miss several of her own special occasions—and as is the case, she came not to care if I would be there or not. But I apologize—you tend to reminisce at the drop of a hat when you're my age. How many slices should we cut this cake into?
dialogue_tracker.char_4114_harold_CN_044: Being of two different stations, some things I can't tell you, nor could you I. But there is one point we needn't doubt—we both are fed up with war. I imagine that's more than enough reason we might sit down together, open and honest, and share a drink.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_001: There are some matters I could help you with. But make no mistake, I am not a go-between for you and Enciodes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_002: I once ran into the Saintess at the foot of the mountain, where she stuffed a book into my hands. She told me that, if I'm bored, I might as well try copying some scripture. I heeded her suggestion and copied a passage every day. At first, I did it just to pass the time, but then I realized it helps me to relax a little too. I find it intriguing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_003: Leithanien, Kazimierz, Kjerag. Three decades, more or less. The days I spent in Kjerag were the most dull. No opponents, no challenges, no excitement... But before I knew it, I had become accustomed to the bleats of burdenbeasts, the sensation of shoes sinking into the snow, and the weight of a little sobering medicine on me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_004: The first time I became champion was to prove myself. The second time was to hone myself. And the third was a wake up call I made to those who thought they could control me. The price I paid for it? Just a few Darksteel arrows. Hmph, a pity I didn't get an actual match.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_005: I saw the Radiant Knight. No, there's no point in fighting here, so you need not arrange one for me. A proper fight needs her at her peak, at the right time, in the right place, and situation. Victory then will be a matter of life and death. Though, how or when that moment will come won't be up to me at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_006: Enciodes treats me like a sword—a sword intended to reflect more than kill, a blade serving as a mirror with which to scrutinize himself. The stronger I get, the more he exercises restraint. Such a relationship will continue until the day... he no longer needs a sword.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_007: I went back to Leithanien once, after becoming champion. From 'a defective Leithanian unable to use Arts', to 'a natural-born warrior', only to still find myself unwelcome. The locals looked at me the same as they did decades earlier. Coming to terms with that, I found my hatred for the land had cooled some.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_008: A few years ago in Kjerag, I was dining at a local restaurant I frequented where some foreign tourists tried to pick a fight with me. Before I could get a word in, the shop owner grabbed me by the arm and shouted to them, 'What are you punks doing?! Get away from our Kjerag lady!' I'll never forget that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_009: There are many who rely on you and Enciodes to provide them a meaningful way of life, and you relish it just as he does. But for me, I've just met another patron who engages in self-neglect. Right then, the meeting's about to begin. Drink this glass of water to refresh yourself. And hold still, your collar's wrinkled.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_010: Sleep. No one will bother you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_011: Degenbrecher. A codename? You can just use that. I looked through the contract, and the scope of my work seems unchanged. I am still a bodyguard, just the employer is different.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_013: Formalities like these remind me of the time when Karlan Trade was first established. Gnosis was so full of himself as he declared my position to the others. It was then that I decided to wait for a chance... to smash that cocky face of his to the ground.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_014: When I pinned the medals on my soldiers, the first cohort of Tschäggättä to complete my training, I saw some pretty fine expressions on them. I can see this ship has many with similar faces.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_017: Is this a mission, or a training session?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_018: Follow me close, no dinner for those who fall behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_019: Good, I suppose you've already got a plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_020: Keep your distance, or you risk getting caught up in the fighting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_021: Still mulling things over, Dr. Perfectionist?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_023: How soon do you want them gone?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_024: You can go do something else.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_026: Conviction will throw you off pace.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_027: Still soaking yourself in the past?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_028: Use your weapon to tell me who you are.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_029: Whenever there's an avalanche in Kjerag, I always free my schedule to test my skills there. It's a rare form of recreation for me. Apparently, Rhodes Island won't be dull in that respect, at the very least.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_030: Your face just now... it seems the expression 'fowls of a feather flock together' is indeed true.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_031: I let a few get away, as you bid me. What next?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_032: Hold my hand tight, and your breath with it. What comes next might be a little disorienting, but press on.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_033: We have to use codenames here? That's obnoxious.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_034: You'll need to try a little harder if you want to pick up my degenbrecher.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_036: Here. You left this file in the meeting room. It's fine, I'm used to doing this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_038: Rhodes Island is a bit too warm, compared to Kjerag, be it the temperature or the extent of enthusiasm here. I'm far more used to spending winter all bundled up indoors, partaking of some home-cooking together with a few weary faces. But maybe I should adapt to the ambience here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_042: Doctor, you know how busy your schedule is today, yes?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_043: I've forgotten my birthday, just as I'll soon forget my own name. But that's not important. Degenbrecher is my name, and if I can recall the day I took it, you can call that my birthday. But back on topic. Will you manage to open all the presents here today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4116_blkkgt_CN_044: I used to have my doubts about Rhodes Island, same as I used to distrust a certain someone's nonsense when I started working for him. But today, Karlan Trade is building Kjerag, and tomorrow, Rhodes Island will treat more Oripathy patients still. I've been keeping an eye on Rhodes Island for Karlan Trade long enough that it's just another part of my routine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_001: This animal almanac's a beauty. Right, from the bookshelves. I've washed my hands, so the pages'll be fine... Yeah, this is your office. Something wrong?
