dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_002: I hear explosions. One min, I'll head down to check. Exhaust fans sound normal, then next is... No, right. Forgot I'm riding with Rhodes Island now. You don't get Originium slugs in the pipes here. Um... Must be Engineering running weapon tests. Sorry about that, breaking your door down.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_003: You can tell how the air's doing from a sandbeast's back, so that's why you see pitsinkers bring one down. If there's poison and it keels over... you buy a new one. But this one wasn't from the shop. I don't even own it, so I don't keep it on a leash.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_004: Tales of the supernatural, these tapes said. Didn't really like watching them, but I do feel... Chills, from these? No. It's hot in the dark. The deeper down the pit, the hotter, harder to breathe. Always took yonks for the lift to bring us back up. I'd just stare at the lights in the ceiling, waiting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_005: Got shooed out of the workshop by Lanns. She wasn't pissed though, just hauled me along to a doctor, then had me on Potlid-watching duty. And watching I love my own body more... That day she asked me what life was like catching Oripathy. But all that came to mind was being down in the pit, staring at the Infected creatures and thinking, 'we're more alike now.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_006: Proactive? Is this about me applying to rescue Infected...? Remember when you had me treat my wounds? So I have my cotton wads, and they're getting covered in bloodstains, and dust, and Originium shards, and sandbeast fur, and it struck me then: the pit's behind me, a million miles behind, and it's like I'm still being stabbed. Do you think I'm... still carrying the fear?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_007: Ninety-seven, ninety-eight... Oh, first time seeing you at the training grounds. You always train at four in the morning too? That's not it? An op said I scared them target practicing here all night...?  But the light went kaput in my accommodation. I wanted to be somewhere lit-up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_008: I think Amiya's being nice to me. Hiding something and she won't tell me what. But it does occur to me, you know. The giant shadow I saw in a sandstorm as a kid. I might've mistook it. But it's always occurred to me... Doctor, give her these carrot pies for me, would you? She's always so busy and all, I want to be nice back, and care for her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_009: I've given it some thought. Hijacking Rhodes Island sounds unideal, but dragging you off might leave the whole ship out of order... Hm? Oh, it's just there's some great tales in your database. A few I wanna see with my own eyes, and it'd be nice if you come with. That's the new goal I found. What's wrong?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_010: No scratching, you'll wake the Doctor. C'mon, let's go walkies on the deck.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_011: I passed the Operator tests, Doctor, so thanks for all of you inviting me. That whole chase is over with, but I'm thinking I'll find my new goal on this ship.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_012: That's not danger I can cope with yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_013: You know, they wanted to certify me for my professional skills before. Gloompincer made off with the paper that time. Lost to the mineshaft depths... Anyway, there's a few extra things I can do. What's this ship need?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_014: If that tiny patch of sky opened wide... wouldn't people want to chase the sun and the moons?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_017: Here, Sandbeast, we need to get going.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_018: I'll take the very front, as always.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_019: Sound of muddy air, tracks of animal... I'll keep a watch that way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_020: Fine visibility. I can see more than just danger.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_023: Yeah, you'll hear from me as needed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_024: You lot stay up there if it gets risky.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_025: Threat at my position—yeah, not anymore soon.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_027: And that's as far as you go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_028: I'm done rambling in the dark.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_029: Sun's out. What a beauty… Sandbeast, let's get home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_030: This area's clear of danger for now. Doctor, you always been like this? Any problem, you'll solve it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_031: We'll have to expand the mine out... Hold the treatment for now. Got a lurking threat to handle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_032: You all leg it. Comms might cut out. If things get grim, I'll leave the most discernible signs I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_033: Ship's sailing on sandstone… That's strange. Like I've heard it somewhere before?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_034: Was I not meant to dodge that? Okay, I'll stay put. You tap me again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_036: Sandbeasts with arcing backs like this should be living in the desert... Wonder why this bugger came with me? Here, got you new food to try.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_038: Short-term disembarkment application. Rhodes stopping over here's perfect to hunt some sandbeast food. I'll be gone half a day. Offices are deserted—lucky I ran into you... Yeah, it is New Year's today, Happy New Year. So?
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_042: Weather's fine outside. No dust cloud, and not a Catastrophe billow in sight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_043: Happy birthday to you, Doctor. Made you this cake—it's that giant sandbeast print I photoed... Why didn't you think I'd come? I'm your friend. I'd make you sad forgetting your birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4117_ray_CN_044: A 'pipe dream'—that's how I hear some people describe Rhodes. My destination's nothing like this ship's—apples to oranges, really—but I've gotten up close and personal with my own dream thanks to you all, and I'm sure you can make yours come true. I know it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_001: I've arranged the incoming documents just the way you like them, and added a few labels for categorization. Feel free to use them to find what you need. If only my master was so organized... Oh, it's nothing, just an idle musing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_002: Wait, there's a bug on your collar. Don't worry, it's a green lacewing, a helpful sort. They hunt the pests that eat our crops. Look at the wings on this cute little guy, the color of jade. Really beautiful... My master always jokes that if I didn't become a farmer, I could've been an entomologist.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_003: Low clouds bring rain, high clouds bring fair skies.' See that cloud down by the horizon? That's a cumulus... The proverbs may not always be right, but they do have reference value. Using that one, you predict that tomorrow will be clear, but with strong winds and lightning? You might be a Catastrophologist, but just how did you come to that conclusion?
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_004: I've read that 'Tianshi' means 'to be a role model for the generations to come, and to search for perpetual truth.' I used to think I could never live up to that, but after seeing some of my seniors befuddled from time to time... Maybe I've been overthinking it. There may be a saying more suitable for me: 'Focus on your search, and learn for the sake of the people'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_005: I once challenged myself to a fast, but I ended up fainting on the fourth day. Still, my master said this was not true hunger. I didn't know what it was like to go hungry for years on end, so I could not possibly understand. I hope there comes a time when no one has to know that feeling.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_006: I've gotten tanned again, you say? No big deal, every farmer worth his salt ends up dark as a chestnut. So long as we accomplish our goal, so long as we see our  crops prosper in the contaminated soil, and the hard work of so many bears fruit, then it's all good. Me? I don't need to be there to see it. If the people keep walking the right path, that's enough for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_007: Oh, did you need me for something? Just a second, I need to braid my hair again. When I was younger, I grew out this 'rice stalk braid' as a prayer for peace. Now I spend a lot of time managing it every day. Back then, Grain Buds always thought I was a girl thanks to this braid...
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_008: The crops grown in Dahuang have a much better texture and taste than others. If you get a chance, I'd love to show you about the city. You wonder if they could supply Rhodes Island with food? Um, that's a little... I-I'm afraid that you'll need to discuss that with the proper authorities. It's not up to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_009: These seeds occasionally fall onto the ship. Oftentimes I gather them up and wait like this on the solid ground, closing my eyes and feeling which way the wind is blowing. There, once the breeze rises, I let them go, and those seeds find someplace to take root all on their own.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_011: Why am I called 'Wanqing'? It's one of the breeds of rice that my master cultivated in Dahuang. Others include Fanglao #3, the waterlogging-resilient one, Zaoyou #8, the quick-ripening one, and Kangdong #11, the frost-resistant one... 'Wanqing' means wide, and it sounds the most like a proper name.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_012: Everyone looks so well-mannered around here, it's hard to imagine that they're so fierce in battle...
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_013: The rating standards of the Tianshi Bureaus seem to stipulate that you can use evaluations from exchange visits in their assessments... Excuse me Doctor, is Rhodes Island able to provide an officially-stamped study visit certificate?
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_014: I've consulted with my master. As long as Rhodes Island agrees to sign a contract of cooperation with the Tianshi Bureaus, I'll get to offer my assistance as an advisor on experimental crop fields. We both do what we can for the sake of the many, and we'd be delighted to support your goals.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_017: Initial environmental survey completed. Nothing abnormal. We're good to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_018: I hope everyone takes my commands seriously. Let’s get this done right.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_019: If we cross any farmland, watch where you step.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_020: I'm a student of the Tianshi Bureaus. I won't hold you back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_021: Here! Er, I mean I'm in position.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_022: Tell me what you require, and I will deliver.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_023: I've finished construction of the refinement system. Deployment point confirmed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_024: We're in a complex environment. Don't go off on your own or you might get disoriented.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_025: With the aid of the wind, we too can soar through the skies.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_026: Watch your step, don't hurt the crops.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_027: The landscape here is tricky. Only step where I step.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_028: Until we can confirm that this area is safe, I will hold this position.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_029: Ensuring the harvest isn't easy. I hope to pass on the torch of our ideals.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_030: Just as the farms never rest, there will always be new growth from the ground, and there will always be those who wish to follow in our footsteps.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_031: Let's try that one again. The tiniest oversight leads to different experimental outcomes, and you can't let an error cloud your conclusions.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_032: Success is the fruit of a thousand failures. Experiments under the Tianshi Bureaus are the same. Don't be discouraged, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_033: Ever since I got here, there haven't been any leftovers? Of course. Waste not, want not.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_034: Who—Ah, my braid hit you? I am truly sorry...
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_036: I reassemble my Tianshi apparatus while I wait for my experiments to finish. My record is twelve seconds. Would you like to try?
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_038: The poems I read when I was little always compared winter snow to a thick blanket. The seedlings sleep beneath the snows, ready to welcome the spring days with new life. Dahuang is always busy this time of year. People my age go to the frozen rivers and throw firecrackers at the frost while covering their ears. Grain Buds always shouts the loudest. Would you like to give it a try?
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_042: Doctor, I'm pretty sure I heard this cactus say 'I was already watered yesterday—'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_043: Well, since it's your birthday, I have no choice. I'll stand to the side and watch. You'll want to keep your lower body firmly planted. If you're unfamiliar with a Tianshi apparatus, you could very easily get pulled into the air by the kite, so keep your center of gravity low... Oh, you've flown off already...
dialogue_tracker.char_4119_wanqin_CN_044: At first I didn't really understand why my master wanted me to go on a study visit to a pharmaceutical company. But after spending all this time here, I've come to realize that you're all just like the people of Dahuang. They are fighting to provide for the countless people of this land who cannot provide for themselves. We walk the same path.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_001: Gavial doesn't do this kind of work, and nobody in the tribe wants to do this stuff either. So, that's why I help out a bit when I have the time.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_002: If there's no trainee nurse at the Medical Department, I can give it a try. I have some basic nursing knowledge.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_003: Doctor, this pen seems to be out of ink. Oh, wait! Please don't throw that out! If it's not too much to ask... Um... could I have that?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_004: I can't dig up the floors on Rhodes Island? There's no buried treasure? But where are all your precious things, then? Locked inside rooms? Oh, that's too bad…
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_005: My tail's gotten even bigger. If this keeps up, everyone's going to hate me for sure. Wuh... What do I do…?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_006: Some people are born strong and cool, others, smart. For me, I've got a big tail... Since we can't choose what we're born with, let's embrace our uniqueness and make the most of it. Um, of course, if you could help me out every now and then, Doctor... that would be best.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_007: I understand Gavial skipping work, but why would she skip a meal? Could something be bothering her so much that even she has to hide? And no one else even noticed. I'm the only one who can save her! Ah, Doctor, good thing you're here. Can you help me with something?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_008: Are you sure you want to see what's inside my backpack? Okay... I haven't organized it in a while so it might be kind of messy. Let's see… An amber wrapped in a leaf. A loose fang...? A bloodstained black crystal... and a stack of autographs?! Uh, Doctor, that's all for today! Sorry, but we're done here!
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_009: She shines with such brilliance that I can't help but stare, even as her flames scorch my eyes dry. That's my Gavial, she shines like the sun. Oh, by the way, I came across that passage in a book and thought it sounded nice, so I memorized it. It really fits Gavial, doesn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_010: I'll leave this dreamcatcher over here… May you have a pure and peaceful dream, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. Er, I'm not here to cause trouble. I'm here to… to... Study! Right, study. No reason for me to stay home alone if Gavial is here, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_012: Hmm... Maybe I should just practice on the battlefield, I guess…
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_013: Thank you for giving me such a pretty badge, Doctor. What? It's a promotion badge? Ah, uh, y-you sure...? A-A-Am I really qualified to have this?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_014: I'll be worthy of this flag one day, I swear I will.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_017: I'll watch and learn, Doctor. It would be great if I could actually master some of your skills…
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_018: You're leaving it to me? Really?
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_019: Let's go. We are gonna F… um… beat them up!
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_021: Please not me, please not me…
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_025: C-Come on, you can do this!
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_026: A little more, a little more!
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_029: I got beaten like that before, by you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_031: Phew, my back's sore. I need a break.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_033: Ah! Please don't throw that away yet. Can you leave it to me? I'll take care of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_036: Want to try Sargonian barbecue? I'll work the grill, you just enjoy the food, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_038: If today's a holiday, does that mean I can take the day off? Haghhh… Oh, where's Gavial? Have you seen her, Doctor? If I've got a free day, of course I'm going to spend it with Gavial!
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_043: Doctor! I brought you a birthday present! Umm... huh? Wh-Where did it go? I hid it behind my back so I could surprise you. How could it go missing...? Wahh… Oh! Here it is! It was stuck under my tail... Sorry about that, and happy birthday to you, Doctor. Hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_411_tomimi_CN_044: Doctor, I got a paper slip from the fortune box, and it says if I say five positive words to a plant every day, it will grow even bigger. Let me try it with this one! Tail, backpack, barbecue, sweet dreams... And... Gavial. Hehe... Doctor! Why are you laughing at me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_001: When I first became a Candleholder, it took me three whole months to finish reading all the literature in the Sui Regulator's library. The paperwork you have piled up here... is no less impressive in size. I will have time to familiarize myself with my duties, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_002: Doctor? Let me join you for a walk... Oh, it's just Kroos and Mr. Nothing said they would take me around to introduce myself to all the operators on the landship. They've been very warm, much more so than when we first met... Wait, what? You're inspecting the entire ship today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_003: My father forged these blades for me. 'Drive out the shadows of the Feranmut and all the people's troubles.' A Candleholder's work is not so simple that we can manage it with force alone... Um, of course, I've also been practicing my kung fu every day!
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_004: Yes, I do know Lin Qingyan. We held different titles, serving the Sui Regulator and the Central Judicial Office respectively. I've had my doubts about Rhodes Island before I arrived, and my time spent here has only doubled those suspicions. That being said, I shan't pry into the matters that 'Operator Leizi' is investigating.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_005: That Operator just now... was that Lord Wei's niece? No, I don't know her, but when I was little, my father told me to learn from her example. Not long ago, we discovered that Miss Ch'en resigned her position with the Lungmen Guard Department. Father did not say anything to me that day. Thinking back, I indeed find her admirable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_006: My father sent me to Dahuang in hopes that I would reflect upon my mistakes and improve as a man. Indeed, one should avoid deviating from the proper path. But perhaps my father's meaning runs deeper... Decades ago, he and the Grandmaster worked all night on a blade at the Sword Forge, making them late for work the following morning. Hmm... It may be that Father hates to see the flame in my heart snuff out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_007: I'll keep an eye on the siblings, but I can't simply stand by and watch as Nian plays mahjong. Doctor, you've seen those exaggerated metal casts of hers. She conjures them as effortlessly as she blinks. Don't you think she's... just a little obnoxious? I can tell you're not playing dumb. That's the trickiest part.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_008: On-deck capture the flag is no doubt a competition of athletic ability. I was the first to climb onto the bridge, but the Vulpo lady riding her staff breezed past me to snatch the flag. That is blatant cheating, Doctor. How could you accuse me of being too competitive and unsportsmanlike?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_009: This is a handbook that all Candleholders keep on their person. I did record some observations about you, Doctor. I'm very sorry. But for what it's worth, I am now sure of one thing: You are the guiding post of this ship, and you are indeed ordinary. I will shred those pages, and I will ensure your safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_010: The Feranmuts breathe with this vast land, and the Candleholder walks into the long night.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_011: Doctor, I am Zuo Le. The number of proxies aboard Rhodes Island has almost exceeded that of those in Yan. The Sui Regulator should have sent someone here long ago. In fact, it has been some time since we sent you an official notice, but it would seem your company may have forgotten to reply?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_012: For a pharmaceutical company to have so competently recorded and analyzed battle records… This is nigh unimaginable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_013: My sincerest apologies, in my capacity as the mandarin, I'm afraid I cannot accept any form of 'promotion' from Rhodes Island... Ahem, what I mean is... we will forgo the titles, but I can accept the other benefits.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_014: Each megastructure coursing through Catastrophes has a meaning unique to itself. Shangshu transferred its mountains and waterscapes to its nomadic cities, while Yumen fends off sandstorms with its Wind Aegis. And so, what of Rhodes Island? On what convictions do you sail?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_017: I hope my meager assistance will prove fruitful.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_018: To the right men, give the right jobs, enlist the talent, and forsake the snobs. I, Zuo Le, shall do my very best.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_019: The arrow has been nocked. Do not hesitate.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_020: The thrust of a blade takes no shape, take no comfort that it lies sheathed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_021: From here on, your words are my command.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_022: The situation is complicated, I shall improvise and adapt.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_023: When chaos abounds, tugging a single thread can pull the entire net.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_024: Not even a stirring of grass will go overlooked.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_025: Go no further, this road is closed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_026: Such violence will not be tolerated!
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_027: All balance held by the orders of Yan. All beasts hunted by the sons of man!
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_028: Tiny may a candle be, it shall drive out the darkest night!
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_029: Seeking total victory in peril. You are truly of extraordinary talent and courage.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_030: A unit never takes the same formation, as water never takes the same shape. Such extraordinary planning and execution... Doctor, I cannot fathom your past.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_031: Man strives for perfection, yet flaws remain in every plan. Doctor, the deed is done. Let's not dwell on it further.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_032: The Sui Regulator has contingencies for all possible outcomes. Leave the cleanup to me. Don't worry, my qinggong is good. I'll catch up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_033: I've lived in tents, and I've slept in fields. I'm not particularly demanding.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_034: You must have urgent need of assistance?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_036: Doctor, how about a game of weiqi? Or perhaps a capture-the-flag rematch?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_038: The northern mandarins are busy, just as farmers have little time for leisure... My duties have me traveling all across Yan. The Yanese are always busy, but this time of year, they come together to eat, to beat the drums, and to enjoy their reunions... The shadows have yet to fade, but likewise, the fireworks will never cease.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_042: Good timing. You must have something to discuss with me. Yes and no?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_043: I was a fairly mischievous boy. I once leapt into a sand wheel in Yumen, nearly costing me my life. It was my birthday, so my father had me wear this mask for the entire day. Happy birthday, Doctor. Rhodes Island won't be stopping, but would you like to hop off for a look? Don't worry, I'll fly you back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_044: Londinium, Gran Faro, Trimounts... Rhodes Island has played a role in many crises. The Sui Regulator knows that you are not a simple pharmaceutical company, of course, but you have been doing everything in your power to prevent invisible disasters. And so you may stand shoulder-to-shoulder with us.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: When I first became a Candleholder, it took me three whole months to finish reading all the literature in the Sui Regulator's library. The paperwork you have piled up here... is no less impressive in size. I will have time to familiarize myself with my duties, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: Doctor? Let me join you... Oh, Kroos and Mr. Nothing said you'd take me around for a 'bai shan men' today to meet all the operators on the landship. They've been very warm, much more so than when we first met... Hold on, are you going to tour the entire ship?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: My father forged these blades for me in Yumen himself. 'Exorcise the shadows of the Feranmuts, and ameliorate the plague on our land.' A Candleholder's work is not so simple that we can manage it with force alone... Um, of course, I've also been training as diligently as ever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: Yes, I do know Lin Qingyan. We held different titles, serving the Sui Regulator and the Central Judicial Office respectively. I've had some doubts about Rhodes Island both before and after I arrived here. That being said, I shan't pry into the matters that 'Operator Leizi' is investigating.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: That woman just now... was that Lord Wei's niece? No, I don't know her, but when I was little, my father told me to learn from her example. We later discovered that Miss Ch'en resigned her position. Father did not say anything to me that day. Thinking back, I indeed find her admirable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: My father sent me to Dahuang in hopes that I would improve myself. But decades ago, he and the Grandmaster worked all night forging a blade at the Sword Forge, making them late for work the following morning. Of course, one should avoid deviating from the proper path, but I think my father wanted me to hold on to that spirit.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: I'll keep an eye on the siblings, but I can't simply stand by and watch when Nian plays mahjong. You've seen those exaggerated casts that Nian conjures up, and you think she's... only a little obnoxious? You're not playing dumb. That's the trickiest part.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: On-deck capture the flag is a challenge of mobility. Even though I was the first to climb onto the bridge, the Vulpo lady rode her staff and breezed past me to snatch the flag... Doctor, that is blatant cheating. How could you accuse me of being too competitive and unsportsmanlike?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: This is a handbook that all Candleholders keep on their person. Yes, I recorded some observations about you... I'm very sorry, Doctor, but for what it's worth, I am now sure of one thing: You are the guiding post of this ship, and you are indeed ordinary. I will shred those pages, and I will ensure your safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: The beast walks with the generous earth, as the Candleholder walks into the long night...
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: Doctor, I am Zuo Le. The number of proxies aboard Rhodes Island has almost exceeded that of those in Yan. The Sui Regulator should have sent someone here long ago. In fact, it has been some time since we sent you an official notice, but it would seem your company may have forgotten to reply?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: To think that a pharmaceutical company has made such a competent analysis of battle records.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: My sincerest apologies, in my capacity as the mandarin Zuo Le, I'm afraid I cannot accept any form of 'promotion...' Ahem, what I mean is... we will forgo the titles, but I can accept the other benefits.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: Each megastructure coursing through Catastrophes has a meaning unique to itself. Shangshu transferred its mountains and waterscapes to its nomadic cities, while Yumen fends off sandstorms with its Wind Aegis. And so, what of Rhodes Island? On what convictions do you sail?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_017: I hope my meager assistance will prove fruitful.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: To choose the right man for the job is a virtue, to choose a talent is more virtuous still. I, Zuo Le, shall do my very best.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: The arrow has been nocked, why hesitate?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: The thrust of a blade takes no shape, take no comfort that it lies stowed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_021: From here on, your wish is my command.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_022: The more complicated the situation, the simpler it is for me to act.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_023: When chaos abounds, the most minute adjustment can change everything.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_024: Not even the slightest stirring of grass will go overlooked.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_025: Go no further, this road is closed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: Let there be order in Yan, and may Heaven safeguard our hunt.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: Even the shortest candle may exorcise the longest dark of night!
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: Seeking total victory in peril. You are truly of extraordinary talent and courage.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: A unit never takes the same formation, as water never takes the same shape. Such extraordinary planning and execution... Doctor, I cannot fathom your past.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Man strives for perfection, yet flaws remain in every plan. Doctor, the deed is done. Let's not dwell on it further.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: The Sui Regulator has contingencies for all possible outcomes, of course. Leave the cleanup to me. I have good qinggong. I'll catch up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: I've lived in tents, and I've slept in fields. I'm not particularly demanding.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: You must have urgent need of assistance?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Doctor, how about a game of weiqi? Or perhaps a capture-the-flag rematch?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: The northern mandarins are busy, just as farmers have little time for leisure... My duties have me traveling all across Yan. The Yanese are always busy, but this time of year, they come together to eat, to beat the drums, and to enjoy their reunions... The shadows have yet to fade, but likewise, the fireworks will never cease.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Good timing. You must have something to discuss with me... Yes and no?
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: I was a fairly mischievous boy. I once leapt into a sand wheel in Yumen, nearly costing me my life. It was my birthday, so my father had me wear this mask for the entire day. Happy birthday, Doctor. Rhodes Island won't be stopping, but would you like to hop off for a look? Don't worry, I'll fly you back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4121_zuole_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: Londinium, Gran Faro, Trimounts... Rhodes Island has played a role in many crises. The Sui Regulator knows that you are not a simple pharmaceutical company, of course, but you have been doing everything in your power to prevent invisible disasters. And so you may stand shoulder-to-shoulder with us.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_001: I looked after the stockbeasts in Dahuang, so I'm looking after you here, of course. You'll have to listen to me, work hard, and rest on time. Let's see... It's rest time now. Let's head out and have some fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_002: Of course I know what the stockbeasts are saying. The beastlings in Dahuang always talk to me about things like what kind of snacks they want or who they like, and I sneak them a little help. This apple? A stockbeast asked for it, obviously. I'm just tasting it for them, making sure it's sweet enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_003: Zuo Le is Candlestick, the Record Keeper is Inkbrush, that blinged out guy is Megaphone, and you're Wisehead. I also know a Tall Shades and Smiley Sharpshooter! Oh, and Amiya is the best! We made a promise to come up with a better nickname for you together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_004: Shu made me this fowlbeast whistle, and whenever I wanna tell the stockbeasts to go home, I give it a blow. Sometimes, when Dahuang feels empty, I sit down on the street corner to play it. People come and go, and my whistle's my goodbye and hello.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_005: Dahuang's operas are sung in different dialects. That commemorates the farmers who came to our rescue a few centuries ago. They were from all across Yan, farming here for generations. They're why Dahuang fields are so fertile and prosperous now. I'm really proud that I can play the accompaniment on my flute here every year!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_006: When I first stood on the terraces, I could only see the aqueducts, but after the farmlands were raised, I could see the edge of the city, and now that Shu brought me here, I can see the horizon from the top deck. Megaphone tells me that Baba and Mama will come back someday, but when, exactly?
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_007: Could you draw a line over my head...? I'm not standing on my tiptoes! I'm not stretching my neck out, either! Are you done? Let's see. See? I told you I got taller! Maybe I'll be taller than Xiaohe next year! Let's see how tall you are. Minus your hood and shoes, you... come up to my shoulders!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_008: When I'm in a bad mood, I sometimes go to the embankment to play my flute. There's a woodcutter there who yelled at me every time, but he always quieted down as soon as I played this song. He even hummed along. That was the first time I saw him smile! Like I said, I'm really good at the flute.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_009: The farmers say that the stockbeasts live by following water and grass. Fowlbeasts fly freely in the sky, but they always eventually land in the fields. I know what that means now.  Everyone has a field to call their own. Rhodes Island is your field, and you are the fowlbeast that will come back to land, isn't that right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_010: Hm... You fell asleep...? You really fell asleep...? Hehe, have this coat then. Have a good dream. I'm off to have some fun!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_011: Shu brought me here to hang! I think I wrote my name on a document she was supposed to sign...? She said it was fine, though. Now that I've signed it, I get to come here to hang out all the time!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_012: ...Wah! I'd never fall asleep in class, Laoshi...! Huh? It's you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_013: I developed a way to train stockbeasts to identify foods based on their smell. The Tianshi Bureaus gave me a medal for it. It doesn't have a serial number, but it says how amazing I am! And now I have this one you gave me. I'm putting them next to each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_014: I got taller again, right? By the time I'm as tall as you, the people of Dahuang will definitely have cultivated the seeds they want. When that happens, I'll invite you to come sit with us in the fields. The rice flowers are gonna look even better then!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_017: Is it time to do pest control again? I'm the best at catching these nasty little things!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_018: Trust me. I know I can do it extra good.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_019: Listen up, get your boots on, and tread lightly!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_021: Qui-Qui-Quick! The pests are getting away.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_022: I saw them hiding in the bushes there!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_024: None of you are getting away this time!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_026: Come any closer, and I'll whap your heads with my flute!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_028: And don't ever come back to our fields!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_029: Come on, let's go! We need to hurry and tell Shu. She's going to be so happy with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_030: Next year, the year after, and the year after that... One day, the whole of Dahuang will live without fear of Catastrophes or pests, and we'll have stack our harvests as high as Heaven for Shennong.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_031: It's okay. We've been through Catastrophes much worse than this. This one's just a little setback. We'll work harder next season!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_032: We're in trouble... I'll go get the Tianshi to help us!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_033: I want to sneak out when the landship docks. Can you keep it from Shu?
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_034: These buns aren't for you to grab!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_036: Have you learned to play the song I taught you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_038: Here. A multigrain fragrance sachet! It's made by blending some grains and medicinal herbs. Keep it on you, and you're guaranteed peace and good health for the rest of the year. And you should definitely have a bowl of multigrain rice with multigrain beer. The farmers always tell me how good the multigrain beer tastes, but when I took a sip—It was so spicy and bitter!
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_042: I have the basket ready. Should we head to the fields to catch mudfins together?
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_043: I made you a bowl of noodles. Give it a try. I remember when I was still a kid, Shu always made me a bowl of longevity noodles for my birthday. An entire bowl made up of a single noodle. She always added a fried egg over easy too. I think this one might be overcooked, though. It might... have turned into a bowl of gruel.
dialogue_tracker.char_4122_grabds_CN_044: I saw Rhodes Island splitting the sandstorm and sailing here. It felt just like the first time I saw Dahuang protecting the fields and overcoming the Catastrophe with its newly-built buildings. As long as everyone works together, no matter if it's a Catastrophe or anything else, there's always a way, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_001: Since you're stuck here sifting through documents, I might as well help you solve a few problems around the office.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_002: Hitting supply lines does a whole lot more damage than taking out people.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_003: If you ask me, your office is on the bland side. Just hit me up if you ever want to mix things up a little.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_004: The whole 'cozy family relationship' thing isn't for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_005: I get a lot more out of talking to strangers than I do from that 'self-help' shtick.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_006: We define ourselves by symbols, but those symbols can be perverted. Reused. Reworked, reframed, remade. In a word, stolen. Who are you then?
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_007: I don't mind helping you run errands out of combat, but on the battlefield, I need ample room to call the shots.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_008: When someone can't find fault with your results and has to resort to nitpicking your attitude, that tells you everything you need to know about them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_009: To call the shots, you need to prove that you've got what it takes – and you've certainly done that. So, where are you sending me next?
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_010: Your workload is clearly excessive, even by the highest standards. Take a rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_011: Codename Ela, member of Team Rainbow. Just give me my objective, then sit back and wait for the good news.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_012: Picked up a few new tricks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_013: A medal? Thanks. Workmanship's not bad at all, as far as decorations go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_014: Together, we can shake the very stars from the sky.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_018: Time to show you what I can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_030: I'm sorry, was I too fast for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4123_ela_CN_034: Do me a favor, don't talk to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_001: Not sure if it's really me standing before you? Here's a hint: the Gemini doesn't talk.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_002: Multitasking has never been a problem for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_004: You need to clean your pot regularly, if you want decent coffee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_005: Seeing is not always believing. Technology reveals the hidden truth.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_006: I've encountered a few difficulties because of my appearance. No more than that, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_009: I wonder what souvenirs I'll take home from this unforgettable journey.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_010: Hold on, I'll be right back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_011: Code name Iana, Team Rainbow. There's a lot of intel we can share with each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_013: A promotion? Do I get more access permissions?
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_014: Here's hoping this helps me reach more unexplored corners.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_017: Friendly reminder, my hologram doesn't stop bullets.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_019: Rage against the dying of the light.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_029: All systems are complementary, if you know how to connect them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_031: You've still got fight in you, show them what you're made of.
dialogue_tracker.char_4124_iana_CN_033: If that's how you want it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_001: Here are the files, and this is your coffee. No need to thank me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_002: Yes…? Oh! Sorry Doctor, I thought an operator was calling out to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_003: If you can hold a scalpel, you can hold a gun. Never doubt the steadiness of a surgeon's hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_004: Neither sickness nor the enemy can take from me what I want to protect.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_005: When you have walked with death, you learn to appreciate life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_006: I've learned from experience that the place to save lives is in the field, not an office. And sometimes, the only way to save a life is to take one.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_007: My job is to keep you alive. Make it as hard as you like.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_008: Not a fan of your worried face. What's the matter?
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_009: Doctor. I'm so glad we found you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_010: When was the last time you took a break? You need to stop working.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_011: Code name Doc, Team Rainbow. I'll protect you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_014: Thank you, I'd been hoping to get authorization to access confidential files on Oripathy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_017: Call if you need a hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_019: At least we are well prepared.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_020: There are still active targets in the area.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_024: Try not to get yourselves hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_029: Are you alright? Any difficulty breathing?
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_030: We're almost at the extraction point. Then, we can rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_031: Let's get you back on your feet, shall we?
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_034: Careful, I'm carrying a bunch of bric-a-bracs.
dialogue_tracker.char_4125_rdoc_CN_036: Nothing abnormal. If we get a situation, I'll let you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_001: Right... Let me know if you need anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_002: Watch out. There are a lot of dangerous materials in the workroom.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_003: Engineering Department... Not bad. The head of the department, though... A bit too talkative.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_004: I like machines. They don't talk, but they're always honest with their readings.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_005: Chaos is only an enemy if you're unable to adapt.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_006: When the approaching chaos endangers your loved ones, the thing to do isn't to protect them. It's... to keep them as far away from you as possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_007: No, my comms equipment's fine. Nothing to worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_008: You want me to say something? Uh, that's the hardest part.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_009: My hometown? There... the sky is blue, and all the buildings under it are blue, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_010: Good... I'll find something to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_011: Rainbow Operator, codename Fuze. I've said everything I need to. Let's get to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_012: No problem. I'll find some time to watch them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_014: Do I need to give some crowd a speech? No? Good.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_021: Focus on the task at hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_029: Every action builds our chances to win.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_031: On your feet, your wounds are not fatal.
dialogue_tracker.char_4126_fuze_CN_036: I made some pilaf. Want some?
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_001: I'd appreciate it if you let me keep a bit of distance... There's a smell on me I can't get off, no matter how hard I try.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_002: I got this coat from a certain sergeant. Death had already come for her at the time. Her expression was softening, her breathing getting shallower and shallower. I held her hand, and waited... Waited until her head nodded a bit. I helped her close her eyes, and then completed our trade.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_003: Excuse me, Doctor, could you check if this is the right way to record birth and death dates? Oh, don't worry, nobody died. This is for me, in case something happens to me one day. If someone manages to find this, then I'll at least have a decent tombstone or marker... A lot better than an unmarked brick at least.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_004: There was another girl with me getting treatment in Medical. She had a familiar scent on her. Her flame of life burned even dimmer than mine... But she didn't seem to mind at all, just humming happily to herself. What gave her the strength? I envy her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_005: Rhodes Island is always rushing from one conflict to another. I used to be like that too. The difference is, you do it to save people... I was doing it just to save myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_006: Doctor, the operators who made the ultimate sacrifice... their dorms are just as they left them, as if their owners had just stepped out for a minute. This huge ship carries so much that has already passed on... How are you able to hold such a clear course...? As if none of you doubt anything?
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_007: Cantabile taught me to read some of the words in the book today. 'The warm soil uplifts the mist, the branches trace light's brows, and fowlbeasts sing in the dawnlight.' I wanted to know where I could find a place like this, so I asked her... But she went quiet on me. Maybe... it's just someone's imagination.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_008: There's this one particularly ugly type of fowlbeast, big as a human child, with a scary cry. Flocks of them storm onto battlefields, looking for food. When I was a kid, I'd get into fights with them and end up with bruises all over. But, once I grew up, I lost the guts to face them, let alone look them in the eye.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_009: The longer you live in a war, the more you end up forgetting. I can't remember the faces of a lot of those who've died, but new faces appear in front of me every day... If the war ever ends, then I'll finally be able to remember them all. That's why I'm prepared to follow you and your ideals.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_010: I don't like watching people sleep, but... your heartbeat is steady, and that puts me at ease… Rest, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_011: I'm just a girl who cleans up war zones. If you need me for anything, please call me by the name… Lutonada.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_012: So, this is one way to prevent people from dying...
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_013: I've got a vague idea of what a 'promotion' is. A sergeant wears sturdier clothes than a footman, and carries more valuables... I appreciate it a lot, Doctor…
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_014: Tell me, does this mean I get to keep on walking this path with you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_017: Your faith in me... I'll etch it into my heart...
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_018: No more lives will be lost in vain…
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_019: Before the flames of war can spread…
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_025: Your lives are safe in my hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_027: I'll handle this on my own.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_029: This place is not for any of you to clean up. Go home, and enjoy a good night's sleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_030: 'Preventing conflict provides more solace than mourning.' ...These words only made sense after living through them firsthand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_031: They might've gotten away, but they won't want to bleed again. Not a bad end to things.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_032: I vow to lead everyone off the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_033: It's nice, clean, and quiet here... just like the inside of a coffin.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_034: Did you need me? I'm here, as always.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_036: Ah, I'm sorry... I won't sleep under the bed again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_038: Did something happen today? Everyone looks so happy… New Year's? A once-a-year occasion? Alright. I used to have to live every day as if it was my last. Never could've imagined that I'd be celebrating a special one.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_042: Stay healthy, Doctor. Live a life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_043: Life is the opposite of death. It means infinite possibility... In that sense, one's day of birth is very much worth celebrating. I'd like to ask... can today also be my birthday? I would like to share in this joy with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4130_luton_CN_044: The medic says my condition has stabilized, and that I've been approved to travel outside. Doctor, do you think... I should try looking for other kinds of work? Not for the dead, but for the living.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_001: Doctor, I'm leaving the landship tomorrow, so I tidied up your office. I put your daily necessities on your desk, and sorted everything else into the cabinets. You can refer to the notes I made whenever you take or return something, so you'll remember where they are.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_002: Hm? You're talking to me? No, it's just, I only saw you a few times from a distance during our Babel days, and we never had a conversation. I saw you on the deck once. A gust of wind almost blew your coat away , so I wanted to remind you to wear more layers, but in the end... I didn't have the guts to  approach you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_003: Doctor! Sorry, I should have mentioned not to touch my weapon. I'll apply some ointment for you, and you can keep the rest too. It was made for situations like this anyway, and it's pretty good for burns. What about me? It's fine... I've been used to its heat since long ago.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_004: Doctor, why are you always giving me these toys? What? Because I have a baby face? Hahaha, I'm much older than you think. But you do remind me of the first toy I got as a boy, it was my mom's sword. When she gave it to me, she also said it was time I learned to be a man.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_005: I grew up in Kazdel. It sounds like I had it easy, but I'm sure you know it's hard for a couple to raise a child there. They probably burned all the luck they had to let their boy grow up safe and sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_006: Too many things happened in Babel, so it's best you don't pry. Nah, I'm not running from the past. I simply think people naturally forget the past if they choose to keep moving forward. To hate, forgive, or to do neither, none of it matters.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_007: Doctor, someone asked me to give you this letter. She used to be in Babel's assault squad, but now she's back in Kazdel working as a smith. You can't make sense of it? Let me see... Man, there's so many spelling mistakes... Alright, so she's asking... how you are... Saying you should eat more... And wishing... you're still with all your limbs?
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_008: One year, everyone was celebrating a victory here in the canteen. We were both there, but with a group of people between us. People leave, scatter, and now only we two are left at this table. Oh, don't be upset, Doctor. Please, don't be upset. It's alright if you don't remember, at least I still do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_009: You're... oh, it's you, Doctor. I've had a bit too much to drink... Y-You're awful clever, could you tell me something? Why do I have to see so much turmoil... and change? Shouldn't our eyes... be filled with nothing... but our loved ones?
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_010: Sorry to wake you, Doctor. I shouldn't have barged in like that. The weather's been getting colder, so I... just wanted to make sure you stay warm.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_011: Maybe you don't remember me, Doctor? I used to work for you a long time ago. Odda. That's my name.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_012: This training method is pretty good. I remember how recruits used to be sent straight to the battlefield, they would've more or less learned how to fight, if they managed to survive.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_013: Thanks, Doctor. I'm always anticipating your approval.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_014: That's great... you don't exchange heads for rewards here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_017: Live on, so we can see each other again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_018: Don't come too close to me, the flames might sputter.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_020: I'm sorry we had to meet here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_021: This blade has gone through countless whetstones.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_022: This hammer has gone through many years of tempering.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_027: You won't take what I've got now!
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_029: Thank you for lending me your luck, Pops...
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_030: Let's go back, Doctor. I'm craving a huge cup of ice water right about now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_032: Doctor, no matter how things turned out, it's over... let's go back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_033: Doctor, should I turn up the air conditioner? Sorry, my body gets so hot, it's even heating up our surroundings.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_034: Whoa! Your fingers are so cold!
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_036: Ah! Please don't touch my tail. It broke off once, and it doesn't feel good if people touch it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_038: Doctor, I know a new year means new expectations. But... I've long since stopped wanting anything more than not losing what I've got now. That's my biggest hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_042: Don't forget to eat and drink water regularly, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I got some biscuits from Kazdel for you. I guess you could say they're a local specialty? We always eat them on our birthdays. Yes? You bit into something hard? Oh, it's just a tiny piece of shrapnel. Probably flew in while they were being made. It's fine, just toss that bit away and eat the rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4131_odda_CN_044: There was a time when I got myself somewhere high up all alone, thinking I'd see a different view above Kazdel that wasn't just the usual smoke and fire. But even when my eyes were hurting from the smoke, I still couldn't see anything. Unlike the past, today I can see a different sight with you on the landship— a sky so pretty and blue.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_001: Don't bother checking, it's me. We've got a situation, so I swapped schedules with your other assistant. Don't worry, you'll get used to this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_002: That HR op wants me to take a break? Hmph, I know she means well, but I won't rest until she's willing to take a break herself. One of S.W.E.E.P.'s functions is to take care of her work while she's out. We might as well keep things as they are. What's S.W.E.E.P. established for? You don't need to know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_003: Don't trouble yourself trying to figure me out. Even the old you couldn't manage it. Remember, it's my own choice to vanish from your sight. With my duty fulfilled, I won't be interfering with Rhodes Island's future plan. But when you need me, I'll be there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_004: Amnesia is a convenient excuse. You're the only one who knows if you are faking it or not. But since you've taken Rhodes Island this far, true or not, I won't question you. I'm watching you, Doctor, same as ever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_005: When we face Theresis, that will be our final curtain call. What about the future? No point in playing with hypotheticals. W, Hoederer, Closure... Those who witnessed Babel's struggle still stand united with Rhodes Island. They are the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_006: When people talk about Her Highness, they treat her like the unattainable future of the Sarkaz. But to me, she is who she is. She trips over her dress, she intentionally 'forgets' certain meetings, she gives me hugs. Pass over that 'Theresa'? I wouldn't hesitate to do so.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_007: Back when I was wandering the wastes, I didn't fear the dark of night. It scared me less than the sandbeasts biting my toes. Even now, seeing them still makes me feel kinda nervous. It's fine, no harm in letting you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_008: Mercenaries, spies, nobles, convicts... Rhodes Island these days is far more complex than back in the Babel times, and the threats are greater too. It's natural for you to worry. How would the old you have handled it? Doesn't matter. This you knows what to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_009: S.W.E.E.P. never expressed any opinion on the Chernobog operation. Saving you was a unanimous decision by Dr. Kal'tsit and the elite operators. I didn't kill you back then, because I needed time to observe you. In view of the present, my judgment seems correct. Doctor, don't disappoint me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_010: Fate. I've pursued it, confronted it, and finally strangled it to death. You've done the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_011: Ascalon, it's my only name. Call it a code name if you like. But if you want to update my file, you'll have to speak to Dr. Kal'tsit first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_012: The training paid off. Not bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_013: S.W.E.E.P. was established as an independent unit. It's out of Rhodes Island's structures from the very beginning, so this framework doesn't apply to me. You have a new approach? I appreciate the recognition, but those of us in the shadows don't care for glory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_014: It's not time yet. Only the darkness can shroud all the filth. Doctor, when the day comes that Rhodes Island no longer needs S.W.E.E.P., I'll come to you, and take it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_017: Go right ahead at any moment. I'll be there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_018: I've assessed the risks. I'll lead the team on this operation.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_019: Keep track of my position. I'm ready to strike.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_029: Confidence of our companions is earned. The road ahead is perilous, these victories are precious.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_030: Limit the enemy's choices, forcing them into unwitting traps. A familiar style... Hmm... you really don't remember anything? Sooner or later, you'll have to face yourself, so think carefully. Bear in mind, this time, I'm ready to correct your mistakes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_031: The ones who got away will be useful, when the time is right. Don't chase them too hard, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_032: Keep moving ahead with confidence, and don't look back. Seeing me again means you're safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_033: I know where to go. I can handle myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_038: It's not easy to celebrate New Year's in Kazdel, where you always face unpredictable threats. That's why I cherish the changes we've seen at Rhodes Island over the years. Thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_042: With a foot in the darkness, the light becomes clearer. You want to see? No, you don't belong there.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_043: The party is too loud, so you came out for some fresh air? I've been here all along, you just didn't see me. Your safety is the most important thing. And in such a mixed company, reducing my presence makes the mission easier. Oh, and happy birthday, I didn't get a chance to say it inside.
dialogue_tracker.char_4132_ascln_CN_044: Babel is history. Her Highness has shown that that path has no future. And while Rhodes Island's future is even more challenging now, you have ever more companions. I have no doubt that Rhodes Island is on the right path.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_001: The encrypted incantations on these files have been dispelled, you can now read them at your leisure. Except for one register, on which the curse is too cumbersome to remove. May I inquire, Doctor, why you suddenly went silent a moment ago?
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_002: Perplexed? Not quite, I'm just trying to think of a faster way to solve the puzzle program that Mechanist left. However, his ingenious design is providing me with fresh inspiration for my own incantation-weaving. Would you like to join the contest as well, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_003: Mist kisses the travelers' lips, while water ripples caress the soul.' Such is life in the Convallis. Do you still have any other unanswered questions? Uh, what is a 'Hostess'...? Ahem, by the looks of things, you've already met those enthusiastic sisters of mine. Regarding that traditional title of Lord of the Banshees, it is not something I reject altogether.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_004: The power of 'language' comes from rules and restraints, not from arbitrary imagination. Only by imposing constraints upon yourself can you make progress in the incantation Arts. Master this, and overnight, your knowledge of incantations will surpass the innate talent afforded to our kind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_005: The myriad souls have long departed, but our souls still must find rest. If the deceased require guidance on their journey to the other side, then I am willing to become the ferryman of the Sarkaz, of my countrymen on this great land... Indeed, I'm far from capable of singing an elegy for every departed compatriot, but I will not give up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_006: The prophecy that frightened the King of Sarkaz? Now that Amiya and Rhodes Island have overcome the past, the flame of hope to conquer fate still burns. Doctor, I hereby swear that as long as I am here, we shall never be slaves to that prophecy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_007: Did you notice, Doctor? Indeed, the decorations on my uniform are incantations engraved by my own two hands. It is difficult for normal fabrics to contain such power, so I could only seek help from my colleagues in the Logistics Department, who painstakingly modified the textiles of the Convallis. The nightcap I intend to give you is also made through similar methods. I additionally engraved it with an incantation to help you sleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_008: After learning the truth of what happened back then, you've sought out many of our colleagues, so I figured it was only a matter of time until you'd come looking for me. What do I think? I harbor no hatred for you, Doctor. Amiya mentioned to me that you're being haunted by nightmares. I can dispel them for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_009: The same incantation can be interpreted as desired, manifesting its effect in a thousand different ways. If words have countless interpretations, so do names. Dr. {@nickname}, were you to add your name to this incantation, what do you think it would invoke? I'm eager to find out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_010: A blindfold? No need. This 'Banshee's Crown' is enough to cover my eyes and help me sleep, as it contains an incantation forbidding those who would touch— You lost consciousness? Oof... do sleep well, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_011: Rhodes Island elite operator, Logos, reporting in. I think this procedure calls for some formality, cumbersome as it may be— Doctor, you're not thinking of leaving early again, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_012: This battle once offered much inspiration for choreographing my cadence.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_013: Sorry to arrive late to such an important occasion. What part are we at now? My face is flushed? Hmm, looks like there are still some hiccups in the 'hangover removal' incantation I was working on with Mechanist.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_014: Cross beyond death, and usher in a more just vision...' Elite operators have never been in the business of signing blood oaths, but they invariably dedicate their lives in service to their ideals. The fact that we still stand together after all this time, Doctor, is rare indeed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_017: Questions are destined to be answered; rules, bound to be analyzed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_019: Never mind the use of force. Death has its own resting place.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_020: Just as incantations must be restrained, so too must the enemy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_027: Soulriver, the Ferry of the Other Side.'
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_029: Join in our celebration, Doctor. Your joy in this moment is enough to embellish my incantations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_030: Every incantation I wrote was utilized by you, with not a single word wasted. We make for an excellent team, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_031: I can still hear their cries in the distance. The wrathful, unable to find peaceful slumber... There will come a day when the dead will know rest. I'm sure of it, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_032: Retreat. The curtain will cover your tracks.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_033: May I use my own office chair?
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_036: Um… You're stepping on my cloth…
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_038: My mother brought me reeds from the Convallis. I intertwined them with song and incantation, connecting them end-to-end, and formed them into a necklace. It will wither in the night of the old year and sprout in the dawn of the new year. This piece, bearing blessings of new life, is my gift for you, Doctor. Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_042: Doctor, did I bother you with my whistling? No? That's a relief to hear. What is the name of this piece? It's untitled; just an improv piece I came up with in my spare time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. How many years have I been offering my blessings to you now? You don't remember either...? It's fine. Sometimes, forgetting is a blessing in its own right, letting the past be put to rest. Just remember that I'll still be here for you next year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4133_logos_CN_044: I first came here as a wanderer in search of knowledge. Though the fragments of Rhodes Island's past are lost to time, hope remains. We have overcome the nightmares of the bygone days. As for where we ought to go in the future, I believe you already know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_001: I still remember this conference room. This seat… was it reserved for Theresa? No... I have no need for it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_002: Theresa is no more. This body, this vestige before you, is but a program that exists within the 'King of Sarkaz.' My form and my presence are the result of Amiya's emotions. As much as I may remember everything from the past, please do not mistake me for Theresa herself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_003: I will stay by Amiya's side, accompanying everyone here at Rhodes Island. Though, this hardly makes up for all the lost time... Doctor, I'm not a program in the same sense as PRTS. See? You might not be able to feel my body temperature, but I can at least smile.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_004: Rhodes Island has strode beyond war, and should now re-embark on her intended route. For starters, how about optimizing our logistics? There are several conference rooms that can be freed up and converted into sickbays... You'd like my personal opinion? Doctor, allow me to remind you again, I am not Theresa.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_005: 'Rhodes Island Pharmaceuticals Inc.'... registered to Amiya's hometown... And these medicines... They were all developed by Kal'tsit... No, I have no regrets. Babel has fulfilled its duty. Rhodes Island will continue to sail, and continue to alleviate sickness and pain. If Theresa was here, I'm sure she would have been pleased.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_006: Never have I regretted any of my decisions. We did everything we could have done, and bequeathed hope unto the future. Time will close wounds, love will mend scars. When the long night ends, Rhodes Island will usher in the light of dawn. Though many have left us along the way, I will remain here and bear witness to the ending.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_007: Amiya still looks so thin and frail. For a girl at this age, maybe she should be a bit taller? All these days, has she been eating well…? How she so wished to see Amiya as she is now, to watch her grow for just a bit longer. Her wish should have been granted...
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_008: Kal'tsit still refuses to speak to me. When she poses questions to this crown, she avoids looking me in the eye. 'The King of Sarkaz' remembers her past. While I can sympathize with her loneliness, I cannot free her from her shackles. Perhaps one day, Doctor, you can help her find meaning in her existence, as her companion.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_009: Doctor, you carry such guilt within your eyes. But you ask, is one's memory sufficient to define who they are? You have lost your memories. I merely inherited all of hers. How are we to settle what happened so long ago? Doctor, go and spend some more time with Amiya and Kal'tsit. None shall linger in the past, except her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_010: Are you weary, Doctor? Then, go ahead and rest. Everyone has the right to fall into peaceful slumber, and you are no exception.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_013: I still remember every medal I distributed with these very hands. These ceremonies are also commitments. Rhodes Island will never give up on her ideals, let sacrifices be in vain, or forget about those who've traveled with her. Even now, we remain on the same course we originally charted.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_014: I know, there are still many people who need me. Don't worry. This time, I'm not going anywhere.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_017: Will you lead us to victory once more, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_018: I will stand alongside the warriors of Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_019: Warriors of Rhodes Island, may you all return victorious.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_020: I can hear the sorrow within you all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_021: Doctor, I have faith in your command.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_022: It's okay. I am with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_024: I am right here. I will always remain with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_025: I will remember each and every one of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_026: Your ideals... are equally worthy of respect.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_027: Keep striding forward. I shall be at your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_028: Don't cry. It will all be over soon.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_029: There shall come a day... when we can strike alight the flames that burn away all decay.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_030: You always make the perfect calculations so that everything falls into place just as you planned, don't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_031: Without you, our casualties would have been far worse... Thank you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_032: We will be able to move beyond this pain and suffering. Rhodes Island will not stop here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_033: A new security system? Will it still recognize me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Rhodes Island is a lot livelier than it used to be. Though there's still so much unfinished business, this moment of peace is precious nevertheless. Doctor, can you give these storybooks and toys to the children for me? It's something Theresa always used to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. How did you used to celebrate this day in the previous world? It must've been a scene full of warmth and happiness. I found one such song in 'Civilight Eterna.' Would you like to listen to it? Before that, Doctor, may you never be alone again in the journey ahead.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_CN_044: 'Rhodes Island.' This very name fills one with warmth and comfort. Surely, tender memories will rush forth as soon as you speak these words. I hope that Rhodes Island can continue to carry forth the hopes and expectations of countless people, and in the future, become home for many, many more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_001: 记忆化作殿堂，结构会比莱塔尼亚人的乐器还要精巧，比死魂灵的呓语更难解。支撑起整座殿堂的梁柱，也许只是一口汤的味道。而这座殿堂，与其说是砖石垒成，不如说是丝线织就......
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_002: 在特蕾西娅的记忆中深潜是一件古怪的事。这一切早已存在于我之中，但我探索这些记忆......就像一个读者。这很古怪......这份深潜记录，我是不会对你开放的，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_003: 卫国战争，它让一个衣匠成了英雄，又让英雄成了魔王......嗯，这里就是开端：特雷西斯捶响房门，特蕾西娅放下了剪刀。打开门发现，傍晚下起了暴雨。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_004: 那天，那位歌利亚冲出城门斩首了一个高卢军官，我们才缓了口气。他拿回了高卢人的外套，但只是从侧兜里掏出一块糖，让我带给一个伤兵......可我没能送到，也没能忍心告诉他这件事。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_005: 我们抓住了唯一的胜机。凯尔希本不打算杀死以勒什，她想将黑冠从萨卡兹的传承中剥离，而“懦弱的魔王”以仅有的方法阻挠了她。战争就这样被延长了......直到特雷西斯得以挥出那一剑。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_006: 凯尔希从“茧”中重生的那一刻，我也犹豫过，但她的眼神竟有些熟悉。戴上黑冠后，我时而见到......我想，也许我们不是必须成为敌人。我很庆幸我那么想了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_007: 那时贝尔莎已经不年轻了，老师说没想到她会来。贝尔莎笑着说，反正她那个牙尖嘴利的学徒跑不了了，就算她死在卡兹戴尔也没关系。她和我们开过那么多玩笑，我唯独，不喜欢这一个......
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_008: 这个秘密我保守了很久......那次换防，老师的布条缠在了一个卡普里尼脑袋的角上，他绊了一跤。我没有笑。真的没有。嗯......直到我告诉了阿米娅。反正她总会知道的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_009: 特雷西斯总是不笑。我戳过他的眉头那么多次，他就是改不了。但......胜利的那一天，我们以为终于结束了，终于能回家了的时候，我看到他笑了。下一刻，那顶小小的王冠浮在了我们中间。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_010: 有一次，我六十个小时没有合眼，菈玛莲为了强迫我睡觉，给我唱了一支歌......那是我第一次听到女妖除了挽歌之外的歌声。虽然，我只听了一句半就睡着了......
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_011: 这份深潜记录只属于我。它们离你很遥远，甚至离“那之前”的你也是。这是两百年前的故事，是泰拉的特蕾西娅的过去。但如果设想有一位旅伴......
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_012: ......即使走过战争筑造的回廊，也很少见到战场厮杀的画面。当然，她想要铭记的不会是那些。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_013: 如果这只是一段探索记忆的旅程，它该是愉快的......这里最坚固、柔韧、光洁的丝线，总是与希望、信任和爱有关。我明白她的意思。我当然能。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_014: 所有这些被珍重的记忆，愉快的记忆，看得越多，越使我感受到另一种情感。这种情感该是叫做“哀悼”。我哀悼......她。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_017: 我知道。还没到能休息的时候。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_018: 那么，一定要服从我的指挥。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_019: 有增援的消息吗？歌利亚那边怎么样了？
