dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_020: ......只能这样上了。没关系，我们会找到机会的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_022: 血魔已经在路上了？好，我会守住这里。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_023: 占领前方高地，必须让石翼魔修好这段工事。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_024: 不能再后退了。我留下，你们去通知贝尔莎。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_025: 特雷西斯，杀死他们。入侵者没有权利在这里举剑。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_026: 菈玛莲，我会让他们沉默。异邦人的乐音不会再干扰你的歌声。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_027: 是你们不该出现在这里。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_028: 你们以为能从卡兹戴尔得到什么？
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_029: 那之后，联军的旗帜如流水一样退去，露出阳光下皴裂的卡兹戴尔。多少人死在了洪潮之中。但那一天我们知道，没有什么能淹没我们的城市。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_030: ......必须有人思考，胜利之后又将怎样。只是，放下剪刀的时候，特蕾西娅还没有察觉，谁将成为这个人。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_031: 全胜并不存在。用空间换取时间，用后撤拉扯攻势，用西线的血潭交换东线的寸进，即使是特蕾西娅，也开始把一切换算成战斗的资源，直到......不，全胜并不存在，每个人都是代价。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_033: ......如果走得足够远，我会......唔，不会的。我原本就认识这里的一切。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_034: 我没有睡着。所以，你也叫不醒我。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_036: 其实我还记得你的手的触感，不过，你不会记得我的了，对吧？
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_038: 人活得越长，一年就会变得越短，过去会越发庞大，现在会越发渺小——计算上来说，是这样的。但其实我们都很容易被骗哦。今年会是最好的一年，要相信我吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_042: 休息好了，继续向前走吗？......博士，如果你在这里，我就可以这样问你。如果你在的话。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_043: 其实，你可以拥有宇宙中的一切的。热，光，引力，空间，存在的次序。如果没有回到原本的终点，你会恨我吗？即使如此......也请收下我的礼物吧，不论你拥有一切，或是一无所有。
dialogue_tracker.char_4134_cetsyr_epoque#50_CN_044: 回溯记忆的时候会发现，那些梦的种子在一开始是多么微小。你也是一样吗？罗德岛会驶向我们共同期许的那个未来吧。这一次，我会一直在的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_001: Please do not feel anxious, Doctor. You're not a person with a chaotic mind. The order in your life does not always manifest as an organized external environment. Therefore, I respect your preference for a cluttered personal space.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_002: Doctor, my sound may closely mirror that of Laqeramaline, but I'm not her. The Banshees just want to express their longing for Aefanyl in her utterance. They also hope that when he comes to miss his home, his mother's voice will be there to answer him.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_003: The lace veil on the table? It was a gift that my sisters knitted for me the first time I returned to the Convallis. It is embroidered with a blessed incantation, capable of greatly amplifying the potency of Arts on the battlefield, and serving as a dust cover in times of peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_004: Doctor, my predecessor was an Arts device carrying a protective incantation. It was Aefanyl who chose to give me a consciousness, to bring me with him. So, in my algorithmic model, the very first line of code professes the Banshees' love for him. I think I'm very lucky. I was born to carry love.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_007: Sorry, Doctor, I'm the one who drew you here with my singing. Are you busy today? You were nowhere to be found— and please look over this document. It requires your urgent attention. Oh, right, this piping-hot cup of herbal tea is for you as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_008: Shhh, please don't tell Aefanyl that I hid his access card. I'm testing some data provided by my sisters: according to the calculations, the probability of Aefanyl's left eyebrow twitching when he gets angry is as high as 97.6%. Shall we observe this experiment together, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_009: Doctor, as a Banshee, I know well the power of language per se. The most maleficent curse can't rival cold words hurled in the flesh. The most efficacious blessing dims beside compliments offered in person. As such, every word I speak to you has been carefully calculated thousands of times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_010: Statistics show that not all Banshees prefer falling asleep in the embrace of melody. Most of my sisters actually favor 'Three Thousand Long Years: The Evolution of the Bone Flute' for sleep-inducing. I'd be glad to read you a passage, if you needed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_011: To the esteemed Doctor of Rhodes Island, allow me to extend my most respectful greetings on behalf of the Banshees.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_012: May I download these onto my own memory module, Doctor? Before leaving the Convallis, Laqeramaline specifically asked me to save some videos of Aefanyl for her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_017: Wherever my song rises, blessings are pronounced and bestowed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_018: This is the current state of the battlefield… Oh Aefanyl, even with that serious look on your face, I can tell your mind is wandering.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_019: I leave my blessings upon your shoulders. They will protect you in times of crisis.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_020: Please don't rush over here like that. It really is… not graceful.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_021: As impolite as this may be... I want to sing my enemies' elegies before they even get close.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_022: If the sun has not yet set by the time of our victory, could we sing together?
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_024: It's alright. I have plenty of patience.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_029: May victory be permanent, and peace everlasting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_030: Cherish victory, for it never comes easily.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_031: I'm so sorry, Doctor, but I'm afraid there's a limit to my power, and it's far from the true might of a Banshee.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_032: Let not melancholy consume your heart, Doctor. Life is long, when we look back at this defeat from a distant tomorrow, it will be nothing more than a wisp upon the winds of memory.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_033: I very much appreciate the interior structure of this room. It is conducive to sound propagation. Every time I offer a prayer, it will spread far and wide.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_034: Doctor, an incantation has been laid upon me— one that brings bad luck to all those who touch me without permission. Oh, don't worry though, I've already given you my permission.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_036: Doctor, I want to hear your opinion on something. The landship's choir asked me to be their soprano...
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_038: Doctor, your food intake for the day is getting dangerously close to the critical line, and it might be advisable to exercise some restraint. Oh, please don't look at me like that, I... Okay... it's New Year's Eve, after all. You may eat a little more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_042: Good evening, Doctor. May your dreams be sweet.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_043: If Aefanyl chose Rhodes Island as his second home, then I will regard you as family, same as him. Tonight, I'll sing a song that belongs only to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4136_phonor_CN_044: Throughout the long history of the Sarkaz, the Banshees suffered terrible losses after each upheaval. Our decision to go into isolation was a last resort. We were worried, of course, seeing Aefanyl stride into the heart of danger again and again with Rhodes Island, but we are also proud of him. He truly lives up to his Banshee name.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_001: I'm sorry, but the pen scratching you hear is just me engaging in shorthanding... to put it another way, I'm helping myself to think. I'm busy with Joint Marine Corps affairs, so I'm afraid I can't help you tackle your paperwork.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_002: It's been difficult explaining how my launcher works to the Sankta operators, and when I asked them about their guns, their eccentric answers only confused me more. Hm? I shouldn't lose heart? You're overthinking it, how could I be discouraged from just that? The reason I'm here is precisely for the sea and land to understand each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_003: Coffee, tea, cocoa... These land stimulants have a novel taste to them. They're not very effective, but it's fine. This way I get to try many types of them. How many cups have I had today? This is number eight. The Seaborn swarm is still on the move, and HQ may reach out at any time, so I have to stay alert.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_004: Doctor, there's no fresh information from Ægir on this sketch board. These wavy lines and small squares are just my thought process. As for what they mean exactly, it's very hard to explain. Hm? If this part means 'signal strength'? You... can read it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_005: Unfortunately, I didn't manage to become an Abyssal Hunter, but that's not the only way Ægir fights the Seaborn. We have the Hunters, the Waterway—and many more in the future. My current position dictates I no longer be affiliated with any projects, but that does not imply my duties are lighter, even in the slightest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_006: Our nation is not a machine, but an organic system. The gears do not spin on their own, yet every single cell, even if it loses the system's protection, will fight to the end for the organism's survival... This is what I defend and firmly believe in, nothing more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_007: Irene invited me to a ball last time, but I'm unfamiliar with the way land dwellers dance. I thought a direct refusal would be rude, so I didn't answer at all. Yet, it seemed to make her even more disappointed... Um? I can dance however I want? Then I'll join them next time. I may shoulder heavy responsibilities, but there's no harm in engaging in appropriate and beneficial recreation.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_008: Drop the act, I know who was just in here. As long as you're not the one he's contacting—no, even if it is you— Nah, forget it, I've already neglected my duties by not reporting him immediately, not to mention our current situation. Anyway, I'd like you to tell him this for me—he may be a genius, but he is a terrible mess as a teacher.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_009: The Abyssal Hunters have returned, surprisingly, and the Waterway has been opened somehow. Those are certainly not what I expected as watchman, but they are gratifying enough. Doctor, I stand here now watching over you as well, and look forward to seeing how you'll transform this war.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_010: Doctor, contacts from Ægir will be here anytime. If you're not awake by then, I will inject you with a nerve activating solution. Oh, I will try to wake you up first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_011: Dr. {@nickname}, I'm glad to meet you on land. We're fighting the same war, and that is why I stand before you now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_012: I'm adapting myself to land-based warfare and combat styles.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_013: I'm grateful for your recognition. The promotion ceremony has ended, right? Perfect, I have some new Joint Marine documents to look through together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_014: Praise in a perilous time often means even heavier responsibilities. I'm prepared, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_017: I'll intercept the tides. It is Ægir's duty to keep them off the land.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_018: I'll synchronize everyone with our battle plans promptly. If there's anything you find hard to understand, don't worry. Ægir guarantees your lives are the paramount priority.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_019: Our fleet is in position. I'll guide us to our designated spot.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_021: Toxic finspine launcher, ready to fire.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_024: The air is so dry... no, it's nothing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_025: Don't misunderstand, you're not even threats to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_026: Be glad you're only facing the Sea Patrol, not our regular army.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_027: Did you just beg for mercy? Couldn't hear you over all that shelling.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_028: Requesting more firepower—Gah, I'll do it myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_029: Your results surpassed my expectations, even in such difficult circumstances. Do you have time to tell me what was on your mind? There are some parts of your plan I still don't understand...
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_031: This result... isn't entirely unacceptable. Only, the enemies we let go, may not necessarily let us go in turn.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_032: I take it you're just having a bad day, but our enemies hope you stay like that for good. You need to pull yourself together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_033: I still have Sea Patrol work to deal with, so I can't always be at Rhodes Island. If you need anything from me, raise a request and I'll get to it promptly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_034: Casual chats aren't my strong suit. Find someone else to talk to.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_036: If you really want to know how I think while writing shorthand, I can explain it to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_038: You people flip through this printed product every day or month, treat it with great importance, and even celebrate when you switch it out for another... Can I have a look? Oh... it's called 'paper calendar'? Hmm... so land dwellers celebrate the first day of every year. I will record this in my cultural exchange notes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_043: Doctor, for you. Wait, why are you using it as a coaster? Doctor, they're not shorthand scribbles, I wrote an earnest birthday message, so I'd appreciate it if you would actually read it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4137_udflow_CN_044: I had lots of worries before I came ashore. My concerns have been validated, yet I feel even more confident. Why? Because I see a universal tenacity shared by land and sea. You face Catastrophes as Ægir fights the Seaborn—we will never surrender.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_001: Alright, I'll schedule the training, organize a tournament, and manage the burdenbeasts. You handle all the talking and writing here. I got it wrong? But I thought I gave you the easiest tasks?
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_002: Check out this knife. It just cut through tough bones, yet its edge hasn't dulled a bit, and its patterns remain intact. What a beauty, isn't it? What? Why are you backing away? It's not like I'm going to wipe the blood on your clothes. This is just from the Leporibeasts I slaughtered on the deck. Come tonight, and I'll treat you all to a nice meal.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_003: Yep, this is the toxin you're developing. I simply borrowed it for a look. It's true that I couldn't pick the laboratory's lock, so when I saw the door open during the day, I pasted a 'Do not lock the door' notice inside. Wait... that face of yours... You knew it already? But I was so careful...
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_004: I've sat on a mountain of gold coins before. One lord ameer coveted the treasury of another, so we did the job for him. He paid us the full amount as promised—not a single coin less, and, all in gilded metal. A cheat? On his turf, he gets to say what counts as a gold coin. But once we're outside his city? Then it's up to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_005: Even your 'high-grade hair dye' isn't working on me? I guess we'd better find someone else for our infiltration mission. I don't get it, people always talk about 'bloodlines', but I bleed the same red as everyone else. It only made my hair EXTRA red..
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_006: I just have to watch the sky and I'll know where to go. Like, stay clear of hungry beasts when the southern wind blows. Ship all the wood downstream before a flood hits. Plus, I know no one will transport any ancient paintings during a heatwave. But prayer vessels can be seen all over the ground in a long dry spell. Now I follow you chasing Catastrophes. As for the future, I might gather up a gang and go after the sun.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_007: I'm pretty good at handicrafts. We have a saying: 'A dead beast has a hundred uses, worthy of a living person to master a hundred skills.' So don't be shy. Just sit here, be good. Wait for me to braid your hood drawstring and thread beads onto it, alright? I'm sure the patterns are going to be great.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_008: There were some commanders I admired. They are good with tactics, but they always scare their minions and cause trouble for me. You're different, and I like that. But since Amiya is the real boss here and not you, you'll probably get your name known by half of Sargon, while I'll be known by the whole, for sure.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_009: My kin, friends, and my men are all scattered, like the stars in the sky. Have you ever tried stargazing? The fun thing is, wherever we look up, we all see the same night sky with the same stars... Hehe, sometimes I wonder what would it look like, if all the stars gathered together...? Huh? What do you mean by 'a big bang'?
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_010: They all say you're a workaholic, but it's not as if you're always awake... Hmm… or these work just isn't exciting enough for you to stay up all night?
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_011: Thanks a lot for the free ride. If I, Narantuya Kapudan were to die on my Khaganquest, what a loss it would be for Sargon… You have never heard of me? Doesn't matter, one day, everyone will know who I am.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_012: This recording system seems very useful! If I had one of my own... No... forget it. It's too expensive. Better to just draw my battle plans in the sand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_013: Rank, title, trust level, all good stuff. But what I want the most is for you to lend me a few of your people. As for when I'll give them back—We'll see when they want to come back.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_014: Delivery today, rescue tomorrow. We've accomplished so much together. But hey, let me get this straight—sometimes I'll look at the sky to decide where to go next, so when I do have to leave one day… Ahem, you'd better not miss me too much.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_017: Raise your whips, swirl the sand, shade the sun. Then take whatever you want.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_018: Just give me the target and enough hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_019: Sun's perfectly positioned. Let's head to the ambush point.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_020: The only sound they will hear is my blade slicing through wind, not my footsteps.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_022: Relax, I'll always help you out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_023: Toxins and traps are my tactics.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_024: Illusion and intimidation are my tactcis too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_026: Bam! I've swallowed up the sun!
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_027: What, you think you're a better robber than ME?
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_028: Enough dreaming. Only nightmares come with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_029: I'm scaring some of our own men? Alright, give me some time to stroll around the battlefield. Need to cool off my blood.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_030: You're reliable, the people around you are reliable. Man, how can everybody here be so reliable? I'm starting to envy the captain of this landship…
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_031: You know, sometimes we'll toss our gold coins into a stream, and pray we find them in times of need.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_032: You don't look so good...? Wasn't that just an early test? Every plan has to be tested, adjusted, and you repeat that until it's good to go. That's my secret to a foolproof success.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_033: This bed is so soft, and the air conditioning is so perfect! But I have one tiny question... do I have to pay for the lodging?
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_036: What a shame. If you had a blade of your own, I could sharpen it for you now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_038: Come, let's dance! Festive music's always nice to groove to! Relax, I'll lead, you just stomp to the rhythm, and slap your own—I'm hitting your hand? I've had a bit too much? I mean... All the drinks are free here, you know!
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_042: So, Doctor. Had a good dream? Tell me about our next objective, even if it's from your dream.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_043: We always say that maturity comes with the paths you've traveled, not the time you've passed. So on a day like this, we'll use these colorful ropes to decorate the burdenbeasts, or... You call the chair your burdenbeast? Nonsense, you can't hang these ropes on it. Give me your hand. You can forge a path on your own, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4138_narant_CN_044: People often call me greedy, but you guys are the same, no? You fight for the best outcome, same as I fight for the best treasures. Even if we turn up more losses than wins, even if what we hold slips away like sand... Hehe, well, no wonder I like you so much.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_001: Doctor, archiving and categorizing documents is my specialty. Rest assured, I will put the files you need precisely where you want them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_002: Eek—It's okay, Doctor. I got a papercut, that's all. Please don't worry. It's not bleeding anymore. Pepe used to tease me for getting hurt without even going outsi—Agh! It's okay. The coffee scalded me, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_003: This? It's only a notebook for my work at the museum. It's mostly meeting minutes and exhibition schedules, nothing really interesting... But there are some silly mementoes. Like this photo here. It's a little bird that often stops by my window.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_004: I still remember how Pepe and Titi would come by and play with me when we were kids. Even when Father had me grounded in the study, they'd stand outside the window and make animals with their hands. They were so animated… We haven't seen each other so much since we grew up. But when I look out my window, I sometimes think of those times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_005: Doctor, truth be told, I've spent most of my life following Father's plans, from my education to my career. He did pick a path that's been fairly easy for me. So I have nothing to complain about, and the idea of leaving home never truly crossed my mind. If I had made my own choices, what would life be like?
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_006: Doctor, there are two kinds of fowlbeasts. One soars through the skies, roaming freely. The other, with its shorter wings, dwells in the woods, catching only glimpses of the blue sky through the leaves as it enjoys the shade. Which one am I? Hm... In truth, I don't wish to be a fowlbeast at all. I would rather be a tree that doesn't block the sky.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_007: Oh, Doctor, you're here today, too? Me? I visit the Medical Department once a week to spend time with the children. I tell them stories, or simply chat with them. They're so young, confined to their sickrooms... I know how they feel... truly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_008: When I was little, if I misbehaved, Father would confine me to the study for an entire day. In those moments of boredom, I would take all the books off the shelves and reorder them in different ways, again and again. Reflecting on it now, it seems I was perhaps fated to pursue archival science.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_009: My favorite exhibit? I couldn't choose. What does my heart say? Hmm... Okay... There is an ancient seed. It was sealed away in darkness for centuries, yet it persevered and quickly blossomed with just a little care. Ahh... Truly an inspiring miracle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_010: Doctor, it's dry here in the office. Don't forget to hydrate.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_011: Hello, Pepe told me that once I'm ready to leave my office and go on a journey, I should come here and ask for a Doctor... She didn't specify a Doctor in which field, just that I'd know as soon as I saw the right one.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_012: My hypothesis was correct… There is so much I can learn only by stepping out of the office.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_013: I am only doing my job. It's nothing worth mentioning.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_014: Thank you very much for your recognition of my work. Father would likely hold these ribbons and medals in high esteem. Me... I don't think they matter as much as your approval.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_017: I've made a complete, thorough plan for the mission. I'm ready to sortie at any time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_018: Everyone, I'll be leading this one. Please follow the operation manual I distributed, and stay safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_019: Perhaps I should bring an extra notebook. There may be lots of things out there worth documenting.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_020: Don't worry. I have anticipated the enemy's plans and written them down in detail.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_021: Wait, please! I-I still need a bit more time…
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_022: Phew... I-I'm ready. Please let me give it a try!
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_023: From here, I should be able to cover everyone, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_024: I really hope nothing goes wrong.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_025: Don't panic. I have everything I need to know in my notebook.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_026: Um, which page did I put my notes in...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_027: Oh no… I can't find it anywhere…
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_029: Thank goodness everyone's alright... Your quick thinking was the key, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_030: How wonderful. The operation went according to plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_031: If only I had planned for more variables. I'll definitely reflect this in my notes!
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_032: Our plan has failed. Please give the order to retreat, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_033: Doctor, please let me explain! I didn't bring all these books here for leisure! I just prefer to rest my head on a stack of books during lunch. Like so. It's surprisingly comfy…
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_034: Hnngh! D-Don't tease me like that…
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_036: Doctor, could you please pinch my ear? When I get anxious... my friends comfort me like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_038: When we celebrated the New Year Festival at home, Father would always have the entire day planned. We'd visit family and friends, attend parties and banquets. It was all so overwhelming. This year, I hope to relax a bit more… Maybe... play an extra thirty minutes tonight?
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_042: Doctor, when will your next trip be? Would you mind if I went with you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_043: Please stay still, Doctor. You could get pricked. The museum makes these brooches custom for our VIPs. If… hypothetically, you're willing to visit the museum… I could be your guide. Oh? Today? O-Of course. I took the day off, so I'm totally free.
dialogue_tracker.char_4139_papyrs_CN_044: Doctor, after visiting so many places with you, I've come to realize that the true destination of every journey is also its beginning. We may wander far and wide, but we always return to where we started, to reunite with those from whom we parted. And then, we wait... until the next journey.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_001: Doctor of Rhodes Island, I hope you fully understand that any extraneous information you provide to me will influence my evaluation of our cooperation... Of course, you can also use this as leverage in your negotiations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_002: I use this set of counting rods for accounting. It's a gemstone trading tradition dating back several centuries. You merely set it down like this, then... Ahem, I could show you how to use it, but I normally set it down just to let visitors know I'm busy. Besides, it's faster to use a calculator.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_003: Your company's Engineering Department is very interested in my clockwork fowlbeast, and so I made a batch without surveillance functions. This one is for you... A hobby of mine? Hardly. It's a traditional craft in my family. There was a time when our work was unrelated to gemstones.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_004: That's true, I took over the gemstone trading post when I was fifteen. For three hundred years since the day the first set of scales went up, the one who stands behind the counter has never been important, much less his age. Visitors need only see order.  Are you perhaps questioning my abilities?
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_005: Are you... reading my medical report? Pardon me if this is inappropriate. It's true that I often injure myself with no rhyme or reason. Some say it's because of a family curse, and my life will be as short as the previous overseer. Still, I lived to see those gemstones returned, and that is more than long enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_006: The caravan that is now disappearing into the golden sands will reach the markets I shall build anew. Once the commerce network is built, the settlement will grow stronger and stronger... Another 'City of Radiance'? No, I would rather it grow naturally. What happens in a hundred years will have nothing to do with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_007: Come here, little cutie. Give this can of meat a try. You'll love it, that's right... Uh... No, it's not right! Doctor, since when have you been here? I'm afraid I shouldn't be taking care of your operators' companions. Could you please help get this slumberfoot away from me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_008: Oh, my apologies. It's been an exhausting journey. I think I fell asleep— Hold on, you needn't have someone take me to the lounge. You were inspecting the cargo manifest. I had nothing to do and so... You want to tell a story to relax? Something about snow? Oooh, very well.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_009: Trading necessitates weighing your bargaining chips as well as the human heart. After a few rounds of back-and-forth, I already have a good picture of the other party's heart. I feel honored to be able to partner with Rhodes Island, but what do you perceive when you see me...? If you believe this heart will one day grow wings, I shall want for nothing more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_010: Still asleep? The sands of time are flowing away one grain after another, even if you care not for the gemstone scoured with it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_011: I would like to thank Lady Anat for facilitating this partnership, but contrary to what she said, I am no longer the gemstone trading overseer of the 'City of Radiance'. All I have now is the codename known to the merchants, 'Sand Reckoner'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_012: A pharmaceutical company cultivating its own bodyguards? Impressive.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_013: Thank you. If you choose to award medals to make our agreement more ceremonial, I shall prepare a few traditional Sargonian gifts. Do you prefer gold or silver?
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_014: I had a dream. I saw my clockwork fowlbeasts taking flight without returning to me. In the end, I stood in front of a long river empty-handed, yet... I couldn't help but feel relieved, knowing they would roam the skies free, knowing where to fly.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_017: I weigh gains against losses, good against evil.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_018: Judging by the security forces I've met, this team holds its own.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_019: The clockwork fowlbeast has taken flight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_020: I shall not make deals with war and disaster.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_021: What is it you are weighing?
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_022: If there is anything you can't see clearly, you can ask me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_024: Lives are always used as leverage.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_025: I'm afraid your value is not as high as you imagined.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_027: They who dwell in darkness will be punished.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_029: Sands gather and disperse, life blooms and withers... You always pick the most difficult among the countless cycles. This is a priceless masterpiece, and I am honored to be its witness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_030: I do hope they will receive the forgiveness they deserve.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_031: Do you wish to know their whereabouts, or the best terrain for a frontal counterattack? On this battlefield, there is nothing that I cannot see.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_032: No need to be disappointed. With a few more weights, the scales shall be balanced.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_033: I cannot say I agree with post-Crystal Age aesthetic sensibilities.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_034: Do you know how many fingers I've cut for disrupting the scales?
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_036: Do you have any thoughts on my electric head-bobbling cloudbeast figurine?
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_038: This is the New Year. The beginning of the changing of seasons, and the day everyone purchases gemstones in hopes of improving their luck. If you need any, I can pick a few for you... You prefer one like mine...? Yes... perhaps starting this year, I should allow myself a little wish.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_042: Doctor, remember to wear some more clothing— Um, my apologies. In the desert, the temperature can vary wildly between night and day. This is our customary greeting to visitors.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_043: In the past, to ensure that balance was not lost, the overseer was permitted no trusted aides. That's why I never had any time, even if I wanted to celebrate some special day... But if you have any worries, I am willing to lend you my assistance. You have my best wishes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4140_lasher_CN_044: My family's atonement is a secret, and as such, no one has ever asked me how one is to wash away the whole of Sargon's golden sands. Rhodes Island chose a similarly long-winding road. It is seeing you doubted by others that made me reexamine myself, after which I learned from your experience.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_001: I did this all the time back in magic school, and I've mastered how to use all your magical tools, so you can leave everything to me! ...Someone blew up that Originium flashlight? *ahem* Well, it wasn't me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_002: Canned sandworm? Lemon fin-mint noon tea? Sea Terror jerky?... NOOO! NO, NO, ABSOLUTELY NOT! ABSOLUTELY NOT!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_003: Here, your summary on healing magic compared to restorative Arts. What? You thought I'd take longer to finish? Heh-heh! Back in school, when I was developing a new healing magic, I'd read through tons of papers like that every day. So the next time you have any work like this, just let me handle it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_004: Seventh Night's Awakened'? 'Fiend of the Night'? Do you really have members with such titles? Sounds like they walked straight out of some ancient legend. Awakened in a banquet of blood and darkness, a lonely moon glimmering in his blood-red pupils, surrounded by countless... Huh? Who was that man being dragged away by the ear?
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_005: My gosh, these vegetables are so fresh! No soil at all, just water? I never knew you could garden with such devices! Having one of these in the dungeon would solve everything! ...You need electricity to run it...? Well, I'll pedal a whole generator if that's what it takes!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_006: It's true Familiar Creation is a dangerous magic, but I saw those children in the Medical Department and... They saw me as a mighty sorceress from the dungeon! And the one who can summon these little things to play with them! Aww, look how much they love it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_007: Just a moment ago, I saw Laios eating yet another monster I've never seen. It was tall as a half-foot, covered in thorns, and it squirted poison. Doctor, how long until food poisoning symptoms show? Never mind, I'll just pay a visit to the Medical Department and get prepared beforehand...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_008: I learned how to make this straw grasshopper in a handicraft class. When we go back, I'll give it to Falin. The first time we hanged out together, she caught a grasshopper live, and she took me to see a real dungeon, and we ate raspberries... That was the day we became friends. I'll always remember it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_009: Doctor, can you show me how you use that thing you call a camera? I want to take a photograph of us—you, Laios and everyone. When we go back, I'll show it to Falin and tell her about each one of you. Am—am I doing it right? Laios, huddle up a little more. Three, two, one,  cheese—
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_010: ...I wonder if my sleeping bag's still on the fifth floor... and the really valuable soap... *snzzz*... *snzzz*...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_011: Thank you for helping us in finding a way back! Oh, yes, and my party may not look it but they're all wonderful people, and if they do anything strange, er, please try and forgive them...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_012: Is this really the time rewind magic which allows you to relive the past? On a scale this big? How is it done? Can you teach me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_013: So in other words, I have the permissions now to borrow all the books on advanced Originium Arts theory? Wow! Thank you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_014: When I tell Falin about everything that's happened to us, she's sure to be excited... And that's just one more reason we have to make it back, and save her!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_017: Magic tome, staff, repair tools... Done. Everything's packed and I'm ready to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_018: Huh? Wait a moment, our leader's always been Laios.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_019: Let's go. As long we have a battle plan, I can make it work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_020: Don't worry, I just ate my fill. My mana is in tip-top shape.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_021: Take it easy. Just leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_022: Do you want me to ready a magic circle?
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_023: I've never seen all these monsters before...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_025: Ever since my last familiar channeling, my arm's been sore...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_026: Fall back, let me handle this! I'll wipe them all out!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_027: Exhausting your mana is dangerous. Be careful how you plan your tactics, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_028: I can see the monsters! Just give me a moment to aim...!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_029: Heh-heh! And THAT'S why I was top of my class.
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_030: I know for a fact Rhodes Island has regular cuisine! Why are Laios and Senshi still rushing to cook up the monsters we defeat?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_031: Phew, still alive. I almost ended up a full-course meal for the monsters...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_033: I have to say, it's just like a dungeon in here...
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_034: EYAARGH! ...Oh, thank heavens, I thought you were a man-eating plant!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_036: Are you heading to the Library too? Excellent, let's go together!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_038: It feels like it was just yesterday that we got here. I've already gotten the hang of that camera you showed me how to use! Right, we should take another photo today, with all my new friends—a big group photo altogether. Falin will love hearing all our stories!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_042: Doctor, how did you sleep last night? If you've been having bad dreams, then you want to check for Nightmares in your pillow—that's what we do before sleeping in the dungeon!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_043: It took me forever to pick out your gift. As a huge, huge fan of The Daltian Clan, this one hits all the same notes, and the narrative and writing style are superb. Promise me this, Doctor, you WILL read it! Very well, it's yours—the classic romance tale, Love on Terra!
dialogue_tracker.char_4141_marcil_CN_044: I studied the theory of maladies and injuries in magic school, and took up developing healing magic as well. I know just how excruciating it is to battle with a seemingly incurable disease. Doctor, if you're ever in need, I'll be there to give all the help I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_001: Oh! This machine carries people's voices straight over, and l can talk back to them too! That 'photocopier' over there can produce exact replicas of anything painted on paper... Is my job to learn to use all of them? I'd love to know how they work!
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_002: Do you like the brined sandworm, Kay? How about this gloompincer mushroom pâté? Just as good? I've got garlic fin shiokara here, do you like that too? I'm so glad I meet you here! Come on, let's look for more new mon—whaaagh?! Vulcan? What are you doing? Where are you taking me?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_003: Doctor! I'm behind this door! The little room next to you! I need your help, Mon3tr's sick... it's not eating anything I feed it. Do you have any ideas? What? But Dr. Kal'tsit saw how good friends we were and asked me to look after it for her. What do you mean she was keeping me shut in here? You're lying, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_004: Orchid said a big flick on the forehead of whoever steps out of line is how you manage your party members, but Fang told me really earnestly that it should start with living up to your leadership responsibilities. Then they made me talk about what I think matters most in a leader. To tell the truth... I think what matters most is that everyone can trust each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_005: Monsters have talons so they can hunt, and look cute so they can trick adventurers. By observing how monsters act, you get to know them. They always put themselves on full display, while humans are nothing like them... I'm more of a fan of monsters after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_006: When I was young, I once got possessed by a spirit. Falin was the one who banished it, but because of that, our neighbors shunned her, and our father even kicked her out of the village. Later on, she ran away from school and went to the dungeon with me, but I couldn't protect her like I should have... I'm going to rescue her. I will rescue her.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_007: Be careful, Elysium gave me this Liberi egg to look after. He told me it'll hatch in a few days—oooh! It's doing it, it's hatching! A little damp chick just popped out! Is this what Liberi look like when they're young? What's so funny, Doctor... Elysium was playing a prank on me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_008: Marcille always hates eating monsters, and Chilchuck once got betrayed by his own party... I was fully resolved to save Falin all on my own, and yet they still decided to stick with me despite everything. I'm really grateful to them for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_009: I never imagined there'd be anyone except Senshi, but so many operators are interested in monsters! Plus, they want to come with me and see what it's like in the dungeon. If we have the ability to teleport back and forth, I bet Falin will want to visit as well and make friends with you all, and then we'll go on a tour around Terra!
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_010: Huh, I think Kensuke's asleep as well... So adorable…
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_011: I noticed! You're interested in cooking monsters too, aren't you? I have sandworm & needlefly meatballs here, do you wanna try some?
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_012: These monsters just get neater and neater...
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_013: Thank you for letting me on! Excuse me, Doctor, is there some reason I haven't met any operators lately? ...What? They filed complaints against me? For getting too much plumage and fur from them? They think I'm weird? I—I just wanted to make a collection of specimens—
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_014: I totally grasp how to get along with the operators here now, and I'm confident I'll blend in with everyone soon. Here are some seven-headed, super-undefeatable monster figures made by myself, and I'll send them out later to make up for everything.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_017: Weapons, armor, medicine, food, cookware, sleeping pads... We don't need the sleeping pads? Oh, alright.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_018: Got it. I'll perform my duty.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_019: Yup, my belly's nice and full. Everything's gonna be fine this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_021: What are your monsters like here?
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_022: It'd be great if we could encounter a new species.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_023: Let me check for any carnivorous monster dung...
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_024: The terrain here is totally different to the dungeon...
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_029: Ahh, I have to note down everything we learned today. Terra's got so many kinds of monsters...!
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_031: Cheer up, Doctor. Just watch, we'll succeed next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_032: Fighting on an empty stomach is a recipe for party wipes...
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_033: Alright, let's ask Chilchuck to map out this place!
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_036: This metal crab can't right itself. Look, it's sooo cute.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_038: When Marcille was taking our photograph just now, she left a spot next to her for Falin. I wonder what kind of souvenir I should get her... How about this needlefly pâté? Really, you don't think so? You don't understand. This is made from a monster from another world!
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_042: I have a shiny mouth...? Right, I just ate a fluorescent Originium Slug gummy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_043: I wasn't sure what kind of birthday cake I should buy you, but then the instant I saw it, I had to get it—it's a dragon cake! See? The strawberry jam on it is like its flame breath! Isn't that super cool?
dialogue_tracker.char_4142_laios_CN_044: They say so long as you defeat the Lunatic Magician of the dungeon, all that lies within is yours. When I was in the depths before, I wasn't thinking at all about why I was down there, or what it was that I truly wanted... but meeting you all made me realize just what it's like to have a goal in life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_001: Can't say I wrap my head around your job. Anything you want me to cook? Rice omelette, veggie stew, barbecue?
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_002: Take a deep breath! Skyfire, young lady, your body heat'll burn a fritter at this rate! Gummy, wonderful cookies you made—Goldenglow, why's your popcorn all stuck in your hair? There now, let me think how to go about this…
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_003: AH-CHOO! I was going to see inside the greenhouse where they raise the metal crabs, and fancy Marcille and Perfumer having a talk in there! I thought I'd slip out, but Marcille dragged me right back in to spray all these fancy smells on my beard. Now I can't even whiff an onion! AH-CHOO!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_004: Is this your kitchen? This is... unmistakably magic! Originium cookers, full-automatic ovens, an eight-burner range with temperature control—Aye, they're all for lazy people who lack of dedication to cooking. Take them away at once!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_005: If you want a sturdy body, you can't go ignoring your diet. Biotransformative Arts, helping you build up body strength in no time, you say? ...Your body'll get dull if you keep trying to take short-cuts. There's a difference between convenience and laziness, aye?
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_006: Just cleaned your kitchen, gave the crops a sprinkling, and put everything I cleaned out into the composter. I eat the food your grow here, and I put my effort back into this land. Makes me feel like I'm a part of it that way. Couldn't be more satisfied.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_007: The first time I went to that 'gym' place, they said they never saw a Durin as strong as me, and asked me how I got that way. I told them I just cook everyday. What's that? Now they're all in the kitchen tossing up stir-frys? Well, I'm pleased as punch to get so many people interested in cooking.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_008: Makes me happy to see Laios's bunch eating proper everyday now. That said, Doctor, I hear that you've been eating nothing but instant food lately, using your busy schedule as an excuse, and that's no way to stay healthy! You want balanced nutrition, and that'll only start with more fresh veggies and good-quality proteins!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_009: I might scratch my head at the things you all do everyday, but I respect you mightily for all the patients you'll take on. It warms the cockles of my heart too to see them enjoy my food so much. If we find any way to hop between here and the dungeon, I'll be coming back to visit you all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_010: Hmm, fine amount of sleep. Good, good.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_011: Hmm. Clean stovetops, all the utensils, nice and hot flames, and you store your ingredients well... Looks like you know the value of a healthy diet. I like the place you've got!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_012: I was wondering when did I lose my rare spice collection. That's when it happened!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_013: Be it with magic or Originium Arts, people have been trying to save the effort of cooking so long they've forgotten how to start a fire. Proper use of a flint and tinder, that's the most essential skill to grasp!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_014: Sami-style kebabs, Seaborn full courses, Ink Spirit jams and wines, I've done it all. Just give me the ingredients, and I can make you them to try... Speak up? You say we can't be eating those things, now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_017: One second, I'll double-check I've got all my kitchenware and weapons.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_018: Chin up, I've got it in me to protect the few of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_020: That's more monsters than I imagined...
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_022: Don't you worry, I know what to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_023: Nice spot. Wouldn't mind cooking here later.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_024: Aye, you leave this to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_025: Now, what's the best dish to make...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_028: Just a little longer, and it's done!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_029: Phew, I haven't tussled with a monster that tough in a long while.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_030: I'm going to see with Laios if there's a way to cook these monsters. You interested, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_031: Seems I added something funny by mistake...
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_034: Are you poking me? Hmm... I say you're not going to get anything poking through my beard.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_036: Like it? You want me to ladle you some more?
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_038: If you want to make a dish for the operators, I recommend you go with hotpot. You can put in all kinds of stewing ingredients. It can feed a whole table at once, and it's simple to make. Come with me, I'll teach you how the tastiest hotpot's made.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_042: Just in time, it's done. Come give my work a taste.
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_043: Tell me anything you'd like to eat, no matter what. Go on now, it's your birthday, and I haven't much I could wrap up and give you anyhow, so I'll make you a whole banquet to celebrate!
dialogue_tracker.char_4143_sensi_CN_044: This whole journey's been one endless surprise... Laios and Marcille are both much tougher than I'd thought, Chilchuck's really acting like a grown-up now, and I've made plenty of exciting new friends. It's been a fulfilling time, this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_001: Uh-huh... I see. Hand me this paperwork. I'll sort it out. What? Don't tell me 'I know you can do this'. I'm not a child!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_002: Tch... I had a feeling, but actually hearing the doc dissect my numbers during the checkup was another thing. I need a while away from any missions with Senshi and Laios. Can't keep eating with them at this rate.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_003: I see your face, and I know what you're thinking—'I didn't even know you could eat this!' or something like that. I was reluctant at first, but then I got used to it. Spend enough time with them, and you will too. Uh, not that getting used to it matters or anything, I mean.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_004: *sigh* This is what I get for hanging around Laios and Senshi. Now everyone thinks I'm some monster-loving wacko too. What's that you've got there, Doctor? Senshi's brand new pièce de résistance? ...You look excited, too. Don't tell me you're one of them?
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_005: Okay. It's dawned on me that Durins look young because they're actually young—Myrtle more than anyone. That girl is practically a child. I had a brief conversation with her, and she decided I was lying about not being her age—give me a break!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_006: Doctor, Terran mimics are much easier to tell than the dungeon kind. Watch, all it takes to lure one is some bait, just wait for it to bite and you can—ha! Nailed it... Tch, didn't expect there's another one!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_007: I used to manage a guild too, you know. It keeps me on my feet every day, but sometimes even my own kind don't see the point. With Rhodes Island being such a big organization, you should learn to unwind every now and then. Wanna go grab a drink? It's not like the work will run off while you're away, so we may as well relax for now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_008: Laios and the others believe that giving all you've got equals a happy ending. As if it's ever that simple—what a bunch of morons. You're smart, Doctor. You don't believe in that either, right? ...Come again? I am NOT worried for them!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_009: You want to try dungeoneering? Considering the combat skills you have, you can never have too many extra lives. Okay, how about this? If you really wanna go, then you must follow my instructions when it comes to pathfinding and operation strategies. I'm the expert. For anything else, you and Laios can make it up.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_010: I know I'm sick of Senshi yapping about having a healthy diet, but you might actually need the lecture from him.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_011: I've read through the contract. The terms all look solid, and so do the benefits. If you can pay me upfront, I'll be glad to work with you. I'm being blunt here for good reason—it benefits us all that we hash this out in advance, doesn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_012: You're not gonna try and put me in combat, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_013: Thanks. I'll do however much I'm paid for.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_014: The viciousness of Terra gives dungeons a real run for their money. On top of that, you have some nasty mimics too... Doctor, you ever see a suspicious chest, don't sit on it. Let me deal with it. Understand?
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_017: Let's be clear, I'm just the scout. Don't count on me for combat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_018: This isn't my forte, but I'll try.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_019: Let's go. I've got the route planned.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_022: I scouted this part. All clear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_023: Hey, this is a LOT of enemies!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_024: Doctor, this is a mistake, right?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_026: Don't count on me to do any serious damage!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_029: Doctor, give me a heads-up about this sort of mission next time. Because I'm not coming again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_030: Good wrap-up, and I'm a little hungry too. Times like this call for... tch, they're tainting me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_031: You guys recover for now, I'll keep watch. Don't worry, if anyone approaches, I'll hear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_032: Good thing I secured our escape route... everyone follow me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_033: Time I mapped out Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_038: A party? Count me out. Some Durin buddies got hold of some good booze, I'll go meet with them and we're getting ourselves smashed. If you want a round yourself, you're free to come by. Oh yeah, and Happy New Year.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_042: Doctor, you're not here just to see me, are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_043: Catch—yep, that's a lockpicking kit, your birthday present. You were curious ever since Senshi brought it up, right? I got Engineering to make you a whole set. Do whatever you like with it, just don't let me know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4144_chilc_CN_044: To be honest, I was pretty skeptical of you at first. People who say they'll help for nothing are usually up to some pretty shocking stuff behind your back. Now? Now I believe a do-gooder can be real, I'll say that...
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_001: I have no objections. If these long-winded documents turned out to be a waste of our time, you would be the one to suffer the consequences.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_002: You should see how Gladiia trains. It could almost be called self-flagellation. I once reminded her that in the depths of the abyss, maintaining your sense of direction is both more difficult and more important than increasing your speed. Yes, of course my navigational skills are better than the other Hunters,
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_003: There's no point in staring at it. Ægir's musical notation would be unfamiliar to you land-dwellers. I make it a habit to compose a song before battle, and I ask my teammates to memorize it. Once the battle is over, they are to sing it with utmost accuracy. The Seaborn have no taste for artistry, so it has proved a useful test.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_004: Sargonian, Iberian, Rim Billitonian... During my short time on the land, I have learned several languages. The Seaborn are willing to communicate with other kinds for the sake of their evolution, while humanity uses whatever excuses it can to divide itself. We should be ashamed of ourselves.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_005: There are many ways to foster unity. Perhaps you could blame your collapse on a common foe, or open up a waterway that changes the tide of war, or maybe send a disgraced, fallen man into exile... Hmm. This really is the only value I can bring to the table.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_006: The Seaborn issue is already out of our control. If a single waterway or several battles could annihilate them, I would not be here seeking your cooperation. I should be off now. Stay in contact... Become one of them, then uncover their fatal weakness from within... this is the only way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_007: No need to arrange a meeting. I have already ascertained the status of the other Hunters. Please continue to monitor their health, and help them keep their heads clear. I will return and check. As Ægir's first Abyssal Hunter, I hope that I will not be its last.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_008: You are very forward-thinking with your vision of the future of gene therapy, but right now, discussing anything other than the Seaborn or the Hunters is a waste of our time. Doctor, they continue their endless march onto dry land, but the answer lies deep in the abyss.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_009: The Hunters will lose awareness if deprived of water, but they need only return to the sea to awake their past. How about you? What opportunity would you need? What did you forget, and why did you forget it? You have been to the depths of the abyssal sea, you are connected to all this. I need you to recall, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_010: You are dreaming. Which part of yourself do you speak to?
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_011: We meet again. This method of contact that you are imposing upon me, is it Rhodes Island's standard treatment, or perhaps it is you trying to confirm if my sense of self has already begun to change… Hmph. Ulpianus, Abyssal Hunter.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_012: You must think carefully on what you base your battle plans upon.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_013: Only when baptized in death does one exist. This ceremony is not much use for a warrior.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_014: If there truly is a creator of all things, then it should be the one to suffer the plagues that torment us.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_017: You will obtain the result that you seek.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_018: Skadi and the other Hunters are masters of violence. What about the ones on this team?
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_020: The scent in the air is changing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_023: They will cough up some useful information.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_024: This execution is not worth witnessing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_025: Who takes joy in the fall?
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_026: Your wounds will be rather striking.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_027: The depths will devour your bones.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_028: Your useless tricks will only make your death more miserable.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_029: Good. That means we still have time…
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_030: From watching you and Gladiia discuss your battle plans, I see that the two of you share similar lines of thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_031: Is your objective victory, or is it ultimately survival?
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_032: Not everyone is able to taste victory, but all must bear the burden of defeat.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_033: You can contact me from anywhere, but do not let others learn of my whereabouts. You should know that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_034: How many hands do you have?
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_036: I am not entirely new to the land. What you just did falls outside your etiquette.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_038: The establishment of a new city. The birth of a new artform. The rising of a new line of thought. These are all worth celebrating, as opposed to the mere passage of time. But now, I wish to mark this occasion with you—the tides have not yet broken free of the ocean, and ruination has not yet arrived in full.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_042: No need to turn your head. I will keep my report brief.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_043: Take this. I understand that land-dwellers require a certain level of ceremony on their birthdays. Mastering the notes of Ægir music shouldn't take you too long. Or you could seek out the other Hunters and ask them to sing it for you... Me? I must be wary of my own voice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4145_ulpia_CN_044: The Abyssal Hunters were created to annihilate the Seaborn. What of Rhodes Island? Relying on this clumsy ship to take you this far, yet you show no will to stop. This speaks to your tenacity that rivals even us Hunters. Why were you established, and what is your endpoint? Answer me, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_001: Sort the paperwork for the other departments, check. Water the plants, done... Oh! Doctor, here's the water you wanted. I've also asked the cafeteria to make you a snack. I've done my homework with help from the other operators, nothing'll go wrong on my watch!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_002: There's a small furnace next to my home. Ermi once told me it's used to transport energy, but we mainly use it to cook, dry our clothes, and stay warm. I've also heard that if you knock on the furnace twice before using it, your ancestors will watch over you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_003: Djaj don't read minds, and we don't suck out your emotions, and we definitely don't eat brains! Honestly, where you even get these ideas? Keep saying stuff like that and I'm gonna get mad! I mean it, I-I'll bite your head off!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_004: When I was searching for my ancestors' soul fragments in Kazdel, Ermi gave me this cube to hold them. Now, I use it to store oversized luggage. I really want to know how it works, but Lich technology is way too complicated. Even if I could take a peek into Ermi's soul, I doubt I'd understand it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_005: I'll put this money to good use, hehe... Oh, hello, Doctor! This? It's a little reward for helping out my friends. Completely legit and very common practice. What did I do, you ask? Hmmm... finding their lost pets, organizing their thoughts, and other stuff like that. Nothing special.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_006: Hi Doctor, just wanted to check if you're satisfied with my work so far? Cos you know, being trusted and being favored are two different things. We Djaj get the latter a lot, but the former... Mm, I can hear it. Thank you for your trust, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_007: Mom and Dad have been away for quite a long time... Do I miss them? Mmm... A little, I guess? They're my parents, but they're also their own people. I can already take care of myself, so why keep them chained to me? As long as I can feel their love, I'm happy that they're out there doing what makes them happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_008: Djaj can penetrate one's psyche, which is why they call us the heart-whippers. But we must also remember to whip our own hearts, by that, I mean self-restraint. Legend tells of Djaj whose obsession with the mind drove them to insanity. The King of Sarkaz had to finish them off. O-Of course, it's not like I witnessed it myself. Anyway, as long as I stay on the right track, everything will be fine!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_009: Heart whipping is no joke. You really want to give it a try? Okay. I won't go too deep. Now, look into my eyes… Um, uhhh. Sorry, I-I-I got a little nervous, like my heart is in my mouth! Let's try it a-another time. Lots of stuff I need to prepare first...
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_010: What a good dream. It's making me a little drowsy, too…
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_011: Sorry I'm late! I was chatting with the Djall HR lady and lost track of time… You must be the Doctor. Hello, I'm Nymph. I'm great at taking care of all sorts of trouble, so please come to me if anything ever bothers you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_012: This is pretty interesting. Is it okay if I take it with me to watch later?
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_013: Ohhh… I've only seen people from the Military Commission wear medals like this! Thank you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_014: Let's open our hearts to each other, Doctor. We will definitely get to know each other better.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_017: Do we really have to settle this with violence...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_018: I understand. Don't worry. I'll find a way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_019: It's time to go. I can't keep hesitating like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_020: Focus, Nymph. It's… it's no big deal!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_026: Turn back. Don't let your heart shatter here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_027: Let my key whip reach your soul!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_029: What you did back there, they're all natural reflexes to you? You are amazing!
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_030: I've learned a lot from your commands, Doctor. Maybe I'll get to use them in the future, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_031: Don't worry, just let them go. We should head back now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_032: Don't be scared! I-I'll think of something. There's gotta be a way...
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_033: It's so clean here. With a few simple touches, I can definitely make it a comfy little home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_036: There's no key to that lock at the bottom of your heart? Don't worry. I'll find it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_038: There's laughter all around. Just being here, part of all of this, makes my heart melt... OK! Let's go all out and enjoy the day, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_042: Put your thoughts to rest, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_043: Today's your birthday, right, Doctor? So why are you still buried in these documents? Quit looking at them. Look at me... Go to the cafeteria, and have a big, hearty meal. No coming back after dinner either. Okay? That's right. Everyone deserves a break on their birthdays, even the hardest worker. Now come on, let's go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4146_nymph_CN_044: Looking back, it's amazing how much I've done this year. I've been going back and forth between Rhodes Island and Kazdel so much, it's a wonder my legs didn't fall off... Tired? Umm, not really. More like happy. As for next year... Hmm... I think it's best not to think about it too much. It's the unknown that fills us up with anticipation, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_001: Whaa? More work? But I came to Rhodes Island for a good holiday... Alright, if it's simply sorting files, I'm OK with that, I guess. But tell me, Doctor, what's my per diem?
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_002: The report you wanted's on your desk. Yeah, just one page. Not like we get something new in Kazdel every day. I mean C'mon, What else do you wanna know? How to pick the gate of the Temple of Knowledge? Cut me some slack, will ya? I'm just a slum snitch. Oh, right, you people here prefer intelligence agent.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_003: Our rules are different from the ones you have at Rhodes Island. Also, they're not spelled out in black and white. Cuz' paper's pricey, and only a few can read. Plus each neighbourhood's got their own rules, so no one outside those blocks calls me 'consultant'. You can if you want, just don't expect me to get all tangled up in your mess.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_004: The bandages on my digits? Just for style. Funny story, a few days ago I taught a bunch of nitpicking punks a lesson at the market. A vendor saw these bandages and thought I got hurt in the scuffle, so he gave me a few more green onions as a thank-you gift. Hmm? There's blood seeping out? No worries, that's just beetroot juice.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_005: We call brown bread 'soft brick' and coats 'plaster'… What about sausages? What about 'em? Just sausages. Why? I mean, why give something you only get to eat once every few years a moniker? There's not much to the Kazdelian street slang, really. Just hang around a local construction site and you'll learn everything you need to know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_006: With how crowded Rhodes Island is, I'm surprised you don't have full-on fights on your hands. In Kazdel, people trade blows over just about anything, like if a valve should be turned once or twice. Sounds stupid, right? But when I tried to calm them down, I had to defuse a fight with dozens of pitchforks and shovels in my face. By the time I did, my legs were so wobbly I could barely walk home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_007: Want a candy? I always bring a few when I go out in case I run into street brats. When they block you for stuff, just throw one out, and they'll try to beat up the kid who grabbed it, leaving me alone to go on my merry way. Is this strategy talk? Nah, just sharing an anecdote is all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_008: Yo, you still need those coupons? Let me have 'em if you're gonna throw them out, I'm so close to getting a free BBQ. Nope, I read the rules, what they say is 'Only one coupon per purchase'. So it's fine if I settle the bill after each free dish... Tell you what, I also have a 50% off coupon for two, so if you don't tell Closure my plan, I'll take you for some roast beast tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_009: Seems like there's more budget for next season's operation? I'm not a real intelligence dealer, but I agree with one of their rules: Valuable info for valuable clients. I never waste your time with worthless trivia, and it's not just on account of your good prices.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_010: Keep up the good work, Doctor. I need a nap.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_011: Hey, wassup, here's my recommendation letter, HR already checked it. Wrong one? Give me a sec… uh, no… no… Oh, coupon... Ah, here it is. Sorry about that. Too many pockets on this plaster, hard to keep track of where I keep my things.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_012: Way more entertaining than watching random street fights.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_013: Your recognition is worth more than this medal, Doctor. By the by, is this pure gold? Kinda hard, to the bite.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_014: Seems to me I've really sold my soul to Rhodes Island, but I'm sure you wouldn't want me to throw my life away so easily. If you ask me, we should live life to the fullest until we finish off everything we've gotta do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_017: No… My sweet, sweet vacation… But seriously though, I got you. When have I ever dropped the ball before?
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_018: Now, ain't these big shoes to fill? Stay sharp everyone, and give me your a hundred and ten percent.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_019: Here's the battle plan, if you got any questions... Figure them out yourself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_020: Don't warn 'em, just hit 'em. Don't give them a chance to react.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_023: What a mess, but the view's perfect.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_024: Oww… this is tricky, gonna cost you more. How about double the pay?
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_025: I don't owe you an explanation.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_027: Oh I'm sorry, now you wanna surrender?
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_028: Seeing stars now are we? Sounds about right.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_029: Man, that stuff was hairy. If all our missions are gonna be that rough, I'll need extra insurance.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_030: My hands are shaking? It's totally normal, and proof I gave it a hundred percent... Hey! I said it's normal, alright!
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_031: No need for a blind chase. They won't get far, we should rest and refuel.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_032: Stay cool, everyone. Fall back this way!
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_033: Big place. Wonder how the food tastes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_034: Careful now, you might prick your fingers.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_036: Fruit's half off today, you can even buy it with points—ssh! Go get yours quick, and don't tell anyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_038: I used to only see so many lanterns and decorations in Sauin parades. They don't carry the same significance, but it's breathtaking all the same. Go down for a closer look? Nah, here's a good spot. New Year's sale's starting soon, and I gotta be first in line.
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_042: Doctor, how was your break? Me, I'm still a little tired...
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_043: You're a real mystery, you know? I asked around and nobody seemed to know what you like for your birthday. But from what I've seen, you probably won't hate this. Try it out, nothing like hot soup to wash away all your worries, so chug it down and celebrate!
dialogue_tracker.char_4147_mitm_CN_044: Doctor, I've archived these reports as you requested. I even have a closing speech for you while you wipe my access clearances. The info you were most interested in last year was— I can stop? But you told me yesterday we have to keep looking back to stay on the right track.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_001: I can help you transcribe the documents. I used to help the priests copy the scriptures all the time, so I have a lot of experience with this kind of work. Oh, you use photocopiers here? In that case, I'll just guard you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_002: Shh, keep quiet; don't startle it. An operator who knows insects told me this chrysalis is about to emerge. It feels wonderful, waiting for life to break free. I wonder what color its wings will be. Yes? You think it's turning darker? It can't be…
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_003: The high priest gave me this telescope to broaden my perspectives. I would watch tuskbeasts on the prowl, traveling merchants, and even the Minoan cities, yet my thoughts lingered in the temple. Even though it was right beside me, it felt farther than the horizon.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_004: Am I daydreaming? No, I'm feeling the flow of the wind. Doctor, do you believe there are rivers in the sky as well? I do. They're invisible, yet nourishing; the gentle wind is their gift. Hmm, is it... raining? Let's head back, Doctor. I wouldn't want you to catch a cold.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_005: Doctor, Midnight is twisting Spot's neck, and Orchid is pummeling Midnight... They are not fighting? But Sarkaz don't usually form friendships with other races... Is it because of Midnight's charm? Mhmm... Yes? You say he is not a good role model?
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_006: When I left the temple, I took it with me and had a master smith craft it into a shield. Special, isn't it? The ancient texts say that sarcophagi are meant to guard the deceased for centuries, so they're always sturdy. I thought, since it would be my final companion anyway, I might as well use it to ward off evil.
