dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_007: Even the slightest contact with my Arts can cause extreme fatigue. You want to use my power to cure your insomnia? I'm afraid I can't do that. If you're having trouble sleeping, I'll burn some incense and chant for you, or join you in quiet contemplation, but my Arts would make you feel even worse. Oh, you were only joking? Phew.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_008: After the rainy season, life flourishes. Every year, when the time comes, I go back to the villages to help drive away unwelcome intruders—wild beasts gnashing their fangs, swarms of sand fleas, and even armed raiders… Think that's scary? Well, many think the Sarkaz are even scarier.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_009: Someone once invited me to become a mercenary for the Lord Ameer, but that's not what I want to do. The river will still flood, conflicts will still rage, and life remains at risk. And I… I don't want to stand on the sidelines. Doctor, I once asked why you chose to save people, and you gave me the same answer.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_010: The sun will set, and people need sleep. We don't need to carry on as the ever-flowing river, it's okay to rest.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_011: I come from Sargon to travel across the land, training along the way. Is it the 'River of Life' that brought us together here? Human Resources tells me you're the most knowledgeable one on this ship. May I learn from you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_012: This is a very efficient way to train. The next time I return, I hope to record the flow of the river... Doctor, may I ask what is the maximum recording length?
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_013: Promotion… I am one step further than I was yesterday.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_014: Thank you. I understand how precious it is to win recognition. But this also means I'm entering even more turbulent waters… I won't back down.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_017: Stride forward, righteously, to ward off disaster.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_018: I shall take up this responsibility.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_019: Some conflicts are irreconcilable, but I will try my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_020: I see you dumping filth into the river.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_021: This is the branch to which destiny flows…
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_027: Feel the sand in your mouth. Taste the unspeakable bitterness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_028: The River of Life flows unceasing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_030: May they all reach the other side safely.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_031: Perfection is hard to come by. You have done a great job, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_032: Failure is an inevitable part of learning. Let's try again.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_033: I'll be careful not to knock anything over.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_036: I haven't finished telling my last story. It won't take too long, three days and nights at most.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_038: During the Wepet Renpet celebration offerings, nearby settlements send emissaries with gifts of fine wine, fresh milk, and seasonal fruits. The priests pour these offerings into the river, giving thanks for the blessings of the past year… Oh, perhaps we should share a drink together, as is tradition? Hehe, happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_042: Doctor, are you free today? I still have many questions I'd like you to answer.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_043: In our faith, birthdays are incredibly significant. To us, birthdays do not hearken back to the beginnings of our lives; rather, they remind us of the difficult paths we have trod to our births, Doctor. Having endured countless hardships in your previous life, you won't be daunted by the trials of the present. Relax, and proceed apace.
dialogue_tracker.char_4148_philae_CN_044: 'The rivers of Sargon are never bound to any one oasis.' This saying is common among our followers. Yet if I could start again, I would still sail here and share a journey with the Rhodes Islanders. Why? Doctor, I think you know better than anyone else.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_001: Ah, files all sorted. Relax. Not everything spills its secrets, and not everything merits recording. A document left to a Maylander detective? Well, that must be one not worthy of doctoring.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_002: Now that Rhodes Island and Maylander have reached an understanding on our partnership, we'll be sending specialists for the follow-up. In fact, I'm more curious about my old friends on this ship. For example, the K'uk'ulkan, the Friston-3 robot, and you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_003: Can I smoke in the office? If it bothers you, I won't exhale... Mmmm. Picked up this little habit during my time at a volcanic caldera in Bolívar. Can't seem to break it. But no worries, not like I have lungs to file a complaint.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_004: Are those kids still following me? Fine. Let them believe the Columbian fairy tale is real... My exoskeleton sure grabs attention, and man, does it need regular maintenance. But I'm just too lazy to keep replacing it. Well, that's the force of habit... even a tin can gets used to its dents.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_005: Wanna take a look together? These are social dynamics reports from some academic journals. Helps us catch a glimpse of the new inventions and trends coming next year... Hmm? Of course it's necessary. Can you tell that I'm a revenant who's lived for millennia? See? That's the charm of keeping a youthful mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_006: W brought a swath of drastic reforms. Nasti's aiming for a city floating above the clouds... Hehe, you gotta admit, the Sarkaz vision for the future never disappoints. Me? I'm just an average joe working for the Foundation, investing in the next generation is where it's at.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_007: I like the top deck of Rhodes Island. It's got a great view. Too bad I didn't have a ship like this, or friends like yours when I was... scavenging, all those years ago... But I did meet Maylander Selene, and we roamed that wilderness together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_008: Keep your distance and don't get yourself burned. Without witchcraft, sometimes this tin can sizzles in mere sunlight... Do I regret it? Perhaps. If becoming a pile of firewood could solve the Sarkaz's problems, then I'd hop right into the Soul Furnace. Yet, that's not how it works.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_009: Dame Kal'tsit and I talked a little about you. Don't worry. Your past won't be an issue for Maylander. Time sure flies for people like us, don't you agree? Care for a smoke? A few puffs and we'll be enjoying the sunset.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_010: Good, I'll get the newspapers, and make us hot dogs with some nachos. Hats off to fast food, for keeping us pioneering without even a moment's rest. Great invention, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_011: I haven't seen you since Trimounts, Doctor. Tin Man, P.I., representing the Maylander Foundation. Starting today, we'll be cooperating with Rhodes Island in a variety of sectors, along with sharing our resources... and secrets.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_012: It looks like Rhodes Island excels in its other business areas, besides just Oripathy treatment. We've got more room for cooperation... than I expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_013: And the last time I experienced something like this was by a campfire. Maylander Selene threw a map and a bottle of hard stuff across the flame, and invited me to join his team. Columbia wasn't even on the map yet... Hmph, it's like yesterday once more.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_014: Thanks. It's tough for people like you and me to trust, I know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_017: Some people on this team are as talented and impressive as Maylander's agents. I'm interested to see how this operation unfolds, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_018: Call me Tin Man, ladies and gentlemen. For this operation, I'm expecting you to follow all my orders to the letter.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_019: I'll be finding a backup route for our operation.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_020: How about you take another way, good sir?
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_021: Let me stretch a little first. My joints are getting rusty.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_022: Patience, my friend. Let me have a smoke first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_023: Watch out for voice; it's the best vessel for curses.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_024: Even an old haunt has its perils.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_025: Don't treat history with such a flippant attitude.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_026: Don't imagine the future with such a narrow view.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_028: Feel how your soul's imprisoned; it will be a lesson you won't forget.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_029: A few years ago, I heard some rumors about the Kazdel civil war. Seems time has not rusted your talents in this area, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_030: I had a taste of it back in Trimounts, but your strategic planning and judgment here were truly impressive... Would you mind if I reported to the Foundation? They would be glad to know there's an outstanding commander behind Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_031: They may have escaped the battle, but they can't escape the war.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_032: It's not a problem. Per our agreement, the Maylander Foundation is responsible for damage control. Leave this to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_033: Pretty nice room. Maybe once I get used to it, I'll turn it into my new body... Hehe, Just kidding.
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_034: What do you think happens when a human touches scorching hot metal?
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_036: You... didn't spot me pulling smoke rings back in my body through the gaps, did you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_038: Kazdel doesn't have New Year's celebrations like this, but in Columbia, I always join the kids in the square for the countdown to the bell. As a Rhodes Island operator, I guess I'll have to satisfy the children's curiosity about this tin man…
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_043: Me? How to decide a revenant's birthday? Umm... The day I was born? Too long ago to remember. The day I got a new body? Then I'd have too many birthdays to count. Birthdays don't mean much to me. But for you, commemorating something is a way to validate your own existence, isn't it? Happy birthday, Doctor. How about we go for a walk?
dialogue_tracker.char_4151_tinman_CN_044: Columbia, Kazdel of the future, and even Rhodes Island share one thing in common—Youth. Youth represents everything. Doctor, you and I are from the past, but at the moment, we're defending the future. I believe Rhodes Island and Maylander's partnership will continue.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_001: Back when I was an assistant at the shop, I filled the binders with hundreds of customers' preferences. Materials, hem lengths, even the number of buttons they wanted on the cuffs. Rhodes Island's paperwork couldn't be more complicated than––oh, w-wait, so much?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_002: This strap buckle came from a Carnival stall, and the strap itself is an old measuring tape of mine. The hairpin was customized with a beading needle, and I embroidered this pattern here myself... It's too flamboyant? How silly, this is the pinnacle of Siracusan style. Get with the times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_003: The tailor shop isn't half bad. Let me tell you about two of my good friends: one went to the police academy, the other joined a famiglia. They don't speak anymore. But they're both customers here at my shop. They come to me when they need clothes made.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_004: Nonno used to tell me all sorts of fanciful stories, so I wouldn't get bored in the shop. I've known those stories backwards and forwards my whole life now. There's no way I would believe—oh, by heaven! D-Doctor, a doll just floated by! In midair! Y-You didn't see it? No-no-no, I'm not kidding!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_005: Once upon a time, I wanted to join the ranks of Siracusa's worthies, but Nonno only taught me how to hold a ruler and a pair of scissors. Still, with nothing but these two tools, he managed to win the respect of so many such worthies... There's still a lot for me to learn. And for now, I want to start with a new suit of clothes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_006: I thought the end of Carnival was just as cruel as Siracusa's old fairy tales. But when midnight came and the fireworks burst into the night sky, everyone could still truly celebrate together... I guess that's how a fairy tale should end. Ah, will future Siracusan fairy tales also be like this?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_007: It's alright, I can sort out these letters on my own. See, they're from our neighbors, de Montano's regulars. Even though they know that Nonno isn't around anymore, they still send their regards to the shop... Hmm, maybe this is what he meant by 'decency'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_008: Doctor, did you not sleep well? I can see the bags under your eyes. Why not take a page from my book and use some eyeshadow to make yourself look more energetic? Ah no, pretend I didn't say anything. I can tell that you're the type who never gets enough rest, but can always freshen up when it's time to get serious. I'll keep all the makeup stuff for myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_009: Fold this corner first, go around twice like this, and finally tie it around your neck... Hmph, the scarf doesn't match your outfit. How about I just make you a complete Siracusan ensemble? It won't take anything I don't already know, so you might as well say yes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_010: This thread goes here, this goes there... Ugh, it's all tangled anew. What, you think tailors never get their threads tangled?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_011: This is where I report in, right? Sorry, I came without getting changed first. Oh, I don't need to do that? Thank goodness, I feel more comfortable in familiar clothes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_012: Uhhh… can't be any harder than learning to tailor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_013: I appreciate the thought, but you really don't have to go out of your way to treat me like a child.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_014: Ah, does this second promotion mean I can finally take charge on my own?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_017: Trust me, I'm capable of handling field operations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_018: Formulating strategies? Phew... Okay, I can do this, nothing I can't handle. It's just like threading a needle…
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_019: Suit up, it's time to set out.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_025: A waste of perfectly good fabric.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_027: Hey! Stand still while I'm measuring!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_028: Keep your back straight—tsk, tsk. Who told you to keel over?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_030: This tactic was tailor-made for today's battle!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_031: Thank goodness we accomplished our mission. Hmm, why is there a loose thread...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_032: Don't worry. It's only natural to waste some material when tailoring a suit.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_033: Any place to stash my toolkit?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_036: Doctor, have you settled on the style you'd like to have made?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_038: The mafiosi had their own secret ways of exchanging New Year's greetings. Back in the shop, we'd sew lace onto sleeves and gift leather wallets to our clients to celebrate the occasion. But none of these rituals seem appropriate for Rhodes Island. For now, I'll have to make do with a simple 'Happy New Year'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_042: Ah, Doctor, what a spiffy ensemble you've got there today. Oh? This is what you always wear? Err... Well, that's worth complimenting too!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Come and try this new outfit. I based it off the measurements of your coat to make sure it would fit. Huh? I made it too small? Impossible! You must've eaten too much cake! Uhh... *Ahem* No, no, that's not an issue. I have all the tools on me right now. Let me fix it for you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_CN_044: When I set out, I grabbed all the spools of thread from the store, thinking I would advance beyond Nonno's level before they ran out. Now, with plenty of thread still left, I wonder, Doctor—if I might have already reached my goal long ago?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_001: Back when I was an assistant at the shop, I recorded whole binders of hundreds of different customers' preferences. Materials, hem lengths, even the number of buttons they wanted on the cuffs. Rhodes Island's paperwork couldn't be more complicated than–– W-Wait, this much?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_002: This strap buckle came from a Carnival stall, and the strap itself is an old measuring tape of mine. The hairpin was customized with a beading needle, and I embroidered this pattern here myself... It's too flamboyant? I'll have you know, this is the pinnacle of Siracusan style. Get with the times.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_003: The tailor shop isn't half bad. Look at this way: I have two brothers; one went to the police academy, the other joined a famiglia, and the two have never spoken since. But at the tailor shop, they're both my customers. They come to me when they need their clothes made.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_004: Nonno used to tell me all sorts of fanciful stories so I wouldn't get bored in the shop. I've been able to retell those stories backwards and forwards for ages, so how could I believe in them...? Woah! D-Doctor, just now, there was a doll floating by! Y-You didn't see it? Don't try to scare me!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_005: Once upon a time, I wanted to join the ranks of Siracusa's worthies, but Nonno only taught me how to hold a ruler and a pair of scissors. Yet with those two tools alone, he managed to win the respect of so many such worthies... There's still a lot for me to learn, and for now, I want to start with a new suit of clothes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_006: I thought the end of Carnival was just as cruel as Siracusa's old fairy tales. But when midnight came and the fireworks burst into the night sky, everyone could still truly celebrate together... And that's how a fairy tale should end, right? I wonder if the tale of Siracusa to come will be like that too.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_007: It's alright, I can finish these letters on my own. See, they're from our neighbors, di Montano's regulars. Even though they know that Nonno isn't around anymore, they still send their regards to the shop... Maybe that's what he meant by 'respectability'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_008: Doctor, did you not sleep well? I can see the bags under your eyes. Why not take a page from my book and use some eyeshadow to make yourself look more energetic? Never mind. Even though you're the type who never gets enough rest, you can always freshen up quick when it's time to get serious. I'll take care of dressing you then.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_009: Fold this corner first, go around twice like this, and finally tie it around your neck—Oops, the scarf doesn't match. How about I just make you a complete Siracusan ensemble? It won't take anything I don't already know, so you might as well say yes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_010: One end of the thread's over here, and other's over here... Ugh, it's all messed up again. What, do you think tailors never get their threads tangled?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_011: This where I report in, right? Sorry, I came without getting changed first. Oh, I don't need to do that? Thank goodness, I feel more comfortable wearing familiar clothes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_012: Well, can't be any harder than learning to tailor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_013: I appreciate the thought, but you really don't have to go out of your way to treat me like a child.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_014: Does this second promotion mean I can finally take charge on my own?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_017: Trust me, I'm capable of handling field operations.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_018: Formulating strategies? Phew... Okay, I can do this, nothing I can't handle. It's just like threading a needle...
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_025: A waste of perfectly good fabric.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_028: Keep your back straight—Tsk, tsk. Who told you to keel over?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_030: This tactic was tailor-made for today's battle!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_031: Thank goodness we accomplished our mission. Tsk, why is there a loose thread...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_032: Don't worry. It's only natural to waste some material when tailoring a suit.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_033: Any place to stash my toolkit?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_036: Doctor, have you settled on the style you'd like to have made?
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_038: The mafiosi had their own secret ways of exchanging New Year's greetings. Back in the shop, we'd sew lace onto sleeves and gift leather wallets to our clients to celebrate the occasion. But none of these rituals seem appropriate for Rhodes Island. Getting to say 'Happy New Year' is more than good enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_042: Oh, Doctor, what a spiffy ensemble you've got there today. Oh? This is what you always wear? Err... Well, that's worth complimenting too!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Come and try this new outfit. I based it off the measurements of your coat to make sure it would fit. Huh? I made it too small? Nonsense, you must've eaten too much cake! No, no, that's not the issue. I have all the tools on me right now. Let me fix it for you!
dialogue_tracker.char_4155_talr_ITA_CN_044: When I set out, I grabbed all the spools of thread from the store, thinking to myself that I had to surpass Nonno before the thread ran out. And at this moment, I still have plenty of thread left—Doctor, do you think I've met my goal?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_001: File management? Alright, then. Teach me how. Okay... Sort them first. Like this? Then put them in order, by date… Uh. I tore the paper… S-Sorry. I didn't mean to.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_002: Some of the people here. Don't you think they're a little too tall? No, I don't care. Not actually. How tall you are and how strong you are don't relate. I just need to bring every last one of them down.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_003: What's my tribe gonna do now that I'm gone? That's a dumb question. See who has the bigger fists. The biggest is the new leader. Then they're done. That's it.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_004: I heard a lot about Gavial. Like how she can crush a rock with her abs, and tear a raging beast apart with one hand. Is she actually that strong? Stronger than Chief Blaze? Warfarin said if I get treatment from Gavial, I'll know firsthand how strong she is. It's worth a try... Hm? Doctor, why are you stopping me?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_005: I came here to get stronger, and that hasn't changed. Not just Chief Blaze and Gavial, there's a lot of people here worth challenging... What? I look happy? You're right. I sort of like being here.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_006: The Rhodes Islanders. They all think too much. You too, Doctor. You have to think about so many things every day. You must be tired. You're not? You have to do it? Hmm, I guess that's true. There's a lot of stuff only you know how to handle. So it has to be you... Alright then, keep it up. Shout any time you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_007: Doctor, I need help. The flower basket up there. Get it down for me. What? You can't reach either? This sucks... Okay. I got an idea. How about I lift you up?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_008: Zumama's going on the same mission as me this time? Don't worry. I won't pick a fight with her. We'll have lots of chances to settle our score. Also, if we started fighting, that would make things hard for you, right? Yeah. I don't want to do that to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_009: This flower. Don't you think it's pretty? I grew this one myself. Hey, why are you so surprised? I'm not so crazy about fighting that I only care about getting stronger. Having a hobby or two is completely normal, okay? You... You like it too? Then I'll give you this one. Not bad. It suits you.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_010: Doctor, I picked a flower and... You're asleep? Aren't you lazy? I'll just put this flower on your head. Mm, looks pretty good.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_011: We meet again, huh. I'm the tallest, strongest warrior of my tribe, Flint. I hear you've got a lot of strong people around here? Great. I'll challenge them one by one. Oh, right. Do you know where I can find Chief Blaze?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_012: Not bad. Very nice move. Doctor, I want to challenge this warrior! Where can I find him?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_013: Promotion? Sure, do whatever you want, but I can keep fighting like I was already, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_014: Doctor, you. You've been thinking too much. Any enemies, we can hit them away with our fists! Come. Relax a little. You need to loosen up when it's time to take a rest. Do you want to come over here and lie down with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_017: Got it. Shout for me when it's time to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_018: No problem. Leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_019: We're going. Each of you, watch your cover. Don't leave any tracks.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_024: Will you come one by one? Or all at once?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_027: That look in your eyes, it disgusts me.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_029: You can find victory even without your fists? Heh. I guess that's your style...
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_030: Good job. Didn't know it, but you really are skilled.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_031: Tch. Just some weaklings. Let them go. They're not worth chasing.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_032: Don't blame yourself. It's my fault. I'm still not strong enough.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_033: Hey. Can I hang a sandbag or two in my room?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_036: Huh? What are you doing squatting down over here? You want me to pat your head?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_038: So much food and so many presents... Say, how about ringing in the New Year with a nice boxing match? It would be hard on Medical? How come? They've got Gavial.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_042: Let's pull it together. Anything you need me to help with today?
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_043: Here, a pair of boxing gloves and a bouquet of flowers. Which one do you want? Both fights and flowers can lift your mood, and I want you to be happier. It really feels like you're being too hard on yourself. Oh, know what? I'll give you both. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_415_flint_CN_044: I used to be determined to beat anyone who looked down on me. It wasn't until I came to Rhodes Island that I found there were a lot more ways to prove myself. Say, finishing a mission, helping others... Yeah, I learned a lot of new things here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_001: A little fowlie says you want me for your job supervisor? You asked for it, then. No bunking off.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_002: What's that? Bit of a din? Sorry about that, treacle. We work as we chat, we do. Say, did Feist ever mention? I can't sing a lullaby to save me life. We're all out building Londinium, keeping it going day and night, and meanwhile our little ones are nodding off to the clinking of our hammers.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_003: You don't believe it, do you, when I say the kids here can't get enough of me? I talk about me metalworking, that's all, and they gawp like I'm straight out of fairyland. Got a few Sarkaz eyeing me like a ghost, too... Bet you anything they saw what we could rustle up in Londinium.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_004: Rummaging scrap from the tip, forging a thing or two out of it, it's pretty run-of-the mill. Plenty of us did that for fun during job training, I know I did. You hammer down at first and 'BANG!', and you think to yourself, heaven almighty, what if someone hears me? But soon enough, you're going hammer and tong just to get it finished. See, now you know how we felt making the walkers.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_005: Our Speaker's got a gorgeous name, you know, Vina Victoria. Right pain of a signature! I can see her practicing now. She asked me one time, get this, 'do you want a seat in Parliament?' But I think I'd rather stay in the factories, keep an eye on the kinds of acts she's signing in. She bloody well knows we're watching.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_006: Treacle, I've nothing to hide. You'd find it crap too, having to shelter in your own city. The first step was working with everyone I could. Get them to safety, made more arms in secret, more munitions to fight back. Carried on until every factory was in on it. Luckily, some people did us a massive favor with their agendas. Reunion, you know plenty about them, right? I want to hear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_007: I need to thank you, Doctor, you did more than I ever guessed. If the airship hadn't fallen, we wouldn't be here now having tea. And while we're at it, I appreciate you not calling an old foundrywoman a 'war hero' for driving a walker. Let's be clear: us workers never wanted to be fighting the war.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_008: Pardon me boy Feist. He's got inventions on the brain, and not much in the way of people skills. Got a bit of a ways to go. Lucky he's still alive to invent Londinium something new... That's not what really matters, though, I just thank the stars he survived at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_009: I'm getting on. Even without the Oripathy, my time's coming up, and I'm fine with that. Mind if I have a smoke...? Odds are, I'll be gone before I can hammer out the Londinium I remember. So be it. For each of us old bastards that kicks it, the city's frees up for a youngen.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_010: Don't nod off here. If you want good rest, you sleep when you're meant to. Do things when you should, keep it to a rhythm, alright, treacle?
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_011: Save your hospitality, Doctor. I'm only checking in me grandson here. I'll park myself in your office for a bit, give him time to hide all his gadgets… Huh, don't constipate yourself either, just say the word if Rhodes Island wants a favor done.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_012: Doctor, how many of you made it back safe and sound?
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_013: Now what's the point in decorating this old rust bucket? I suppose she could bang out a shinier medal for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_014: The war had us Londiniers all hammering away on the same line. It might be over now, but we're still thick as thieves. You've won the trust of a good lot, and I think you can imagine their power.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_017: The old machine's getting on a bit, but she still runs as fine as ever.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_018: Sure. I'll be watching this lot.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_019: Keep your wits about ya. Even a factory machine can bite your finger right off.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_020: Nothing to fear. We're here now. We're standing firm. We will win.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_022: Got the ol' girl ready to work.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_024: What? We've got secret tunnels of our own.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_029: They say quenching makes or breaks steel, but without all the hammering first, you'll never get the good stuff. Haha, not half bad, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_030: The grander the machinery, the tighter the little parts need to mesh. All credit to you, Doctor. You know how to make a squad tick.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_031: The most precise tools aren't free from error, and sometimes we have to accept defects. Don't look back, Doctor. What matters is planning the next step.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_032: *cough*, *cough* *hack*... Did you really think it through, eh?
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_033: Whoo… Is all of this your little Closure girl's nonsense?
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_036: Doesn't smell of motor oil here. I'll have to get used to that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_038: It's rare to hear the factories go quiet like this in Londinium. Even the snow can fall without being melted by steam. War's over now. Even if the snow's not as white, I'm sure people can feel that it's a fresh start. For those who have made it through the war, there's no better blessing than that.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_042: Don't stretch yourself too thin, Doctor. I've spied with my little eye, Amiya worrying for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_043: What, you think I didn't bake this cake? It's a little fancy-pants, but I'll have you know, it's me who does up all of Feist's birthdays. It's like working a machine: practice makes perfect. So, happy birthday, Doctor, and thank you and your lot for looking after me boy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4162_cathy_CN_044: Time's the most honest thing there is. Your manifesto won't prove anything. The tracks you leave on the earth, that's what matters… Not that you need me teaching you. I see that part of you, Doctor. The part that's always here to stay.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_001: Come on, Doctor, I just got back from fieldwork. My arms ache, my legs are sore… Can't we leave this stuff for tomorrow? Pretty please? No? Tsk, stupid hood-head… My Rhodes Island pass is ready...? Ahaha! Just kidding. Right away, boss!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_002: Hey, you awake? C'mon, c'mon, snap out of it! And what's with that dopey look on your face? You said you were dead tired and didn't wanna work, so I told HR you passed out and got you some sick leave. Oh, that smell in the air? Dizzyleaf smoke. Isidro tried some before, and he slept like a log.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_003: Who made this finshit class schedule?! Why do I have to sit in an etiquette class with those stupid little brats? And what in the saltdamned seas is this supposed to be? 'List of banned profanity: salty bastard, inquisition gilipollas…' Hmph, honestly, how is—Ow! Why'd you hit me...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_004: Doctor! It's been two weeks since I applied for field missions. I was wondering if—What the hell? Three years with a clean record at Rhodes Island first?! Ahem, I mean, come on, can't you bend the rules just a little. Doing bad things in Rhodes Island's name? I would never! So... Please, my most esteemed boss. Help me, O Supreme and Invincible Commander. Oh, I beg you, the Great Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_005: So much stuff in my room? Not really. Only a bunch of pretty dresses, yummy snacks, and shiny gems. Hey, don't look at me like that! I paid for all this! I just wanna be surrounded by the things I've always wanted. Snuggling up to them helps me sleep at night.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_006: I've slept on beds softer than this one, as well as out in the Salt Flat, and on a ship's deck. I'll never forget how it feels, just like I'll never return to a life on the run. You know what, Doctor? One day, I'll have a nice, big, comfy bed all my own, and that's how I'll know I'm living the good life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_007: Listen, Doctor. Those Bastards at the Inquisition are nothing more than a school of starving saltfins. The moment they smell blood, they'll lock their dead finny eyes on you and mark you for death. Disgusting! Vermin! Stay clear at all costs! Wait, what...? The little bird I was just dancing with was an Inquisitor?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_008: Any towns in Iberia I don't know? Pfft! I could show you where all their mayors hide their doblones. So what's this about? Ohh... You need intel but can't dig it up yourselves? And now you're... begging me for help? Hee hee hee hee. Well then, first of all… Address me properly, as Señora Pascuala.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_009: Oye, Doctor, you think I could earn more in Columbia or Kazimierz? I hear those two places have loads of people who'll throw money at anything. The streets are a treasure trove of opportunity! Oh, don't worry, if I do get a big haul, I'll need you there to help reel it in.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_010: *Sigh* Imagine having a whole office to yourself… I wish I had one too…
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_011: Hola, everyone, pleased to meet you! I'm your newest operator! Señores Elysium and Weedy recommended this place to me. I hope we can all get along—Hey, Pelirrojito! What's with the pretend puking? You got a problem with me?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_012: See? Didn't I say I'm pretty good at this sort of thing?
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_013: A raise? Excellent! Oh Doctor, you are truly my guiding light, and Rhodes Island is the best company ever. I'll work here until the day I die! So, when's the next raise?
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_014: This is just one small step. I'll take another, then another, till one day, everything I ever wanted will be within reach.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_017: Yahoo, I'm here and ready for another day's work!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_018: Hello everyone, I'm your captain for today, so please listen up and listen well!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_019: Careful out there—I'm not that good a medic.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_020: Uwaah! My gosh… Please keep me safe, everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_021: What? Worried I'm not healing them right?
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_022: Relax, your operators have been good to me. I still have a conscience, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_023: This here is a good spot. They can't see me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_024: Check again, it's dizzyleaf smoke. If we can't take 'em down, this'll take 'em out…
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_025: Remember to stand inside the smoke, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_026: The smoke won't chase you like a hungry saltfin, so stay put already!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_027: If anyone's severely injured, just let me know and I'll add more herbs to the censer!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_028: Is my smoke toxic?! More herbs won't kill you, so stop whining already!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_029: Wow, it's a privilege to be working with you all!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_030: Not bad. If I hired one of you as a bodyguard, I'd never have to worry about danger again… What? I'm showing my true colors? Oh, you must've misunderstood. What I meant is, I couldn't bear to be apart from you all.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_031: Frigging heartless bastards… You better remember this! I'll be back for my pound of flesh one day!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_032: Didn't expect you to be so loyal, waiting for me like that! Now move it, or we're dying together!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_033: Hmm, this place isn't half bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_034: Hey hey hey, ever heard of personal space?!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_036: Oh, it's you, Doctor. Want some water? A snack? Just call me whenever and I'll be there to help.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_038: I don't really get what this holiday's about. What's there to celebrate about time simply passing by? If you ask me, people should celebrate when they get what they want. For me, I'll look back at all the hardships I went through, and cherish how they've become precious things I can hold in my hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_042: Hello, Doctor! If you need any help, just give me a shout!
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_043: Of course I remembered your birthday! Though I gotta admit, I only memorized it to get on your good side at first, but then... You turned out to be a real great boss, and a true friend too. Here, some rum I nabbed from the salt ship. For you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4163_rosesa_CN_044: Doctor, I hope you and all the friends I made aboard the landship can live the lives you truly want. Heehee, who knows? Next time we meet, I might be rich and famous, coming to sponsor Rhodes Island!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_001: Help you with your work? Okay, I can do street art, choreography, puppet craft... anything, really. What do you need?
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_002: No, I don't know any Durins at Rhodes Island. Besides, I don't want to go back underground. You know why I left in the first place? When we voted on the monthly music genre, I tossed in death metal. They actually voted against me a thousand-to-one!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_003: The graffiti in the corridor? I forgot to wipe it off. Besides, I went to fess up to Closure. And I got a gift for Aciddrop, since she took the blame. I even stepped in to clean for Purestream. You're not mad at me about anything? Hm, okay. So... Do you want to go tagging with me next time, then?
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_004: The bandages? Yeah, I was gonna use them to cover my Originium crystals, but they keep popping up all over me. A few little bandages can't get them all. It only makes the crystals even more obvious. Why keep the bandages? It's like a statement, you know? The crystals are there, whether you see them or not, and they haven't killed me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_005: After they destroyed the puppets my street art community made, I spent two weeks apprenticing with my electrician neighbor. Taking the new skills I learned with my Arts, my puppets became more than just artwork. Whenever I cast it, the puppets appear, and uppercut the bad guys as hard as I do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_006: This looks like a coffin? Because that's what it is. Oh, could I trouble you to write a eulogy for me? Don't worry, it's for an art exhibition. Many people are 'further from death' than me, but they're still basically walking dead. I just want to give them a wake-up call.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_007: The Society Tribune in Dossoles talks bad about our community. They called us 'sociopathic'. So I pinned a bulletin outside their office, telling them how we eat when we're hungry, sleep when we're tired, and love when we're lonely. If that's 'sociopathic', then society's pathetic.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_008: We beat Mateo down hard in the end, but storming the art gallery was a mess, especially when I led the charge to the balcony to save that bastard, Reynell. Some guys got hurt so bad they'll never hold a paintbrush again… This should've been my blood.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_009: I told you NOT to pat my head! If you were anyone else, I would've thrashed you for that. Since you're not exactly tough, lower your head... lower... now close your eyes. Hmm... there! I just slapped a ticket on your head. Wanna know where? Go ahead, pat your head for it, hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_010: Doctor, I know I was wrong. I shouldn't have hidden my medicine, let alone tried to send it to Dossoles. Please don't be mad, okay? Wait... Are you snoring? Are you even listening?! Ah well, guess that means my apology is accepted.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_011: Are you the Doctor? I'm Tecno. Ernesto sent me to Rhodes Island for treatment, so I'm here to say hi... Um...You're not calling me kiddo? Because you're a nice person, or because there are lots of Durins at Rhodes Island?
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_012: The way that guy fights, it's like some sick choreographed dance. I'm totally stealing those moves. Fighting or dancing? Wouldn't you like to know... hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_013: Doctor, ahem, well... you've always looked out for me. So I got my street art crew to make this bracelet for you. Ah? Wait, you've got something for me first? I... guess I won't argue, hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_014: Doctor, forget the medal. I got my art crew to build you a puppet—we're talking several stories high. Now I just need a hood for this monster. You got any spare outfits I can snag?
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_017: Beating up bad guys again? Count me in! My puppets and I will come in handy!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_018: A group fight? Leave it to me. I'll make sure everyone gets back in one piece.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_019: I don't care how you fight. Just remember one thing: don't play the hero. Call me if things get messy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_020: Hmph, aggressive. Looks like we'll have to settle this with force.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_021: Out with it! I'm in the middle of stretching!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_022: Give me an order. Me, and my puppets, are getting antsy.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_023: I'm not used to being this high up. Can I go back down?
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_024: Okay, sure. My puppets should be able to handle these guys, anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_028: Hey, you! You're the one getting beaten! You don't have to follow my moves!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_029: Doctor, why are you just standing there? C'mon, take my hand, let's dance!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_030: Phew, another lesson for those who never learn. What a satisfying day.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_031: Some of them got away? Let them go. You know the old saying, 'today's enemies are tomorrow's friends'.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_032: Today you got lucky, but we'll see! Quickly, Doctor, we gotta run!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_033: Rhodes Island's facilities are impressive... I'm getting the itch to help renovate the art community. Have to pay it forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_034: Puppet's right behind you. Hmmm, seriously? You're not scared at all? Boooring!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_036: A shoulder tap? Fine, so long as you don't pat my head.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_038: Come! Check out our New Year's concert. Doesn't it make you want to dance? Hahaha~ Good music is supposed to make you jump out of your seat and dance! And Leithanian music totally fails at that!
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_042: Morning, Doctor. Still remember the dance moves I taught you yesterday?
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_043: Come dance with my puppet! Your feet are stuck in their joints? Don't. Move. I'll fix this... There! Now you've got yourself a mobility scooter! Happy birthday! Wondering how to get your feet out? Hehe, I'll tell you tomorrow.
dialogue_tracker.char_4164_tecno_CN_044: Doctor, my old man just came to Rhodes Island to visit me! Who's crying? I'm not! Here, a voucher for Spicy Krysztauowa's Rhodes location. Go there! Go and eat! Don't you forget to use it!
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_001: You want me to help you sort these files? Alright... And double check the numbers too? Sure, leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_002: Wow... There's a lot of people heading up on deck... What? Someone jumped off the bridge and they're organizing a rescue? But I didn't see anything like that when I was flying... W-Wait, they might be looking for me! Ohhh no, I've gotta clean up this mess! How am I gonna explain...?
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_003: Have you ever seen the land stars, Doctor? When I was flying over the frontier, the scattered bonfires were like stars sprinkled across the wilderness. Animals migrate to find a new place to live, but those Pioneers... I wonder if they dream of a nice, warm home?
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_004: Yes, this is a monitoring device. l'll stick it onto a fowlbeast, and then adjust the rhythm of my breathing to the data it sends over. That way, I won't disturb the flock while I'm flying. Ah, sorry, I'm babbling again... Umm... Any other questions, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_005: As a kid, I was really scared of the featherless monster fowls in the stories. They were always snatching up children. Even hearing the chirping of a real fowlbeast got me shaking. But after the first time I got plucked off the ground for real, after I got to see the whole land from above, I was never scared again. Um, you don't believe I got carried off by a fowlbeast? B-but it really did happen...
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_006: I learned some painful lessons on my first test flight. I lost my balance and almost flew straight into a cliff. It's all thanks to my glider that I survived. There's nothing left of it now, only these tattered strips of blue and purple. But I tie them on before every flight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_007: Once, I had an Originium slug pulled out of its shell and plopped down right in front of me. Can you guess who gave it to me? It was a mother fowlbeast hen. She decided I was one of her chicks, but I never saw her again once I left the forest... Well, I'll try to finish the slug soup, it's the least I can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_008: I record my voice, so I can play it back to the fowlbeasts and get them to slowly see me as one of their own. 'Gah gah' means 'look at me', 'Ah-kah' is 'run away'… Hehe, it's all guesses, really, but you learned them pretty quick.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_009: That's the entire pre-flight checklist. Come on, Doctor, I'll be taking you up for a quick loop around. Don't worry, no need to be scared, I'll hold you tight the whole way through. Eh? Ah, uh, no, wh-what I mean is... We'll be strapped together while we're flying, so you can relax. I'm not going to drop you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_010: Doctor, this file... Oh, you're asleep? Go ahead and rest up, then. I'll come back later.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_011: Hello, Doctor, I'm Operator Contrail. Nice to meet you—you remember seeing a photo of me flying with a fowlbeast flock in the news? I-I'm glad you remember me…
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_012: On my next flight, I'll try this super-tricky barrel roll…
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_013: Thanks, Doctor... I love the medal. I'll hang it up with the pendants showcasing my successful test flights.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_014: 'Though it may fall a hundred thousand times, a chick still yearns for its first flight.' I've loved those words ever since I first read them. Doctor, do you think... I've grown?
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_020: Let me check the wind direction first.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_021: Propulsion units and emergency ejection equipment, check. All systems go.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_023: In the pipe, five by five.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_024: All units, watch for my signal.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_028: Is that fog...? Oh, just condensation on my glasses.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_029: A perfect flight record... Next time, we can try somewhere even further.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_030: The two long white plumes up in the sky...? Yeah, those are mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_031: Looks like there's still room for improvement... Maybe I should add a multi-speed pursuit module.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_032: It's okay, Doctor... Anyone could run into a storm. Let's rest up for the night and try again when the weather clears.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_033: The setting sun, some floating feathers, a sea of clouds stretching out into the distance... No, not a painting, it's the view out the window.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_036: There's a black cloud in the corner of the test flight photo? Th-That's my tail…
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_038: You're looking for peace and quiet on the deck too, Doctor? I'm still not too good with crowds, so I wrote all my New Year's greetings down on cards. I didn't have any other plans tonight, so I was just gonna stand here and look up at the night sky... Sure, we can look together.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_042: I don't have any test flights planned for today, Doctor... You just wanted to chat? Alright, you've got my ear.
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_043: This multicolored, feathered wobble doll... It means you should live life to the fullest and never give up. Huh? No, I'm not saying you should get all round and, and, and plump like this, and I'm definitely not saying you're too stingy... Ummm, I'm sorry, I'm bad at picking out gifts... Oh... You were joking? You're teasing me again, Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_4165_ctrail_CN_044: Starting from Columbia, twisting and turning all the way to Rim Billiton. Rhodes Island's following a long and windy course, just like a migratory fowlbeast. I'll be your wingman, but more than the destination, I'm excited for what I'll find along the way. You too, right, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_001: Anything you need help with, Boss? Good.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_002: We aren't allowed to sleep on the ground here? I'll put up a tent in the hallway, then... that won't do either? Why not? At my tribe, we'd just sleep wherever we were when we got tired.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_003: Doctor, why was my application to room with Lancet-2 rejected? Because she's a robot? You're mistaken. The two of us are sisters now. She's my big sister, and I'm her little sister.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_004: Doctor, are medics outside always like Gavial? When she gives me my Oripathy checkups, it always feels like she's just trying to beat me up... That's why we always end up fighting each other as soon as my tolerance runs out.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_005: The Big Priest? Yeah, he didn't come with me, but he did say he'd come visit from time to time. Speaking of which, does he even know where Rhodes Island is...?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_006: Before, my dream was to build a gigantic robot like the nomadic cities. Now, my dream is not only to build a gigantic robot like the nomadic cities, but one that can talk too. Master Closure has already promised to teach me the best of the best about machineries.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_007: ...Oh, I get it now. So, just like 'Great Chieftain', 'Doctor' is a title we use to honor people who are knowledgeable. So that means everyone will start calling me Dr. Zumama once I learn everything I can here, right? Oh, they won't?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_008: Doctor, I was hoping you could accompany me back to Sargon when you have time to teach me how to go about all sorts of things there. But you look busy... In that case, may I ask Lancet-2 to accompany me? Otherwise, Master Closure is fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_009: People outside are always worried about things that don't matter and fighting over them. It's so strange. You too, Doctor. You always look like you're giving yourself a hard time over everything. Here, take this wrench. Let's build some machines together. I'm sure you'll enjoy seeing a machine in the works getting bigger and greater bit by bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_010: I'm starting to get a bit tired myself, watching the Doctor sleeping... *yawn*...
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_011: I passed all the exams, so that means I can stay here, right? I want to learn how to build a talking robot like Lancet-2... Oh, codename? My name is Zumama. Can't I use that as my codename?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_012: To think there's someone who could go up against Gavial on an equal footing...
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_013: A promotion? Is that something like going from a fighter to a warrior? ...In that case, we must celebrate. I think I'll have a barbeque with Lancet-2 on the bridge tonight.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_014: The High Priest told me before it's a vast, big world out here. He sounded kind of heartbroken when he said that. I didn't understand why at the time, but I'm starting to understand after having spent so much time here. The world being so vast, might not necessarily be a good thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_020: I just need to take care of all of them, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_023: It'll be even more efficient if someone who can work with me comes along.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_025: You people are no match for Gavial!
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_026: I'm not all that weak either!
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_027: I'll give it my all no matter the prey!
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_030: Compared to Gavial, you've still got a ways to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_032: Don't worry about it. I've lost to Gavial too many times myself. It's nothing to be ashamed of.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_036: What do I need to do to become as educated as the Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_038: Doctor, is there a holiday today…? New Year's? We welcome in the new year…? I don't understand, we don't have this holiday in my tribe. But everyone looks happy. Can I join in? Where is Lancet-2?
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_042: Doctor, good timing. There's something I wanted to ask you.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_043: I think I've seen how you celebrate your birthdays. You make a wish and tell it to no one, in hopes that it will come true in the following year. Can I make a wish too? I can? Then, let's close our eyes… Hmmm… Oh, right, happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_416_zumama_CN_044: I read in a book that today is a day to show my loyalty to my boss and prove my sincerity. Doctor, I'm struggling with the concept of loyalty. This is a heart-shaped badge I designed and built myself on the Engineering lathe. Why is it heart-shaped? Doesn't that represent loyalty?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_001: Still remember all those mineral geology facts I told you last time, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_002: Pop quiz, Doctor! We've got three different ores here. Get their names right, and you can keep them all, how's that? Here we go... Wow, nailed it... Okay, you get this one too... Bzzt, so close! Just missed one. Better luck next time, Doc.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_003: Come here, closer... Hold still... Don't worry, nothing weird, I'm just putting on some high SPF sunscreen on you. Our next mission's got some brutally harsh sunshine in store for us. You don't prepare, you'll regret it. Alright, come on, let's head up on deck and test it out!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_004: Hang the bag from my tail, Doctor. It's easier that way. Don't worry, my tail is way stronger than my arms. I'd say it's my proudest feature. And Grandma says people in certain parts of Sargon respect strong tail-havers. What do you think of mine?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_005: People ask why I don't collect gems, since they're supposedly prettier. But that's not the kind of beauty I'm after. Exactly! Gemstones have a defined beauty, but an ore's beauty is unbounded. I'm more into the whole 'irregular' thing. I knew you'd understand, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_006: Finding the ore isn't the end, Doctor. You take it slow, you analyze it, you understand it, and you find out that everything leading up to its discovery might be a link in its creation. And then? Then, for the first time, you truly feel the history of this great land.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_007: Hey, why do I hear my own voice? Oh, it's you, Doctor. You're watching my old expedition videos. No, it's cool. I'm glad you've decided to unearth the beauty of minerals, or me. Of course, I'd be even happier if you just asked me straight.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_008: I had a chance to visit a padishah's trove when I was little. There, I saw a massive piece of ore, its color as vibrant as my own hair. It was many years later before I learned its name: Wulfenite. That's what inspired me to start collecting minerals.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_009: You saw my application, didn't you? I'm planning to start a channel here at Rhodes Island to introduce people to geology. And I want you for my inaugural guest. What do you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_010: Are you bored, Doctor? Hee hee, let me show you my special skill: blowing just this one shock of white hair in my bangs. Watch! Huff—!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_011: Hi there, Doctor. I'm Wulfenite, and we're gonna be working together! Let's start by introducing ourselves. I'm from Columbia, and I love exploring, collecting minerals, and...
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_012: I can't believe what amazing adventurers are here at Rhodes Island! I need to work harder!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_013: Doctor, I'd like to apply for a room to set up my own mineral showcase.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_014: Look, Doctor! I passed my aptitude test, and now I'm qualified to lead my own expedition! There are a LOT of ore veins I want to survey. Will you come with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_017: Where are we digging this time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_018: Leave it to me. I'm well prepared.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_019: No need to worry. Just stay close to me, and we'll be fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_021: Did you find a vein, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_023: What ores will we find today?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_026: Ah, I've never seen this ore before!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_027: Fire in the hole. Watch for falling rocks!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_028: I'm the hammer and you're the rock!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_029: Doctor... a hand, please... I'm exhausted... let me catch my breath before we continue the survey…
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_030: Look, Doctor! I found a really rare ore! It's our lucky day!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_031: Come on, don't give me that look, Doctor. It's low grade, but it leaches well!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_032: Let's go back, Doctor. There's no ore here worthwhile.
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_033: Where's the warehouse? I need a place to keep the ore I just dug up...
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_034: Wanna play tug-of-war with my tail, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_036: Hey, Doctor! Good timing. Check out this ore!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_038: What are your goals for the new year, Doctor? Me? I set goals every year: where to explore and how many rare minerals to collect. I've met all last year's goals! We could set our goals together and motivate each other!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_043: Here, Doctor, the mineral you wanted before. Took a lot of effort to find it, hehe. No, don't mention it! I did it because I wanted to. By the way, are you really gonna sit alone in your office all day again? That would be such a waste. Come on, let's go party!
dialogue_tracker.char_4171_wulfen_CN_044: I'm back! Phew... Hehe, Doctor, did you really think I'd spend the whole day in the mines? I rushed back for this important day. How could I miss it? Oh oh, come over here, quick! Look what I found on my trip!
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_001: Although I know this is beyond the scope of an assistant's duties, I would like to tidy up your desk for you before work. Something as simple as stacking your books into a neat pile helps manage one's inner biases and distractions. Would you like to try, Doctor? Don't worry, I'm here to help. Why don't we start with this little mountain of documents?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_002: Why do I have all these bottles of ink on my desk? Are you an ink enthusiast too? Hehe, of course you can borrow some. I have Ceramic Gray for dignity, Feldspar Gray for simplicity and Cloud Gray for elegance. Which are you most partial to...? Oh, they all look the same to you...? Well, I do have some ink the Logistics Department gave to me. Let's get you started with that, shall we?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_003: Baizao fare is defined by delicacy rather than dearness. The lingzhi mushrooms used in Fortune Soup need three years to mature. Tea leaves need prior removal of stems before they can be made into a bowl of tea soup rice, which imparts a light sweetness to the final dish. Whether a meal is frugal or abundant should not change the feeling with which you cook it. Whether your life is poor or rich should not change the feeling with which you live it. That is the bone and soul of Baizao.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_004: Blaze is spreading rumors that I deal in ancient texts? Aww, this is but a collection of historical records. I simply cannot bear to see them lost in the long river of time. Ballads, proverbs, poems, even accounting ledgers. They all harbor secrets between their lines... Hmm...? Doctor, what was that you were hiding just now? Don't worry, I won't conduct any research without permission. Soooo, what is it you're hiding?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_005: The first time I challenged my superior was over his demand to soften a satirical poem into something more pleasant. Yet to what degree is the truth distorted in the name of this pleasantness? How many narratives massaged? How many people... The chronicles of history cannot be a curated collection of comfortable tales.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_006: The Yanese delight in leaving our mark on history, to accomplish great things worthy of record. But what did Father think? Did he ever feel regret? I cannot say. But how could one label him insignificant? A man like him is not mere marginalia or interlinear space… he is the very page upon which history is inscribed.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_007: You are full already, Doctor? No, you're not. Here, try a Laobing. It's a beastmeat pancake of Yang nature, and best paired with bamboo shoot and lily soup for Yin. Oh, and these seasonal apricot blossom pastries are an absolute must! Haha, I'll chronicle today thusly: 'Springtime wandering with a companion, our bellies full, bathed in apricot blossom shadows, sharing wine beneath rustling branches'. That is true refinement.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_008: My relationship with Blaze isn't nearly as harmonious as you say. She's far less well-behaved with me than she is with you. I've apologized to her. After all, she could have led a peaceful life. What did she do? It was a forehead flick. With such force as to leave you dazed for hours. But thanks to that, I've found the courage to maintain our relationship thereafter.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_009: Grandfather cherished his garden, though the two persimmon trees he nurtured bore fruit perpetually astringent, fit only for drying. We would wash the harvest, then spread them out to dry, finally dusting them with a sugar coating as delicate as freshly fallen snow. The sweetness would mask the bitterness, deceiving the tongue, rendering them unexpectedly palatable... Ah, what a pristine snowfall.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_010: Perfect, what a flawless moment… each of us working quietly, our focus undisturbed. How about we go for a warm meal and a break? Say, in two hours' time?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_011: Oh, I've already been introduced? Please, don't believe a word Blaze says. The girl still insists I'm a folk singer. I am Xingzhu, a historian of Baizao. If you happen upon any intriguing ballads or proverbs, I'd be delighted if you would share them with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_012: How very educational. I've learned something new today.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_013: This medal in my hand represents your recognition that more than casualties are worth recording on the battlefield. At times, there may also be primroses in full bloom.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_014: There is a saying I am fond of that goes: the unofficial history is built verse by verse, lyric by lyric. When I think about how I myself will be a verse in the mundane saga, I find it pleasing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_017: A spot of field research? How wonderfu—*cough* I will keep safety in mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_018: Bring forth all your prowess. My pen shall stand witness.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_019: It's a golden opportunity to gather folk material myself. Is there anything I should take note of?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_020: *Sigh* One cannot discuss ice with an insect of summer. However shall I explain this to you?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_021: Very well. I'm on my way.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_022: The road ahead is bumpy. Do take care.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_023: A glance is all I need to comprehend.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_024: There is much to be recorded.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_025: My ink and pen may never rest, my stack of papers put to test.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_026: A humble scholar's duty is all I claim, the way of life that leads not to shame.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_027: Cross mount and river, night of gale and snow, all blankets any whisper of my home.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_028: Here, some poprice candy. Just a little while longer, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_029: I can finally breathe easy. Why don't we get something to eat, Doctor, once you're finished with work? I said after work. The hawker stalls aren't going anywhere.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_030: Hmm… Let me ponder how best to commend your exceptional leadership. Yes, a Compendium of Extraordinary Talents would undoubtedly be less vivid without your story.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_031: I've already meticulously documented the physical characteristics of the escapees. Would you prefer to handle this immediately, or take a brief respite first?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_032: I don't think you need to be bolstered by those 'rallying' folk tales right now. Here, this should do the trick. Delightfully sweet and sour, isn't it? Feeling a bit better now?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_033: May I ask how to get to the archive? Oh, so it's not in the dormitories... Then could you please tell me where the library is?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_034: Oh my! Please, keep the jests in moderation…
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_036: There was a girl, with words so sweet, who stole two chops of burden-meat. She made two biscuits, oiled them neat, then gorged so much she had to bleat: 'Oh! Ouchie-Eek!'…
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_038: I used to detest the clamor of the new year, but now, I find myself with rather more complicated feelings, sitting alone in this courtyard. So I ended up writing a poem on the wall. Instead of wallowing in misery, I would rather whimsically spill my ink. Are the splashes not like silent fireworks, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_043: Oh, Doctor, I dropped my notebook at the noodle house. I need you to come along with me and—Why do we need to go together? Look, ah… erm… well… Sorry, I meant this as a birthday surprise, to offer you a Yanese longevity noodle. It's remarkably challenging for one who despises dishonesty to tell such white lies.
dialogue_tracker.char_4172_xingzh_CN_044: Doctor, we have a tradition of gifting each other books on commemoration days at the academy. I thought long and hard about what you needed before deciding on this: 'Calligraphy: From Amateur To Adept'—It sounds like homework? Nonsense. Just one page a day, and you'll learn to love the tranquility of mastering your strokes.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_001: I'm a jack of all trades, master of none. If there's one skill I can say I have, it's whiling the time away.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_002: Hmm? Oh, these are test lenses, I'm sorting them by prescription strength… Indeed, glasses help us to see things clearly, but 20/20 eyesight is far from enough to truly see the land for what it is.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_003: Reunion? I was with them for a brief moment. The bonfire that is life... You see, they still have much flame left; meanwhile, what am I but leftover ashes, cupped in the hand, waiting until I scatter to the wind.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_004: Was I distracted again? Sorry. I was just glancing at the drizzle and mist outside. It's the bane of wanderers. The mud traps our feet and the mist blinds our vision, making every step feel like wading through a bog, and I mean that literally.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_005: I learned Gaulish pugilism as a form of self-defense when I was an apprentice in Lingones. It hardly differed in technique from plain street brawling, and it was already lost by the time Gaul fell. Hm! I might even be the last in the land to remember it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_006: There's only one way to free myself, and it perfectly coincides with Rhodes Island's goal. That's why I choose to stay, to help others, in hopes that each day, little by little, I get closer to... the end.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_007: In my great-grandson's eyes, you know, I see his grandmother. He visited me, but I wasn't the stranger of the family this time, nor was I struck with pain to see the lines on his face. We've made great progress both. We met, and bid farewell to each other in peace. I could envision no other ending for you and me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_008: See? Tilt the lens just so, point it at your kindling... and poof, fire. Got the hang of it? Good. Not that I recommend it as a technique, no. All that fussing with sunlight and angles? Just grill with an electric grill instead.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_009: These involuntary flashbacks and déjà-vu are beginning to affect my work. The young lady from Medical suggested I carry a notebook with me, so I could jot keywords down to piece together later. Her other advice was to find someone who could help verify the content of my memories. And well... here I am.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_010: I can prescribe a pair of glasses for you, if you can't read what's on the… Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_011: I'm Nowell. I've made glasses for your patients, and I know a little about medicine... I'll be spending some time here.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_012: That one's carrying an umbrella, but it's not raining... oh, it's an Arts Unit.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_013: I didn't do anything worthy of this medal, but... Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_014: I still await death with a passion. It may be that I never repay Rhodes Island for its kindness. Even so, do you still insist on this... reward?
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_017: My experience working alongside others is limited.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_018: You don't need me in the rear?
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_024: I'll take good care of them.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_025: The light is shining at the right angle.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_027: If you're wounded, stay behind me.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_029: Will there ever be an end to conflict like this?
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_030: We have saved some lives. That's something.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_031: Making mistakes is a human thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_032: Go! I have the rear… Go!
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_033: Any place to rest is fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_034: Unfortunately for me, with age does not come heart disease, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_036: Being an optician doesn't mean I have any vision problems. That's to say, I can see you, Doctor. You don't need to get so close.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Once, it tortured me to see doors and courtyards dressed in festive decor, a cruel reminder of time's passage that one could never escape, a far cry from the intended joy. Thankfully, things are different now.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_043: I've heard it's your birthday. When you blow out the candles and make a wish, don't let anyone hear it, for those with cruel intent might exploit it… Just a joke. Happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4173_nowell_CN_044: Rhodes Island is a ship that gives sanctuary to those on a long and arduous journey. Those who find this vessel no longer need to wander, to measure their remaining lives with their feet. If only I had... no, it never could have been.
dialogue_tracker.char_4177_brigid_CN_001: I dunno what this assistant thing's all about, sorry, but hanging around, doing our own thing? That's me all over. Run into someone, belt out a tune, share a wee bite and a pinch of cheer, then we move on. That's the way of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_4177_brigid_CN_002: Even with an empty post bag and no Catastrophes on the horizon, I'd still be wanderin' with my burdenbeasts in tow, never stoppin' in one place for long at all. Mm... Lyin' on their backs, fallin' asleep under the blanket of a starry sky... The further I am from them, the more I miss that life.
dialogue_tracker.char_4177_brigid_CN_003: Down below, whether I'm in or out, I can't see the sky at all, sorry, I'm happier staying on the top deck so. There's a Lupo girl's tent pitched not quite securely. I helped her peg it with some rope and stakes, heheh, now it won't go flappin' mad as the landship goes full tilt.
dialogue_tracker.char_4177_brigid_CN_004: I went down to have a look at where you forge your weapons. The furnace is massive, and its flames get the tin red-hot! The ceiling is real low though, and there's only one lad mannin' the whole place. He the one who makes all the weapons for you? 'Boiler room'? What's that?
