dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_003: 手背上？是留在我身上的两片往日，一次将身体构筑成施术单元的无聊尝试。在秘术印痕覆满全身前，我厌倦了萨尔贡的一切。当它们如潮水般回退，故乡也步步远去，只有残余提醒着我曾属于那里。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_004: 当人们对事物的实际认知与他们说出口的话语不相符时，我能辨别这种差异。测谎，而非读心，与Raidian的情况类似。不同在于，我曾持有心理咨询师执照，她则有天然的同理心与感染力。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_005: 一双干枯的手，抚过农民、商贩、士兵，甚至王酋和帕夏的头顶。所有寻求解答的人无一例外得到混沌的下场，不停歇地惊惧、狂喜，行为失序。我知道，曾经我与圣愚的界限并不分明。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_006: 离开的人让我们连接起过去与现在。在这之后，我们才拥有未来。有人说，“这是牺牲的意义”，我认为，“不”。不要如此功利地铭记，不要将生活抽象，不要神化痛苦与死亡。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_007: “当心那个不动手就能让人痛苦到呕出自己内脏的术师。”某种程度上，这是事实，但我的队员却对此反应激烈，奔走辟谣。极境说，向他人传达关于我的真相，这很重要。......多年轻啊。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_008: 博士，我没有生气，只是放空头脑恢复精力，毕竟我已经到了需要不时停下来喘口气的年纪。好吧，最后一句是玩笑。这是凯尔希医生的建议，可惜同样的方法她自己却不常使用。她总是思虑过重。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_009: 煌和迷迭香都各自保存了一些其他人的旧物。她们找来时，我给了煌一枚信号接收器，给了迷迭香一张发信小唱片。我？我什么也没有留下。对我而言，如果从不打算遗忘，也就不必留意铭记。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_010: 你好，博士。无意打扰你的好眠，只是阿米娅要我提醒你，这里还有很多工作需要完成。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_011: 在授权口令更改前，我将直接听从你的指挥。不必担心，虽然辅助我交流的设备有了改进，但如果没有得到允许，我依旧不会贸然闯进你的意识。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_012: 如果这场战斗里能有Outcast来机动配合，敌方动作应该能被更利落地打断。......你想看看更早时候的录像吗？我知道它们放在哪里。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_013: 先前极境提出要为我模拟特殊晋升过程，说他在这方面算是我的前辈。现在看来，或许他只是为了拖延时间，逃避常规训练。等这边结束，我要找他“谈谈”。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_014: 精英干员晋升有固定的流程，只是审批人员会产生变动。这个位置上有过议长、凯尔希医生，以及你。也许这不算是个好时机，但，欢迎回来，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_020: 请告知我需要探知的波域广度。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_026: 你们无法拒斥我的侵入。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_029: 敌人无所遁形。必然的结果，完美的指挥。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_031: 残敌坐标已经发送至收尾队伍的终端。结束了，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_032: 我干扰了对面的追踪器。趁现在，离开！
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_036: 再试一次吧。这次，我会装作没有提前发现。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_038: 拉特兰颜料走私、卡兹戴尔长脚的赤金......精英干员们习惯在今天晚上分享一年外勤任务的见闻。错过一些故事在所难免，如果你希望的话，我会尽可能为你补足缺憾。坐好了，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_042: （在相互点头示意之后，你们享受了一段舒适的静默）
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_043: 我为你申请了一天白噪音室的使用权。在这边的热闹结束之后，如果你仍然想尝试新的放松方式，可以去那里一探究竟。预约记录在你的终端上，音频也已经按照你的喜好调试完毕。好好享受，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4204_mantra_CN_044: 如果只是为了回报凯尔希医生，我不会留到现在。生养我的是萨尔贡的黄沙，鞭笞我的是乌萨斯的冰雪，而塑造我成为如今模样的，是罗德岛号坚实的甲板。我决定在这里停下，也决定为此处守望。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_001: 我、我认识字......我能帮上忙。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_002: 抱、抱歉，我说话，很慢。华法琳医、医生说，能治好，但是要......很久。没关系，我已经习、习惯了。嗯，只要不会，让您，觉得烦......就好。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_003: 我，手里的？不是草药，是、是一种苔藓。以前，矿工会、会用它烧火，还有，泡水喝。颜色，很好看？嗯。在苔原上，它很显眼，所以很、很早就被人摘光啦。这是最、最后一点，我想，留着。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_004: 您让我敲、敲响钟？想看看我，在矿井是、是怎么工作的......好吧。其实，它算不上，一口钟，只是敲起来，声音......很吵。不，您一定得，捂着耳朵......一定。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_005: 在矿井里，很容易，忘记时间。我就在外、外面，帮他们数着，不能太久，不然他们会、会死。一百一十一，一百一十二，一百一十三......就、就像这样。数的时候很、很流利？欸——欸？
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_006: 对着矿洞，说话，有奇怪的回、回音。我笑，它也笑。我凶它，它就凶我。其实有、有些人，也和矿洞一样——雷尔金，他见到了太多......很复杂的事，最后，也变得，复杂。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_007: 这封信，和里面的麦、麦穗，是他们从边境寄给，我的。开心？嗯。好像，大家最后都、都会走散，然后再也不见？真奇怪，一想到他们的笑，眼睛就、就会酸。欸？您说......不奇怪吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_008: 您听、听说过吗？父母出门去、去铲雪，不久有人敲门，孩子去开门，发现，那是像人一样，站起来的裂兽——我不敢再——不、不止是因为娜迦奶奶。您、您说得对。真的家人，不会，逼我开门。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_009: 没、没有走神！在数太阳，落下去......要多久。舍、舍不得？嗯，在北、北方，太阳，很宝贵，所以害怕，它不、不回来了——明早？您、您愿意，陪我等它......升起来？真的吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_010: 您已经工作很、很长时间了，需要，休息一下吗......我会记得，叫醒您的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_011: 您、您好，博士！大家都叫我......别乔克，嗯——嗯，对，就是小、小树枝的意思！
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_012: 我......只需要保、保护好大家......应该就、就可以了吧？
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_013: 我不怕......吃苦，也不、不怕疼！我会更努力......训练，您可以相、相信我。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_014: 勋章，是给——我的？可是我做得还、还不够。还有好多，感染者......我会帮、帮助更多人！嗯，您、您说得对，我们......一起。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_025: 七百二十三，七百二十二，七百二十一......活下去......
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_026: 五十九，六十。一，二......深呼吸......
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_032: 我们要回、回去，那里还有......我们的人！
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_036: 很久，很久以前，有一、一个迷路的......小雪人......这、这个故事，您听过吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_038: 再、再往左一点，这样就好......啊，又、又偏了。右边请再抬高......一点点就好——好、好了！博士，谢谢您帮我，挂节日彩、彩灯！马上就可以，敲响，新年钟声了，要试试吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_042: 博、博士，您很准时......嗯，我也刚、刚刚才到。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_043: 办公桌上，摆着很、很多礼物呢......啊，博士！您什、什么时候，回来的？项——项链？嗯......这个护身符，是我用带颜色的石、石头做的，我想——送给您。祝您生日快乐。
dialogue_tracker.char_4207_branch_CN_044: 我从小，一直觉得——疼，没、没什么大不了的。也许，我应该疼。但——其他人呢？那些我没、没去过的地方，那里的人，他们不该这样。罗德岛，给了我很多“止疼药”。我想，分给更、更多人。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_001: 第三十六次实验的数据？从左边数，第二个柜子里的蓝色文件夹就是。失误报告？在您身后文件堆的最上面。演算公式在您书桌的左抽屉......您还有什么要找的文件吗？都可以问我。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_002: 您放心，罗德岛的实验室很好，实验器材也没有任何问题，我最近一直在反复地整理这些只是因为......咳，我没想到，居然能再次拥有一张属于自己的研究桌。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_003: 唔！抱歉撞到您，我的眼镜突然起雾了......原本以为自己能正常走到工位上，但是手上的东西太多又没法摘掉眼镜擦一擦，我还是先在原地站一会儿吧......
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_004: 帮忙？不用，我会在终端上输入和上传数据，只是......那些存在终端里的数据，别人点一下按键就能删除或是封禁，用笔写在纸上，能给我一些安心的感觉。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_005: 乌萨斯的极夜实在是太漫长了，漫长到即使把所有的灯都打开，我还是觉得自己等不到哪怕一点光亮、一点希望。跟着你们一路走到这里，我或许只是想证明，自己不是个一事无成的废物吧。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_006: 在远北时，我觉得跟你们走能逃开那无穷无尽的雪，要是留下或许连遗书都会被当成柴火烧了取暖。我一定要跟你们走。在乌萨斯做那些事，你们简直就是疯子，但或许，我也早已经疯了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_007: 在切城时，伊利亚老师迫切地想把知识塞进我的脑子，凯尔希所长和大家不眠不休地演算，我每天都在担心自己要是出错会受到怎样的惩罚......没想到那是我迄今为止最美好的一段日子。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_008: “最年轻的天才研究员”，我也曾为这样的名号骄傲过，可是在远北随便用镐子砸开冻土，都能翻出天才的尸体化成的源石粉尘。有时我会庆幸自己居然能逃离那个地方......我真的逃离了吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_009: 酒是个好东西，能让身子暖和起来，也能把脑子搅浑，好让人不用去想外面发生的任何事......这里太暖和，我现在不用再靠它度日了，博士，接下来我该依靠什么呢？您能告诉我吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_010: 我誊抄了一会儿数据，您就睡着了。是写字的声音让人感到安心吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_011: 博士，感谢你们收留了我，也感谢你们给了我一间......不会被打扰的实验室。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_012: 看来不止是我，为了能活下去，所有人都是如此地努力。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_013: 刚收到开头这么正式的通知时我吓了一跳，还好，不是中止研究的消息......多谢您，我会继续我的研究的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_014: 博士，我找了您很久，您看，我的论文发表在了哥伦比亚的学术期刊上，我的研究方向是正确的！啊？我在笑吗......看来我是真的很开心。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_017: 需要的材料已经准备好了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_018: 我来负责这次的项目吗？好，明白了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_019: 仪器显示的数据......开始读取并绘制图表。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_020: 注意，每隔二十分钟记录一次数值。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_029: 博士，您、您看！我们成功了，竟然真的......有这一天？
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_030: 假设成立，报告一会儿就放到您的桌上。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_031: 我这就去排查问题点，请您相信我。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_032: 失败了？不、不，怎么会？请再给我点时间，下一次肯定不会出什么问题了！
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_034: 欸？我以为是谁，抱歉用文件砸了您......
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_038: 在研究所时我们不会专门庆祝这个节日，除了提醒我们项目毫无进展之外，时间的流逝并没有什么特殊的意义。不过现在......我很愿意相信，它代表着我离下一个出成果的日子又近了一些。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_042: 博士，您来了，实验在正常进行中。给，以前在乌萨斯，我常用热茶提神驱寒。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_043: 虽然觉得给自己的上司准备生日礼物有些奇怪，但我仍旧想这么做。博士，是您给予了我继续从事研究工作的希望，从您决定深入矿井，寻找残余的样本开始......我一直很感激您。
dialogue_tracker.char_4208_wintim_CN_044: 我曾无数次地感叹自己竟然真的在这里完成了一项又一项研究，甚至有病人受益于我的研究成果，用上了更好的药物......能做成事情，看着这里越来越好，我已经非常满足了。
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_001: Hm? Need a hand, Doctor? Or you got something interesting for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_002: Do you know how wild it is, as a Kazimierz Knight, to see a 'company' actually trying so hard to treat Infected? It's a mind-melter, trust me. Yeah, seriously. Justyna still keeps wondering how Rhodes Island turns a profit.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_003: Doctor, question? Can I take a look at Operator Nearl's battle records? Uh, no, I'm just a little curious—yeah? Thanks, Doctor! Let's see, uh... oh, man. Maybe I oughta tell Iwona to push back her sparring with Nearl…
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_004: Ashley and me? We met through the Major. I just got a feeling we could get along. So I took it upon myself to talk to her after the match. Jeez, thinking about it, I've got a talent for scouting, don't I?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_005: Platinum,' huh. I know what happened with her after, but still, no plans to be her friend. Y'know, before, we said the Armorless Union, and the General Chamber of Commerce, were our greatest enemies. But to be real... ha, it's the whole age we live in we're dissenting against.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_006: The titans we call cities rumble forth. As people live on their backs, neon outshines the moonlight, and car engine silences bug chirps with its deafening rumbles. Too much gets tossed away, flattened undertread. Those people, they all deserve a different life... a better one. Infected or not, Doctor, we all oughta be searching for a new way forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_007: Doctor! Heard from Gravel and Amiya, you faced off with the Armorless Union during the Major? And you're the one who sniffed out the Area 0 plot? How'd you—wait, hold on, lemme bring a chair over and get some snacks while I'm at it. Alright, Teach! Take it away!
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_008: Before I met Ashley, I honestly figured I'd be fine if I just kept living. But now, with Justyna, Iwona, Maria—and the Radiant Knight... I'm prepared to fight alongside them. Throw that life of mine out there for them. It's why I fight on.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_009: Maybe one day, when everyone figures out what 'Knight' deep inside their hearts really holds for them , and knights truly retire from the stage, Kazimierz can be peaceful in the truest sense. The Radiant Knight, she told me these words, and they spurred me into seeing more and further with my eyes. Maybe there's more I should be doing, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_010: Take a rest, Doctor. Man, I wonder what Ashley and the others are up to right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_011: Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub Leader, Flametail Knight, Sona! You're the Doctor? Mmm, well, you're kinda not like I imagined, but hey. I'm under your wing from here on out, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_012: Huh. The stuff you watch for real combat's pretty crazy different from the Major.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_013: It's a first for me to get promoted without commercials or camera flashes. Well, Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub Leader, Flametail Knight, Sona! Continuing the stride!
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_014: I used to worry how an ever-heartless fight would lead us all down a messed-up way, but now... heheh, I guess ideals are something you oughta have. Aren't they, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_018: Flametail' Sona, spearheading and rolling out!
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_020: Enemy spotted. It'll be nice if they entered single file like the Knights do, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_022: Feels fresh every time when someone gives me orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_025: C'mon, let's pick up the pace.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_027: Feels bad to lose your target, doesn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_028: 'Tail like a shooting star,' that's what they say.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_029: Maybe our life and times will make its own choice for us. But right now, we can only choose to fight to the last. Because we're Knights, because we're Infected. Because we're alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_030: We've won a lot of times before, Doctor. Here and now, though, we're struggling for our own destiny, our own future. That's the real fight, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_031: This sure as hell isn't a competition, Doctor. Letting them off easy's not gonna win the crowd over, y'know?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_032: Everyone, retreat! Let me hold the rear! Don't worry, I'm an expert in escaping the pursuits.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_033: Wow, this sure beats the Grand Knight Territory sewers. Guesstimating a couple hundred times better?
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_036: You're wondering how I usually dress? Mm, uhh... ahaha...
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_038: Never woulda expected I'd be spending New Year's at Rhodes Island... nah, not like I miss my days in the Grand Knight Territory. Who's gonna go and miss getting hunted, right? I'm just closing my eyes, seeing the broke and Infected celebrating the New Year, under that skyscraper's shadow. The looks on their faces. I still remember it even now.
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_043: Doctor, please take this emblem of Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub handmade by myself! From now on, you are an honorary member of us. Thank you for all the things you've done for the Infected. And happy birthday to you!
dialogue_tracker.char_420_flamtl_CN_044: What a bustling day. Ashley's been busy signing her autographs for the fans, Justyna's playing her grass whistle, and Iwona and Justice Knight are also having fun with other buggies. It's been a while since the last time I saw such smiles on their faces. Good to see they enjoy themselves again, and it's all thanks to you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_001: 这个任务是让我像监督弟弟妹妹学习那样监督您工作吗？好的，我明白了。如果您没有按时完成工作，我会罚您在雪地里跑十圈的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_002: 吁！抬头，挺胸，甩尾，很不错！帮我治病是救命的大事，一定要用我们猎户的最高礼仪来感谢，博士您看这角跳兽又是喷气又是甩蹄子，是我猎到的最壮的一只，可医疗干员为什么不收呢？
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_003: 道歉书：对不起教官，猎人只取自己所需的那部分，如果不能一箭让猎物毙命，就不是捕猎，而是不应发生的杀戮。这是耶拉冈德为雪山定下的规矩，呃，也是我射穿了训练箭靶的原因......
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_004: 传说，有一种生灵会为在暴风雪里迷路的猎人指引归途，它神秘美丽——不，我肩上这只不是，它是为了蹭我的猎物吃而迷路的笨家伙，我叫它裂云兽，很酷吧——啊啊，不可以吃博士的帽子！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_005: 工匠们都知道，耶拉冈德的眼能观万里，要雕得深邃；祂的手能抚平伤痕，要雕得细致。但其实这些观念都是在我们一刀一刀的雕刻中形成的，所以我觉得，明天是什么样，还是要靠自己的眼和手。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_006: 等回去了，我要告诉弟弟妹妹矿石病没什么可怕的，他们的大姐没有被打倒，她现在仍旧拿得稳重弩，照样很厉害！矿石病不是耶拉冈德的惩罚，耶拉冈德只会引导我们，并不会惩罚......
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_007: 啊啊，博士您帮我一下，把左边那股头发放在中间那股上，再把最右边的也放上去编起来——不对不对又乱了！怎么和圣女大人亲自给我编的一点也不像啊......博士，您会编辫子吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_008: 做错事就要受罚，我没看好裂云兽让它偷了您的零食，按我家的规矩，我和它自请离开，您不用再劝了！欸？您说按这的规矩把它给您摸三天就行？博士您算是这里的“家主”，不会骗我，喏，给！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_009: 您也想一起去打猎？好，我明白了，我这就去训练室加强训练。为什么要这样做？您肯定没法自己在雪山里埋伏和追踪，我好好锻炼一下，才有力气全程背着您！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_010: 耶拉冈德在上......请保佑这里的人都能平安，健康。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_011: 圣女大人说，你们能帮我治病，我就过来了。你们这里缺不缺人打猎？比人高三倍的野兽，我一箭就能解决！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_012: 大家的身手都很不错啊！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_013: 这个勋章是干什么用的？哦......有了它以后我就能拿更多酬劳了？明白了，多谢您！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_014: 虽然看不太懂体检报告上的数字，但我知道，我的病情没有恶化。博士，是你们救了我，你们都是很好很好的人，耶拉冈德会保佑你们的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_017: 你们遇上了搞不定的猎物吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_018: 雪山的环境你们不熟悉，记得跟紧我。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_020: 看，这是它们在雪地上留下的脚印......
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_025: 折断的冰凌......这附近有大家伙。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_026: 还没被雪覆盖的粪便......它刚从这里离开。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_029: 这么大的猎物，我也是第一次见......这真是我们捕到的？
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_030: 耶拉冈德在上。我们已经猎到了足够的猎物，就此返回吧！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_031: 裂云兽，快，去找点能止血的药草来！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_032: 博士，快走，血腥味会引来更多野兽的！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_033: 呼......这里真暖和，暖和得都有些热了！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_034: 哇！我有条件反射，会打到人！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_036: 啊啊，裂云兽又在啃您的帽子......
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_038: 谢谢您同意我把弟弟妹妹也接来罗德岛一起过年！他们难得离开谢拉格，在这里玩得特别开心！听说干员们还准备了一些特色菜，我这就带他们去尝尝看！真的非常感谢您！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_042: 博士，您看到裂云兽了吗？它吃掉了我的早饭，我找它找到现在！
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_043: 我不太清楚您这样的大人会想要什么生日礼物，不过我之前给父母送过类似的链子，是用我猎到的第一只猎物的牙串成的，他们都很高兴。这串珠链能保平安，送给您，祝您生日快乐，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4211_snhunt_CN_044: 博士，这是我和圣女大人巡山时用的手杖，我带着它淋过最纯净的湖水，沐浴过圣山上的第一抹朝阳，我将它带来给您，它会护佑你们，走向期望中的未来。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_001: 给，施工计划书和数据核对表。为什么这副表情？我的一天不比你的长，没理由单方面替你干活。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_002: 请握住这几节“树枝”......很好，我已掌握你的身高、体重和骨密度数据。十分钟后，机器人会送来为你量身定做的安全设备。惊讶什么，你没打算跟我进施工现场？
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_003: 霍尔海雅？一个将探究和挑衅写在脸上的羽蛇，给人添麻烦是她的特长。她自称是我的朋友......我听到过这样的传言。只要不耽误我工作，我不会讨厌她。你也一样，博士。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_004: 我拒绝参与罗德岛的工程优化——不，莱茵的技术你们偷不走。只是同为工程师，我知道那位血魔熬夜画施工图的时候是什么心情，这不是特里蒙八点档的建筑真人秀，我没兴趣点评别人的家。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_005: 哪怕克丽斯腾还在的时候，所谓的“十杰”也很少聚齐，所以现在那张圆桌上空了一些位置，并不意味着多大的危机。我在工程科，我很清楚这台名为“莱茵”的机器还能运作多久。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_006: 没错，万千哥伦比亚人旁观了那场坠落，它壮观得令人灰心。我不想讨论为一股狂热的潮流降温是否有必要，博士......羽兽在坠落中学会飞翔，终有一日，卡兹戴尔将悬于天顶。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_007: 我昨天在廊桥上邀请你跳舞？唉，看来缪尔赛思真的喜欢上了这种模仿游戏。博士，我权且相信你没有认出那是水分身，所以，你是不够了解缪尔赛思，还是不够了解我？
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_008: 你听错了，我没有唱歌——你认识逻各斯，以他为参照，我是个不合格的女妖，也已经不属于河谷。但挽歌于我的意义并未改变。累了？如果不习惯在施工的背景噪音里入睡，我可以用咒言帮你。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_009: 看看我们头顶的阻隔层，你觉得它遥不可及吗？还是说，你清楚其形成的原理和解构它的手段？克丽斯腾笃信她的选择是有意义的，而我会确保这份意义成立。博士，我在意你的立场。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_010: 终于，浑浊的梦要沉淀了......
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_011: 初次见面，莱茵生命工程科主任，娜斯提。我有好几位同事经常提起你，幸会。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_012: 倒退三秒，左边显像终端的数据输出有误......好了，问题解决。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_013: 我需要发表演讲吗......抱歉，讨论抽象的话题会让我觉得虚无。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_014: 感谢你与罗德岛的认可，博士。我们合作取得的成果令人安心。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_017: 罗德岛的许多干员都身兼数职，跟莱茵的情况很像。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_018: 塞雷娅负责突破敌方包围，缪尔赛思负责必要的谈判斡旋，她们缺一不可。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_020: 必须确保施工现场的环境安全。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_021: 要是计划不够精准，我会修正。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_023: 不用重申施工目标，我已经开始工作了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_025: 再听听，这只是施工的杂音？
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_026: 忏悔？我只听见灵魂的乱码。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_030: 再补充一轮检查......对我们来说，“完美”只是合格。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_031: 达成“预期”。怎么说？我们给自己保留了改进空间。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_032: 为什么要生气？你猜莱茵的各个项目正式动工前，我要为同事改多少遍施工图？
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_033: 电梯间的灯泡接触不良，我换了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_036: 别揪机器人的叶子......知道了，我会教你吹母亲作的那首曲子。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_038: 接上最后一根电缆，三、二、一，启动......每到这种时候，研究员们都会冲着四溅的电火花兴奋地喊“烟花”，你倒是很平静——新年快乐，博士，我们来不及回去和其他人庆祝了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_043: 你还活着，树叶就是比骨哨应景的乐器。我熟悉的旋律？不，约翰老妈的广告曲不太合适......曾经，有一群拓荒者瘫坐在脚手架上，对着夕阳哼起一首歌，欢迎一位女妖的加入。听听看？
dialogue_tracker.char_4212_nasti_CN_044: 女妖不会忘记养育她的河谷，拓荒者不会忘记她跋涉过的荒野——这是我加入莱茵生命的来路，也是我的未来。博士，罗德岛对你而言意味着什么，你又将给予它怎样的指引？我们的合作将继续。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_001: 整理计划书？拉倒吧，都是些实现了的计划，整理它们干嘛？......也有没实现的？那我们还花时间在这整理废纸干嘛？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_002: 先别说，让我猜猜。这是智能头部按摩仪、自律气压调节头套，还是全息环境监测装置？......就是个普通兜帽？那咋行！拨点经费，我给你整一套配得上“罗德岛之主”的行头。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_003: 我捣鼓违禁品是不假，但，“反抗规则”？那套只要钱给够，牙膏都能变成违禁品的“规则”，不配。我想把有意思的好东西救出违禁品仓库，你想把有用的好药卖进正规市场，我们才是一路人。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_004: 看我，博士！为了这次的源石制品规制峰会，我专门捣鼓了这副炫光假鬣毛！它能自动变色，还能......啥，峰会半小时前就开始了？算了，不亏，我反正捣鼓爽了，峰会的事再想办法就是。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_005: “螺旋桨天堂”里也不都是天才，我这个物理知识全从益智玩具上学来的外行，尤其不是。我都能搞出这些名堂，那随便哪个长了脑子的，都能。要是我能让大家都拿到称手的家伙，那得是什么盛况？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_006: 瞅瞅，星空，亮闪闪一条毯子盖在天上。不怕你笑话，我小时候还会顶着戳满了孔的毯子走到灯下，假装是在看星星呢。是很蠢，但人就是得摸着一个个的蠢办法，才摸得到自己想要的未来，不是吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_007: 我挂在天花板上干嘛？哈，看你热得坐立难安的，我这螺旋桨不是好歹能当个风扇用用嘛。说真的，我最不理解你这种天才的，就是为啥有脑子能研究绝症，但想不到先给自己装个好用点的空调？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_008: 当年在提卡伦多，看你蹲在拘留室里还若无其事地研究墙角的蘑菇，就知道不是管理局抓你，而是你在戏耍管理局。能和你这等奇人混成合作伙伴，算我有本事，也算我当年没白给你的牢饭里加肉。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_009: 等等，你刚才叫我什么，“朋友”？不不不不，我是用这个称呼讨好过很多人，但咱俩之间，没必要吧？我可不想用这种吃饭口味不合就能闹掰的关系，玷污我最可靠的合作伙伴。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_010: 我迟早得想个办法，把那些长了脑子不会用的蠢货白白浪费的营养都转移给你，免得你还要花时间睡觉。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_011: 来一根，博士。给，火。源石烟花而已，更厉害的还有的是，咱今天谈得好，你明天就能拿到。烟酒施术单元以及源石制品管理局，高登·谭农，幸会。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_012: 我还有以前在边境制服犯罪团伙的执法录像呢，需要不？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_013: 这是实实在在的晋升奖章，不是替死鬼的断头凭证吧？嘿，那我还真是第一次拿。开一瓶？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_014: 我看这罗德岛，倒是颇有成为下个“螺旋桨天堂”的潜质！再多晋升几次，我带着你干，哈哈......嗝！
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_017: 这都是来帮忙搬运我的小家伙们的？那我多带几箱。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_018: 你们就记住一件事，一会儿踹门要踹出气势来！剩下的我来搞定。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_019: 高能源石化合手雷，亲爱的，不用继续在收藏室里度日如年了，我会让你炸得惊世骇俗。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_020: 一个两个的都给我蹲下！看什么看，没见过管理局执法啊！
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_021: 放一万个心，我懂你意思。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_023: 就别琢磨了，甭管把我安排在哪，我最后都是要往天上飞的。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_024: 你还是往里头站站吧博士，我都看见你的兜帽了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_025: 敢动手，防护服你给我修？没轻没重。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_026: 再叫唤，我计错数了咋办？没点眼色。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_027: 你趴着，我怎么测试武器？不负责任。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_028: 别装死，换武器再来一轮，对照实验！
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_029: 高能源石化合手雷，亲爱的，看到那烟尘和碎片了吗？你是成功的，你是伟大的，你有上百千克的爆炸当量！
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_030: 手铐铐上了知道说自己是被忽悠来的了？当初怎么没想着自己还长了个脑子呢？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_031: 别管那几个逃掉的了，胶带，胶带有吗？这可是萨米搞来的过冷凝液化源石，漏一滴少一滴啊！
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_032: 你们跑呗！我高登·谭农天不怕地不怕，就算是把命丢了，也不会把这根尾巴丢了！
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_033: 这么漂亮的基地，会钻地和会飞天总得占一样吧？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_034: 解压吧，这手感？专门设计的，我自己也戳。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_038: 来，敬您，博......啧。你看看我，管理局里带出来的老毛病，阿谀奉承的，把咱俩平等的合作关系都搞变味儿了。这样吧，待会你给我的新装备当一回体验员，咱就算又扯平了，怎么样？
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_042: 琢磨什么呢博士，讲给我听听。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_043: 来，博士，还有几百个小家伙等着认识你呢，一会儿让它们给你放个前无古人的大烟花......什么叫太隆重了？我巴不得你天天过生日呢，不然我自己想这么搞还得专门找个由头，多麻烦啊。
dialogue_tracker.char_4213_skybx_CN_044: “螺旋桨天堂”、罗德岛，如今都只能独自在荒野上流浪。但早晚有一天，会有一百座“螺旋桨天堂”和一百座罗德岛并驾齐驱。到那时候，我们才是大陆，而麦克斯特区，会变成一艘流浪的小船。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_001: 你也不想听我讲解你自己的办公室吧！哪怕让我用板车拉着你也好，麻烦出个门吧！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_002: 那边可不只有被锈锤驱逐的食人族，还有为了活体源石森林而潜入的天灾信徒......啧，一般的顾客这时候都求着我带他们去啦，你是什么好奇心绝缘体吗！你等着，我拿两瓶水再来讲！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_003: 不用捞我也没关系啦，那所监狱服务还不错来着。被我不小心砸过招牌的那几家旅行社老想着给我整进局子，托他们的福，我的《泰拉旅行“免费住宿”指南》已经新添了不少素材啦。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_004: 收多少钱和难不难走没关系啦，不会因为你要去骸骨荒原就开高价的。要是你的点子足够有趣，那把自己带上就好了，要是你只想踩着禁区警示牌拍纪念照，那就要多带点钱了！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_005: 虽然天天违法违规，但我也是有准则的！比如，一定要把带进去的游客毫发无损地带出来！要不是有这条绝对不能违背的准则，我肯定一辈子也想不到自己打得过一头裂兽......
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_006: 也不是一定要去禁区啦，我又不是喜欢被隔离网电得嗷嗷叫。如果你坚信罗德岛的厕所里藏了古代密道，我也超乐意现在就带你去找。这片大地上，有多少不信邪的人，就有多少值得我去的地方。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_007: 我的领带？皱皱巴巴的？哎呀，用来擦过太多游客的眼泪，就这样啦。有吓哭的，有感动哭的，有开心哭的......旅行就是有这样神奇的效果。你说，我什么时候能让你也哭出来？
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_008: 什么星星上的文明遗迹，什么亚空间的流浪舰队，嘶......我才没有不信，我只是没听懂！哪怕你不是博士，而是个躺在病床上烧糊涂了的老家伙，我也会信的。问题是，我们啥时候去看？
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_009: 嘘——不行！矿石病没法治是常识不假，但唯独不该由一个天天忙活着要治愈矿石病的家伙说出来吧？我还有好多“不可能去得了”的地方要琢磨怎么走呢，这身“不可能治得好”的病，就交给你啦。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_010: 看来你是随时随地思考人生型的游客呢。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_011: 给你介绍一下我们旅行社的成员！社长是我，社员是你，咱们去哪？
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_012: 咱们都去过的地方，还要在录像里看一遍吗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_013: 噗，导游还能“晋升”？听着像是鼷兽获封“最佳城市清道夫”。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_014: 号称药企却和多国政治人物频繁往来的神秘组织独家认证的金牌导游！拿这个名号出去揽客，我都不敢想会吸引来多少人！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_017: 我还没带过这么多人的团呢。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_018: 都跟紧我的导游旗哦，可别走着走着丢了。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_019: 跟这么紧是要干什么啦！我是要放哨才爬大树的！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_020: 噫，这个臭味，我知道敌人在哪边了！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_023: 博士，上我这儿来，这儿风景好！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_024: 不让他们过就行了？这个我熟呀！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_025: “须知：闯禁区不会使你获得超能力！”
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_026: “弹药涨价，击毙前将不予鸣铳示警！”
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_027: “警告：继续前进可能招致导弹打击！”
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_028: 嘿，这些聒噪的喇叭拿来吓唬人还真好使。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_029: 怎么样，汗毛都没少一根吧？以后谁都不许说那儿是什么“死亡地带”了啊。
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_030: 本团到此解散！大家回去之后记得帮我跟身边的人宣传一下哦！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_031: 逃跑得这么专业干嘛，我要告这些家伙侵犯我的技术专利了！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_032: 嗨呀问题不大，跟着我跑就好啦！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_033: 这里不会正好有什么不让进的秘密区域吧？
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_034: 博士，你怎么跟个针蚤似的！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_036: 想体验抱团取暖的话，跟我去一趟萨米呗？
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_038: 噗，别跳啦博士，萨尔贡没有哪个部落的新年习俗真的是围着源石晶簇倒立跳舞，我刚刚是逗你的。不过，为了让你今天不白跳，我决定了，新年第一个目标就是带你找到一个真有这种习俗的地方！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_043: 生日生日，你猜是纪念什么的日子？是你的活动空间从一个小小的器官，变成一片很大的大地的日子哦！怎么这些年过去，你的活动空间又只剩一间办公室啦！至少今天，跟我！出门！一趟啦！
dialogue_tracker.char_4214_cairn_CN_044: 哦——大家都这么有理想真是太好了，咱俩这辈子都不愁没活儿干了。你呢，负责实现大家本来就有的理想；我呢，负责实现大家还不敢有的理想，咱俩简直就像三明治的两片面包！
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_002: I wonder how papa is doing nowadays... But, I trust the mayor to keep her word, so it should be fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_003: Though Dossoles is noisy and filled with bad people, life there is still a lot better there than the rest of Bolívar... Mhm? You haven't been there yet, Doctor? Hehe, Let's go together next time then.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_004: Phew… Staying inside all day is so stuffy. Doctor, let's go get some fresh air up on the deck, okay? I'm sure you must be tired from working for so long.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_005: Doctor, do you enjoy all this fighting and killing? I don't, not really. But I guess I've been around it too long, and done too much myself... I'm kinda used to it…
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_006: Getting stronger is nice, but I can't think of what to do once I'm stronger... Doctor, how do you decide what you want to do?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_007: For the longest time, Papa didn't want me to help him. You know, my personality isn't really suited for what he does. But still... I gave it my all, because he took me in as his daughter.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_008: Doctor, doctor, can I scooch a little closer to you? Well, the office is so big, it feels a bit empty and lonely sitting so far from you… Can I?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_009: Doctor, I don't think you can fight at all, but you're just as reliable as papa. It feels like I can just follow your orders, and I won't ever have to think for myself. Oh...? But for me, that's a good thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_010: What does the Doctor look like under that mask? Let's sneak a peek…
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I'm Rafaela, the one Miss Ch'en introduced. I'll be formally joining Rhodes Island today. Uh, code name? Mhmm... You can call me La Pluma.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_012: Hmm... Wonder if I can really do this.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_013: Doctor, did you need me for something? Mm? A promotion? Hmm... did I do something special?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_014: Doctor, I'm stronger than before? Really? Hmm… I'm not sure I feel anything different… But if you say so, then it must be true.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_018: I'm kinda good at leading the way.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_019: Where are we going this time?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_020: Now then, I can't afford to get sidetracked.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_021: Woah, Doctor... Don't scare me like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_024: All I have to do is keep them from passing, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_029: Woah... I didn't think I could accomplish a mission like this…
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_031: Doctor, leave the rest to me. I'll get them.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_032: Doctor, this way. We need to run.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_033: The corridors in Rhodes Island are so wide…
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_036: What's the Doctor doing now? Let's go take a look.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_038: Happy new year, Doctor. Rhodes Island is so lively during New Year. Woo, look over there, the operators have prepared so many games. It looks like a lot of fun... Doctor, which one should I try? Can you choose for me?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_042: Oh, Doctor. How did you end up right in front of me?
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_043: Doctor, a lot of Operators ask me to mix special drinks for their birthdays. Each one is custom-made based on their preferences and the weather that day. Would you like one too, Doctor? Hehe, but only after you've finished your work.
dialogue_tracker.char_421_crow_CN_044: Here you are, Doctor! I was just helping the others with the decorations. I did a whole wall by myself. Celebrations like this are so much fun. Oh, do you have a moment? I'd love to show you my work.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_001: You can hand me whatever work you want, as long as I'm capable of handling it. After all, I'm here to let you catch your breath, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_002: My sickness isn't that bad. It hurts once in a while, but I can take it. Doctor, I'll continue working, be sure of that. I don't want to let anyone down.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_003: I think… I ate them all. Eh...? Those were your snacks for the week? I'm so sorry... I can make you some cheese fondue for your afternoon teatime.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_004: I still can't help but bow whenever I meet Master SilverAsh and the Saintess in the corridors, even though they tell me that at Rhodes Island, I should treat them as coworkers. I'll try, somehow.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_005: I... wouldn't make a good explorer. I want to protect much more than explore. Driving the posts in, building a home. People as tenacious as you always need someone to watch your flanks, right? That's who I want to be, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_006: Master SilverAsh says that Kjerag can't forever rely on Kjeragandr, let alone another country. One day I hope to stand against the blizzard with this shield, for the sake of my family.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_007: I have dreams of snowy mountains all the time. Dreams of... running across lakes frozen deep. But my home isn't just snow and ice. Grass covers the valleys, and trains weave swiftly between the slopes. Those, too, form the Kjerag of my memories.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_008: ...I'm always asleep when you come to see me? No, I'm not feeling unwell or anything. It's a habit; I work for days at a time, and the moment I lie down, I fall into a long, deep sleep. But just call my name, Doctor, and I'll wake up straight away. Don't worry about me.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_009: Doctor, have you ever seen the aurora? When I was a student, I saw it just once in the northernmost tundra. It was very soon after I got sick, and I had to say goodbye to the survey group. If I can ever go back... would you come see the aurora with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_010: Doct... you can have my jacket, okay? You'll catch a cold, sleeping somewhere like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_011: Doctor, I'm Aurora. My boss Closure talks about you a lot. I promised her I'd protect you.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_012: Is this... a record from the battle in Lungmen? So this is another way you can use shields... I've learned a lot.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_013: Captain Sharp's assessment... is so high? And you agree as well? I... I'm so happy!
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_014: Could I send this medal home? I want my mother to know, I might be sick, but not everything looks bad. I have made my way.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_017: A field mission again? I'm with you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_018: You want me leading? I... I'll work to follow Captain Sharp's example.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_020: You there, stay back! Don't come any closer.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_024: Don't even think of coming through.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_025: The snows of my home... are with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_026: Snow, be what boils my blood.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_027: Snow, be what freezes their blood.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_028: Snow, be what warms my family.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_029: I'll become stronger than I was, to make your victories easier.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_030: Stay back, for just a second... I'm too icy now. Let me just rub a bit to warm up... good, that's better! Alright, now it's safe to high-five!
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_031: Next time, I won't let a single one escape.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_032: Doctor, we have to retreat! Can you still move? Get on my back... no, I'll carry you!
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_036: Are you heading out? I'll be your bodyguard.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_038: Doctor, Happy New Year. I hope the snowflakes that cover the land this year can be gentler and warmer than before.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_042: You're looking well, Doctor. Just say if you need anything.
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Sit here and wait for me one moment, okay? Shield output adjusted, and... Look! Now it's snowing inside your room! When the snowflakes melt in the palm of your hand, doesn't it feel so wonderful? I've always been wanting another chance to see the snows of Kjerag with you!
dialogue_tracker.char_422_aurora_CN_044: Rhodes Island has alleviated my Oripathy, and given me a great job, so by all rights, I shouldn't be asking for anything more... but, Doctor! If you'd be willing to take a look at this proposal for improving the dormitory refrigeration and air conditioning, I'd be very, very thankful! You—You accepted it? Really?!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_001: I wouldn't dare boast of my prowess with a sword or Arts, but if you have any problems with equipment maintenance, you can come talk to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_002: Zofia is my distant aunt, as well as my swordsmanship instructor. It's thanks to her that I can survive in the knight sports scene, but my aunt sometimes— Oh! I mean, my sister! Um, Doctor! Please don't tell her I let that slip, she's actually super sensitive about it!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_003: Doctor, to be honest, I'm a much better craftsman than I am a knight! Whether it's repairing an alarm clock or forging armor, I can help! So, Doctor... Can you please take me to see Vulcan's and Closure's workshops? Pleeeeease.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_004: Those two Sarkaz ladies seem hard to talk to... But if my sister trusts them so much, they must be very good people. The Radiant Knight fighting alongside the Sarkaz for the sake of the Infected... Unbelievable! That sounds even more exciting than a breaking news headline!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_005: Actually, I never got an official title like my sister's 'Radiant Knight.' 'Blemishine' is just the codename I chose for myself... But if I was to continue down the path of knighthood, maybe Blemishine wouldn't be a bad name.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_006: Kazimierz's knight sports are nothing more than a huge commercial game, and we all eat out of its palm. I didn't realize it until after I came to Rhodes Island. But the trouble with Kazimierz may run deeper than its betrayal of the knightly traditions... much, much deeper.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_007: Compared to competition knights, Rhodes Island operators are way more like the traditional knights in the novels. In fact, I've been pretty obsessed with these knight novels for a long time. Knights, enemies, adventures, and treasures... But I guess everyone can get that stuff from knight sports, so the novels aren't as big as they used to be.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_008: When I first saw my sister after all this time, it was like she was a totally different person. Instead of that dazzling, blinding light she used to give off, she was more like the gentle sun, warm and stalwart. Did she change for Rhodes Island? Then I want to see for myself what my sister found here!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_009: I couldn't become a real knight, but maybe that's why I was able to get a better view of the lands. I might have more insight now because of it. 'To be a knight is to be the noble light that illuminates the land.' {@nickname}, you will bear witness to my resolve.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_010: Doctor? Oh, you fell asleep. I wonder if you also have dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_011: Kazimierz knight, codename 'Blemishine.' I've heard all about you from my sister, Doctor. You can just call me Maria if you want.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_012: Wait, hold on... Gosh, you can do it like that?
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_013: A promotion...? Hehe, for the glory of the Nearl family, I'll continue to give it my all!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_014: I just realized it's all older folks around me, and I don't really have any friends around to ask... So, Doctor? What do you think about this equipment I made for myself? Pretty cool, yeah? Does it look good on me?
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_018: Captain? Me? B-B-But I don't have any experience with team battles…
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_020: Our family motto is, 'fear neither hardship nor darkness!'
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_029: Small as it may be... our light persisted until the end!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_030: Each victory will become a light that illuminates the path forward. Doctor, you've done well!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_032: I'll protect the wounded. Take the others and retreat, quickly!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_033: So this is the inside of Rhodes Island... Aw, I'd really love to see the schematics…
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_034: Woah! Don't scare me like that...
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_036: Doctor! Shh! I snuck over here to hide from Auntie Zofia. Hehe, let me take the day off!
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_038: Kazimierz will have already auctioned off the 'firework rights' by now. But rather than a flashy fireworks show, thank-you letters to my grandfather made a deeper impression on me. The kid he saved from the war grew up, started a family, and came to Kazimierz to see him. Margaret was also really happy that day.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_043: I've made you all sorts of gifts, Doctor. Metal mask, swords, other things… But I guess you don't have much use for them. Why don't you choose something you'd like to display in your office? Ahahah... Sorry... I really only know how to craft knight stuff, I haven't figured out what to do for Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_423_blemsh_CN_044: What exactly should the Golden Pegasus coat of arms symbolize? I'm not nearly as clear on that as my sister. I never got the chance to learn much from our ailing grandfather. But I still think... people can recognize a sublime spirit, and naturally look up to it, even outside Kazimierz.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_001: You pulled an all-nighter, and you're still not done? Sheesh, what should I do with you...? How much do you have left? I'll help. You should get some rest. And work on your time management.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_002: I can confirm we've received this shipment of medicine without issues. The quantities are right. As for the payment, could you please let Kal'tsit know I'll take care of that pain-in-the-neck mission for her.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_003: Count Hohenlohe, some call him the Hyacinth Count. The way I see it, he's quite a handful with that personality of his. I'm serving as huscarl to this Leithanian noble, on account of some trouble. What trouble, you ask? Hm... Let's keep this a secret for the time being.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_004: That little one... Her codename here is uh... Beeswax? Looks like she tripped in the hallway again this morning. Can she really cut it? She sure knows how to keep her sister worrying.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_005: Rhodes Island provides what the count and I need. In return, I take care of Rhodes Island's troubles in Leithanien. This is what you call a win-win situation, isn't it? Come, shake my hand. This is the beginning of a beautiful friendship, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_006: The Leithanians' research on Arts has far exceeded my expectations, and their architecture, music, and education... All are worthy of study. One day, I will bring all this back home. Yeah, and I might bring something else along, though.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_007: The longer we acclimate to an environment and the different people there, the harder it will get for us to free ourselves, and eventually we'll be made to fit its mold... Don't you agree, Doctor? Well, that's not going to get me tied down here. Not unless I allow it.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_008: I'm sure the nobles think of me as an odd thorn in their side. No matter. I don't mind. Though I'd rather keep all this trouble a secret from Beeswax. It's too dangerous... Now that I mention it, I can't quite stop worrying about you, either.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_009: If it's at all possible, I'd rather stay out of the nobles' bickering. Do you know how much I have to worry about each and every day with all the chaperone work and missions on my plate? Maybe I should talk the count into letting me hop over here full time. I'm relying on you to keep me under your wing when the time comes, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_010: My little sister sometimes talks in her sleep. This one time, I even caught her talking bad about me. Heheh, Doctor, do you know what you said in your sleep the other day?
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_011: Hello, you must be the Doctor? I'm Carnelian, huscarl to Count Hohenlohe... Oh, I'm just a normal operator here at Rhodes Island. Kindly refrain from frivolous conversation with my little sister, won't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_012: I see. These are tactics worth studying.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_013: There is no need, but I appreciate your kind gesture. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_014: You see, I find myself worrying about a vast number of people and things, and that number is growing by the day. It's been a while since I was able to do as I pleased, but since you're up for it... Let's put on a show.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_017: This is not part of our agreement, but fine. I'm happy to help.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_018: Don't worry. I'll bring everyone back, safe and sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_020: Elegance and etiquette are the way of nobility. Not mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_022: Between a refined combat style or something more direct, which do you prefer?
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_023: It's been a long time since my blood boiled like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_024: Greetings... Let's forgo the bothersome formalities and get this thing started.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_025: Gnaw them to shreds and drink their blood!
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_026: Crush them, beat them to a pulp!
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_027: Careful! Don't get torn to shreds so quickly!
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_028: My oh my, what a pitiful sight. Why are you covered in blood?
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_029: Nothing to worry about then. That was easy enough for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_030: Okay, mission complete, and right on time, too... Are you hurt, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_031: Calm down. Just leave the rest to me. They won't get away.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_032: Fall back, now! Don't panic. As long as I'm still standing, no one will touch you!
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_033: Just as I thought. I can relax better in a room without much decoration.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_034: Oh... Watch out. My horns could get you.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_036: What's wrong? Are you tired? Get some rest. You've worked hard enough already.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_038: My horns look especially good today? Thank you. It was my little sister who insisted on giving me a cornicure. I might as well assume that such things bring good luck for the new year. Having experienced a variety of customs, people's feelings when praying for new beginnings are always similar.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_042: More work today? Don't spend the whole day sitting, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. I am not one to play the sycophant on such occasions, but I'm willing to offer you a gift as a friend. This gramophone is for you, and when next I travel between Rhodes Island and Leithanien, I'll be sure to bring back some records.
dialogue_tracker.char_426_billro_CN_044: Rhodes Island is a partner that keeps its promises, but true partners need connections deeper than contracts. No, Beeswax has grown up, and her relationship with Rhodes Island is her own business. What we are discussing now is between you and me.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_001: Organizing documents? Doctor, we have much more important things to do. Bene, I'll give you a hand, if you insist. But do remember, I expect you to come up with a plan that's worth my while. Do not disappoint me.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_002: What do you want to know? Secrets of the Siracusan famiglie? There's hardly anything worth mentioning there. The things we do are no different from the wolves fighting in the wilderness thousands of years ago. Only, time has taught us some new tricks. Heh, you see 'order' could be the official name for 'tearing your prey to pieces.'
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_003: For many years, I couldn't really understand my father. He paid the ultimate price, only to betray almost everything in the end... But I still remember the question my father posed to me many years ago, when we were sitting together in a park: 'Siracusa, sara un posto migliore senza le famiglie?'
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_004: Judge Lavinia never realized what she was getting herself into. The game with Signora Sicilia won't be won through courage or resourcefulness alone... She's looking for me? To discuss my unbalanced diet…? Tell her I'm not here.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_005: The old ways make it impossible to find a new path. If the new Siracusa is built on violence, it will fall back into the same well. The destruction of a few individual famiglie is far, far from enough. We must kick the entire 'habit.'
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_006: The disputes among the famiglie were petty and stupid. The dons clung on to whatever authority they had, thinking they were the masters of Siracusa. But I invite you, Doctor, to join me in shaping a new era.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_007: If you want to show respect to the Siracusans, then hire a proper Siracusan chef. The next time I see any 'innovative Siracusan cuisine' out of your minions... Beh, let's just say somebody knows about your little office naps, and it'd be a shame if the beans got spilled on your beauty sleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_008: Something on your mind? If it calls for blackmail, bribery, or something worse... none of that would be much trouble for me. Underhanded business is pretty much all I inherited from my famiglia. As for how to use my knowledge, that's your call.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_009: Zaaro, il Signore dei Lupi... the shadow lurking behind me and my father. Don't be fooled by his pretentious words. A wild beast's hunt won't slow the progress of humanity. If he appears before you one day, I will drive him away.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_010: Hey. Is our 'cooperation' just me watching you sleep?
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_011: Buongiorno, Doctor. I am Famiglia Bellone's... Lasci perdere. My famiglia doesn't exist anymore, but that was the price we paid to buy change in Siracusa. As for what comes next... Operator Vigil is at your service, Doctor. I hope our partnership will be productive.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_012: I am no stranger to violence. As long as I'm on the scene, things should be a little more efficient.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_013: A promotion? There's no need to test me like that, Doctor. I've played this game too... winning people over with small rewards. But if you're just trying to show your faith in me... Va bene, grazie.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_014: Our partnership has been productive, Doctor. A made man would sell out anybody for his ambitions, but I can promise you one thing: you've bought my loyalty with yours.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_017: Va bene. Let's see if your plan is worthy of my work.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_018: The process is just as important as the end result. Don't go dying on me, ragazzi.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_019: Remember, our purpose is not violence itself, but rather the victory it brings.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_022: They'll be sleeping with the fins in no time.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_023: Don't make this harder than it needs to be.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_024: Anything outside the plan, I'll judge for myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_025: Let's put an end to this show, pronto.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_026: And what purpose do you think your sacrifice will serve?
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_027: This hunt has dragged on for too long.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_028: A valiant struggle, but you won't get away.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_029: They have no idea who they're messing with. Bravo, Doctor. I was right to partner with you. I hope you'll find even more challenges for me in the next battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_030: Are we done yet? What are you looking all smug for? These stronzi have already wasted too much of our time.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_031: They're getting away. Do you need me to walk you through this? Ma dai! Whack them already.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_032: I'll take care of the evacuation. You get moving, fast. I hope this won't happen again, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_033: Careful with the moisture-proofing. I hate the smell of rotting wood.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_034: Are you having fun? Because I'm not.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_036: Ah... Mi mancano le osterie di Siracusa. Doctor, is the kitchen available right now? I can make something myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_038: It's a brand new year. A toast to our goals, alla nostra salute. Oh, don't worry, this is just apple juice. I can't handle wine that's too strong. Why are you laughing? Whoever said that mafiosi have to drink?
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_042: None of these documents matter at all, Doctor. The only thing that matters is how you act.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_043: Your birthday? Doctor, do you seriously celebrate things like that at your age? Alright then. We're partners, so I have to go along with this. Happy birthday. You want me to sing it? Don't push your luck.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_CN_044: Doctor, the two of us are actually pretty similar. I believe that even a swamp like Siracusa can change. And your ambitions, hah, they are even bigger than mine. We both have what it takes to make this happen. I'll keep working on myself. I hope you'll do the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_ITA_CN_001: Organizing documents? Doctor, we have much more important things to do. Bene, I'll give you a hand, if you insist. But do remember, I expect you to come up with a plan that's worth my while. Do not disappoint me.

dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_ITA_CN_043: Your birthday? Doctor, do you seriously celebrate things like that at your age? Alright then. We're partners, so I have to go along with this. Happy birthday. You want me to sing it? Don't push your luck.
dialogue_tracker.char_427_vigil_ITA_CN_044: Doctor, the two of us are actually pretty similar. I believe that even a swamp like Siracusa can change. And your ambitions, hah, they are even bigger than mine. We both have what it takes to make this happen. I'll keep working on myself. I hope you'll do the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_001: It's done. The battle plans, reports, and mission schedules have all been sorted... Eh... Is this not the right way? Sorry, I'm not used to this yet...
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_002: Iwona and Ashlock can make quite a ruckus together. I can't hear the wind when they do that. It's a pain.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_003: Hm? Who's that in the training grounds...? The Radiant Knight? Doctor, is it okay if I go check it out up close?
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_004: It's really close. When I sit here and look outside, I can see the crops in the distant ripening as the farmers harvest their fields. It's just like my hometown.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_005: It's actually not very hard to become a knight in Kazimierz if you're healthy. All you have to do is sign up at the arena. But to become a real 'knight' is difficult. Real difficult, even for those who are healthy.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_006: I agree with Sona's ideas, and I'm willing to fight for them... Though, I guess I might just be afraid of losing the one place where I belong. Doctor, do you also see Rhodes Island as a place you will protect no matter what it takes?
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_007: Thank you for treating us. Sona, Iwona, and Ashlock asked me to bring you these as thanks. And here's one that I picked. It's a small token of my appreciation.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_008: I used to dream of becoming a knight, but on the way to the Grand Knight Territory, I got infected in an accident. I still remember how it felt. The numbness spread from my palm to my fingertips... That was the first time I couldn't hold my sword.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_009: Here's a grass whistle... Want to listen to me use it? I used to whistle with it whenever I had some free time back home. The wind back then is not like it is now. It was clear as crystal, and it wasn't dangerous at all... It was calming.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_010: Finally awake? Here, the files are sorted... Should be right this time, I think?
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_011: 'Fartooth' Justyna, Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub. You can call me Fartooth. I've heard about Rhodes Island and you in particular, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_012: They're going to lose. If they don't take a proper defense stance, they won't be able to block this one. You've got them.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_013: A promotion? Is that something like advancing to the next round?
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_014: There's not much that I want, and I don't have much either. That's why... as long as I'm still standing here, nobody can hope to take anything from me!
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_017: ...I'll do as you say. You are my commander, and I'll follow your orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_020: Wait, the winds have shifted... Everyone, stay alert!
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_023: I hope we can win this match fair and square.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_024: I, 'Fartooth' Justyna, will be your opponent.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_025: The winds are stirring. I can tell.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_027: There's no need to talk in battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_028: Let's put an end to this... You can't beat me; accept your defeat.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_029: You've done well, Doctor. This is a glorious victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_030: I fended them off just as you instructed... I'm being too solemn? Really...?
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_031: I won't attack those who leave the arena.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_032: Go on ahead...! I'll hold them here, Doctor! Lead the others away!
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_033: Not bad. The airflow here feels refreshing... Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_034: Hm? What is it? Want an autograph?
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_036: Doctor...? Yeah, I can tell it's you without listening to your footsteps. The winds around you aren't like the others.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_038: There are so many noises mixed in on the wind here. Fireworks, dishes and glasses, the voices of people as they celebrate. My neighbors would be just as noisy every holiday back home, but I've never minded it, because that's how this day should be. Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_042: Don't move... Your hair's sticking out. That's right. Stay still. I'll fix it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_043: Here, Doctor. This is your present from me. It's a chime. Hang it on your window, and it'll sing whenever the breeze stirs. Very soothing. Happy birthday, Doctor. I gift you the sound of the wind.
dialogue_tracker.char_430_fartth_CN_044: I brought this flute from home, and the only songs I play are ones my neighbors taught me. I know you can never return to the past, but that's not so bad, is it? Just like how the wind never blows back to where it came from. It carries itself on its own momentum, flying further and further away, to a loftier place.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_001: So, just like the big corporations' office workers, even you have a bunch of deskwork to do. That's quite a lot, too. Do you need any help?
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_002: I never imagined the Radiant Knight would take up employment anywhere. Rhodes Island is a mysterious company.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_003: Knights may be able to climb back up after they fall, but the Infected don't have such kindhearted options available to them.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_004: *Cough*... My weapon seems to be acting up, *cough*... Which way is the workshop? That way? Thank you. *Cough*.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_005: If the knight nobles were able to fulfill their vows and responsibilities, the Infected wouldn't have found themselves so oppressed. But... those nobles... the Kazimierz people would rather sign contracts with those big security companies than trust those knight nobles to protect them from crime and violence.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_006: They tell me my family met its downfall because I got infected, that I am to blame for everything. Hmph, just what you'd expect from the knight nobles. They're all good-for-nothings who know only to bully the weak.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_007: Justyna likes to use titles when she talks to me... Why is that? Is the word 'Ashlock' that special to her?
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_008: Sona and I met each other during a team melee match. That was a tough battle, but we reached an understanding and worked with each other as soon as we met. At the very end, she took all my points with her sword, but then apologized to me right away... That's how we started working together.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_009: If I can't go back home anymore, then all I can do is find the way forward with Sona and the gang. Heh... Becoming an Infected knight hasn't been kind to me, but at least we have the chance to fight. It doesn't matter what miseries the future has in store for us; I'm sure it'll still be a much brighter place.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_010: Be sure to get enough rest. The break after a match is just as important as your daily training.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_011: I'm 'Ashlock' Greynuty of Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub. Thank you for taking us in.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_012: A coordinated assault? Yeah, they work well with each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_013: Is this a medal to prove my qualifications? Oh... Sorry, I still don't have all of Rhodes Island's rules down. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_014: 'When the cannon fire rings through the air, victory is already within sight.'
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_018: You need me to take charge? Okay.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_023: It's not like the knight competitions. You can't pause a battle when someone gets injured.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_026: Cannon fire is just the first step.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_029: Wonderful. So this is the art of command. You've opened my eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_030: Looks like you're good at commanding team battles.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_031: The more points you lose in the arena, the less likely you are to win.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_033: Good thing my equipment doesn't take up too much space.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_036: A present from a fan? It was sent to you? Sorry for the trouble.
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_038: Sona should still be asleep, Iwona's at the training grounds, and Justyna's standing guard up on the watchtower. As for me... I haven't figured it out yet. Doctor, what would a normal Rhodes Island operator do on this day?
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_042: Do we have any missions today?
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_043: Happy birthday. Here's... no, actually, forget it. Giving you an autographed postcard as a gift just feels too arrogant, my apolo— You don't mind? Oh... thanks for that...
dialogue_tracker.char_431_ashlok_CN_044: I used to believe that, in looking for a better way to help the infected, we need to cast our sights beyond the border of Kazimierz, but the situation there turns out to be... even more complicated. And we won't get to the bottom of it unless we learn firsthand ourselves. Still, I'm ready to face all of it. Send me out on missions, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_001: I get oil on me real easy, so I don't clean my apron often... There's some on my face too? Uhh, I'll go get it off.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_002: Doctor, I don't know if this is offensive to ask, but... say you start things out with a mindset that gets people to live in peace with the Infected. Do you ever feel like your effort is in vain? What do you do, in times like that?
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_003: I consulted with my profs and sent a lot of resumes out close to graduation, but got no reply. I was told later how a lot of spots and big companies  are fixed in advance, and not for students with no background like me. So the day I got Rhodes Island's hiring invitation, I thought it was some employment scam.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_004: Doctor! I ever tell you about my club at college? We used the funds from the school to buy new machines on the market, tear 'em down and reassemble 'em. Learnt a lot of new stuff that way. Is Rhodes Island about that too? Check this one out! It's smoking right now, sure, but it's got new functionality.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_005: I helped out at my parents' factory when I was a kid. Lots of stuff you've just gotta count on pure manual labor for. I've gone over all the notes the vets at Engineering lent me. If we can pass all this new tech down to my parents, we can save 'em a lot of effort.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_006: My parents saved hard for a good school when I was a kid. I had classmates clowning on us for being poor, so I was dead set on learning something, showing them who's boss. They might still be living a cushier life than me, but nowadays, I just focus on myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_007: Doctor, Rhodes Island is all real passionate folks. Saying they wanna make me clothes, they wanna gimme a haircut, and then they drag me off to show me around their own stalls. What do I do...? H—Hug 'em? Got it. I'll go try right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_008: Doctor, I've never had a boss like you before. Ones I met before were all money-grubbing owner types, so... y'know hugs have really worked out. Can I hug you? C'mon, here we go!
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_009: I used to feel like this world was unfair, no matter where you went, and no one could do a thing to change it. But here, poverty or infection, none of that discrimination exists, and everyone gets rewarded equal to what they put in. Doctor, pulling this whole thing off...it's incredible.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_010: You out? Real quiet... Woof! —Ooh, awake now, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_011: Nice meeting you, Doctor, I'm Windflit, new Operator at Engineering. You said you saw ability in me? Real thankful for that.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_012: Effort is the root of progress. Regular review lets me realize a lotta issues I overlooked before.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_013: I really love Rhodes Island's standards for promotion. No unfairness about 'em.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_014: Getting to this level of endorsement makes all my previous effort really kinda pay off. Doctor, Rhodes Island truly is a company worth sticking with for a long time.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_017: I've got no combat experience, but I'll give it my best shot.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_018: I'm not circling you all because I wanna. You're all too scattered apart. It'll be dangerous.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_019: Can't let 'em bully us. Let's go!
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_020: I wonder if these guys have their own problems too...
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_027: What is it you guys fight for?
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_029: Phew... Each new battle teaches me a lotta new things. Maybe one day, I can finally get my own issues figured out.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_030: Doctor, how was my equipment this time? Real useful, right?!
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_031: Let's forget chasing 'em, maybe they've got their own problems. They chose to run, so no need to corner 'em now.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_033: Real spacious room. And real clean.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_036: I welded together this little metal doll kinda thing to look like you, hahaha...
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_038: Never got to really celebrate when I was a kid. Have the right conditions now, but it's not with my family. Just need to make a bit more cash, and then I can ask for a couple days off and go see 'em again without worrying about my salary. That's my New Year's resolution.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor~ I'm not all that good at picking, is this kind of cake your thing? C'mon, let's have another hug.
dialogue_tracker.char_433_windft_CN_044: This really sells Rhodes Island as a loaded place. Is everyone gonna be able to finish all this food off? Not gonna be nice to waste it. Ooh—is that Kay over there? Not—Not gonna hold her back?
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_001: Please, leave all these reports to me. I take great delight in indulging myself in records and documents.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_002: That Suzuran girl I turned down just now, I wonder if I've been too harsh on her... She was kind enough to invite me to her tea party, but socializing isn't really my forte…
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_003: My body is frail, frailer than most others'. To die a young death, to forsake all my pasts, then to be born anew… 'Rejuvenation'… such is the cruel fate of mine…
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_004: Memories dissipate as spumes on shore. The pains, the joys, the pasts I don't want to let go… nothing will be there as I look back.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_005: Though my memory fails to serve me, I can still sense the unspeakable flowing within my blood. Stay away from the sea, Doctor. It'll be a nightmare devouring us all. It is… fear itself.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_006: I do wonder sometimes what 'mortality' is to those with true longevity, like Dr. Warfarin and her people. For them to shed not a tear when bidding farewell to the departed, is it only because theirs have long run dry?
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_007: Doctor, could you take these flowers to the children in the ward, for me? Yes, just like always, place them by their bedsides… Thank you, for helping keep this secret.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_008: Doctor, come quickly, we need to find Closure! It seems Thorns and his companions have burst a water pipe open in the corridor, and Weedy is furious now! I'm soaked to the skin... Um, I seem—like I'm enjoying myself? Wh-What do you mean?!
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_009: Every time I watch a film, I keep the ticket stub afterward. These leftover vestiges always serve to me as a reminder, even if the contents would be lost to me... Doctor, could you come watch a film with me? I'd like to preserve the time I've passed with you, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_010: Sleep sound, Doctor... By the time you wake, will you have forgotten about me?
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_011: Code name… Whisperain. A roving doctor, nothing more. If possible, please take me as a traveler lodging under the eaves in rain. You needn't pay me much mind…
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_012: In the face of such fierce combat, I worry... I wouldn't be able to survive.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_013: Thank you very much. But I hope you treat me the same as always...
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_014: Those sorrows I could not wash away with one death—I always feel like they're strands, wisps, winding about my skin... Doctor, you've come to forget the past too—could you maybe understand this feeling?
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_017: Please leave the assistive work to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_018: I'm the leader...? That's a little…
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_019: Please keep with me. Don't go too far.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_020: Please be careful, everyone. Protect yourselves and stay safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_023: Come to me if you get wounded.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_028: I know this scent of death well.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_029: Sleep tight... May the rainfall shelter all dreams.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_030: This is how their story ends. Tragedies, one following another...
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_031: Leave the pursuit for later. I'd like to see everyone treated first.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_032: I'm sorry, I could have fulfilled my role better…
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_033: Such a peaceful place this is. I can hear the patter of rainfall.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_036: D-Don't move, please! Something got my hair…
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_038: Elysium, Thorns, please stop blowing your noisemakers, quite a few operators are already staring at you... Ah, Happy New Year, Doctor. The New Year at Rhodes Island truly is so vigorous... Was I ever this happy to celebrate in the past? I'm afraid I no longer remember.
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_042: What will we be doing today, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Amnesiac as you are, you still haven't forgotten the meaning of this day, which tells me a lot. In that case, would you like to keep the stub of a movie ticket with your birthday on it?
dialogue_tracker.char_436_whispr_CN_044: Please, allow me to sit out here on my own. It doesn't feel quite right being a part of this ship's commemoration day, given that I don't know when I might depart... That being said, I will always remember the sound of rain pattering on the deck. There's little else like it.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_001: Dr. Kal'tsit told me if you ever chose to place me at your side, it means you've decided to protect me. But maybe you're just as clueless as I am with her riddle, Doctor. Still, I'm sure she must've said it for a reason.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_002: Tasty food, manga, and video games… I see them all as poetry scattered under the starry sky. I intend to relish them all on my journey... and eliminate anything that threatens their existence.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_003: Ah, Doctor! Perfect timing! Please try this special sashimi I made. With my secret technique, the nutrients and vitality of the ingredients are best preserved.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_004: Oh, this? It's a classic arcade game that used to be popular in Higashi. Want to have a go, Doctor? Here, just move that yellow mouth to eat and grow. However… until you've absorbed enough nutrients to grow strong, you'll only be prey to others.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_005: A sense of justice? No, You got me wrong, Doctor. I don't really care much about bad guys. It's just… for some reason, good people always let them get away with bad things. What if... someone came along and got rid of them? No one would feel bad for them, right? Everyone would just be happy.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_006: Hmm… I still don't get your point, Doctor, but I just need to take out the ones you say are bad, yes? After all, I know the Doctor is a good person. What if you're the bad guy? Don't ask me that! I would be crushed. Even if you are, I really, really don't wanna…
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_007: There's something on this ship that's both familiar and strange... gentle, yet hostile. It's making me uneasy, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_008: Doctor, what does it feel like to hold the lives of others in your hands? If it were me, their warmth would make me tremble with excitement. Hm? Oh, I was talking about you as a commander, holding everyone's lifeline.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_009: The food and nutrients we take in sustain and shape us. So sometimes I wonder... if we ate the same food and did the same things, would we gradually become the same? Doctor, would we?
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_010: It's time to take a little break, Doctor. Come here, lie down. I'll go grab a blanket.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_011: Ah, hello there, Doctor. Dr. Kal'tsit tells me you're my commander from today on! It's too bad I don't count as an official operator, but as long as you need my help, I'll do whatever I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_012: I need to digest and absorb all this, right? I'll do my best.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_013: I've earned your approval? Does that mean I can go to more places with you and get rid of more bad guys?
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_014: On one rainy day, I received an unexpected gift that changed me, but I was not taught how to face the future… Doctor, if it were you, would you have shown me the path yourself?
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_017: I should stay hidden, even from my teammates? Understood, I'll do as you say, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_018: I will protect you from the shadows, Doctor, as well as everyone else in our squad.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_019: The deployment plan and secret missions for this operation... Mhm, all confirmed.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_020: Are they the enemies? They don't look half bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_023: You always help me find my place.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_024: Be bold, Doctor, trust what the mind says.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_025: Looks like a piece of cake.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_027: These tentacles are illusions? Why delude yourself?
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_028: Evildoers need to be culled. They always will be culled.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_029: What a tough nut to crack. It'll take some time to digest this battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_030: There are fewer bad guys out there now, and it's all thanks to you, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_031: Huh? Doctor, why'd you let some bad guys through? I'll go clean them up for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_032: If it's only to cover everyone's retreat, I can do that… No, just saving everyone is not enough, the bad guys still need to be eliminated…
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_033: Shall I whip up something tasty to help everyone unwind?
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_036: Achoo! Ugh... Why does it feel like someone's looking right through me...
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! We've all grown by another year, and I've absorbed plenty of nutrients. I really hope everyone can keep evolving and become even better.
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_043: I dunno where it came from… But they say if you mix a little of yourself into a cake, then whoever eats it will go crazy for you. Sounds… sick, right? Wait, Doctor, don't run away! I didn't put anything weird in this birthday cake, I swear!
dialogue_tracker.char_437_mizuki_CN_044: Doctor, when you look at me now, what do you see? Am I still just a kid, or have I grown strong enough… maybe even stronger than you? If that were true… Then shouldn't I protect you instead?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_001: Doctor? No, I wasn't taking a nap! I was... I was just spacing out!
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_002: Is it raining outside? I used to really hate rainy days... Mud gets everywhere, and construction grinds to a halt. Dad would always come home late when it rained. But I always felt cozy when the rain let up and I'd stay inside, just like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_003: Back when I worked construction in Columbia, life was a real grind. I had to get up early every morning and go to bed late every night. Sometimes I'd be working overtime and suddenly realize I hadn't slept at all…
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_004: Oh, Doctor, would you like to go for a walk together? Hm? Ahh...! Wh-Where's my tool bag...? Did I leave it at the construction site again? I-I'm sorry, wait a sec while I fetch it!
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_005: What I want to do...? Hmm... A steady job and an honest life would be enough for me. So why sign on to be an operator here? Well... The pay is a bit better, and the work isn't all that different... so I figured, why not give it a shot? I guess?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_006: The Infected... There were plenty of Infected workers back in Columbia. Everyone warned me to keep my distance. But watching them work, I realized they're no different from the rest of us.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_007: Oh... what the job Closure put me on again...? If I go back and ask her, I'll probably get an earful... Say, Doctor? Do you think you could help me out...?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_008: My dad always says, studying hard is the key to a better life. Doctor, you know lots of stuff, right? Could you teach me something? I promise I won't zone out. Well, I'll try really hard, anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_009: I never used to think much about the future. I figured I'd just drift between odd jobs with the Pioneers, spending my life as a craftsman. But now... I really need to thank our friend—the big guy. I wouldn't have met you, if it wasn't for him... Uh... A-Anyway, I really appreciate what he did for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_010: Fwahh... I'm so tired... Maybe I'll take a little nap, just like the Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_011: Codename Pinecone... I'm starting at Rhodes Island today... Um... Have you seen my portable battery?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_012: Um... Umm... I don't get it...
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_013: Thank you, Doctor... But what should I do now? Oh... Do I just kinda do what the others do? Okey-dokey…
