dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_014: Hm...? Another promotion? Ehehe, you're awfully forgetful yourself, Doctor. Didn't you already give me a promot—This is a new one? Um... Okay. I'll follow your lead. So, when are we heading out?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_018: I guess it's like being a foreman at a construction site?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_019: Um... Where are we going again...?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_020: It's the enemy! Don't hold back!
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_024: I'll stay right here like a nail.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_026: I still have lots of batteries on me!
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_028: Just like shooting nails at work!
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_029: Phew... That was a lot harder than building a house. Doctor, it makes us kinda impressive, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_030: That was perfect... Doctor, are you happy with how we did?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_031: Hmm... Maybe I messed up the process...? I'm sorry. It didn't go as well as I'd hoped.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_032: Eh? Why are there sparks... S-Sorry... It's all my fault...
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_033: Okay, is there anything that needs maintenance?
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_036: Doctor, want to watch the rain together? There's not much to see, though...
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_038: Uh, since it's New Year's, I figured I'd give your office a little touch-up, Doctor... Yes, I cleaned up some wear marks and remade the wall decorations. Err, if—if you don't like it, I can take everything down right away...
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Hope you have another year of steady employment as a doctor... Err, is that not your job? Okay, I hear you. So, uh... hope you have a year with less overtime. Mm-hm.
dialogue_tracker.char_440_pinecn_CN_044: Doctor, after listening to everyone's stories over dinner, I've been wondering... I feel like we're doing something epic, aren't we? So, would it be... inappropriate someways if I brought my parents to work at Rhodes Island?
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_001: Thirty-two, then thirty... three? Oh, Doctor? Wait, where was I? Hmm, I've been away half an hour? No worries, almost done. The fiftieth document from the left... one, two... don't worry, I'm the best counter at my escort association.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_002: In this line of work, encountering odd clients comes with the territory. There was this one time when I was hired to escort a gentleman, he insisted I carry him on my back down a muddy road. I agreed, but said only after terminating our escort contract, because I couldn't defend him while carrying someone on my back.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_003: Doctor, take some of these. My family came by during their escort job and brought me some treats from back home. What? We're under attack? Wait, you mean... them? Uh, hey, don't smoke on the landship. Put your shoes on and mind your manners! Don't glare at people like that! Ahem, Doctor... let me introduce you to my family.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_004: I'll ask the local bandit boss about the situation here. No, we're not exactly friends, but we sort of pay this toll of theirs. Does that sound like we're in cahoots with the bandits? Hahah, it's just a way we can both make a living. Nobody wants unnecessary bloodshed, if we can help it.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_005: I got the crystals on my hand from a highwayman. His legs were shaking and I thought I could talk him out of it, but his mind was made up. When I discarded his Originium explosive, we both got caught in the blast. In the end, I left him some money for his sick child's treatment. As for my own condition, I got used to it long ago.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_006: Not every bandit manages to make the move to an honest escort life. Some have walked the way of the bandit for too long to change, many of them were aunts and uncles who watched me grow up. I couldn't look them in the eye when I had to show them out, but people must keep moving forward, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_007: What are you eating? Give me a bite; I haven't eaten yet. Ran into a righteous volunteer on the way, he was collecting relief funds for his hometown that got hit by a Catastrophe, so I gave him all my money. A scam? Maybe, but I don't need more money than I can spend, and I can always sock him if it turns out he was lying. It's not like I'll ever starve with you around.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_008: My swords? This one was given by my adoptive mother. The other was hers—she threw it in my face the day she left. The blood was everywhere. I had tried to convince her to retire from banditry and join the escort business, but she saw it as a betrayal. People... when goals differ, they are quick to call it treachery. She raised me, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_009: Once I no longer have to worry about the escort association, I want to go wander the jianghu, to see what's out there. Want to come along, Doctor? Where to? Haven't thought about it yet. What matters is wandering free like a fowlbeast, traveling only with my two swords, drawing them at the first sign of injustice, and drinking and singing to my heart's delight.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_010: Want some dried plums, Doctor? I always eat one when I get sleepy on the night shift. A piece of green plum with no sugar added works better than pinching my thigh. Haha, look at your face! You look like the plum just bit you.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_011: You're the Doctor of Rhodes Island? I've heard so much about you. I sign this, and you'll be an official friend of Windscoot. Any help you might need, just— er... no, I know how to write my name. It's—where do I sign?
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_012: My eyelids, they're stuck... Doc, just step on my tail. It's fine, just stomp!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_013: Just like when I wore my escort association's badge for the first time. Gotta keep my head bowed and tail tucked. I won't let you lose face, Doc!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_014: There was this time I picked up a cloudbeast on a solo escort mission. We traveled together for a while. But just before entering the city, I set it free, afraid customers might see it and think I was soft. Now, I suppose I wouldn't be afraid to keep such a companion.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_017: Three bulkies, twelve mid-sized… all set. Huh, why is there one more here? Did I count wrong?.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_018: Everyone, keep an eye open, your sword at hand and uniform on. Safety first.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_019: The fortune stick reads 'very lucky'! Only took one, two... five draws to get it. What a good sign! Let's go!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_020: They've got guts, coming at us like this. Don't they recognize our banner? Guess we're in for a fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_021: Just tell me which one to cleave.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_022: Just tell me where to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_024: Give the signal and I'll do it.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_025: Don't pick a fight if you're not prepared to get punched.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_026: A few broken bones would be a good lesson for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_027: Want my goods, none; else my life, one. Come and take it if you dare!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_028: I've already drawn my swords. You can beg for your life after we've fought.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_029: We're friends for life from this day on, Doctor. One word from you and I'll rush to your aid, even if I'm on the other side of Terra—that's a promise.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_030: The goods are intact, and everyone's unhurt! Ahhh, damn it!—I've dreamed of having such a reliable escort leader as you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_031: Look at him run! He even lost his shoes, hahaha! As long as the goods are safe, that's all that matters. Bandits never forget an ass-kicking. Next time they hear our association's escort chant, they'll stay far away.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_032: I'll keep them at bay while you go get backup. Want my goods? Over my dead body!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_033: Oh, it's nothing, just a habit. Always make sure a room's safe before going in. Well, the facilities are secure, but the personnel are a bit... mixed. However, if you trust them, I'll consider it safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_034: Come on, come on—argh! Almost caught that Burderupt! Oh, er, yes, this terminal is normally used for taking inventory, but there's always a way to install games. Keep it a secret, will you?
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_036: Haha... you're allowed just this once. Ears are my weakness, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! Yeah, I'm preparing to set out. This is the peak season in my line of work. It's nothing. On the contrary, it's a good omen to get busy on the first day of the New Year. Hope we both have a prosperous year, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_042: Doctor. Yeah, I just finished training. I'll help out once I've cleaned up.
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_043: Cut the crap, just stew it. The Doctor and I are friends for life, we'll have nothing but the finest birthday food! Stew the entire cystybeast! Hey, our usual bowls aren't fit for the Doctor. Find a smaller one, just enough for one catty of rice!
dialogue_tracker.char_445_wscoot_CN_044: We developed several new routes last year to deliver goods for Rhodes Island. Those rascals were so busy they had no time to cause mischief, but they looked much more spirited and energetic. Better life to chase, more glow on face, as it's said. Hahaha... All that's to say, we look forward to your continued support for our business this year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_001: The neat little circles on that page? I didn't draw them. I wouldn't doodle on your documents.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_002: W-Wait, Doctor! Don't open that lid! That's a device I use to make bubbles... Sorry, I'm not laughing at you for getting all bubbled up. I-I just like seeing a bunch of bubbles together! Really! I'm not lying!
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_003: Sorry, Doctor. I didn't have the detergent-to-aroma formula under control. Um… I made some changes to it, and the aroma might linger in your nose for a very, very long time. You might smell it every now and then for the next two weeks...
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_004: I put on a bubble show for the young patients at Medical today. What kind of show? It's like this... There’s a big, big, big bubble with a big, big bubble inside. And then the big, big bubble’s got a big bubble. And Bubble’s inside the big bubble. Oh, that last one is my partner, Bubble, not a normal bubble.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_005: Doctor, my family's formulators aren't quite like the others in our industry. Our peers try to create aromas that remind users of a certain beautiful moment in their memories. But my family, we work to suppress the worst, most terrible smells in their memories.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_006: All this time, I've thought that aromas by themselves couldn’t eradicate stenches. The most important thing is to open the windows and let the foul air out. Otherwise, the aroma and stench blend together, and that would just be a different, disgusting smell.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_007: I'm cleaning the room right now, and you came at just the right time, Doctor. Would you help me wipe the light tubes up top? They're a bit too high, and I can't reach them, even on a ladder. Yeah, there's a small black spot just a little to the left... Ah! W-Why is that black spot flying?!
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_008: Doctor, I brought some shampoo my family made onto the landship. It's from a small workshop, but we source all the essential oils we use from plants in nature. Like this lemon-scented one. We used lemons taken from my family's backyard, where my grandmother planted a lemon tree the year I was born.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_009: There was a chaotic time where murders were a daily occurrence in Siracusa, and my family served as 'cleaners' charged with clearing out the aftermath. We left that line of work a long time ago, but every now and then, we still remember the thick stench of blood that seemed to overpower everything else.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_010: Oh no. A bubble floated into the room and landed on the Doctor's nose... If somebody goes in there and thinks the Doctor's got a snot bubble, that wouldn't be good…
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. I'm Logistics Operator Aroma. Would you open your hands like this? Don't worry... I just thought that with how nice and bright the sun is today, it would be perfect to put a bubble reflecting a rainbow onto your palm.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_012: This will make a very useful reference. I never knew detergent could be used like that.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_013: Doctor, I will pass on your encouragement and feedback to my family. I'm pleased that you like our products so much.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_014: Doctor, I'm humbled that my family's products are so well-liked by the operators here... Huh...? A manufacturing cooperation with Rhodes Island? Can we really?
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_017: How convenient. I want to test out my new bubbling formula.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_018: Remember to cover your noses. The aroma this time might be a little intense. Don't let the smell get you sneezing.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_019: I put a sign here— Wet floor. Be extra careful.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_020: The smell here reminds me of something really scary.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_023: These bubbles won't burst so easily.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_024: Remember to give your honest feedback on our products.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_029: Hm... smells a lot more refreshing now.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_030: I like this new ingredient. It's effective, and it doesn't harm your skin.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_031: Looks like we'll need a stronger stain removing formula next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_033: Doctor, n-no, I know it's polite to look at the person you're talking to... I-I'm not looking out the window. It's just... the water stains on the glass are making me really uncomfortable. I really want to wipe it.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_034: Ah! Please don't do that. I almost splashed some of the soap I'm holding on you.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_036: Watch out, Doctor! There's soapy water all over the floor. You could slip if you aren't careful.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_038: The New Year calls for new vibes, Doctor, so I put a small plant on your windowsill. I collected a bunch of lemon seeds from my family's kitchen and planted them. This is the one that grew the best.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_042: You should go take a walk, Doctor. It's not good to stay in your office all day.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_043: Perfume? Why would I give you perfume? Hehe, your scent shouldn't be covered by any other smell, Doctor. It’s natural and pleasing, much more so than any perfume I could mix.
dialogue_tracker.char_446_aroma_CN_044: Every time a patient at Medical passes away, the clothing they wore gets sent to me to be washed and stored until their family comes to retrieve it one day. Some are picked up soon after, but others... still haven't been picked up even after a long, long time.
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_001: Do we work so hard every day? Hohh... this is rough... Doctor, if the stress ever gets to you, please don't bottle it up. I'll chat with you anytime.
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_002: Here, Doctor, this is for you. I sent an application to Dr. Kal'tsit, and remodeled an unused cabin into a conversation room. This is the leaflet I made myself!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_003: I've heard there's a mysterious snackseller here who can dodge the Medical Department's controls, and shows up when anyone needs them... Doctor, is this all true?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_004: As long as you take daily precautions, Oripathy is hardly that easy to catch! The sick aren't that dangerous, let alone their healthy relatives... Why do people always let ignorance scare them about this or that, and they're never even willing to look into it some more?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_005: Doctor, look at this! Ehehe, it's a notice that I'm qualified and approved for psychological counseling. I've been preparing forever, and I finally passed the test!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_006: My dad passed away when I was very little, because of Oripathy. The villagers were scared of getting infected, and they shunted us deep into the forest, far from the settlement. Life might've been very tough, but my mum still carried on as she took me through... Now I'm grown up, and it'll be my turn to look after her!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_007: My old home was in the woodlands in west Rim Billiton. I grew up in the forest all my life, so I'm a bit familiar with all kinds of herbals. That said, herbals can treat your surface injuries, but invisible wounds on your spirit just aren't that easily cured...
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_008: Doctor, can I stay here? Would I be able to chat with you? I promise I won't interrupt your work! Everyone in the Medical Department has missions today, Mint's studying and she's not coming out for any fun, and there's no patients who need tending to. It's just me left now... I don't want to be alone...
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_009: I believe that getting good sleep, eating good food, and sharing the glad and the sad times with friends can make people happy. There's times when enduring too much does more harm... Doctor, just to let you know if you've got any worries, share them with me. Don't forget about it, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_010: Doctor, did you fall asleep...? Hmm, no reaction, gotta be asleep. Okay, good chance! Let's find where the Doctor's been hiding all those snacks...
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_011: Nice to meet you, I'm the new Medical Department intern, Honeyberry. I'm assuming you're the Doctor...? Hmm, it's just like Dr. Kal'tsit said. You're different enough from everyone else that I can tell you at a glance!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_012: So you can do emergency treatment like this too...!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_013: A promotion? So that means, I've cleared my internship without any problems?! That's brilliant!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_014: I've learned and gained so much at Rhodes Island. It's all the experiences that build up, and all the beautiful memories, that give me the drive to keep going, to strive together with all of you!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_017: After our mission's over, why don't we all celebrate together?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_018: Please don't worry, leave your health to me...
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_019: It's time. We should be departing any moment now.
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_020: Before checking what methods the other side might use, each of you please watch yourselves!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_022: Do I have to jump down? I've got a real penchant for that!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_023: Arrived at designated position, treatment targets sighted!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_024: Everyone, focus on fighting! Just leave treatment to me!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_025: Get a hold of your breathing, and relax.
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_027: I've got a way to treat you here!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_028: No matter what trouble we're in, I'll face it together with all of you...!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_029: Mission complete! Now it's time for a celebration party... why don't you join us, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_030: It's finally over... you all worked so hard.
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_031: We're not done yet, we need to treat the wounded as soon as possible...
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_032: Don't get discouraged, we still have a chance!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_033: What do you think about building a treehouse?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_036: Doctor, do you want some snacks?
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_038: Happy new year! It's such a major day. I wonder if everyone's celebrating with their families? Um, me? My mum's waiting for me to go see the fireworks with her... hehe, Rhodes Island is like a second home for me now, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_042: Wow! D—Doctor, I'll jump down right now! Catch me, please!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Here's a dried berry mix as a present! I've divided it into little pouches according to your intake each day, so eating one a day will supplement all the nutrients you need. Um, Doctor, Why are you hiding them? You don't want Hibiscus to see them? Hehe, Don't worry, she's already gotten some herself!
dialogue_tracker.char_449_glider_CN_044: I used to dream of being an executive, and my mum still frets over that sometimes. But one day, I'll cheer her up for real, and she'll see that her daughter's doing great. More than that, I'm doing amazing. One day, when we help people overcome prejudice towards Oripathy, I know she'll be proud of me.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_001: Would you care to try some sweets? I could prepare a selection for you. Wine to pair with? I have some too.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_002: My servants relish in manipulating the fates of others. Some imagine themselves cunning conspirators, others mere wavering dreamers. Yet they remain equally cold when consuming lives not their own. And me? Heheh. It matters not whether I am puppet or puppetmaster… for the end of life lies with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_003: That Dr. Kal'tsit has a frightening glare. Whenever her eyes fall on me, I feel as if she plans to nail me to the landship deck. Fret not... during my brief stay here, I am but your Operator Necrass, and nothing more.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_004: An ice-cold body, a dulled sense of touch; a pain inside that never rests, as if my own freezing flames pierce me through... But it is the pain I find so fascinating, for without it, I might forget I've already tamed death.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_005: Rhodes Island is a beautiful place, where anyone can write their story, no matter who they may be. It's something of a utopia, built at the theoretical cost of countless lives. Illusions are ephemeral, however, so do try your best to keep it alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_006: I permit your silence—or perhaps, your evasiveness—toward my invitation, but this does not mean you can escape me. Once I grasp you, your soul will be mine. Time, life, and joy are all yours to squander, but remember this well: your end, too, lies with me.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_007: What brings me here, you ask? You do. Or should I say, your willingness to explain the glimpse I saw... of a future where even death is gone? Whether you choose to serve me before that future comes matters little... I'll gladly keep on waiting.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_008: Loughshinny? Were she still the girl shivering under that snowy night, I would have simply gifted her a peaceful life until death reunited us both. A pity she ultimately learned to dance between blades and lies, and you surely understand how rare a truly endearing dance partner can be.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_009: What must I do to have you submit to me? Must I plead, or yell? Show you a side of me no one has ever seen, or grant you my dominion over death? All that you desire, I... refuse. First you must submit, and then we can discuss further.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_010: ...A deep sleep is akin to death. I hope you manage to wake as usual, Erudite.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_011: Allowing me on board at last? Then, hand me the register. 'Necrass'—how about this codename, Erudite? Hm? Rhodes Island requires I go by a codename, so I've decided to fashion an appropriate one for you as well.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_012: How delightful. Another momentary escape from their predestined end.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_013: A promotion. Does this imply I now have a formal position in your organization? Do you deem this appropriate, Erudite?
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_014: This medal symbolizes your trust, yet death is an eternal betrayal of life. If you've thought it through, perhaps set me a deadline—I'll strive to live up to your expectations until then.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_017: Do you require me to conceal my face? No? A judicious judgment. The dead shall remember, while the living will forget.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_018: Your operators might fail to keep up with my harsh demands.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_019: Let us be off, to create many more corpses.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_020: Mortals grieve over death, but death has never mourned.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_025: A touch of my finger shall crumble your wills.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_026: Life withers and dissipates, remnants left to hesitate.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_027: Bathed in fire, departed souls dance in a frenzy of fear.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_028: The clamor of the dead peters out into oblivion.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_029: You and your tactics are equally lethal, Erudite.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_030: Why repress yourself? I see a desire for destruction in you, and you should let it all out... with no reservations.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_031: Life is inherently flawed, so let's not grieve too much over it.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_032: Should I take them all away? Good, you need only pay a tiny price... I'm sure you can afford it.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_036: You may hold my hand, if you can bear the icy burn.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_038: A new year ought to be welcomed with fire; burn away the past to build again upon the remains, and the cycle continues anew. That being said, I do quite fancy this tiny flame before me as well. Roast something for me, accomplish what my flames cannot.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_042: Are you happy to see me, Erudite?
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_043: Should I prepare a bouquet of flowers for you? For what reason, you ask? I simply want to receive one in return, and watch your flowers crumble into ashes between my fingers, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_450_necras_CN_044: Loughshinny aside, Rhodes Island still bears scant traces of Dublinn... don't be nervous. The dream has been realized, so Dublinn should die, but death does not mean to vanish without reason. I shall allow it—let this gravestone of Dublinn remain at Rhodes Island as-is.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_001: Doctor, anything I should help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_002: Doctor, you're always so busy with work. Don't you have any hobbies? Me, I like watching obscure old movies.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_003: Truth is, I learned how to fight because of this movie I saw when I was little. Main character fought with knives and homemade traps. I thought it was really cool, so I started learning myself. My knives here, they're actually the same kind as the ones in that movie.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_004: In Columbia, anything can be bought with money. It sounds great, until you turn it around: Without money, nothing's yours at all.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_005: Rhodes Island feels like a company out of a movie. Medical corp on the outside, actually a private army underneath. Operating to save more and more people… feels pretty cool.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_006: Doctor, do you think I come off gloomy? Dammit… I didn't used to be like this. It was ever since my pop got the way he did, and I had to start worrying about keeping the family afloat. Hmm…
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_007: I don't hate Anthony. If we have to talk about the past, I think my pop's to blame too. And honestly, I thank Anthony. If he wasn't in the right place at the right time, I might've done something... I could never take back.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_008: Pop never understood. Mom didn't leave because we had no money. It was 'cause his temper got worse every day. I've thought about if I went with Mom instead, but Pop used to be... so nice to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_009: Doctor, there's times I'm with you and I ease up so much I forget my own issues. I have the money to treat my pop's illness now, but I don't have a cure for his emotional troubles… Doctor, could you help me?
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_010: So you get tired and drop right where you are, just like me…
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_011: Nice to meet you, Doctor. I'm a new Operator. Robin's the name. I've got money troubles, so if it's all the same to you, just send me to do whatever.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_012: Intense. Feels just like I'm watching an action movie...
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_013: What? I got a raise so quick...? That's great. Thank you, Doctor!
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_014: I never stuck with my old jobs for very long. The company itself had problems, or it was something with my pop... This time, it feels like I'll be able to stick with Rhodes Island for a long time.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_018: I'm not too good at teamwork…
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_019: Wonder what kind of place we're going to this time.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_020: Let's take a look around first…
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_028: I've got more than just knives!
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_029: Doctor, can we cut this sort of mission down a little? Bad for the heart…
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_030: I bet everybody dreams of having a boss like you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_031: Doctor, need me to chase them?
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_032: Doctor, you go! I'll cover you!
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_033: I better get to know this place…
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_038: 'The happiest thing about today is we say goodbye to the past; the hardest thing about today is we say goodbye to the memories.' It's, uh, a line from a movie... Umm, Happy New Year, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_042: Doctor. Need me to guard you today?
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday. I got a necklace for you. It's from my movie tie-in collection. Comes from a real classic romance flick. But now I'm, uh, remembering what happens to the ship and the lead couple, and it sends kind of a crappy message... Umm, please forget what I said. Just treat it like a normal necklace, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_451_robin_CN_044: My pop's sickness eased up a little. I'm thankful—really, truly, I am... I gotta be honest though, I know with my abilities I don't deserve this contract. The most I can do is repay Rhodes Island for helping us, however I can. Just, I can start by protecting you, Doctor. That's experience I've got under my belt, as a bodyguard.
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_001: Want my help? Hehe, I'll think about it if you give my buddies three days of luxury pet food! How about it, sounds like a deal, isn't... Hey, wait up! I'm just kidding! Don't go!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_002: Outta the way, outta the way~ Beanstalk Breeding Center coming right through! Watch your feet! Careful not to step on any of us~
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_003: Doctor! Click is here at Rhodes Island? I can't believe you haven't ever told me! I'm a huge fan of her outdoorsy videos! She called Pea cute, and she even said she'll bring Pea along the next time she goes on a shoot!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_004: There's been all these morons saying they'd go mining and then dug up a bunch of holes out in the wilderness. Fine, but how dare they make a mess of everyone's home! If I ever catch those bastards, I'm blowing a hole in their asses with my crossbow!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_005: Doctor, I'm done with my breeding proposal. Take a look, will ya? Huh? The budget doesn't add up...? Tsk, he found out, huh? Oh, my bad! I probably got the numbers messed up somewhere! I'll get it fixed right away~
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_006: Before I came to Rhodes Island, I sent my resume to so many companies out there, and they all turned me down. Well, just look at how helpful my little buddies are now, both in the battlefield and in logistics. Those big shots only have themselves to blame. It's their loss!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_007: You see, Pea may be the smallest of the Metal Crabs I brought with me, but she's also the brightest of the bunch! She's gonna be so amazing in the future~! My little buddies are nothing like the normal Metal Crabs out there. They're so smart! They won't be controlled by anyone out there so easily!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_008: 1, 2! 1, 2! Line up! Defense position, and block! Okay! All of you are doing amazing! Here's your reward. Eat up~! Let's switch it up now. Attac—Whoa, Doctor, how long've you been here? How come you're always so quiet when you walk?!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_009: My old man doesn't really support me raising my little pals. He says they're useless, and that I'd be better off raising burdenbeasts. Hmph, I'm show him. I'll make it big with my buddies, and we'll see if he has anything to say then! Hey, Doctor, have you ever thought of investing in me? I guarantee you you'll be raking in lots of money!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_010: Alright, focus! Doctor, you can't just space out while you're working. Take a look at what a good girl Pea is. Be more like her.
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. My name's Beanstalk. Starting today, I'll be... Eh? What's in my case? Oh, this is Peacake. Here, Pea, say hi to the Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_012: Aha! That was awesome! Did you see that, Pea?
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_013: Ehe, you're promoting us because of how well we did in the last operation, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_014: Doctor, thanks for giving me and my buddies a chance to prove ourselves! I'll cut the formalities. We'll get even more amazing than this! You're in for a surprise!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_018: Alright! Everyone, do what I say!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_020: Huh? Are these who we're up against?
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_023: Go! Show them what we've got!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_027: I won't let you get past us!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_028: You assholes! I won't let you hurt my buddies!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_029: Hehe, you guys are no match for us~
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_030: Mission complete~! How's that? My buddies did great, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_031: Oh, some of them got through! Wait here, Doctor. I'll go after them!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_032: *Sob*. It's okay, everyone. Don't cry. I'll beat those jackasses up next time!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_033: I don't mind sleeping anywhere. Where's the breeding room, though?
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_034: Why'd you do that? Stop pulling my ribbon!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_036: Hm? What's up? Wanna pet Pea?
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. For my New Year's wish, I want the Beanstalk Breeding Company to get founded this year without a hitch! If you'll do me just the tiniest favor, then I'll work even harder when I'm on the clock!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday! Given our unusual friendship, I've decided to give you a very precious present. Ta-dah—a robust little metal crabling, choice selection of the Beanstalk Breeding Company! Isn't he just adorable? Shh! You can't let anyone else know, or they'll all be hounding me for their own!
dialogue_tracker.char_452_bstalk_CN_044: Rhodes Island dinner parties never fail to impress! But when do we get to hold a pet show here? We can compete to see whose pets know the most tricks, or just find out who's most popular. You want them to fight? Are you crazy, Doctor?! You think way too violent!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_001: Hm. So this is the place you work, Doctor? Marvelous, truly marvelous. Allow me, then, for a brief moment, so that I can consult my feng shui crash-course guidebook…
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_002: I might sound like a braggart, but beyond a little kickboxing in a scuffle, I can rustle up meals, practice acupuncture, and divine with feng shui. And the list goes on: working masonry, farming, fishing—I'm a maestro of all kinds! Just give the order, and I'll see everything through.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_003: D-Doctor, I was a little idle, and went to make myself useful at HR, and by carelessness glimpsed at a few operator files, and by chance… Er, by no means do I intend to pry into a fellow operator's privacy, Doctor, but could that FEater be the very star of 'Fiends of the Gods Reincarnated Immortal' herself? Truly? Could I go get an autograph?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_004: Who was my master? Hmm, a question as complex as a showdown of Yanese cuisines. Normally I'd refrain from answering that, as slipping up would get me beaten sideways. That said... you need only know, Doctor, I'm the last descendant of the Lien line. Ah, but my family name's not Lien. It's Ch'u.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_005: Heavens be praised... Miss Dusk really did come to Rhodes Island with us, then? Truth be told, my recollection's quite fuzzy now, yet I have the vague impression that within her painted dreams, I had a peek into my own miserable future... Ah, look at me, carried away by my emotions again. I say it's high time we set aside the nonsense and look forward. Now, You be careful too, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_006: Now, now, Doctor, don't worry about me. I and the Infected do get along well. Back at my old place, a Catastrophe once struck not too far away. It frightened all of us, seeing the world go pitch black. My master remarked then that Catastrophes were Heaven's false charge against the human realm. Ah, truly a bitter thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_007: Benefactor Lava? Yes, I call her my benefactor. She once saved me, and as time went on, it became second nature. Throughout my life I've been saved thrice, and every time, I engrave it upon my soul. The gloompincer incident, you mean? No, not that. She showed to me a path, and that was true grace beyond all.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_008: Say, Doctor, are people able to leave their past behind like water under the bridge? Certainly not, right? But if the bonds you once left behind still hold fast, what ought you do? You've no idea either? Well, then. It seems we're companions in our misery. Here, what say we crack some sunflower seeds?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_009: Countless, they were, the ancient parasol trees about Kou-wu City. Oh, just reminiscing all of a sudden. I remember the leaves scattered across the ground come fall, when my parents would visit me from the country. Only then would my strict master speak nothing but good, and I would be spared of my seniors' bully for a moment. No, no, just reminiscing.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_010: Hmm. I've been pondering a fan for you too, but what ought we write on it?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_011: My codename? It's 'nothing' worth mentioning here. And you, fine soul, are the Doctor? That is to say, my new boss? Ah. Pleasure to meet you. How can I be of service? Perhaps you would like a back massage? Or some chiropractic maybe?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_012: Ho. what a hundredfold bouquet of martial prowess. You've got my eyes wide open now!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_013: A promotion and a raise?! Ohh, ohh, I thank you, Doctor, in all respects possible! Be it for you, I would brave hell and high waters... That said, how much might my wages be growing by?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_014: Sooner or later, I plan to return to Kou-wu City and set that last unsettled debt in my book straight. My only worry is I may invite trouble and sweep others up in its path. You know this, dear Doctor, and yet you still wish to bestow such partiality on me...? Your kindness toward me is a grace, and I will never, in eternity, forget it.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_017: Very well! Doctor, I'll see to it that you have nothing at all to worry about.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_018: Me, the captain? Hold one moment, just let me find my secret tomes for the art of war…
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_019: As they say, all have their own methods, whether arms against a force or earth to a waterspout. There'll be a way!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_020: I'm witnessing fiends, one and all! Quite frightening!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_024: The Doctor, you are! What a sagacious decision!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_025: Mind at ease, thoughts at peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_026: A perfect technique makes freedom to act!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_027: The moon waxes and wanes. The fan opens and shuts!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_028: Now, if I may have the honor to see your move first…
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_029: More hands bring more fuel for the fire. When we concert our efforts together, yes, we truly can burn the sky a red to rival sunsets. Now that's what I call a feat!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_030: As they say, those of just ways have much support, and those of lost ways find little. Seen as such, it was a victory preordained.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_031: Pursue not the desperate. Suppose anything troublesome should happen, we'll just bear it together.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_032: Go on ahead, everyone. No worries. My runaway act is first in class. I'll be just fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_033: Oh-hoh, Rhodes Island truly is a wondrous land. I feel quite dizzy just looking.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_034: Hoh? What's this for exactly, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_036: Doctor, what say I teach you a move or two?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_038: Come one, come all! Ah, hello, Doctor! Nice to see you here on such a holiday. The rest area's full of people, so I thought I'd issue some secret little tomes to life, at low prices to boot! Good tidings to all, won't you agree? Oh, speaking of which, Have you been sleeping well recently? I just so happen to have a copy of 'Winter Sleep-Aiding Breathing and Respiration Techniques'. What say you have a look?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_042: Well, if it isn't the Doctor! What a happy coincidence!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_043: Ah, Doctor, I've rustled up a divination for you, the grams are written here on this fan. They signify this fresh year ahead of you will be a smooth sail, with waves and winds both on your side... You don't believe me? Not unless I give you a performance with this fan? I'd be put at a loss, you know, given my mere modest speck of kickboxing artistry. But you are the boss, your word is the law.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_044: My master did tell me I was suited to martial arts, but she never taught of any place where you could use it, only that we shouldn't let down the conscience... Ah, I'm just thinking. If I'd not come to Rhodes Island, I'd probably be in Lungmen running a gym, I suppose? But all moneymaking aside, I fear I'd never have used this fan again.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Hm. The office of the vaunted Doctor, then? Marvelous, truly. Allow me a brief moment to consult my feng shui crash-course guidebook...
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: I'm no mere braggart! Beyond a little kickboxing in a scuffle, I can rustle up meals, practice acupuncture, divine with feng shui, work masonry, tend to rice and angle fish alike—I'm a maestro of all kinds! Doctor, you need only give the order, and I'll see everything through!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: D-Doctor, I was a little idle, see, and went to make myself useful at HR, and by carelessness glimpsed at a few operator files, and... er, well, could FEater be the very star of 'Fiends of the Gods Reincarnated Immortal' herself? Truly? Could I go get an autograph?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_004: Who was my master? Hmm, a question as complex as a showdown of Yan cuisines. Normally I'd refrain from answering that, as slipping up would get me beaten sideways. That said... you need only know, Doctor, I'm the last descendant of the Lien line. Ah, but my family name's not Lien. I'm a Ch'u.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_005: M-Miss Dusk really did... come to Rhodes Island with us, then? My, um... what was it now? My recollection's quite fuzzy now, yet I have the vague impression that within her painted dreams, I had a peek into my own miserable future. Ah, let's never mind. Dear, oh, dear. You be quite careful too, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: Now, now, Doctor, don't worry about me. I and the Infected do get along well. Back at my old place, a Catastrophe once struck not too far away. It frightened all of us, seeing the world go pitch black. My master remarked then that Catastrophes were Heaven's false charge against the human realm. Ah, truly a bitter thing.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_007: Benefactor Lava? Yes, I call her my benefactor. She once saved me, and as time went on, it became second nature. Throughout my life I've been saved thrice, and every time, I engrave it upon my soul. The gloompincer incident, you mean? No, not that. She showed to me a path, and that was true grace beyond all.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_008: Say, Doctor, are people able to brush the past away as they live? Certainly not, hm? If the bonds you once left behind still hold fast, what ought you do? You've no idea either? Well, then. It seems we're companions in our misery. Here, what say we crack some sunflower seeds?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: Countless, they were, the ancient parasol trees about Kou-wu City. Oh, just reminiscing all of a sudden. I remember the leaves scattered across the ground come fall, when my parents would visit me from the country. Only then would my strict master speak nothing but good, and her other disciples, my brothers and sisters, wouldn't bully me. No, well, just reminiscing.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_010: Hmm. I've been pondering a fan for you too, but what ought we write on it?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_011: My codename? 'Mr. Nothing.' The latter man of Tzu-hsu and Wu-yu; Nonexistent and Nothing indeed. And you, fine soul, are the Doctor? That is to say, my new boss? Well, then, would you like me to massage your back? Loosen up your legs?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: Ho, what a hundredfold bouquet of martial prowess. You've got my eyes wide open now!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: A promotion and a raise?! Ohh, ohh, I thank you, Doctor, in all respects possible! Be it for you, I would brave the greatest fires and waters, I would not hesitate to... well, that said, how much might my wages be growing by?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_014: Sooner or later, I plan to return to Kou-wu City and set every debt in my books straight. My only worry is I may invite trouble and sweep others up in its path. You know this, dear Doctor, and yet you still wish to bestow such partiality on me...? Your kindness toward me is a grace, and I will never, in eternity, forget it.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_017: Very well! Doctor, I'll see to it that you have nothing at all to worry about.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: Me, the captain? Hold one moment, just let me find my secret tomes for the art of war, now...
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: As they say, all have their own methods, whether arms against a force or earth to a waterspout. There'll be a way!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: I'm witnessing fiends, one and all! Quite frightening!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_023: Very well! Leave this to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_024: The Doctor, you are! What a sagacious decision!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: A perfect technique makes freedom to act!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: The moon waxes and wanes. The fan opens and shuts!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: Let's have you make a move first, now.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: More hands bring more fuel for the fire. When we concert our efforts together, yes, we truly can burn the sky a red to rival sunsets. Not bad, not bad.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: As they say, those of just ways have much support, and those of lost ways find little. Seen as such, our victory is assured.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Pursue not the cornered. Suppose anything troublesome should happen, we'll just bear it together.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: Go on ahead, everyone. No worries. My runaway act is first in class. I'll be just fine.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: Oh-hoh, Rhodes Island truly is a wondrous land. I feel quite dizzy just looking.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: Hoh? What's this for exactly, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Doctor, what say I teach you a thing or two about some moves?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Now, everyone, don't miss it while... ah, Doctor. It's a holiday today, see? The rest area's full of people, so I thought I'd issue some secret little tomes to life, at low prices to boot! Good tidings to all, you know. Have you been sleeping well as of late? I just so happen to have a copy of 'Winter Sleep-Aiding Breathing and Respiration Techniques'. What say you have a look?
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Well, if it isn't the Doctor! What a happy coincidence!
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_043: Ah, Doctor, I've rustled up a divination for you, the grams are written here on this fan. They signify all will flow like water and wind in this fresh year of your... You don't believe me? Not unless I give you a performance with this fan? *cough* I'd be put at a loss, you know, given my mere modest speck of kickboxing artistry. But you are the boss, your word is law.
dialogue_tracker.char_455_nothin_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_044: My master did tell me I was suited to martial arts, but she never taught of any place where you could use it, only that we shouldn't let down the conscience. Ah, I'm just thinking. If I'd not come to Rhodes Island, I'd probably be in Lungmen running a gym, I suppose? But all moneymaking aside, I fear I'd have never used this fan again.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_002: The most important thing my safta taught me was that life shouldn't have too many taboos.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_003: Focus on the work at hand and don't jump to any conclusions.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_004: Tachanka's taught me a thing or two about how to build defenses.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_005: I have some questions, Doctor. I hope you can answer them for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_006: Overcoming obstacles and breaking down barriers makes a lot of things easier.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_007: I'm willing to try, as long as the reward is commensurate to the risk.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_008: You think I'm strict, huh? I'll take that as a compliment.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_009: Do me a favor. You worry about the strategy and let me worry about the tactics.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_011: Rainbow Operator, codename Ash. I have my authorization and I'm ready for assignment.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_012: The more we can learn about their attack patterns, the better off we'll be.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_014: You can't really understand a conflict until you've been on both sides.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_018: Let's get our heads in the game.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_019: Let's show them what we can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_029: That worked out better than I expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_456_ash_CN_031: We knew the risks. We still have to see this through.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_001: Instead of sitting here, why don't we walk out together?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_002: I'm in the starting lineup for next week's football match. Come watch the game!
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_003: If you know how we can improve my G52 Tactical Shield, please submit a test application. I'll be there anytime.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_004: Ease up, there's nothing to be nervous about. Should I invite Tachanka to dance a little ballet for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_005: The doctors don't test me because I'm sick. They test me because I'm too healthy. Good thing I'm not afraid of needles!
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_006: Flash! Bash! Kapow! That's all you need to know.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_007: Not only am I sweet, but I've got a great sense of humor.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_008: If you find something interesting to play with, count me in.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_009: We have a responsibility to look after one another. I take that very seriously.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_010: This is really interesting, but not to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_011: RAINBOW Operator, codename Blitz. Give the order and I'll bash 'em in the face with my shield!
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_012: This is pretty good. The popcorn, I mean. Want some?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_013: Medals, awards, promotions. They go really well with my shield, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_014: I don't like photos of myself. The lighting is always wrong.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_017: Should we go get the bad guys maybe? Just a suggestion.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_018: Remember: point your guns at the bad guys.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_021: Do think I have time to use the bathroom?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_022: If anyone needs to sneeze, do it now.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_029: Are we good? Can we go home now?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_030: Everything will be fine, I'm here after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_031: Am I going to need to save all your asses again?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_032: Dammit, did anyone remember to bring the ammo?
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_033: Let's go say hello to our neighbors first.
dialogue_tracker.char_457_blitz_CN_036: You should invite me over for dinner. We are friends, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_001: Here's the schedule. You'll also need to review the weekly reports, expense records, and meeting agendas. Which do you want to do first?
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_002: We'll overcome any obstacle as long as we work together.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_003: Excuse me, sir, but do you mind if I tidy up the bookshelf?
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_004: Sometimes humans behave exactly like wild animals. Understanding this makes me a more efficient operator.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_005: To see the really interesting things, you have to get out of the city. That's why I'm always so far away.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_006: Putting out the Welcome Mat is the first step. Luring the prey takes a bit more doing.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_007: No, no. This is all wrong. Let me reconsider for a bit.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_008: Is there anything I can help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_009: Who's the hunter? Who's the hunted? That's up to Mother Nature and the battlefield in question.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_010: Simply pull this string and there's the Welcome Mat...
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_011: RAINBOW Operator, codename Frost. At your service, sir.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_013: Thank you for your trust, sir.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_014: There are two things we absolutely need in a survival situation: water and hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_018: Don't forget, we're a team and we have a plan.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_019: Time for all the planning to pay off.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_020: I've got eyes on the hostiles.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_023: Don't let them get the drop on you.
dialogue_tracker.char_458_rfrost_CN_029: Stay two steps ahead of the enemy at all times.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_001: If you invited me, you must not be looking for a tactician.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_002: I love my country, for better or for worse.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_003: Have you met my sister? She's the one in the white coat in the photo, and those are her children.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_004: Survive. Be a leader. You don't want your loved ones crying over your grave, do you?
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_005: I don't want my kids to follow in my footsteps. Being a soldier is too dangerous.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_006: In my country, focusing firepower on a target is considered a simple and effective way to achieve victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_007: I like the way you think.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_008: Personally, I prefer the enemies come to us in search of death. How about you?
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_009: Relax, baby. When this is all over, I'll buy you some vodka.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_010: Are you bored? Why not clean your weapon?
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_011: RAINBOW Operator, codename Tachanka. I'm ready. Where do you want me?
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_012: First, we learn about them. Then we outsmart them.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_014: They told me I'd died. They were wrong. I was reborn.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_018: Just don't play hero, it never works.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_023: Guys, you are all lucky I was there.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_031: We're not out of the woods, bratan.
dialogue_tracker.char_459_tachak_CN_036: Call me in for support if you need it.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_001: Don't stay cooped up in your office all the time, Doki. Why don't you come down to the mines with me one of these days?
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_002: Something smells moldy. Should be in the bottom left drawer. My nose is never wrong... Well, Doki, You should really deal with those documents before they pile up. If you just leave them like that, they're gonna get damp.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_003: My drills are all souped up. They've got twice the impact, improved stability, and they pretty much can't jam. Anyway, I'm a pro when it comes to boring, tunneling, and laying concrete. If you've got any construction jobs like that, I'm your girl!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_004: First, you check construction blueprints ahead of time. Second, you don't disrupt our work without a good reason. Third: You never, ever fall behind on your payments. That's the three principles Shana's Construction Crew uses to decide on projects. No exceptions, Doki, not even for Rhodes Island.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_005: Rim Billiton has more prospecting operation platforms than you can count, with tons of workers running around. You gotta know what you're doing to get anybody to listen to ya. I work hard to refine my skills, and I teach what I know to the gang. That's the way I do things... Yeah.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_006: We don't compromise on safety, even in barren mines with low output. Infected or not, so long as you work the mines, your rights oughta be guaranteed. I hope we never see another Billy mine accident. At the very least, I always make sure my projects stand up to inspection.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_007: Doctor, want a lolly? It's just a regular mint one. I always keep some in my pocket. Don't underestimate the power of a lolly, though. When there's dusty air all around you, a little sweetness can really calm you down.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_008: My dad always said that Columbia's Great Expansion marked the start of a new age. Now, the big corps pull in all different countries on big projects. Rim Billiton's ores really shine out there. But you know how things go, the taller the building, the more solid the foundations have to be. That's why the work we do is always meaningful, no matter the task.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_009: A Billy worker never sees the sun.' That's what my friends in the mines always say. The darkness down there swallows everything, work and life, past and future... I want to give people hope for the future, Doki, give them better lives. Easy enough to say, but there's lots of work to do. You'll lend a hand, won't you, Doki?
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_010: Alright, lads, day's done. Rest up now.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_011: Oh, so you're the Doctor everyone's talking about! I'm new in Engineering; foreman of Shana's Construction Crew out of Rim Billiton! Here's my business card.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_012: Nah yeah… If the mines just provided workers with recorders, it would save us so much hassle.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_013: I thought it was a joke when I got a new contract from HR. Not only did my pay go up, I get even more benefits... Thanks, Doki!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_014: If I ever get the chance, I want to go check out Columbia, see the Great Expansion with my own eyes and how their workers are different from ours in Rim Billiton... Doki, Rhodes Island works with a lot of big companies, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_017: Work, work! Hop to it now!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_018: You all got your helmets on? Check again!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_019: This shaft's got a complicated layout. Follow me.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_020: Ah! Why is my drill stuck?!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_022: Relax, Doki, just show up at completion time.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_023: The blueprints check out. Let the construction work begin!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_024: Remember, max deviation for each drill hole is two centimeters!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_025: Oi! Stay focused when you're running that boring machine!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_026: A triple bright miner's lamp could make ya go blind!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_027: Move, or this cement's going right on your heads!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_029: Doki! We… We just wrapped up a huge project!
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_030: When worker safety's on the line, you can't slip up for even a single second.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_031: If you spot anything after construction's done, that's already too late. We need to find as many problems as we can in the design stage.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_032: Don't be glum, chum. Follow-up work is part of construction, too. Just leave it to me to take care of the reinforcement. Cheer up, Doki.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_033: Let's say Rhodes Island needs some dorms rebuilt, think you might hire Shana's Construction Crew? Hehe…
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_034: Eeek! Oh, it's you, Doki. Sorry, didn't notice you over the sound of the drill.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_036: Doki, can you hold this shield for me? Careful now, it's heavy. The inside there? That's concrete, baby.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_038: Every time, around this year, those of us workers that couldn't go back home would gather somewhere free in the quarry for an open-air screening. Seeing how happy the people up on that curtain were, we'd all forget our worries for a while. A whole new day, and a whole new year.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_042: Hey, Doki! Here, a mint for ya.
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor! Are you free today? The construction team just took on a new mining project, and the groundbreaking ceremony's today. Everyone would be so happy to see you there... Why don't I buy you lunch afterwards?
dialogue_tracker.char_464_cement_CN_044: Even the smallest project can call for a lot of workers, but Rhodes Island is the place I've seen so many amazing people gathered in one place. What is it that Rhodes Island is trying to accomplish, Doctor? I'm in on it now, so I can't wait to see for myself!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_001: Doctor! Do you want these files here? A Liberi lady just taught me how to use a printer! Look, I even learned how to print on both sides! This needs to be single-sided? Uh-oh, sorry! I'll print it again!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_002: My mother has gotten a lot better. That time, even divination showed a dark future. If not for the medical equipment we got from the explorers, she might have left us... Since then, I decided to go out into the world. I hope to bring more equipment like that back to the village.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_003: I'm really grateful to Magallan. We've only met a few times during search and rescue operations, but she put me in touch with Rhodes Island after hearing my situation. And she's an incredible lady. Not many people dare to explore the ice fields like her. Even people in our tribe seldom set foot there. It's a place that's feared and revered.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_004: I'm part of my tribe's rescue team, helping people who accidentally wander into the bog, or get lost in the snowstorms. That's how I met a lot of explorers from Columbia. Woah, Doctor, how did you know they always compliment my tail?
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_005: I never thought I would leave the tribe and come here. I was never interested in things from the outside world. But that shiny medical equipment blew me away. They went against our divination. That's a miracle to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_006: The explorers told me things I've never heard before, about 'corporations', 'timetables', 'entrepot'... we don't even have these words because we've never had a use for them. But I learned them quickly, thanks to my conversations with the explorers.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_007: Can I see the future like Gitano? I suppose I could divine your future, but I'm not great at it. If you really want me to tell your fortune for the day, let's see... Okay, it says... the stars will fall from the sky, and eggplant must go on top of rice.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_008: Doctor, Accounting says my 'reimbursement claim' has been delayed. What does 'reimbursement claim' mean? Sorry, but there's still so much I don't understand about paperwork…
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_009: Doctor! I'm back from my field mission! We delivered some equipment to my tribe and taught them how to use it. Turns out aunt's leg pains were caused by bone spurs. Now that we know how to treat it, she won't have to rely on my cousin's Arts to relieve the pain.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_010: Oh, the phone is ringing! What did the Doctor say I should do in this situation… Okay... He-hello? Um, nice to hear you. This is the Doctor's office.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_011: I forgot to ask the Perro man what I should call you. I only learned the word 'company' from the Columbians. Do you have a name? Oh, just 'Doctor'? I can do that!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_012: Is this one of your technologies? How do you manage to record everything like that?
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_013: Doctor, is this what you call a 'contract'? It's very difficult to understand. Do I have to sign it? You say if I don't sign it, I'll be forced to work day and night by a cruel boss? But Doctor, you are not cruel… What? What do you mean don't be so sure?
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_014: I won't make a fool of myself like before, Doctor! You've helped me so much. My mother's getting better, and my tribe is learning to use Rhodes Island medical equipment. I hope I can do even more for them in the future.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_017: Don't worry, I've been on a lot of rescue operations.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_018: Everyone, follow my orders and don't run off on your own.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_020: Make sure you're well-prepared. That's the foundation of a successful rescue.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_023: Don't worry, help is on the way.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_024: Please save your strength, we will get you out!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_028: Don't worry. You're going to be fine!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_029: I was nervous, but my experience really came in handy!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_030: A well-planned and well-executed rescue operation, our target has been brought to safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_031: The victim was injured… Don't worry, I'll ease the pain for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_033: Oh, so this is where I'm supposed to use this 'access card.'
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_036: Doctor, you don't really want me to divine your future, do you?
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_038: Doctor! My mother divined Rhodes Island's future to thank you. She'll tell you the results herself. She also asked me to give you this, a feather that's only given to the strongest warrior or wisest sage among our people.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_042: Boo! Did that scare you? Not at all? Aw, I used to spook lots of people in the snow.
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_043: I've been practicing tsoavttsomav iednijn (divination with my mother). Do you want to have your fortune told again? Maybe start with easy questions, like how big you'll grow this year. Apparently, I'm going to grow a lot!
dialogue_tracker.char_466_qanik_CN_044: I used to be scared of contracts and paperwork, but I can handle those now. My tribe has started calling me the 'oavdos unna rájadusásj' ('Wonderful Little Messenger'). I heard Magallan set a new record. People with dreams just don't stop.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_001: Mhmmmm... Hm? Did you say something? No, I'm not ignoring you. I'm just... thinking of something else.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_002: I... I've always been alone, so I'm not good at making conversation. It did cause much trouble when my travels began. Some people feared me, one even conned me out of my luggage. Things were difficult, but not entirely hopeless. As long as I have my staff, I can work, so I won't go hungry for too long.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_003: Life in the lighthouse was hardly dull. The seas are always changing. However, my teacher said that only by seeing more of this land, could I guard a small corner of the seaside. She then drove me out of the lighthouse. That's how I made my way here.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_004: Blue Poison gave me a new pair of gloves. Pretty, aren't they? She also said the material is modified. Now it can better prevent poisoning from accidental touches. Actually, It happens so often when I'm around my poison-wielding friends... I feel that I may have built up an immunity.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_005: I used to gaze into the sea every night. No one in town knew what we were seeking or guarding, and my teacher never told me. All I know is that, where there is darkness, there must be a lighthouse. I will stay watching, until that day comes.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_006: The light you just saw… Some call it Originium Arts, but my teacher says it's the power from our hearts. With light to guide them, even those who sail in the foggiest nights will brave the raging tides and find their way to shore. That is why I will do my best to protect this light.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_007: My tail has a beautiful color? Mhm, thank you very much. You may touch it if you want. Despite the color, it's not poisonous.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_008: Could you hold my staff for me, Doctor? My hair's getting too long. I want to arrange it before it gets tangled up. It might take a while, but I'll be able to better support you on the battlefield.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_009: I'm starting to realize that people can be like lighthouses… Some can even shine farther and brighter than any of them... like you, Doctor. Would it be okay if I stay beside you for a little longer before I go back?
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_010: You don't need me to keep watch while you sleep? Yes? You want me to take a nap, too? I-I'll try...
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_011: Hello, Doctor. My name is Aria… Uh, sorry, I mean Indigo. I used to be a lighthouse keeper... Um, apprentice. Now my position is a Caster, but... also an apprentice. I really look forward to learning from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_012: Are these techniques for fending off enemies? My teacher taught me a little, but I didn't know you could do this.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_013: What…? A promotion? A lighthouse needs only one keeper. Is that... not the case here?
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_014: I can do even more…? Indeed… my light shines even farther now... Thank you, Doctor. I will keep doing all I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_018: Very well... I'll keep this light up. Please be careful not to wander off.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_020: If you insist on stopping us, then we have no choice but to defeat all of you.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_025: These enemies do not compare to the seas' ferocity.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_026: I shall stand guard, until daybreak.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_027: The fear for light, comes only from the evil within.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_028: If you wish to flee, then follow this light.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_029: With such power, perhaps we won't need to fear the arrival of that day…?
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_030: Thank goodness. Another night of calm sea.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_031: S-Some enemies got away? I see. We must alert everyone.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_032: Doctor, this way... Don't be afraid. It doesn't matter how dark the path up ahead is, I'll light it for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_033: It's okay. I'll be fine by myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_034: Oh... Doctor, you're tangled in my hair. Please be careful; tripping and falling can be painful.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_036: Would you like to stay here with me...? You know... The night watch won't be as dull with company.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_038: To the ocean, every day is the same with its ebbs and flows. As its watcher, I feel the same. I read that the ocean used to be gorgeous at night, with moonlit waves that danced as if wearing silvery capes. It's a pity we can't see that anymore. If we could go back in time, Doctor, I would love to see it with you.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_042: Doctor, would you like the light to be brighter?
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_043: Here… a cake for you. Blue Poison taught me how to bake it. I've practiced plenty of times, so it's sure to taste great despite its looks. The gloves? They're for food hygiene, Doctor, not because the cake's poisonous, trust me.
dialogue_tracker.char_469_indigo_CN_044: When my teacher sent me away, I couldn't see why. She had taught me everything she knew, yet she still said I wasn't ready. It only became clear after I came to Rhodes Island. Anyone can guard the lighthouse, but to face all that follows once the light is lit requires great knowledge of this land.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_001: To be of assistance to you would be my great honor.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_002: The Originium crystal on my forehead is oft regarded as an adornment. A very convenient mistake; it lets me save the effort of concealing my Infected status. That said, every time pain crosses my brow, I'm deeply struck by my own foolishness. To say I leave Sargon asks just where my path now leads.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_003: Sesa is still quite young. Indeed, I am but a few years his senior. Yet, his grasp on patience is somewhat awkward, and his resentment lacks solidity. Should he seek a spark of truth to ignite his thirst for vengeance, I would be more than willing to oblige... Ah, should you forbid it, I would not act out of turn.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_004: I abhor the black market. Only lowly, vapid ruses circle it. People all believe themselves the most veteran players, yet all end dismally. At times, you need only think with some care, and you can send someone to their demise—even a padishah's very own appointed lord ameer. Hm, might you be curious?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_005: That great fire, you say? Do you look to blame me? Indeed, I shall not contest it. But know this: not a single innocent suffered in that fire, nor did any perpetrator survive. In the black market of Sargon, the good only comes in one form... They are the ones who've endured. And I have endured.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_006: Kal'tsit... Dr. Kal'tsit and I, are indeed old acquaintances. To be precise, she was my rescuer and savior, but be at ease; I am yours now. Oh, was that not your concern? How remarkable, that as a coworker of our 'Kal'tsit,' you could still be so unwary?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_007: Were I to return to Columbia'... I cannot say I've never entertained the possibility over the years, but such supposition would only serve to shake me. Doctor, I hope you will use me to the utmost. If such mild civilian technologies have become a stranger to me, I would now much rather renounce them.
