dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_008: Elliot? How do you... Hm. Elliot. His parents gone before their time, his one beloved, esteemed teacher dead in Sargon. The work which bore his faith but a stepping stone in someone else's conspiracy. To this day, he is bereft of anything. Elliot Glover is merely a laughable life lived.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_009: I know a scientist—a star so bright, a soul so graceful, a leader so natural. I admire him, rely on him, and regard him as my elder brother. However, his end is not a good one, considerably not. So you must protect yourself well, Doctor. After all, we do get along quite pleasantly.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_010: How long it has been—since such clear skies.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_011: Your Operator, Passenger. I have long wished to work alongside you, Doctor. I'm sure we will both find this journey most enjoyable.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_012: Marvelous tactics, owing to your command, no doubt.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_013: I shall refine my services even further for you and Rhodes Island. Trust that the Sand Soldier of Reefsteep Black Market has more tricks up his sleeve.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_014: I truly hope that my amusing Operator codename will remind you—Doctor, there is no need to trust others, and you are capable of doing everything yourself. Oh? It seems you have other views. I shall duly accede, then.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_017: Allow me to demonstrate how a truly exceptional weapon of war operates.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_018: I am quite familiar with strategy and planning. Of course, should you have other ideas, I defer to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_020: Now then, we have everything in place.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_029: You must pardon me; it seems my lowly weapons have barely served to accomplish this mission. Should you assent to my adopting more... extreme methods, we may thus have an easier time.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_030: Thunder and lightning are but a form of punishment. They have paid the price for their ill deeds. How good it is, do you not think?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_031: I cannot permit the punished to leave my sight in peace. Doctor, I plead you permit me to perform this aftercare.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_032: A rather harsh defeat. But worry not, Doctor. Those who have snatched victory from your hands... will be privileged to experience suffering in full.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_033: What a captivating landship. Doctor, Sargon has never accorded me such treatment.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_034: Oh. Might something be the matter?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_036: Doctor, care for some coffee? I grew these beans myself. Back in Sargon, it was my sole form of recreation.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_038: The New Year... what an unfamiliar concept. The golden sands of Sargon remain unchanged year after year. Making resolutions for a new start on an artificial calendar is nothing but empty self-consolation. That said, here at Rhodes Island, perhaps a day when everyone has a common cause for celebration is indeed special.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_043: A birthday should be no cause for celebration. It is, instead, a countdown to one's death. Each time such an occasion arises, I reflect on what remains unaccomplished. The terminus of ideals and hatred lies far beyond sight, much like the unpredictable end of one's life. These ravings are perhaps not suitable for this occasion. I should congratulate you instead. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_CN_044: Having lived such an absurd life, I am but a husk of a man. Yet, from this ship that Kal'tsit has placed great hope in, I caught a glimpse of light in this boundless, dull realm. Doctor, I look forward to the sights you will show me, after we traverse the immeasurable hatred and battles ahead.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_001: What did you find in time, mysterious master of the black market? The past, Elliot. I have always been seeking the past. Perhaps I will find a home among the patterns of the cacti and quicksand, but neither you nor I know where our fate will lead.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_002: I detest everything there. I had to leave Sargon, even if letting a coin flip decide for me meant surrendering to fate. But I am still there, Sand Soldier. You can't escape what you are. Our destinies have already been written.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_003: Sargon will leave its mark on you. To the employer, you are as feeble as a fledgling fowlbeast. I forgot how it felt to be put to the lash. Do you hate those people? No. I know their end. I know it from your eyes. Fortunately, you don't seem to regret it.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_004: Yet your expression suggests otherwise. Did you not throw all of the past into that big fire? There is a plaza in the black market with a view of the sky. Do you remember what the night reminds you of? I called it a cremation ceremony, but when my plan worked and the flames raged... What came to mind was not the face of my beloved teacher.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_005: Do you remember the first component of Thorne's Gift? The shoddy Arts Unit you obtained by burying your conscience in the sand? By exploiting and deceiving a guard who had just lost his son? Not to mention the irony in that name. What gift will a teacher give to a conspirator, Passenger?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_006: Tell me. Has Oripathy changed our lives? Do you feel pain? How will the illness transform me? Have the schemers behind the scenes miscalculated? You are trembling, poor Elliot. Never mind the cause, leave them in the past. Now, I simply marvel at the beauty of Oripathy's creation in the mirror.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_007: Spring is when business is best. Summer is adorned by festivals. Autumn is the season to seek fortune away from Ibut. Winter belongs to war. These are the seasons of Sargon, seasons that you will come to hate… But in Ibut, I can see the stars shine bright on summer nights.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_008: Strange things, fabricated dreams are. What should I say to you, Doctor of the future? If I had met you earlier... No. The Doctor does not exist where we do. The Doctor belongs to my time. Let our special friend act freely. I have high hopes for this one.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_009: A Vouivre, and the 'Doctor'. Are you begging for their pity? No, I simply want to learn about my future, or tell others about theirs. Nothingness without end is worse than any illness... Listen to me, Elliot. I feel a little tired.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_010: Sleep, my Elliot. Sleep and dream together with me. In our dreams, you will become me, and I will still be you.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_011: Have I turned the pages of destinies past? No, it is but a dream you avoid. My future.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_012: I see conspiracies from time to time... Yes, Elliot. The conflicts, the greed. They are everywhere.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_013: Oripathy has robbed me of my future. I hope that Rhodes Island can make use of what I have left. Wrong. Nobody in Rhodes Island can indulge your desire for self-harm. It is not that they are too kind, it is that you are too harsh. This is Elliot Glover's conclusion.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_014: Will you see the Sargon's winter when you awake? Will you sleep away in the eternal summer? Must I become you? Prophecy is but fate in disguise. Sleep soundly, Elliot. You've shaped me, and I shall complete you, until the day the prophecies no longer foretell.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_017: Why do you not seek more companions? It will make things easier. In time, you will understand. And much more than once, I regret to say.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_018: Elliot would have asked me: How does an empty soul lead others with sincerity?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_019: I recall the weight on my back as I carried my grievously injured teacher—it was the weight of my war. Most wars are waged for profit; mine is born from vengeance.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_020: I fought for a single purpose. Let war be the past, then, if the purpose is lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_022: Do you remember the touch of quicksand?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_023: My war machine will fulfill your wishes.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_024: After all, 'Man' is the ultimate weapon.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_025: I remember how each piece of equipment was born.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_026: What is there to be gained... by fighting in the name of my teacher?
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_029: There is no snow in the winters of the black market. Will I still see snow? Yes, but in that world of silvery white, nothing you know will remain.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_030: Your machinations will claim all. Is this how you became the master of the black market? Yes, as will you, Elliot. I know that well. You will not let anyone escape.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_031: Did you see how the punished fled? Yes, I did. I wonder if that was how those Columbians saw me.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_032: The days to permit mistakes are gone for good, never to return. We are fighting an enemy too powerful. Fate? No, ourselves.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_033: Do you find Rhodes Island comforting? It's more the caffeine.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_036: Treasure your memories, treasure a time when you still had emotions. I understand. At least, I can still understand.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_038: At New Year's Day, I guess many will come to curry the favor of the master of the black market? Is that so? I have forgotten. I only remember that science museum admission was free when the professor took me there that winter... So distant. The memory is so very distant.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_042: I dreamed of a future where all faded into nothingness with the changing seasons. No sweet dreams, no nightmares, only... darkness. That is where fate will lead us, Elliot. That darkness is no metaphor, just nothingness itself.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_043: Seems that even time celebrates you, Doctor. Forgive me for not having prepared a gift. May your dreams be free of the pains of the past. Or perhaps, I will tell your future when the past eats away at you.
dialogue_tracker.char_472_pasngr_epoque#17_CN_044: The mission of Rhodes Island is clear, but you seem to seek something else. I know. What I seek could never be had, ever since the morning that I left Columbia. Do you remember Professor Thorne's voice, Elliot?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_001: Doctor, I'll leave the files I sorted here. Oh, you don't have to thank me. I am used to it, and it's nothing difficult... Um, are you thirsty perhaps? Should I make you some tea?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_002: I'm not very good at speaking any languages other than Yanese. That's why I was a little scared at first and didn't talk much. But everyone's very friendly, and there are a lot of people from Yan here. Phew... it really puts my mind at ease.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_003: Sorry to disturb you, Doctor, but would you happen to know where Provence and everyone else went? My family sent me some goodies from back home, and I thought I'd share some with them since they've been taking care of me... Oh, there are some for you too, Doctor. Please have a taste!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_004: Doctor, could you help me look for my little dumpling? It's the small black-and-white doll. I thought I'd left it here, but I can't find it... *Whimpers*, please, I can't sleep at night without it.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_005: The rescue team has to deal with the Catastrophes a lot, so it's only a matter of time for us before we become infected. None of us reject anyone because of that. The crystallization on my body isn't very conspicuous, and it doesn't hurt even if you press down on it... Sometimes, I even forget that I have this on my body.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_006: When I first joined the rescue team, I wasn't very used to the climate or the food there. I'd get too homesick to fall asleep at night, and I cried to myself many, many times, but whenever I see the people we rescued, I start to think that maybe I can keep at it...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_007: Doctor, sorry to bother you... I've been studying Oripathy prevention techniques during Catastrophe relief, and Tsukinogi suggested that I come ask for your advice... Um... Sorry, am I being a bother?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_008: Uhh! Doctor, why would you sneak up on me like that? Huh? What am I holding? Oh, this is a letter I got from home. When I made the decision to leave, my parents were so angry that they said they would disown me, but there's a saying where I come from: Blood is thicker than water...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_009: When I got infected with Oripathy, I knew I probably wouldn't be able to live the peaceful life my parents wanted for me. I don't regret it, though... Besides, if I hadn't made my decision, I would never have met you or anyone else from Rhodes Island here and now, hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_010: Doctor? Doctor? Sorry to bother you. Please lift your head up a little and sleep with the cushion. If you fall asleep like this, the letters from the report will get all over your face...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_011: Hello, I'm a member of the Yan disaster relief organization 'Chun-qian,' dispatched here as an intern. My name is... Oh, I-I'm sorry. We need to use our codenames here, right? I'm terribly, terribly sorry. Please call me Mulberry.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_012: Uhh..The mountain collapsed, and the ground crumbled...! They're not special effects from an action movie, are they?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_013: Huh? A promotion? Really? I get a salary from Rhodes Island as well as Chun-qian?! I... I'm so happy...!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_014: This time, I'm not doing this to help someone else, I'm doing it for myself... Doctor, thanks for always being there to cheer me on. Now, I'm sure that everything that I've done is truly meaningful.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_017: I'll do my best to support everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_018: Huh? Me as team captain? Ah... Are you sure?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_019: Okay, we'll head out right away... Everyone, please stay safe. We'll meet again once this is over.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_020: Watch out, everyone! There's movement up ahead!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_021: Safety goggles... Okay, I have mine on. Let's go!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_022: Phew... Haah! Oh, I'm here! I-I'm not nervous!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_026: I... I can do it too!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_027: Where are you looking? It's dangerous to get distracted!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_028: It's my job to ensure everyone's safety!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_029: Report! All rescue operations in the area have been completed. Evacuation and escort proceeding without issue! Phew, thank goodness nobody's hurt...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_030: Phew, that wraps up the operation. Doctor, was I helpful?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_031: Wait! It's not safe that way... We have to do something. I'll go fetch them right away!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_032: It's not safe here! Everyone, please evacuate! Doctor, follow me!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_033: Whoa, this is the staff dormitory... Um, will I need to pay rent?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_034: Huh? Ah! I'm sorry! I'm sorry!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_036: Doctor! I really appreciate it, but please stop trying to sneak any more amulets onto me... I have way too many already!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. I didn't expect to spend the New Year here at Rhodes Island. It feels...fresh. Actually, it's been a few years since I've been home for the New Years because of work. I really want to go back, even if I can only see my home from far away...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. Do you have work today too?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_043: Doctor, happy birthday... I'd like to ask, ever since I gave you that amulet, did any of your wishes happen to come true...? N—No? Then... do you have any wishes for your birthday, that I can make real?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_044: So many doctors aboard Rhodes Island are Infected themselves. Rescue workers who can't protect themselves properly... they're not a rare sight to see. But these rescuers still choose to walk towards disaster, realizing the risk and taking it in. Their conviction is most precious. I hope that our effort can help more people live in peace.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_001: Doctor, I'll leave the files I sorted here. Oh, you don't have to thank me. I am used to it, and it's nothing difficult... Um, are you thirsty perhaps? Should I make you some tea?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_002: I'm not very good at speaking any languages other than Yanese. That's why I was a little scared at first and didn't talk much. But everyone's very friendly, and there are a lot of people from Yan here. Phew... it really puts my mind at ease.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_003: Sorry to disturb you, Doctor, but would you happen to know where Provence and everyone else went? My family sent me some goodies from back home, and I thought I'd share some with them since they've been taking care of me... Oh, there are some for you too, Doctor. Please have a taste!

None of us reject anyone because of that. The crystallization on my body isn't very conspicuous, and it doesn't hurt even if you press down on it... Sometimes, I even forget that I have this on my body.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_006: When I first joined the rescue team, I wasn't very used to the climate or the food there. I'd get too homesick to fall asleep at night, and I cried to myself many, many times, but whenever I see the people we rescued, I start to think that maybe I can keep at it...

When I made the decision to leave, my parents were so angry that they said they would disown me, but there's a saying where I come from: Blood is thicker than water...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_009: When I got infected with Oripathy, I knew I probably wouldn't be able to live the peaceful life my parents wanted for me. I don't regret it, though... Besides, if I hadn't made my decision, I would never have met you or anyone else from Rhodes Island here and now, hehe.

dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_012: Uhh..The mountain collapsed, and the ground crumbled...! They're not special effects from an action movie, are they?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_013: Huh? A promotion? Really? I get a salary from Rhodes Island as well as Chun-qian?! I... I'm so happy...!

dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_017: I'll do my best to support everyone!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_018: Huh? Me as team captain? Ah... Are you sure?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_019: Okay, we'll head out right away... Everyone, please stay safe. We'll meet again once this is over.
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_020: Watch out, everyone! There's movement up ahead!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_021: Safety goggles... Okay, I have mine on. Let's go!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_022: Phew... Haah! Oh, I'm here! I-I'm not nervous!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_026: I... I can do it too!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_027: Where are you looking? It's dangerous to get distracted!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_028: It's my job to ensure everyone's safety!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_029: Report! All rescue operations in the area have been completed. Evacuation and escort proceeding without issue! Phew, thank goodness nobody's hurt...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_030: Phew, that wraps up the operation. Doctor, was I helpful?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_031: Wait! It's not safe that way... We have to do something. I'll go fetch them right away!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_032: It's not safe here! Everyone, please evacuate! Doctor, follow me!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_033: Whoa, this is the staff dormitory... Um, will I need to pay rent?
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_034: Huh? Ah! I'm sorry! I'm sorry!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_036: Doctor! I really appreciate it, but please stop trying to sneak any more amulets onto me... I have way too many already!
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. Phew... I didn't expect to spend the New Year here at Rhodes Island this time. It feels kind of strange. Actually, because of work, it's been a few years since I've been home for the New Years. I really want to go back, even if I can only look at it from far away...
dialogue_tracker.char_473_mberry_CN_TOPOLECT_CN_042: Hello, Doctor. Do you have work today too?
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_001: Please leave for now. Any disruption during my work hours is not permitted. Should there be any offense, I appreciate your understanding.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_002: To stop people from conducting foolish and meaningless deeds... At least you and I have that goal in common. Given your rich experience, I am certain you are well aware of how fervently most humans court their own destruction. That said, until the time the others are fully prepared, it would be all futile, no matter how much you rack your brains about the sea.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_003: Please inform your operators to avoid any physical contact with me or my weapon after a battle. Intense exercise raises my surface temperature. If someone were to complain about being scalded, I would hate to feel guilty.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_004: The language I use is overly polite...? Hm, I'm still getting acquainted with the language used on the land. But, besides, in my humble opinion, it would not be in your best interest to see me being impolite.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_005: As Abyssal Hunters, we must fulfill our responsibilities. To abandon the sacrifices of the past would be an unforgivable act of betrayal.  That being said, how many Hunters can I still save other than Specter and Skadi? Even if I were to rescue another Hunter who survived by sheer luck, the fear may have crushed them whole long ago. Their future will be fraught with nothing but agony.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_006: Do you like to sing? What about dancing? Would you like to dance with me? It doesn't matter if you don't know the steps. I will teach you. Poetry, art, music... You must never forget these things. They are proof that all humans once lived beneath the starry night sky. Through these arts, and upheld by us, humans become eternal. Come, let's dance.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_007: Kal'tsit encouraged me to seek your help, though I still remain skeptical of its utility. The technology of land dwellers is primitive compared to that of Ægir, yet the average mental state is even more problematic. Fear and cowardice seem to pervade most of you. Honestly, I cannot imagine how you people would face 'that.'
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_008: The air here is dry. Fighting on land sometimes feels sweltering. Uncomfortable as it is, this is still better than being surrounded by the dead bodies of my comrades... I remember how the sea was littered with shreds of corpses. Their deaths etched onto your brain, and the stench lingers on your tongue whenever you open your mouth. Yet you cannot hang your head.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_009: Do you think we can form an alliance? We may not even be counted as the same species. Kal'tsit is far older than me. The burden she carries is beyond anyone's imagination, but it is also a burden you must face one day... You must get stronger, strong enough to fear no loss. I will watch you by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_011: Dr. {@nickname}. I am Gladiia, the officer in charge of Rhodes Island's Ægir affairs. We will have many opportunities to collaborate in the future, but please see me as an outsider. I am not worthy of your trust yet.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_012: I see. Your tactics and equipment match your kind's development progress.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_013: A new contract? While I appreciate your recognition, I already have many important missions demanding my attention. The matters you assigned will have to wait. I apologize, for the inconvenience..
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_014: War. The concept of victory doesn't exist in a war that revolves around the continuance of a species. The only conclusion it can lead to is the destruction of the opposing side under the night sky. We Abyssal Hunters put our lives on the line to fend off and delay this fate. Unwavering, unrelenting, and without any regrets.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_017: I'll join this training as your squadron's aide.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_018: This seems to be a low-intensity battle. Allow me to use it as hunting practice for your operators.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_019: You are slow like you're caught in an undertow. I will slow down and wait, try to catch up.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_020: Considering the level of this battle, allow me to save my strength.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_025: Watch out. The currents will pull the weak into the abyss.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_026: Have I granted you the permission to run away, my prey?
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_027: Just a second, then this lance will pierce your heart.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_029: Survive. That's the only rule you must follow.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_030: An archetypical victory. One day, you will be able to defeat all feeble creatures that come your way.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_031: Better hope that the fleeing prey won't share information, so you still have a chance to savor the rest of your life at ease.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_033: I appreciate the sentiment, but I'm perhaps more comfortable staying in my own little cramped dwelling.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_034: Please respect the land's etiquette, Doctor, or perhaps discourtesy is more your thing?
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_036: Best be careful. By nature, my kind are all monsters.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_038: And so another year has come and passed. How far has our plan come? Has the sea engulfed more land from the coastlines without us even realizing? Rhodes Island's operators celebrate the New Year. Let them. As for us, the more we know, the more we must judge our own actions.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_043: If we are to suppose the birth of a life is worth celebrating, said life must first possess notable value. Take my hand. This dance will be a special one. You may well consider it my endorsement of you. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_474_glady_CN_044: A species faces many threats in its survival. Under my assessment of dry land, I might equate Rhodes Island's intrinsic work to that of my Hunters. Dr. {@nickname}. It is yours to gather the weight of your decisions.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_001: You need me for something? Hah... Look at all these papers on the desk, each one filled with words. Just the sight of them makes me want to cut them up!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_002: Hfph—haah... Leave me alone. I'm trying to feel my new technique. Aren't techniques meant to be conceived, you say? Hmph, not for me. I just need to quiet down and feel it with my heart. When the time comes, my technique will naturally unfold on my blade.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_003: That ninja... She may evade your eyes, but she cannot fool my senses. I know not what she schemes, but I can promise you I shall not engage her here and now. However, if I find her trying to harm my master... You won't be able to stop my blade.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_004: Who says my eye sight is poor? Heh! This medical report is utter nonsense. If you doubt me, send your strongest, swiftest warriors, and as many as you want. Have them attack me from any direction all at once. If they can make it anywhere close to my body, I'll accept defeat.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_005: It hurts my head to hear righteous principles. Especially when those hypocrites go on and on like preaching scriptures. Hmph, the principles in their mouths are just fancy garbage. For benefit, they will stab even their family in the back. These shameless cowards, my katana will slice them apart!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_006: I've seen winters like that many times. The snow would turn red the moment it hit the ground. My enemies were everywhere. Lying, sitting... I never saw their faces, nor did I care to. My face and chest felt cold, but my hands gripping my blade were warm. Tsk, why am I even telling you all this? Just forget what I said.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_007: Um? How many times have I told you? Don't stand in front of me all of a sudden! What? You wanted me to see you better? You're a strange fellow. I don't need to look at you to know it's you. You think I would just let anybody come this close to me?
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_008: Dr.{@nickname}, you remind me of my master when you get serious. I suppose it's because… both you and her compel yourselves to go forward in chase of a grand, ambitious goal.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_009: My master had me come to Rhodes Island for some peace and quiet, but there is no peace to be had as long as the flames of war rage in my homeland. Nonetheless, as a commander, you have my respect. {@nickname}, I am under your command. Together, we will take to the battlefield, and I shall slay everyone that stands in our way as your blade!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_010: Hmm… The air here is nice and cool. Hey you, move over a bit. Let me lie down for a while too.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_011: Akafuyu, samurai, the strongest you'll find. Worrying about my katana? Haha, unlucky for you, I carry it with me wherever I go. You better keep your distance if you are scared.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_012: Oi oi, I'm already strong enough. Stop wasting my time!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_013: I don't need anyone's approval. However, I appreciate your gesture, and will repay the favor with my katana.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_014: Heh, if those guys were here, we'd be out drinking and celebrating. How about this, Dr.{@nickname}. YOU come with me! We'll drink till we drop tonight!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_017: Let's get going already. My katana is starting to rust.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_018: Now we're talking! All of you, with me!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_020: No matter who, I shall slay them by my katana!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_026: Come one, slay one! Come a thousand, slay all!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_027: Not only your head, I will cut your will to fight!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_029: Where are the foes actually worth fighting?
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_030: Hardly a challenge. I barely broke a sweat.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_031: Some enemies got through? Impossible. There's no way I didn't see them.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_032: I won't run away. My blade has not failed me, I can still fight!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_033: What a small room! Don't keep me waiting in here for too long! I might just draw my katana!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_034: Hmph... You see, if you were my enemy, I would already have sliced you in half.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_036: Come on, let's get ourselves all the ale and meat!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_038: Happy New Year, and why so late to rise? I'm already back from my training. Let me tell you, think of a wish. On the first day of the new year, make 1,000 sword swings. Then that wish will come true. Do not ask whether it's true! It's real, as long as you believe it.
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_042: Yo, Doctor, how about some katana training together?
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_043: Oh? Today's your birthday, Dr.{@nickname}? Haha! Come, I'll take you for ale and meat! Honestly, why stay quiet about a day so important? Hm? You wonder what I would've gotten you if I knew? Well, need you ask? Better ale and even more meat!
dialogue_tracker.char_475_akafyu_CN_044: Never have I asked you what we fight for, yes? Stop, no need for an answer. Words are the least reliable of all. I only care that you've considered the question, and considered it well. Lead us forth on a just path, Doctor, and I assure you my katana will be sharp enough to cut through all.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_001: Your files are all fully sorted. Hm? Was that fast? I wasn't dozing off on your last shift, after all. I have your whole workflow noted right inside my head.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_002: Stop! You're triggering one of my traps. Move any further, and a bolt will blow your brains out. How could I fall asleep surrounded by traps? That's a strange question. I couldn't sleep at all without these little trinkets around me.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_003: What we stole from the Leithanian nobles, they plundered from the land before that. We're the children of the wilds, but we are not unreasonable. Lungmen traders do good to others, and Siracusans keep to the rules, so I told my team not to lay a finger on them.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_004: Is that Lee guy here too? He got me when I was careless, and now I want a rematch. No, no need to worry, none of the trinkets he carries interest me. You go tell him as much.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_005: Infected? Only city people would call themselves that. In the endless and cutthroat wilds, whether beast or human, survival means you can call yourself the strongest.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_006: There's plenty who think the wilds are a frightening place, but to me, they were my home. I made a mistake once. It torn my family apart,  and these slumberfoots are the only ones left to roam with me. I'll never make a mistake like it again.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_007: The name Blacknight was given to me by a Yan storyteller. I always used to do my work at night, pulling the floor from under them when those merchants were drowsy. Me and my slumberfoots would take away their wealth, and 'devour' their dreams too.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_008: Don't act so nice to me... you never know when my crossbow will be aimed at your head. You don't believe I'm like that? Up to you, then. I've got no interest in dealing with a penniless good guy.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_009: They called me their boss. So I protected them, gave them food and a place to rest. But now, for as long as I haven't beaten you, you're my boss. I'll protect you, and I'll follow your orders.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_010: ...Fell asleep hugging Helmet? Light, bring a blanket over. Keep your movements low.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_011: You're the best tactician on Rhodes Island? I'm Blacknight, and excuse me but we're going to need a showdown. If I lose, you'll be my boss from then on, and I ask to be trained properly.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_013: You're not worried I'll take the bonus and run? I'm joking. For that matter, a badge like this won't fetch any real money anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_014: Work and earn a living. I wonder if my parents lived a life like this in Rim Billiton? It's fine, but I'm not letting my crossbow rust.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_017: Good timing. I need something to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_018: You want me leading? Then you'll want to watch how I do it.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_019: Listen up, darlings. Once we're on the battlefield, you need to listen to the Doctor too.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_020: You want to run? Before you do, remember to leave your valuables behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_021: I'm right by you. Don't make a sound.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_024: Let's clear this path up first.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_027: Cart, set mines in the bushes!
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_029: How'd me and the darlings do? No compliments for us?
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_030: Not bad! I've learned some more moves.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_031: I'll take a few to the next crossing. We need to get this cleaned up.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_032: No, you have to get out of here! Do as I said, or the enemy will have you trapped. We'll retreat for now and think of a better way to fight back.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_033: Roaming under the night sky is just one hundred times better than getting shut in here.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_036: Tired? You can have Helmet to hug for a little bit, then. At least until tomorrow.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_038: Well, New Year's today. Once winter passes, the caravans start coming again. If things were usual, we'd pull off a big job, and have a feast on the nobles' dime, celebrating all around. It's comfy times here, though, and I have no need for my old job. I wonder when I'll finally get the chance to bring those kids in.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_042: Hey, Helmet, no running about in the corridor! Don't think I can't see you just because you're hiding in someone's arms... oh, fine, I'll let you off, for {@nickname}'s sake.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_043: To the children of the wild, having food in your belly and a safe place to shelter's all the lucky blessings you'll ever count—no one has birthdays on their mind, and I have no idea what I should even give you. How about this? Ten favors I'll do you. Not missions from the Doctor of Rhodes Island, but things you want me to do.
dialogue_tracker.char_476_blkngt_CN_044: I still remember some of my toddler days. The fireplace at home. Mum holding me. The little handicraft beastling from my dad. That was my first home. Then I left the wilds, and lost my home again. I know there's no protecting who I want to protect yet, not before I get stronger. So, you're not going to stop me in my step. No one will.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_001: All done now. Um… do you mind if I read my manga here?
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_002: A-ah. I'm just not cut out for real life relationships… On SNS, all I gotta do is send a request to make friends. Reality is such a nightmare.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_003: Utage was my classmate in middle school, and the one who introduced me here. We're… friends, I guess, but Doctor, be warned, riajuus are terrifying!
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_004: Eh? Why send messages when we're face to face? Uh, cuz, you know, it's easier that way…
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_005: Back in Higashi, I saw Koga election vans on the street a bunch. Their representative is kinda hot... Um, but I don't understand much about that whole side of things, so usually I just voted whatever.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_006: My family says that we all came out of the sea onto dry land forever ago, and that's how we settled down. Would I wanna go back into the sea? Mmnn... honestly, I don't really care.  As long as they don't get Oripathy, life's pretty good in Higashi.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_007: There's some trouble lately. I hear things between us and the Kougon guys up north are getting heated again. This sucks... I wonder if their latest games will make it through…
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_008: Um… Doctor, do you think my hobbies are weird or anything? When I was young, the other kids would make fun of me, calling me gross and gloomy. Hmph. Who cares what they said, I certainly don't.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_009: Doctoooor! I'll lend you this game, this manga, and this CD! They're masterpieces that I handpicked, so once you go through them, we'll be otaku buddies for life! We will have so much to talk about. If you're into other genres, just say the word. Better yet, just come over and pick something you like.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_010: Not now, pal, I'm busy right here! Just one more hit... one more hit and he's down! Perfect! Got the rare drop!
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_011: I'm Kirara. Nice to meet you... Uh… um… If you don't need anything else, can I leave?
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_012: Wow, that's cool… Uhhhh, the ultimate's name's kinda cringe though.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_013: A promotion? As in a job promotion? Ugh, a middle management job is gonna kill me.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_014: I just want to thank everyone for, uh, sticking by me all this time. I realize that, uh some things are better… said in person than by text... So, um, I guess... Tha-that's all I want to say! Thank you!
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_017: If you want a support, maybe I can help out… I guess.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_018: ...Huh? Me? Captain? Really? Are you serious?
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_020: Ah. Look over there. Enemy came right out of the tall grass.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_024: Woah, the mangas do not lie.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_028: Wait… That move was pretty awesome, huh?
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_029: Uso! I've seen no-damage runs, but this is on a whole new level!
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_031: Aaarrnngh, missed, darn. No save scumming in real life. I guess…
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_033: If it's an option, I'd like to just stay in my room forever…
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_034: Whah! Aaaahh, wrong button... this round is lost.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_036: Oh, hey, Doctor. What? Got an action game you want me to take over?
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_038: First off, please do not invite me to anything today without a good reason. Nothing's wrong, it's just…urgh, you wouldn't get it—the terror of having to say Happy New Year to strangers at a party. Besides, I've decided to just dorm it up and play games all day. You're always welcome by the way, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_042: Good stuff in the login rewards today.
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_043: Happy Birthday, got you a dedicated pager. Just press this button and mine will light up. It also works vice-versa. Hehe. This way, you can reach me whenever you want a game buddy! Um, friends do this with each other, right? This is, like, a normal friend thing?
dialogue_tracker.char_478_kirara_CN_044: As an Infected, I get to live a stable life, and I can still read manga and play games outside of work… I never thought a fantasy like this could come true. Maybe there are more dreams that I can make real… Say, Doctor, let's take on the world, together.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_001: File organization is one of my fortes! Uhh... What are these? Data charts and theory analyses...? Seems very complicated, unlike the romance novels I read. Doctor, have you read any Victorian literature? Just between the two of us, I share my name with the protagonist from my favorite work.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_002: I used to believe the Infected would understand if I smiled at them, but I was wrong... Before I smile, I should put myself in their shoes to learn their pain, and that goes for all those who are oppressed.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_003: Now that I've talked to Amiya and the Doctor, I can understand why she, an elite operator... and the rest of Rhodes Island made that choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_004: It's a little embarrassing to say... but I really admire Bagpipe. It doesn't matter what she has been through, she takes pride in the fact she was once a Victorian soldier. Oh, please don't get the wrong idea. I still love Victoria, and it is this love that drove me to leave my homeland.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_005: It wasn't easy to lose the Dublinns. I talked to the girl called Reed afterwards, but it doesn't seem she remembers me. I suppose... that's a good thing for her. Should we get the chance, I would love to have a chat with her about poetry and novels. Oh, and it would be lovely if we became friends.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_006: I have every step of Trooping the Colour memorized by heart, but I still have a long way to go to truly carry the banner's weight and find the way forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_007: It takes a little time to care for my hair. I know merely keeping up appearances isn't enough, but I see this as part of living diligently. Doctor, your hair's kind of messy. Would you like me to fix it for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_008: If the day comes that you must face those countless fearsome enemies, I will stand by your side.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_009: Doctor... if we had met before that incident, I'm sure I would've found myself relying on your help. But I can't well wait forever for someone to tell me what righteousness is. At the very least, on this journey we walk together, I wish to be an ally you can count on.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_010: Doctor, when I see you here like this, it reminds me of the days I spent lazing around in the Rhodes Island offices... the sunshine, the card games, and my friends... It really brings back memories.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_011: You must be Rhodes Island's commander? Operator Saileach, reporting in!
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_012: Oh, could you stop for a moment, please? I would like to take notes.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_013: I was... disappointed in them. And so I threw away all the ribbons and medals I'd ever earned. But Rhodes Island is different. Thank you, Doctor. I accept this award.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_014: Even now, the blinding light that fended off the darkness still shines in my dreams, though I am still far, far away from her.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_017: May my banner protect all those who are innocent before my eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_018: My friends, as long as we stand together, there will be no evil we can't overcome!
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_020: If battle is unavoidable, I will not allow my weaknesses to get in my way.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_023: It's my duty to stand here.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_025: Can't you hear the children's cries?
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_026: Can't you feel the cities crumbling away?
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_027: You've never ever noticed the hideous grins of conspirators.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_028: Could you ever imagine… friends turning against each other, and homeland fading into nothing but memories?
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_029: I simply want to defend the people's right to live, and it doesn't matter if they are Victorians or Infected.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_030: You showed me that even weeds struggling to grow in the ruins can stand tall. Thank you.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_031: I can only hope they will come to understand their injustice.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_032: Doctor, this time, I'll stay. Hurry and take the others to safety.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_033: Phew... I reckon it won't be easy to slack off once I become an actual staff member here?
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_036: Are you tired? I've baked some scones. Please, sit down, have some tea, and tell me what's on your mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_038: Here's some trifle, pudding, and carrot cake... Oh, is it too much? Sorry, I've been a little nervous for the whole morning. Before I knew it, I'd already made this much... Hehe, let's just say I made you all these desserts to thank you for everything you've done. I hope you can spend the year surrounded by sweetness.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_042: Hey, Doctor, you look cheerful as always!
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_043: This Victorian poetry anthology is one I always used to read, back in County Hillock. Now, I'm giving it to you. Oh, there's one passage I really love—'Old Sunlight hugs tight all the town in her bosom. Old Moonlight bends down with a kiss to the wild.' The feeling you give me is, really, just as warm as that. Heheh, have a happy birthday, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_479_sleach_CN_044: I may have left the military, but my honor and calling are things I won't lay aside. In future, I'll return to where my duty lies. Please, don't worry. The memories we've made, the ideals we've borne together at Rhodes Island, they will always be carved upon this ensign, to be forever by my side.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_001: Hello, Doctor. Have you figured out the style you wanna go with today? Huh...? You didn't call me here for that? I really, really hope you can give it at least a little more thought. Please?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_002: Watch out! I've got tons of stuff in my pocket here. If this negative ion hair softener bumps into the horn growth stimulant and spills... Well... I could end up getting hanged on the deck! It's no joke!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_003: You've probably heard how assassins who know their stuff in anatomy work more efficiently, no? Of course, my goal's not to take anyone's hope to survive away. Instead, I want to turn that hope into something more vivid and brilliant! Styling is an art, but it's also a science!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_004: She looks familiar... Is that the girl who shows up in all those kung fu movies? Whoa, don't ever tell her I'm here! Nah, it's not her that I'm afraid of, but I really don't wanna run into her stylist, Lauder! The last thing I need is anybody calling me 'Bobbi'...
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_005: I'm a researcher, not a modeler, and I definitely don't want to be the kind of girl who works her mindless brush on monotonous faces under spot light day in and day out! Coming on the ship's been kind of like a vacation to me, I guess? If I had to stare at those lifeless faces all day, my brain would get completely fried sooner or later. I'm not doing that no matter how much I get paid.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_006: If I got no money, I can't buy any new tools or materials. That's why even I got to work sometimes. Hm... I think the girl who came to me last time just got an academy award? She'd be fine to spot me, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_007: Doctor, I asked Dr. Warfarin for some info about your body... and modified my brush texture based around that. I promise you it won't trigger any allergies this time!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_008: If you want to touch my hair, go right ahead. It's pretty messy already anyway. Is that weird? When you do styling work for as many people as I do, you definitely won't find yourself in the mood to work on yourself even if you have the time.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_009: Interesting faces are like stories in their own right. Dr. {@nickname}, you are like... a kinda damaged videotape, waiting for someone to dust you off. If the day ever comes that you get repaired, what kind of story will you reveal?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_010: Did you really fall asleep? In that case, I guess I can get to work? Your bone structure, your skin... Whoa, this is even more spectacular than I thought!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_011: Hello, I'm Roberta! We meet again! Once I sign here, I'll be your personal stylist, right? Huh... 'You'll be an operator?' Doesn't matter as long as I get to stay!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_012: Beat up all the annoying guys, right? No more difficult than swinging ten brushes around while taking a sip of coffee. I'm from Siracusa, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_013: I've got an entire room full of medals like this one back in my studio in Wrankwood... Hey, Doctor, can't you give me something a little more interesting for my reward?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_014: Since you're giving me another promotion, I want a bigger studio. You'll approve it, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_017: Should I go with eyeshadow palette #3001... or perhaps #3002?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_018: Doesn't look like we have a color base that works for all of us...
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_019: Let's go, everyone! I'll do the re-touch in case your makeup slides off.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_020: I know exactly which part of the face is the most fragile!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_021: You gotta put on the most suitable style even when you're giving out commands in the frontlines.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_022: These real battlefields give me so much more inspiration than any film set I've been to.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_023: Bring your face closer this way, okay? Thanks. I'll pay attention to how much force I use.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_024: Even the biggest stars out there gotta book me in advance, you know? You should count yourselves lucky!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_026: Infused Originium Slug acid styling spray!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_027: Facial bone full structured self-image shading highlighter!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_028: Wet/Dry ambient color adapted lipstick and blusher!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_029: Whoa... Not even I can replicate that look on your face right now.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_030: What a perfect operation. Makes me want to add a few more touches to bring out that joy on your face.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_031: There's nothing as boring as watching the cowards run. They always stiffen up like Rock Spiders that've spent a bit too much time in antiseptics.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_032: Doctor, need me to give your face a little blush? If you go back like this, the others might worry when they look at you.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_033: Can I do my experiments here? Relax, I won't blow the walls out. At most... I guess the doors and windows might bend a little?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_034: Didn't I say I'm not seeing anyone...? Oh, it's you.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_036: Doctor, can I come over to your room this evening? Your face could really use a massage.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_038: New Year, new scenery! Doctor, this stack of paper... Oh, no, actually, all these papers are brand new looks I've been thinking up just for you... Hey! Why are you running away, Doctor?!
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_042: Hey, Doctor, want to try this new look I designed just for you?
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_043: Tons of celebrities in Wrankwood would ask me to do their makeup for their birthday parties. Cover every trace of time on their faces, no matter the cost. But is that really beauty? Doctor, this mirror's my gift to you. I hope you'll find a true and beautiful you staring back.
dialogue_tracker.char_484_robrta_CN_044: I've noticed a lot of operators and patients covering up their Originium crystals. That's not gonna cut it! I've got a plan: I'm going to design a whole set of patterns for decorating your crystals. That's the most meaningful thing I can do for Rhodes Island as a makeup artist!
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_001: You would have me as your assistant? Well, if the said duty is akin to my last, where I served within the Hall of the Twelve Heroes as its priest, I shall be fine, I assume.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_002: Ugh... Uh… Ehem… I must not drink so much... next time… Ah, Dr.{@nickname}. Why do you stagger and sway, so much in your movement today?
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_003: The city is a grand sight during the festivals. Theatrical performances, sparkling wine, sports competitions... Truth be told, I once joined Formula Chariot racing, competing with my equally unskilled fellows. That chariot was not cheap. I wonder if its fate was inheritance, or if it was simply abandoned after I left?
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_004: To think there were so many like-minded souls at Rhodes Island. Ah, poetry, war, freedom! From within the torrent of history, you summon the strength of many to rebel against fate, and undo its blight upon the lands. How exhilarating! These tragic yet extraordinary stories… They should be immortalized, and passed down forevermore.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_005: After contracting Oripathy, I moved to a small village in the Minoan borderlands. There was a small ongoing war against the Sargon incursions... which ended with the victory of the Minoans. However, I would prefer this story to gradually spread as a tale, rather than live in its so-called reality.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_006: Simply light the flames of resistance, and they shall burn hot and fierce. For those whose wishes for liberation are so dear, the story of the 'Goddess of War' shall be their flag, a banner under which they will unite in the forthcoming battles. For me, I have naught but this infected body of mine, and this unchanging faith.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_007: I see... Vulcan, once the champion of weapon forging, is here at Rhodes Island. That is great news indeed! This weapon in my hand has confounded many a smith. But none could restore it to its rightful condition. Here, look upon this signature, that of the very same Vulcan... Hm? I ought to keep it a secret?
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_008: The stories of Minoan heroes… They include both comedy and tragedy alike. However, the noblest aspect of the Twelve Heroes is that——Without exception, each and every one of them returned to a simple, ordinary life.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_009: To suffer oppression for such a length of time, that their souls have grown numb to it… My heart goes out to those poor souls. Still, a heart without hope cannot burn with the fires of rage. I would never wish for anyone to face cruelty, but if a man is to be a warrior, then he needs a bit of faith, a little spark, and most importantly— a 'start.'
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_010: I am used to thinking while standing upright. From time to time, I am suddenly poked, simply to check if I have fallen asleep on my feet.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_011: I am the Minoan priestess, Pallas. I shall be convalescing at Rhodes Island for a time... Be that as it may, I hope to enjoy my share of alcohol and theatre, and I yearn even more for battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_012: Recording the valiant warriors in battle, and with such realism. What a great convenience it is.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_013: Abandoning glory, the hero decided to return to normal life, but could not, due to Oripathy infection? No… It should not be so.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_014: I, Pallas of Minos, am a woman of faith, a follower of the will of the heroes. My weapon shall remain ever sharp and free of rust, such that it may strike at the forces of injustice and cruelty. My humility shall not be forgotten, an eternal expression of my duty to salvation and redemption.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_017: O heroic heralds of victory, I welcome your blessings.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_018: O great warriors, I fight by your side, shoulder to shoulder.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_019: The next time you turn your head, you will find us returning, with victory in hand.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_020: Fear not, for we shall claim victory over these reckless foes.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_023: There is no room for regret.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_024: There is no need to retreat.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_025: O heroes, stand together with us, for the paramount power of faith!
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_026: Tremble, in the face of ture bravey.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_027: Weep, for that wavering faith of yours.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_029: Have we done it...? I feel only the greatest honor and joy.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_030: Turn about, brave champions. We have achieved a perfect victory, and it is now time to return and enjoy the fruits of our labors.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_031: Listen well, the lamentations have ceased. This calm heralds the arrival of peace and joy.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_032: Even though the wars of humanity have no end in sight, we have protected our dignity, for the moment. Leave. Keep your heads held high.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_033: My horns might pose a threat to furniture. I shall be vigilant.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_034: What would you do, should you possess wisdom and strength?
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_036: There is a Minoan-themed multimedia room event. Shall we go and see what thrills await?
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_038: A happy new year to you, Dr.{@nickname}. I have dined upon many delicacies of the East today, and experienced a uniquely different kind of celebration. I have even obtained many fun prizes, such as this... Oh? This 'firecracker', it is not to be used indoors?
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_043: Congratulations on the day of your birth, Dr.{@nickname}. This wreath, a symbol of honor and victory, is a gift for you. On your road ahead, may you always journey alongside wisdom and courage. The glory befitting a hero, it's sure to be awaiting you at the end of the thorny path.
dialogue_tracker.char_485_pallas_CN_044: A boisterous celebration is always exciting no matter the venue. Sing! Rejoice! Let us engrave this moment's animated air into our mirth, and we ought to open our vision for tomorrow with some fine wine— What? I should limit my drinking, even on such a day as this...?
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_001: Good work, Doctor. Why don't you take a break? Oh, don't worry, I'm already done with the report… Haha, there's no need for a compliment. It's really not a big deal, I've simply become experienced with these things.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_002: Wait, wait, Doctor, s-stop tugging, I'll take them out myself! There, all the cards I hid up my sleeves. Haha, I figured you'd see right through me. If we get a chance to go to Dossoles, I'll show you some even more interesting things.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_003: Every time I talk to Miss Ch'en, as well as that Miss Lin, I get all nervous. Man, I really don't want to get beaten up again… What, you can't tell? Well, Doctor, here, check out my palms. They're all sweaty!
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_004: Yo, Doctor, fancy seeing you here. Looking for someone? Oh, Rafaela? I'm afraid I don't know where she is either. Guess you can tell, without the old man here, we have very little to say to each other.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_005: My old man threw me into the army reserves when I was just a kid. We were all kids, really. Some of us had burning ambitions, but I'd say most of us didn't even know what we wanted. Life was tough, and we were just looking for a way out, nothing more.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_006: Dossoles should be in good hands with Miss Candela. As for the old man, he's better off behind bars for now. He needs to calm down and reflect on his actions. You see, Doctor, when I agreed to help him one last time,  it was my way of trying to find answers,  and sort out my thoughts. Now... I've found my answers.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_007: When we first arrived in Dossoles, Rafaela and I were still very young. We quickly adapted to life there, but the old man still insisted on his integrity and his old ideology... Can't do anything about it, but I figure I should at least try to help.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_008: Doctor, here's the mission report from last time. I've already handled the follow-ups. Ah, don't worry, there won't be any problems. It'd be a real bummer if something unexpected happened and ruined our carefully laid plans. I'm not about to allow that.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_009: So how about it, Doctor? Did you draw the card you wanted? Aw, better luck next time! Though I should say, in a game of chance, there's nothing less reliable than luck. But rest assured, if you're ever in need of it, I'll deliver luck right into your hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_010: Doctor, I'll put all the materials I've organized over here. Hm? Asleep… Look at all the important documents you left lying here... You must trust me a whole lot…
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_011: Hello there, are you the Doctor? Great, you're just as recognizable as Miss Ch'en said you'd be. Oh, right, I should pick out a code name, then? Hmm... Let's go with Tequila! Sounds pretty nice, eh?
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_012: I'm supposed to try this move myself? That… seems painful.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_013: A promotion? Already? Whoa… thanks a million. In any case, without further ado, let's talk about future changes to my work…
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_014: When Miss Ch'en brought me in, I never thought I'd see a day like this. So, does that mean I'm one of your most capable subordinates? Haha, it's not a joke, whether you need me to be a tour guide or something else, you can rest easy knowing you're in good hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_017: OK, Got it. Leave it to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_018: I'm in charge of the squad? Haha, I appreciate the trust…
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_019: Follow my lead. Be careful, and don't fall behind.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_020: Come, let us show our guests some hospitality.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_023: Sorry, this path is closed for business.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_024: Pardon me, I'd like you all to stop right there.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_025: Don't get worked up, let's talk first.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_026: Violence isn't really my thing, but well…
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_029: You even managed to anticipate their ambush, Doctor! I guess there's no shame in them losing like that. I still have much to learn.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_030: Everything's taken care of, Doctor... How did I take care of it? Doctor, do you really need to hear that?
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_031: Phew, that was a close one. Are you alright, Doctor? Yeah… A few of 'em got away. Let me see…
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_032: Let's retreat for now! We'll live to fight another day!
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_033: Ah, so this is the dorm... Mind if I give it a makeover, and buy some little decorations for it?
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_034: Tsk... What the… Oh, it's you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_036: It was raining out there just now, and my hair got a little wet... Sorry, Doctor, could you pass me that towel?
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_038: Happy new year, Doctor! My new cards are here, so, how about a game? Entertainment at Rhodes Island is nothing compared to Dossoles, sure, but as long as you've got me, we'll manage. I know a thing or two about creating a festive atmosphere.
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_042: How are you feeling today? Want to head out for a bit?
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_043: Here, Doctor, a birthday present for you. Guess what's in the box… Hey, no, don't shake it so hard! It's expensive, and we'll have nothing to drink if you break it!
dialogue_tracker.char_486_takila_CN_044: For those who seek change but set off on the wrong foot, no matter how flashy their appearance, they will always lack substance. That's why I appreciate Rhodes Island and its work. Salud, Doctor, to us both finding the right path forward.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_001: No problem, I'll handle it. Filling forms and organizing data are complicated and dull procedures to be sure. But it's necessary work, if we want local governments to help out in assisting the Infected. I'm sure you've nurtured a patience for it, as I have.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_002: No, no, I didn't put these healthy living advisories up. Our organization aims to help people live better lives, but I don't believe that gives us the right to dictate what a better life is. Besides, I personally prefer energy bars to regular meals... Oh, heh, I'll consider your advice.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_003: Operators have been coming to me for talks? True enough. Even HR Operators are asking me about it. The only thing I can tell you is that I'm not here to poach people for Pure Heart Medical. You know very well I must keep all work engagements confidential, whether they've killed a relative, or simply stolen a cookie.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_004: Doctor, could you help me review this script for a business conference? There's a part about distributing Oripathy medicine on the frontier. I'm not used to such loud public speeches. Quiet talks are more my thing... But I'm so good at pushing for a dangerous mission? Th-That's a very different situation!
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_005: The discussion went smoothly, so I'm in no position to feel down, but... I got yet another 'If the Infected were as well-mannered as you, we would have donated much more'. Tolerance or humility, people can only afford it when their backs aren't up against the wall.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_006: I once escorted some Infected out of that city, with a few Sarkaz in tow. It was a long journey. They had no staves, and their condition only worsened when casting Arts to protect themselves, while I use my own Arts to keep them safe, at no cost to myself... ah, the irony of it all.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_007: Yes, the Infected are usually isolated from the masses, and physical contact can be an act of kindness. Though, hugs inherently make people happy. You don't have to be infected or have a particular reason to enjoy one. Would you like a hug, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_008: Do we have to talk about Londinium...? I once attended an aristocratic ball where everyone covered their crystals as they danced; I helped workers move their lumber as I heard them hoping to build a home before they took their last breaths. They were all smiling, so I want to smile when I tell their stories.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_009: Have a seat, Doctor. No, you aren't interrupting anything. The view isn't that special either. Just another sunrise in the barrens amidst dusky skies. I tell myself the sun rises the same every morning... just as it did that one time I didn't look back.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_010: Ssh—Hello there, the Doctor's on break at the moment... No, no, the Doctor is being very responsible. No one can work 24/7—everyone has to recharge every once in a while, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_011: Hello, I'm here at Rhodes Island for an exchange study, representing the Maylander Foundation's Pure Heart Medical. Your Operators saw me before in Victoria...? I'd like to avoid discussing my experiences there for the time being, if I could.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_012: Sorry, could I just take a short break? It's honestly a bit too loud for me...
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_013: Thank you, Doctor. I'm glad Rhodes Island values me, but I'm afraid my suggestions won't be any better than what you're already doing.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_014: I spent one afternoon in middle school reading a Maylander report on how the Infected live, and decided I had to do something for them. As my mind wanders back to that young boy's arrogant self-righteousness, I'm filled with shame. But I did the right thing. I have no regrets.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_017: All this noise... I've gotten used to it.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_018: Just follow me, everyone. Our plan is set and we have plenty of supplies, so we'll get through this.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_019: If you get too cold, come over near me.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_020: We should try talking with the other side, if it's not too late.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_023: Phew… My ears might need a second to get used to this environment.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_026: Please don't force your way through.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_027: I won't surrender, so I suggest you take a detour.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_028: If only you had more choices in life…
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_029: It's no wonder so many see you as hope itself... ah, sorry. Does that put a lot of pressure on you?
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_030: Phew— you're really incredible! How about taking a break to celebrate?
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_031: Doctor, just say the word and I'll go have a talk with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_032: ...It's alright, we have a contingency plan and plenty of medical supplies. No need to worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_033: It's going to be hard, convincing other companies to follow this standard of treatment for Infected employees…
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_034: If you want to scare me, you should try yelling 'boo!' or something next time.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_036: Would you like to talk? I'll bring the beanbag chairs over... oh, you don't have to be so formal. I'm happy to hear whatever you have to say.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_038: ...Did you call me? Ah, sorry. I had my earplugs in. They only asked me to untangle these streamers, so at least it wouldn't bother anyone if I didn't hear you. Oh, Please don't get me wrong, I do love New Year's. When people make their resolutions, it means they still have hope in their hearts.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_042: Please let me know if you need anything. Oh yes, you can also ask me to join you on your coffee break.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_043: You're an important partner of Pure Heart Medical, so of course we got you a birthday gift. Please, open it. Haha, I'm sorry. I just wanted to see the shocked look on your face when you opened it. This body pillow is a personal gift from me, I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
dialogue_tracker.char_487_bobb_CN_044: It's crucial we consolidate our achievements so far, but it's inevitable that we'll recall our many regrets and sorrows as well... We should find another day for it, but could I talk to you about a few things I've had on my mind? Yes, I hope you can be the one to hear me out.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_001: The wind blew the documents all over the place… This can't be because of my luck, can it…?
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_002: When I was a kid, Grandpa told me stories of how they built Siesta, but before he could see it to completion, he moved to Columbia with my parents. I went back to Siesta hoping to see what it had become in his place, only to find that it's all volcanic ash now.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_003: This is my grandpa's hammer. It's been with me all the way, from when I was a civil engineering student to my demolition work, and finally to what I always wanted to be——a builder. If Rhodes Island ever needs any demolition work done, just say the word! Uh, by that, I mean construction work! Anyway, for some reason, I find hammers more wieldy...
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_004: Everybody knows making bets with Rope is a good way to lose your stuff. And I know Glaucus's cocktails are a little different from the ones everyone else gets. And anything Savage's hammer touches is bound to blow up—Oh, um! I know all that, but not because I've got rotten luck!
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_005: New Siesta has some unfinished city plates where you can see the volcano. Old workers like to gather there and chat about what the old Siesta looked like. I've heard most of their stories, but I still stay and listen, the same way I listened to Grandpa's stories... I still wonder what it was really like...
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_006: Back in school, my classmates always told me that Siesta is a tourist destination. It doesn't have its own architectural style. People just build whatever attracts the tourists. Look at Siesta today, though. We are her style.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_007: Want some walnut jam? Freshly made. Uh, I didn't mean to make it. It just, you know, happened. What's that on my hammer, you ask? Oh, um... it's walnut husks... Okay, okay, I admit it. Vulcan said it's a good way to train my strength control, but I didn't get a single one right. So, do you want the walnut jam or not?
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_008: Look, the last time I came to the landship, the incomplete city plate was still empty, but now there are rows of houses there, and the lights of the high-tech district reach even the beaches nearby. I'm building our new homeland bit by bit, alongside many others. It's, how do you say, an interesting feeling, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_009: After I graduated, I could only find demolition work in Columbia, and I even caught Oripathy. I wanted to go back to Siesta to make a living, only to find a pile of volcanic ash waiting for me. It took a lot of work to find the new Siesta, so I was real happy that day. I even yelled out loud: Hey hey hey—That's it for my rotten luck! Everything's going to work out just fine from here on out!
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_010: I've got classmates still with the demolition teams, another who's a contractor, and yet another who's a Pioneer... I'm the only one who, after that roundabout path, came back to Siesta to work on what I actually studied... I guess it worked out pretty well for me?
