dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_011: You're the Doctor that Ceylon talked about, right? I'm Poncirus. Thanks for agreeing to provide medical assistance to us workers. My codename? It's a kind of fruit that's very close to my hair in color. The workers like to squeeze its juices into wine.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_012: Finding the structural support core in an instant and destroying it right away...  Alright, with a little practice, I'm sure I can do this, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_013: A promotional medal... I'll take it. Thanks for your acknowledgment, Doctor. I'll work hard to make sure I'm worth it.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_014: Senior Engineering Operator? Does that mean my pay goes up, too? That's great! I can send more money back home to my parents now, and I gotta write a letter to Grandpa, too. Yeah, everything's working out just fine!
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_018: What did those stubborn professors do back in college again... Hold a seminar first? Pff... Everyone would hate me so much...
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_019: Bring your site plans, everyone. Watch out for accident-prone areas.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_020: Arrived at the most optimal combat location. Ready to move.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_022: I'll give you the best plan possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_023: If you need me to, I'll wreck this place without hesitation.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_028: The structure's stable and sound. Nothing to worry about!
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_029: Like a building that'll never be destroyed.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_030: Looks like luck's on my side instead of theirs this time!
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_031: It's okay, Doctor. A city covered in volcanic ash is always pale, but beautiful flowers will eventually sprout on it.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_032: The road's been demolished. Enemy pursuit vehicles intercepted.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_033: What a sophisticated design... I gotta find time to really look at it.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_036: Ah! Doctor, remember to stay clear of my hammer the next time you talk to me. It's dangerous!
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. You'll be there at the ceremony tonight, right? I gave the operators in charge of the hall's design a few suggestions and divided it into a few zones based on the operators' homeland... Right, on a special day like this, a sense of belonging is important.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_042: Why don't we head outside together for some fresh air, Doctor? Staying in one place can really slow your thinking.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. This is a 'mini hammer' that I designed myself. It works on the same principles as my weapon, and you can wield it with just one hand. I'll be heading back to Siesta tomorrow. While I'm gone, you can use it to crack nuts.
dialogue_tracker.char_488_buildr_CN_044: I just tidied up our design documents from the past year. I didn't expect there to be so many, and it really gives me a rare sense of fulfillment. Although there isn't much I myself can do for Siesta, I know that each and every stroke I draw represents the journey I've traveled.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_001: Make the most of everything, hm? As you've given approval, I'll do my very best to provide you all additional joint effort and technological support necessary, within our agreement's scope, of course. Fortunately, assistant work was my exact vocation.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_002: Rhodes Island's ambience is more assuaging than I'd imagined, at least personally speaking. After all, you typically feel medical firms would be nothing but dour to almost insipid researchers. Not to even start on your armed force to keep the Oripathy-related technologies and personnel safe.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_003: In my time at Raythean, I took part in several project teams, but they mostly bored me. Obviously, one can't complain about their technological prowess, but if all it is is fulfilling orders to quota, without attempting to inject a little inspiration, doesn't work become just too dull?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_004: You seem somewhat mindful of my manner of speech. Hmm, if possible, I'd like if you could bear with it. My last project team, whether superiors or juniors, all took up overly polite address that only sent communication efficiency to rock bottom. It posed a headache to me too.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_005: True, work calls for strict treatment, and serious accomplishment. But after work is over, you also need to understand keeping a balance and relaxing, which is what lets you adjust your own state and achieve glowing results next time in your work. Do you believe so, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_006: Have you heard the observation that though many find satisfaction in neat, orderly things, there's a set that feels apprehension in a space holding the same qualities? Yes, every time a rest day passes and I return to a work station that's been tidied up, I feel suffering.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_007: A pileup of overdue reports and files just won't do. The paper shredder? No, Doctor, don't tell me you wouldn't want to try this environmentally-friendly corrosive, able to turn a ream of paper to pulp with a dropper's worth. There's no use? That's true. How about I launch a project to develop a papermaking machine utilizing this pulp?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_008: The impression you give may not seem quite like my project manager at Raythean, but there's some similarities. However, saying this with a wide open heart, you as a superior outstrip that unpredictable, outlandish black box of a crackpot project-intending plan-addled trickster genius by miles.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_009: Both Raythean R&D projects and working together with you have been delightful experiences. I'm finding myself torn between choosing, and I don't mean it as a pleasantry. Perhaps, you'd mock my greed? But people like us might just all be greedy. What's your view?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_010: Only when you have finished everything at hand can you rest carefree and firm-willed. At this rate, I'm worried you'll... heh, whatever. With this little left, I can figure it out for you without any worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_011: Hello there, Dr. {@nickname}. Raythean Industries liaison, Corroserum. I'm sure you saw the relevant contracts and forms, despite your busy schedule. Now then, do share any upcoming workflow arrangements.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_012: Rhodes Island Pharmaceuticals Inc.'s battle records are more interesting than I expected.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_013: You've raised your evaluation of me? Thank you, this'll be good grounds to include when I apply for another tour here.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_014: True, it's worth taking joy in a project's smooth progress, but the evaluation you've given me, in my opinion, seems to have already outclassed my resume. That is to say, do you have further expectations of me, even greater than this?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_017: Ah, another assignment perfect for testing weapons. Of course, I'm very pleased to be working with you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_018: This is an anti-corrosive coating spray, with no toxic side-effect on the human body at all. Given you were all willing to sign the disclaimer and participate in this test, I sincerely hope none of you become collateral damage due to irregular operation in this weapon's test.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_019: The holiday's always over in the blink of an eye. Well, then, let's get to work.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_020: I'll be troubling you to make these test targets fall in line a little with our work, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_021: Do you have any additional directives?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_022: You can order me for anything you'd like.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_024: The stressful test phase is now beginning.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_025: Can I make sure none of you will surrender just yet?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_026: I have an extra project here that needs all your cooperation for testing.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_027: I'd like to ensure you all persevere until I can gather enough data.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_028: Of course. This is part of work, too.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_029: Doctor, this has thrown a slight wrench in things. After all, you've obtained combat results beyond expectations, and made it marginally more difficult for my assessment of weapon performance limits to be universal and objective. I'll have to increase the quantity of test samples to ensure accuracy... was that in your plans too?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_030: A pleasing result. It seems once we return and I finish collating this data, I'll have some spare time for free movement. Well, then, do you have any free time coming up, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_031: Not too ideal in terms of results. Deployment tactics still have room for optimization. Don't you think so, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_032: Let's not feel down, Doctor, you will find a solution to break this deadlock. After all, you'd like the reports we'll be writing to be worth more than scrap paper, wouldn't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_033: Is there anything I'd be able to help with?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_034: I wouldn't trouble you with a matter this small.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor. I'm very glad I don't have to confront those nightmare piles of annual reports here at Rhodes Island. It seems quite a few Operators have requested advance leave to visit family at home? Well, then, do you have any upcoming plans for this provisionally idle time?
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_042: It's nice to see you, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_043: I apologize, Doctor, I'm currently working. If you wanted to chat, you'll have to wait until I'm on break. Oh, yes, I left your birthday present on your desk early this morning—if that's what you wanted to talk about, I'd be very happy to sit down with you at dinner this evening.
dialogue_tracker.char_489_serum_CN_044: I originally came to Rhodes Island to test weaponry and nothing more, but your command never ceases to demonstrate the importance and value of people. I've certainly learned very much from it... So, the idea of formally joining Rhodes Island may be a decent one. Doctor, can we have an honest chat about your terms of employment for any job-hoppers?
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_001: Can I have this printer that's written off? And my gosh, how could you dump that whole pile of paper in the shredder? You can still write on the back!
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_002: Whoa whoa, Stay back. I just finished work, so I'm all sweaty. You need something? If it's not urgent, just go back to your office. Let me wash up and get a change of clothes, then I'll come talk to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_003: Hahaha, Check me out! I made this whole outfit by myself. Yeah, it looks like crap, but it's sturdy! And you see this sickle?  I tore a door off a huge car to make it. I've used it for years, and it's good as new.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_004: See that electric cooker of mine? I made it out of an old heater. And my space heater there, I made it out of an old TV. And As for the TV here, I put that together from the parts of a broken bread maker. Where did I get this bread maker? Aha, I modded an electric cooker I scavenged.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_005: The Pioneer guys are different from us. They get to wander around. Not us. Once you come to the disposal plant, you're staying forever.  Think you can run? Not happening, my friend. Look at your supplies, how far could you go? There's nothing but wasteland for miles. Your only shot at survival is staying inside.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_006: You have no idea how heartless those snobs are. They dump just about anyone in the disposal plant. Kids barely old enough to work, old folks in bad health. I can't stand it, but there's not much I can do other than making sure they get fed alongside me.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_007: Doctor, remember that printer I took off your hands? Here, I fixed it. Oh, but keep an eye on the thermometer up top when you use it. If it goes over the threshold, it could explode.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_008: Yeah, Doctor, I've got a temper, and I can't just sit by and watch bad things happen. In the end, I made the wrong enemies, and got thrown in the disposal plant. A whole decade came and went in the blink of an eye, like a nightmare... But now the dream's gone, and I'm awake! I don't regret it one bit. I'll keep my temper and make no compromises.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_009: Ever since we were kids, if folks like us wanted to eat, we had to count on the scraps the snobs let slip from on high. Sadly, that's not enough to fill your stomach. So some folks end up stealing, naturally. That's not something anyone should do, I know. But if there was another way, why would you need to steal?
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_010: Whatever it is, it can wait until tomorrow! There's unlimited steak at the canteen today, I'd better get over there right away!
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_011: Doctor, Rhodes Island has done so much for me. What can I say except thank you? If you need anything, just say the word. I'll do whatever it takes to make it happen!
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_012: Doctor, I can read a little bit, but the jargon in this video is pretty dense. I can barely make any sense of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_013: What? You're giving me a promotion? Me? For real? Hold up, what was I doing before this?
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_014: Thanks, Doctor... If only my old man had lived long enough to see this day. His kid... always up to no good... has finally made a name for himself.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_017: Agh... It's been a while since I beat anyone up. Hope I didn't get too rusty.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_018: Yeah, I can be the captain and chaperone these kids. I'll make sure all of them come back alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_019: Stop right there, you little cubs! Don't just rush in ahead!
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_020: You come at me like that, you can't blame me for what happens next.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_023: Huh? I thought you wanted me here to fix a lock!
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_024: Whose car is this? I... How should I know?
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_026: What, you think you're gonna grind me down with numbers?
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_027: There's more of you? Ugh, what a day.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_028: Arghhhh screw it! Bring it on, all of you!
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_029: Ugh, I just hope these punks learned their lesson.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_030: No enemies in sight. But I'm sure they left behind some pretty good stuff.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_031: No, no, don't chase them. Just let them be. They got beaten so bad, they won't be causing trouble for a long while.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_032: Relax, nobody wins every fight. Go home, wash your face. Life goes on.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_033: Man, this bed is too soft. I just can't fall asleep. Could you give me something firmer? That's how I like it.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_034: Hm? Need some help? I'm your man.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_036: Here, I grabbed you some tangerines from the canteen.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_038: When I first got to that stinking place, I didn't celebrate any holidays. That's for men who still got something to look forward to. But the kids kept pestering me, asking me to make them some fireworks. In the end, I burned the whole tent... Save it. Thinking back, I guess it was pretty funny, hahaha.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_042: No matter how busy you are, be sure to eat right, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_043: It's your birthday, huh...? *sigh* I didn't know, so I didn't get you anything. How about this? I'll treat you to a feast tomorrow. Whatever you want. But uh... try to not order anything too expensive.
dialogue_tracker.char_491_humus_CN_044: I sorted through tons of trash at the disposal center, for years. You can use most things after a little cleaning. If cleaning isn't enough, you can probably still fix it. If that doesn't do the trick, you can disassemble it and use its parts. That goes for people too, don't you think? No one out there's completely useless.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_001: Last time I was an assistant, I think I was still thirteen or fourteen, treating people with my mum. Of course, I can do much more than hand out herbals and sing well-wishing verses now. If you need my help, ask away! Don't be shy.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_002: I think I've seen a few new faces this time after returning to Rhodes Island. Dr. {@nickname}, how does it feel to have more and more people under you? Do you feel that brimming and bursting vitality? We always say back home, rage against death with new life.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_003: Rhodes Island Bridge-Climbing Competition? Dr. Kal'tsit shut that down midway, didn't she? Citing lack of safety ropes for all the contestants and so on. Well, I wasn't that likely to win it, and the look on Dr. Kal'tsit's face was a much greater sight to see anyway.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_004: You look put out with all these reports on your desk. Don't worry, if there's any danger, I'll know it by the scent. But! If you just don't want to work, I can't help you there.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_005: Of course it's much easier to gather intel when you're a lone operator. But every time I'm in the country, I pick a bag full of berries while I'm free, and I think to myself, maybe I want someone to share with after all. Otherwise, I've got no one to tell me how great I am at picking.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_006: You get the sense I served from how I work? You only got that impression from seeing my files. Service members come in all shapes and sizes, too. Some only like to read and research their comms tech, some spend all day dreaming about going on holidays in the city to see idol concerts...
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_007: Dr. {@nickname}, you might be covering your face, but I can tell you've perked up a lot more compared to when you came back from Chernobog. But if you spend the whole time under this low of a ceiling, your mind'll get dull. Head out onto the deck every now and then. Get some fresh air. It's good for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_008: When I looked after the ill back home, I ran across a couple Infected calling themselves 'Reunion'... and then I got into a fight with them. I can't stand it, seeing those children with firelight in their eyes lost in all the pointless violence, about to burn themselves through.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_009: Those who depart us receive the land's forgiveness, and rest in her embrace... but some people go too quickly, the roots of the forests of their homes unable to hold onto their hands. Was that not like me, being so serious? You really should've seen me when I worked back home.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_010: Not sure if the Doctor's a light sleeper... I'd better stand watch quietly.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_011: Nice to meet you, Doctor. Call me Quercus. It's the first time we've met, but the intel on your desk about northern Victoria is straight from me... What, even you're going to tell me my reports aren't standard?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_012: I wish I'd learned all this a little earlier.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_013: What's this promotion come out of nowhere for? My candied fruit must make a strong impression.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_014: In my hometown, you had to make a choice with Originium Arts. Whether to terrorize others, or to aid them... The result of my greed was that I couldn't commit properly to either. Even so, would you still have faith in me?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_017: As long as it's your decision, I'll have no objections.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_019: Shouldn't we consider marching routes other than on the ground?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_020: The more defined a battle's goal is, the clearer tactics become.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_021: Will the land shake with fury, or display her mercy?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_022: If you're still hesitating, I can give some advice.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_025: The land will forgive all in the end, but not now.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_026: The wind blows through; the leaves tell stories of those who sleep.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_027: Arbor, reach your hands to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_028: I remember your face as well, now.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_029: Wow, incredible! I've got the urge to snap a formal salute just to show my respect.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_030: That was a perfect operation! Once we're back, dinner will taste even better.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_031: They can't be running far. Do you plan to pursue?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_032: It's alright, let me organize the retreat. I leave our next counterattack to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_033: It always feels a little hard to catch my breath when I'm shut in here for long.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_034: Oh? Are you as much of a prank-lover as all those kids?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_036: You want to hear me sing? Do you know who our songs are sung for? Usually, it's for the gravely ill.
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! I've brought candied berries, canned home-style sandworms, and some rose-filled flower biscuits, all specialties from Victoria. Pick out what takes your fancy, Dr.{@nickname}? My homebrewed fruit wine's done fermenting too, so you'll want to taste as soon as you can, or else your share will be gone before you know it!
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_042: You're back here in your office again, Dr. {@nickname}. Have you refreshed your body and mind well?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_043: Happy birthday, Dr.{@nickname}. One look at the floral mess on your desk shows me your operators don't speak the language of flowers. Doctor, would you like to know their meaning? How about I give you a flower of my own here, and you listen carefully?
dialogue_tracker.char_492_quercu_CN_044: New buds break through the soil, and tender flowers blossom from vines, while those branches that have grown shelter and surround them, protecting them from the elements. Whether Rhodes Island, or back home, that is always what I hope to be—like the branches, a shelter for the young children.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_001: With all this paper around, it's hard to resist the urge to start fires… Whoa, whoa, don't look at me like that, I'm just joshin', okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_002: Doctor, our employees are all Billy natives who know the lay of the land. If any Rhodes operators are traveling to Rim Billiton and need an escort, come find us! We will offer you a fair price.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_003: Why hire Infected when it's bad for business? Well, umm, because... Ah, come on, we all know how Oripathy's transmitted. All you need is proper protection and monitoring. Rhodes Island does the same, right? Ahaha…
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_004: The right type of ammo can turn the tide of a battle', it's a line every artilleryman knows. So their bags are filled with grapeshot, flashbangs and tracers. 'Course, they always have trouble deciding which to use when the time comes. As for me, I just bring incendiaries. Use 'em right, and they replace any type of ammo you could need.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_005: I hated it whenever anyone brought up my dad while I was in university. Are we on bad terms? Naw, he's not a bad dad, and I'm grateful to him. But I hate it when people look at me like a mining mogul's spoiled kid. I'm more than just my dad's daughter!
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_006: Dad wouldn't let me near fire, Mum didn't let me play with the miners' kids, my old boss told me not to poke my nose into business that isn't my own, and everyone told me not to be too nice to the Infected. I never listened to any of that. You decide what's right and wrong for yourself, and never get swept up if you need time to make a choice.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_007: That little firefighter always tenses up when she sees me, then points her hose right at me. Well, It's cute, sure, but that can't go on forever. The three of us should go for a drink sometime and clear up this misunderstanding. For the two of you, I'll make my special flaming cocktail.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_008: I know I'm not great at business, but I also know how it feels to be helpless, relying on the kindness of others. It hurts, the company being in debt, but debtor's prison beats having to burn your own comrades to cinders.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_009: I loved playing army when I was little, and I always dreamed of becoming a general. But Rim Billiton wasn't the place for that, so I had to settle for a private security firm... Now? Now I just want to keep my people warm and fed. My dream of becoming a general died the first time I saw someone get shot.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_010: Yawn... I'm bored. Might as well build a grenade tower over here... Whoa?! You're awake? Er, these are blanks! Nah yeah, just blanks!
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_011: Thank you for choosing Firewhistle Security Services! My name is... huh? Codename? Umm, just call me Firewhistle. Yup, that's the key to raising brand awareness!
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_012: Nice strat. Would've been even better with some fire on that spot.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_013: A promotion? Thank you! If you've got any more security jobs for me and my people, that'd be even better. Hehe.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_014: Working with Rhodes Island's seen my company turn a profit at last. I'm not paying my employees out of my own pocket anymore! Thank you so much, Doctor! You have all my appreciation and all my gratitude!
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_018: Captain? No problem, I'm used to running the show.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_019: Let's go,everyone! I'll buy a round for us all when we're done.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_020: Stay low. Wait 'till you see my fire.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_021: Need some fire to turn up the heat?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_023: In position and ready to light'em up.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_027: Panicking just spreads the fire faster.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_029: Your plan actually worked! Sure wish I had a tactical genius like you on my payroll.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_030: We should put out the fires before we call it a day. Wanna join me?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_031: Leaving a smoldering ember is a good way to end up with a wildfire. Let's watch out for those.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_032: I'll cover our retreat. Don't worry, I've done this a bunch of times.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_033: Rhodes Island's base is outfitted so much better than my little office.
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_036: Here, I made this ornament out of a shell casing. Hehe, I'm really good at it, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_038: Just a sec, I need to file my annual financials... alright! I hear you've got a lot of good Billy cooks at Rhodes Island. Why don't we go for a little tasting together?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_042: G'day, Doctor! Need a warm fire?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_043: Here, Doctor, rainbow candles for your birthday! Hey, what's that look on your face? The flames are as colorful as the candles. How about that?
dialogue_tracker.char_493_firwhl_CN_044: I thought about asking my family for help when my company was in debt. I even went home once, but when they asked how I was doing and whether I needed money, I just said everything was fine. I don't regret it one bit, but everytime I think of the concern in their eyes, I still feel sorry.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_001: I can choose my own workplace? Thank you, I'll have the documents over shortly! Hmm, was the Convalescent Garden this way... or that way? Sorry, I'll still need you to show me the way after all…
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_002: My grandfather told me how wild roses used to grow all over behind the town. White ones, red ones, out in the mountains and fields... Children loved them. Dignitaries took pride in them... But I never saw any. Perhaps he just wanted to trick a naughty child into going to sleep...
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_003: The sunlight through the glass, the town's humid air, the aroma of petals and soil... Those were what made naps special for me, alone in the afternoons. No one would ever bother me—at most they'd quietly leave behind their coin, and take what flowers they fancied back home. At least, that's how it was until the tragedy.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_004: I was bringing some seeds back, and Lena was smiling at me the whole time. Why...? Oh, I didn't even notice I had dirt on my face! I feel like when I get busy, I start letting all sorts of things slip my mind. Has it been this way? Well... I used to never have so many worries in the first place.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_005: I don't think me stepping onto the front lines was an act of bravery. My time in the Self-Salvation Corps wasn't that dramatic either. My hometown's gone and I had nowhere to go. All I could do was carry on my friend's last wish, and never look back. Isn't that what war's all about?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_006: Do you think flowers can grow once more, in steel and soil's gaps? Ever since I saw again what that city of iron's become, the question has been bothering me. Maybe Rockrock was right—I'd better take a bag of seeds back home after the war dies down... You don't think we'll be waiting too long?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_007: Excuse me, Doctor, I'm not getting in the way of your sunbathing, am I? I like it here too... The portholes might not be that big, but their sunlight's enough for these flowers to grow. What do you think? It worries me when a place feels lonely, so I took the initiative to decorate the room with them.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_008: Doctor, watch out for the thorns on the stems! It's not that I don't want to pick them for you, it's just that they haven't reached the peak of their beauty yet. Hm...? You'd like to help me take care of them? Oh, no problem. Do you need me to teach you how?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_009: To be honest, my greatest wish would be to return to my hometown, and rebuild my greenhouse. Doctor, are you laughing? I'm guessing you—think I should have loftier dreams...? No need, you say? Heheh, I suppose. Well, not that this'll be easy either, seeing as my hometown's rubble now.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_010: Take a deep breath, Doctor. The scent of roses will put your mind at ease.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_011: Greetings, Doctor. Vendela reporting in. Um, what did Rockrock write for me next, I can't remember... Never mind! Please take this flower, I insist! Its meaning is good luck.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_012: The method's a perfect fit. You prune leaves and branches the same way.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_013: A promotion? Then may I request a bigger room? No... It's not that I can't get used to it. I just have more and more roses in my room, and they need more sunlight... Okay, maybe the same goes for me.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_014: Don't worry yourself about these entangled thorns. They're just trying to protect me.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_017: I'll try my best to help everyone out.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_018: Everyone, please follow where the petals flutter.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_019: Don't be afraid of the thorns. They are here to help us.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_020: I won't allow them to trample apart this land!
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_021: Ugh, there's a bad scent in the air.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_022: Will it really be possible to plant seeds here?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_023: I like these high places. They have plenty of sunshine.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_024: I heard someone tried planting sunflowers on the roof? Not a bad idea.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_027: Pay attention to where the petals fall.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_029: Do you see the dew shimmering on the petals? Such splendid scenery in the morning light… We wouldn't be enjoying this if not for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_030: Scything, uprooting... It sounds cruel. But if we want to deal with the weeds competing for nutrients, then I think there's no other way, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_031: While on the front lines, I caught a glimpse of an unforgettable field of flowers, blooming with vigor and vitality. I was always curious where their nutrients came from. Now, I think I know…
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_033: Cold and isolated... Is this the sort of atmosphere you prefer, Doctor?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_034: Oh! Did you want to buy some flowers?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_036: Eep. You knocked the flower out of my hair.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! Oh, the gift in front of everyone's room? That's poinsettia. In the past, I'd leave a bouquet at each and every doorstep to celebrate New Year's Eve... I didn't want this beautiful custom to disappear because of that incident.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_042: You spotted it, Doctor? That's a new variety I've been breeding. Do you like it?
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_043: Doctor, these little florets are for you. They grow all across the outcrops and pastures of my homeland. Even when gales level them flat, all they need is a little bit of sunshine, and they'll bloom forth again with renewed vitality. Isn't that just like us Victorians? Thank you for everything you've done, and happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_494_vendla_CN_044: I was going around the greenhouse collecting all the fresh buds, when it suddenly struck me how long it's been since that tragedy. Do you think I'll be able to rebuild my greenhouse back home? I know you might not have all the answers, but somehow, seeing everyone brimming with confidence... just puts my heart at ease too.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_001: Nah-ah, keep those documents away from me... I go all vertigo when I see too much text. Don't even think of making me help you on the paper work, Doctor, I'm just gonna stand here nice and good.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_002: Armor paint? It's gotta be gold. I love gold. It's the color of lightning, and when they say things are fast as lightning, that's fast!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_003: For combat, I got my own way of doing things. If you want 'em to respect you, just beat 'em down. If you want 'em to listen to you, go for a round, and let 'em know they could never ever win.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_004: Armorless Union assassins, Nearl family knights, the Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub... how's Rhodes Island hold all of them together? Your recruiting standards are mad out of sight.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_005: I‘ve been honing myself into a campaign knight since childhood. That's how I've learnt all my combat skills. But after I got infected…pssh, I still wanna be a 'knight.' If winning fights is the way to prove myself, then I'll win every fight to show'em all.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_006: Sometimes I don't really get what Sona says, yet I still believe she'll lead us to do right and proper. She's changing and improving herself to adapt, so maybe I'll try working on my own faults too. But, that doesn't mean I'm gonna take up everything she says, haha.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_007: When Justyna says things, her first sentence is the most important part! But if you don't listen to what comes after, you don't get what the first sentence was about. Good thing I'm already used to that, so I can grasp her point nice and clear.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_008: Justice Knight's my pet. I got people to give her a bunch of functions, so she's got the chops to do it all at least a little. Yeah, she's a real doer!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_009: I made the title 'Wild Mane' renowned through my own hard work. It's the symbol of a Knight as strong as hell, and an Infected Knight even. However, the General Chamber of Commerce takes our lives and our glory no more than products and consumables. Tch. Sucks I can't pound their masks to pieces right damned now.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_010: Man, I'm so bored... hey, let's go for a drink. It's always Ashley who drinks with me, and that's just dull.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_011: Wild Mane' Iwona, I'm a Knight from Pinus Sylvestris Knightclub. Sona says this place does good by the Infected? Sounds cool.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_012: Ooh... that's a sick surprise attack to make! Can we rewind that and watch it again?
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_013: A promotion? Then you can tell I've gotten stronger? Haha, fine by me, gimme a few more!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_014: Those hypocrites, wearing hollow masks and treading on the Infected as they want. Screw them, my lance is gonna run them all through!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_017: Who's got the guts to spar with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_018: Phalanx formation suits me most. If I'm the captain, then let's go with my kind of tactics!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_023: You guys think you're worth my full strength?
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_024: Don't you dare go down in one!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_029: Keep on winning, and you'll never be forgotten. It's that simple.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_030: Cheers, Doctor. You're a solid commander.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_031: My Major Lance... *sigh* Gotta get repairs again.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_032: Leave any regrets for later! Go, I'll cover the rear!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_033: Any rooms in all gold around here? Just a little dream of mine.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_034: What, you wanna have a race with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_036: Skirts? Nuh-uh. I don't wear 'em 'cept for special days.
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_038: Haha, just bought some confetti cannons from the stand over there. Sparking Golden ones, of course, to suit the day best! The instructions here... Gah, never mind, I'm not reading through this wordy crap. Here, Doctor, hold this one in your hand and I'll count to three. Three! Two! One— What the...? Where's the BOOM?  Production date, you say? ... EIGHT YEARS AGO?! Where's that stand owner? He'd better be gone for REAL!
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_042: Ready for the day, Doctor? Wanna try some breakfast from the Justice Knight?
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_043: Here, your birthday present, you're gonna love it for sure! Last time when Sona and the rest unpacked my gifts, I could tell they were trying hard to keep a calm face just because they could barely contain their excitement inside! C'mon now, this time I wanna see YOUR reaction— Surprise! Did you guess it? A pair of lightning-patterned socks! Cool, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_496_wildmn_CN_044: I only agreed to move with the others to Rhodes Island at first because it was Sona's idea. I may not have her perception and capability, but one day people will come to realize I'm doing more than just proving my strength, that I'm giving my all so that people can look at us infected with unbiased eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_001: Doctor, watch your hands. If you aren't careful around my weapons, you'll get hurt.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_002: Here are the instruments I used to play. There aren't too many of them, but the gems on them are very valuable. Sell them, and they should cover my medical fees... Once my debt's cleared, I'd like to go back to living on my own. Would that be alright?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_003: I've seen pets kept around your hospital here, and you have a training room. I've seen some of the children you're giving intensive care in the wards. 'Instructor?' 'Professor?' My previous savior brought me to those with the same title, and look how I ended up.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_004: This? This is my lyre. I may be better with other instruments, but I like playing this one most. Listen. Such an airy, lingering timbre, and the hand moves so beautifully when playing. But when you fully lose yourself in the melody, the knife concealed inside will... I'm sorry, I got carried away.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_005: Doctor, do you intend only to treat me here? Strange. You really don't need me to do anything? I can't trust kindness with no strings attached. Let me do a little something for you, okay? I'm sure you'll be satisfied, no matter the task—But, you must share with me your motivations.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_006: I remember coming back from my first fulfilled mission when I was young, weeping and throwing up, scared I didn't do well enough, that I would starve to death in some forgotten corner, unknown to anyone... No longer do I fear these things. Thanks to the days with Rhodes Island, I now know how it feels to be truly alive.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_007: The Originium on my arm... it hurts terribly, but it's much more manageable by now. I know none of the physicians, but I can tell how sincerely they're working to save me. Doctor, once my illness has stabilized to a point, can I... stay here?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_008: A lot of my past mistakes were made out of fear. I was scared—I felt that if I didn't listen to them, I was dead. But after catching Oripathy, they threw me out there to die. I should have been terrified at that moment, but instead I was... relieved. The sun shining on my face—it was so warm, it really was.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_009: Doctor, could you take me with you on your next field mission? I want to know the reasoning behind your every decision. Why did you save me, a stranger? Just what does my life mean to you...? I want to figure you out, just a little clearer.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_010: All the ones before you would sleep with one eye open, when I was around. Do you... trust me that much?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_011: So you're the Doctor from Rhodes Island...? Thank you for what you did. I'll pay for my treatment in time. Otherwise, I'd like to be on my own for now.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_012: I'm a fast learner, don't worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_013: So this is how it feels... to hold my life in my own hands.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_014: This isn't the first time someone saves my life. But, if I had a chance to get back to those barrens, a chance to weigh up what's behind those helping hands again, I would choose to starve to death there. Doctor, I've been thinking... how nice it would've been, if you were there offering your hand instead.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_017: I trust your judgment. You won't lead me astray.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_018: If I make any mistakes, please point them out to me.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_019: Things are different. I don't want to hide myself any longer.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_023: In time, I'll find the right place for myself too.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_025: I'm aware of what I'm doing.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_026: I know what it is I want.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_029: That's one more step in the right direction, isn't it?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_030: Someday in the future, I'll have as clear a direction as you do.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_031: We have a few runaways. A little like I once was.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_032: This isn't happening, don't abandon me... Doctor, where are you?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_033: Are you interested in my instruments? I can teach you how to play.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_036: If I leave someday, you'll send me off, won't you?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_038: Such pretty fireworks... I used to think they were too far away, but here I am today, watching them lit below me. A single firework's just a tiny little thing, but there it goes, flying into the sky, blossoming into flowers so bright. Doctor, is that something I can aspire to?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_042: I heard the sound of your footsteps, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_043: So today's your birthday... I don't even remember my own. Does my record in Medical note what day I was saved? I want that day to be my birthday. Doctor, I'll spend the day with you, so when my birthday comes, would you spend it with me?
dialogue_tracker.char_497_ctable_CN_044: They told me I was meant to be an assassin, twisted my life onto a path it never should've taken. But they never even gave me a reason, and I did far too much I never should have done. You've given me a new lease on life, and I'll be sure to use it well.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_001: You need my help with your mountain of work? Haha, I'm not sure if I should be intervening in Rhodes Island's internal affairs though...? It's no problem? Uh, really?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_002: Our laws are incapable of perfectly solving every dispute. There are many situations where even the saints can't help. I must admit, I have a deep respect for people like the bishop from that monastery, considering the problems he faced. Too bad I don't have such lofty faith.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_003: Was that Arene earlier? Now when did that punk learn some manners...? You taught him? Wow, now that's impressive! I guess even a devious boy like him is still just a boy. Easy enough to trick him onto the right track... Huh...? You didn't trick him?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_004: Yo, Doctor! Ambriel and the others are doing a dessert potluck, and I'm bringing donuts. Mind helping me taste test? Okay, so what do you think—Whoa whoa, slow down on the water! It's too sweet and greasy? Strange, I thought the sugar level was just right...
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_005: Don't get me wrong, Doctor, yes, I was elected as 'a representative of the Notarial Hall', but that's just because everyone's curious about what magical place could  Federico endorse, and they needed someone out to take a look for them. In other words, they picked me to come take a look-see here. I've got no say on any matters relating to the Notarial Hall, so don't ask me about that sort of thing, okay?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_006: I'm lucky I was born a Lateran. No, Doctor, our good fortune does not lie in our halos, but in our material abundance and strong state. You have an ideal Rhodes Island of your own? It's not easy, chasing your dreams, but... good luck I guess?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_007: Take note of your posture, keep your crossbow aimed straight ahead, turn your body slightly... Yes, just like that, and then pull the trigger! Wow, bullseye! Very nice! Oh no, no need to thank me, I just helped correct your posture, that's all. You're very talented, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_008: Come sit over here, Doctor. I have something to discuss with you. There's a bunch of Sarkaz I know, and they're pretty good in a fight, so if Rhodes Island ever needs a few helping hands... Haha, yes, I'm not eager to make trouble for myself, but... Well, I might be going too soft, but why not consider it?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_009: I thought you might have found this business annoying, so I dealt with it in your place, and here's the mission report. The scene was something of an eyesore, so I didn't attach any photos. I executed every last name in your notes, no exceptions.   What's with the look, Doctor? Do you feel unwell?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_010: Oh, Doctor, you're awake… What? Please don't tell Dr. Kal'tsit and Amiya you were napping at work? Ahaha, what napping?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_011: Liaison from the Lateran Notarial Hall, Insider. Here's the paperwork for our collaboration. May I ask which office I should be heading to next? I'm making my first impression here at Rhodes Island, so I want to do this perfectly.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_012: Let's see... Ezell is still so merciful in battle, huh... Sheesh, Federico is the exact opposite!
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_013: Promotion? Thank you for your affirmation, Doctor. However, does this mean I'm going to have to handle even more difficult work in the future?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_014: Many thanks. I will report that Rhodes Island intends to deepen the level of cooperation with the Notarial Hall... Wait, this is a personal commendation for me? Haha, what an honor.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_017: Got it. You've determined that use of force is required in the current situation, and I'll trust you on that.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_018: I'm in charge? Alright then, I would like everyone to act freely as they wish. And everyone is responsible for their own actions.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_020: I wish everyone could just calm down, before I raise my gun to settle things.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_022: Bullets may be fast, but they aren't always so quick to solve disputes.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_023: Chill, everyone, I'm just here for a few questions.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_024: If you insist on being so stubborn, then... prepare for execution.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_025: I'm actually better at wrestling than shooting. Makes the cleanup easier.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_026: I'll give you some time to cry out in pain while I adjust my weapon.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_027: I was really hoping it wouldn't turn out like this.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_028: In our current situation... A complete sweep would be the most efficient solution.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_029: I knew I was getting into trouble coming here, but thankfully I've got you, Doctor. I wouldn't have figured out how to resolve such a complicated conflict by myself.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_030: Alright, time to pack up my gun. Mission complete, Doctor. We achieved victory just as planned, so there shouldn't be any post mortem work required, right?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_031: What, did some of them escape? Ah, I had one eye closed while aiming my shots, so maybe they happened to be out of my sight.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_032: It's clear we need to overhaul our plans.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_033: You have such good accommodation here? This place is top-notch in all the foreign posting I've had.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_034: Haha, Doctor. You're not scaring me that easily.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_036: It's nice to occasionally get some rest in places like this corridor. After all, most of Laterano's benches are found only outdoors.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_038: Happy New Year, Doctor! A new year usually comes with a multitude of troublesome incidents, and I don't know how Rhodes Island deals with... Why aren't I back in Laterano to work right now? Ahaha, foreign missions are also very important, you know.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_042: You can take a break first, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_043: Doctor, what would you like for your birthday? One of the occasional tasks I get is to help people return unwanted gifts. Instead of making things so troublesome, it's better to just outright ask the recipient what they would like, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_498_inside_CN_044: Hmm, the atmosphere calls for a serious talk, does it? Alright, I'll be serious, Doctor, I wasn't actually that curious about Rhodes Island compared to the other executors, but now, I really admire your capabilities. Moving towards conflict instead of avoiding it is definitely not easy.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_001: I won't refuse if you insist, but my poor vision makes it difficult for me to handle clerical work.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_002: The Engineering Department is very interested in my weapon. I wish I could explain how it works, but all I know is that it requires high-purity gem crystals to run. I have ways to acquire gem scraps, but cutting a precious stone of great value into pieces works the same.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_003: My gosh, briefing documents again? You're not lacking in manpower or technology. My advice would be to avoid spending time and effort on roundabout things... Oh, you didn't bring documents. Then I must express my gratitude. I don't want to be gazing at graphs or designs anymore. It hurts my eyes.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_004: Whistle? Oh, it was me whistling a Leithanian tune. My sincerest apologies, this place just makes me feel relaxed, and it wasn't my... You seem to be fine with it? Strange... to my knowledge, every spire-dweller feels insulted when they hear the sound, and even the mildest scholar would lose his temper when a child whistles at them on the streets.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_005: I've lived with the Infected since I was little, so it was only natural that I would get Oripathy myself... Well, Rhodes Island doesn't seem to accept that explanation. Then how do you like the story of a single explosion at the quarry that also collapsed many futures? A story too fanciful to believe, don't you think?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_006: I may have underestimated you, Doctor. Tell me, would you like to bet on me? Betting on whether I'm worth trusting, betting on what tricks I have up my sleeves, betting on if I'm more than an infected. Of course, should you have a change of mind, I'll get back and continue to work on my worthless stone.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_007: I'm not interested in talking about the past. As you can see, my lab was destroyed, and all traces cut off. I no longer have to put a price on gems with blood on them... all of which have put my mind at ease, in fact. I no longer have to imagine the gems being cut into pieces, after all.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_008: I don't know when I'll return to Leithanien, but I would like to invite you for my next operation. There won't be any cooperation, nor do I intend to share my plans... but I'll ask you to keep your eyes on me, to witness all that I do. You're the only one who can see through me, aren't you? Come then.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_009: I can take you to the top of any spire in Leithanien. How does that sound? You'd understand me there. The scent of the wind is clean at the top... and that's all. That's all that young boy in the gem mine longed for.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_010: If you fall asleep, then nothing here can pique my interest.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_011: Which name card would you like: the one in my left hand, or the one in my right...? Diamante, gemologist. Pleased to make your acquaintance. Don't worry, there's no target here worth my attention, even if you picked the other card.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_012: A practical video, free from excessive narration and trite background music.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_013: Thanks. I don't normally collect medals for the purpose of displaying status, but if you insist, I will place it at the top of my collection to demonstrate my respect for you.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_014: Steal a piece of bread, go to jail. Offend a noble, get beaten. Steal a priceless treasure, and you get to stand at the top of the tallest spire. Be my guest, Doctor, and come watch my show, watch the audience cheer. Will it bring you joy, or sorrow?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_017: Colluding with me is not something to be done lightly.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_018: One wrong step, and we'll pay a heavy price. I expect perfect teamwork from you.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_020: What do you possess that's mine to take?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_022: This is the only value of gemstones.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_023: To all my enemies: I will Crack. You. Down.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_024: I shall have the honor to pulverize what you treasure.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_025: Will you cheer for me? I can't help but wonder!
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_026: How will you struggle? How will you hold on to what you have?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_027: When will I strike, and take what you cherish the most?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_028: Who has not earned their end?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_029: I shared my life with you. Repay that debt, and tell me what fruit our efforts have born. Tell me what's the rewards of valor.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_030: We can leave now. I'm sure no witnesses escaped.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_031: A gem loses its value when flawed with impurities and cracks. You might as well dispose of it.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_032: Are you still alive? Good. We all have our share of misfortune, but now you've had your stakes back, which you can risk on the line in the next game. Allow me to congratulate you on that.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_033: What assessment would you like from me? It's the only place I can call home for now. I don't dare to be critical.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_036: If I may interest you with a grind such as gem polishing, then please, take the seat to my opposite.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_038: Should I hang this up on that wall over there...? Don't look at me like that, I just want to have a good holiday season. I always hope for good things to happen when a new year comes around, even though I know that nothing ever changes without sacrifice.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_042: Greetings, Doctor. Do you need something appraised?
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_043: Be careful when eating that cake, Doctor. I put a little ruby in it. Good luck to you.
dialogue_tracker.char_499_kaitou_CN_044: I laugh at those people who put such value on a rock, but I couldn't laugh at you, because you truly want to prove that even an Infected life is worth something. It's almost as absurd as I am.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_001: What's up, Doctor? Me, I'm just on standby.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_002: My shield? Fun fact: I personally provide a portion of the energy it needs.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_003: What I look like beneath the mask? Well, I... Actually, let's keep it secret for a bit longer.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_004: Man, nothing better than a break after you finish a mission.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_007: Doctor, if I get to know you better, I figure my shield's gonna get even sturdier.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_008: Course I know where my limit's at. But I don't want Yato to worry about me, which is what matters. We'll worry about the rest some other time!
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_009: There's always the need for guys like me, you know? Nah, I'm not trying to act high and mighty. What I'm saying is: when you have a VIP plus a lot of danger, you need a guy to stand between them, that's all.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_010: Sometimes you've just gotta take off the mask and catch a breather.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_011: Defender Noir Corne, reporting for duty. You need VIP protection, I'm your guy.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_012: Cool... So this stuff is what Grandpa Rangers was talking about earlier.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_019: Holding the line is a Defender's most important job!
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_029: Even guys like me are happy to get through tough battles like these.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_032: This wouldn't have happened if I'd worn my good mask! God dammit!
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_036: You wanna get some drinks after work?
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_038: It's these kinds of days I love the most. Everyone has a blast getting together, and we're off work. C'mon, Doctor, you gotta try this burdenbeast offal flambé while it's still fresh from the pan! Whoa, whoa, I don't think Dr. Kal'tsit's gonna like you drinking that much, y'know?
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_043: Yo, Doctor! Here's a mask from my stash, straight to you! You've rocked the hood for long enough, right? You could try masking up, just for today. Think about it! And hey, if no one else is gonna say it, I will—I think you'll look cool as hell with it on.
dialogue_tracker.char_500_noirc_CN_044: With all the years I've spent at Rhodes Island, I know exactly what's left on the agenda today. The Doctor's still got mad business, alright? Can't keep 'em any longer. Everyone, a toast to the Doctor, who's spent another year working hard for us! To you!
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_001: Morning, Doctor... Mind if I lay out my sleeping bag here...? Thanks. The rest is up to you...
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_002: How do I fight? Using Arts, of course... Want me to show you the power of earth?
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_003: What time is it...? See, I don't work mornings, noons, afternoons, or nights...
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_004: You'll make an S-sized uniform for me...? No thanks. My oversized one works as a sheet when I take naps... plus, it's really warm.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_007: Dooooctoooooor? I need a break! I'm competing in the Speedy Sleep Contest.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_008: Doctor, check this out. This isn't my normal wand, it's a pendulum. You're feeling very sleepy and will nap in five minutes without giving me any work... Zzzz...
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_009: I was hoping I could tell you about my homeland, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_010: After you went to sleep, I somehow didn't feel sleepy at all anymore... Hmmmph...
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_011: Hello? Hellooooo? Can you hear me? Down here. Down heeeeere! Nice meeting you, big Doctor. I'm Durin the Caster.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_017: The secret to staying healthy is to sleep whenever you can.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_018: Captain's orders: everyone, save your energy and take a nap!
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_019: I wanna dig a hole in the ground and make a shelter to sleep in, if you don't mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_029: Why do we have annoying missions like this? Can't we do something easier...? Still, it's nice that we won.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_030: Of course we won. I worked real hard supporting you with my Arts.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_031: Doctor, are you still worried about those ones that got through?
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_032: Ugghh... Sorry... I'll try harder next time...
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_033: The Land of Giants... Here I aaaaaaaaaaaaaaam!
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_036: I'm in a good mood, so how about a magic trick?
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_038: Happy New Year, Big Doctor. There's lots of tasty foods at the cafeteria. Have you been eating well? Oh, right, I saw Myrtle carrying a huge sack with her to the cafeteria just now. Too late, though. I already ate all the cheese fried fowlbeast.
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_043: Big Doctor, Big Doctor, Happy birthday! If you're another year older, does that mean you're getting taller, too? I bought you a sleeping bag. If you're getting taller, I don't know how long it'll fit...?
dialogue_tracker.char_501_durin_CN_044: Because of how short I am, nobody ever notices whether I'm working or playing hooky... Rhodes Island gave me a really comfortable environment to sleep in, though, so I still gotta do some things every now and then to repay the favor. Doctor, I'm looking forward to a good year.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_001: Hey, Doctor. Do me a favor and just tell me what you need done.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_002: I'll be watching you even when I'm off duty.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_004: My skin is sensitive to sunlight. So please assign me to nighttime missions, whenever you can.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_007: There's limits to what I'm capable of, but even so, I want to help ease the burden you carry, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_008: I can't help but feel just a little envious when I see how the other Operators fight...
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_009: I need no particular reason to fight for you, Doctor. I hope to see an exciting frontline battle someday...
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_010: Doctor, let me be your guardian, now and forever...
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_011: Vanguard Yato here. Are you the one I'm protecting?
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_018: We're ready to execute your plans, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_020: Targets spotted. Get ready for battle.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_029: As long as we follow the Doctor's orders, we won't have any problems.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_030: The Doctor's brilliant command was the key to victory.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_031: Victory is the most welcome news.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_032: I apologize... We failed to execute your plan, Doctor...
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_033: Please send me somewhere that sunlight can never touch.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_036: Doctor, thank you for always taking care of us.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_038: Happy holidays, Doctor. Thank you for your work over the past year, and may you continue to guide us this year.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_042: Doctor, I will be your shield.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_043: Happy birthday, Doctor. Please, accept this humble gift. Yes, of course I remember your birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_502_nblade_CN_044: A blade needs a sheath. It is a shelter, and a place to return. For me, Rhodes Island is that sheath.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_001: Doctor, I greatly admire your genius. It's my honor to be your guard.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_002: A man of my experience can tell you'll be a great leader one day, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_003: I have an unusual skin tone, you say? Hah. Just a souvenir from back when I snuck into a biolab, and... Please, I'm joking around.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_004: I need to wear this scarf, even when I sleep, or else my neck will get cold.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_007: This face of mine might be a little too exotic for your typical townsfolk. Heh, I tend to draw a curious crowd when I wander.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_008: I'm surprised how polite you are to this old man! Not many besides Durin ask after my health.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_009: When I go barefoot, I can sense enemies through their vibrations on the ground.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_010: Hmm... Snoring is a bad habit. The other rangers will hear you.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_011: I'm Rangers, the Sniper. Call whenever you need me.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_018: Good. Let me show you what an old man can do.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_029: Challenge after challenge. Exactly what we wanted. Right, Noir Corne?
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_031: A few of them got through. I'd call that decent.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_032: Oh no, I'm out of breath...
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_033: If you need anything, just say the word.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_034: Urgh! Please, leave my tail be...
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_036: You like me that much, huh? Weird taste, I gotta say.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_038: Doctor, it's been three hours, and the kiddos still clamoring for more of my stories. Talk to them, will ya...? The New Year always makes the young'uns so astonishingly lively. I can't compete with that…
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_042: Doctor, how can I help you?
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_043: I'm kinda too old to follow what you young'uns may want. But here's a little something I like. This scarf's made out of my favorite material, lightweight but warm. It will keep you cozy when it's cold, Doctor. Happy birthday.
dialogue_tracker.char_503_rang_CN_044: Retirement? Too soon for that. Not while I still eat five buns for breakfast. Once my appetite declines, then—and only then, will I find some place to bask in the sun. But for now, don't you worry.
dialogue_tracker.char_508_aguard_CN_018: Read the briefing? Good, now here's your assignments.
dialogue_tracker.char_508_aguard_CN_019: Know your jobs? Then let's do this.
dialogue_tracker.char_508_aguard_CN_020: I prefer to keep my fight quiet.
dialogue_tracker.char_508_aguard_CN_024: I can handle this on my own.
dialogue_tracker.char_508_aguard_CN_030: It's always reassuring to carry out your orders, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_509_acast_CN_018: Attention casters: set comms to operation channel.
dialogue_tracker.char_509_acast_CN_020: Opertaion is a go. Keep your support countersign in mind.
dialogue_tracker.char_510_amedic_CN_026: War is a plague, and I'm the cure.
dialogue_tracker.char_510_amedic_CN_028: No more suffering, no more pain.
dialogue_tracker.char_510_amedic_CN_030: Your commands were my thoughts as well, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_018: Alright, squad, keep your status updated.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_020: The enemy's moving as expected. Brace yourselves.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_022: I know the difference between sparring and a real fight.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_025: Don't worry, you won't escape the storm.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_026: This surge of energy has only one place to go.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_027: I've got a clear shot on target.
dialogue_tracker.char_511_asnipe_CN_030: Aggression is all part of the plan. Returning to base.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_001: Doctor, might these be the books and documents you were looking for? No, no need to thank me, I'm simply glad to be of help. How could I have known what you needed? Heheh. That would be... a secret.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_002: Phantom and I certainly have our similarities, in what we've been through. Though now he pursues the truth, while I only wish to be as far away from it as possible.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_003: Doctor. About that lady who came to borrow your books... is her codename Mint? She seems to be curious about a great many things. Too much curiosity usually invites disaster, you see, and I have my reservations.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_004: It is quite the relief you were with us last mission, Doctor. I find myself dazed by the sight of you when you command. As if something crosses past the curtain of night and the stirring stars, leading your way...
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_005: Dance, music. Both soothe the soul, twin arts calling on us to focus and follow. But at times, too great a fixation can be our undoing. Such stories were already far too plenty where I formerly lived. Even I... am no exception to the rule.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_006: Doctor? What are you standing there for...? I see... you overheard me talking with someone...? Cease your jests, please. There is no one here... but me.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_007: You wish to learn of the Crimson Troupe's affairs? Of course, I know of them all. But take caution, Doctor, for should you stray like they from the proper path... or come near to too many of them, you may be taken hold of. And that is not, whatsoever, desirable.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_008: Here you are once more. Please, sit. Be reassured that I will not drive you out. So, what's the matter this time? Could Hibiscus have made another healthy meal? Or is Sideroca bound to whisk you away for training again?
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_009: My stories are hackneyed, bereft of novelty. Likely, not as engaging as you imagine. You would like to hear them nonetheless? Very well. Then I will tell you tales... but in exchange, Doctor, would you grant me a request?
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_010: Doctor. Doctor? Beg pardon, I know I should not disturb your rest... but it is far too still here for me to fully be at ease.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_011: I envisaged the scene in which we would formally meet, Doctor, and this very moment brings it to life. Operator Shalem, pleased to make your acquaintance.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_012: At times, I do feel the battlefield and the stage resemble one another, in ways.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_013: Promotion, did you say...? Ah, I'm sorry, it just startled me. Thank you for your acknowledgment, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_014: Unlike he, still wreathed in his struggle, I had long since fled the past, never to concern me again... yes, Doctor, so I once hoped.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_017: Worry not, coordinating with others is a strength of mine. So long as nothing untoward happens...
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_018: I may lack for power, but I will do all that I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_020: See those on the stage... knowing nothing of their fates.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_022: Their future is clear to see.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_023: I hope we may resolve this peacefully.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_024: To kill and to be killed, to do battle. Far too many plays are penned on these themes.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_025: And may this end as swiftly as can be.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_026: The path you all now walk bears not one hope.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_027: Surely, your skulls... would mesmerize to see?
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_029: This is far beyond my wildest dreams. The best outcome, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_030: It is done. Be at ease, for no danger remains. Well done, Doctor.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_031: Our mission is complete, Doctor. As for those who escaped... they have their own fates to meet.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_032: Haste not; ponder leisurely. We still have opportunities.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_033: Shall we rest here a while? How about some music?
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_034: Ah... I'm sorry, I was lost in thought.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_036: Doctor, could you hold my coat for me briefly? I'll be done in a moment. My thanks.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_038: Some dance and song is all it takes—days like these never fail to tempt art into showing a hint of its beauty, such that more would bow to it. A grand performance is about to begin, Doctor, and when the time has come, will you be able to recognize the true me beneath the limelight?
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_042: Welcome, Doctor. Indeed, I knew you would surely come.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_043: Excellent, you are here just as I expected. Though some young operators express their affection in far too ardent ways, you'll nevertheless break their hearts should you hide away like this. And one more hint before you open the door, try to place your feet back, and find something to brace against. Yes. This way, you won't be thrown to the floor when they joyfully tackle you.
dialogue_tracker.char_512_aprot_CN_044: I have to wear this...? Are you sure, Doctor? I don't recall this sort of adornment being called for on the stage... Very well... And dance with you? That would be a little... Oh my. Excuse me, Doctor. The steps here should go like this... Here, let me show you.
dialogue_tracker.char_513_apionr_CN_017: Give your orders. I will work with them the best I can.
dialogue_tracker.char_513_apionr_CN_018: I have nothing to say. But remember this one word: survive.
dialogue_tracker.char_513_apionr_CN_019: Watch your surroundings. Do not get ambushed.
dialogue_tracker.char_513_apionr_CN_024: This will be a disappointing day for our foes.
dialogue_tracker.char_513_apionr_CN_027: Pay for your sins with your life.
dialogue_tracker.char_513_apionr_CN_030: Finally, I can leave the commanding to others...
